root-pli-ms: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā antarā ca rājagahaṁ antarā ca nāḷandaṁ addhānamaggappaṭipanno hoti mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi.
translation-en-sujato: At one time the Buddha was traveling along the road between Rājagaha and Nālanda together with a large Saṅgha of around five hundred mendicants.
translation-my-my-team: အခါတစ်ပါး၌ မြတ်စွာဘုရားသည် များစွာသော ငါးရာခန့်မျှသော ရဟန်းသံဃာနှင့်အတူ ရာဇဂြိုဟ် (ပြည်) နှင့် နာဠန္ဒာ (မြို့) အကြား၌ ခရီးရှည်ကြွတော်မူ၏၊

root-pli-ms: Suppiyopi kho paribbājako antarā ca rājagahaṁ antarā ca nāḷandaṁ addhānamaggappaṭipanno hoti saddhiṁ antevāsinā brahmadattena māṇavena.
translation-en-sujato: The wanderer Suppiya was also traveling along the same road, together with his pupil, the brahmin student Brahmadatta.
translation-my-my-team: သုပ္ပိယပရိဗိုဇ်သည်လည်း တပည့်ဖြစ်သော ဗြဟ္မဒတ်လုလင်နှင့်အတူ ရာဇဂြိုဟ် (ပြည်) နှင့် နာဠန္ဒာ (မြို့) အကြား၌ပင် ခရီးရှည်သွား၏။

root-pli-ms: Tatra sudaṁ suppiyo paribbājako anekapariyāyena buddhassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati, dhammassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati, saṅghassa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati;

root-pli-ms: Atha kho sambahulānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ rattiyā paccūsasamayaṁ paccuṭṭhitānaṁ maṇḍalamāḷe sannisinnānaṁ sannipatitānaṁ ayaṁ saṅkhiyadhammo udapādi:
translation-en-sujato: Then several mendicants rose at the crack of dawn and sat together in the pavilion, where the topic of evaluation came up:
translation-my-my-team: ထိုအခါ ညဉ့်၏ (အဆုံး) မိုးသောက်ချိန်၌ (အိပ်ရာမှ) ထကြ၍ တန်ဆောင်းဝန်း၌ များစွာသော ရဟန်းတို့ စုဝေးထိုင်နေကြရာတွင် ဤစကားဖြစ်ပေါ်၏ —
comment-en-sujato: saṅkhiyadhamma is a unique term, occurring, so far as I can tell, nowhere else in the Pali literature. The commentary glosses as kathadhamma, and thus Bodhi and Thanissaro effectively just have it as 'conversation'. Rhys Davids followed by Wals have something like 'trend of conversation.' Yet it seems to me that such a unique term in such a prominent position should have a more specific maning. I am not aware of elsewhere in the ENTs where sankya has the plain sense 'conversation'. rather, it is connected with the notion of evaluation, measuring. Here the subject of discussion is the different ways the two parties evaluate the Sangha.
reference: bj7.4, cck9.3, km14.4, lv1.4, ms6D_4, msdiv3, pts-cs1.3, sc3, sya9.3

root-pli-ms: “Mamaṁ vā, bhikkhave, pare avaṇṇaṁ bhāseyyuṁ, dhammassa vā avaṇṇaṁ bhāseyyuṁ, saṅghassa vā avaṇṇaṁ bhāseyyuṁ, tatra tumhehi na āghāto na appaccayo na cetaso anabhiraddhi karaṇīyā.
translation-en-sujato: “Mendicants, if others criticize me, the teaching, or the Saṅgha, don’t make yourselves resentful, bitter, and exasperated.
translation-my-my-team:
ရဟန်းတို့ သူတစ်ပါးတို့သည် ငါ၏ အပြစ်ကိုဖြစ်စေ တရား၏ အပြစ်ကိုဖြစ်စေ 
သံဃာ၏ အပြစ်ကိုဖြစ်စေ ပြောကြလျှင် ထို (ပြောကြရာ) ၌ သင်တို့သည် 
ရန်ငြိုးထားခြင်း နှလုံးမသာခြင်း စိတ်မကျေချမ်းခြင်း မဖြစ်စေသင့်။
comment-en-sujato: I think this passage is more gently critical of the monks than implied in previous translations. The phrasing here is somewhat unusual and specific, and is more active than just “giving way”: they “should not do” what creates bitterness (i.e. sit around judging others). Cp MN 22, where the same phrases are used. In the Buddha’s case, it has the neutral hoti, while for the mendicants it uses karaniya, as here.
reference: cck9.4, dr9.4, km14.6, lv1.6, ms6D_6, msdiv5, ndp6.5, pts-cs1.5, pts-vp-pli1.3, sc5, sya9.4

သံဃာ၏အပြစ်ကိုဖြစ်စေ ပြောကြရာ၌ သင်တို့သည် အမျက်ထွက်ကြလျှင်

root-pli-ms: ‘Pāṇātipātaṁ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭivirato samaṇo gotamo nihitadaṇḍo, nihitasattho, lajjī, dayāpanno, sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampī viharatī’ti—
translation-en-sujato: ‘The ascetic Gotama has given up killing living creatures. He has renounced the rod and the sword. He’s scrupulous and kind, living full of compassion for all living beings.’

သနားတတ်၏၊ ခပ်သိမ်းသော သတ္တဝါတို့၏ အစီးအပွားကို လိုလားလျက် နေတော်မူ၏”

root-pli-ms: ‘Adinnādānaṁ pahāya adinnādānā paṭivirato samaṇo gotamo dinnādāyī dinnapāṭikaṅkhī, athenena sucibhūtena attanā viharatī’ti—
translation-en-sujato: ‘The ascetic Gotama has given up stealing. He takes only what’s given, and expects only what’s given. He keeps himself clean by not thieving.’

ရှောင်ကြဉ်တော် မူ၏၊ ပေးသည်ကိုသာ ယူ၏၊ ပေးသည်ကိုသာ အလိုရှိ၏၊ မခိုးမဝှက်၊ 
စင်ကြယ်သောကိုယ်ဖြင့် နေတော်မူ၏”

root-pli-ms: ‘Abrahmacariyaṁ pahāya brahmacārī samaṇo gotamo ārācārī virato methunā gāmadhammā’ti—
translation-en-sujato: ‘The ascetic Gotama has given up unchastity. He is celibate, set apart, avoiding the common practice of sex.’

“ရဟန်းဂေါတမသည် မမြတ်သော အကျင့်ကို ပယ်၍ မြတ်သော အကျင့်ကို ကျင့်တော်မူ၏၊ 
ယုတ်သော အကျင့်ကို ကျင့်လေ့မရှိ၊ ရွာသူတို့၏ အလေ့ဖြစ်သော မေထုန်အကျင့်မှ 
ရှောင်ကြဉ်တော်မူ၏”

translation-en-sujato: Such is an ordinary person’s praise of the Realized One.
translation-my-my-team: ရဟန်းတို့ ပုထုဇဉ်သည် ဘုရား၏ဂုဏ်ကို ပြောခဲ့လျှင် ဤသို့သော်လည်း ပြောနိုင်ရာ၏။

root-pli-ms: ‘Musāvādaṁ pahāya musāvādā paṭivirato samaṇo gotamo saccavādī saccasandho theto paccayiko avisaṁvādako lokassā’ti—
translation-en-sujato: ‘The ascetic Gotama has given up lying. He speaks the truth and sticks to the truth. He’s honest and trustworthy, and doesn’t trick the world with his words.’

“ရဟန်းဂေါတမသည် မမှန်ပြောခြင်းကို ပယ်၍ မမှန်ပြောခြင်းမှ 
ရှောင်ကြဉ်တော်မူ၏၊ အမှန်ကိုသာ ဆိုလေ့ရှိတော်မူ၏၊ မှန်သော စကားချင်း 
ဆက်စပ်စေတော်မူတတ်၏၊ တည်သောစကား ရှိ၏၊ ယုံကြည်ထိုက်သော စကားရှိ၏၊ လောကကို 
လှည့်စားတော်မမူ”

root-pli-ms: ‘Pisuṇaṁ vācaṁ pahāya pisuṇāya vācāya paṭivirato samaṇo gotamo, ito sutvā na amutra akkhātā imesaṁ bhedāya, amutra vā sutvā na imesaṁ akkhātā amūsaṁ bhedāya. Iti bhinnānaṁ vā sandhātā, sahitānaṁ vā anuppadātā samaggārāmo samaggarato samagganandī samaggakaraṇiṁ vācaṁ bhāsitā’ti—
translation-en-sujato: ‘The ascetic Gotama has given up divisive speech. He doesn’t repeat in one place what he heard in another so as to divide people against each other. Instead, he reconciles those who are divided, supporting unity, delighting in harmony, loving harmony, speaking words that promote harmony.’

root-pli-ms: iti vā hi, bhikkhave, puthujjano tathāgatassa vaṇṇaṁ vadamāno vadeyya.
translation-en-sujato: Such is an ordinary person’s praise of the Realized One.
translation-my-my-team: ရဟန်းတို့ ပုထုဇဉ်သည် ဘုရား၏ဂုဏ်ကို ပြောခဲ့လျှင် ဤသို့သော်လည်း ပြောနိုင်ရာ၏။

root-pli-ms: ‘Pharusaṁ vācaṁ pahāya pharusāya vācāya paṭivirato samaṇo gotamo, yā sā vācā nelā kaṇṇasukhā pemanīyā hadayaṅgamā porī bahujanakantā bahujanamanāpā tathārūpiṁ vācaṁ bhāsitā’ti—
translation-en-sujato: ‘The ascetic Gotama has given up harsh speech. He speaks in a way that’s mellow, pleasing to the ear, lovely, going to the heart, polite, likable and agreeable to the people.’

ကျွဲတိုက်ပွဲ နွားတိုက်ပွဲ ဆိတ်တိုက်ပွဲ သိုးတိုက်ပွဲ ကြက်တိုက်ပွဲ 
ငုံးတိုက်ပွဲ တုတ်သိုင်းပွဲ လက်ဝှေ့ထိုးပွဲ လက်ပမ်းလုံးပွဲ စစ်ထိုးပွဲ 
စစ်သည်စစ်ဆေးပွဲ စစ်ဆင်ပွဲ စစ်အင်ကျင်းပွဲတို့တည်း။*[သဘင်ပွဲဟူသည် ဇာတ် ရုပ်သေး အငြိမ့် စသည်ပင်တည်း။]*
comment-en-sujato: uyyodhika in the suttas is only used here and at AN 10.30, where is not a sham. And the definition at Pc 50 says Uyyodhikaṁ nāma yattha sampahāro dissati “where strife is seen”.

translation-en-sujato: This includes such things as sofas, couches, woolen covers—shag-piled, colorful, white, embroidered with flowers, quilted, embroidered with animals, double- or single-fringed—and silk covers studded with gems, as well as silken sheets, woven carpets, rugs for elephants, horses, or chariots, antelope hide rugs, and spreads of fine deer hide, with a canopy above and red cushions at both ends.

ဆန်းကြယ်သော သားမွေးအခင်း ဖြူသော သားမွေးအခင်း ပန်းပြောက်ခြယ် သားမွေးအခင်း
 လဲသွတ်အခင်း ရုပ်ပုံခြယ်သားမွေးအခင်း နှစ်ဖက်မွေးရှိအခင်း 
တစ်ဖက်မွေးရှိအခင်း ရွှေချည်ထိုးအခင်း ပိုးချည်အခင်း သားမွေးအခင်းကြီး

အခင်းမြတ် (နီသော) မျက်နှာကြက်နှင့် အုံးနီနှစ်ဖက်ရှိသောနေရာတို့တည်း။*[မြင့်လွန်းသောနေရာဟူသည် မြတ်စွာဘုရား လက်ရှစ်သစ် ပမာဏထက်လွန်သော အခြေရှိသော ညောင်စောင်း အင်းပျဉ်။]* *[ပလ္လင်ဟူသည် ခြေထောက်တို့၌ သားရဲရုပ်တပ်ထားသော နေရာတည်း။]*

translation-en-sujato: This includes such things as applying beauty products by anointing, massaging, bathing, and rubbing; mirrors, ointments, garlands, fragrances, and makeup; face-powder, foundation, bracelets, headbands, fancy walking-sticks or containers, rapiers, parasols, fancy sandals, turbans, jewelry, chowries, and long-fringed white robes.

When I passed away from that place I was reborn here.’ And so they recollect their many kinds of past lives, with features and details.

comment-en-sujato: I have my doubts about this phrase: in every other occurrence, ito bahiddha means “outside of the Buddhist community”. Still, comm and the Chinese text at T21 agree on this sense.

root-pli-ms: Tayidaṁ, bhikkhave, tathāgato pajānāti:

root-pli-ms: ‘ime diṭṭhiṭṭhānā evaṅgahitā evaṁparāmaṭṭhā evaṅgatikā bhavanti evaṁabhisamparāyā’ti,
translation-en-sujato: ‘If you hold on to and attach to these grounds for views it leads to such and such a destiny in the next life.’

“ဤအယူတို့သည် ဤသို့ စွဲယူထားလျှင် ဤသို့ မှားယွင်းစွာ

translation-en-sujato: He understands this, and what goes beyond this. Yet since he does not misapprehend that understanding, he has realized extinguishment within himself.

root-pli-ms: Vedanānaṁ samudayañca atthaṅgamañca assādañca ādīnavañca nissaraṇañca yathābhūtaṁ viditvā anupādāvimutto, bhikkhave, tathāgato.
translation-en-sujato: Having truly understood the origin, ending, gratification, drawback, and escape from feelings, the Realized One is freed through not grasping.

 (တစ်စုံတစ်ရာ) မစွဲလမ်းမူ၍ လွတ်မြောက်တော်မူ၏။

translation-en-sujato: These are the principles—deep, hard to see, hard to understand, peaceful, sublime, beyond the scope of reason, subtle, comprehensible to the astute—which the Realized One makes known after realizing them with his own insight. And those who genuinely praise the Realized One would rightly speak of these things.

root-pli-ms: 3.1.2. Ekaccasassatavāda
translation-en-sujato: 3.1.2. Partial Eternalism
translation-my-my-team: ၃-၁-၂။ ဧကစ္စသဿတဒိဋ္ဌိ (အချို့တည်မြဲအယူ လေးမျိုး)

root-pli-ms: Santi, bhikkhave, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā ekaccasassatikā ekaccaasassatikā ekaccaṁ sassataṁ ekaccaṁ asassataṁ attānañca lokañca paññapenti catūhi vatthūhi.
translation-en-sujato: There are some ascetics and brahmins who are partial eternalists, who assert that the self and the cosmos are partially eternal and partially not eternal on four grounds.
translation-my-my-team:
ရဟန်းတို့ အချို့တည်မြဲ အချို့မတည်မြဲ အယူရှိကုန်သော အချို့သောသမဏဗြာဟ္မဏ 
တို့သည်ရှိကုန်၏၊ (ထိုသူတို့သည်) အတ္တကိုလည်းကောင်း၊ လောကကိုလည်းကောင်း 
အချို့တည်မြဲ၏၊ အချို့မတည်မြဲဟု လေးမျိုးသော အကြောင်းတို့ဖြင့် ပြကုန်၏၊
reference: mc9.18, ms6D_74, msdiv38, ndp6.17, pts-cs2.1, sc69, sya9.23

root-pli-ms: Te ca bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā kimāgamma kimārabbha ekaccasassatikā ekaccaasassatikā ekaccaṁ sassataṁ ekaccaṁ asassataṁ attānañca lokañca paññapenti catūhi vatthūhi?
translation-en-sujato: And what are the four grounds on which they rely?
translation-my-my-team: အချို့တည်မြဲ အချို့မတည်မြဲ အယူရှိကုန်သော ထိုသမဏဗြာဟ္မဏတို့သည် အဘယ်ကို အကြောင်းပြု၍ အဘယ်ကို စွဲမှီ၍ အတ္တကိုလည်းကောင်း၊ လောကကိုလည်းကောင်း အချို့ တည်မြဲ၏ အချို့မတည်မြဲဟု လေးမျိုးသော အကြောင်းတို့ဖြင့် ပြကုန်သနည်း။

root-pli-ms: Hoti kho so, bhikkhave, samayo, yaṁ kadāci karahaci dīghassa addhuno accayena ayaṁ loko saṁvaṭṭati.
translation-en-sujato: There comes a time when, after a very long period has passed, this cosmos contracts.
translation-my-my-team: **ဧကစ္စသဿတဒိဋ္ဌိ ပဌမဝါဒ**ရဟန်းတို့ ရှည်သောကာလလွန်သော် တစ်ရံတစ်ခါ၌ ဤလောကသည် ပျက်၏၊ ထိုအခါသည်ရှိသည်သာတည်း၊
reference: bj7.30, cck9.23, km14.44, lv1.43, ms6D_75, msdiv39, pts-cs2.2, sc70

root-pli-ms: Saṁvaṭṭamāne loke yebhuyyena sattā ābhassarasaṁvattanikā honti.
translation-en-sujato: As the cosmos contracts, sentient beings are mostly headed for the realm of streaming radiance.
translation-my-my-team: လောကပျက်လတ်သော် သတ္တဝါတို့သည် များသောအားဖြင့် အာဘဿရ ဘုံ၌ ဖြစ်ကုန်၏၊*[ဒုတိယဈာန်သုံးဘုံတွင် တတိယဘုံ၊ အရောင်အဝါထွက်သော ဗြဟ္မာတို့၏နေရာ။]*

root-pli-ms: Te tattha honti manomayā pītibhakkhā sayaṁpabhā antalikkhacarā subhaṭṭhāyino, ciraṁ dīghamaddhānaṁ tiṭṭhanti.
translation-en-sujato: There they are mind-made, feeding on rapture, self-luminous, moving through the sky, steadily glorious, and they remain like that for a very long time.
translation-my-my-team: ထိုသူတို့သည် ထိုဘုံ၌ ဈာန်စိတ်ကြောင့် ဖြစ်ကုန်၏၊ နှစ်သိမ့်ခြင်း (ပီတိ) လျှင် အစာရှိကုန်၏၊ မိမိတို့ ကိုယ်ရောင်ဖြင့် လင်းလျက်ရှိကုန်၏၊ ကောင်းကင်၌ ကျက်စားကုန်၏၊ တင့်တယ်သော နေရာရှိကုန်၏၊ ကြာရှည်စွာသော ကာလပတ်လုံး တည်ကုန်၏။

root-pli-ms: Hoti kho so, bhikkhave, samayo, yaṁ kadāci karahaci dīghassa addhuno accayena ayaṁ loko vivaṭṭati.
translation-en-sujato: There comes a time when, after a very long period has passed, this cosmos expands.
translation-my-my-team: ရဟန်းတို့ ရှည်သော ကာလလွန်သော် တစ်ရံတစ်ခါ၌ ဤလောကသည် ဖြစ်၏၊ ထိုအခါသည်ရှိသည်သာတည်း၊

root-pli-ms: Vivaṭṭamāne loke suññaṁ brahmavimānaṁ pātubhavati.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho aññataro satto āyukkhayā vā puññakkhayā vā ābhassarakāyā cavitvā suññaṁ brahmavimānaṁ upapajjati.
translation-en-sujato: Then a certain sentient being—due to the running out of their life-span or merit—passes away from that host of radiant deities and is reborn in that empty mansion of Brahmā.
translation-my-my-team:
ထိုအခါ တစ်ဦးတစ်ယောက်သော သတ္တဝါသည် အသက်ကုန်သော ကြောင့်ဖြစ်စေ 
ကောင်းမှုကံကုန်သော ကြောင့်ဖြစ်စေ အာဘဿရဘုံမှ သေခဲ့၍ (သတ္တဝါမှ) ဆိတ်သော 
ဗြဟ္မာ့ဗိမာန်၌ ဖြစ်ပေါ်၏

root-pli-ms: So tattha hoti manomayo pītibhakkho sayampabho antalikkhacaro subhaṭṭhāyī, ciraṁ dīghamaddhānaṁ tiṭṭhati.
translation-en-sujato: There they are mind-made, feeding on rapture, self-luminous, moving through the sky, steadily glorious, and they remain like that for a very long time.

root-pli-ms: Tassa tattha ekakassa dīgharattaṁ nivusitattā anabhirati paritassanā uppajjati:
translation-en-sujato: But after staying there all alone for a long time, they become dissatisfied and anxious:

ကောင်းမှုကံကုန်သော ကြောင့်ဖြစ်စေ အာဘဿရဘုံမှ သေခဲ့ကုန်၍ ထိုသတ္တဝါ၏

ကာလပတ်လုံး တည်ကုန်၏။

root-pli-ms: Tatra, bhikkhave, yo so satto paṭhamaṁ upapanno tassa evaṁ hoti:

comment-en-sujato: The parallel with khiddapadosika rather confuses the issue, suggesting a rendering “depraved in mind” here. However elsewhere in the suttas, manopadosa consistently means “malicious intent”, MN 56, MN 93, also see mano padūseyya at MN 21 and MN 28. Thus the contrast here would seem to be greed vs hate. Also note DN 26, “tesaṁ sattānaṁ aññamaññamhi tibbo āghāto paccupaṭṭhito bhavissati tibbo byāpādo tibbo manopadoso tibbaṁ vadhakacittaṁ.”

translation-en-sujato: Having truly understood the origin, ending, gratification, drawback, and escape from feelings, the Realized One is freed through not grasping.

translation-en-sujato: These are the four grounds on which those ascetics and brahmins who are equivocators resort to evasiveness and equivocation whenever they’re asked a question.

root-pli-ms: Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā amarāvikkhepikā tattha tattha pañhaṁ puṭṭhā samānā vācāvikkhepaṁ āpajjanti amarāvikkhepaṁ, sabbe te imeheva catūhi vatthūhi, etesaṁ vā aññatarena, natthi ito bahiddhā …
translation-en-sujato: Any ascetics and brahmins who resort to equivocation do so on one or other of these four grounds. Outside of this there is none.

root-pli-ms: pe…
translation-en-sujato: The Realized One understands this …

root-pli-ms: yehi tathāgatassa yathābhuccaṁ vaṇṇaṁ sammā vadamānā vadeyyuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: And those who genuinely praise the Realized One would rightly speak of these things.

root-pli-ms: 3.1.5. Adhiccasamuppannavāda
translation-en-sujato: 3.1.5. Doctrines of Origination by Chance

root-pli-ms: Santi, bhikkhave, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā adhiccasamuppannikā adhiccasamuppannaṁ attānañca lokañca paññapenti dvīhi vatthūhi.
translation-en-sujato: There are some ascetics and brahmins who theorize about chance. They assert that the self and the cosmos arose by chance on two grounds.
reference: csp1ed6.27, csp2ed6.27, mc9.29, ms6D_110, msdiv67, pts-cs2.30, sc105

root-pli-ms: Te ca bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā kimāgamma kimārabbha adhiccasamuppannikā adhiccasamuppannaṁ attānañca lokañca paññapenti dvīhi vatthūhi?
translation-en-sujato: And what are the two grounds on which they rely?

root-pli-ms: Santi, bhikkhave, asaññasattā nāma devā.
translation-en-sujato: There are gods named ‘non-percipient beings’.
reference: dr9.37, km14.72, lv1.72, lv1.73, ms6D_111, msdiv68, pts-cs2.31, pts-vp-pli1.29, sc106, sya9.39

root-pli-ms: Saññuppādā ca pana te devā tamhā kāyā cavanti.
translation-en-sujato: When perception arises they pass away from that host of gods.

root-pli-ms: Ṭhānaṁ kho panetaṁ, bhikkhave, vijjati, yaṁ aññataro satto tamhā kāyā cavitvā itthattaṁ āgacchati.
translation-en-sujato: It’s possible that one of those beings passes away from that host and is reborn in this state of existence.

root-pli-ms: Itthattaṁ āgato samāno agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajati.
translation-en-sujato: Having done so, they go forth from the lay life to homelessness.

root-pli-ms: Agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajito samāno ātappamanvāya padhānamanvāya anuyogamanvāya appamādamanvāya sammāmanasikāramanvāya tathārūpaṁ cetosamādhiṁ phusati, yathāsamāhite citte saññuppādaṁ anussarati, tato paraṁ nānussarati.
translation-en-sujato: By dint of keen, resolute, committed, and diligent effort, and right focus, they experience an immersion of the heart of such a kind that they recollect the arising of perception, but no further.

root-pli-ms: So evamāha:
translation-en-sujato: They say:

root-pli-ms: ‘adhiccasamuppanno attā ca loko ca.
translation-en-sujato: ‘The self and the cosmos arose by chance.

root-pli-ms: Taṁ kissa hetu?
translation-en-sujato: Why is that?

root-pli-ms: Ahañhi pubbe nāhosiṁ, somhi etarahi ahutvā santatāya pariṇato’ti.
translation-en-sujato: Because formerly I didn’t exist. Now, having not been, I’ve sprung into existence.’

root-pli-ms: Idaṁ, bhikkhave, paṭhamaṁ ṭhānaṁ, yaṁ āgamma yaṁ ārabbha eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā adhiccasamuppannikā adhiccasamuppannaṁ attānañca lokañca paññapenti. (1: 17)
translation-en-sujato: This is the first ground on which some ascetics and brahmins rely to assert that the self and the cosmos arose by chance.

root-pli-ms: Dutiye ca bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā kimāgamma kimārabbha adhiccasamuppannikā adhiccasamuppannaṁ attānañca lokañca paññapenti?
translation-en-sujato: And what is the second ground on which they rely?

root-pli-ms: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā takkī hoti vīmaṁsī.
translation-en-sujato: It’s when some ascetic or brahmin relies on logic and inquiry.

root-pli-ms: So takkapariyāhataṁ vīmaṁsānucaritaṁ sayampaṭibhānaṁ evamāha:
translation-en-sujato: They speak of what they have worked out by logic, following a line of inquiry, expressing their own perspective:

root-pli-ms: ‘adhiccasamuppanno attā ca loko cā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘The self and the cosmos arose by chance.’

root-pli-ms: Idaṁ, bhikkhave, dutiyaṁ ṭhānaṁ, yaṁ āgamma yaṁ ārabbha eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā adhiccasamuppannikā adhiccasamuppannaṁ attānañca lokañca paññapenti. (2: 18)
translation-en-sujato: This is the second ground on which some ascetics and brahmins rely to assert that the self and the cosmos arose by chance.

root-pli-ms: Imehi kho te, bhikkhave, samaṇabrāhmaṇā adhiccasamuppannikā adhiccasamuppannaṁ attānañca lokañca paññapenti dvīhi vatthūhi.
translation-en-sujato: These are the two grounds on which those ascetics and brahmins who theorize about chance assert that the self and the cosmos arose by chance.
reference: lv1.74, mc9.30, ms6D_113, msdiv70, pts-cs2.33, sc108

root-pli-ms: Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā adhiccasamuppannikā adhiccasamuppannaṁ attānañca lokañca paññapenti, sabbe te imeheva dvīhi vatthūhi, etesaṁ vā aññatarena, natthi ito bahiddhā …
translation-en-sujato: Any ascetics and brahmins who theorize about chance do so on one or other of these two grounds. Outside of this there is none.

root-pli-ms: pe…
translation-en-sujato: The Realized One understands this …

root-pli-ms: yehi tathāgatassa yathābhuccaṁ vaṇṇaṁ sammā vadamānā vadeyyuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: And those who genuinely praise the Realized One would rightly speak of these things.

root-pli-ms: Imehi kho te, bhikkhave, samaṇabrāhmaṇā pubbantakappikā pubbantānudiṭṭhino pubbantaṁ ārabbha anekavihitāni adhimuttipadāni abhivadanti aṭṭhārasahi vatthūhi.
translation-en-sujato: These are the eighteen grounds on which those ascetics and brahmins who theorize about the past assert various hypotheses concerning the past.
reference: csp1ed6.28, csp2ed6.28, dr9.38, km14.74, ms6D_114, msdiv71, pts-cs2.35, sc109, sya9.40

root-pli-ms: Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā pubbantakappikā pubbantānudiṭṭhino pubbantamārabbha anekavihitāni adhimuttipadāni abhivadanti, sabbe te imeheva aṭṭhārasahi vatthūhi, etesaṁ vā aññatarena, natthi ito bahiddhā.
translation-en-sujato: Any ascetics and brahmins who theorize about the past do so on one or other of these eighteen grounds. Outside of this there is none.

root-pli-ms: Tayidaṁ, bhikkhave, tathāgato pajānāti:
translation-en-sujato: The Realized One understands this:

root-pli-ms: ‘ime diṭṭhiṭṭhānā evaṅgahitā evaṁparāmaṭṭhā evaṅgatikā bhavanti evaṁabhisamparāyā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘If you hold on to and attach to these grounds for views it leads to such and such a destiny in the next life.’

root-pli-ms: Tañca tathāgato pajānāti, tato ca uttaritaraṁ pajānāti, tañca pajānanaṁ na parāmasati, aparāmasato cassa paccattaññeva nibbuti viditā.
translation-en-sujato: He understands this, and what goes beyond this. Yet since he does not misapprehend that understanding, he has realized extinguishment within himself.

root-pli-ms: Vedanānaṁ samudayañca atthaṅgamañca assādañca ādīnavañca nissaraṇañca yathābhūtaṁ viditvā anupādāvimutto, bhikkhave, tathāgato.
translation-en-sujato: Having truly understood the origin, ending, gratification, drawback, and escape from feelings, the Realized One is freed through not grasping.

root-pli-ms: Ime kho te, bhikkhave, dhammā gambhīrā duddasā duranubodhā santā paṇītā atakkāvacarā nipuṇā paṇḍitavedanīyā, ye tathāgato sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedeti, yehi tathāgatassa yathābhuccaṁ vaṇṇaṁ sammā vadamānā vadeyyuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: These are the principles—deep, hard to see, hard to understand, peaceful, sublime, beyond the scope of reason, subtle, comprehensible to the astute—which the Realized One makes known after realizing them with his own insight. And those who genuinely praise the Realized One would rightly speak of these things.
reference: bj7.54, ms6D_116, msdiv73, pts-vp-pli1.30, sc111, vri1.26

root-pli-ms: Dutiyabhāṇavāro.
3.2. Aparantakappika
translation-en-sujato: 3.2. Theories About the Future

root-pli-ms: Santi, bhikkhave, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā aparantakappikā aparantānudiṭṭhino, aparantaṁ ārabbha anekavihitāni adhimuttipadāni abhivadanti catucattārīsāya vatthūhi.
translation-en-sujato: There are some ascetics and brahmins who theorize about the future, and assert various hypotheses concerning the future on forty-four grounds.

root-pli-ms: Te ca bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā kimāgamma kimārabbha aparantakappikā aparantānudiṭṭhino aparantaṁ ārabbha anekavihitāni adhimuttipadāni abhivadanti catucattārīsāya vatthūhi?
translation-en-sujato: And what are the forty-four grounds on which they rely?

root-pli-ms: 3.2.1. Saññīvāda
translation-en-sujato: 3.2.1. Percipient Life After Death

root-pli-ms: Santi, bhikkhave, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā uddhamāghātanikā saññīvādā uddhamāghātanaṁ saññiṁ attānaṁ paññapenti soḷasahi vatthūhi.
translation-en-sujato: There are some ascetics and brahmins who say there is life after death, and assert that the self lives on after death in a percipient form on sixteen grounds.
reference: csp1ed6.29, csp2ed6.29, dr9.39, lv1.77, mc9.31, ms6D_119, msdiv75, pts-cs2.38, pts-vp-pli1.31, sc113, sya9.41

root-pli-ms: Te ca bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā kimāgamma kimārabbha uddhamāghātanikā saññīvādā uddhamāghātanaṁ saññiṁ attānaṁ paññapenti soḷasahi vatthūhi?
translation-en-sujato: And what are the sixteen grounds on which they rely?

root-pli-ms: ‘Rūpī attā hoti arogo paraṁ maraṇā saññī’ti naṁ paññapenti. (1: 19)
translation-en-sujato: They assert: ‘The self is sound and percipient after death, and it is physical …

root-pli-ms: ‘Arūpī attā hoti arogo paraṁ maraṇā saññī’ti naṁ paññapenti. (2: 20)
translation-en-sujato: non-physical …

root-pli-ms: ‘Rūpī ca arūpī ca attā hoti …pe…. (3: 21)
translation-en-sujato: both physical and non-physical …

root-pli-ms: ‘Nevarūpī nārūpī attā hoti …. (4: 22)
translation-en-sujato: neither physical nor non-physical …

root-pli-ms: ‘Antavā attā hoti …. (5: 23)
translation-en-sujato: finite …

root-pli-ms: ‘Anantavā attā hoti …. (6: 24)
translation-en-sujato: infinite …

root-pli-ms: ‘Antavā ca anantavā ca attā hoti …. (7: 25)
translation-en-sujato: both finite and infinite …

root-pli-ms: ‘Nevantavā nānantavā attā hoti …. (8: 26)
translation-en-sujato: neither finite nor infinite …

root-pli-ms: ‘Ekattasaññī attā hoti …. (9: 27)
translation-en-sujato: of unified perception …

root-pli-ms: ‘Nānattasaññī attā hoti …. (10: 28)
translation-en-sujato: of diverse perception …

root-pli-ms: ‘Parittasaññī attā hoti …. (11: 29)
translation-en-sujato: of limited perception …

root-pli-ms: ‘Appamāṇasaññī attā hoti …. (12: 30)
translation-en-sujato: of limitless perception …

root-pli-ms: ‘Ekantasukhī attā hoti …. (13: 31)
translation-en-sujato: experiences nothing but happiness …

root-pli-ms: ‘Ekantadukkhī attā hoti …. (14: 32)
translation-en-sujato: experiences nothing but suffering …

root-pli-ms: ‘Sukhadukkhī attā hoti …. (15: 33)
translation-en-sujato: experiences both happiness and suffering …

root-pli-ms: ‘Adukkhamasukhī attā hoti arogo paraṁ maraṇā saññī’ti naṁ paññapenti. (16: 34)
translation-en-sujato: experiences neither happiness nor suffering.’

root-pli-ms: Imehi kho te, bhikkhave, samaṇabrāhmaṇā uddhamāghātanikā saññīvādā uddhamāghātanaṁ saññiṁ attānaṁ paññapenti soḷasahi vatthūhi.
translation-en-sujato: These are the sixteen grounds on which those ascetics and brahmins assert that the self lives on after death in a percipient form.
reference: bj7.56, lv1.78, ms6D_136, msdiv77, pts-cs2.39, pts-vp-pli1.32, sc130, vri1.27

root-pli-ms: Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā uddhamāghātanikā saññīvādā uddhamāghātanaṁ saññiṁ attānaṁ paññapenti, sabbe te imeheva soḷasahi vatthūhi, etesaṁ vā aññatarena, natthi ito bahiddhā …
translation-en-sujato: Any ascetics and brahmins who assert that the self lives on after death in a percipient form do so on one or other of these sixteen grounds. Outside of this there is none.

root-pli-ms: pe…
translation-en-sujato: The Realized One understands this …

root-pli-ms: yehi tathāgatassa yathābhuccaṁ vaṇṇaṁ sammā vadamānā vadeyyuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: And those who genuinely praise the Realized One would rightly speak of these things.

root-pli-ms: 3.2.2. Asaññīvāda
translation-en-sujato: 3.2.2. Non-Percipient Life After Death

root-pli-ms: Santi, bhikkhave, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā uddhamāghātanikā asaññīvādā uddhamāghātanaṁ asaññiṁ attānaṁ paññapenti aṭṭhahi vatthūhi.
translation-en-sujato: There are some ascetics and brahmins who say there is life after death, and assert that the self lives on after death in a non-percipient form on eight grounds.

root-pli-ms: Te ca bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā kimāgamma kimārabbha uddhamāghātanikā asaññīvādā uddhamāghātanaṁ asaññiṁ attānaṁ paññapenti aṭṭhahi vatthūhi?
translation-en-sujato: And what are the eight grounds on which they rely?

root-pli-ms: ‘Rūpī attā hoti arogo paraṁ maraṇā asaññī’ti naṁ paññapenti. (1: 35)
translation-en-sujato: They assert: ‘The self is sound and non-percipient after death, and it is physical …

root-pli-ms: ‘Arūpī attā hoti arogo paraṁ maraṇā asaññī’ti naṁ paññapenti. (2: 36)
translation-en-sujato: non-physical …

root-pli-ms: ‘Rūpī ca arūpī ca attā hoti …pe…. (3: 37)
translation-en-sujato: both physical and non-physical …

root-pli-ms: ‘Nevarūpī nārūpī attā hoti …. (4: 38)
translation-en-sujato: neither physical nor non-physical …

root-pli-ms: ‘Antavā attā hoti …. (5: 39)
translation-en-sujato: finite …

root-pli-ms: ‘Anantavā attā hoti …. (6: 40)
translation-en-sujato: infinite …

root-pli-ms: ‘Antavā ca anantavā ca attā hoti …. (7: 41)
translation-en-sujato: both finite and infinite …

root-pli-ms: ‘Nevantavā nānantavā attā hoti arogo paraṁ maraṇā asaññī’ti naṁ paññapenti. (8: 42)
translation-en-sujato: neither finite nor infinite.’

root-pli-ms: Imehi kho te, bhikkhave, samaṇabrāhmaṇā uddhamāghātanikā asaññīvādā uddhamāghātanaṁ asaññiṁ attānaṁ paññapenti aṭṭhahi vatthūhi.
translation-en-sujato: These are the eight grounds on which those ascetics and brahmins assert that the self lives on after death in a non-percipient form.
reference: bj7.58, csp1ed6.30, csp2ed6.30, km14.79, lv1.80, ms6D_146, msdiv80, pts-cs3.3, pts-vp-pli1.33, sc140, vri1.28

root-pli-ms: Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā uddhamāghātanikā asaññīvādā uddhamāghātanaṁ asaññiṁ attānaṁ paññapenti, sabbe te imeheva aṭṭhahi vatthūhi, etesaṁ vā aññatarena, natthi ito bahiddhā …
translation-en-sujato: Any ascetics and brahmins who assert that the self lives on after death in a non-percipient form do so on one or other of these eight grounds. Outside of this there is none.

root-pli-ms: pe…
translation-en-sujato: The Realized One understands this …

root-pli-ms: yehi tathāgatassa yathābhuccaṁ vaṇṇaṁ sammā vadamānā vadeyyuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: And those who genuinely praise the Realized One would rightly speak of these things.

root-pli-ms: 3.2.3. Nevasaññīnāsaññīvāda
translation-en-sujato: 3.2.3. Neither Percipient Nor Non-Percipient Life After Death

root-pli-ms: Santi, bhikkhave, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā uddhamāghātanikā nevasaññīnāsaññīvādā, uddhamāghātanaṁ nevasaññīnāsaññiṁ attānaṁ paññapenti aṭṭhahi vatthūhi.
translation-en-sujato: There are some ascetics and brahmins who say there is life after death, and assert that the self lives on after death in a neither percipient nor non-percipient form on eight grounds.

root-pli-ms: Te ca bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā kimāgamma kimārabbha uddhamāghātanikā nevasaññīnāsaññīvādā uddhamāghātanaṁ nevasaññīnāsaññiṁ attānaṁ paññapenti aṭṭhahi vatthūhi?
translation-en-sujato: And what are the eight grounds on which they rely?

root-pli-ms: ‘Rūpī attā hoti arogo paraṁ maraṇā nevasaññīnāsaññī’ti naṁ paññapenti. (1: 43)
translation-en-sujato: They assert: ‘The self is sound and neither percipient nor non-percipient after death, and it is physical …

root-pli-ms: ‘Arūpī attā hoti …pe…. (2: 44)
translation-en-sujato: non-physical …

root-pli-ms: ‘Rūpī ca arūpī ca attā hoti …. (3: 45)
translation-en-sujato: both physical and non-physical …

root-pli-ms: ‘Nevarūpī nārūpī attā hoti …. (4: 46)
translation-en-sujato: neither physical nor non-physical …

root-pli-ms: ‘Antavā attā hoti …. (5: 47)
translation-en-sujato: finite …

root-pli-ms: ‘Anantavā attā hoti …. (6: 48)
translation-en-sujato: infinite …

root-pli-ms: ‘Antavā ca anantavā ca attā hoti …. (7: 49)
translation-en-sujato: both finite and infinite …

root-pli-ms: ‘Nevantavā nānantavā attā hoti arogo paraṁ maraṇā nevasaññīnāsaññī’ti naṁ paññapenti. (8: 50)
translation-en-sujato: neither finite nor infinite.’

root-pli-ms: Imehi kho te, bhikkhave, samaṇabrāhmaṇā uddhamāghātanikā nevasaññīnāsaññīvādā uddhamāghātanaṁ nevasaññīnāsaññiṁ attānaṁ paññapenti aṭṭhahi vatthūhi.
translation-en-sujato: These are the eight grounds on which those ascetics and brahmins assert that the self lives on after death in a neither percipient nor non-percipient form.
reference: cck9.42, lv1.82, ms6D_156, msdiv83, pts-cs3.7, sc150, vri1.29

root-pli-ms: Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā uddhamāghātanikā nevasaññīnāsaññīvādā uddhamāghātanaṁ nevasaññīnāsaññiṁ attānaṁ paññapenti, sabbe te imeheva aṭṭhahi vatthūhi …
translation-en-sujato: Any ascetics and brahmins who assert that the self lives on after death in a neither percipient nor non-percipient form do so on one or other of these eight grounds. Outside of this there is none.

root-pli-ms: pe…
translation-en-sujato: The Realized One understands this …

root-pli-ms: yehi tathāgatassa yathābhuccaṁ vaṇṇaṁ sammā vadamānā vadeyyuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: And those who genuinely praise the Realized One would rightly speak of these things.

root-pli-ms: 3.2.4. Ucchedavāda
translation-en-sujato: 3.2.4. Annihilationism

root-pli-ms: Santi, bhikkhave, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā ucchedavādā sato sattassa ucchedaṁ vināsaṁ vibhavaṁ paññapenti sattahi vatthūhi.
translation-en-sujato: There are some ascetics and brahmins who are annihilationists. They assert the annihilation, eradication, and obliteration of an existing being on seven grounds.
reference: bj7.60, csp1ed6.31, csp2ed6.31, km14.81, ms6D_157, msdiv84, ndp6.30, pts-cs3.9, pts-vp-pli1.34, sc151

root-pli-ms: Te ca bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā kimāgamma kimārabbha ucchedavādā sato sattassa ucchedaṁ vināsaṁ vibhavaṁ paññapenti sattahi vatthūhi?
translation-en-sujato: And what are the seven grounds on which they rely?

root-pli-ms: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā evaṁvādī hoti evaṁdiṭṭhi:
translation-en-sujato: There are some ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:
reference: dr9.42, lv1.83, ms6D_158, msdiv85, pts-cs3.10, sc152

root-pli-ms: ‘yato kho, bho, ayaṁ attā rūpī cātumahābhūtiko mātāpettikasambhavo kāyassa bhedā ucchijjati vinassati, na hoti paraṁ maraṇā, ettāvatā kho, bho, ayaṁ attā sammā samucchinno hotī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘This self is physical, made up of the four primary elements, and produced by mother and father. Since it’s annihilated and destroyed when the body breaks up, and doesn’t exist after death, that’s how this self becomes rightly annihilated.’

root-pli-ms: Ittheke sato sattassa ucchedaṁ vināsaṁ vibhavaṁ paññapenti. (1: 51)
translation-en-sujato: That is how some assert the annihilation of an existing being.

root-pli-ms: Tamañño evamāha:
translation-en-sujato: But someone else says to them:

root-pli-ms: ‘atthi kho, bho, eso attā, yaṁ tvaṁ vadesi, neso natthīti vadāmi;
translation-en-sujato: ‘*That* self of which you speak does exist, I don’t deny it.

root-pli-ms: no ca kho, bho, ayaṁ attā ettāvatā sammā samucchinno hoti.
translation-en-sujato: But that’s not how *this* self becomes rightly annihilated.

root-pli-ms: Atthi kho, bho, añño attā dibbo rūpī kāmāvacaro kabaḷīkārāhārabhakkho.
translation-en-sujato: There is another self that is divine, physical, sensual, consuming solid food.

root-pli-ms: Taṁ tvaṁ na jānāsi na passasi.
translation-en-sujato: You don’t know or see that.

root-pli-ms: Tamahaṁ jānāmi passāmi.
translation-en-sujato: But I know it and see it.

root-pli-ms: So kho, bho, attā yato kāyassa bhedā ucchijjati vinassati, na hoti paraṁ maraṇā, ettāvatā kho, bho, ayaṁ attā sammā samucchinno hotī’ti.

root-pli-ms: 3.2.5. Diṭṭhadhammanibbānavāda
translation-en-sujato: 3.2.5. Extinguishment in the Present Life

root-pli-ms: Santi, bhikkhave, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā diṭṭhadhammanibbānavādā sato sattassa paramadiṭṭhadhammanibbānaṁ paññapenti pañcahi vatthūhi.
translation-en-sujato: There are some ascetics and brahmins who speak of extinguishment in the present life. They assert the ultimate extinguishment of an existing being in the present life on five grounds.
reference: lv1.89, ms6D_166, msdiv93, pts-cs3.19, sc160, sya9.47

root-pli-ms: Te ca bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā kimāgamma kimārabbha diṭṭhadhammanibbānavādā sato sattassa paramadiṭṭhadhammanibbānaṁ paññapenti pañcahi vatthūhi?
translation-en-sujato: And what are the five grounds on which they rely?

root-pli-ms: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā evaṁvādī hoti evaṁdiṭṭhi:
translation-en-sujato: There are some ascetics and brahmins who have this doctrine and view:

root-pli-ms: ‘yato kho, bho, ayaṁ attā pañcahi kāmaguṇehi samappito samaṅgībhūto paricāreti, ettāvatā kho, bho, ayaṁ attā paramadiṭṭhadhammanibbānaṁ patto hotī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘When this self amuses itself, supplied and provided with the five kinds of sensual stimulation, that’s how this self attains ultimate extinguishment in the present life.’

root-pli-ms: Ittheke sato sattassa paramadiṭṭhadhammanibbānaṁ paññapenti. (1: 58)
translation-en-sujato: That is how some assert the extinguishment of an existing being in the present life.

root-pli-ms: Tamañño evamāha:
translation-en-sujato: But someone else says to them:
reference: csp1ed6.34, csp2ed6.34, km14.88, lv1.90, ms6D_168, msdiv95, pts-cs3.21, pts-vp-pli1.37, sc162

root-pli-ms: ‘atthi kho, bho, eso attā, yaṁ tvaṁ vadesi, neso natthīti vadāmi;

root-pli-ms: no ca kho, bho, ayaṁ attā ettāvatā paramadiṭṭhadhammanibbānaṁ patto hoti.
translation-en-sujato: But that’s not how *this* self attains ultimate extinguishment in the present life.

root-pli-ms: Taṁ kissa hetu?
translation-en-sujato: Why is that?

root-pli-ms: Kāmā hi, bho, aniccā dukkhā vipariṇāmadhammā, tesaṁ vipariṇāmaññathābhāvā uppajjanti sokaparidevadukkhadomanassupāyāsā.
translation-en-sujato: Because sensual pleasures are impermanent, suffering, and perishable. Their decay and perishing give rise to sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress.

root-pli-ms: Yato kho, bho, ayaṁ attā vivicceva kāmehi vivicca akusalehi dhammehi savitakkaṁ savicāraṁ vivekajaṁ pītisukhaṁ paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati, ettāvatā kho, bho, ayaṁ attā paramadiṭṭhadhammanibbānaṁ patto hotī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: Quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, this self enters and remains in the first absorption, which has the rapture and bliss born of seclusion, while placing the mind and keeping it connected. That’s how this self attains ultimate extinguishment in the present life.’

root-pli-ms: Ittheke sato sattassa paramadiṭṭhadhammanibbānaṁ paññapenti. (2: 59)
translation-en-sujato: That is how some assert the extinguishment of an existing being in the present life.

root-pli-ms: Tamañño evamāha:
translation-en-sujato: But someone else says to them:

root-pli-ms: ‘atthi kho, bho, eso attā, yaṁ tvaṁ vadesi, neso natthīti vadāmi;

root-pli-ms: no ca kho, bho, ayaṁ attā ettāvatā paramadiṭṭhadhammanibbānaṁ patto hoti.
translation-en-sujato: But that’s not how *this* self attains ultimate extinguishment in the present life.

root-pli-ms: Taṁ kissa hetu?
translation-en-sujato: Why is that?

root-pli-ms: Yadeva tattha vitakkitaṁ vicāritaṁ, etenetaṁ oḷārikaṁ akkhāyati.
translation-en-sujato: Because the placing of the mind and the keeping it connected there are coarse.

root-pli-ms: Yato kho, bho, ayaṁ attā vitakkavicārānaṁ vūpasamā ajjhattaṁ sampasādanaṁ cetaso ekodibhāvaṁ avitakkaṁ avicāraṁ samādhijaṁ pītisukhaṁ dutiyaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati, ettāvatā kho, bho, ayaṁ attā paramadiṭṭhadhammanibbānaṁ patto hotī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: But when the placing of the mind and keeping it connected are stilled, this self enters and remains in the second absorption, which has the rapture and bliss born of immersion, with internal clarity and confidence, and unified mind, without placing the mind and keeping it connected. That’s how this self attains ultimate extinguishment in the present life.’

root-pli-ms: Ittheke sato sattassa paramadiṭṭhadhammanibbānaṁ paññapenti. (3: 60)
translation-en-sujato: That is how some assert the extinguishment of an existing being in the present life.

root-pli-ms: Taṁ kissa hetu?
translation-en-sujato: Why is that?

root-pli-ms: Yadeva tattha pītigataṁ cetaso uppilāvitattaṁ, etenetaṁ oḷārikaṁ akkhāyati.
translation-en-sujato: Because the rapture and emotional excitement there are coarse.

root-pli-ms: Yato kho, bho, ayaṁ attā pītiyā ca virāgā upekkhako ca viharati, sato ca sampajāno, sukhañca kāyena paṭisaṁvedeti, yaṁ taṁ ariyā ācikkhanti “upekkhako satimā sukhavihārī”ti, tatiyaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati, ettāvatā kho, bho, ayaṁ attā paramadiṭṭhadhammanibbānaṁ patto hotī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: But with the fading away of rapture, this self enters and remains in the third absorption, where it meditates with equanimity, mindful and aware, personally experiencing the bliss of which the noble ones declare, “Equanimous and mindful, one meditates in bliss”. That’s how this self attains ultimate extinguishment in the present life.’

root-pli-ms: Ittheke sato sattassa paramadiṭṭhadhammanibbānaṁ paññapenti. (4: 61)
translation-en-sujato: That is how some assert the extinguishment of an existing being in the present life.

translation-en-sujato: But that’s not how *this* self attains ultimate extinguishment in the present life.

root-pli-ms: Taṁ kissa hetu?
translation-en-sujato: Why is that?

root-pli-ms: Yadeva tattha sukhamiti cetaso ābhogo, etenetaṁ oḷārikaṁ akkhāyati.
translation-en-sujato: Because the bliss and enjoyment there are coarse.

root-pli-ms: Yato kho, bho, ayaṁ attā sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā pubbeva somanassadomanassānaṁ atthaṅgamā adukkhamasukhaṁ upekkhāsatipārisuddhiṁ catutthaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati, ettāvatā kho, bho, ayaṁ attā paramadiṭṭhadhammanibbānaṁ patto hotī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: But giving up pleasure and pain, and ending former happiness and sadness, this self enters and remains in the fourth absorption, without pleasure or pain, with pure equanimity and mindfulness. That’s how this self attains ultimate extinguishment in the present life.’

root-pli-ms: Ittheke sato sattassa paramadiṭṭhadhammanibbānaṁ paññapenti. (5: 62)
translation-en-sujato: That is how some assert the extinguishment of an existing being in the present life.

root-pli-ms: Imehi kho te, bhikkhave, samaṇabrāhmaṇā pubbantakappikā ca aparantakappikā ca pubbantāparantakappikā ca pubbantāparantānudiṭṭhino pubbantāparantaṁ ārabbha anekavihitāni adhimuttipadāni abhivadanti dvāsaṭṭhiyā vatthūhi.
translation-en-sujato: These are the sixty-two grounds on which those ascetics and brahmins who theorize about the past and the future assert various hypotheses concerning the past and the future.

root-pli-ms: Ye hi keci, bhikkhave, samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā pubbantakappikā vā aparantakappikā vā pubbantāparantakappikā vā pubbantāparantānudiṭṭhino pubbantāparantaṁ ārabbha anekavihitāni adhimuttipadāni abhivadanti, sabbe te imeheva dvāsaṭṭhiyā vatthūhi, etesaṁ vā aññatarena; natthi ito bahiddhā.
translation-en-sujato: Any ascetics and brahmins who theorize about the past or the future do so on one or other of these sixty-two grounds. Outside of this there is none.

root-pli-ms: Tayidaṁ, bhikkhave, tathāgato pajānāti:
translation-en-sujato: The Realized One understands this:

root-pli-ms: ‘ime diṭṭhiṭṭhānā evaṅgahitā evaṁparāmaṭṭhā evaṅgatikā bhavanti evaṁabhisamparāyā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘If you hold on to and attach to these grounds for views it leads to such and such a destiny in the next life.’

root-pli-ms: Tañca tathāgato pajānāti, tato ca uttaritaraṁ pajānāti, tañca pajānanaṁ na parāmasati, aparāmasato cassa paccattaññeva nibbuti viditā.
translation-en-sujato: He understands this, and what goes beyond this. Yet since he does not misapprehend that understanding, he has realized extinguishment within himself.

root-pli-ms: Vedanānaṁ samudayañca atthaṅgamañca assādañca ādīnavañca nissaraṇañca yathābhūtaṁ viditvā anupādāvimutto, bhikkhave, tathāgato.
translation-en-sujato: Having truly understood the origin, ending, gratification, drawback, and escape from feelings, the Realized One is freed through not grasping.

root-pli-ms: Ime kho te, bhikkhave, dhammā gambhīrā duddasā duranubodhā santā paṇītā atakkāvacarā nipuṇā paṇḍitavedanīyā, ye tathāgato sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedeti, yehi tathāgatassa yathābhuccaṁ vaṇṇaṁ sammā vadamānā vadeyyuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: These are the principles—deep, hard to see, hard to understand, peaceful, sublime, beyond the scope of reason, subtle, comprehensible to the astute—which the Realized One makes known after realizing them with his own insight. And those who genuinely praise the Realized One would rightly speak of these things.
reference: cck9.49, csp1ed6.36, csp2ed6.36, ms6D_177, msdiv104, pts-cs3.31, sc171

root-pli-ms: 4. Attālokapaññattivatthu
translation-en-sujato: 4. The Grounds For Assertions About the Self and the Cosmos

root-pli-ms: 4.1. Paritassitavipphanditavāra
translation-en-sujato: 4.1. Anxiety and Evasiveness

root-pli-ms: Tatra, bhikkhave, ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā sassatavādā sassataṁ attānañca lokañca paññapenti catūhi vatthūhi, tadapi tesaṁ bhavataṁ samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṁ ajānataṁ apassataṁ vedayitaṁ taṇhāgatānaṁ paritassitavipphanditameva.
translation-en-sujato: Now, these things are only the feeling of those who do not know or see, the agitation and evasiveness of those under the sway of craving. Namely, when those ascetics and brahmins assert that the self and the cosmos are eternal on four grounds …
reference: km14.94, lv1.97, ms6D_178, msdiv105, pts-cs3.32, pts-vp-pli1.40, sc172

root-pli-ms: Tatra, bhikkhave, ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā ekaccasassatikā ekaccaasassatikā ekaccaṁ sassataṁ ekaccaṁ asassataṁ attānañca lokañca paññapenti catūhi vatthūhi, tadapi tesaṁ bhavataṁ samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṁ ajānataṁ apassataṁ vedayitaṁ taṇhāgatānaṁ paritassitavipphanditameva.
translation-en-sujato: partially eternal on four grounds …

root-pli-ms: Tatra, bhikkhave, ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā antānantikā antānantaṁ lokassa paññapenti catūhi vatthūhi, tadapi tesaṁ bhavataṁ samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṁ ajānataṁ apassataṁ vedayitaṁ taṇhāgatānaṁ paritassitavipphanditameva.
translation-en-sujato: finite or infinite on four grounds …

root-pli-ms: Tatra, bhikkhave, ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā amarāvikkhepikā tattha tattha pañhaṁ puṭṭhā samānā vācāvikkhepaṁ āpajjanti amarāvikkhepaṁ catūhi vatthūhi, tadapi tesaṁ bhavataṁ samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṁ ajānataṁ apassataṁ vedayitaṁ taṇhāgatānaṁ paritassitavipphanditameva.
translation-en-sujato: or they resort to equivocation on four grounds …

root-pli-ms: Tatra, bhikkhave, ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā adhiccasamuppannikā adhiccasamuppannaṁ attānañca lokañca paññapenti dvīhi vatthūhi, tadapi tesaṁ bhavataṁ samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṁ ajānataṁ apassataṁ vedayitaṁ taṇhāgatānaṁ paritassitavipphanditameva.
translation-en-sujato: or they assert that the self and the cosmos arose by chance on two grounds …

root-pli-ms: Tatra, bhikkhave, ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā pubbantakappikā pubbantānudiṭṭhino pubbantaṁ ārabbha anekavihitāni adhimuttipadāni abhivadanti aṭṭhārasahi vatthūhi, tadapi tesaṁ bhavataṁ samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṁ ajānataṁ apassataṁ vedayitaṁ taṇhāgatānaṁ paritassitavipphanditameva.
translation-en-sujato: they theorize about the past on these eighteen grounds …
reference: csp1ed6.37, csp2ed6.37, km14.96, lv1.99, ms6D_183, msdiv110, pts-cs3.37, sc177, vri1.35

root-pli-ms: Tatra, bhikkhave, ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā uddhamāghātanikā saññīvādā uddhamāghātanaṁ saññiṁ attānaṁ paññapenti soḷasahi vatthūhi, tadapi tesaṁ bhavataṁ samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṁ ajānataṁ apassataṁ vedayitaṁ taṇhāgatānaṁ paritassitavipphanditameva.
translation-en-sujato: or they assert that the self lives on after death in a percipient form on sixteen grounds …

root-pli-ms: Tatra, bhikkhave, ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā uddhamāghātanikā asaññīvādā uddhamāghātanaṁ asaññiṁ attānaṁ paññapenti aṭṭhahi vatthūhi, tadapi tesaṁ bhavataṁ samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṁ ajānataṁ apassataṁ vedayitaṁ taṇhāgatānaṁ paritassitavipphanditameva.
translation-en-sujato: or that the self lives on after death in a non-percipient form on eight grounds …
reference: dr9.50, km14.97, ms6D_185, msdiv112, pts-cs3.39, pts-vp-pli1.41, sc179, sya9.52

root-pli-ms: Tatra, bhikkhave, ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā uddhamāghātanikā nevasaññīnāsaññīvādā uddhamāghātanaṁ nevasaññīnāsaññiṁ attānaṁ paññapenti aṭṭhahi vatthūhi, tadapi tesaṁ bhavataṁ samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṁ ajānataṁ apassataṁ vedayitaṁ taṇhāgatānaṁ paritassitavipphanditameva.
translation-en-sujato: or that the self lives on after death in a neither percipient nor non-percipient form on eight grounds …

root-pli-ms: Tatra, bhikkhave, ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā ucchedavādā sato sattassa ucchedaṁ vināsaṁ vibhavaṁ paññapenti sattahi vatthūhi, tadapi tesaṁ bhavataṁ samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṁ ajānataṁ apassataṁ vedayitaṁ taṇhāgatānaṁ paritassitavipphanditameva.
translation-en-sujato: or they assert the annihilation of an existing being on seven grounds …

root-pli-ms: Tatra, bhikkhave, ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā diṭṭhadhammanibbānavādā sato sattassa paramadiṭṭhadhammanibbānaṁ paññapenti pañcahi vatthūhi, tadapi tesaṁ bhavataṁ samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṁ ajānataṁ apassataṁ vedayitaṁ taṇhāgatānaṁ paritassitavipphanditameva.
translation-en-sujato: or they assert the ultimate extinguishment of an existing being in the present life on five grounds …

root-pli-ms: Tatra, bhikkhave, ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā aparantakappikā aparantānudiṭṭhino aparantaṁ ārabbha anekavihitāni adhimuttipadāni abhivadanti catucattārīsāya vatthūhi, tadapi tesaṁ bhavataṁ samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṁ ajānataṁ apassataṁ vedayitaṁ taṇhāgatānaṁ paritassitavipphanditameva.
translation-en-sujato: they theorize about the future on these forty-four grounds …

root-pli-ms: Tatra, bhikkhave, ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā pubbantakappikā ca aparantakappikā ca pubbantāparantakappikā ca pubbantāparantānudiṭṭhino pubbantāparantaṁ ārabbha anekavihitāni adhimuttipadāni abhivadanti dvāsaṭṭhiyā vatthūhi, tadapi tesaṁ bhavataṁ samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṁ ajānataṁ apassataṁ vedayitaṁ taṇhāgatānaṁ paritassitavipphanditameva.
translation-en-sujato: When those ascetics and brahmins theorize about the past and the future on these sixty-two grounds, these things are only the feeling of those who do not know or see, the agitation and evasiveness of those under the sway of craving.
reference: bj7.72, csp1ed6.38, csp2ed6.38, dr9.51, ms6D_190, msdiv117, pts-cs3.44, sc184, sya9.53, vri1.36

root-pli-ms: 4.2. Phassapaccayāvāra
translation-en-sujato: 4.2. Conditioned by Contact

root-pli-ms: Tatra, bhikkhave, ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā sassatavādā sassataṁ attānañca lokañca paññapenti catūhi vatthūhi, tadapi phassapaccayā.
translation-en-sujato: Now, these things are conditioned by contact. Namely, when those ascetics and brahmins assert that the self and the cosmos are eternal on four grounds …

translation-en-sujato: or they assert that the self and the cosmos arose by chance on two grounds …

translation-en-sujato: they theorize about the past on these eighteen grounds …

translation-en-sujato: they theorize about the future on these forty-four grounds …
reference: lv1.105, ms6D_202, msdiv129, pts-cs3.56, pts-vp-pli1.43, sc196

root-pli-ms: Tatra, bhikkhave, ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā pubbantakappikā ca aparantakappikā ca pubbantāparantakappikā ca pubbantāparantānudiṭṭhino pubbantāparantaṁ ārabbha anekavihitāni adhimuttipadāni abhivadanti dvāsaṭṭhiyā vatthūhi, tadapi phassapaccayā.
translation-en-sujato: When those ascetics and brahmins theorize about the past and the future on these sixty-two grounds, that too is conditioned by contact.

root-pli-ms: 4.3. Netaṁṭhānaṁvijjativāra
translation-en-sujato: 4.3. Not Possible

root-pli-ms: Tatra, bhikkhave, ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā sassatavādā sassataṁ attānañca lokañca paññapenti catūhi vatthūhi, te vata aññatra phassā paṭisaṁvedissantīti netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.

Tatra, bhikkhave, ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā ekaccasassatikā ekaccaasassatikā ekaccaṁ sassataṁ ekaccaṁ asassataṁ attānañca lokañca paññapenti catūhi vatthūhi, te vata aññatra phassā paṭisaṁvedissantīti netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
Tatra, bhikkhave, ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā antānantikā antānantaṁ lokassa paññapenti catūhi vatthūhi, te vata aññatra phassā paṭisaṁvedissantīti netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
reference: cck9.54, csp1ed6.40, csp2ed6.40, km14.104, ms6D_206, msdiv133, pts-cs3.60, sc200, vri1.38

root-pli-ms: Tatra, bhikkhave, ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā amarāvikkhepikā tattha tattha pañhaṁ puṭṭhā samānā vācāvikkhepaṁ āpajjanti amarāvikkhepaṁ catūhi vatthūhi, te vata aññatra phassā paṭisaṁvedissantīti netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
reference: lv1.107, ms6D_207, msdiv134, ndp6.38, pts-cs3.61, sc201
