root-pli-ms: “Santāneva kho, mahāli, sunakkhatto licchaviputto dibbāni saddāni nāssosi piyarūpāni kāmūpasaṁhitāni rajanīyāni, no asantānī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Such sounds really do exist, but Sunakkhatta cannot hear them.”

root-pli-ms: “Ko nu kho, bhante, hetu, ko paccayo, yena santāneva sunakkhatto licchaviputto dibbāni saddāni nāssosi piyarūpāni kāmūpasaṁhitāni rajanīyāni, no asantānī”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “What is the cause, sir, what is the reason why Sunakkhatta cannot hear them, even though they really do exist?”

root-pli-ms: “Idha, mahāli, bhikkhuno puratthimāya disāya ekaṁsabhāvito samādhi hoti dibbānaṁ rūpānaṁ dassanāya piyarūpānaṁ kāmūpasaṁhitānaṁ rajanīyānaṁ, no ca kho dibbānaṁ saddānaṁ savanāya piyarūpānaṁ kāmūpasaṁhitānaṁ rajanīyānaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: “Mahāli, take a mendicant who has developed one-sided immersion to the eastern quarter so as to see heavenly sights but not to hear heavenly sounds.
comment-en-sujato: RD’s translation of this passage is much more satisfactory than MW’s.
reference: cck9.196, csp1ed6.146, csp2ed6.146, dr9.207, km15.61, ms6D_605, msdiv366, pts-vp-pli1.153, sc9

root-pli-ms: So puratthimāya disāya ekaṁsabhāvite samādhimhi dibbānaṁ rūpānaṁ dassanāya piyarūpānaṁ kāmūpasaṁhitānaṁ rajanīyānaṁ, no ca kho dibbānaṁ saddānaṁ savanāya piyarūpānaṁ kāmūpasaṁhitānaṁ rajanīyānaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: When they have developed immersion for that purpose,

root-pli-ms: Puratthimāya disāya dibbāni rūpāni passati piyarūpāni kāmūpasaṁhitāni rajanīyāni, no ca kho dibbāni saddāni suṇāti piyarūpāni kāmūpasaṁhitāni rajanīyāni.
translation-en-sujato: they see heavenly sights but don’t hear heavenly sounds.

root-pli-ms: Taṁ kissa hetu?
translation-en-sujato: Why is that?

root-pli-ms: Evañhetaṁ, mahāli, hoti bhikkhuno puratthimāya disāya ekaṁsabhāvite samādhimhi dibbānaṁ rūpānaṁ dassanāya piyarūpānaṁ kāmūpasaṁhitānaṁ rajanīyānaṁ, no ca kho dibbānaṁ saddānaṁ savanāya piyarūpānaṁ kāmūpasaṁhitānaṁ rajanīyānaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Because that is how it is for a mendicant who develops immersion in that way.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, mahāli, bhikkhuno dakkhiṇāya disāya …pe…
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, take a mendicant who has developed one-sided immersion to the southern quarter …

root-pli-ms: pacchimāya disāya …
translation-en-sujato: western quarter …

root-pli-ms: uttarāya disāya …
translation-en-sujato: northern quarter …

root-pli-ms: uddhamadho tiriyaṁ ekaṁsabhāvito samādhi hoti dibbānaṁ rūpānaṁ dassanāya piyarūpānaṁ kāmūpasaṁhitānaṁ rajanīyānaṁ, no ca kho dibbānaṁ saddānaṁ savanāya piyarūpānaṁ kāmūpasaṁhitānaṁ rajanīyānaṁ.

Uddhamadho tiriyaṁ dibbāni rūpāni passati piyarūpāni kāmūpasaṁhitāni rajanīyāni, no ca kho dibbāni saddāni suṇāti piyarūpāni kāmūpasaṁhitāni rajanīyāni.
Taṁ kissa hetu?

Evañhetaṁ, mahāli, hoti bhikkhuno uddhamadho tiriyaṁ ekaṁsabhāvite samādhimhi dibbānaṁ rūpānaṁ dassanāya piyarūpānaṁ kāmūpasaṁhitānaṁ rajanīyānaṁ, no ca kho dibbānaṁ saddānaṁ savanāya piyarūpānaṁ kāmūpasaṁhitānaṁ rajanīyānaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: That is how it is for a mendicant who develops immersion in that way.

root-pli-ms: Idha, mahāli, bhikkhuno puratthimāya disāya ekaṁsabhāvito samādhi hoti dibbānaṁ saddānaṁ savanāya piyarūpānaṁ kāmūpasaṁhitānaṁ rajanīyānaṁ, no ca kho dibbānaṁ rūpānaṁ dassanāya piyarūpānaṁ kāmūpasaṁhitānaṁ rajanīyānaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Take a mendicant who has developed one-sided immersion to the eastern quarter so as to hear heavenly sounds but not to see heavenly sights.
reference: cck9.197, km15.63, km15.64, ms6D_607, msdiv368, pts-cs8, pts-vp-pli1.154, sc11, sya9.197

translation-en-sujato: That is how it is for a mendicant who develops immersion in that way.

root-pli-ms: Idha, mahāli, bhikkhuno puratthimāya disāya ubhayaṁsabhāvito samādhi hoti dibbānañca rūpānaṁ dassanāya piyarūpānaṁ kāmūpasaṁhitānaṁ rajanīyānaṁ dibbānañca saddānaṁ savanāya piyarūpānaṁ kāmūpasaṁhitānaṁ rajanīyānaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Take a mendicant who has developed two-sided immersion to the eastern quarter so as to both hear heavenly sounds and see heavenly sights.
reference: km15.67, ms6D_609, msdiv370, ndp6.132, pts-cs10, pts-vp-pli1.155, sc13, sya9.198

root-pli-ms: So puratthimāya disāya ubhayaṁsabhāvite samādhimhi dibbānañca rūpānaṁ dassanāya piyarūpānaṁ kāmūpasaṁhitānaṁ rajanīyānaṁ, dibbānañca saddānaṁ savanāya piyarūpānaṁ kāmūpasaṁhitānaṁ rajanīyānaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: When they have developed immersion for that purpose,

translation-en-sujato: they both see heavenly sights and hear heavenly sounds.

translation-en-sujato: Because that is how it is for a mendicant who develops immersion in that way.

translation-en-sujato: northern quarter …

Uddhamadho tiriyaṁ dibbāni ca rūpāni passati piyarūpāni kāmūpasaṁhitāni rajanīyāni, dibbāni ca saddāni suṇāti piyarūpāni kāmūpasaṁhitāni rajanīyāni.
Taṁ kissa hetu?

Evañhetaṁ, mahāli, hoti bhikkhuno uddhamadho tiriyaṁ ubhayaṁsabhāvite samādhimhi dibbānañca rūpānaṁ dassanāya piyarūpānaṁ kāmūpasaṁhitānaṁ rajanīyānaṁ, dibbānañca saddānaṁ savanāya piyarūpānaṁ kāmūpasaṁhitānaṁ rajanīyānaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: That is how it is for a mendicant who develops immersion in that way.

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ kho, mahāli, hetu ayaṁ paccayo, yena santāneva sunakkhatto licchaviputto dibbāni saddāni nāssosi piyarūpāni kāmūpasaṁhitāni rajanīyāni, no asantānī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: This is the cause, Mahāli, this is the reason why Sunakkhatta cannot hear heavenly sounds that are pleasant, sensual, and arousing, even though they really do exist.”

root-pli-ms: “Etāsaṁ nūna, bhante, samādhibhāvanānaṁ sacchikiriyāhetu bhikkhū bhagavati brahmacariyaṁ carantī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Surely the mendicants must live the spiritual life under the Buddha for the sake of realizing such a development of immersion?”
reference: bj7.332, ms6D_611, msdiv372, pts-cs12, pts-vp-pli1.156, sc15, vri1.139

root-pli-ms: “Na kho, mahāli, etāsaṁ samādhibhāvanānaṁ sacchikiriyāhetu bhikkhū mayi brahmacariyaṁ caranti.
translation-en-sujato: “No, Mahāli, the mendicants don’t live the spiritual life under me for the sake of realizing such a development of immersion.

root-pli-ms: Atthi kho, mahāli, aññeva dhammā uttaritarā ca paṇītatarā ca, yesaṁ sacchikiriyāhetu bhikkhū mayi brahmacariyaṁ carantī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: There are other things that are finer, for the sake of which the mendicants live the spiritual life under me.”

root-pli-ms: 2.2. Catuariyaphala
translation-en-sujato: 2.2. The Four Noble Fruits

root-pli-ms: “Katame pana te, bhante, dhammā uttaritarā ca paṇītatarā ca, yesaṁ sacchikiriyāhetu bhikkhū bhagavati brahmacariyaṁ carantī”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “But sir, what are those finer things?”
reference: dr9.211, ms6D_612, msdiv373, ndp6.133, pts-cs13, sc16

root-pli-ms: “Idha, mahāli, bhikkhu tiṇṇaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ parikkhayā sotāpanno hoti avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyaṇo.
translation-en-sujato: “Firstly, Mahāli, with the ending of three fetters a mendicant is a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.

root-pli-ms: Ayampi kho, mahāli, dhammo uttaritaro ca paṇītataro ca, yassa sacchikiriyāhetu bhikkhū mayi brahmacariyaṁ caranti.
translation-en-sujato: This is one of the finer things for the sake of which the mendicants live the spiritual life under me.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, mahāli, bhikkhu tiṇṇaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ parikkhayā rāgadosamohānaṁ tanuttā sakadāgāmī hoti, sakideva imaṁ lokaṁ āgantvā dukkhassantaṁ karoti.
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, a mendicant—with the ending of three fetters, and the weakening of greed, hate, and delusion—is a once-returner. They come back to this world once only, then make an end of suffering.

root-pli-ms: Ayampi kho, mahāli, dhammo uttaritaro ca paṇītataro ca, yassa sacchikiriyāhetu bhikkhū mayi brahmacariyaṁ caranti.
translation-en-sujato: This too is one of the finer things.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, mahāli, bhikkhu pañcannaṁ orambhāgiyānaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ parikkhayā opapātiko hoti, tattha parinibbāyī, anāvattidhammo tasmā lokā.
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, with the ending of the five lower fetters, a mendicant is reborn spontaneously and will become extinguished there, not liable to return from that world.

root-pli-ms: Ayampi kho, mahāli, dhammo uttaritaro ca paṇītataro ca, yassa sacchikiriyāhetu bhikkhū mayi brahmacariyaṁ caranti.
translation-en-sujato: This too is one of the finer things.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, mahāli, bhikkhu āsavānaṁ khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, a mendicant has realized the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and lives having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.

root-pli-ms: Ayampi kho, mahāli, dhammo uttaritaro ca paṇītataro ca, yassa sacchikiriyāhetu bhikkhū mayi brahmacariyaṁ caranti.
translation-en-sujato: This too is one of the finer things.

root-pli-ms: Ime kho te, mahāli, dhammā uttaritarā ca paṇītatarā ca, yesaṁ sacchikiriyāhetu bhikkhū mayi brahmacariyaṁ carantī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: These are the finer things, for the sake of which the mendicants live the spiritual life under me.”

root-pli-ms: 2.3. Ariyaaṭṭhaṅgikamagga
translation-en-sujato: 2.3. The Noble Eightfold Path

root-pli-ms: “Atthi pana, bhante, maggo atthi paṭipadā etesaṁ dhammānaṁ sacchikiriyāyā”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “But, sir, is there a path and a practice for realizing these things?”

root-pli-ms: “Atthi kho, mahāli, maggo atthi paṭipadā etesaṁ dhammānaṁ sacchikiriyāyā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “There is, Mahāli.”

root-pli-ms: “Katamo pana, bhante, maggo katamā paṭipadā etesaṁ dhammānaṁ sacchikiriyāyā”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “Well, what is it?”

root-pli-ms: “Ayameva ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo.
translation-en-sujato: “It is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:

root-pli-ms: Seyyathidaṁ—sammādiṭṭhi sammāsaṅkappo sammāvācā sammākammanto sammāājīvo sammāvāyāmo sammāsati sammāsamādhi.
translation-en-sujato: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ kho, mahāli, maggo ayaṁ paṭipadā etesaṁ dhammānaṁ sacchikiriyāya.
translation-en-sujato: This is the path and the practice for realizing these things.

root-pli-ms: Ekamidāhaṁ, mahāli, samayaṁ kosambiyaṁ viharāmi ghositārāme.

root-pli-ms: muṇḍiyo ca paribbājako jāliyo ca dārupattikantevāsī yenāhaṁ tenupasaṅkamiṁsu. upasaṅkamitvā mayā saddhiṁ sammodiṁsu.
translation-en-sujato: the wanderer Muṇḍiya and Jāliya the pupil of Dārupattika—came and exchanged greetings with me.
comment-en-sujato: Contra MW, text does not say both were paribbajaka. Again, RD is more accurate.

root-pli-ms: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhaṁsu. Ekamantaṁ ṭhitā kho te dve pabbajitā maṁ etadavocuṁ:

root-pli-ms: ‘kiṁ nu kho, āvuso gotama, taṁ jīvaṁ taṁ sarīraṁ, udāhu aññaṁ jīvaṁ aññaṁ sarīran’ti?

root-pli-ms: ‘Tena hāvuso, suṇātha sādhukaṁ manasi karotha bhāsissāmī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Well then, reverends, listen and pay close attention, I will speak.’

root-pli-ms: ‘Evamāvuso’ti kho te dve pabbajitā mama paccassosuṁ.

root-pli-ms: Ahaṁ etadavocaṁ:

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
translation-en-sujato: So I have heard.

root-pli-ms: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā uruññāyaṁ viharati kaṇṇakatthale migadāye.
translation-en-sujato: At one time the Buddha was staying near Ujuñña, in the deer park at Kaṇṇakatthala.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho acelo kassapo yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodi.
translation-en-sujato: Then the naked ascetic Kassapa went up to the Buddha and exchanged greetings with him.

root-pli-ms: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhāsi. Ekamantaṁ ṭhito kho acelo kassapo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he stood to one side, and said to the Buddha:

root-pli-ms: “sutaṁ metaṁ, bho gotama:
translation-en-sujato: “Master Gotama, I have heard the following:

root-pli-ms: ‘samaṇo gotamo sabbaṁ tapaṁ garahati, sabbaṁ tapassiṁ lūkhājīviṁ ekaṁsena upakkosati upavadatī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘The ascetic Gotama criticizes all forms of mortification. He categorically condemns and denounces those self-mortifiers who live rough.’
comment-en-sujato: See AN 10.94

root-pli-ms: Ye te, bho gotama, evamāhaṁsu: ‘samaṇo gotamo sabbaṁ tapaṁ garahati, sabbaṁ tapassiṁ lūkhājīviṁ ekaṁsena upakkosati upavadatī’ti, kacci te bhoto gotamassa vuttavādino, na ca bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ abhūtena abbhācikkhanti, dhammassa cānudhammaṁ byākaronti, na ca koci sahadhammiko vādānuvādo gārayhaṁ ṭhānaṁ āgacchati?
translation-en-sujato: Do those who say this repeat what the Buddha has said, and not misrepresent him with an untruth? Is their explanation in line with the teaching? Are there any legitimate grounds for rebuke and criticism?

root-pli-ms: Anabbhakkhātukāmā hi mayaṁ bhavantaṁ gotaman”ti.
translation-en-sujato: For we don’t want to misrepresent Master Gotama.”

root-pli-ms: “Ye te, kassapa, evamāhaṁsu: ‘samaṇo gotamo sabbaṁ tapaṁ garahati, sabbaṁ tapassiṁ lūkhājīviṁ ekaṁsena upakkosati upavadatī’ti, na me te vuttavādino, abbhācikkhanti ca pana maṁ te asatā abhūtena.
translation-en-sujato: “Kassapa, those who say this do not repeat what I have said. They misrepresent me with what is false, baseless, and untrue.
reference: cck9.206, dr9.219, km15.80, ms6D_631, msdiv382, pts-cs3, pts-vp-pli1.162, sc2, sya9.206

root-pli-ms: Idhāhaṁ, kassapa, ekaccaṁ tapassiṁ lūkhājīviṁ passāmi dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapannaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: With clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman, I see some self-mortifier who lives rough reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.

root-pli-ms: Idha panāhaṁ, kassapa, ekaccaṁ tapassiṁ lūkhājīviṁ passāmi dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapannaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: But I see another self-mortifier who lives rough reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.

root-pli-ms: Idhāhaṁ, kassapa, ekaccaṁ tapassiṁ appadukkhavihāriṁ passāmi dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapannaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: I see some self-mortifier who takes it easy reborn in a place of loss.

root-pli-ms: Idha panāhaṁ, kassapa, ekaccaṁ tapassiṁ appadukkhavihāriṁ passāmi dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapannaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: But I see another self-mortifier who takes it easy reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.

root-pli-ms: Yohaṁ, kassapa, imesaṁ tapassīnaṁ evaṁ āgatiñca gatiñca cutiñca upapattiñca yathābhūtaṁ pajānāmi, sohaṁ kiṁ sabbaṁ tapaṁ garahissāmi, sabbaṁ vā tapassiṁ lūkhājīviṁ ekaṁsena upakkosissāmi upavadissāmi?
translation-en-sujato: Since I truly understand the coming and going, passing away and rebirth of these self-mortifiers in this way, how could I criticize all forms of mortification, or categorically condemn and denounce those self-mortifiers who live rough?

root-pli-ms: Santi, kassapa, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā paṇḍitā nipuṇā kataparappavādā vālavedhirūpā. Te bhindantā maññe caranti paññāgatena diṭṭhigatāni.
translation-en-sujato: There are some clever ascetics and brahmins who are subtle, accomplished in the doctrines of others, hair-splitters. You’d think they live to demolish convictions with their intellect.

root-pli-ms: Tehipi me saddhiṁ ekaccesu ṭhānesu sameti, ekaccesu ṭhānesu na sameti.
translation-en-sujato: They agree with me in some matters and disagree in others.

root-pli-ms: Yaṁ te ekaccaṁ vadanti ‘sādhū’ti, mayampi taṁ ekaccaṁ vadema ‘sādhū’ti.
translation-en-sujato: Some of the things that they applaud, I also applaud.

root-pli-ms: Yaṁ te ekaccaṁ vadanti ‘na sādhū’ti, mayampi taṁ ekaccaṁ vadema ‘na sādhū’ti.
translation-en-sujato: Some of the things that they don’t applaud, I also don’t applaud.

root-pli-ms: Yaṁ te ekaccaṁ vadanti ‘sādhū’ti, mayaṁ taṁ ekaccaṁ vadema ‘na sādhū’ti.
translation-en-sujato: But some of the things that they applaud, I don’t applaud.

root-pli-ms: Yaṁ te ekaccaṁ vadanti ‘na sādhū’ti, mayaṁ taṁ ekaccaṁ vadema ‘sādhū’ti.
translation-en-sujato: And some of the things that they don’t applaud, I do applaud.

root-pli-ms: Yaṁ mayaṁ ekaccaṁ vadema ‘sādhū’ti, parepi taṁ ekaccaṁ vadanti ‘sādhū’ti.
translation-en-sujato: Some of the things that I applaud, others also applaud.

root-pli-ms: Yaṁ mayaṁ ekaccaṁ vadema ‘na sādhū’ti, parepi taṁ ekaccaṁ vadanti ‘na sādhū’ti.
translation-en-sujato: Some of the things that I don’t applaud, they also don’t applaud.

root-pli-ms: Yaṁ mayaṁ ekaccaṁ vadema ‘na sādhū’ti, pare taṁ ekaccaṁ vadanti ‘sādhū’ti.
translation-en-sujato: But some of the things that I don’t applaud, others do applaud.

root-pli-ms: Yaṁ mayaṁ ekaccaṁ vadema ‘sādhū’ti, pare taṁ ekaccaṁ vadanti ‘na sādhū’ti.
translation-en-sujato: And some of the things that I do applaud, others don’t applaud.

root-pli-ms: 1. Samanuyuñjāpanakathā
translation-en-sujato: 1. Examination

root-pli-ms: Tyāhaṁ upasaṅkamitvā evaṁ vadāmi:
translation-en-sujato: I go up to them and say:

root-pli-ms: ‘yesu no, āvuso, ṭhānesu na sameti, tiṭṭhantu tāni ṭhānāni.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Let us leave aside those matters on which we disagree.

root-pli-ms: Yesu ṭhānesu sameti, tattha viññū samanuyuñjantaṁ samanugāhantaṁ samanubhāsantaṁ satthārā vā satthāraṁ saṅghena vā saṅghaṁ:
translation-en-sujato: But there are some matters on which we agree. Regarding these, sensible people, pursuing, pressing, and grilling, would compare teacher with teacher or community with community:

root-pli-ms: “ye imesaṁ bhavataṁ dhammā akusalā akusalasaṅkhātā, sāvajjā sāvajjasaṅkhātā, asevitabbā asevitabbasaṅkhātā, na alamariyā na alamariyasaṅkhātā, kaṇhā kaṇhasaṅkhātā.
translation-en-sujato: “There are things that are unskillful, blameworthy, not to be cultivated, unworthy of the noble ones, and dark—and are reckoned as such.

root-pli-ms: Ko ime dhamme anavasesaṁ pahāya vattati, samaṇo vā gotamo, pare vā pana bhonto gaṇācariyā”ti?
translation-en-sujato: Who behaves like they’ve totally given these things up: the ascetic Gotama, or the teachers of other communities?”’

root-pli-ms: Ṭhānaṁ kho panetaṁ, kassapa, vijjati, yaṁ viññū samanuyuñjantā samanugāhantā samanubhāsantā evaṁ vadeyyuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: It’s possible that they might say:

root-pli-ms: ‘ye imesaṁ bhavataṁ dhammā akusalā akusalasaṅkhātā, sāvajjā sāvajjasaṅkhātā, asevitabbā asevitabbasaṅkhātā, na alamariyā na alamariyasaṅkhātā, kaṇhā kaṇhasaṅkhātā.
Samaṇo gotamo ime dhamme anavasesaṁ pahāya vattati, yaṁ vā pana bhonto pare gaṇācariyā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘The ascetic Gotama behaves like he’s totally given those unskillful things up, compared with the teachers of other communities.’

root-pli-ms: Itiha, kassapa, viññū samanuyuñjantā samanugāhantā samanubhāsantā amheva tattha yebhuyyena pasaṁseyyuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: And that’s how, when sensible people pursue the matter, they will mostly praise us.

root-pli-ms: Aparampi no, kassapa, viññū samanuyuñjantaṁ samanugāhantaṁ samanubhāsantaṁ satthārā vā satthāraṁ saṅghena vā saṅghaṁ:
translation-en-sujato: In addition, sensible people, engaging, pressing, and grilling, would compare teacher with teacher or community with community:
reference: cck9.208, ms6D_637, msdiv387, ndp6.140, pts-cs7, sc8, sya9.208

root-pli-ms: ‘ye imesaṁ bhavataṁ dhammā kusalā kusalasaṅkhātā, anavajjā anavajjasaṅkhātā, sevitabbā sevitabbasaṅkhātā, alamariyā alamariyasaṅkhātā, sukkā sukkasaṅkhātā.
translation-en-sujato: ‘There are things that are skillful, blameless, worth cultivating, worthy of the noble ones, and bright—and are reckoned as such.

root-pli-ms: Ko ime dhamme anavasesaṁ samādāya vattati, samaṇo vā gotamo, pare vā pana bhonto gaṇācariyā’ti?
translation-en-sujato: Who proceeds having totally undertaken these things: the ascetic Gotama, or the teachers of other communities?’

root-pli-ms: Ṭhānaṁ kho panetaṁ, kassapa, vijjati, yaṁ viññū samanuyuñjantā samanugāhantā samanubhāsantā evaṁ vadeyyuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: It’s possible that they might say:
reference: dr9.222, km15.84, ms6D_638, msdiv388, pts-cs8, pts-vp-pli1.164, sc9

root-pli-ms: ‘ye imesaṁ bhavataṁ dhammā kusalā kusalasaṅkhātā, anavajjā anavajjasaṅkhātā, sevitabbā sevitabbasaṅkhātā, alamariyā alamariyasaṅkhātā, sukkā sukkasaṅkhātā.
Samaṇo gotamo ime dhamme anavasesaṁ samādāya vattati, yaṁ vā pana bhonto pare gaṇācariyā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘The ascetic Gotama proceeds having totally undertaken these things, compared with the teachers of other communities.’

root-pli-ms: Itiha, kassapa, viññū samanuyuñjantā samanugāhantā samanubhāsantā amheva tattha yebhuyyena pasaṁseyyuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: And that’s how, when sensible people pursue the matter, they will mostly praise us.

root-pli-ms: Aparampi no, kassapa, viññū samanuyuñjantaṁ samanugāhantaṁ samanubhāsantaṁ satthārā vā satthāraṁ saṅghena vā saṅghaṁ:
translation-en-sujato: In addition, sensible people, pursuing, pressing, and grilling, would compare teacher with teacher or community with community:

root-pli-ms: ‘ye imesaṁ bhavataṁ dhammā akusalā akusalasaṅkhātā, sāvajjā sāvajjasaṅkhātā, asevitabbā asevitabbasaṅkhātā, na alamariyā na alamariyasaṅkhātā, kaṇhā kaṇhasaṅkhātā.
translation-en-sujato: ‘There are things that are unskillful, blameworthy, not to be cultivated, unworthy of the noble ones, and dark—and are reckoned as such.

root-pli-ms: Ko ime dhamme anavasesaṁ pahāya vattati, gotamasāvakasaṅgho vā, pare vā pana bhonto gaṇācariyasāvakasaṅghā’ti?
translation-en-sujato: Who behaves like they’ve totally given these things up: the ascetic Gotama’s disciples, or the disciples of other teachers?’

root-pli-ms: Ṭhānaṁ kho panetaṁ, kassapa, vijjati, yaṁ viññū samanuyuñjantā samanugāhantā samanubhāsantā evaṁ vadeyyuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: It’s possible that they might say:

root-pli-ms: ‘ye imesaṁ bhavataṁ dhammā akusalā akusalasaṅkhātā, sāvajjā sāvajjasaṅkhātā, asevitabbā asevitabbasaṅkhātā, na alamariyā na alamariyasaṅkhātā, kaṇhā kaṇhasaṅkhātā.
Gotamasāvakasaṅgho ime dhamme anavasesaṁ pahāya vattati, yaṁ vā pana bhonto pare gaṇācariyasāvakasaṅghā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘The ascetic Gotama’s disciples behave like they’ve totally given those unskillful things up, compared with the disciples of other teachers.’

root-pli-ms: Itiha, kassapa, viññū samanuyuñjantā samanugāhantā samanubhāsantā amheva tattha yebhuyyena pasaṁseyyuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: And that’s how, when sensible people pursue the matter, they will mostly praise us.

root-pli-ms: Aparampi no, kassapa, viññū samanuyuñjantaṁ samanugāhantaṁ samanubhāsantaṁ satthārā vā satthāraṁ saṅghena vā saṅghaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: In addition, sensible people, pursuing, pressing, and grilling, would compare teacher with teacher or community with community:
reference: csp1ed6.156, csp2ed6.156, dr9.223, ms6D_641, msdiv391, pts-cs11, pts-vp-pli1.165, sc12, vri1.149

root-pli-ms: ‘Ye imesaṁ bhavataṁ dhammā kusalā kusalasaṅkhātā, anavajjā anavajjasaṅkhātā, sevitabbā sevitabbasaṅkhātā, alamariyā alamariyasaṅkhātā, sukkā sukkasaṅkhātā.
translation-en-sujato: ‘There are things that are skillful, blameless, worth cultivating, worthy of the noble ones, and bright—and are reckoned as such.

root-pli-ms: Ko ime dhamme anavasesaṁ samādāya vattati, gotamasāvakasaṅgho vā, pare vā pana bhonto gaṇācariyasāvakasaṅghā’ti?
translation-en-sujato: Who proceeds having totally undertaken these things: the ascetic Gotama’s disciples, or the disciples of other teachers?’

root-pli-ms: Ṭhānaṁ kho panetaṁ, kassapa, vijjati, yaṁ viññū samanuyuñjantā samanugāhantā samanubhāsantā evaṁ vadeyyuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: It’s possible that they might say:
reference: cck9.210, km15.86, ms6D_642, msdiv392, ndp6.141, pts-cs12, sc13

root-pli-ms: ‘ye imesaṁ bhavataṁ dhammā kusalā kusalasaṅkhātā, anavajjā anavajjasaṅkhātā, sevitabbā sevitabbasaṅkhātā, alamariyā alamariyasaṅkhātā, sukkā sukkasaṅkhātā.
Gotamasāvakasaṅgho ime dhamme anavasesaṁ samādāya vattati, yaṁ vā pana bhonto pare gaṇācariyasāvakasaṅghā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘The ascetic Gotama’s disciples proceed having totally undertaken those skillful things, compared with the disciples of other teachers.’

root-pli-ms: Itiha, kassapa, viññū samanuyuñjantā samanugāhantā samanubhāsantā amheva tattha yebhuyyena pasaṁseyyuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: And that’s how, when sensible people pursue the matter, they will mostly praise us.

root-pli-ms: 2. Ariyaaṭṭhaṅgikamagga
translation-en-sujato: 2. The Noble Eightfold Path

root-pli-ms: Atthi, kassapa, maggo atthi paṭipadā, yathāpaṭipanno sāmaññeva ñassati sāmaṁ dakkhati:
translation-en-sujato: There is, Kassapa, a path, there is a practice, practicing in accordance with which you will know and see for yourself:

root-pli-ms: ‘samaṇova gotamo kālavādī bhūtavādī atthavādī dhammavādī vinayavādī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Only the ascetic Gotama’s words are timely, true, and meaningful, in line with the teaching and training.’
comment-en-sujato: Note the va, which is ignored by RD and MW. Comm, however, takes it in exclusive sense, referring back to the Brahmajala. The usage is similar to, eg. eso’va maggo, natthi anno, and, given the context, it seems likely this exclusive sense was meant here.

root-pli-ms: Katamo ca, kassapa, maggo, katamā ca paṭipadā, yathāpaṭipanno sāmaññeva ñassati sāmaṁ dakkhati:
translation-en-sujato: And what is that path?

root-pli-ms: ‘samaṇova gotamo kālavādī bhūtavādī atthavādī dhammavādī vinayavādī’ti?
Ayameva ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo.
translation-en-sujato: It is simply this noble eightfold path, that is:

root-pli-ms: Seyyathidaṁ—sammādiṭṭhi sammāsaṅkappo sammāvācā sammākammanto sammāājīvo sammāvāyāmo sammāsati sammāsamādhi.
translation-en-sujato: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion.

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ kho, kassapa, maggo, ayaṁ paṭipadā, yathāpaṭipanno sāmaññeva ñassati sāmaṁ dakkhati ‘samaṇova gotamo kālavādī bhūtavādī atthavādī dhammavādī vinayavādī’”ti.
translation-en-sujato: This is the path, this is the practice, practicing in accordance with which you will know and see for yourself: ‘Only the ascetic Gotama’s words are timely, true, and meaningful, in line with the teaching and training.’”

root-pli-ms: 3. Tapopakkamakathā
translation-en-sujato: 3. Practicing Self-Mortification

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vutte, acelo kassapo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: When he had spoken, Kassapa said to the Buddha:

root-pli-ms: “imepi kho, āvuso gotama, tapopakkamā etesaṁ samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṁ sāmaññasaṅkhātā ca brahmaññasaṅkhātā ca.
translation-en-sujato: “Reverend Gotama, those ascetics and brahmins consider these practices of self-mortification to be what makes someone a true ascetic or brahmin.

root-pli-ms: Acelako hoti, muttācāro, hatthāpalekhano, naehibhaddantiko, natiṭṭhabhaddantiko, nābhihaṭaṁ, na uddissakataṁ, na nimantanaṁ sādiyati.
translation-en-sujato: They go naked, ignoring conventions. They lick their hands, and don’t come or wait when asked. They don’t consent to food brought to them, or food prepared on purpose for them, or an invitation for a meal.

root-pli-ms: So na kumbhimukhā paṭiggaṇhāti, na kaḷopimukhā paṭiggaṇhāti, na eḷakamantaraṁ, na daṇḍamantaraṁ, na musalamantaraṁ, na dvinnaṁ bhuñjamānānaṁ, na gabbhiniyā, na pāyamānāya, na purisantaragatāya, na saṅkittīsu, na yattha sā upaṭṭhito hoti, na yattha makkhikā saṇḍasaṇḍacārinī, na macchaṁ, na maṁsaṁ, na suraṁ, na merayaṁ, na thusodakaṁ pivati.
translation-en-sujato: They don’t receive anything from a pot or bowl; or from someone who keeps sheep, or who has a weapon or a shovel in their home; or where a couple is eating; or where there is a woman who is pregnant, breastfeeding, or who has a man in her home; or where there’s a dog waiting or flies buzzing. They accept no fish or meat or liquor or wine, and drink no beer.

root-pli-ms: So ekāgāriko vā hoti ekālopiko, dvāgāriko vā hoti dvālopiko … sattāgāriko vā hoti sattālopiko;
translation-en-sujato: They go to just one house for alms, taking just one mouthful, or two houses and two mouthfuls, up to seven houses and seven mouthfuls.

root-pli-ms: ekissāpi dattiyā yāpeti, dvīhipi dattīhi yāpeti … sattahipi dattīhi yāpeti;
translation-en-sujato: They feed on one saucer a day, two saucers a day, up to seven saucers a day.

root-pli-ms: ekāhikampi āhāraṁ āhāreti, dvīhikampi āhāraṁ āhāreti … sattāhikampi āhāraṁ āhāreti. Iti evarūpaṁ addhamāsikampi pariyāyabhattabhojanānuyogamanuyutto viharati.
translation-en-sujato: They eat once a day, once every second day, up to once a week, and so on, even up to once a fortnight. They live committed to the practice of eating food at set intervals.

root-pli-ms: Imepi kho, āvuso gotama, tapopakkamā etesaṁ samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṁ sāmaññasaṅkhātā ca brahmaññasaṅkhātā ca.
translation-en-sujato: Those ascetics and brahmins also consider these practices of self-mortification to be what makes someone a true ascetic or brahmin.

root-pli-ms: Sākabhakkho vā hoti, sāmākabhakkho vā hoti, nīvārabhakkho vā hoti, daddulabhakkho vā hoti, haṭabhakkho vā hoti, kaṇabhakkho vā hoti, ācāmabhakkho vā hoti, piññākabhakkho vā hoti, tiṇabhakkho vā hoti, gomayabhakkho vā hoti, vanamūlaphalāhāro yāpeti pavattaphalabhojī.
translation-en-sujato: They eat herbs, millet, wild rice, poor rice, water lettuce, rice bran, scum from boiling rice, sesame flour, grass, or cow dung. They survive on forest roots and fruits, or eating fallen fruit.

root-pli-ms: Imepi kho, āvuso gotama, tapopakkamā etesaṁ samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṁ sāmaññasaṅkhātā ca brahmaññasaṅkhātā ca.
translation-en-sujato: Those ascetics and brahmins also consider these practices of mortification to be what makes someone a true ascetic or brahmin.

root-pli-ms: Sāṇānipi dhāreti, masāṇānipi dhāreti, chavadussānipi dhāreti, paṁsukūlānipi dhāreti, tirīṭānipi dhāreti, ajinampi dhāreti, ajinakkhipampi dhāreti, kusacīrampi dhāreti, vākacīrampi dhāreti, phalakacīrampi dhāreti, kesakambalampi dhāreti, vāḷakambalampi dhāreti, ulūkapakkhikampi dhāreti,
translation-en-sujato: They wear robes of sunn hemp, mixed hemp, corpse-wrapping cloth, rags, lodh tree bark, antelope hide (whole or in strips), kusa grass, bark, wood-chips, human hair, horse-tail hair, or owls’ wings.
comment-en-sujato: vekaṭikopi hoti vikaṭabhojanānuyogamanuyutto means eating urine, etc. see MN 12.

root-pli-ms: kesamassulocakopi hoti kesamassulocanānuyogamanuyutto,
translation-en-sujato: They tear out hair and beard, committed to this practice.

root-pli-ms: ubbhaṭṭhakopi hoti āsanapaṭikkhitto,
translation-en-sujato: They constantly stand, refusing seats.

root-pli-ms: ukkuṭikopi hoti ukkuṭikappadhānamanuyutto,
translation-en-sujato: They squat, committed to persisting in the squatting position.

root-pli-ms: kaṇṭakāpassayikopi hoti kaṇṭakāpassaye seyyaṁ kappeti,
translation-en-sujato: They lie on a mat of thorns, making a mat of thorns their bed.

root-pli-ms: phalakaseyyampi kappeti, thaṇḍilaseyyampi kappeti,
translation-en-sujato: They make their bed on a plank, or the bare ground.

root-pli-ms: ekapassayikopi hoti
translation-en-sujato: They lie only on one side.

root-pli-ms: rajojalladharo,
translation-en-sujato: They wear dust and dirt.

root-pli-ms: abbhokāsikopi hoti
translation-en-sujato: They stay in the open air.

root-pli-ms: yathāsanthatiko,
translation-en-sujato: They sleep wherever they lay their mat.

root-pli-ms: vekaṭikopi hoti vikaṭabhojanānuyogamanuyutto,
translation-en-sujato: They eat unnatural things, committed to the practice of eating unnatural foods.

root-pli-ms: apānakopi hoti apānakattamanuyutto,
translation-en-sujato: They don’t drink, committed to the practice of not drinking liquids.

root-pli-ms: sāyatatiyakampi udakorohanānuyogamanuyutto viharatī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: They’re committed to the practice of immersion in water three times a day, including the evening.”

root-pli-ms: 4. Tapopakkamaniratthakathā
translation-en-sujato: 4. The Uselessness of Self-Mortification

root-pli-ms: “Acelako cepi, kassapa, hoti, muttācāro, hatthāpalekhano …pe… iti evarūpaṁ addhamāsikampi pariyāyabhattabhojanānuyogamanuyutto viharati.
translation-en-sujato: “Kassapa, someone may practice all those forms of self-mortification,

root-pli-ms: Tassa cāyaṁ sīlasampadā cittasampadā paññāsampadā abhāvitā hoti asacchikatā. Atha kho so ārakāva sāmaññā ārakāva brahmaññā.
translation-en-sujato: but if they haven’t developed and realized any accomplishment in ethics, mind, and wisdom, they are far from being a true ascetic or brahmin.

root-pli-ms: Yato kho, kassapa, bhikkhu averaṁ abyāpajjaṁ mettacittaṁ bhāveti, āsavānañca khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.
translation-en-sujato: But take a mendicant who develops a heart of love, free of enmity and ill will. And they realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ vuccati, kassapa, bhikkhu samaṇo itipi brāhmaṇo itipi.
translation-en-sujato: When they achieve this, they’re called a mendicant who is a ‘true ascetic’ and also ‘a true brahmin’.

root-pli-ms: Sākabhakkho cepi, kassapa, hoti, sāmākabhakkho …pe… vanamūlaphalāhāro yāpeti pavattaphalabhojī.
Tassa cāyaṁ sīlasampadā cittasampadā paññāsampadā abhāvitā hoti asacchikatā.
Atha kho so ārakāva sāmaññā ārakāva brahmaññā.
Yato kho, kassapa, bhikkhu averaṁ abyāpajjaṁ mettacittaṁ bhāveti, āsavānañca khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.
Ayaṁ vuccati, kassapa, bhikkhu samaṇo itipi brāhmaṇo itipi.
Sāṇāni cepi, kassapa, dhāreti, masāṇānipi dhāreti …pe…
sāyatatiyakampi udakorohanānuyogamanuyutto viharati.
Tassa cāyaṁ sīlasampadā cittasampadā paññāsampadā abhāvitā hoti asacchikatā.
Atha kho so ārakāva sāmaññā ārakāva brahmaññā.
Yato kho, kassapa, bhikkhu averaṁ abyāpajjaṁ mettacittaṁ bhāveti, āsavānañca khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.
Ayaṁ vuccati, kassapa, bhikkhu samaṇo itipi brāhmaṇo itipī”ti.
Evaṁ vutte, acelo kassapo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: When he had spoken, Kassapa said to the Buddha,

root-pli-ms: “dukkaraṁ, bho gotama, sāmaññaṁ dukkaraṁ brahmaññan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “It’s hard, Master Gotama, to be a true ascetic or a true brahmin.”

root-pli-ms: “Pakati kho esā, kassapa, lokasmiṁ ‘dukkaraṁ sāmaññaṁ dukkaraṁ brahmaññan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: “It’s typical, Kassapa, in this world to think that it’s hard to be a true ascetic or brahmin.

root-pli-ms: Acelako cepi, kassapa, hoti, muttācāro, hatthāpalekhano …pe… iti evarūpaṁ addhamāsikampi pariyāyabhattabhojanānuyogamanuyutto viharati.
translation-en-sujato: But someone might practice all those forms of self-mortification.

root-pli-ms: Imāya ca, kassapa, mattāya iminā tapopakkamena sāmaññaṁ vā abhavissa brahmaññaṁ vā dukkaraṁ sudukkaraṁ, netaṁ abhavissa kallaṁ vacanāya:
translation-en-sujato: And if it was only because of just that much, only because of that self-mortification that it was so very hard to be a true ascetic or brahmin, it wouldn’t be appropriate to say that

root-pli-ms: ‘dukkaraṁ sāmaññaṁ dukkaraṁ brahmaññan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: it’s hard to be a true ascetic or brahmin.

root-pli-ms: Sakkā ca panetaṁ abhavissa kātuṁ gahapatinā vā gahapatiputtena vā antamaso kumbhadāsiyāpi:
translation-en-sujato: For it would be quite possible for a householder or a householder’s child—or even the bonded maid who carries the water-jar—

root-pli-ms: ‘handāhaṁ acelako homi, muttācāro, hatthāpalekhano …pe… iti evarūpaṁ addhamāsikampi pariyāyabhattabhojanānuyogamanuyutto viharāmī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: to practice all those forms of self-mortification.

root-pli-ms: Yasmā ca kho, kassapa, aññatreva imāya mattāya aññatra iminā tapopakkamena sāmaññaṁ vā hoti brahmaññaṁ vā dukkaraṁ sudukkaraṁ, tasmā etaṁ kallaṁ vacanāya:
translation-en-sujato: It’s because there’s something other than just that much, something other than that self-mortification that it’s so very hard to be a true ascetic or brahmin. And that’s why it is appropriate to say that

root-pli-ms: ‘dukkaraṁ sāmaññaṁ dukkaraṁ brahmaññan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: it’s hard to be a true ascetic or brahmin.

root-pli-ms: Yato kho, kassapa, bhikkhu averaṁ abyāpajjaṁ mettacittaṁ bhāveti, āsavānañca khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.
translation-en-sujato: Take a mendicant who develops a heart of love, free of enmity and ill will. And they realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ vuccati, kassapa, bhikkhu samaṇo itipi brāhmaṇo itipi.
translation-en-sujato: When they achieve this, they’re called a mendicant who is a ‘true ascetic’ and also ‘a true brahmin’.

root-pli-ms: Sākabhakkho cepi, kassapa, hoti, sāmākabhakkho …pe… vanamūlaphalāhāro yāpeti pavattaphalabhojī.
Imāya ca, kassapa, mattāya iminā tapopakkamena sāmaññaṁ vā abhavissa brahmaññaṁ vā dukkaraṁ sudukkaraṁ, netaṁ abhavissa kallaṁ vacanāya:
‘dukkaraṁ sāmaññaṁ dukkaraṁ brahmaññan’ti.
Sakkā ca panetaṁ abhavissa kātuṁ gahapatinā vā gahapatiputtena vā antamaso kumbhadāsiyāpi:
‘handāhaṁ sākabhakkho vā homi, sāmākabhakkho vā …pe… vanamūlaphalāhāro yāpemi pavattaphalabhojī’ti.
Yasmā ca kho, kassapa, aññatreva imāya mattāya aññatra iminā tapopakkamena sāmaññaṁ vā hoti brahmaññaṁ vā dukkaraṁ sudukkaraṁ, tasmā etaṁ kallaṁ vacanāya:
‘dukkaraṁ sāmaññaṁ dukkaraṁ brahmaññan’ti.
Yato kho, kassapa, bhikkhu averaṁ abyāpajjaṁ mettacittaṁ bhāveti, āsavānañca khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.
Ayaṁ vuccati, kassapa, bhikkhu samaṇo itipi brāhmaṇo itipi.
Sāṇāni cepi, kassapa, dhāreti, masāṇānipi dhāreti …pe… sāyatatiyakampi udakorohanānuyogamanuyutto viharati.
Imāya ca, kassapa, mattāya iminā tapopakkamena sāmaññaṁ vā abhavissa brahmaññaṁ vā dukkaraṁ sudukkaraṁ, netaṁ abhavissa kallaṁ vacanāya:
‘dukkaraṁ sāmaññaṁ dukkaraṁ brahmaññan’ti.
Sakkā ca panetaṁ abhavissa kātuṁ gahapatinā vā gahapatiputtena vā antamaso kumbhadāsiyāpi:
‘handāhaṁ sāṇānipi dhāremi, masāṇānipi dhāremi …pe… sāyatatiyakampi udakorohanānuyogamanuyutto viharāmī’ti.
Yasmā ca kho, kassapa, aññatreva imāya mattāya aññatra iminā tapopakkamena sāmaññaṁ vā hoti brahmaññaṁ vā dukkaraṁ sudukkaraṁ, tasmā etaṁ kallaṁ vacanāya:
‘dukkaraṁ sāmaññaṁ dukkaraṁ brahmaññan’ti.
Yato kho, kassapa, bhikkhu averaṁ abyāpajjaṁ mettacittaṁ bhāveti, āsavānañca khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.
Ayaṁ vuccati, kassapa, bhikkhu samaṇo itipi brāhmaṇo itipī”ti.
Evaṁ vutte, acelo kassapo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: When he had spoken, Kassapa said to the Buddha,

root-pli-ms: “dujjāno, bho gotama, samaṇo, dujjāno brāhmaṇo”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “It’s hard, Master Gotama, to know a true ascetic or a true brahmin.”

root-pli-ms: “Pakati kho esā, kassapa, lokasmiṁ ‘dujjāno samaṇo dujjāno brāhmaṇo’ti.
translation-en-sujato: “It’s typical in this world to think that it’s hard to know a true ascetic or brahmin.

root-pli-ms: Acelako cepi, kassapa, hoti, muttācāro, hatthāpalekhano …pe… iti evarūpaṁ addhamāsikampi pariyāyabhattabhojanānuyogamanuyutto viharati.
translation-en-sujato: But someone might practice all those forms of self-mortification.

root-pli-ms: Imāya ca, kassapa, mattāya iminā tapopakkamena samaṇo vā abhavissa brāhmaṇo vā dujjāno sudujjāno, netaṁ abhavissa kallaṁ vacanāya:
translation-en-sujato: And if it was only by just that much, only by that self-mortification that it was so very hard to know a true ascetic or brahmin, it wouldn’t be appropriate to say that

root-pli-ms: ‘dujjāno samaṇo dujjāno brāhmaṇo’ti.
translation-en-sujato: it’s hard to know a true ascetic or brahmin.

root-pli-ms: Sakkā ca paneso abhavissa ñātuṁ gahapatinā vā gahapatiputtena vā antamaso kumbhadāsiyāpi:
translation-en-sujato: For it would be quite possible for a householder or a householder’s child—or even the bonded maid who carries the water-jar—

root-pli-ms: ‘ayaṁ acelako hoti, muttācāro, hatthāpalekhano …pe… iti evarūpaṁ addhamāsikampi pariyāyabhattabhojanānuyogamanuyutto viharatī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: to know that someone is practicing all those forms of self-mortification.

root-pli-ms: Yasmā ca kho, kassapa, aññatreva imāya mattāya aññatra iminā tapopakkamena samaṇo vā hoti brāhmaṇo vā dujjāno sudujjāno, tasmā etaṁ kallaṁ vacanāya:
translation-en-sujato: It’s because there’s something other than just that much, something other than that self-mortification that it’s so very hard to know a true ascetic or brahmin. And that’s why it is appropriate to say that

root-pli-ms: ‘dujjāno samaṇo dujjāno brāhmaṇo’ti.
translation-en-sujato: it’s hard to know a true ascetic or brahmin.

root-pli-ms: Yato kho, kassapa, bhikkhu averaṁ abyāpajjaṁ mettacittaṁ bhāveti, āsavānañca khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.
translation-en-sujato: Take a mendicant who develops a heart of love, free of enmity and ill will. And they realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements.
variant-pli-ms: Yato kho → yato ca kho (bj, mr)

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ vuccati, kassapa, bhikkhu samaṇo itipi brāhmaṇo itipi.
translation-en-sujato: When they achieve this, they’re called a mendicant who is a ‘true ascetic’ and also ‘a true brahmin’.”

root-pli-ms: Sākabhakkho cepi, kassapa, hoti sāmākabhakkho …pe… vanamūlaphalāhāro yāpeti pavattaphalabhojī.
Imāya ca, kassapa, mattāya iminā tapopakkamena samaṇo vā abhavissa brāhmaṇo vā dujjāno sudujjāno, netaṁ abhavissa kallaṁ vacanāya:
‘dujjāno samaṇo dujjāno brāhmaṇo’ti.
Sakkā ca paneso abhavissa ñātuṁ gahapatinā vā gahapatiputtena vā antamaso kumbhadāsiyāpi:
‘ayaṁ sākabhakkho vā hoti sāmākabhakkho …pe… vanamūlaphalāhāro yāpeti pavattaphalabhojī’ti.
Yasmā ca kho, kassapa, aññatreva imāya mattāya aññatra iminā tapopakkamena samaṇo vā hoti brāhmaṇo vā dujjāno sudujjāno, tasmā etaṁ kallaṁ vacanāya:
‘dujjāno samaṇo dujjāno brāhmaṇo’ti.
Yato kho, kassapa, bhikkhu averaṁ abyāpajjaṁ mettacittaṁ bhāveti, āsavānañca khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.
Ayaṁ vuccati, kassapa, bhikkhu samaṇo itipi brāhmaṇo itipi.
Sāṇāni cepi, kassapa, dhāreti, masāṇānipi dhāreti …pe… sāyatatiyakampi udakorohanānuyogamanuyutto viharati.
Imāya ca, kassapa, mattāya iminā tapopakkamena samaṇo vā abhavissa brāhmaṇo vā dujjāno sudujjāno, netaṁ abhavissa kallaṁ vacanāya:
‘dujjāno samaṇo dujjāno brāhmaṇo’ti.
Sakkā ca paneso abhavissa ñātuṁ gahapatinā vā gahapatiputtena vā antamaso kumbhadāsiyāpi:
‘ayaṁ sāṇānipi dhāreti, masāṇānipi dhāreti …pe… sāyatatiyakampi udakorohanānuyogamanuyutto viharatī’ti.
Yasmā ca kho, kassapa, aññatreva imāya mattāya aññatra iminā tapopakkamena samaṇo vā hoti brāhmaṇo vā dujjāno sudujjāno, tasmā etaṁ kallaṁ vacanāya:
‘dujjāno samaṇo dujjāno brāhmaṇo’ti.
Yato kho, kassapa, bhikkhu averaṁ abyāpajjaṁ mettacittaṁ bhāveti, āsavānañca khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.
Ayaṁ vuccati, kassapa, bhikkhu samaṇo itipi brāhmaṇo itipī”ti.
5. Sīlasamādhipaññāsampadā
translation-en-sujato: 5. The Accomplishment of Ethics, Immersion, and Wisdom

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vutte, acelo kassapo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: When he had spoken, Kassapa said to the Buddha,
reference: bj7.376, dr9.232, ms6D_668, msdiv400, pts-cs18, sc39

root-pli-ms: “katamā pana sā, bho gotama, sīlasampadā, katamā cittasampadā, katamā paññāsampadā”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “But Master Gotama, what is that accomplishment in ethics, in mind, and in wisdom?”

root-pli-ms: “Idha, kassapa, tathāgato loke uppajjati arahaṁ, sammāsambuddho …pe…
translation-en-sujato: “It’s when a Realized One arises in the world, perfected, a fully awakened Buddha …

root-pli-ms: bhayadassāvī samādāya sikkhati sikkhāpadesu, kāyakammavacīkammena samannāgato kusalena parisuddhājīvo sīlasampanno indriyesu guttadvāro satisampajaññena samannāgato santuṭṭho.
translation-en-sujato: Seeing danger in the slightest fault, a mendicant keeps the rules they’ve undertaken. They act skillfully by body and speech. They’re purified in livelihood and accomplished in ethical conduct. They guard the sense doors, have mindfulness and situational awareness, and are content.

root-pli-ms: Kathañca, kassapa, bhikkhu sīlasampanno hoti?
translation-en-sujato: And how is a mendicant accomplished in ethics?

root-pli-ms: Idha, kassapa, bhikkhu pāṇātipātaṁ pahāya pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti nihitadaṇḍo nihitasattho lajjī dayāpanno, sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampī viharati.
translation-en-sujato: It’s when a mendicant gives up killing living creatures. They renounce the rod and the sword. They’re scrupulous and kind, living full of compassion for all living beings.

root-pli-ms: Idampissa hoti sīlasampadāya …pe…
translation-en-sujato: This pertains to their accomplishment in ethics. …

root-pli-ms: Yathā vā paneke bhonto samaṇabrāhmaṇā saddhādeyyāni bhojanāni bhuñjitvā te evarūpāya tiracchānavijjāya micchājīvena jīvitaṁ kappenti.
translation-en-sujato: There are some ascetics and brahmins who, while enjoying food given in faith, still earn a living by unworthy branches of knowledge, by wrong livelihood. …

root-pli-ms: Seyyathidaṁ—santikammaṁ paṇidhikammaṁ …pe… osadhīnaṁ patimokkho
iti vā iti evarūpāya tiracchānavijjāya micchājīvā paṭivirato hoti.
translation-en-sujato: They refrain from such unworthy branches of knowledge, such wrong livelihood.

root-pli-ms: Idampissa hoti sīlasampadāya.
translation-en-sujato: This pertains to their accomplishment in ethics.

root-pli-ms: Sa kho so, kassapa, bhikkhu evaṁ sīlasampanno na kutoci bhayaṁ samanupassati, yadidaṁ sīlasaṁvarato.
translation-en-sujato: A mendicant thus accomplished in ethics sees no danger in any quarter in regards to their ethical restraint.

root-pli-ms: Seyyathāpi, kassapa, rājā khattiyo muddhāvasitto nihatapaccāmitto na kutoci bhayaṁ samanupassati, yadidaṁ paccatthikato;
translation-en-sujato: It’s like a king who has defeated his enemies. He sees no danger from his foes in any quarter.

root-pli-ms: evameva kho, kassapa, bhikkhu evaṁ sīlasampanno na kutoci bhayaṁ samanupassati, yadidaṁ sīlasaṁvarato.
translation-en-sujato: In the same way, a mendicant thus accomplished in ethics sees no danger in any quarter in regards to their ethical restraint.

root-pli-ms: So iminā ariyena sīlakkhandhena samannāgato ajjhattaṁ anavajjasukhaṁ paṭisaṁvedeti.
translation-en-sujato: When they have this entire spectrum of noble ethics, they experience a blameless happiness inside themselves.

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ kho, kassapa, bhikkhu sīlasampanno hoti.
translation-en-sujato: That’s how a mendicant is accomplished in ethics.

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ kho, kassapa, sīlasampadā …pe…
translation-en-sujato: This, Kassapa, is that accomplishment in ethics. …

root-pli-ms: paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati.
translation-en-sujato: They enter and remain in the first absorption …

root-pli-ms: Idampissa hoti cittasampadāya …pe…
translation-en-sujato: This pertains to their accomplishment in mind. …

root-pli-ms: dutiyaṁ jhānaṁ …
translation-en-sujato: They enter and remain in the second absorption …

root-pli-ms: tatiyaṁ jhānaṁ …
translation-en-sujato: third absorption …

root-pli-ms: catutthaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati.
translation-en-sujato: fourth absorption.

root-pli-ms: Idampissa hoti cittasampadāya.
translation-en-sujato: This pertains to their accomplishment in mind.

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ kho, kassapa, cittasampadā.
translation-en-sujato: This, Kassapa, is that accomplishment in mind.

root-pli-ms: So evaṁ samāhite citte …pe…
translation-en-sujato: When their mind is immersed like this,

root-pli-ms: ñāṇadassanāya cittaṁ abhinīharati abhininnāmeti …
translation-en-sujato: they extend and project it toward knowledge and vision …

root-pli-ms: idampissa hoti paññāsampadāya …pe…
translation-en-sujato: This pertains to their accomplishment in wisdom. …

root-pli-ms: nāparaṁ itthattāyāti pajānāti.
translation-en-sujato: They understand: ‘… there is no return to any state of existence.’

root-pli-ms: Idampissa hoti paññāsampadāya.
translation-en-sujato: This pertains to their accomplishment in wisdom.

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ kho, kassapa, paññāsampadā.
translation-en-sujato: This, Kassapa, is that accomplishment in wisdom.

root-pli-ms: Imāya ca, kassapa, sīlasampadāya cittasampadāya paññāsampadāya aññā sīlasampadā cittasampadā paññāsampadā uttaritarā vā paṇītatarā vā natthi.
translation-en-sujato: And, Kassapa, there is no accomplishment in ethics, mind, and wisdom that is better or finer than this.

root-pli-ms: 6. Sīhanādakathā
translation-en-sujato: 6. The Lion’s Roar

root-pli-ms: Santi, kassapa, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā sīlavādā.
translation-en-sujato: There are, Kassapa, some ascetics and brahmins who teach ethics.
reference: km15.102, ms6D_674, msdiv402, pts-cs21, sc45, sya9.219

root-pli-ms: Te anekapariyāyena sīlassa vaṇṇaṁ bhāsanti.
translation-en-sujato: They praise ethical conduct in many ways.

root-pli-ms: Yāvatā, kassapa, ariyaṁ paramaṁ sīlaṁ, nāhaṁ tattha attano samasamaṁ samanupassāmi, kuto bhiyyo.
translation-en-sujato: But as far as the highest noble ethics goes, I don’t see anyone who’s my equal, still less my superior.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho ahameva tattha bhiyyo, yadidaṁ adhisīlaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Rather, I am the one who is superior when it comes to the higher ethics.

root-pli-ms: Santi, kassapa, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā tapojigucchāvādā.
translation-en-sujato: There are, Kassapa, some ascetics and brahmins who teach mortification in disgust of sin.

root-pli-ms: Te anekapariyāyena tapojigucchāya vaṇṇaṁ bhāsanti.
translation-en-sujato: They praise mortification in disgust of sin in many ways.

root-pli-ms: Yāvatā, kassapa, ariyā paramā tapojigucchā, nāhaṁ tattha attano samasamaṁ samanupassāmi, kuto bhiyyo.
translation-en-sujato: But as far as the highest noble mortification in disgust of sin goes, I don’t see anyone who’s my equal, still less my superior.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho ahameva tattha bhiyyo, yadidaṁ adhijegucchaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Rather, I am the one who is superior when it comes to the higher mortification in disgust of sin.

root-pli-ms: Santi, kassapa, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā paññāvādā.
translation-en-sujato: There are, Kassapa, some ascetics and brahmins who teach wisdom.

root-pli-ms: Te anekapariyāyena paññāya vaṇṇaṁ bhāsanti.
translation-en-sujato: They praise wisdom in many ways.

root-pli-ms: Yāvatā, kassapa, ariyā paramā paññā, nāhaṁ tattha attano samasamaṁ samanupassāmi, kuto bhiyyo.
translation-en-sujato: But as far as the highest noble wisdom goes, I don’t see anyone who’s my equal, still less my superior.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho ahameva tattha bhiyyo, yadidaṁ adhipaññaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Rather, I am the one who is superior when it comes to the higher wisdom.

root-pli-ms: Santi, kassapa, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā vimuttivādā.
translation-en-sujato: There are, Kassapa, some ascetics and brahmins who teach freedom.

root-pli-ms: Te anekapariyāyena vimuttiyā vaṇṇaṁ bhāsanti.
translation-en-sujato: They praise freedom in many ways.

root-pli-ms: Yāvatā, kassapa, ariyā paramā vimutti, nāhaṁ tattha attano samasamaṁ samanupassāmi, kuto bhiyyo.
translation-en-sujato: But as far as the highest noble freedom goes, I don’t see anyone who’s my equal, still less my superior.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho ahameva tattha bhiyyo, yadidaṁ adhivimutti.
translation-en-sujato: Rather, I am the one who is superior when it comes to the higher freedom.

root-pli-ms: Ṭhānaṁ kho panetaṁ, kassapa, vijjati, yaṁ aññatitthiyā paribbājakā evaṁ vadeyyuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: It’s possible that wanderers who follow other paths might say:
reference: bj7.382, cck9.220, ms6D_678, msdiv403, pts-cs22, pts-vp-pli1.175, sc49

root-pli-ms: ‘sīhanādaṁ kho samaṇo gotamo nadati, tañca kho suññāgāre nadati, no parisāsū’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘The ascetic Gotama only roars his lion’s roar in an empty hut, not in an assembly.’

root-pli-ms: Te: ‘mā hevan’tissu vacanīyā.
translation-en-sujato: They should be told, ‘Not so!’

root-pli-ms: ‘Sīhanādañca samaṇo gotamo nadati, parisāsu ca nadatī’ti evamassu, kassapa, vacanīyā.
translation-en-sujato: What should be said is this: ‘The ascetic Gotama roars his lion’s roar, and he roars it in the assemblies.’

root-pli-ms: Ṭhānaṁ kho panetaṁ, kassapa, vijjati, yaṁ aññatitthiyā paribbājakā evaṁ vadeyyuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: It’s possible that wanderers who follow other paths might say:

root-pli-ms: ‘sīhanādañca samaṇo gotamo nadati, parisāsu ca nadati, no ca kho visārado nadatī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘The ascetic Gotama roars his lion’s roar, and he roars it in the assemblies. But he doesn’t roar it boldly.’

root-pli-ms: Te: ‘mā hevan’tissu vacanīyā.
translation-en-sujato: They should be told, ‘Not so!’

root-pli-ms: ‘Sīhanādañca samaṇo gotamo nadati, parisāsu ca nadati, visārado ca nadatī’ti evamassu, kassapa, vacanīyā.
translation-en-sujato: What should be said is this: ‘The ascetic Gotama roars his lion’s roar, he roars it in the assemblies, and he roars it boldly.’

root-pli-ms: Ṭhānaṁ kho panetaṁ, kassapa, vijjati, yaṁ aññatitthiyā paribbājakā evaṁ vadeyyuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: It’s possible that wanderers who follow other paths might say:

root-pli-ms: ‘sīhanādañca samaṇo gotamo nadati, parisāsu ca nadati, visārado ca nadati, no ca kho naṁ pañhaṁ pucchanti …pe…
translation-en-sujato: ‘The ascetic Gotama roars his lion’s roar, he roars it in the assemblies, and he roars it boldly. But they don’t question him. …

root-pli-ms: pañhañca naṁ pucchanti; no ca kho nesaṁ pañhaṁ puṭṭho byākaroti …pe…
translation-en-sujato: Or he doesn’t answer their questions. …

root-pli-ms: pañhañca nesaṁ puṭṭho byākaroti; no ca kho pañhassa veyyākaraṇena cittaṁ ārādheti …pe…
translation-en-sujato: Or his answers are not satisfactory. …

root-pli-ms: pañhassa ca veyyākaraṇena cittaṁ ārādheti; no ca kho sotabbaṁ maññanti …pe…
translation-en-sujato: Or they don’t think him worth listening to. …

root-pli-ms: sotabbañcassa maññanti; no ca kho sutvā pasīdanti …pe…
translation-en-sujato: Or they’re not confident after listening. …

root-pli-ms: sutvā cassa pasīdanti; no ca kho pasannākāraṁ karonti …pe…
translation-en-sujato: Or they don’t show their confidence. …

root-pli-ms: pasannākārañca karonti; no ca kho tathattāya paṭipajjanti …pe…
translation-en-sujato: Or they don’t practice accordingly. …

root-pli-ms: tathattāya ca paṭipajjanti; no ca kho paṭipannā ārādhentī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: Or they don’t succeed in their practice.’

root-pli-ms: Te: ‘mā hevan’tissu vacanīyā.
translation-en-sujato: They should be told, ‘Not so!’

root-pli-ms: ‘Sīhanādañca samaṇo gotamo nadati, parisāsu ca nadati, visārado ca nadati, pañhañca naṁ pucchanti, pañhañca nesaṁ puṭṭho byākaroti, pañhassa ca veyyākaraṇena cittaṁ ārādheti, sotabbañcassa maññanti, sutvā cassa pasīdanti, pasannākārañca karonti, tathattāya ca paṭipajjanti, paṭipannā ca ārādhentī’ti evamassu, kassapa, vacanīyā.
translation-en-sujato: What should be said is this: ‘The ascetic Gotama roars his lion’s roar; he roars it in the assemblies; he roars it boldly; they question him; he answers their questions; his answers are satisfactory; they think him worth listening to; they’re confident after listening; they show their confidence; they practice accordingly; and they succeed in their practice.’

root-pli-ms: 7. Titthiyaparivāsakathā
translation-en-sujato: 7. The Probation For One Previously Ordained

root-pli-ms: Ekamidāhaṁ, kassapa, samayaṁ rājagahe viharāmi gijjhakūṭe pabbate.
translation-en-sujato: Kassapa, this one time I was staying near Rājagaha, on the Vulture’s Peak Mountain.

root-pli-ms: Tatra maṁ aññataro tapabrahmacārī nigrodho nāma adhijegucche pañhaṁ apucchi.
translation-en-sujato: There a certain practitioner of self-mortification named Nigrodha asked me about the higher mortification in disgust of sin.

root-pli-ms: Tassāhaṁ adhijegucche pañhaṁ puṭṭho byākāsiṁ.
translation-en-sujato: I answered his question.

root-pli-ms: Byākate ca pana me attamano ahosi paraṁ viya mattāyā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: He was extremely happy with my answer.”

root-pli-ms: “Ko hi, bhante, bhagavato dhammaṁ sutvā na attamano assa paraṁ viya mattāya?
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, who wouldn’t be extremely happy after hearing the Buddha’s teaching?

root-pli-ms: Ahampi hi, bhante, bhagavato dhammaṁ sutvā attamano paraṁ viya mattāya.
translation-en-sujato: For I too am extremely happy after hearing the Buddha’s teaching!

root-pli-ms: Abhikkantaṁ, bhante, abhikkantaṁ, bhante.
translation-en-sujato: Excellent, sir! Excellent!

root-pli-ms: Seyyathāpi, bhante, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṁ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṁ dhāreyya: ‘cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī’ti; evamevaṁ bhagavatā anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
translation-en-sujato: As if he were righting the overturned, or revealing the hidden, or pointing out the path to the lost, or lighting a lamp in the dark so people with good eyes can see what’s there, so too the Buddha has made the teaching clear in many ways.

root-pli-ms: Esāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavantaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi, dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
translation-en-sujato: I go for refuge to the Buddha, to the teaching, and to the mendicant Saṅgha.

root-pli-ms: Labheyyāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavato santike pabbajjaṁ, labheyyaṁ upasampadan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Sir, may I receive the going forth, the ordination in the Buddha’s presence?”

root-pli-ms: “Yo kho, kassapa, aññatitthiyapubbo imasmiṁ dhammavinaye ākaṅkhati pabbajjaṁ, ākaṅkhati upasampadaṁ, so cattāro māse parivasati, catunnaṁ māsānaṁ accayena āraddhacittā bhikkhū pabbājenti, upasampādenti bhikkhubhāvāya.
translation-en-sujato: “Kassapa, if someone formerly ordained in another sect wishes to take the going forth, the ordination in this teaching and training, they must spend four months on probation. When four months have passed, if the mendicants are satisfied, they’ll give the going forth, the ordination into monkhood.

root-pli-ms: Api ca mettha puggalavemattatā viditā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: However, I have recognized individual differences in this matter.”

root-pli-ms: “Sace, bhante, aññatitthiyapubbā imasmiṁ dhammavinaye ākaṅkhanti pabbajjaṁ, ākaṅkhanti upasampadaṁ, cattāro māse parivasanti, catunnaṁ māsānaṁ accayena āraddhacittā bhikkhū pabbājenti, upasampādenti bhikkhubhāvāya. Ahaṁ cattāri vassāni parivasissāmi, catunnaṁ vassānaṁ accayena āraddhacittā bhikkhū pabbājentu, upasampādentu bhikkhubhāvāyā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, if four months probation are required in such a case, I’ll spend four years on probation. When four years have passed, if the mendicants are satisfied, let them give me the going forth, the ordination into monkhood.”

root-pli-ms: Alattha kho acelo kassapo bhagavato santike pabbajjaṁ, alattha upasampadaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: And the naked ascetic Kassapa received the going forth, the ordination in the Buddha’s presence.

root-pli-ms: Acirūpasampanno kho panāyasmā kassapo eko vūpakaṭṭho appamatto ātāpī pahitatto viharanto na cirasseva—yassatthāya kulaputtā sammadeva agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajanti, tadanuttaraṁ—brahmacariyapariyosānaṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihāsi.
translation-en-sujato: Not long after his ordination, Venerable Kassapa, living alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and resolute, soon realized the supreme end of the spiritual path in this very life. He lived having achieved with his own insight the goal for which gentlemen rightly go forth from the lay life to homelessness.

root-pli-ms: “Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ, kataṁ karaṇīyaṁ, nāparaṁ itthattāyā”ti abbhaññāsi.
translation-en-sujato: He understood: “Rebirth is ended; the spiritual journey has been completed; what had to be done has been done; there is no return to any state of existence.”

root-pli-ms: Aññataro kho panāyasmā kassapo arahataṁ ahosīti.
translation-en-sujato: And Venerable Kassapa became one of the perfected.

root-pli-ms: Mahāsīhanādasuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ aṭṭhamaṁ.
Dīgha Nikāya 9
translation-en-sujato: Long Discourses 9
translation-ru-team: Длинные беседы, 9

root-pli-ms: Poṭṭhapādasutta
translation-en-sujato: With Poṭṭhapāda
translation-ru-team: Беседа с Поттхападой

root-pli-ms: 1. Poṭṭhapādaparibbājakavatthu
translation-en-sujato: 1. On the Wanderer Poṭṭhapāda
translation-ru-team: О страннике Поттхападе

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
translation-en-sujato: So I have heard.
translation-ru-team: Так я слышал:

root-pli-ms: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
translation-en-sujato: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
translation-ru-team: Однажды Будда находился в Саваттхи, в роще Джеты монастыря Анатхапиндики.

root-pli-ms: Tena kho pana samayena poṭṭhapādo paribbājako samayappavādake tindukācīre ekasālake mallikāya ārāme paṭivasati mahatiyā paribbājakaparisāya saddhiṁ tiṁsamattehi paribbājakasatehi.
translation-en-sujato: Now at that time the wanderer Poṭṭhapāda was residing together with three hundred wanderers in Mallikā’s single-halled monastery for group debates, set among the flaking pale-moon ebony trees.
translation-ru-team: В то же время в павильоне для дебатов монастыря Маллики, расположенном среди эбеновых деревьев, жил странник Поттхапада с тремястами другими странниками.
comment-en-sujato: See my note on MN 78.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya sāvatthiṁ piṇḍāya pāvisi.
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, entered Sāvatthī for alms.
translation-ru-team: Тогда, рано утром Будда оделся и взял свою чашу, и пошёл в Саваттхи за подаяниями.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavato etadahosi:
translation-en-sujato: Then it occurred to him,
translation-ru-team: Затем такая мысль пришла к Будде:

root-pli-ms: “atippago kho tāva sāvatthiyaṁ piṇḍāya carituṁ.
translation-en-sujato: “It’s too early to wander for alms in Sāvatthī.
translation-ru-team: "Ещё слишком рано собирать подаяния в Саваттхи.

root-pli-ms: Yannūnāhaṁ yena samayappavādako tindukācīro ekasālako mallikāya ārāmo, yena poṭṭhapādo paribbājako tenupasaṅkameyyan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Why don’t I go to Mallikā’s monastery to visit the wanderer Poṭṭhapāda?”
translation-ru-team: Почему бы мне не пойти в зал для дебатов монастыря Маллики, расположенный среди эбеновых деревьев, и не повидать странника Поттхападу?"

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā yena samayappavādako tindukācīro ekasālako mallikāya ārāmo tenupasaṅkami.
translation-en-sujato: So that’s what he did.
translation-ru-team: И тогда Будда отправился туда.

root-pli-ms: Tena kho pana samayena poṭṭhapādo paribbājako mahatiyā paribbājakaparisāya saddhiṁ nisinno hoti unnādiniyā uccāsaddamahāsaddāya anekavihitaṁ tiracchānakathaṁ kathentiyā.
translation-en-sujato: Now at that time, Poṭṭhapāda was sitting together with a large assembly of wanderers making an uproar, a dreadful racket. They engaged in all kinds of unworthy talk, such as
translation-ru-team: В то время странник Поттхапада сидел со своей большой группой остальных странников, которые, создавая много шума, занимались обсуждением различных низменных тем, таких как:
reference: cck9.224, dr9.239, ms6D_687, msdiv408, pts-cs3, pts-vp-pli1.179, sc3

root-pli-ms: Seyyathidaṁ—rājakathaṁ corakathaṁ mahāmattakathaṁ senākathaṁ bhayakathaṁ yuddhakathaṁ annakathaṁ pānakathaṁ vatthakathaṁ sayanakathaṁ mālākathaṁ gandhakathaṁ ñātikathaṁ yānakathaṁ gāmakathaṁ nigamakathaṁ nagarakathaṁ janapadakathaṁ itthikathaṁ sūrakathaṁ visikhākathaṁ kumbhaṭṭhānakathaṁ pubbapetakathaṁ nānattakathaṁ lokakkhāyikaṁ samuddakkhāyikaṁ itibhavābhavakathaṁ iti vā.
translation-en-sujato: talk about kings, bandits, and ministers; talk about armies, threats, and wars; talk about food, drink, clothes, and beds; talk about garlands and fragrances; talk about family, vehicles, villages, towns, cities, and countries; talk about women and heroes; street talk and well talk; talk about the departed; motley talk; tales of land and sea; and talk about being reborn in this or that state of existence.
translation-ru-team: о царях, о бандитах, о министрах, об армиях, об угрозах и войнах, о еде и напитках, об одежде и постелях, об украшениях и благовониях, о семье, о повозках, о деревнях, о городах и странах, о женщинах, о героях, о различных уличных беседах, о беседах у колодца, об умерших, обо всём подряд, о мире, об океане, о сути бытия, и так далее.

root-pli-ms: Addasā kho poṭṭhapādo paribbājako bhagavantaṁ dūratova āgacchantaṁ;
translation-en-sujato: Poṭṭhapāda saw the Buddha coming off in the distance,
translation-ru-team: Поттхапада увидел идущего вдалеке Будду
reference: km15.111, ms6D_688, msdiv409, pts-cs4, sc4, sya9.224, vri1.161

root-pli-ms: disvāna sakaṁ parisaṁ saṇṭhapesi:
translation-en-sujato: and hushed his own assembly,
translation-ru-team: и стал успокаивать свою группу:

root-pli-ms: “appasaddā bhonto hontu, mā bhonto saddamakattha.
translation-en-sujato: “Be quiet, good sirs, don’t make a sound.
translation-ru-team: "Тише, господа, не шумите.

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ samaṇo gotamo āgacchati.
translation-en-sujato: Here comes the ascetic Gotama.
translation-ru-team: Вон идёт отшельник Готама.

root-pli-ms: Appasaddakāmo kho so āyasmā appasaddassa vaṇṇavādī.
translation-en-sujato: The venerable likes quiet and praises quiet.
translation-ru-team: Уважаемый любит тишину и хвалит тишину.

root-pli-ms: Appeva nāma appasaddaṁ parisaṁ viditvā upasaṅkamitabbaṁ maññeyyā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Hopefully if he sees that our assembly is quiet he’ll see fit to approach.”
translation-ru-team: Возможно, если он увидит, что наше собрание тихо, он решит подойти."

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vutte, te paribbājakā tuṇhī ahesuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Then those wanderers fell silent.
translation-ru-team: И тогда те странники затихли.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā yena poṭṭhapādo paribbājako tenupasaṅkami.
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha approached Poṭṭhapāda,
translation-ru-team: Тогда Будда подошёл к Поттхападе,
reference: csp1ed6.168, csp2ed6.168, mc9.177, ms6D_689, msdiv410, ndp6.151, pts-cs5, sc5

root-pli-ms: Atha kho poṭṭhapādo paribbājako bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: who said to him,
translation-ru-team: который обратился к нему:

root-pli-ms: “etu kho, bhante, bhagavā.
translation-en-sujato: “Come, Blessed One!
translation-ru-team: "Подойди, Почтенный!

root-pli-ms: Svāgataṁ, bhante, bhagavato.
translation-en-sujato: Welcome, Blessed One!
translation-ru-team: Добро пожаловать, Почтенный!

root-pli-ms: Cirassaṁ kho, bhante, bhagavā imaṁ pariyāyamakāsi, yadidaṁ idhāgamanāya.
translation-en-sujato: It’s been a long time since you took the opportunity to come here.
translation-ru-team: Давно Почтенный не захаживал сюда.

root-pli-ms: Nisīdatu, bhante, bhagavā, idaṁ āsanaṁ paññattan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Please, sir, sit down, this seat is ready.”
translation-ru-team: Пожалуйста, Почтенный, садись, это место для вас."

root-pli-ms: Nisīdi bhagavā paññatte āsane.
translation-en-sujato: The Buddha sat on the seat spread out,
translation-ru-team: Будда сел на приготовленное место,

root-pli-ms: Poṭṭhapādopi kho paribbājako aññataraṁ nīcaṁ āsanaṁ gahetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
translation-en-sujato: while Poṭṭhapāda took a low seat and sat to one side.
translation-ru-team: тогда как Поттхапада сел рядом на место пониже.

root-pli-ms: Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho poṭṭhapādaṁ paribbājakaṁ bhagavā etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: The Buddha said to him,
translation-ru-team: Будда обратился к нему:

root-pli-ms: “kāya nuttha, poṭṭhapāda, etarahi kathāya sannisinnā, kā ca pana vo antarākathā vippakatā”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “Poṭṭhapāda, what were you sitting talking about just now? What conversation was unfinished?”
translation-ru-team: "Поттхапада, что вы обсуждали, собравшись здесь? Какая беседа была прервана?"

root-pli-ms: 1.1. Abhisaññānirodhakathā
translation-en-sujato: 1.1. On the Cessation of Perception
translation-ru-team: 1.1. О прекращении восприятия

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vutte, poṭṭhapādo paribbājako bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: When he said this, the wanderer Poṭṭhapāda said to the Buddha,
translation-ru-team: Когда он спросил это, странник Поттхапада сказал Будде следующее:

root-pli-ms: “tiṭṭhatesā, bhante, kathā, yāya mayaṁ etarahi kathāya sannisinnā.
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, leave aside what we were sitting talking about just now.
translation-ru-team: "Досточтимый, оставим то, о чём мы сейчас говорили,

root-pli-ms: Nesā, bhante, kathā bhagavato dullabhā bhavissati pacchāpi savanāya.
translation-en-sujato: It won’t be hard for you to hear about that later.
translation-ru-team: тебе будет несложно послушать об этом позже.

root-pli-ms: Purimāni, bhante, divasāni purimatarāni, nānātitthiyānaṁ samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṁ kotūhalasālāya sannisinnānaṁ sannipatitānaṁ abhisaññānirodhe kathā udapādi:
translation-en-sujato: Sir, a few days ago several ascetics and brahmins who follow various other paths were sitting together at the debating hall, and this discussion came up among them:
translation-ru-team: Досточтимый, несколько дней назад некоторые аскеты и брахманы сидели в этом зале для дебатов, и среди них велась такая дискуссия:

root-pli-ms: ‘kathaṁ nu kho, bho, abhisaññānirodho hotī’ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘How does the cessation of perception happen?’
translation-ru-team: "Как происходит прекращение восприятия?"
comment-en-sujato: abhisaññānirodha doesn’t appear elsewhere. Comm says: Abhisaññānirodheti ettha abhīti upasaggamattaṁ. Saññānirodheti cittanirodhe … Rendering abhi-here as “higher” or “ultimate” is, I think, overdetermining it.

root-pli-ms: Tatrekacce evamāhaṁsu:
translation-en-sujato: Some of them said:
translation-ru-team: Некоторые из них говорили:

root-pli-ms: ‘ahetū appaccayā purisassa saññā uppajjantipi nirujjhantipi.
translation-en-sujato: ‘A person’s perceptions arise and cease without cause or reason.
translation-ru-team: "Чьё-либо восприятие возникает и прекращается без причин.

root-pli-ms: Yasmiṁ samaye uppajjanti, saññī tasmiṁ samaye hoti.
translation-en-sujato: When they arise, you become percipient.
translation-ru-team: Когда оно возникает, вы воспринимаете.

root-pli-ms: Yasmiṁ samaye nirujjhanti, asaññī tasmiṁ samaye hotī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: When they cease, you become non-percipient.’
translation-ru-team: Когда оно прекращается, вы перестаёте воспринимать."

root-pli-ms: Ittheke abhisaññānirodhaṁ paññapenti. (1)
translation-en-sujato: That’s how some describe the cessation of perception.
translation-ru-team: Вот как некоторые описывают прекращение восприятия.

root-pli-ms: Tamañño evamāha:
translation-en-sujato: But someone else says:
translation-ru-team: Другие говорили:

root-pli-ms: ‘na kho pana metaṁ, bho, evaṁ bhavissati.
translation-en-sujato: ‘That’s not how it is, gentlemen !
translation-ru-team: "Это не так, уважаемые!
comment-en-sujato: For this idiom, cp SN 47.19

root-pli-ms: Saññā hi, bho, purisassa attā.
translation-en-sujato: Perception is a person’s self,
translation-ru-team: Восприятие - это чьё-либо "я".

root-pli-ms: Sā ca kho upetipi apetipi.
translation-ru-team: Которое приходит и уходит.

root-pli-ms: Yasmiṁ samaye upeti, saññī tasmiṁ samaye hoti.
translation-en-sujato: When it enters, you become percipient.
translation-ru-team: Когда оно приходит, вы воспринимаете.

root-pli-ms: Yasmiṁ samaye apeti, asaññī tasmiṁ samaye hotī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: When it departs, you become non-percipient.’
translation-ru-team: Когда оно уходит, вы перестаёте воспринимать."

root-pli-ms: Ittheke abhisaññānirodhaṁ paññapenti. (2)
translation-en-sujato: That’s how some describe the cessation of perception.
translation-ru-team: Вот как некоторые описывают прекращение восприятия.

root-pli-ms: Tamañño evamāha:
translation-en-sujato: But someone else says:
translation-ru-team: Другие говорили:

root-pli-ms: ‘na kho pana metaṁ, bho, evaṁ bhavissati.
translation-en-sujato: ‘That’s not how it is, gentlemen !
translation-ru-team: "Это не так, уважаемые!

root-pli-ms: Santi hi, bho, samaṇabrāhmaṇā mahiddhikā mahānubhāvā.
translation-en-sujato: There are ascetics and brahmins of great power and might.
translation-ru-team: Существуют очень могущественные аскеты и брахманы.

root-pli-ms: Te imassa purisassa saññaṁ upakaḍḍhantipi apakaḍḍhantipi.
translation-en-sujato: They insert and extract a person’s perception.
translation-ru-team: Они дают и забирают чьё-либо восприятие.
comment-en-sujato: These verbs are used in DN 29 in the sense of being able to “take away “or” add to” the sasana.

root-pli-ms: Yasmiṁ samaye upakaḍḍhanti, saññī tasmiṁ samaye hoti.
translation-en-sujato: When they insert it, you become percipient.
translation-ru-team: Когда они его дают, вы воспринимаете.

root-pli-ms: Yasmiṁ samaye apakaḍḍhanti, asaññī tasmiṁ samaye hotī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: When they extract it, you become non-percipient.’
translation-ru-team: Когда они его забирают, вы перестаёте воспринимать."

root-pli-ms: Ittheke abhisaññānirodhaṁ paññapenti. (3)
translation-en-sujato: That’s how some describe the cessation of perception.
translation-ru-team: Вот как некоторые описывают прекращение восприятия.

root-pli-ms: Tamañño evamāha:
translation-en-sujato: But someone else says:
translation-ru-team: Другие говорили:

root-pli-ms: ‘na kho pana metaṁ, bho, evaṁ bhavissati.
translation-en-sujato: ‘That’s not how it is, gentlemen !
translation-ru-team: "Это не так, уважаемые!

root-pli-ms: Santi hi, bho, devatā mahiddhikā mahānubhāvā.
translation-en-sujato: There are deities of great power and might.
translation-ru-team: Существуют очень могущественные боги.

root-pli-ms: Tā imassa purisassa saññaṁ upakaḍḍhantipi apakaḍḍhantipi.
translation-en-sujato: They insert and extract a person’s perception.
translation-ru-team: Они дают и забирают чьё-либо восприятие.

root-pli-ms: Yasmiṁ samaye upakaḍḍhanti, saññī tasmiṁ samaye hoti.
translation-en-sujato: When they insert it, you become percipient.
translation-ru-team: Когда они его дают, вы воспринимаете.

root-pli-ms: Yasmiṁ samaye apakaḍḍhanti, asaññī tasmiṁ samaye hotī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: When they extract it, you become non-percipient.’
translation-ru-team: Когда они его забирают, вы перестаёте воспринимать."

root-pli-ms: Ittheke abhisaññānirodhaṁ paññapenti. (4)
translation-en-sujato: That’s how some describe the cessation of perception.
translation-ru-team: Вот как некоторые описывают прекращение восприятия.

root-pli-ms: Tassa mayhaṁ, bhante, bhagavantaṁyeva ārabbha sati udapādi:
translation-en-sujato: That reminded me of the Buddha:
translation-ru-team: Это напомнило мне о Будде:

root-pli-ms: ‘aho nūna bhagavā, aho nūna sugato, yo imesaṁ dhammānaṁ sukusalo’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Surely it must be the Blessed One, the Holy One who is so skilled in such matters.’
translation-ru-team: "В самом деле, Счастливый - тот, кто разбирается в таких вещах."

root-pli-ms: Bhagavā, bhante, kusalo, bhagavā pakataññū abhisaññānirodhassa.
translation-en-sujato: The Buddha is skilled and well-versed in the cessation of perception.
translation-ru-team: Будда, досточтимый, - тот, кто хорошо разбирается и умелый относительно прекращения восприятия.
comment-en-sujato: pakataññū is, I think, unique to this passage.

root-pli-ms: Kathaṁ nu kho, bhante, abhisaññānirodho hotī”ti?
translation-en-sujato: How does the cessation of perception happen?”
translation-ru-team: Как же прекращается восприятие?"

root-pli-ms: 1.2. Sahetukasaññuppādanirodhakathā
translation-en-sujato: 1.2. Perception Arises With a Cause
translation-ru-team: 1.2. Восприятие возникает из-за причин

root-pli-ms: “Tatra, poṭṭhapāda, ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā evamāhaṁsu:
translation-en-sujato: “Regarding this, Poṭṭhapāda, those ascetics and brahmins who say that
translation-ru-team: "Касательно этого, Поттхапада, те аскеты и брахманы, которые говорят, что
reference: bj7.392, km15.115, ms6D_696, msdiv412, pts-cs7, pts-vp-pli1.181, sc12, sya9.226

root-pli-ms: ‘ahetū appaccayā purisassa saññā uppajjantipi nirujjhantipī’ti, āditova tesaṁ aparaddhaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: a person’s perceptions arise and cease without cause or reason are wrong from the start.
translation-ru-team: чьё-либо восприятие возникает и прекращается без причин неправы с самого начала.

root-pli-ms: Taṁ kissa hetu?
translation-en-sujato: Why is that?
translation-ru-team: И почему?

root-pli-ms: Sahetū hi, poṭṭhapāda, sappaccayā purisassa saññā uppajjantipi nirujjhantipi.
translation-en-sujato: Because a person’s perceptions arise and cease with cause and reason.
translation-ru-team: Потому что чьё-либо восприятие возникает и прекращается из-за причин.

root-pli-ms: Sikkhā ekā saññā uppajjati, sikkhā ekā saññā nirujjhati.
translation-en-sujato: With training, certain perceptions arise and certain perceptions cease.
translation-ru-team: С тренировкой, определённые восприятия возникают и определённые восприятия прекращаются.

root-pli-ms: Kā ca sikkhā”ti? Bhagavā avoca.
translation-en-sujato: And what is that training?” said the Buddha.
translation-ru-team: И что это за тренировка?" - спросил Будда.

root-pli-ms: “Idha, poṭṭhapāda, tathāgato loke uppajjati arahaṁ, sammāsambuddho …pe…
translation-en-sujato: “It’s when a Realized One arises in the world, perfected, a fully awakened Buddha …
translation-ru-team: "Это когда в мире появляется Так-Идущий, совершенный, полностью пробуждённый... [см. ДН 2]

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ kho, poṭṭhapāda, bhikkhu sīlasampanno hoti …pe…
translation-en-sujato: That’s how a mendicant is accomplished in ethics. …
translation-ru-team: Вот как, Поттхапада, монах совершенный в этике...

root-pli-ms: tassime pañcanīvaraṇe pahīne attani samanupassato pāmojjaṁ jāyati, pamuditassa pīti jāyati, pītimanassa kāyo passambhati, passaddhakāyo sukhaṁ vedeti, sukhino cittaṁ samādhiyati.
translation-en-sujato: Seeing that the hindrances have been given up in them, joy springs up. Being joyful, rapture springs up. When the mind is full of rapture, the body becomes tranquil. When the body is tranquil, they feel bliss. And when blissful, the mind becomes immersed.
translation-ru-team: видит, что пять помех устранены, он становится радостным. Будучи радостным, он становится восхищён. Когда ум полон восхищения, тело успокаивается. Когда тело успокоено, он чувствует лёгкость. С облегчением, ум становится собран.

root-pli-ms: So vivicceva kāmehi, vivicca akusalehi dhammehi, savitakkaṁ savicāraṁ vivekajaṁ pītisukhaṁ paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati.
translation-en-sujato: Quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, they enter and remain in the first absorption, which has the rapture and bliss born of seclusion, while placing the mind and keeping it connected.
