translation-ru-team: Отстранённый от чувственных удовольствий, отстранённый от неумелых объектов ума, с размышлением и обдумыванием, а также с радостной лёгкостью, он достигает и пребывает в первой джхане.

root-pli-ms: Tassa yā purimā kāmasaññā, sā nirujjhati.
translation-en-sujato: The sensual perception that they had previously ceases.
translation-ru-team: Чувственное восприятие, что у него было раньше, прекращается.

root-pli-ms: Vivekajapītisukhasukhumasaccasaññā tasmiṁ samaye hoti, vivekajapītisukhasukhumasaccasaññīyeva tasmiṁ samaye hoti.
translation-en-sujato: At that time they have a subtle and true perception of the rapture and bliss born of seclusion.
translation-ru-team: И тогда у него наличествует тонкое восприятие восхищения и лёгкости, вызванных отстранённостью.

root-pli-ms: Evampi sikkhā ekā saññā uppajjati, sikkhā ekā saññā nirujjhati.
translation-en-sujato: That’s how, with training, certain perceptions arise and certain perceptions cease.
translation-ru-team: Вот как благодаря тренировке определённые восприятия возникают и определённые восприятия прекращаются.

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ sikkhā”ti bhagavā avoca.
translation-en-sujato: And this is that training,” said the Buddha.
translation-ru-team: И вот что это это за тренировка." - сказал Будда.

root-pli-ms: “Puna caparaṁ, poṭṭhapāda, bhikkhu vitakkavicārānaṁ vūpasamā ajjhattaṁ sampasādanaṁ cetaso ekodibhāvaṁ avitakkaṁ avicāraṁ samādhijaṁ pītisukhaṁ dutiyaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati.
translation-en-sujato: “Furthermore, as the placing of the mind and keeping it connected are stilled, a mendicant enters and remains in the second absorption, which has the rapture and bliss born of immersion, with internal clarity and confidence, and unified mind, without placing the mind and keeping it connected.
translation-ru-team: "Затем, Поттхапада, с успокоением размышления и обдумывания,  с внутренним спокойствием, с намерением на единение ума, без размышления и обдумывания, с удовольствием и блаженством, рождённым собранностью ума, монах входит и пребывает во второй джхане.
reference: bj7.402, csp1ed6.170, csp2ed6.170, mc9.179, ms6D_698, pts-cs11, pts-vp-pli1.183, sc14, sya9.227

root-pli-ms: Tassa yā purimā vivekajapītisukhasukhumasaccasaññā, sā nirujjhati.
translation-en-sujato: The subtle and true perception of the rapture and bliss born of seclusion that they had previously ceases.
translation-ru-team: Тонкое восприятие восхищения и лёгкости, вызванных отстранённостью, прекращается.

root-pli-ms: Samādhijapītisukhasukhumasaccasaññā tasmiṁ samaye hoti, samādhijapītisukhasukhumasaccasaññīyeva tasmiṁ samaye hoti.
translation-en-sujato: At that time they have a subtle and true perception of the rapture and bliss born of immersion.
translation-ru-team: И тогда у него наличествует тонкое восприятие восхищения и лёгкости, вызванных собранностью ума.

root-pli-ms: Evampi sikkhā ekā saññā uppajjati, sikkhā ekā saññā nirujjhati.
translation-en-sujato: That’s how, with training, certain perceptions arise and certain perceptions cease.
translation-ru-team: Вот как благодаря тренировке определённые восприятия возникают и определённые восприятия прекращаются.

root-pli-ms: Ayampi sikkhā”ti bhagavā avoca.
translation-en-sujato: And this is that training,” said the Buddha.
translation-ru-team: И вот что это это за тренировка." - сказал Будда.

root-pli-ms: “Puna caparaṁ, poṭṭhapāda, bhikkhu pītiyā ca virāgā upekkhako ca viharati sato ca sampajāno, sukhañca kāyena paṭisaṁvedeti, yaṁ taṁ ariyā ācikkhanti: ‘upekkhako satimā sukhavihārī’ti, tatiyaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati.
translation-en-sujato: “Furthermore, with the fading away of rapture, a mendicant enters and remains in the third absorption, where they meditate with equanimity, mindful and aware, personally experiencing the bliss of which the noble ones declare, ‘Equanimous and mindful, one meditates in bliss.’
translation-ru-team: Затем, Поттхапада, с угасанием удовольствия, монах пребывает в равностности, осознанности и бдительности, с приятным чувствованием тела. Он входит и пребывает в третьей джхане, о которой Благородные говорят: "Приятное пребываение в равностности и осознанности."

root-pli-ms: Tassa yā purimā samādhijapītisukhasukhumasaccasaññā, sā nirujjhati.
translation-en-sujato: The subtle and true perception of the rapture and bliss born of immersion that they had previously ceases.
translation-ru-team: Тонкое восприятие удовольствия и блаженства, рождённых собранностью ума, прекращается.

root-pli-ms: Upekkhāsukhasukhumasaccasaññā tasmiṁ samaye hoti, upekkhāsukhasukhumasaccasaññīyeva tasmiṁ samaye hoti.
translation-en-sujato: At that time they have a subtle and true perception of equanimous bliss.
translation-ru-team: И тогда у него наличествует тонкое восприятие блаженства равностности.

root-pli-ms: Evampi sikkhā ekā saññā uppajjati, sikkhā ekā saññā nirujjhati.
translation-en-sujato: That’s how, with training, certain perceptions arise and certain perceptions cease.
translation-ru-team: Вот как благодаря тренировке определённые восприятия возникают и определённые восприятия прекращаются.

root-pli-ms: Ayampi sikkhā”ti bhagavā avoca.
translation-en-sujato: And this is that training,” said the Buddha.
translation-ru-team: И вот что это это за тренировка." - сказал Будда.

root-pli-ms: “Puna caparaṁ, poṭṭhapāda, bhikkhu sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā pubbeva somanassadomanassānaṁ atthaṅgamā adukkhamasukhaṁ upekkhāsatipārisuddhiṁ catutthaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati.
translation-en-sujato: “Furthermore, giving up pleasure and pain, and ending former happiness and sadness, a mendicant enters and remains in the fourth absorption, without pleasure or pain, with pure equanimity and mindfulness.
translation-ru-team: "Затем, Поттхапада, с оставлением лёгкости и тягостности, с окончанием прошлых радостей и печалей, монах входит и пребывает в четвёртой джхане: в чистой равностности и осозноннаости, ни-лёгкости-ни-тягостности.

root-pli-ms: Tassa yā purimā upekkhāsukhasukhumasaccasaññā, sā nirujjhati.
translation-en-sujato: The subtle and true perception of equanimous bliss that they had previously ceases.
translation-ru-team: Тонкое восприятие блаженства равностности, что наличествовало ранее, прекращается.

root-pli-ms: Adukkhamasukhasukhumasaccasaññā tasmiṁ samaye hoti, adukkhamasukhasukhumasaccasaññīyeva tasmiṁ samaye hoti.
translation-en-sujato: At that time they have a subtle and true perception of neutral feeling.
translation-ru-team: И тогда у него наличествует тонкое восприятие нейтрального чувства.

root-pli-ms: Evampi sikkhā ekā saññā uppajjati, sikkhā ekā saññā nirujjhati.
translation-en-sujato: That’s how, with training, certain perceptions arise and certain perceptions cease.
translation-ru-team: Вот как благодаря тренировке определённые восприятия возникают и определённые восприятия прекращаются.

root-pli-ms: Ayampi sikkhā”ti bhagavā avoca.
translation-en-sujato: And this is that training,” said the Buddha.
translation-ru-team: И вот что это это за тренировка." - сказал Будда.

root-pli-ms: “Puna caparaṁ, poṭṭhapāda, bhikkhu sabbaso rūpasaññānaṁ samatikkamā paṭighasaññānaṁ atthaṅgamā nānattasaññānaṁ amanasikārā ‘ananto ākāso’ti ākāsānañcāyatanaṁ upasampajja viharati.
translation-en-sujato: “Furthermore, a mendicant, going totally beyond perceptions of form, with the ending of perceptions of impingement, not focusing on perceptions of diversity, aware that ‘space is infinite’, enters and remains in the dimension of infinite space.

root-pli-ms: Tassa yā purimā rūpasaññā, sā nirujjhati.
translation-en-sujato: The perception of luminous form that they had previously ceases.

root-pli-ms: Ākāsānañcāyatanasukhumasaccasaññā tasmiṁ samaye hoti, ākāsānañcāyatanasukhumasaccasaññīyeva tasmiṁ samaye hoti.
translation-en-sujato: At that time they have a subtle and true perception of the dimension of infinite space.

root-pli-ms: Evampi sikkhā ekā saññā uppajjati, sikkhā ekā saññā nirujjhati.
translation-en-sujato: That’s how, with training, certain perceptions arise and certain perceptions cease.

root-pli-ms: Ayampi sikkhā”ti bhagavā avoca.
translation-en-sujato: And this is that training,” said the Buddha.

root-pli-ms: “Puna caparaṁ, poṭṭhapāda, bhikkhu sabbaso ākāsānañcāyatanaṁ samatikkamma ‘anantaṁ viññāṇan’ti viññāṇañcāyatanaṁ upasampajja viharati.
translation-en-sujato: “Furthermore, a mendicant, going totally beyond the dimension of infinite space, aware that ‘consciousness is infinite’, enters and remains in the dimension of infinite consciousness.

root-pli-ms: Tassa yā purimā ākāsānañcāyatanasukhumasaccasaññā, sā nirujjhati.
translation-en-sujato: The subtle and true perception of the dimension of infinite space that they had previously ceases.

root-pli-ms: Viññāṇañcāyatanasukhumasaccasaññā tasmiṁ samaye hoti, viññāṇañcāyatanasukhumasaccasaññīyeva tasmiṁ samaye hoti.
translation-en-sujato: At that time they have a subtle and true perception of the dimension of infinite consciousness.

root-pli-ms: Evampi sikkhā ekā saññā uppajjati, sikkhā ekā saññā nirujjhati.
translation-en-sujato: That’s how, with training, certain perceptions arise and certain perceptions cease.

root-pli-ms: Ayampi sikkhā”ti bhagavā avoca.
translation-en-sujato: And this is that training,” said the Buddha.

root-pli-ms: “Puna caparaṁ, poṭṭhapāda, bhikkhu sabbaso viññāṇañcāyatanaṁ samatikkamma ‘natthi kiñcī’ti ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ upasampajja viharati.
translation-en-sujato: “Furthermore, a mendicant, going totally beyond the dimension of infinite consciousness, aware that ‘there is nothing at all’, enters and remains in the dimension of nothingness.

root-pli-ms: Tassa yā purimā viññāṇañcāyatanasukhumasaccasaññā, sā nirujjhati.
translation-en-sujato: The subtle and true perception of the dimension of infinite consciousness that they had previously ceases.

root-pli-ms: Ākiñcaññāyatanasukhumasaccasaññā tasmiṁ samaye hoti, ākiñcaññāyatanasukhumasaccasaññīyeva tasmiṁ samaye hoti.
translation-en-sujato: At that time they have a subtle and true perception of the dimension of nothingness.

root-pli-ms: Evampi sikkhā ekā saññā uppajjati, sikkhā ekā saññā nirujjhati.
translation-en-sujato: That’s how, with training, certain perceptions arise and certain perceptions cease.

root-pli-ms: Ayampi sikkhā”ti bhagavā avoca.
translation-en-sujato: And this is that training,” said the Buddha.

root-pli-ms: “Yato kho, poṭṭhapāda, bhikkhu idha sakasaññī hoti, so tato amutra tato amutra anupubbena saññaggaṁ phusati.
translation-en-sujato: “Poṭṭhapāda, from the time a mendicant here takes responsibility for their own perception, they proceed from one stage to the next, gradually reaching the peak of perception.
comment-en-sujato: For sakasaññī, see Pj2, “perceives it as his own”.

root-pli-ms: Tassa saññagge ṭhitassa evaṁ hoti:
translation-en-sujato: Standing on the peak of perception they think,

root-pli-ms: ‘cetayamānassa me pāpiyo, acetayamānassa me seyyo.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Intentionality is bad for me, it’s better to be free of it.

root-pli-ms: Ahañceva kho pana ceteyyaṁ, abhisaṅkhareyyaṁ, imā ca me saññā nirujjheyyuṁ, aññā ca oḷārikā saññā uppajjeyyuṁ;
translation-en-sujato: For if I were to intend and choose, these perceptions would cease in me, and other coarser perceptions would arise.

root-pli-ms: yannūnāhaṁ na ceva ceteyyaṁ na ca abhisaṅkhareyyan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: Why don’t I neither make a choice nor form an intention?’

root-pli-ms: So na ceva ceteti, na ca abhisaṅkharoti.
translation-en-sujato: They neither make a choice nor form an intention.

root-pli-ms: Tassa acetayato anabhisaṅkharoto tā ceva saññā nirujjhanti, aññā ca oḷārikā saññā na uppajjanti.
translation-en-sujato: Those perceptions cease in them, and other coarser perceptions don’t arise.

root-pli-ms: So nirodhaṁ phusati.
translation-en-sujato: They touch cessation.

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ kho, poṭṭhapāda, anupubbābhisaññānirodhasampajānasamāpatti hoti.
translation-en-sujato: And that, Poṭṭhapāda, is how the gradual cessation of perception is attained with awareness.

root-pli-ms: Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, poṭṭhapāda,
translation-en-sujato: What do you think, Poṭṭhapāda?

root-pli-ms: api nu te ito pubbe evarūpā anupubbābhisaññānirodhasampajānasamāpatti sutapubbā”ti?
translation-en-sujato: Have you ever heard of this before?”

root-pli-ms: “No hetaṁ, bhante.
translation-en-sujato: “No, sir.

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ kho ahaṁ, bhante, bhagavato bhāsitaṁ ājānāmi:
translation-en-sujato: This is how I understand what the Buddha said:

root-pli-ms: ‘yato kho, poṭṭhapāda, bhikkhu idha sakasaññī hoti, so tato amutra tato amutra anupubbena saññaggaṁ phusati,
translation-en-sujato: ‘From the time a mendicant here takes responsibility for their own perception, they proceed from one stage to the next, gradually reaching the peak of perception.

root-pli-ms: tassa saññagge ṭhitassa evaṁ hoti:
translation-en-sujato: Standing on the peak of perception they think,

root-pli-ms: “cetayamānassa me pāpiyo, acetayamānassa me seyyo.
translation-en-sujato: “Intentionality is bad for me, it’s better to be free of it.

root-pli-ms: Ahañceva kho pana ceteyyaṁ abhisaṅkhareyyaṁ, imā ca me saññā nirujjheyyuṁ, aññā ca oḷārikā saññā uppajjeyyuṁ;
translation-en-sujato: For if I were to intend and choose, these perceptions would cease in me, and other coarser perceptions would arise.

root-pli-ms: yannūnāhaṁ na ceva ceteyyaṁ, na ca abhisaṅkhareyyan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Why don’t I neither make a choice nor form an intention?”

root-pli-ms: So na ceva ceteti, na cābhisaṅkharoti, tassa acetayato anabhisaṅkharoto tā ceva saññā nirujjhanti, aññā ca oḷārikā saññā na uppajjanti.
translation-en-sujato: Those perceptions cease in them, and other coarser perceptions don’t arise.

root-pli-ms: So nirodhaṁ phusati.
translation-en-sujato: They touch cessation.

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ kho, poṭṭhapāda, anupubbābhisaññānirodhasampajānasamāpatti hotī’”ti.
translation-en-sujato: And that is how the gradual cessation of perception is attained with awareness.’”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, poṭṭhapādā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “That’s right, Poṭṭhapāda.”

root-pli-ms: “Ekaññeva nu kho, bhante, bhagavā saññaggaṁ paññapeti, udāhu puthūpi saññagge paññapetī”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “Does the Buddha describe just one peak of perception, or many?”

root-pli-ms: “Ekampi kho ahaṁ, poṭṭhapāda, saññaggaṁ paññapemi, puthūpi saññagge paññapemī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “I describe the peak of perception as both one and many.”

root-pli-ms: “Yathā kathaṁ pana, bhante, bhagavā ekampi saññaggaṁ paññapeti, puthūpi saññagge paññapetī”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “But sir, how do you describe it as one peak and as many?”

root-pli-ms: “Yathā yathā kho, poṭṭhapāda, nirodhaṁ phusati tathā tathāhaṁ saññaggaṁ paññapemi.
translation-en-sujato: “I describe the peak of perception according to the specific manner in which one touches cessation.

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ kho ahaṁ, poṭṭhapāda, ekampi saññaggaṁ paññapemi, puthūpi saññagge paññapemī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: That’s how I describe the peak of perception as both one and many.”

root-pli-ms: “Saññā nu kho, bhante, paṭhamaṁ uppajjati, pacchā ñāṇaṁ, udāhu ñāṇaṁ paṭhamaṁ uppajjati, pacchā saññā, udāhu saññā ca ñāṇañca apubbaṁ acarimaṁ uppajjantī”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “But sir, does perception arise first and knowledge afterwards? Or does knowledge arise first and perception afterwards? Or do they both arise at the same time?”
reference: bj7.408, cck9.231, ms6D_707, msdiv416, pts-cs20, sc23

root-pli-ms: “Saññā kho, poṭṭhapāda, paṭhamaṁ uppajjati, pacchā ñāṇaṁ, saññuppādā ca pana ñāṇuppādo hoti.
translation-en-sujato: “Perception arises first and knowledge afterwards. The arising of perception leads to the arising of knowledge.

root-pli-ms: So evaṁ pajānāti:
translation-en-sujato: They understand,

root-pli-ms: ‘idappaccayā kira me ñāṇaṁ udapādī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘My knowledge arose from a specific condition.’

root-pli-ms: Iminā kho etaṁ, poṭṭhapāda, pariyāyena veditabbaṁ—
translation-en-sujato: That is a way to understand how

root-pli-ms: yathā saññā paṭhamaṁ uppajjati, pacchā ñāṇaṁ, saññuppādā ca pana ñāṇuppādo hotī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: perception arises first and knowledge afterwards; that the arising of perception leads to the arising of knowledge.”

root-pli-ms: 1.3. Saññāattakathā
translation-en-sujato: 1.3. Perception and the Self

root-pli-ms: “Saññā nu kho, bhante, purisassa attā, udāhu aññā saññā añño attā”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, is perception a person’s self, or are perception and self different things?”

root-pli-ms: “Kaṁ pana tvaṁ, poṭṭhapāda, attānaṁ paccesī”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “But Poṭṭhapāda, do you believe in a self?”

root-pli-ms: “Oḷārikaṁ kho ahaṁ, bhante, attānaṁ paccemi rūpiṁ cātumahābhūtikaṁ kabaḷīkārāhārabhakkhan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “I believe in a substantial self, sir, which is physical, made up of the four primary elements, and consumes solid food.”

root-pli-ms: “Oḷāriko ca hi te, poṭṭhapāda, attā abhavissa rūpī cātumahābhūtiko kabaḷīkārāhārabhakkho. Evaṁ santaṁ kho te, poṭṭhapāda, aññāva saññā bhavissati añño attā.
translation-en-sujato: “Suppose there were such a substantial self, Poṭṭhapāda. In that case, perception would be one thing, the self another.

root-pli-ms: Tadamināpetaṁ, poṭṭhapāda, pariyāyena veditabbaṁ yathā aññāva saññā bhavissati añño attā.
translation-en-sujato: Here is another way to understand how perception and self are different things.

root-pli-ms: Tiṭṭhateva sāyaṁ, poṭṭhapāda, oḷāriko attā rūpī cātumahābhūtiko kabaḷīkārāhārabhakkho, atha imassa purisassa aññā ca saññā uppajjanti, aññā ca saññā nirujjhanti.
translation-en-sujato: So long as that substantial self remains, still some perceptions arise in a person and others cease.
comment-en-sujato: Here titthateva is not “leaving aside”, but as per MN 107, which also has a titthateva … atha construction.

root-pli-ms: Iminā kho etaṁ, poṭṭhapāda, pariyāyena veditabbaṁ yathā aññāva saññā bhavissati añño attā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: That is a way to understand how perception and self are different things.”

root-pli-ms: “Manomayaṁ kho ahaṁ, bhante, attānaṁ paccemi sabbaṅgapaccaṅgiṁ ahīnindriyan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, I believe in a mind-made self which is complete in all its various parts, not deficient in any faculty.”
comment-en-sujato: All manuscripts appear to be missing rūpī, which occurs in the corresponding passage on the attapatilabha

root-pli-ms: “Manomayo ca hi te, poṭṭhapāda, attā abhavissa sabbaṅgapaccaṅgī ahīnindriyo, evaṁ santampi kho te, poṭṭhapāda, aññāva saññā bhavissati añño attā.
translation-en-sujato: “Suppose there were such a mind-made self, Poṭṭhapāda. In that case, perception would be one thing, the self another.

root-pli-ms: Tadamināpetaṁ, poṭṭhapāda, pariyāyena veditabbaṁ yathā aññāva saññā bhavissati añño attā.
translation-en-sujato: Here is another way to understand how perception and self are different things.

root-pli-ms: Tiṭṭhateva sāyaṁ, poṭṭhapāda, manomayo attā sabbaṅgapaccaṅgī ahīnindriyo, atha imassa purisassa aññā ca saññā uppajjanti, aññā ca saññā nirujjhanti.
translation-en-sujato: So long as that mind-made self remains, still some perceptions arise in a person and others cease.

root-pli-ms: Imināpi kho etaṁ, poṭṭhapāda, pariyāyena veditabbaṁ yathā aññāva saññā bhavissati añño attā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: That too is a way to understand how perception and self are different things.”

root-pli-ms: “Arūpiṁ kho ahaṁ, bhante, attānaṁ paccemi saññāmayan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, I believe in a non-physical self which is made of perception.”
reference: bj7.410, km15.126, ms6D_710, msdiv419, pts-cs23, pts-vp-pli1.187, sc26, sya9.232

root-pli-ms: “Arūpī ca hi te, poṭṭhapāda, attā abhavissa saññāmayo, evaṁ santampi kho te, poṭṭhapāda, aññāva saññā bhavissati añño attā.
translation-en-sujato: “Suppose there were such a non-physical self, Poṭṭhapāda. In that case, perception would be one thing, the self another.

root-pli-ms: Tadamināpetaṁ, poṭṭhapāda, pariyāyena veditabbaṁ yathā aññāva saññā bhavissati añño attā.
translation-en-sujato: Here is another way to understand how perception and self are different things.

root-pli-ms: Tiṭṭhateva sāyaṁ, poṭṭhapāda, arūpī attā saññāmayo, atha imassa purisassa aññā ca saññā uppajjanti, aññā ca saññā nirujjhanti.
translation-en-sujato: So long as that non-physical self remains, still some perceptions arise in a person and others cease.

root-pli-ms: Imināpi kho etaṁ, poṭṭhapāda, pariyāyena veditabbaṁ yathā aññāva saññā bhavissati añño attā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: That too is a way to understand how perception and self are different things.”

root-pli-ms: “Sakkā panetaṁ, bhante, mayā ñātuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: “But, sir, am I able to know whether

root-pli-ms: ‘saññā purisassa attā’ti vā ‘aññāva saññā añño attā’ti vā”ti?
translation-en-sujato: perception is a person’s self, or whether perception and self are different things?”

root-pli-ms: “Dujjānaṁ kho etaṁ, poṭṭhapāda, tayā aññadiṭṭhikena aññakhantikena aññarucikena aññatrāyogena aññatrācariyakena:
translation-en-sujato: “It’s hard for you to understand this, since you have a different view, creed, preference, practice, and tradition.”

root-pli-ms: ‘saññā purisassa attā’ti vā, ‘aññāva saññā añño attāti’ vā”ti.
“Sacetaṁ, bhante, mayā dujjānaṁ aññadiṭṭhikena aññakhantikena aññarucikena aññatrāyogena aññatrācariyakena:
translation-en-sujato: “Well, if that’s the case, sir,

root-pli-ms: ‘saññā purisassa attā’ti vā, ‘aññāva saññā añño attā’ti vā;
kiṁ pana, bhante, ‘sassato loko, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’”ti?
translation-en-sujato: then is this right: ‘The cosmos is eternal. This is the only truth, anything else is wrong’?”

root-pli-ms: “Abyākataṁ kho etaṁ, poṭṭhapāda, mayā:
translation-en-sujato: “This has not been declared by me, Poṭṭhapāda.”

root-pli-ms: ‘sassato loko, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’”ti.
“Kiṁ pana, bhante, ‘asassato loko, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “Then is this right: ‘The cosmos is not eternal. This is the only truth, anything else is wrong’?”

root-pli-ms: “Etampi kho, poṭṭhapāda, mayā abyākataṁ:
translation-en-sujato: “This too has not been declared by me.”

root-pli-ms: ‘asassato loko, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’”ti.
“Kiṁ pana, bhante, ‘antavā loko …pe…
translation-en-sujato: “Then is this right: ‘The cosmos is finite …’ …

root-pli-ms: ‘anantavā loko …
translation-en-sujato: ‘The cosmos is infinite …’ …

root-pli-ms: ‘taṁ jīvaṁ taṁ sarīraṁ …
translation-en-sujato: ‘The soul and the body are the same thing …’ …

root-pli-ms: ‘aññaṁ jīvaṁ aññaṁ sarīraṁ …
translation-en-sujato: ‘The soul and the body are different things …’ …

root-pli-ms: ‘hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā …
translation-en-sujato: ‘A Realized One exists after death …’ …

root-pli-ms: ‘na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā …
translation-en-sujato: ‘A Realized One doesn’t exist after death …’ …

root-pli-ms: ‘hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā …
translation-en-sujato: ‘A Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death …’ …

root-pli-ms: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’”ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death. This is the only truth, anything else is wrong’?”

root-pli-ms: “Etampi kho, poṭṭhapāda, mayā abyākataṁ:
translation-en-sujato: “This too has not been declared by me.”

root-pli-ms: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’”ti.
“Kasmā panetaṁ, bhante, bhagavatā abyākatan”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “Why haven’t these things been declared by the Buddha?”
reference: bj7.414, dr9.250, ms6D_715, pts-cs28, pts-vp-pli1.189, sc31

root-pli-ms: “Na hetaṁ, poṭṭhapāda, atthasaṁhitaṁ na dhammasaṁhitaṁ nādibrahmacariyakaṁ, na nibbidāya na virāgāya na nirodhāya na upasamāya na abhiññāya na sambodhāya na nibbānāya saṁvattati,
translation-en-sujato: “Because they’re not beneficial or relevant to the fundamentals of the spiritual life. They don’t lead to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.

root-pli-ms: tasmā etaṁ mayā abyākatan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: That’s why I haven’t declared them.”

root-pli-ms: “Kiṁ pana, bhante, bhagavatā byākatan”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “Then what has been declared by the Buddha?”

root-pli-ms: “Idaṁ dukkhanti kho, poṭṭhapāda, mayā byākataṁ. Ayaṁ dukkhasamudayoti kho, poṭṭhapāda, mayā byākataṁ. Ayaṁ dukkhanirodhoti kho, poṭṭhapāda, mayā byākataṁ. Ayaṁ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadāti kho, poṭṭhapāda, mayā byākatan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “I have declared this: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.”

root-pli-ms: “Kasmā panetaṁ, bhante, bhagavatā byākatan”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “Why have these things been declared by the Buddha?”

root-pli-ms: “Etañhi, poṭṭhapāda, atthasaṁhitaṁ, etaṁ dhammasaṁhitaṁ, etaṁ ādibrahmacariyakaṁ, etaṁ nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati;
translation-en-sujato: “Because they are beneficial and relevant to the fundamentals of the spiritual life. They lead to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.

root-pli-ms: tasmā etaṁ mayā byākatan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: That’s why I have declared them.”

root-pli-ms: “Evametaṁ, bhagavā, evametaṁ, sugata.
translation-en-sujato: “That’s so true, Blessed One! That’s so true, Holy One!

root-pli-ms: Yassadāni, bhante, bhagavā kālaṁ maññatī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Please, sir, go at your convenience.”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha got up from his seat and left.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho te paribbājakā acirapakkantassa bhagavato poṭṭhapādaṁ paribbājakaṁ samantato vācā sannitodakena sañjhabbharimakaṁsu:
translation-en-sujato: Soon after the Buddha left, those wanderers gave Poṭṭhapāda a comprehensive tongue-lashing,
reference: csp1ed6.175, csp2ed6.175, dr9.251, km15.130, mc9.184, ms6D_718, msdiv421, pts-cs31, pts-vp-pli1.190, sc34, vri1.168

root-pli-ms: “evameva panāyaṁ bhavaṁ poṭṭhapādo yaññadeva samaṇo gotamo bhāsati, taṁ tadevassa abbhanumodati:
translation-en-sujato: “No matter what the ascetic Gotama says, Poṭṭhapāda agrees with him:

root-pli-ms: ‘evametaṁ, bhagavā, evametaṁ, sugatā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘That’s so true, Blessed One! That’s so true, Holy One!’

root-pli-ms: Na kho pana mayaṁ kiñci samaṇassa gotamassa ekaṁsikaṁ dhammaṁ desitaṁ ājānāma:
translation-en-sujato: We understand that the ascetic Gotama didn’t make any definitive statement at all regarding whether the cosmos is eternal and so on.”

root-pli-ms: ‘sassato loko’ti vā, ‘asassato loko’ti vā, ‘antavā loko’ti vā, ‘anantavā loko’ti vā, ‘taṁ jīvaṁ taṁ sarīran’ti vā, ‘aññaṁ jīvaṁ aññaṁ sarīran’ti vā, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’ti vā, ‘na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’ti vā, ‘hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’ti vā, ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’ti vā”ti.
Evaṁ vutte, poṭṭhapādo paribbājako te paribbājake etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: When they said this, Poṭṭhapāda said to them,

root-pli-ms: “ahampi kho, bho, na kiñci samaṇassa gotamassa ekaṁsikaṁ dhammaṁ desitaṁ ājānāmi:
translation-en-sujato: “I too understand that the ascetic Gotama didn’t make any definitive statement at all regarding whether the cosmos is eternal and so on.

root-pli-ms: ‘sassato loko’ti vā, ‘asassato loko’ti vā …pe…
‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’ti vā;
api ca samaṇo gotamo bhūtaṁ tacchaṁ tathaṁ paṭipadaṁ paññapeti dhammaṭṭhitataṁ dhammaniyāmataṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Nevertheless, the practice that he describes is true, real, and accurate. It is the regularity of natural principles, the invariance of natural principles.

root-pli-ms: Bhūtaṁ kho pana tacchaṁ tathaṁ paṭipadaṁ paññapentassa dhammaṭṭhitataṁ dhammaniyāmataṁ, kathañhi nāma mādiso viññū samaṇassa gotamassa subhāsitaṁ subhāsitato nābbhanumodeyyā”ti?
translation-en-sujato: So how could a sensible person such as I not agree that what was well spoken by the ascetic Gotama was in fact well spoken?”

root-pli-ms: 2. Cittahatthisāriputtapoṭṭhapādavatthu
translation-en-sujato: 2. On Citta Hatthisāriputta

root-pli-ms: Atha kho dvīhatīhassa accayena citto ca hatthisāriputto poṭṭhapādo ca paribbājako yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā citto hatthisāriputto bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
translation-en-sujato: Then after two or three days had passed, Citta Hatthisāriputta and Poṭṭhapāda went to see the Buddha. Citta Hatthisāriputta bowed and sat down to one side.
comment-en-sujato: RD, MW, Thanissaro, and DPPN all say “son of an elephant trainer”. But this seems to assume a form hatthisarathiputta. Am I missing something?

root-pli-ms: Poṭṭhapādo pana paribbājako bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodi. Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
translation-en-sujato: But the wanderer Poṭṭhapāda exchanged greetings with the Buddha, and when the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side.

root-pli-ms: Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho poṭṭhapādo paribbājako bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: Poṭṭhapāda told the Buddha what had happened after he left. The Buddha said:

root-pli-ms: “tadā maṁ, bhante, te paribbājakā acirapakkantassa bhagavato samantato vācāsannitodakena sañjhabbharimakaṁsu:
‘evameva panāyaṁ bhavaṁ poṭṭhapādo yaññadeva samaṇo gotamo bhāsati, taṁ tadevassa abbhanumodati:
“evametaṁ, bhagavā, evametaṁ, sugatā”ti.
Na kho pana mayaṁ kiñci samaṇassa gotamassa ekaṁsikaṁ dhammaṁ desitaṁ ājānāma:

“sassato loko”ti vā, “asassato loko”ti vā, “antavā loko”ti vā, “anantavā loko”ti vā, “taṁ jīvaṁ taṁ sarīran”ti vā, “aññaṁ jīvaṁ aññaṁ sarīran”ti vā, “hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā”ti vā, “na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā”ti vā, “hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā”ti vā, “neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā”ti vā’ti.
Evaṁ vuttāhaṁ, bhante, te paribbājake etadavocaṁ:
‘ahampi kho, bho, na kiñci samaṇassa gotamassa ekaṁsikaṁ dhammaṁ desitaṁ ājānāmi:
“sassato loko”ti vā, “asassato loko”ti vā …pe…
“neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā”ti vā;
api ca samaṇo gotamo bhūtaṁ tacchaṁ tathaṁ paṭipadaṁ paññapeti dhammaṭṭhitataṁ dhammaniyāmataṁ.
Bhūtaṁ kho pana tacchaṁ tathaṁ paṭipadaṁ paññapentassa dhammaṭṭhitataṁ dhammaniyāmataṁ, kathañhi nāma mādiso viññū samaṇassa gotamassa subhāsitaṁ subhāsitato nābbhanumodeyyā’”ti?
“Sabbeva kho ete, poṭṭhapāda, paribbājakā andhā acakkhukā;
translation-en-sujato: “All those wanderers, Poṭṭhapāda, are blind and sightless.

root-pli-ms: tvaṁyeva nesaṁ eko cakkhumā.
translation-en-sujato: You are the only one who sees.

root-pli-ms: Ekaṁsikāpi hi kho, poṭṭhapāda, mayā dhammā desitā paññattā;
translation-en-sujato: For I have taught and pointed out both things that are definitive

root-pli-ms: anekaṁsikāpi hi kho, poṭṭhapāda, mayā dhammā desitā paññattā.
translation-en-sujato: and things that are not definitive.

root-pli-ms: Katame ca te, poṭṭhapāda, mayā anekaṁsikā dhammā desitā paññattā?
translation-en-sujato: And what things have I taught and pointed out that are not definitive?

root-pli-ms: ‘Sassato loko’ti kho, poṭṭhapāda, mayā anekaṁsiko dhammo desito paññatto;
translation-en-sujato: ‘The cosmos is eternal’ …

root-pli-ms: ‘asassato loko’ti kho, poṭṭhapāda, mayā anekaṁsiko dhammo desito paññatto;
translation-en-sujato: ‘The cosmos is not eternal’ …

root-pli-ms: ‘antavā loko’ti kho, poṭṭhapāda …pe…
translation-en-sujato: ‘The cosmos is finite’ …

root-pli-ms: ‘anantavā loko’ti kho, poṭṭhapāda …
translation-en-sujato: ‘The cosmos is infinite’ …

root-pli-ms: ‘taṁ jīvaṁ taṁ sarīran’ti kho, poṭṭhapāda …
translation-en-sujato: ‘The soul is the same thing as the body’ …

root-pli-ms: ‘aññaṁ jīvaṁ aññaṁ sarīran’ti kho, poṭṭhapāda …
translation-en-sujato: ‘The soul and the body are different things’ …

root-pli-ms: ‘hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’ti kho, poṭṭhapāda …
translation-en-sujato: ‘A Realized One exists after death’ …

root-pli-ms: na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’ti kho, poṭṭhapāda …
translation-en-sujato: ‘A Realized One doesn’t exist after death’ …

root-pli-ms: ‘hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’ti kho, poṭṭhapāda …
translation-en-sujato: ‘A Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death’ …

root-pli-ms: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā’ti kho, poṭṭhapāda, mayā anekaṁsiko dhammo desito paññatto.
translation-en-sujato: ‘A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’

root-pli-ms: Kasmā ca te, poṭṭhapāda, mayā anekaṁsikā dhammā desitā paññattā?
translation-en-sujato: And why haven’t I taught and pointed out such things that are not definitive?

root-pli-ms: Na hete, poṭṭhapāda, atthasaṁhitā na dhammasaṁhitā na ādibrahmacariyakā na nibbidāya na virāgāya na nirodhāya na upasamāya na abhiññāya na sambodhāya na nibbānāya saṁvattanti.
translation-en-sujato: Because those things aren’t beneficial or relevant to the fundamentals of the spiritual life. They don’t lead to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.

root-pli-ms: Tasmā te mayā anekaṁsikā dhammā desitā paññattā.
translation-en-sujato: That’s why I haven’t taught and pointed them out.

root-pli-ms: 2.1. Ekaṁsikadhammā
translation-en-sujato: 2.1. Things That Are Definitive

root-pli-ms: Katame ca te, poṭṭhapāda, mayā ekaṁsikā dhammā desitā paññattā?
translation-en-sujato: And what things have I taught and pointed out that are definitive?
reference: dr9.254, ms6D_724, msdiv424, pts-vp-pli1.192, sc40, sya9.237

root-pli-ms: Idaṁ dukkhanti kho, poṭṭhapāda, mayā ekaṁsiko dhammo desito paññatto.
translation-en-sujato: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.”

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ dukkhasamudayoti kho, poṭṭhapāda, mayā ekaṁsiko dhammo desito paññatto.
Ayaṁ dukkhanirodhoti kho, poṭṭhapāda, mayā ekaṁsiko dhammo desito paññatto.
Ayaṁ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadāti kho, poṭṭhapāda, mayā ekaṁsiko dhammo desito paññatto.
Kasmā ca te, poṭṭhapāda, mayā ekaṁsikā dhammā desitā paññattā?
translation-en-sujato: And why have I taught and pointed out such things that are definitive?

root-pli-ms: Ete hi, poṭṭhapāda, atthasaṁhitā, ete dhammasaṁhitā, ete ādibrahmacariyakā ete nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattanti.
translation-en-sujato: Because they are beneficial and relevant to the fundamentals of the spiritual life. They lead to disillusionment, dispassion, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.

root-pli-ms: Tasmā te mayā ekaṁsikā dhammā desitā paññattā.
translation-en-sujato: That’s why I have taught and pointed them out.

root-pli-ms: Santi, poṭṭhapāda, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā evaṁvādino evaṁdiṭṭhino:

root-pli-ms: ‘ekantasukhī attā hoti arogo paraṁ maraṇā’ti.

root-pli-ms: Tyāhaṁ evaṁ vadāmi:

root-pli-ms: Tyāhaṁ evaṁ vadāmi:

root-pli-ms: ‘api pana tumhe āyasmanto jānātha:

root-pli-ms: Iti puṭṭhā ‘no’ti vadanti.

root-pli-ms: “Addhā kho, bhante, evaṁ sante tesaṁ samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṁ appāṭihīrakataṁ bhāsitaṁ sampajjatī”ti.

root-pli-ms: “Seyyathāpi, poṭṭhapāda, puriso evaṁ vadeyya:

translation-en-sujato: ‘Mister, that finest lady in the land who you desire—do you know whether she’s an aristocrat, a brahmin, a merchant, or a worker?’

root-pli-ms: Iti puṭṭho ‘no’ti vadeyya.

root-pli-ms: Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, poṭṭhapāda,

root-pli-ms: nanu evaṁ sante tassa purisassa appāṭihīrakataṁ bhāsitaṁ sampajjatī”ti?

root-pli-ms: 2.2. Tayoattapaṭilābha
translation-en-sujato: 2.2. Three Kinds of Reincarnation

root-pli-ms: “Tayo kho me, poṭṭhapāda, attapaṭilābhā—
translation-en-sujato: “Poṭṭhapāda, there are these three kinds of reincarnation:
comment-en-sujato: Comm: Tattha attapaṭilābhoti attabhāvapaṭilābho, ettha ca bhagavā tīhi attabhāvapaṭilābhehi tayo bhave dassesi

root-pli-ms: oḷāriko attapaṭilābho, manomayo attapaṭilābho, arūpo attapaṭilābho.
translation-en-sujato: a substantial reincarnation, a mind-made reincarnation, and a non-physical reincarnation.

root-pli-ms: Katamo ca, poṭṭhapāda, oḷāriko attapaṭilābho?
translation-en-sujato: And what is a substantial reincarnation?

root-pli-ms: Rūpī cātumahābhūtiko kabaḷīkārāhārabhakkho, ayaṁ oḷāriko attapaṭilābho.
translation-en-sujato: It is physical, made up of the four primary elements, and consumes solid food.

root-pli-ms: Katamo manomayo attapaṭilābho?
translation-en-sujato: What is a mind-made reincarnation?

root-pli-ms: Rūpī manomayo sabbaṅgapaccaṅgī ahīnindriyo, ayaṁ manomayo attapaṭilābho.
translation-en-sujato: It is physical, mind-made, complete in all its various parts, not deficient in any faculty.

root-pli-ms: Katamo arūpo attapaṭilābho?
translation-en-sujato: What is a non-physical reincarnation?

root-pli-ms: Arūpī saññāmayo, ayaṁ arūpo attapaṭilābho.
translation-en-sujato: It is non-physical, made of perception.

root-pli-ms: Oḷārikassapi kho ahaṁ, poṭṭhapāda, attapaṭilābhassa pahānāya dhammaṁ desemi:
translation-en-sujato: I teach the Dhamma for the giving up of these three kinds of reincarnation:

root-pli-ms: ‘yathāpaṭipannānaṁ vo saṅkilesikā dhammā pahīyissanti, vodāniyā dhammā abhivaḍḍhissanti, paññāpāripūriṁ vepullattañca diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharissathā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘When you practice accordingly, corrupting qualities will be given up in you and cleansing qualities will grow. You’ll enter and remain in the fullness and abundance of wisdom, having realized it with your own insight in this very life.’

root-pli-ms: Siyā kho pana te, poṭṭhapāda, evamassa:
translation-en-sujato: Poṭṭhapāda, you might think:

root-pli-ms: ‘saṅkilesikā dhammā pahīyissanti, vodāniyā dhammā abhivaḍḍhissanti, paññāpāripūriṁ vepullattañca diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharissati, dukkho ca kho vihāro’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Corrupting qualities will be given up and cleansing qualities will grow. One will enter and remain in the fullness and abundance of wisdom, having realized it with one’s own insight in this very life. But such a life is suffering.’
comment-en-sujato: I find the syntax of this passage perplexing. Compare the similar sentiment at SN 22.2, which has a much more clear syntax.

root-pli-ms: Na kho panetaṁ, poṭṭhapāda, evaṁ daṭṭhabbaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: But you should not see it like this.

root-pli-ms: Saṅkilesikā ceva dhammā pahīyissanti, vodāniyā ca dhammā abhivaḍḍhissanti, paññāpāripūriṁ vepullattañca diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharissati, pāmujjañceva bhavissati pīti ca passaddhi ca sati ca sampajaññañca sukho ca vihāro.
translation-en-sujato: Corrupting qualities will be given up and cleansing qualities will grow. One will enter and remain in the fullness and abundance of wisdom, having realized it with one’s own insight in this very life. And there will be only joy and happiness, tranquility, mindfulness and awareness. Such a life is blissful.

root-pli-ms: Manomayassapi kho ahaṁ, poṭṭhapāda, attapaṭilābhassa pahānāya dhammaṁ desemi:
‘yathāpaṭipannānaṁ vo saṅkilesikā dhammā pahīyissanti, vodāniyā dhammā abhivaḍḍhissanti, paññāpāripūriṁ vepullattañca diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharissathā’ti.
Siyā kho pana te, poṭṭhapāda, evamassa:
‘saṅkilesikā dhammā pahīyissanti, vodāniyā dhammā abhivaḍḍhissanti, paññāpāripūriṁ vepullattañca diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharissati, dukkho ca kho vihāro’ti.
Na kho panetaṁ, poṭṭhapāda, evaṁ daṭṭhabbaṁ.

Saṅkilesikā ceva dhammā pahīyissanti, vodāniyā ca dhammā abhivaḍḍhissanti, paññāpāripūriṁ vepullattañca diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharissati, pāmujjañceva bhavissati pīti ca passaddhi ca sati ca sampajaññañca sukho ca vihāro.

Pare ce, poṭṭhapāda, amhe evaṁ puccheyyuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: If others should ask us,
reference: bj7.428, ms6D_749, msdiv432, ndp6.164, pts-cs43, sc65

root-pli-ms: ‘katamo pana so, āvuso, oḷāriko attapaṭilābho, yassa tumhe pahānāya dhammaṁ desetha, yathāpaṭipannānaṁ vo saṅkilesikā dhammā pahīyissanti, vodāniyā dhammā abhivaḍḍhissanti, paññāpāripūriṁ vepullattañca diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharissathā’ti, tesaṁ mayaṁ evaṁ puṭṭhā evaṁ byākareyyāma:
translation-en-sujato: ‘But reverends, what is that substantial reincarnation?’ We’d answer like this,

root-pli-ms: ‘ayaṁ vā so, āvuso, oḷāriko attapaṭilābho, yassa mayaṁ pahānāya dhammaṁ desema, yathāpaṭipannānaṁ vo saṅkilesikā dhammā pahīyissanti, vodāniyā dhammā abhivaḍḍhissanti, paññāpāripūriṁ vepullattañca diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharissathā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘This is that substantial reincarnation.’

root-pli-ms: Pare ce, poṭṭhapāda, amhe evaṁ puccheyyuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: If others should ask us,

translation-en-sujato: ‘But reverends, what is that mind-made reincarnation?’ We’d answer like this,

‘ayaṁ vā so, āvuso, manomayo attapaṭilābho yassa mayaṁ pahānāya dhammaṁ desema, yathāpaṭipannānaṁ vo saṅkilesikā dhammā pahīyissanti, vodāniyā dhammā abhivaḍḍhissanti, paññāpāripūriṁ vepullattañca diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharissathā’ti.

root-pli-ms: ‘katamo pana so, āvuso, arūpo attapaṭilābho, yassa tumhe pahānāya dhammaṁ desetha, yathāpaṭipannānaṁ vo saṅkilesikā dhammā pahīyissanti, vodāniyā dhammā abhivaḍḍhissanti, paññāpāripūriṁ vepullattañca diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharissathā’ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘But reverends, what is that non-physical reincarnation?’ We’d answer like this,

root-pli-ms: Tesaṁ mayaṁ evaṁ puṭṭhā evaṁ byākareyyāma:

‘ayaṁ vā so, āvuso, arūpo attapaṭilābho yassa mayaṁ pahānāya dhammaṁ desema, yathāpaṭipannānaṁ vo saṅkilesikā dhammā pahīyissanti, vodāniyā dhammā abhivaḍḍhissanti, paññāpāripūriṁ vepullattañca diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharissathā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘This is that non-physical reincarnation.’

root-pli-ms: Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, poṭṭhapāda,
translation-en-sujato: What do you think, Poṭṭhapāda?
comment-en-sujato: This whole argument is odd, and I suspect it is corrupt.

root-pli-ms: nanu evaṁ sante sappāṭihīrakataṁ bhāsitaṁ sampajjatī”ti?
translation-en-sujato: This being so, doesn’t that statement turn out to have a demonstrable basis?”

root-pli-ms: “Addhā kho, bhante, evaṁ sante sappāṭihīrakataṁ bhāsitaṁ sampajjatī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Clearly that’s the case, sir.”

root-pli-ms: “Seyyathāpi, poṭṭhapāda, puriso nisseṇiṁ kareyya pāsādassa ārohaṇāya tasseva pāsādassa heṭṭhā.
translation-en-sujato: “Suppose a man were to build a ladder for climbing up to a stilt longhouse right underneath that longhouse.
reference: km15.150, ms6D_753, msdiv435, ndp6.165, pts-cs46, sc69

root-pli-ms: Tamenaṁ evaṁ vadeyyuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: They’d say to him,

root-pli-ms: ‘ambho purisa, yassa tvaṁ pāsādassa ārohaṇāya nisseṇiṁ karosi, jānāsi taṁ pāsādaṁ, puratthimāya vā disāya dakkhiṇāya vā disāya pacchimāya vā disāya uttarāya vā disāya ucco vā nīco vā majjhimo vā’ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘Mister, that stilt longhouse that you’re building a ladder for—do you know whether it’s to the north, south, east, or west? Or whether it’s tall or short or medium?’

root-pli-ms: So evaṁ vadeyya:
translation-en-sujato: He’d say,

root-pli-ms: ‘ayaṁ vā so, āvuso, pāsādo, yassāhaṁ ārohaṇāya nisseṇiṁ karomi, tasseva pāsādassa heṭṭhā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘This is that stilt longhouse for which I’m building a ladder, right underneath it.’

root-pli-ms: Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, poṭṭhapāda,
translation-en-sujato: What do you think, Poṭṭhapāda?

root-pli-ms: nanu evaṁ sante tassa purisassa sappāṭihīrakataṁ bhāsitaṁ sampajjatī”ti?
translation-en-sujato: This being so, doesn’t that man’s statement turn out to have a demonstrable basis?”

root-pli-ms: “Addhā kho, bhante, evaṁ sante tassa purisassa sappāṭihīrakataṁ bhāsitaṁ sampajjatī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Clearly that’s the case, sir.”

“Addhā kho, bhante, evaṁ sante sappāṭihīrakataṁ bhāsitaṁ sampajjatī”ti.

translation-en-sujato: While in a mind-made reincarnation, it’s not referred to as a substantial or non-physical reincarnation,

translation-en-sujato: only as a mind-made reincarnation.

translation-en-sujato: While in a non-physical reincarnation, it’s not referred to as a substantial or mind-made reincarnation,

root-pli-ms: arūpo attapaṭilābhotveva tasmiṁ samaye saṅkhaṁ gacchati.
translation-en-sujato: only as a non-physical reincarnation.

root-pli-ms: ‘ahosi tvaṁ atītamaddhānaṁ, na tvaṁ nāhosi;

root-pli-ms: “Sace maṁ, bhante, evaṁ puccheyyuṁ:

root-pli-ms: ‘ahosi tvaṁ atītamaddhānaṁ, na tvaṁ na ahosi;
bhavissasi tvaṁ anāgatamaddhānaṁ, na tvaṁ na bhavissasi;
atthi tvaṁ etarahi, na tvaṁ natthī’ti.
Evaṁ puṭṭho ahaṁ, bhante, evaṁ byākareyyaṁ:
translation-en-sujato: I’d answer like this,

root-pli-ms: ‘ahosāhaṁ atītamaddhānaṁ, nāhaṁ na ahosiṁ;
translation-en-sujato: ‘I existed in the past.

root-pli-ms: bhavissāmahaṁ anāgatamaddhānaṁ, nāhaṁ na bhavissāmi;
translation-en-sujato: I will exist in the future.

root-pli-ms: atthāhaṁ etarahi, nāhaṁ natthī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: I exist now.’

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ puṭṭho ahaṁ, bhante, evaṁ byākareyyan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: That’s how I’d answer.”

root-pli-ms: “Sace pana taṁ, citta, evaṁ puccheyyuṁ:

translation-en-sujato: ‘Is the reincarnation you had in the past your only real one, and those of the future and present fictitious?

translation-en-sujato: Is the reincarnation you have now your only real one, and those of the past and future fictitious?’

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ puṭṭho tvaṁ, citta, kinti byākareyyāsī”ti?

Yo te bhavissati anāgato attapaṭilābho, sova te attapaṭilābho sacco, mogho atīto, mogho paccuppanno.

translation-en-sujato: ‘The reincarnation I had in the past was real at that time, and those of the future and present fictitious.

root-pli-ms: Yo me bhavissati anāgato attapaṭilābho, sova me attapaṭilābho tasmiṁ samaye sacco bhavissati, mogho atīto, mogho paccuppanno.

translation-en-sujato: The reincarnation I have now is real at this time, and those of the past and future fictitious.’

translation-en-sujato: That’s how I’d answer.”

root-pli-ms: “Evameva kho, citta, yasmiṁ samaye oḷāriko attapaṭilābho hoti, neva tasmiṁ samaye manomayo attapaṭilābhoti saṅkhaṁ gacchati, na arūpo attapaṭilābhoti saṅkhaṁ gacchati.
translation-en-sujato: “In the same way, while in any one of the three reincarnations, it’s not referred to as the other two, only under its own name.

root-pli-ms: Oḷāriko attapaṭilābhotveva tasmiṁ samaye saṅkhaṁ gacchati.
Yasmiṁ, citta, samaye manomayo attapaṭilābho hoti …pe…
yasmiṁ, citta, samaye arūpo attapaṭilābho hoti, neva tasmiṁ samaye oḷāriko attapaṭilābhoti saṅkhaṁ gacchati, na manomayo attapaṭilābhoti saṅkhaṁ gacchati;
arūpo attapaṭilābhotveva tasmiṁ samaye saṅkhaṁ gacchati.
Seyyathāpi, citta, gavā khīraṁ, khīramhā dadhi, dadhimhā navanītaṁ, navanītamhā sappi, sappimhā sappimaṇḍo.
translation-en-sujato: From a cow comes milk, from milk comes curds, from curds come butter, from butter comes ghee, and from ghee comes cream of ghee. And the cream of ghee is said to be the best of these.

root-pli-ms: Yasmiṁ samaye khīraṁ hoti, neva tasmiṁ samaye dadhīti saṅkhaṁ gacchati, na navanītanti saṅkhaṁ gacchati, na sappīti saṅkhaṁ gacchati, na sappimaṇḍoti saṅkhaṁ gacchati;
translation-en-sujato: While it’s milk, it’s not referred to as curds, butter, ghee, or cream of ghee.

root-pli-ms: khīrantveva tasmiṁ samaye saṅkhaṁ gacchati.
translation-en-sujato: It’s only referred to as milk.

root-pli-ms: Yasmiṁ samaye dadhi hoti …pe…
translation-en-sujato: While it’s curd

root-pli-ms: navanītaṁ hoti …
translation-en-sujato: or butter

root-pli-ms: sappi hoti …
translation-en-sujato: or ghee

root-pli-ms: sappimaṇḍo hoti, neva tasmiṁ samaye khīranti saṅkhaṁ gacchati, na dadhīti saṅkhaṁ gacchati, na navanītanti saṅkhaṁ gacchati, na sappīti saṅkhaṁ gacchati;
translation-en-sujato: or cream of ghee, it’s not referred to as anything else,

root-pli-ms: sappimaṇḍotveva tasmiṁ samaye saṅkhaṁ gacchati.
translation-en-sujato: only under its own name.

root-pli-ms: Evameva kho, citta, yasmiṁ samaye oḷāriko attapaṭilābho hoti …pe…
translation-en-sujato: In the same way, while in any one of the three reincarnations, it’s not referred to as the other two, only under its own name.

root-pli-ms: yasmiṁ, citta, samaye manomayo attapaṭilābho hoti …pe…
yasmiṁ, citta, samaye arūpo attapaṭilābho hoti, neva tasmiṁ samaye oḷāriko attapaṭilābhoti saṅkhaṁ gacchati, na manomayo attapaṭilābhoti saṅkhaṁ gacchati;
arūpo attapaṭilābhotveva tasmiṁ samaye saṅkhaṁ gacchati.
Imā kho, citta, lokasamaññā lokaniruttiyo lokavohārā lokapaññattiyo, yāhi tathāgato voharati aparāmasan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: These are the world’s usages, terms, expressions, and descriptions, which the Realized One uses without misapprehending them.”

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vutte, poṭṭhapādo paribbājako bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: When he had spoken, the wanderer Poṭṭhapāda said to the Buddha,
reference: km15.158, ms6D_765, msdiv441, ndp6.168, pts-cs54, sc81

root-pli-ms: “abhikkantaṁ, bhante, abhikkantaṁ, bhante.
translation-en-sujato: “Excellent, sir! Excellent!

root-pli-ms: Seyyathāpi, bhante, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṁ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṁ dhāreyya: ‘cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī’ti; evamevaṁ bhagavatā anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
translation-en-sujato: As if he were righting the overturned, or revealing the hidden, or pointing out the path to the lost, or lighting a lamp in the dark so people with good eyes can see what’s there, so too the Buddha has made the teaching clear in many ways.

root-pli-ms: Esāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavantaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
translation-en-sujato: I go for refuge to the Buddha, to the teaching, and to the mendicant Saṅgha.

root-pli-ms: Upāsakaṁ maṁ bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gatan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: From this day forth, may the Buddha remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”

translation-en-sujato: As if he were righting the overturned, or revealing the hidden, or pointing out the path to the lost, or lighting a lamp in the dark so people with good eyes can see what’s there, so too the Buddha has made the teaching clear in many ways.
