translation-en-sujato: Sir, may I receive the going forth, the ordination in the Buddha’s presence?”

root-pli-ms: Alattha kho citto hatthisāriputto bhagavato santike pabbajjaṁ, alattha upasampadaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: And Citta Hatthisāriputta received the going forth, the ordination in the Buddha’s presence.
reference: dr9.268, km15.159, mc9.196, ms6D_767, msdiv443, pts-cs56, pts-vp-pli1.203, sc83

root-pli-ms: Acirūpasampanno kho panāyasmā citto hatthisāriputto eko vūpakaṭṭho appamatto ātāpī pahitatto viharanto na cirasseva—yassatthāya kulaputtā sammadeva agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajanti, tadanuttaraṁ—brahmacariyapariyosānaṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihāsi.
translation-en-sujato: Not long after his ordination, Venerable Citta Hatthisāriputta, living alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and resolute, soon realized the supreme end of the spiritual path in this very life. He lived having achieved with his own insight the goal for which gentlemen rightly go forth from the lay life to homelessness.

root-pli-ms: “khīṇā jāti, vusitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ, kataṁ karaṇīyaṁ, nāparaṁ itthAttāyā”ti abbhaññāsi.
translation-en-sujato: He understood: “Rebirth is ended; the spiritual journey has been completed; what had to be done has been done; there is no return to any state of existence.”

root-pli-ms: Aññataro kho panāyasmā citto hatthisāriputto arahataṁ ahosīti.
translation-en-sujato: And Venerable Citta Hatthisāriputta became one of the perfected.
comment-en-sujato: Not without some wavering, according to AN 6.60

root-pli-ms: Poṭṭhapādasuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ navamaṁ.
Dīgha Nikāya 11
translation-en-sujato: Long Discourses 11

root-pli-ms: Kevaṭṭasutta
translation-en-sujato: With Kevaddha

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
translation-en-sujato: So I have heard.

root-pli-ms: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā nāḷandāyaṁ viharati pāvārikambavane.
translation-en-sujato: At one time the Buddha was staying near Nālandā in Pāvārika’s mango grove.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho kevaṭṭo gahapatiputto yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho kevaṭṭo gahapatiputto bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: Then the householder Kevaddha went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him,

root-pli-ms: “ayaṁ, bhante, nāḷandā iddhā ceva phītā ca bahujanā ākiṇṇamanussā bhagavati abhippasannā.
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, this Nāḷandā is successful and prosperous and full of people.

root-pli-ms: Sādhu, bhante, bhagavā ekaṁ bhikkhuṁ samādisatu, yo uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ karissati;
translation-en-sujato: Sir, please direct a mendicant to perform a demonstration of superhuman psychic power.

root-pli-ms: evāyaṁ nāḷandā bhiyyoso mattāya bhagavati abhippasīdissatī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Then Nāḷandā will become even more devoted to the Buddha!”

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vutte, bhagavā kevaṭṭaṁ gahapatiputtaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: When he said this, The Buddha said,

root-pli-ms: “na kho ahaṁ, kevaṭṭa, bhikkhūnaṁ evaṁ dhammaṁ desemi:
translation-en-sujato: “Kevaddha, I do not teach the mendicants like this:

root-pli-ms: ‘etha tumhe, bhikkhave, gihīnaṁ odātavasanānaṁ uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ karothā’”ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Come now, mendicants, perform a demonstration of superhuman psychic power for the white-clothed laypeople.’”

root-pli-ms: Dutiyampi kho kevaṭṭo gahapatiputto bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: For a second time, Kevaddha made the same request,
reference: km15.202, ms6D_828, msdiv482, pts-cs2, pts-vp-pli1.212, sc2

root-pli-ms: “nāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavantaṁ dhaṁsemi;
api ca evaṁ vadāmi:
‘ayaṁ, bhante, nāḷandā iddhā ceva phītā ca bahujanā ākiṇṇamanussā bhagavati abhippasannā.
Sādhu, bhante, bhagavā ekaṁ bhikkhuṁ samādisatu, yo uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ karissati;
evāyaṁ nāḷandā bhiyyoso mattāya bhagavati abhippasīdissatī’”ti.
Dutiyampi kho bhagavā kevaṭṭaṁ gahapatiputtaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: and the Buddha gave the same answer.

root-pli-ms: “na kho ahaṁ, kevaṭṭa, bhikkhūnaṁ evaṁ dhammaṁ desemi:
‘etha tumhe, bhikkhave, gihīnaṁ odātavasanānaṁ uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ karothā’”ti.
Tatiyampi kho kevaṭṭo gahapatiputto bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: For a third time, Kevaddha made the same request,

root-pli-ms: “nāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavantaṁ dhaṁsemi;
api ca evaṁ vadāmi:
‘ayaṁ, bhante, nāḷandā iddhā ceva phītā ca bahujanā ākiṇṇamanussā bhagavati abhippasannā.
Sādhu, bhante, bhagavā ekaṁ bhikkhuṁ samādisatu, yo uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ karissati.
Evāyaṁ nāḷandā bhiyyoso mattāya bhagavati abhippasīdissatī’”ti.
translation-en-sujato: and the Buddha said the following.

root-pli-ms: 1. Iddhipāṭihāriya
translation-en-sujato: 1. The Demonstration of Psychic Power

root-pli-ms: “Tīṇi kho imāni, kevaṭṭa, pāṭihāriyāni mayā sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā paveditāni.
translation-en-sujato: “Kevaddha, there are three kinds of demonstration, which I declare having realized them with my own insight.

root-pli-ms: Katamāni tīṇi?
translation-en-sujato: What three?

root-pli-ms: Iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ, ādesanāpāṭihāriyaṁ, anusāsanīpāṭihāriyaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: The demonstration of psychic power, the demonstration of revealing, and the demonstration of instruction.

root-pli-ms: Katamañca, kevaṭṭa, iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ?
translation-en-sujato: And what is the demonstration of psychic power?

root-pli-ms: Idha, kevaṭṭa, bhikkhu anekavihitaṁ iddhividhaṁ paccanubhoti—ekopi hutvā bahudhā hoti, bahudhāpi hutvā eko hoti; āvibhāvaṁ tirobhāvaṁ tirokuṭṭaṁ tiropākāraṁ tiropabbataṁ asajjamāno gacchati seyyathāpi ākāse; pathaviyāpi ummujjanimujjaṁ karoti seyyathāpi udake; udakepi abhijjamāne gacchati seyyathāpi pathaviyaṁ; ākāsepi pallaṅkena kamati seyyathāpi pakkhī sakuṇo; imepi candimasūriye evaṁ mahiddhike evaṁ mahānubhāve pāṇinā parāmasati parimajjati; yāva brahmalokāpi kāyena vasaṁ vatteti.
translation-en-sujato: It’s a mendicant who wields the many kinds of psychic power: multiplying themselves and becoming one again; going unimpeded through a wall, a rampart, or a mountain as if through space; diving in and out of the earth as if it were water; walking on water as if it were earth; flying cross-legged through the sky like a bird; touching and stroking with the hand the sun and moon, so mighty and powerful; controlling the body as far as the Brahmā realm.

root-pli-ms: Tamenaṁ aññataro saddho pasanno passati taṁ bhikkhuṁ anekavihitaṁ iddhividhaṁ paccanubhontaṁ—ekopi hutvā bahudhā hontaṁ, bahudhāpi hutvā eko hontaṁ; āvibhāvaṁ tirobhāvaṁ; tirokuṭṭaṁ tiropākāraṁ tiropabbataṁ asajjamānaṁ gacchantaṁ seyyathāpi ākāse; pathaviyāpi ummujjanimujjaṁ karontaṁ seyyathāpi udake; udakepi abhijjamāne gacchantaṁ seyyathāpi pathaviyaṁ; ākāsepi pallaṅkena kamantaṁ seyyathāpi pakkhī sakuṇo; imepi candimasūriye evaṁ mahiddhike evaṁ mahānubhāve pāṇinā parāmasantaṁ parimajjantaṁ yāva brahmalokāpi kāyena vasaṁ vattentaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Then someone with faith and confidence sees that mendicant performing those superhuman feats.

root-pli-ms: Tamenaṁ so saddho pasanno aññatarassa assaddhassa appasannassa āroceti:
translation-en-sujato: They tell someone else who lacks faith and confidence:

root-pli-ms: ‘acchariyaṁ vata bho, abbhutaṁ vata bho, samaṇassa mahiddhikatā mahānubhāvatā.
translation-en-sujato: ‘It’s incredible, it’s amazing! The ascetic has such psychic power and might!

root-pli-ms: Amāhaṁ bhikkhuṁ addasaṁ anekavihitaṁ iddhividhaṁ paccanubhontaṁ—ekopi hutvā bahudhā hontaṁ, bahudhāpi hutvā eko hontaṁ …pe… yāva brahmalokāpi kāyena vasaṁ vattentan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: I saw him myself, performing all these superhuman feats!’

root-pli-ms: Tamenaṁ so assaddho appasanno taṁ saddhaṁ pasannaṁ evaṁ vadeyya:
translation-en-sujato: But the one lacking faith and confidence would say to them:

root-pli-ms: ‘atthi kho, bho, gandhārī nāma vijjā.
translation-en-sujato: ‘There’s a spell named Gandhārī.

root-pli-ms: Tāya so bhikkhu anekavihitaṁ iddhividhaṁ paccanubhoti—ekopi hutvā bahudhā hoti, bahudhāpi hutvā eko hoti …pe… yāva brahmalokāpi kāyena vasaṁ vattetī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: Using that a mendicant can perform such superhuman feats.’

root-pli-ms: Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, kevaṭṭa,
translation-en-sujato: What do you think, Kevaddha?

root-pli-ms: api nu so assaddho appasanno taṁ saddhaṁ pasannaṁ evaṁ vadeyyā”ti?
translation-en-sujato: Wouldn’t someone lacking faith speak like that?”

root-pli-ms: “Vadeyya, bhante”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “They would, sir.”

root-pli-ms: “Imaṁ kho ahaṁ, kevaṭṭa, iddhipāṭihāriye ādīnavaṁ sampassamāno iddhipāṭihāriyena aṭṭīyāmi harāyāmi jigucchāmi.
translation-en-sujato: “Seeing this drawback in psychic power, I’m horrified, repelled, and disgusted by demonstrations of psychic power.

root-pli-ms: 2. Ādesanāpāṭihāriya
translation-en-sujato: 2. The Demonstration of Revealing

root-pli-ms: Katamañca, kevaṭṭa, ādesanāpāṭihāriyaṁ?
translation-en-sujato: And what is the demonstration of revealing?
reference: bj7.488, dr9.296, ms6D_836, msdiv485, ndp6.185, pts-cs6, sc10

root-pli-ms: Idha, kevaṭṭa, bhikkhu parasattānaṁ parapuggalānaṁ cittampi ādisati, cetasikampi ādisati, vitakkitampi ādisati, vicāritampi ādisati:
translation-en-sujato: In one case, someone reveals the mind, mentality, thoughts, and reflections of other beings and individuals:

root-pli-ms: ‘evampi te mano, itthampi te mano, itipi te cittan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘This is what you’re thinking, such is your thought, and thus is your state of mind.’

root-pli-ms: Tamenaṁ aññataro saddho pasanno passati taṁ bhikkhuṁ parasattānaṁ parapuggalānaṁ cittampi ādisantaṁ, cetasikampi ādisantaṁ, vitakkitampi ādisantaṁ, vicāritampi ādisantaṁ:
translation-en-sujato: Then someone with faith and confidence sees that mendicant revealing another person’s thoughts.

root-pli-ms: ‘evampi te mano, itthampi te mano, itipi te cittan’ti.
Tamenaṁ so saddho pasanno aññatarassa assaddhassa appasannassa āroceti:
translation-en-sujato: They tell someone else who lacks faith and confidence:

root-pli-ms: ‘acchariyaṁ vata bho, abbhutaṁ vata bho, samaṇassa mahiddhikatā mahānubhāvatā.
translation-en-sujato: ‘It’s incredible, it’s amazing! The ascetic has such psychic power and might!

root-pli-ms: Amāhaṁ bhikkhuṁ addasaṁ parasattānaṁ parapuggalānaṁ cittampi ādisantaṁ, cetasikampi ādisantaṁ, vitakkitampi ādisantaṁ, vicāritampi ādisantaṁ:
translation-en-sujato: I saw him myself, revealing the thoughts of another person!’

root-pli-ms: “evampi te mano, itthampi te mano, itipi te cittan”’ti.
Tamenaṁ so assaddho appasanno taṁ saddhaṁ pasannaṁ evaṁ vadeyya:
translation-en-sujato: But the one lacking faith and confidence would say to them:

root-pli-ms: ‘atthi kho, bho, maṇikā nāma vijjā;
translation-en-sujato: ‘There’s a spell named Māṇikā.

root-pli-ms: tāya so bhikkhu parasattānaṁ parapuggalānaṁ cittampi ādisati, cetasikampi ādisati, vitakkitampi ādisati, vicāritampi ādisati:
translation-en-sujato: Using that a mendicant can reveal another person’s thoughts.’

root-pli-ms: “evampi te mano, itthampi te mano, itipi te cittan”’ti.
Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, kevaṭṭa,
translation-en-sujato: What do you think, Kevaddha?

root-pli-ms: api nu so assaddho appasanno taṁ saddhaṁ pasannaṁ evaṁ vadeyyā”ti?
translation-en-sujato: Wouldn’t someone lacking faith speak like that?”

root-pli-ms: “Vadeyya, bhante”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “They would, sir.”

root-pli-ms: “Imaṁ kho ahaṁ, kevaṭṭa, ādesanāpāṭihāriye ādīnavaṁ sampassamāno ādesanāpāṭihāriyena aṭṭīyāmi harāyāmi jigucchāmi.
translation-en-sujato: “Seeing this drawback in psychic power, I’m horrified, repelled, and disgusted by demonstrations of psychic power.

root-pli-ms: 3. Anusāsanīpāṭihāriya
translation-en-sujato: 3. The Demonstration of Instruction

root-pli-ms: Katamañca, kevaṭṭa, anusāsanīpāṭihāriyaṁ?
translation-en-sujato: And what is the demonstration of instruction?
reference: csp1ed6.208, csp2ed6.208, dr9.297, mc9.218, ms6D_840, msdiv486, pts-cs8, sc14

root-pli-ms: Idha, kevaṭṭa, bhikkhu evamanusāsati:
translation-en-sujato: It’s when a mendicant instructs others like this:

root-pli-ms: ‘evaṁ vitakketha, mā evaṁ vitakkayittha, evaṁ manasikarotha, mā evaṁ manasākattha, idaṁ pajahatha, idaṁ upasampajja viharathā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Think like this, not like that. Focus your mind like this, not like that. Give up this, and live having achieved that.’

root-pli-ms: Idaṁ vuccati, kevaṭṭa, anusāsanīpāṭihāriyaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: This is called the demonstration of instruction.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, kevaṭṭa, idha tathāgato loke uppajjati arahaṁ sammāsambuddho …pe…
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, a Realized One arises in the world …

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ kho, kevaṭṭa, bhikkhu sīlasampanno hoti …pe…
translation-en-sujato: That’s how a mendicant is accomplished in ethics. …

root-pli-ms: paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati.
translation-en-sujato: They enter and remain in the first absorption …

root-pli-ms: Idampi vuccati, kevaṭṭa, anusāsanīpāṭihāriyaṁ …pe…
translation-en-sujato: This is called the demonstration of instruction.

root-pli-ms: dutiyaṁ jhānaṁ …pe…
translation-en-sujato: They enter and remain in the second absorption …

root-pli-ms: tatiyaṁ jhānaṁ …pe…
translation-en-sujato: third absorption …

root-pli-ms: catutthaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati.
translation-en-sujato: fourth absorption.

root-pli-ms: Idampi vuccati, kevaṭṭa, anusāsanīpāṭihāriyaṁ …pe…
translation-en-sujato: This too is called the demonstration of instruction.

root-pli-ms: ñāṇadassanāya cittaṁ abhinīharati abhininnāmeti …pe…
translation-en-sujato: They extend and project the mind toward knowledge and vision …

root-pli-ms: idampi vuccati, kevaṭṭa, anusāsanīpāṭihāriyaṁ …pe…
translation-en-sujato: This too is called the demonstration of instruction.

root-pli-ms: nāparaṁ itthattāyāti pajānāti …pe…
translation-en-sujato: They understand: ‘… there is no return to any state of existence.’

root-pli-ms: idampi vuccati, kevaṭṭa, anusāsanīpāṭihāriyaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: This too is called the demonstration of instruction.

root-pli-ms: Imāni kho, kevaṭṭa, tīṇi pāṭihāriyāni mayā sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā paveditāni.
translation-en-sujato: These, Kevaddha, are the three kinds of demonstration, which I declare having realized them with my own insight.

root-pli-ms: 4. Bhūtanirodhesakabhikkhuvatthu
translation-en-sujato: 4. On the Mendicant In Search of the Cessation of Being

root-pli-ms: Bhūtapubbaṁ, kevaṭṭa, imasmiññeva bhikkhusaṅghe aññatarassa bhikkhuno evaṁ cetaso parivitakko udapādi:
translation-en-sujato: Once it so happened, Kevaddha, that a mendicant in this very Saṅgha had the following thought,

root-pli-ms: ‘kattha nu kho ime cattāro mahābhūtā aparisesā nirujjhanti, seyyathidaṁ—pathavīdhātu āpodhātu tejodhātu vāyodhātū’ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘Where do these four primary elements cease without anything left over, namely, the elements of earth, water, fire, and air?’

root-pli-ms: Atha kho so, kevaṭṭa, bhikkhu tathārūpaṁ samādhiṁ samāpajji, yathāsamāhite citte devayāniyo maggo pāturahosi.
translation-en-sujato: Then that mendicant attained a state of immersion such that a path to the gods appeared.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho so, kevaṭṭa, bhikkhu yena cātumahārājikā devā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā cātumahārājike deve etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: Then he approached the Gods of the Four Great Kings and said,

root-pli-ms: ‘kattha nu kho, āvuso, ime cattāro mahābhūtā aparisesā nirujjhanti, seyyathidaṁ—pathavīdhātu āpodhātu tejodhātu vāyodhātū’ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘Reverends, where do these four primary elements cease without anything left over, namely, the elements of earth, water, fire, and air?’

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vutte, kevaṭṭa, cātumahārājikā devā taṁ bhikkhuṁ etadavocuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: When he said this, those gods said to him,
reference: cck9.280, csp1ed6.209, csp2ed6.209, mc9.219, ms6D_845, pts-vp-pli1.216, sc19

root-pli-ms: ‘mayampi kho, bhikkhu, na jānāma:
translation-en-sujato: ‘Mendicant, we too do not know this.

root-pli-ms: “yatthime cattāro mahābhūtā aparisesā nirujjhanti, seyyathidaṁ—pathavīdhātu āpodhātu tejodhātu vāyodhātū”ti.
Atthi kho, bhikkhu, cattāro mahārājāno amhehi abhikkantatarā ca paṇītatarā ca.
translation-en-sujato: But the Four Great Kings are our superiors.

root-pli-ms: Te kho etaṁ jāneyyuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: They might know.’

root-pli-ms: “yatthime cattāro mahābhūtā aparisesā nirujjhanti, seyyathidaṁ—pathavīdhātu āpodhātu tejodhātu vāyodhātū”’ti.
Atha kho so, kevaṭṭa, bhikkhu yena cattāro mahārājāno tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā cattāro mahārāje etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: Then he approached the Four Great Kings and asked the same question.

root-pli-ms: ‘kattha nu kho, āvuso, ime cattāro mahābhūtā aparisesā nirujjhanti, seyyathidaṁ—pathavīdhātu āpodhātu tejodhātu vāyodhātū’ti?
Evaṁ vutte, kevaṭṭa, cattāro mahārājāno taṁ bhikkhuṁ etadavocuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: But they also said to him,

root-pli-ms: ‘mayampi kho, bhikkhu, na jānāma:
translation-en-sujato: ‘Mendicant, we too do not know this.

root-pli-ms: “yatthime cattāro mahābhūtā aparisesā nirujjhanti, seyyathidaṁ—pathavīdhātu, āpodhātu tejodhātu vāyodhātū”ti.
Atthi kho, bhikkhu, tāvatiṁsā nāma devā amhehi abhikkantatarā ca paṇītatarā ca.
translation-en-sujato: But the gods of the Thirty-Three …

root-pli-ms: Te kho etaṁ jāneyyuṁ:
“yatthime cattāro mahābhūtā aparisesā nirujjhanti, seyyathidaṁ—pathavīdhātu āpodhātu tejodhātu vāyodhātū”’ti.
Atha kho so, kevaṭṭa, bhikkhu yena tāvatiṁsā devā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā tāvatiṁse deve etadavoca:
‘kattha nu kho, āvuso, ime cattāro mahābhūtā aparisesā nirujjhanti, seyyathidaṁ—pathavīdhātu āpodhātu tejodhātu vāyodhātū’ti?
Evaṁ vutte, kevaṭṭa, tāvatiṁsā devā taṁ bhikkhuṁ etadavocuṁ:
‘mayampi kho, bhikkhu, na jānāma:
“yatthime cattāro mahābhūtā aparisesā nirujjhanti, seyyathidaṁ—pathavīdhātu āpodhātu tejodhātu vāyodhātū”ti.
Atthi kho, bhikkhu, sakko nāma devānamindo amhehi abhikkantataro ca paṇītataro ca.
translation-en-sujato: Sakka, lord of gods …

root-pli-ms: So kho etaṁ jāneyya:
“yatthime cattāro mahābhūtā aparisesā nirujjhanti, seyyathidaṁ—pathavīdhātu āpodhātu tejodhātu vāyodhātū”’ti.
Atha kho so, kevaṭṭa, bhikkhu yena sakko devānamindo tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā sakkaṁ devānamindaṁ etadavoca:
‘kattha nu kho, āvuso, ime cattāro mahābhūtā aparisesā nirujjhanti, seyyathidaṁ—pathavīdhātu āpodhātu tejodhātu vāyodhātū’ti?
Evaṁ vutte, kevaṭṭa, sakko devānamindo taṁ bhikkhuṁ etadavoca:
‘ahampi kho, bhikkhu, na jānāmi:
“yatthime cattāro mahābhūtā aparisesā nirujjhanti, seyyathidaṁ—pathavīdhātu āpodhātu tejodhātu vāyodhātū”ti.
Atthi kho, bhikkhu, yāmā nāma devā …pe…
translation-en-sujato: the gods of Yāmā …

root-pli-ms: suyāmo nāma devaputto …
translation-en-sujato: the god named Suyāma …

root-pli-ms: tusitā nāma devā …
translation-en-sujato: the Joyful gods …

root-pli-ms: santussito nāma devaputto …
translation-en-sujato: the god named Santussita …

root-pli-ms: nimmānaratī nāma devā …
translation-en-sujato: the gods who delight in creation …

root-pli-ms: sunimmito nāma devaputto …
translation-en-sujato: the god named Sunimmita …

root-pli-ms: paranimmitavasavattī nāma devā …
translation-en-sujato: the gods who control the creation of others …

root-pli-ms: vasavattī nāma devaputto amhehi abhikkantataro ca paṇītataro ca.
translation-en-sujato: the god named Vasavattī …

root-pli-ms: So kho etaṁ jāneyya:
“yatthime cattāro mahābhūtā aparisesā nirujjhanti, seyyathidaṁ—pathavīdhātu āpodhātu tejodhātu vāyodhātū”’ti.
Atha kho so, kevaṭṭa, bhikkhu yena vasavattī devaputto tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā vasavattiṁ devaputtaṁ etadavoca:
reference: dr9.300, km15.213, ms6D_849, msdiv492, pts-cs79, pts-vp-pli1.220, sc23, vri1.201

root-pli-ms: ‘kattha nu kho, āvuso, ime cattāro mahābhūtā aparisesā nirujjhanti, seyyathidaṁ—pathavīdhātu āpodhātu tejodhātu vāyodhātū’ti?
Evaṁ vutte, kevaṭṭa, vasavattī devaputto taṁ bhikkhuṁ etadavoca:
‘ahampi kho, bhikkhu, na jānāmi:
“yatthime cattāro mahābhūtā aparisesā nirujjhanti, seyyathidaṁ—pathavīdhātu āpodhātu tejodhātu vāyodhātū”ti.
Atthi kho, bhikkhu, brahmakāyikā nāma devā amhehi abhikkantatarā ca paṇītatarā ca.
translation-en-sujato: the gods of Brahmā’s Host.

root-pli-ms: Te kho etaṁ jāneyyuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: They might know.’

root-pli-ms: “yatthime cattāro mahābhūtā aparisesā nirujjhanti, seyyathidaṁ—pathavīdhātu āpodhātu tejodhātu vāyodhātū”’ti.
Atha kho so, kevaṭṭa, bhikkhu tathārūpaṁ samādhiṁ samāpajji, yathāsamāhite citte brahmayāniyo maggo pāturahosi.
translation-en-sujato: Then that mendicant attained a state of immersion such that a path to Brahmā appeared.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho so, kevaṭṭa, bhikkhu yena brahmakāyikā devā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā brahmakāyike deve etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: Then he approached those gods and said,

root-pli-ms: ‘kattha nu kho, āvuso, ime cattāro mahābhūtā aparisesā nirujjhanti, seyyathidaṁ—pathavīdhātu āpodhātu tejodhātu vāyodhātū’ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘Reverends, where do these four primary elements cease without anything left over, namely, the elements of earth, water, fire, and air?’

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vutte, kevaṭṭa, brahmakāyikā devā taṁ bhikkhuṁ etadavocuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: But they also said to him,

root-pli-ms: ‘mayampi kho, bhikkhu, na jānāma:
translation-en-sujato: ‘Mendicant, we too do not know this.

root-pli-ms: “yatthime cattāro mahābhūtā aparisesā nirujjhanti, seyyathidaṁ—pathavīdhātu āpodhātu tejodhātu vāyodhātū”ti.
Atthi kho, bhikkhu, brahmā mahābrahmā abhibhū anabhibhūto aññadatthudaso vasavattī issaro kattā nimmātā seṭṭho sajitā vasī pitā bhūtabhabyānaṁ amhehi abhikkantataro ca paṇītataro ca.
translation-en-sujato: But there is Brahmā, the Great Brahmā, the Undefeated, the Champion, the Universal Seer, the Wielder of Power, the Lord God, the Maker, the Author, the Best, the Begetter, the Controller, the Father of those who have been born and those yet to be born. He is our superior.

root-pli-ms: So kho etaṁ jāneyya:
translation-en-sujato: He might know.’

root-pli-ms: “yatthime cattāro mahābhūtā aparisesā nirujjhanti, seyyathidaṁ—pathavīdhātu āpodhātu tejodhātu vāyodhātū”’ti.
‘Kahaṁ panāvuso, etarahi so mahābrahmā’ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘But reverends, where is that Brahmā now?’

root-pli-ms: ‘Mayampi kho, bhikkhu, na jānāma, yattha vā brahmā yena vā brahmā yahiṁ vā brahmā;
translation-en-sujato: ‘We also don’t know where he is or what way he lies.

root-pli-ms: api ca, bhikkhu, yathā nimittā dissanti, āloko sañjāyati, obhāso pātubhavati, brahmā pātubhavissati, brahmuno hetaṁ pubbanimittaṁ pātubhāvāya, yadidaṁ āloko sañjāyati, obhāso pātubhavatī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: But by the signs that are seen—light arising and radiance appearing—we know that Brahmā will appear. For this is the precursor for the appearance of Brahmā, namely light arising and radiance appearing.’

root-pli-ms: Atha kho so, kevaṭṭa, mahābrahmā nacirasseva pāturahosi.
translation-en-sujato: Not long afterwards, the Great Brahmā appeared.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho so, kevaṭṭa, bhikkhu yena so mahābrahmā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā taṁ mahābrahmānaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: Then that mendicant approached the Great Brahmā and said to him,

root-pli-ms: ‘kattha nu kho, āvuso, ime cattāro mahābhūtā aparisesā nirujjhanti, seyyathidaṁ—pathavīdhātu āpodhātu tejodhātu vāyodhātū’ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘Reverend, where do these four primary elements cease without anything left over, namely, the elements of earth, water, fire, and air?’

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vutte, kevaṭṭa, so mahābrahmā taṁ bhikkhuṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: The Great Brahmā said to him,

root-pli-ms: ‘ahamasmi, bhikkhu, brahmā mahābrahmā abhibhū anabhibhūto aññadatthudaso vasavattī issaro kattā nimmātā seṭṭho sajitā vasī pitā bhūtabhabyānan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘I am Brahmā, the Great Brahmā, the Undefeated, the Champion, the Universal Seer, the Wielder of Power, the Lord God, the Maker, the Author, the Best, the Begetter, the Controller, the Father of those who have been born and those yet to be born.’

root-pli-ms: Dutiyampi kho so, kevaṭṭa, bhikkhu taṁ mahābrahmānaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: For a second time, that mendicant said to the Great Brahmā,

root-pli-ms: ‘na khohaṁ taṁ, āvuso, evaṁ pucchāmi:
translation-en-sujato: ‘Reverend, I am not asking you whether you are

root-pli-ms: “tvamasi brahmā mahābrahmā abhibhū anabhibhūto aññadatthudaso vasavattī issaro kattā nimmātā seṭṭho sajitā vasī pitā bhūtabhabyānan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Brahmā, the Great Brahmā, the Undefeated, the Champion, the Universal Seer, the Wielder of Power, the Lord God, the Maker, the Author, the Best, the Begetter, the Controller, the Father of those who have been born and those yet to be born.

root-pli-ms: Evañca kho ahaṁ taṁ, āvuso, pucchāmi:
translation-en-sujato: I am asking

root-pli-ms: “kattha nu kho, āvuso, ime cattāro mahābhūtā aparisesā nirujjhanti, seyyathidaṁ—pathavīdhātu āpodhātu tejodhātu vāyodhātū”’ti?
translation-en-sujato: where these four primary elements cease without anything left over.’

root-pli-ms: Dutiyampi kho so, kevaṭṭa, mahābrahmā taṁ bhikkhuṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: For a second time, the Great Brahmā said to him,

root-pli-ms: ‘ahamasmi, bhikkhu, brahmā mahābrahmā abhibhū anabhibhūto aññadatthudaso vasavattī issaro kattā nimmātā seṭṭho sajitā vasī pitā bhūtabhabyānan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘I am Brahmā, the Great Brahmā, the Undefeated, the Champion, the Universal Seer, the Wielder of Power, the Lord God, the Maker, the Author, the Best, the Begetter, the Controller, the Father of those who have been born and those yet to be born.’

root-pli-ms: Tatiyampi kho so, kevaṭṭa, bhikkhu taṁ mahābrahmānaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: For a third time, that mendicant said to the Great Brahmā,

root-pli-ms: ‘na khohaṁ taṁ, āvuso, evaṁ pucchāmi:
translation-en-sujato: ‘Reverend, I am not asking you whether you are

root-pli-ms: “tvamasi brahmā mahābrahmā abhibhū anabhibhūto aññadatthudaso vasavattī issaro kattā nimmātā seṭṭho sajitā vasī pitā bhūtabhabyānan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Brahmā, the Great Brahmā, the Undefeated, the Champion, the Universal Seer, the Wielder of Power, the Lord God, the Maker, the Author, the Best, the Begetter, the Controller, the Father of those who have been born and those yet to be born.

root-pli-ms: Evañca kho ahaṁ taṁ, āvuso, pucchāmi:
translation-en-sujato: I am asking

root-pli-ms: “kattha nu kho, āvuso, ime cattāro mahābhūtā aparisesā nirujjhanti, seyyathidaṁ—pathavīdhātu āpodhātu tejodhātu vāyodhātū”’ti?
translation-en-sujato: where these four primary elements cease without anything left over.’

root-pli-ms: Atha kho so, kevaṭṭa, mahābrahmā taṁ bhikkhuṁ bāhāyaṁ gahetvā ekamantaṁ apanetvā taṁ bhikkhuṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: Then the Great Brahmā took that mendicant by the arm, led him off to one side, and said to him,

root-pli-ms: ‘ime kho maṁ, bhikkhu, brahmakāyikā devā evaṁ jānanti, “natthi kiñci brahmuno aññātaṁ, natthi kiñci brahmuno adiṭṭhaṁ, natthi kiñci brahmuno aviditaṁ, natthi kiñci brahmuno asacchikatan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Mendicant, these gods think that there is nothing at all that I don’t know and see and understand and realize.

root-pli-ms: Tasmāhaṁ tesaṁ sammukhā na byākāsiṁ.
translation-en-sujato: That’s why I didn’t answer in front of them.

root-pli-ms: Ahampi kho, bhikkhu, na jānāmi yatthime cattāro mahābhūtā aparisesā nirujjhanti, seyyathidaṁ—pathavīdhātu āpodhātu tejodhātu vāyodhātūti.
translation-en-sujato: But I too do not know where these four primary elements cease with nothing left over.

root-pli-ms: Tasmātiha, bhikkhu, tuyhevetaṁ dukkaṭaṁ, tuyhevetaṁ aparaddhaṁ, yaṁ tvaṁ taṁ bhagavantaṁ atidhāvitvā bahiddhā pariyeṭṭhiṁ āpajjasi imassa pañhassa veyyākaraṇāya.
translation-en-sujato: Therefore, mendicant, the misdeed is yours alone, the mistake is yours alone, in that you passed over the Buddha and searched elsewhere for an answer to this question.

root-pli-ms: Gaccha tvaṁ, bhikkhu, tameva bhagavantaṁ upasaṅkamitvā imaṁ pañhaṁ puccha, yathā ca te bhagavā byākaroti, tathā naṁ dhāreyyāsī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: Mendicant, go to the Buddha and ask him this question. You should remember it in line with his answer.’

root-pli-ms: Atha kho so, kevaṭṭa, bhikkhu—seyyathāpi nāma balavā puriso samiñjitaṁ vā bāhaṁ pasāreyya, pasāritaṁ vā bāhaṁ samiñjeyya; evameva brahmaloke antarahito mama purato pāturahosi.
translation-en-sujato: Then that mendicant, as easily as a strong person would extend or contract their arm, vanished from the Brahmā realm and reappeared in front of me.
reference: cck9.285, mc9.223, ms6D_856, msdiv496, pts-cs84, sc30, vri1.203

root-pli-ms: Atha kho so, kevaṭṭa, bhikkhu maṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi, ekamantaṁ nisinno kho, kevaṭṭa, so bhikkhu maṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: Then he bowed, sat down to one side, and said to me,

root-pli-ms: ‘kattha nu kho, bhante, ime cattāro mahābhūtā aparisesā nirujjhanti, seyyathidaṁ—pathavīdhātu āpodhātu tejodhātu vāyodhātū’ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘Sir, where do these four primary elements cease without anything left over, namely, the elements of earth, water, fire, and air?’

root-pli-ms: 4.1. Tīradassisakuṇupamā
translation-en-sujato: 4.1. The Simile of the Land-Spotting Bird

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vutte, ahaṁ, kevaṭṭa, taṁ bhikkhuṁ etadavocaṁ—
translation-en-sujato: When he said this, I said to him:
reference: csp1ed6.213, csp2ed6.213, dr9.304, km15.219, ms6D_857, msdiv497, ndp6.190, pts-cs85, pts-vp-pli1.223, sc31, sya9.283

root-pli-ms: bhūtapubbaṁ, bhikkhu, sāmuddikā vāṇijā tīradassiṁ sakuṇaṁ gahetvā nāvāya samuddaṁ ajjhogāhanti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Once upon a time, mendicant, some sea-merchants set sail for the ocean deeps, taking with them a land-spotting bird.

root-pli-ms: Te atīradakkhiniyā nāvāya tīradassiṁ sakuṇaṁ muñcanti.
translation-en-sujato: When their ship was out of sight of land, they released the bird.

root-pli-ms: So gacchateva puratthimaṁ disaṁ, gacchati dakkhiṇaṁ disaṁ, gacchati pacchimaṁ disaṁ, gacchati uttaraṁ disaṁ, gacchati uddhaṁ disaṁ, gacchati anudisaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: It flew right away to the east, the west, the north, the south, upwards, and in-between.

root-pli-ms: Sace so samantā tīraṁ passati, tathāgatakova hoti.
translation-en-sujato: If it saw land on any side, it went there and stayed.
variant-pli-ms: tathāgatakova → tathā pakkantova (cck); tathāpakkanto va (sya1ed, sya2ed)

root-pli-ms: Sace pana so samantā tīraṁ na passati, tameva nāvaṁ paccāgacchati.
translation-en-sujato: But if it saw no land on any side it returned to the ship.

root-pli-ms: Evameva kho tvaṁ, bhikkhu, yato yāva brahmalokā pariyesamāno imassa pañhassa veyyākaraṇaṁ nājjhagā, atha mamaññeva santike paccāgato.
translation-en-sujato: In the same way, after failing to get an answer to this question even after searching as far as the Brahmā realm, you’ve returned to me.

root-pli-ms: Na kho eso, bhikkhu, pañho evaṁ pucchitabbo:
translation-en-sujato: Mendicant, this is not how the question should be asked:

root-pli-ms: ‘kattha nu kho, bhante, ime cattāro mahābhūtā aparisesā nirujjhanti, seyyathidaṁ—pathavīdhātu āpodhātu tejodhātu vāyodhātū’ti?
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, where do these four primary elements cease without anything left over, namely, the elements of earth, water, fire, and air?”

root-pli-ms: Evañca kho eso, bhikkhu, pañho pucchitabbo:
translation-en-sujato: This is how the question should be asked:

root-pli-ms: ‘Kattha āpo ca pathavī,
translation-en-sujato: “Where do water and earth,

root-pli-ms: tejo vāyo na gādhati;
translation-en-sujato: fire and air find no footing;

root-pli-ms: Kattha dīghañca rassañca,
translation-en-sujato: where do long and short,

root-pli-ms: aṇuṁ thūlaṁ subhāsubhaṁ;
translation-en-sujato: fine and coarse, beautiful and ugly;

root-pli-ms: Kattha nāmañca rūpañca,
translation-en-sujato: where do name and form

root-pli-ms: asesaṁ uparujjhatī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: cease with nothing left over?”

root-pli-ms: Tatra veyyākaraṇaṁ bhavati:
translation-en-sujato: And the answer to that is:

root-pli-ms: ‘Viññāṇaṁ anidassanaṁ,
translation-en-sujato: “Consciousness that’s invisible,

root-pli-ms: anantaṁ sabbatopabhaṁ;
translation-en-sujato: infinite, entirely given up:
comment-en-sujato: https://discourse.suttacentral.net/t/whose-consciousness-is-invisible-infinite-and-all-radiant/4098

root-pli-ms: Ettha āpo ca pathavī,
translation-en-sujato: that’s where water and earth,

root-pli-ms: tejo vāyo na gādhati.
translation-en-sujato: fire and air find no footing;

root-pli-ms: Ettha dīghañca rassañca,
translation-en-sujato: and that’s where long and short,

root-pli-ms: aṇuṁ thūlaṁ subhāsubhaṁ;
translation-en-sujato: fine and coarse, beautiful and ugly,

root-pli-ms: Ettha nāmañca rūpañca,
translation-en-sujato: that’s where name and form

root-pli-ms: asesaṁ uparujjhati;
translation-en-sujato: cease with nothing left over—

root-pli-ms: Viññāṇassa nirodhena,
translation-en-sujato: with the cessation of consciousness,

root-pli-ms: etthetaṁ uparujjhatī’”ti.
translation-en-sujato: that’s where this ceases.”’”

root-pli-ms: Idamavoca bhagavā.
translation-en-sujato: That is what the Buddha said.

root-pli-ms: Attamano kevaṭṭo gahapatiputto bhagavato bhāsitaṁ abhinandīti.
translation-en-sujato: Satisfied, the householder Kevaddha was happy with what the Buddha said.

root-pli-ms: Kevaṭṭasuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ ekādasamaṁ.
Dīgha Nikāya 12
translation-en-sujato: Long Discourses 12

root-pli-ms: Lohiccasutta
translation-en-sujato: With Lohicca

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
translation-en-sujato: So I have heard.

root-pli-ms: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā kosalesu cārikaṁ caramāno mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi yena sālavatikā tadavasari.
translation-en-sujato: At one time the Buddha was wandering in the land of the Kosalans together with a large Saṅgha of five hundred mendicants when he arrived at Sālavatikā.

root-pli-ms: Tena kho pana samayena lohicco brāhmaṇo sālavatikaṁ ajjhāvasati sattussadaṁ satiṇakaṭṭhodakaṁ sadhaññaṁ rājabhoggaṁ raññā pasenadinā kosalena dinnaṁ rājadāyaṁ brahmadeyyaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Now at that time the brahmin Lohicca was living in Sālavatikā. It was a crown property given by King Pasenadi of Kosala, teeming with living creatures, full of hay, wood, water, and grain, a royal endowment of the highest quality.

root-pli-ms: Tena kho pana samayena lohiccassa brāhmaṇassa evarūpaṁ pāpakaṁ diṭṭhigataṁ uppannaṁ hoti:
translation-en-sujato: Now at that time Lohicca had the following harmful misconception:

root-pli-ms: “idha samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā kusalaṁ dhammaṁ adhigaccheyya, kusalaṁ dhammaṁ adhigantvā na parassa āroceyya, kiñhi paro parassa karissati.
translation-en-sujato: “Should an ascetic or brahmin achieve some skillful quality, they ought not inform anyone else. For what can one person do for another?

root-pli-ms: Seyyathāpi nāma purāṇaṁ bandhanaṁ chinditvā aññaṁ navaṁ bandhanaṁ kareyya;
translation-en-sujato: Suppose someone cut off an old bond, only to create another new bond.

root-pli-ms: evaṁ sampadamidaṁ pāpakaṁ lobhadhammaṁ vadāmi, kiñhi paro parassa karissatī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: That’s the consequence of such a wicked, greedy deed, I say. For what can one person do for another?”

root-pli-ms: Assosi kho lohicco brāhmaṇo:
translation-en-sujato: Lohicca heard:
reference: cck9.288, dr9.306, ms6D_867, msdiv503, pts-cs3, pts-vp-pli1.225, sc3, sya9.285

root-pli-ms: “samaṇo khalu, bho, gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulā pabbajito kosalesu cārikaṁ caramāno mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi sālavatikaṁ anuppatto.
translation-en-sujato: “It seems the ascetic Gotama—a Sakyan, gone forth from a Sakyan family—has arrived at Sālavatikā, together with a large Saṅgha of five hundred mendicants.

root-pli-ms: Taṁ kho pana bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ evaṁ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggato:
translation-en-sujato: He has this good reputation:

root-pli-ms: ‘itipi so bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṁ buddho bhagavā’.
translation-en-sujato: ‘That Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those who wish to train, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.’

root-pli-ms: So imaṁ lokaṁ sadevakaṁ samārakaṁ sabrahmakaṁ sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiṁ pajaṁ sadevamanussaṁ sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā pavedeti.
translation-en-sujato: He has realized with his own insight this world—with its gods, Māras and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, gods and humans—and he makes it known to others.

root-pli-ms: So dhammaṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti.
translation-en-sujato: He teaches Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And he reveals a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure.

root-pli-ms: Sādhu kho pana tathārūpānaṁ arahataṁ dassanaṁ hotī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: It’s good to see such perfected ones.”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho lohicco brāhmaṇo rosikaṁ nhāpitaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: Then Lohicca addressed his barber Rosika,
comment-en-sujato: While nhapita would seem to be identical with nhapaka, i.e bathroom attendant, it is translated by all as barber. This must follow Ja 395, where it explicitly means barber.
reference: csp1ed6.215, csp2ed6.215, km15.223, mc9.226, ms6D_868, msdiv504, pts-cs4, sc4, vri1.206

root-pli-ms: “ehi tvaṁ, samma rosike, yena samaṇo gotamo tenupasaṅkama; upasaṅkamitvā mama vacanena samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ appābādhaṁ appātaṅkaṁ lahuṭṭhānaṁ balaṁ phāsuvihāraṁ puccha:
translation-en-sujato: “Here, dear Rosika, go to the ascetic Gotama and in my name bow with your head to his feet. Ask him if he is healthy and well, nimble, strong, and living comfortably.

root-pli-ms: ‘lohicco, bho gotama, brāhmaṇo bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ appābādhaṁ appātaṅkaṁ lahuṭṭhānaṁ balaṁ phāsuvihāraṁ pucchatī’ti;
evañca vadehi—
translation-en-sujato: And then ask him whether he,

root-pli-ms: adhivāsetu kira bhavaṁ gotamo lohiccassa brāhmaṇassa svātanāya bhattaṁ saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: together with the mendicant Saṅgha, might accept tomorrow’s meal from the brahmin Lohicca.”
comment-en-sujato: Note the unusual use of kira in this idiom, shared with MN 85 and MN 127. I think this expresses an extra degree of polite deference, and render with “might” rather than “would”.

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bho”ti kho rosikā nhāpito lohiccassa brāhmaṇassa paṭissutvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho rosikā nhāpito bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” Rosika replied. He did as he was asked, and
reference: bj7.542, km15.224, ms6D_869, msdiv505, ndp6.192, pts-cs5, sc5
variant-pli-ms: Evaṁ, bho”ti → evaṁ bhanteti (bj, sya-all, pts1ed)

root-pli-ms: “lohicco, bhante, brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ appābādhaṁ appātaṅkaṁ lahuṭṭhānaṁ balaṁ phāsuvihāraṁ pucchati;
evañca vadeti—
adhivāsetu kira, bhante, bhagavā lohiccassa brāhmaṇassa svātanāya bhattaṁ saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
Adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena.
translation-en-sujato: the Buddha consented in silence.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho rosikā nhāpito bhagavato adhivāsanaṁ viditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā yena lohicco brāhmaṇo tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā lohiccaṁ brāhmaṇaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: Then, knowing that the Buddha had consented, Rosika got up from his seat, went to Lohicca, and said to him,
reference: cck9.289, dr9.307, km15.225, ms6D_870, msdiv506, pts-cs6, pts-vp-pli1.226, sc6, sya9.286

root-pli-ms: “avocumhā kho mayaṁ bhoto vacanena taṁ bhagavantaṁ:
translation-en-sujato: “I gave the Buddha your message,
variant-pli-ms: mayaṁ bhoto → mayaṁ bhante tava (bj, pts1ed) | avocumhā kho → avocumha bho (pts1ed)

root-pli-ms: ‘lohicco, bhante, brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ appābādhaṁ appātaṅkaṁ lahuṭṭhānaṁ balaṁ phāsuvihāraṁ pucchati;
evañca vadeti—
adhivāsetu kira, bhante, bhagavā lohiccassa brāhmaṇassa svātanāya bhattaṁ saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghenā’ti.
Adhivutthañca pana tena bhagavatā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: and he accepted.”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho lohicco brāhmaṇo tassā rattiyā accayena sake nivesane paṇītaṁ khādanīyaṁ bhojanīyaṁ paṭiyādāpetvā rosikaṁ nhāpitaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: And when the night had passed Lohicca had a variety of delicious foods prepared in his own home. Then he had the Buddha informed of the time, saying,
reference: csp1ed6.216, csp2ed6.216, ms6D_871, msdiv507, pts-cs7, sc7

root-pli-ms: “ehi tvaṁ, samma rosike, yena samaṇo gotamo tenupasaṅkama; upasaṅkamitvā samaṇassa gotamassa kālaṁ ārocehi—
translation-en-sujato: “Here, dear Rosika, go to the ascetic Gotama and announce the time, saying:

root-pli-ms: kālo, bho gotama, niṭṭhitaṁ bhattan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Itʼs time, Master Gotama, the meal is ready.’”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bho”ti kho rosikā nhāpito lohiccassa brāhmaṇassa paṭissutvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhāsi.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” Rosika replied. He did as he was asked.

root-pli-ms: Ekamantaṁ ṭhito kho rosikā nhāpito bhagavato kālaṁ ārocesi:
“kālo, bhante, niṭṭhitaṁ bhattan”ti.
Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghena yena sālavatikā tenupasaṅkami.
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, went to Sālavatikā together with the Saṅgha of mendicants.

root-pli-ms: Tena kho pana samayena rosikā nhāpito bhagavantaṁ piṭṭhito piṭṭhito anubandho hoti.
translation-en-sujato: Now, Rosika was following behind the Buddha,

root-pli-ms: Atha kho rosikā nhāpito bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: and told him of Lohicca’s views, adding,

root-pli-ms: “lohiccassa, bhante, brāhmaṇassa evarūpaṁ pāpakaṁ diṭṭhigataṁ uppannaṁ:
‘idha samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā kusalaṁ dhammaṁ adhigaccheyya, kusalaṁ dhammaṁ adhigantvā na parassa āroceyya—
kiñhi paro parassa karissati.
Seyyathāpi nāma purāṇaṁ bandhanaṁ chinditvā aññaṁ navaṁ bandhanaṁ kareyya;
evaṁ sampadamidaṁ pāpakaṁ lobhadhammaṁ vadāmi—
kiñhi paro parassa karissatī’ti.
Sādhu, bhante, bhagavā lohiccaṁ brāhmaṇaṁ etasmā pāpakā diṭṭhigatā vivecetū”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, please dissuade him from that harmful misconception.”

root-pli-ms: “Appeva nāma siyā, rosike, appeva nāma siyā, rosike”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Hopefully that’ll happen, Rosika, hopefully that’ll happen.”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā yena lohiccassa brāhmaṇassa nivesanaṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha approached Lohicca’s home, where he sat on the seat spread out.
reference: bj7.544, km15.227, ms6D_873, pts-cs9, pts-vp-pli1.227, sc9

root-pli-ms: Atha kho lohicco brāhmaṇo buddhappamukhaṁ bhikkhusaṅghaṁ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappesi sampavāresi.
translation-en-sujato: Then Lohicca served and satisfied the mendicant Saṅgha headed by the Buddha with his own hands with a variety of delicious foods.

root-pli-ms: 1. Lohiccabrāhmaṇānuyoga
translation-en-sujato: 1. Questioning Lohicca

root-pli-ms: Atha kho lohicco brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ bhuttāviṁ onītapattapāṇiṁ aññataraṁ nīcaṁ āsanaṁ gahetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
translation-en-sujato: When the Buddha had eaten and washed his hand and bowl, Lohicca took a low seat and sat to one side.

root-pli-ms: Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho lohiccaṁ brāhmaṇaṁ bhagavā etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: The Buddha said to him,

root-pli-ms: “saccaṁ kira te, lohicca, evarūpaṁ pāpakaṁ diṭṭhigataṁ uppannaṁ:
translation-en-sujato: “Is it really true, Lohicca, that you have such a harmful misconception:

root-pli-ms: ‘idha samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā kusalaṁ dhammaṁ adhigaccheyya, kusalaṁ dhammaṁ adhigantvā na parassa āroceyya, kiñhi paro parassa karissati.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Should an ascetic or brahmin achieve some skillful quality, they ought not inform anyone else. For what can one person do for another?

root-pli-ms: Seyyathāpi nāma purāṇaṁ bandhanaṁ chinditvā aññaṁ navaṁ bandhanaṁ kareyya;
translation-en-sujato: Suppose someone cut off an old bond, only to create another new bond.

root-pli-ms: evaṁ sampadamidaṁ pāpakaṁ lobhadhammaṁ vadāmi, kiñhi paro parassa karissatī’”ti?
translation-en-sujato: That’s the consequence of such a wicked, greedy deed, I say. For what can one person do for another?’”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bho gotama”.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, Master Gotama.”

root-pli-ms: “Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, lohicca,
translation-en-sujato: “What do you think, Lohicca?

root-pli-ms: nanu tvaṁ sālavatikaṁ ajjhāvasasī”ti?
translation-en-sujato: Do you reside in Sālavatikā?”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bho gotama”.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, Master Gotama.”

root-pli-ms: “Yo nu kho, lohicca, evaṁ vadeyya:
translation-en-sujato: “Lohicca, suppose someone were to say:

root-pli-ms: ‘lohicco brāhmaṇo sālavatikaṁ ajjhāvasati.
translation-en-sujato: ‘The brahmin Lohicca reigns over Sālavatikā.

root-pli-ms: Yā sālavatikāya samudayasañjāti lohiccova taṁ brāhmaṇo ekako paribhuñjeyya, na aññesaṁ dadeyyā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: He alone should enjoy the revenues produced in Sālavatikā and not share them with anyone else.’

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vādī so ye taṁ upajīvanti, tesaṁ antarāyakaro vā hoti, no vā”ti?
translation-en-sujato: Would the person who spoke like that make it difficult for those whose living depends on you or not?”

root-pli-ms: “Antarāyakaro, bho gotama”.
translation-en-sujato: “They would, Master Gotama.”

root-pli-ms: “Antarāyakaro samāno hitānukampī vā tesaṁ hoti ahitānukampī vā”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “But is someone who creates difficulties for others acting kindly or unkindly?”

root-pli-ms: “Ahitānukampī, bho gotama”.
translation-en-sujato: “Unkindly, sir.”

root-pli-ms: “Ahitānukampissa mettaṁ vā tesu cittaṁ paccupaṭṭhitaṁ hoti sapattakaṁ vā”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “But does an unkind person have love in their heart or hostility?”

root-pli-ms: “Sapattakaṁ, bho gotama”.
translation-en-sujato: “Hostility, sir.”

root-pli-ms: “Sapattake citte paccupaṭṭhite micchādiṭṭhi vā hoti sammādiṭṭhi vā”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “And when the heart is full of hostility, is there right view or wrong view?”

root-pli-ms: “Micchādiṭṭhi, bho gotama”.
translation-en-sujato: “Wrong view, Master Gotama.”

root-pli-ms: “Micchādiṭṭhissa kho ahaṁ, lohicca, dvinnaṁ gatīnaṁ aññataraṁ gatiṁ vadāmi—
translation-en-sujato: “An individual with wrong view is reborn in one of two places, I say:

root-pli-ms: nirayaṁ vā tiracchānayoniṁ vā.
translation-en-sujato: hell or the animal realm.

root-pli-ms: Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, lohicca,
translation-en-sujato: What do you think, Lohicca?

root-pli-ms: nanu rājā pasenadi kosalo kāsikosalaṁ ajjhāvasatī”ti?
translation-en-sujato: Does King Pasenadi reign over Kāsī and Kosala?”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bho gotama”.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, Master Gotama.”

root-pli-ms: “Yo nu kho, lohicca, evaṁ vadeyya:
translation-en-sujato: “Lohicca, suppose someone were to say:

root-pli-ms: ‘rājā pasenadi kosalo kāsikosalaṁ ajjhāvasati;
translation-en-sujato: ‘King Pasenadi reigns over Kāsī and Kosala.

root-pli-ms: yā kāsikosale samudayasañjāti, rājāva taṁ pasenadi kosalo ekako paribhuñjeyya, na aññesaṁ dadeyyā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: He alone should enjoy the revenues produced in Kāsī and Kosala and not share them with anyone else.’

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vādī so ye rājānaṁ pasenadiṁ kosalaṁ upajīvanti tumhe ceva aññe ca, tesaṁ antarāyakaro vā hoti, no vā”ti?
translation-en-sujato: Would the person who spoke like that make it difficult for yourself and others whose living depends on King Pasenadi or not?”

root-pli-ms: “Antarāyakaro, bho gotama”.
translation-en-sujato: “They would, Master Gotama.”

root-pli-ms: “Antarāyakaro samāno hitānukampī vā tesaṁ hoti ahitānukampī vā”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “But is someone who creates difficulties for others acting kindly or unkindly?”

root-pli-ms: “Ahitānukampī, bho gotama”.
translation-en-sujato: “Unkindly, sir.”

root-pli-ms: “Ahitānukampissa mettaṁ vā tesu cittaṁ paccupaṭṭhitaṁ hoti sapattakaṁ vā”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “But does an unkind person have love in their heart or hostility?”

root-pli-ms: “Sapattakaṁ, bho gotama”.
translation-en-sujato: “Hostility, sir.”

root-pli-ms: “Sapattake citte paccupaṭṭhite micchādiṭṭhi vā hoti sammādiṭṭhi vā”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “And when the heart is full of hostility, is there right view or wrong view?”

root-pli-ms: “Micchādiṭṭhi, bho gotama”.
translation-en-sujato: “Wrong view, Master Gotama.”

root-pli-ms: “Micchādiṭṭhissa kho ahaṁ, lohicca, dvinnaṁ gatīnaṁ aññataraṁ gatiṁ vadāmi—
translation-en-sujato: “An individual with wrong view is reborn in one of two places, I say:

root-pli-ms: nirayaṁ vā tiracchānayoniṁ vā.
translation-en-sujato: hell or the animal realm.

root-pli-ms: Iti kira, lohicca, yo evaṁ vadeyya:
translation-en-sujato: So it seems, Lohicca, that should someone say such a thing either of Lohicca or of King Pasenadi,

root-pli-ms: ‘lohicco brāhmaṇo sālavatikaṁ ajjhāvasati;
yā sālavatikāya samudayasañjāti, lohiccova taṁ brāhmaṇo ekako paribhuñjeyya, na aññesaṁ dadeyyā’ti.
Evaṁvādī so ye taṁ upajīvanti, tesaṁ antarāyakaro hoti.
Antarāyakaro samāno ahitānukampī hoti, ahitānukampissa sapattakaṁ cittaṁ paccupaṭṭhitaṁ hoti, sapattake citte paccupaṭṭhite micchādiṭṭhi hoti.
translation-en-sujato: that is wrong view.

root-pli-ms: Evameva kho, lohicca, yo evaṁ vadeyya:
translation-en-sujato: In the same way, suppose someone were to say:

root-pli-ms: ‘idha samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā kusalaṁ dhammaṁ adhigaccheyya, kusalaṁ dhammaṁ adhigantvā na parassa āroceyya, kiñhi paro parassa karissati.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Should an ascetic or brahmin achieve some skillful quality, they ought not inform anyone else. For what can one person do for another?

root-pli-ms: Seyyathāpi nāma purāṇaṁ bandhanaṁ chinditvā aññaṁ navaṁ bandhanaṁ kareyya …pe…
translation-en-sujato: Suppose someone cut off an old bond, only to create another new bond.

root-pli-ms: karissatī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: That’s the consequence of such a wicked, greedy deed, I say. For what can one person do for another?’

root-pli-ms: Evaṁvādī so ye te kulaputtā tathāgatappaveditaṁ dhammavinayaṁ āgamma evarūpaṁ uḷāraṁ visesaṁ adhigacchanti, sotāpattiphalampi sacchikaronti, sakadāgāmiphalampi sacchikaronti, anāgāmiphalampi sacchikaronti, arahattampi sacchikaronti, ye cime dibbā gabbhā paripācenti dibbānaṁ bhavānaṁ abhinibbattiyā, tesaṁ antarāyakaro hoti, antarāyakaro samāno ahitānukampī hoti, ahitānukampissa sapattakaṁ cittaṁ paccupaṭṭhitaṁ hoti, sapattake citte paccupaṭṭhite micchādiṭṭhi hoti.
translation-en-sujato: Now, there are gentlemen who, relying on the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One, achieve a high distinction such as the following: they realize the fruit of stream-entry, the fruit of once-return, the fruit of non-return, or the fruit of perfection. And in addition, there are those who ripen the seeds for rebirth in a heavenly state. The person who spoke like that makes it difficult for them. They’re acting unkindly, their heart is full of hostility, and they have wrong view.

root-pli-ms: Micchādiṭṭhissa kho ahaṁ, lohicca, dvinnaṁ gatīnaṁ aññataraṁ gatiṁ vadāmi—
translation-en-sujato: An individual with wrong view is reborn in one of two places, I say:

root-pli-ms: nirayaṁ vā tiracchānayoniṁ vā.
translation-en-sujato: hell or the animal realm.

root-pli-ms: Iti kira, lohicca, yo evaṁ vadeyya:
‘rājā pasenadi kosalo kāsikosalaṁ ajjhāvasati;
yā kāsikosale samudayasañjāti, rājāva taṁ pasenadi kosalo ekako paribhuñjeyya, na aññesaṁ dadeyyā’ti.
Evaṁvādī so ye rājānaṁ pasenadiṁ kosalaṁ upajīvanti tumhe ceva aññe ca, tesaṁ antarāyakaro hoti.
Antarāyakaro samāno ahitānukampī hoti, ahitānukampissa sapattakaṁ cittaṁ paccupaṭṭhitaṁ hoti, sapattake citte paccupaṭṭhite micchādiṭṭhi hoti.
Evameva kho, lohicca, yo evaṁ vadeyya:
‘idha samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā kusalaṁ dhammaṁ adhigaccheyya, kusalaṁ dhammaṁ adhigantvā na parassa āroceyya, kiñhi paro parassa karissati.
Seyyathāpi nāma …pe…
kiñhi paro parassa karissatī’ti.

Evaṁvādī so ye te kulaputtā tathāgatappaveditaṁ dhammavinayaṁ āgamma evarūpaṁ uḷāraṁ visesaṁ adhigacchanti, sotāpattiphalampi sacchikaronti, sakadāgāmiphalampi sacchikaronti, anāgāmiphalampi sacchikaronti, arahattampi sacchikaronti.
Ye cime dibbā gabbhā paripācenti dibbānaṁ bhavānaṁ abhinibbattiyā, tesaṁ antarāyakaro hoti,
antarāyakaro samāno ahitānukampī hoti, ahitānukampissa sapattakaṁ cittaṁ paccupaṭṭhitaṁ hoti, sapattake citte paccupaṭṭhite micchādiṭṭhi hoti.
Micchādiṭṭhissa kho ahaṁ, lohicca, dvinnaṁ gatīnaṁ aññataraṁ gatiṁ vadāmi—
nirayaṁ vā tiracchānayoniṁ vā.
2. Tayocodanārahā
translation-en-sujato: 2. Three Teachers Who Deserve to Be Reprimanded

root-pli-ms: Tayo khome, lohicca, satthāro, ye loke codanārahā;
translation-en-sujato: Lohicca, there are three kinds of teachers in the world who deserve to be reprimanded.

root-pli-ms: yo ca panevarūpe satthāro codeti, sā codanā bhūtā tacchā dhammikā anavajjā.
translation-en-sujato: When someone reprimands such teachers, the reprimand is true, substantive, legitimate, and blameless.

root-pli-ms: Katame tayo?
translation-en-sujato: What three?

root-pli-ms: Idha, lohicca, ekacco satthā yassatthāya agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajito hoti, svāssa sāmaññattho ananuppatto hoti.
translation-en-sujato: Firstly, take a teacher who has not reached the goal of the ascetic life for which they went forth from the lay life to homelessness.

root-pli-ms: So taṁ sāmaññatthaṁ ananupāpuṇitvā sāvakānaṁ dhammaṁ deseti:
translation-en-sujato: They teach their disciples:

root-pli-ms: ‘idaṁ vo hitāya idaṁ vo sukhāyā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘This is for your welfare. This is for your happiness.’

root-pli-ms: Tassa sāvakā na sussūsanti, na sotaṁ odahanti, na aññā cittaṁ upaṭṭhapenti, vokkamma ca satthusāsanā vattanti.
translation-en-sujato: But their disciples don’t want to listen. They don’t pay attention or apply their minds to understand. They proceed having turned away from the teacher’s instruction.

root-pli-ms: So evamassa codetabbo:
translation-en-sujato: That teacher deserves to be reprimanded:

root-pli-ms: ‘āyasmā kho yassatthāya agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajito, so te sāmaññattho ananuppatto, taṁ tvaṁ sāmaññatthaṁ ananupāpuṇitvā sāvakānaṁ dhammaṁ desesi:
translation-en-sujato: ‘Venerable, you haven’t reached the goal of the ascetic life; and when you teach disciples

root-pli-ms: “idaṁ vo hitāya idaṁ vo sukhāyā”ti.
Tassa te sāvakā na sussūsanti, na sotaṁ odahanti, na aññā cittaṁ upaṭṭhapenti, vokkamma ca satthusāsanā vattanti.
translation-en-sujato: they proceed having turned away from the teacher’s instruction.

root-pli-ms: Seyyathāpi nāma osakkantiyā vā ussakkeyya, parammukhiṁ vā āliṅgeyya;
translation-en-sujato: It’s like a man who makes advances on a woman though she pulls away, or embraces her though she turns her back.

root-pli-ms: evaṁ sampadamidaṁ pāpakaṁ lobhadhammaṁ vadāmi—
translation-en-sujato: That’s the consequence of such a wicked, greedy deed, I say. For what can one do for another?’

root-pli-ms: kiñhi paro parassa karissatī’ti.
Ayaṁ kho, lohicca, paṭhamo satthā, yo loke codanāraho;
translation-en-sujato: This is the first kind of teacher who deserves to be reprimanded.

root-pli-ms: yo ca panevarūpaṁ satthāraṁ codeti, sā codanā bhūtā tacchā dhammikā anavajjā.

translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, take a teacher who has not reached the goal of the ascetic life for which they went forth from the lay life to homelessness.

root-pli-ms: So taṁ sāmaññatthaṁ ananupāpuṇitvā sāvakānaṁ dhammaṁ deseti:

root-pli-ms: Tassa sāvakā sussūsanti, sotaṁ odahanti, aññā cittaṁ upaṭṭhapenti, na ca vokkamma satthusāsanā vattanti.
translation-en-sujato: Their disciples do want to listen. They pay attention and apply their minds to understand. They don’t proceed having turned away from the teacher’s instruction.
comment-en-sujato: Note that at DN 29, the opposite formulation is samādāya taṁ dhammaṁ vattati

root-pli-ms: “idaṁ vo hitāya, idaṁ vo sukhāyā”ti.

translation-en-sujato: they don’t proceed having turned away from the teacher’s instruction.

root-pli-ms: Seyyathāpi nāma sakaṁ khettaṁ ohāya paraṁ khettaṁ niddāyitabbaṁ maññeyya, evaṁ sampadamidaṁ pāpakaṁ lobhadhammaṁ vadāmi—kiñhi paro parassa karissatī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: It’s like someone who abandons their own field and presumes to weed someone else’s field. That’s the consequence of such a wicked, greedy deed, I say. For what can one do for another?’

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ kho, lohicca, dutiyo satthā, yo, loke codanāraho;
translation-en-sujato: This is the second kind of teacher who deserves to be reprimanded.

root-pli-ms: So taṁ sāmaññatthaṁ anupāpuṇitvā sāvakānaṁ dhammaṁ deseti:

root-pli-ms: ‘āyasmā kho yassatthāya agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajito, so te sāmaññattho anuppatto.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Venerable, you have reached the goal of the ascetic life; yet when you teach disciples

root-pli-ms: Taṁ tvaṁ sāmaññatthaṁ anupāpuṇitvā sāvakānaṁ dhammaṁ desesi:
“idaṁ vo hitāya, idaṁ vo sukhāyā”ti.
Tassa te sāvakā na sussūsanti, na sotaṁ odahanti, na aññā cittaṁ upaṭṭhapenti, vokkamma ca satthusāsanā vattanti.

root-pli-ms: Seyyathāpi nāma purāṇaṁ bandhanaṁ chinditvā aññaṁ navaṁ bandhanaṁ kareyya;
translation-en-sujato: Suppose someone cut off an old bond, only to create another new bond.

root-pli-ms: evaṁ sampadamidaṁ pāpakaṁ lobhadhammaṁ vadāmi, kiñhi paro parassa karissatī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: That’s the consequence of such a wicked, greedy deed, I say. For what can one person do for another?’

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ kho, lohicca, tatiyo satthā, yo loke codanāraho;

translation-en-sujato: These are the three kinds of teachers in the world who deserve to be reprimanded.

root-pli-ms: yo ca panevarūpe satthāro codeti, sā codanā bhūtā tacchā dhammikā anavajjā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: When someone reprimands such teachers, the reprimand is true, substantive, legitimate, and blameless.”

root-pli-ms: 3. Nacodanārahasatthu
translation-en-sujato: 3. A Teacher Who Does Not Deserve to Be Reprimanded

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vutte, lohicco brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:

root-pli-ms: “atthi pana, bho gotama, koci satthā, yo loke nacodanāraho”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “But Master Gotama, is there a teacher in the world who does not deserve to be reprimanded?”

root-pli-ms: “Atthi kho, lohicca, satthā, yo loke nacodanāraho”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “There is, Lohicca.”

root-pli-ms: “Katamo pana so, bho gotama, satthā, yo loke nacodanāraho”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “But who is that teacher?”

root-pli-ms: “Idha, lohicca, tathāgato loke uppajjati arahaṁ, sammāsambuddho …pe…
translation-en-sujato: “It’s when a Realized One arises in the world, perfected, a fully awakened Buddha …

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ kho, lohicca, bhikkhu sīlasampanno hoti …pe…
translation-en-sujato: That’s how a mendicant is accomplished in ethics. …

root-pli-ms: paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati …
translation-en-sujato: They enter and remain in the first absorption …

root-pli-ms: yasmiṁ kho, lohicca, satthari sāvako evarūpaṁ uḷāraṁ visesaṁ adhigacchati, ayampi kho, lohicca, satthā, yo loke nacodanāraho.
translation-en-sujato: A teacher under whom a disciple achieves such a high distinction is one who does not deserve to be reprimanded.

root-pli-ms: Yo ca panevarūpaṁ satthāraṁ codeti, sā codanā abhūtā atacchā adhammikā sāvajjā.
translation-en-sujato: When someone reprimands such a teacher, the reprimand is false, baseless, illegitimate, and blameworthy.

root-pli-ms: …pe…
Dutiyaṁ jhānaṁ …pe…
translation-en-sujato: They enter and remain in the second absorption …

root-pli-ms: tatiyaṁ jhānaṁ …pe…
translation-en-sujato: third absorption …

root-pli-ms: catutthaṁ jhānaṁ upasampajja viharati.
translation-en-sujato: fourth absorption.

root-pli-ms: Yasmiṁ kho, lohicca, satthari sāvako evarūpaṁ uḷāraṁ visesaṁ adhigacchati, ayampi kho, lohicca, satthā, yo loke nacodanāraho, yo ca panevarūpaṁ satthāraṁ codeti, sā codanā abhūtā atacchā adhammikā sāvajjā.
translation-en-sujato: A teacher under whom a disciple achieves such a high distinction is one who does not deserve to be reprimanded. …

root-pli-ms: …pe…
Ñāṇadassanāya cittaṁ abhinīharati abhininnāmeti …
translation-en-sujato: They extend and project the mind toward knowledge and vision …

root-pli-ms: yasmiṁ kho, lohicca, satthari sāvako evarūpaṁ uḷāraṁ visesaṁ adhigacchati, ayampi kho, lohicca, satthā, yo loke nacodanāraho, yo ca panevarūpaṁ satthāraṁ codeti, sā codanā abhūtā atacchā adhammikā sāvajjā.
translation-en-sujato: A teacher under whom a disciple achieves such a high distinction is one who does not deserve to be reprimanded. …

root-pli-ms: …pe…
Nāparaṁ itthattāyāti pajānāti.
translation-en-sujato: They understand: ‘… there is no return to any state of existence.’

root-pli-ms: Yasmiṁ kho, lohicca, satthari sāvako evarūpaṁ uḷāraṁ visesaṁ adhigacchati, ayampi kho, lohicca, satthā, yo loke nacodanāraho, yo ca panevarūpaṁ satthāraṁ codeti, sā codanā abhūtā atacchā adhammikā sāvajjā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: A teacher under whom a disciple achieves such a high distinction is one who does not deserve to be reprimanded. When someone reprimands such a teacher, the reprimand is false, baseless, illegitimate, and blameworthy.”

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vutte, lohicco brāhmaṇo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: When he had spoken, Lohicca said to the Buddha:

root-pli-ms: “seyyathāpi, bho gotama, puriso purisaṁ narakapapātaṁ patantaṁ kesesu gahetvā uddharitvā thale patiṭṭhapeyya;
translation-en-sujato: “Suppose, Master Gotama, a person was on the verge of falling off a cliff, and another person were to grab them by the hair, pull them up, and place them on firm ground.
comment-en-sujato: At Thag 16.8, naraka is clearly a term for a cliff in a normal sense. Better to assume a naturalistic meaning here.

root-pli-ms: evamevāhaṁ bhotā gotamena narakapapātaṁ papatanto uddharitvā thale patiṭṭhāpito.
translation-en-sujato: In the same way, when I was falling off a cliff Master Gotama pulled me up and placed me on safe ground.

root-pli-ms: Abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama, abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama.
translation-en-sujato: Excellent, Master Gotama! Excellent!

root-pli-ms: Seyyathāpi, bho gotama, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṁ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṁ dhāreyya: ‘cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī’ti; evamevaṁ bhotā gotamena anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
translation-en-sujato: As if he were righting the overturned, or revealing the hidden, or pointing out the path to the lost, or lighting a lamp in the dark so people with good eyes can see what’s there, Master Gotama has made the Teaching clear in many ways.

root-pli-ms: Esāhaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
translation-en-sujato: I go for refuge to Master Gotama, to the teaching, and to the mendicant Saṅgha.

root-pli-ms: Upāsakaṁ maṁ bhavaṁ gotamo dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gatan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”

root-pli-ms: Tevijjasutta
translation-en-sujato: The Three Knowledges
translation-ru-team: Тройное Знание

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
translation-en-sujato: So I have heard.
translation-ru-team: Так я слышал:

root-pli-ms: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā kosalesu cārikaṁ caramāno mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi yena manasākaṭaṁ nāma kosalānaṁ brāhmaṇagāmo tadavasari.
translation-en-sujato: At one time the Buddha was wandering in the land of the Kosalans together with a large Saṅgha of five hundred mendicants when he arrived at a village of the Kosalan brahmins named Manasākaṭa.
translation-ru-team: Однажды Будда странствовал в стране косал вместе с собранием из пятиста монахов, где он пришёл в село косалских брахманов под названием Манасаката.

root-pli-ms: Tatra sudaṁ bhagavā manasākaṭe viharati uttarena manasākaṭassa aciravatiyā nadiyā tīre ambavane.
translation-en-sujato: He stayed in a mango grove on a bank of the river Aciravatī to the north of Manasākaṭa.
translation-ru-team: Он остановился в манговой роще, на берегу реки Ачиравати, к северу от Манасакаты.

root-pli-ms: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā abhiññātā abhiññātā brāhmaṇamahāsālā manasākaṭe paṭivasanti, seyyathidaṁ—
translation-en-sujato: Now at that time several very well-known well-to-do brahmins were residing in Manasākaṭa. They included
translation-ru-team: В то же время несколько известных и богатых брахманов находилось в селе Манасаката. Среди них присутствовали:

root-pli-ms: caṅkī brāhmaṇo tārukkho brāhmaṇo pokkharasāti brāhmaṇo jāṇusoṇi brāhmaṇo todeyyo brāhmaṇo aññe ca abhiññātā abhiññātā brāhmaṇamahāsālā.
translation-en-sujato: the brahmins Caṅkī, Tārukkha, Pokkharasāti, Jāṇussoṇi, Todeyya, and others.
translation-ru-team: Чанки, Таруккха, Поккхарасати, Джануссони, Тодейя, итд.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho vāseṭṭhabhāradvājānaṁ māṇavānaṁ jaṅghavihāraṁ anucaṅkamantānaṁ anuvicarantānaṁ maggāmagge kathā udapādi.
translation-en-sujato: Then as the students Vāseṭṭha and Bhāradvāja were going for a walk they began a discussion regarding the variety of paths.
translation-ru-team: Тогда, выйдя на прогулку, два молодых ученика, Васеттха и Бхарадваджа, начали дискуссию про духовные пути.
reference: dr9.319, km15.244, ms6D_892, msdiv520, pts-cs3, pts-vp-pli1.236, sc3

root-pli-ms: Atha kho vāseṭṭho māṇavo evamāha:
translation-en-sujato: Vāseṭṭha said this:
translation-ru-team: Васеттха сказал так:

root-pli-ms: “ayameva ujumaggo, ayamañjasāyano niyyāniko niyyāti takkarassa brahmasahabyatāya, yvāyaṁ akkhāto brāhmaṇena pokkharasātinā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “This is the only straight path, the direct route that leads someone who practices it to the company of Brahmā; namely, that explained by the brahmin Pokkharasāti.”
translation-ru-team: "Это единый прямой путь, это прямая дорога к спасению которая ведёт тех, кто ей следует, к Брахме. Этому учит брахман Поккхарасати."
comment-en-sujato: brahmasahabyatāya does not mean “union with Brahmā” as per RD and MW. It means “rebirth as one of the members of Brahma’s retinue”, as per AN 4.13 etc.

root-pli-ms: Bhāradvājopi māṇavo evamāha:
translation-en-sujato: Bhāradvāja said this:
translation-ru-team: Бхарадваджа сказал так:

root-pli-ms: “ayameva ujumaggo, ayamañjasāyano niyyāniko, niyyāti takkarassa brahmasahabyatāya, yvāyaṁ akkhāto brāhmaṇena tārukkhenā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “This is the only straight path, the direct route that leads someone who practices it to the company of Brahmā; namely, that explained by the brahmin Tārukkha.”
translation-ru-team: "Это единый прямой путь, это прямая дорога к спасению, которая ведёт тех, кто ей следует, к Брахме. Тому учит брахман Таруккха."

root-pli-ms: Neva kho asakkhi vāseṭṭho māṇavo bhāradvājaṁ māṇavaṁ saññāpetuṁ, na pana asakkhi bhāradvājo māṇavo vāseṭṭhaṁ māṇavaṁ saññāpetuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: But neither was able to persuade the other.
translation-ru-team: Так они и спорили, но ученик Васеттха не смог убедить ученика Бхарадваджу, и ученик Бхарадваджа не смог убедить ученика Васеттху.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho vāseṭṭho māṇavo bhāradvājaṁ māṇavaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: So Vāseṭṭha said to Bhāradvāja,
translation-ru-team: В конце Васеттха сказал Бхарадвадже так:

root-pli-ms: “ayaṁ kho, bhāradvāja, samaṇo gotamo sakyaputto sakyakulā pabbajito manasākaṭe viharati uttarena manasākaṭassa aciravatiyā nadiyā tīre ambavane.
translation-en-sujato: “Bhāradvāja, the ascetic Gotama—a Sakyan, gone forth from a Sakyan family—is staying in a mango grove on a bank of the river Aciravatī to the north of Manasākaṭa.
translation-ru-team: "Бхарадваджа, тот аскет Готама — сакья, которой ушёл из свего клана — сейчас находится в манговой роще, на берегу реки Ачиравати, к северу от Манасакаты.

root-pli-ms: Taṁ kho pana bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ evaṁ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggato:
translation-en-sujato: He has this good reputation:
translation-ru-team: Я слышал много хорошего про этого Готаму:

root-pli-ms: ‘itipi so bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṁ buddho bhagavā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘That Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those who wish to train, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.’
translation-ru-team: "Тот Готама достигнул совершенства Араханта, полностью пробуждённый, совершенный в знании и поведении, благородный, знаток мира, непревзойдённый учитель для всех, кто хочет учиться, учитель людей и богов: он Будда."

root-pli-ms: Āyāma, bho bhāradvāja, yena samaṇo gotamo tenupasaṅkamissāma; upasaṅkamitvā etamatthaṁ samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ pucchissāma.
translation-en-sujato: Come, let’s go to see him and ask him about this matter.
translation-ru-team: Давай пойдём к нему, и спросим его про наш спор.

root-pli-ms: Yathā no samaṇo gotamo byākarissati, tathā naṁ dhāressāmā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: As he answers, so we’ll remember it.”
translation-ru-team: Так как он скажет, мы так и запомним."

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bho”ti kho bhāradvājo māṇavo vāseṭṭhassa māṇavassa paccassosi.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” replied Bhāradvāja.
translation-ru-team: "Согласен," - ответил ученик Бхарадваджа, и они пошли вмести к аскету Готаме.

root-pli-ms: 1. Maggāmaggakathā
translation-en-sujato: 1. The Variety of Paths
translation-ru-team: 1. Объяснение о разных путях

root-pli-ms: Atha kho vāseṭṭhabhāradvājā māṇavā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodiṁsu.
translation-en-sujato: So they went to the Buddha, and exchanged greetings with him.
translation-ru-team: Итак, ученики Васеттха и Бхарадваджа пришли к Будде, вежливо обменялись приветствиями и сели рядом.

root-pli-ms: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho vāseṭṭho māṇavo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, they sat down to one side and Vāseṭṭha told him of their conversation, adding:
translation-ru-team: После того как ученики и Будда обменялись вежливыми приветствиями, Васеттха рассказал ему про свою беседу с Бхарадваджой. После этого он сказал:

root-pli-ms: “idha, bho gotama, amhākaṁ jaṅghavihāraṁ anucaṅkamantānaṁ anuvicarantānaṁ maggāmagge kathā udapādi.
Ahaṁ evaṁ vadāmi:
‘ayameva ujumaggo, ayamañjasāyano niyyāniko niyyāti takkarassa brahmasahabyatāya, yvāyaṁ akkhāto brāhmaṇena pokkharasātinā’ti.
Bhāradvājo māṇavo evamāha:
‘ayameva ujumaggo ayamañjasāyano niyyāniko niyyāti takkarassa brahmasahabyatāya, yvāyaṁ akkhāto brāhmaṇena tārukkhenā’ti.
Ettha, bho gotama, attheva viggaho, atthi vivādo, atthi nānāvādo”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “In this matter we have a dispute, a disagreement, a difference of opinion.”
translation-ru-team: "У нас в этом деле спор, несогласие, и разница во мнениях."

root-pli-ms: “Iti kira, vāseṭṭha, tvaṁ evaṁ vadesi:
translation-en-sujato: “So, Vāseṭṭha, it seems that you say that

root-pli-ms: Kiñcāpi, bho gotama, brāhmaṇā nānāmagge paññāpenti, addhariyā brāhmaṇā tittiriyā brāhmaṇā chandokā brāhmaṇā bavhārijjhā brāhmaṇā, atha kho sabbāni tāni niyyānikā niyyanti takkarassa brahmasahabyatāya.
translation-en-sujato: Even though brahmins describe different paths—the Addhariya brahmins, the Tittiriya brahmins, the Chandoka brahmins, and the Bavhadija brahmins—all of them lead someone who practices them to the company of Brahmā.
translation-ru-team: Хоть и каждый брахман учит о своём собственном пути — Аддхария, Титтирия, Чандока, и Бавхадиджа — все они ведут того, кто практикует их, в компанию Брахмы.
comment-en-sujato: The identity of these groups is described in the appendix to Jayatilleke’s Early Buddhist Theory of Knowledge, p. 481. Accordingly, brahmacariya used by MW and PTS should be rejected. Skt is Bahvṛca. I use the variant Bavhadija since it is closest to that. Note that Jayatilleke quotes RD SBE 11 as giving the variant Bavharija, but this is incorrect, in fact he has the same variant as PTS, i.e. Bavhadija. Bavharija would be preferable, but I can’t find it attested.

root-pli-ms: Seyyathāpi, bho gotama, gāmassa vā nigamassa vā avidūre bahūni cepi nānāmaggāni bhavanti, atha kho sabbāni tāni gāmasamosaraṇāni bhavanti;
translation-en-sujato: It’s like a village or town that has many different roads nearby, yet all of them meet at that village.
translation-ru-team: Это как город или деревня, около которой много дорог, но все они ведут туда.

root-pli-ms: evameva kho, bho gotama, kiñcāpi brāhmaṇā nānāmagge paññāpenti, addhariyā brāhmaṇā tittiriyā brāhmaṇā chandokā brāhmaṇā bavhārijjhā brāhmaṇā, atha kho sabbāni tāni niyyānikā niyyanti takkarassa brahmasahabyatāyā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: In the same way, even though brahmins describe different paths—the Addhariya brahmins, the Tittiriya brahmins, the Chandoka brahmins, and the Bavhadija brahmins—all of them lead someone who practices them to the company of Brahmā.”
translation-ru-team: И точно так же все эти пути брахманов — Аддхария, Титтирия, Чандока, и Бавхадиджа —  все они ведут того, кто практикует их, в компанию Брахмы.

translation-en-sujato: In the same way, it seems to me that the brahmins’ statement turns out to be comparable to a queue of blind men: the first one does not see, the middle one does not see, and the last one does not see.
translation-ru-team: Точно также мне кажется, что утверждения брахманов сравнимы с той очередью слепых:  первый не видит, средний не видит, и последний не видит.

Yepi kira tevijjānaṁ brāhmaṇānaṁ pubbakā isayo mantānaṁ kattāro mantānaṁ pavattāro, yesamidaṁ etarahi tevijjā brāhmaṇā porāṇaṁ mantapadaṁ gītaṁ pavuttaṁ samihitaṁ, tadanugāyanti, tadanubhāsanti, bhāsitamanubhāsanti, vācitamanuvācenti, seyyathidaṁ—aṭṭhako vāmako vāmadevo vessāmitto yamataggi aṅgīraso bhāradvājo vāseṭṭho kassapo bhagu, tepi na evamāhaṁsu:

translation-ru-team: Мимо проходит человек который хочет перейти на дальний берег.

root-pli-ms: ‘ehi pārāpāraṁ, ehi pārāpāran’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Come here, far shore! Come here, far shore!’
translation-ru-team: "Дальний берег! Приплыви сюда, дальний берег!"

root-pli-ms: Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, vāseṭṭha,
translation-en-sujato: What do you think, Vāseṭṭha?
translation-ru-team: Как ты думаешь, Васеттха?

root-pli-ms: api nu tassa purisassa avhāyanahetu vā āyācanahetu vā patthanahetu vā abhinandanahetu vā aciravatiyā nadiyā pārimaṁ tīraṁ orimaṁ tīraṁ āgaccheyyā”ti?
translation-en-sujato: Would the far shore of the Aciravatī river come over to the near shore because of that man’s call, request, desire, or expectation?”

root-pli-ms: “Evameva kho, vāseṭṭha, tevijjā brāhmaṇā ye dhammā brāhmaṇakārakā te dhamme pahāya vattamānā, ye dhammā abrāhmaṇakārakā te dhamme samādāya vattamānā evamāhaṁsu:
translation-en-sujato: “In the same way, Vāseṭṭha, the brahmins proficient in the three Vedas proceed having given up those things that make one a true brahmin, and having undertaken those things that make one not a true brahmin. Yet they say:
translation-ru-team: "Так же, Васеттха, брахманы сведущие в трёх Ведах опускают практику тех качеств, которые действительно делают человека брахманом. Но они говорят:

root-pli-ms: ‘indamavhayāma, somamavhayāma, varuṇamavhayāma, īsānamavhayāma, pajāpatimavhayāma, brahmamavhayāma, mahiddhimavhayāma, yamamavhayāmā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘We call upon Inda! We call upon Soma! We call upon Īsāna! We call upon Pajāpati! We call upon Brahmā! We call upon Mahiddhi! We call upon Yama!’
translation-ru-team: "Мы призываем  Инду! Мы призываем Сому! Мы призываем Исану! Мы призываем Паджапати! Мы призываем Брахму! Мы призываем Махиддхи! Мы призываем Яму!"

root-pli-ms: Te vata, vāseṭṭha, tevijjā brāhmaṇā ye dhammā brāhmaṇakārakā te dhamme pahāya vattamānā, ye dhammā abrāhmaṇakārakā te dhamme samādāya vattamānā avhāyanahetu vā āyācanahetu vā patthanahetu vā abhinandanahetu vā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā brahmānaṁ sahabyūpagā bhavissantīti, netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
translation-en-sujato: So long as they proceed in this way it’s impossible that they will, when the body breaks up, after death, be reborn in the company of Brahmā.
translation-ru-team: И пока они так практикуют, им будет невозможно переродиться после смерти и распада тела в мире Брахмы.

root-pli-ms: Seyyathāpi, vāseṭṭha, ayaṁ aciravatī nadī pūrā udakassa samatittikā kākapeyyā.

translation-ru-team: Мимо проходит человек который хочет перейти на дальний берег.

root-pli-ms: So orime tīre daḷhāya anduyā pacchābāhaṁ gāḷhabandhanaṁ baddho.
translation-en-sujato: But while still on the near shore, their arms are tied tightly behind their back with a strong chain.
translation-ru-team: И пока он стоит на берегу, его руки крепко связаны цепью за спиной.

root-pli-ms: Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, vāseṭṭha,
translation-en-sujato: What do you think, Vāseṭṭha?
translation-ru-team: Как ты думаешь, Васеттха?

root-pli-ms: api nu so puriso aciravatiyā nadiyā orimā tīrā pārimaṁ tīraṁ gaccheyyā”ti?

translation-en-sujato: Why is that?
translation-ru-team: И почему?

root-pli-ms: “Amu hi, bho gotama, puriso manasākaṭe jātasaṁvaddho, tassa sabbāneva manasākaṭassa maggāni suviditānī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Because they were born and raised in Manasākaṭa. They’re well acquainted with all the roads to the village.”
translation-ru-team: Потому что они родились и выросли в этой деревне. Они хорошо знают все дороги к ней."

root-pli-ms: “Siyā kho, vāseṭṭha, tassa purisassa manasākaṭe jātasaṁvaddhassa manasākaṭassa maggaṁ puṭṭhassa dandhāyitattaṁ vā vitthāyitattaṁ vā, na tveva tathāgatassa brahmaloke vā brahmalokagāminiyā vā paṭipadāya puṭṭhassa dandhāyitattaṁ vā vitthāyitattaṁ vā.
translation-en-sujato: “Still, it’s possible they might be slow or hesitant to answer. But the Realized One is never slow or hesitant when questioned about the Brahmā realm or the practice that leads to the Brahmā realm.
translation-ru-team: "Тем не менее, возможно, что они ответят медленно или задумчиво. Но Пробуждённый никогда не отвечает медленно или задумчиво, когда его спрашивают про царство Брахмы или про духовный путь, который ведет в царство Брахмы.

root-pli-ms: Brahmānañcāhaṁ, vāseṭṭha, pajānāmi brahmalokañca brahmalokagāminiñca paṭipadaṁ, yathā paṭipanno ca brahmalokaṁ upapanno, tañca pajānāmī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: I understand Brahmā, the Brahmā realm, and the practice that leads to the Brahmā realm, practicing in accordance with which one is reborn in the Brahmā realm.”
translation-ru-team: Я знаю Брахму, его царство, и путь который ведет в его царство, практикуя в соответствии с которым человек перерождается в царстве Брахмы."

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vutte, vāseṭṭho māṇavo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: When he said this, Vāseṭṭha said to the Buddha,
