root-pli-ms: “sutaṁ metaṁ, bho gotama, samaṇo gotamo brahmānaṁ sahabyatāya maggaṁ desetī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “I have heard, Master Gotama, that you teach the path to company with Brahmā.
translation-ru-team: "Я слышал, почтенный Готама, что вы знаете духовный путь к Брахме.
comment-en-sujato: Quotes are incoorect in text. Apparently the statement itslef is taken as a quote, I have heard “…”

root-pli-ms: “Sādhu no bhavaṁ gotamo brahmānaṁ sahabyatāya maggaṁ desetu ullumpatu bhavaṁ gotamo brāhmaṇiṁ pajan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Please teach us that path and elevate this generation of brahmins.”
translation-ru-team: Пожалуйста, учите нас, почтенный Готама. Спасите это поколение брахманов."

root-pli-ms: “Tena hi, vāseṭṭha, suṇāhi; sādhukaṁ manasi karohi; bhāsissāmī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Well then, Vāseṭṭha, listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
translation-ru-team: "Ну что же, Васеттха, тогда слушай меня внимательно."
comment-en-sujato: Note he addresses Vasettha alone in singular.

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bho”ti kho vāseṭṭho māṇavo bhagavato paccassosi.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” replied Vāseṭṭha.
translation-ru-team: "Да, почтенный Готама."

root-pli-ms: tassime pañca nīvaraṇe pahīne attani samanupassato pāmojjaṁ jāyati, pamuditassa pīti jāyati, pītimanassa kāyo passambhati, passaddhakāyo sukhaṁ vedeti, sukhino cittaṁ samādhiyati.
translation-en-sujato: Seeing that the hindrances have been given up in them, joy springs up. Being joyful, rapture springs up. When the mind is full of rapture, the body becomes tranquil. When the body is tranquil, they feel bliss. And when blissful, the mind becomes immersed.
translation-ru-team: видит, что пять помех устранены, он становится радостным. Будучи радостным, он становится восхищён. Когда ум полон восхищения, тело успокаивается. Когда тело успокоено, он чувствует лёгкость. С облегчением, ум становится собран.

root-pli-ms: So mettāsahagatena cetasā ekaṁ disaṁ pharitvā viharati. Tathā dutiyaṁ. Tathā tatiyaṁ. Tathā catutthaṁ. Iti uddhamadho tiriyaṁ sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantaṁ lokaṁ mettāsahagatena cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena pharitvā viharati.
translation-en-sujato: They meditate spreading a heart full of love to one direction, and to the second, and to the third, and to the fourth. In the same way above, below, across, everywhere, all around, they spread a heart full of love to the whole world—abundant, expansive, limitless, free of enmity and ill will.
translation-ru-team: Он медитирует распространяя доброжелательность из своего сердца в одну сторону, в другую, в третью, и в четвёртую. Таким же образом он распространяет доброжелательность вверх, вниз, поперёк, везде, и вокруг во весь мир — обильно, обширно, безгранично, и без враждебности и недоброжелательности.

root-pli-ms: Seyyathāpi, vāseṭṭha, balavā saṅkhadhamo appakasireneva catuddisā viññāpeyya;
translation-en-sujato: Suppose there was a powerful horn blower. They’d easily make themselves heard in the four directions.
translation-ru-team: Представь себе человека который может сильно дуть в рог. Его все услышат с легкостью во всех четырёх сторонах.

root-pli-ms: evameva kho, vāseṭṭha, evaṁ bhāvitāya mettāya cetovimuttiyā yaṁ pamāṇakataṁ kammaṁ na taṁ tatrāvasissati, na taṁ tatrāvatiṭṭhati.
translation-en-sujato: In the same way, when the heart’s release by love has been developed and cultivated like this, any limited deeds they’ve done don’t remain or persist there.
translation-ru-team: Таким же образом, когда освобождение сердца доброжелательностью развито и взращено, любые ограниченные поступки, которые он совершил, не остаются и не имеют места быть.

root-pli-ms: Ayampi kho, vāseṭṭha, brahmānaṁ sahabyatāya maggo.
translation-en-sujato: This is a path to companionship with Brahmā.
translation-ru-team: Это путь в царство Брахмы.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, vāseṭṭha, bhikkhu karuṇāsahagatena cetasā …pe…
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, a mendicant meditates spreading a heart full of compassion …
translation-ru-team: Кроме того, монах медитирует, распространяя сострадание из своего сердца ...

translation-en-sujato: They meditate spreading a heart full of rejoicing …
translation-ru-team: И он медитирует, распространяя удовлетворённость ...

root-pli-ms: upekkhāsahagatena cetasā ekaṁ disaṁ pharitvā viharati. Tathā dutiyaṁ. Tathā tatiyaṁ. Tathā catutthaṁ. Iti uddhamadho tiriyaṁ sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantaṁ lokaṁ upekkhāsahagatena cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena pharitvā viharati.
translation-en-sujato: They meditate spreading a heart full of equanimity to one direction, and to the second, and to the third, and to the fourth. In the same way above, below, across, everywhere, all around, they spread a heart full of equanimity to the whole world—abundant, expansive, limitless, free of enmity and ill will.
translation-ru-team: Он медитирует, распространяя равностность из своего сердца в одну сторону, в другую, в третью, и в четвёртую. Таким же образом он распространяет равностность вверх, вниз, поперёк, везде, и вокруг во весь мир — обильно, обширно, безгранично, и без враждебности и недоброжелательности.

root-pli-ms: Seyyathāpi, vāseṭṭha, balavā saṅkhadhamo appakasireneva catuddisā viññāpeyya;
translation-en-sujato: Suppose there was a powerful horn blower. They’d easily make themselves heard in the four directions.
translation-ru-team: Представь себе человека который может сильно дуть в рог. Его все услышат с легкостью во всех четырёх сторонах.

root-pli-ms: evameva kho, vāseṭṭha, evaṁ bhāvitāya upekkhāya cetovimuttiyā yaṁ pamāṇakataṁ kammaṁ na taṁ tatrāvasissati, na taṁ tatrāvatiṭṭhati.
translation-en-sujato: In the same way, when the heart’s release by equanimity has been developed and cultivated like this, any limited deeds they’ve done don’t remain or persist there.
translation-ru-team: Таким же образом, когда освобождение сердца равностностью развито и взращено, любые ограниченные поступки, которые он совершил, не остаются и не имеют места быть.

root-pli-ms: Ayampi kho, vāseṭṭha, brahmānaṁ sahabyatāya maggo.
translation-en-sujato: This too is a path to companionship with Brahmā.
translation-ru-team: Это тоже путь в царство Брахмы.

root-pli-ms: Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, vāseṭṭha,
translation-en-sujato: What do you think, Vāseṭṭha?
translation-ru-team: Как ты думаешь, Васеттха?

root-pli-ms: evaṁvihārī bhikkhu sapariggaho vā apariggaho vā”ti?

root-pli-ms: “Apariggaho, bho gotama”.
translation-en-sujato: “They are not.”
translation-ru-team: "Нет, не собственнический, почтенный Готама."
comment-en-sujato: This shows that pariggaha here must be possessiveness rather than possessions: just getting into a meditation doesn’t mean you have no possessions, see eg DN 17.

root-pli-ms: “Saveracitto vā averacitto vā”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “Is their heart full of enmity or not?”
translation-ru-team: "Его сердце полно враждебности или нет?"

root-pli-ms: “Averacitto, bho gotama”.
translation-en-sujato: “It is not.”
translation-ru-team: "Нет, не полно враждебности, почтенный Готама."

root-pli-ms: “Sabyāpajjacitto vā abyāpajjacitto vā”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “Is their heart full of ill will or not?”

root-pli-ms: “Abyāpajjacitto, bho gotama”.
translation-en-sujato: “It is not.”

root-pli-ms: “Asaṅkiliṭṭhacitto, bho gotama”.
translation-en-sujato: “It is not.”
translation-ru-team: "Нет, не развращено, почтенный Готама."

root-pli-ms: “Vasavattī vā avasavattī vā”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “Do they wield power or not?”
translation-ru-team: "Он обладает могуществом или нет?"

root-pli-ms: “Vasavattī, bho gotama”.
translation-en-sujato: “They do.”
translation-ru-team: "Да, он обладает могуществом, почтенный Готама."

root-pli-ms: “Iti kira, vāseṭṭha, apariggaho bhikkhu, apariggaho brahmā.
translation-en-sujato: “So it seems that that mendicant is not possessive, and neither is Brahmā.
translation-ru-team: "Выходит, что монах не является собственническим, как Брахма.

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bho gotama”.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, Master Gotama.”
translation-ru-team: "Да, почтенный Готама."

root-pli-ms: “Sādhu, vāseṭṭha, so vata vāseṭṭha apariggaho bhikkhu kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apariggahassa brahmuno sahabyūpago bhavissatīti, ṭhānametaṁ vijjati.
translation-en-sujato: “Good, Vāseṭṭha! It’s possible that a mendicant who is not possessive will, when the body breaks up, after death, be reborn in the company of Brahmā, who isn’t possessive.
translation-ru-team: "Хорошо, Васеттха. Такому монаху будет возможно переродиться после смерти и распада тела в мире Брахмы.

root-pli-ms: Iti kira, vāseṭṭha, averacitto bhikkhu, averacitto brahmā …pe…
translation-en-sujato: And it seems that that mendicant has no enmity,
translation-ru-team: Монах не является собственническим,

root-pli-ms: abyāpajjacitto bhikkhu, abyāpajjacitto brahmā …
translation-en-sujato: ill will,
translation-ru-team: не имеет недоброжелательности,

root-pli-ms: asaṅkiliṭṭhacitto bhikkhu, asaṅkiliṭṭhacitto brahmā …
translation-en-sujato: corruption,
translation-ru-team: он не развращен,

root-pli-ms: vasavattī bhikkhu, vasavattī brahmā, api nu kho vasavattissa bhikkhuno vasavattinā brahmunā saddhiṁ saṁsandati sametī”ti?
translation-en-sujato: and does wield power, while Brahmā is the same in all these things. Would a mendicant who is the same as Brahmā in all things come together and converge with him?”
translation-ru-team: и он обладает могуществом, в то время как Брахма является таким же. Может ли такой монах переродится в мире Брахмы и сойтись с ним?"

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bho gotama”.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, Master Gotama.”
translation-ru-team: "Да, почтенный Готама."

root-pli-ms: “Sādhu, vāseṭṭha, so vata, vāseṭṭha, vasavattī bhikkhu kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā vasavattissa brahmuno sahabyūpago bhavissatīti, ṭhānametaṁ vijjatī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Good, Vāseṭṭha! It’s possible that that mendicant will, when the body breaks up, after death, be reborn in the company of Brahmā.”
translation-ru-team: "Хорошо, Васеттха. Такому монаху будет возможно переродиться после смерти и распада тела в мире Брахмы."

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vutte, vāseṭṭhabhāradvājā māṇavā bhagavantaṁ etadavocuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: When he had spoken, Vāseṭṭha and Bhāradvāja said to him,
translation-ru-team: После того как Будда закончил говорить, Васеттха и Бхарадваджа ему вмести сказали:
reference: csp1ed6.236, csp2ed6.236, km15.279, mc9.247, ms6D_956, msdiv559, pts-cs82, sc67

root-pli-ms: “abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama, abhikkantaṁ, bho gotama.
translation-en-sujato: “Excellent, Master Gotama! Excellent!
translation-ru-team: "Замечательно, почтенный Готама! Просто замечательно!

root-pli-ms: Seyyathāpi, bho gotama, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṁ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṁ dhāreyya: ‘cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī’ti; evamevaṁ bhotā gotamena anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
translation-en-sujato: As if he were righting the overturned, or revealing the hidden, or pointing out the path to the lost, or lighting a lamp in the dark so people with good eyes can see what’s there, Master Gotama has made the teaching clear in many ways.
translation-ru-team: Как будто он перевернул назад что-то перевёрнутое, или раскрыл что-то закрытое, или показал дорогу заблудившему, или зажег лампу в темноте, чтобы люди с хорошими глазами могли видеть что там, почтенный Готама разъяснил учение со многих сторон.

root-pli-ms: Ete mayaṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāma, dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
translation-en-sujato: We go for refuge to Master Gotama, to the teaching, and to the mendicant Saṅgha.
translation-ru-team: Мы принимаем прибежище в почтенном Готаме, и дхамме, и сангхе монахов.

root-pli-ms: Upāsake no bhavaṁ gotamo dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupete saraṇaṁ gate”ti.
translation-en-sujato: From this day forth, may Master Gotama remember us as lay followers who have gone for refuge for life.”
translation-ru-team: Начиная с этого дня, пусть почтенный Готама помнит нас как его последователей, которые приняли прибежище на всю жизнь."

root-pli-ms: Mahāpadānasutta
translation-en-sujato: The Great Discourse on the Harvest of Deeds
comment-en-sujato: The title is not easy to translate. There is no reason to think apadāna was yet in use as a standard term for “story of past lives”; rather, such usage derived from here. Chinese versions of the text have completely different titles: “Seven Buddhas”, “The Great Root”, “Vipassi Buddha”, “The Lineage of the Seven Past Buddhas”. Only the second of these might relate to the Pali. The sense seems to have been “(story about) reaping results of deeds”.

translation-en-sujato: With clairaudience that is purified and superhuman, the Buddha heard that discussion among the mendicants.
reference: cck10.2, ms7D_3, msdiv2, pts-cs1.2, sc2, vri2.2

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā uṭṭhāyāsanā yena karerimaṇḍalamāḷo tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi, nisajja kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: So he got up from his seat and went to the pavilion, where he sat on the seat spread out and addressed the mendicants,

root-pli-ms: “kāya nuttha, bhikkhave, etarahi kathāya sannisinnā; kā ca pana vo antarākathā vippakatā”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “Mendicants, what were you sitting talking about just now? What conversation was unfinished?”

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vutte, te bhikkhū bhagavantaṁ etadavocuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: The mendicants told him what had happened, adding,

root-pli-ms: “idha, bhante, amhākaṁ pacchābhattaṁ piṇḍapātapaṭikkantānaṁ karerimaṇḍalamāḷe sannisinnānaṁ sannipatitānaṁ pubbenivāsapaṭisaṁyuttā dhammī kathā udapādi:
‘itipi pubbenivāso itipi pubbenivāso’ti.
Ayaṁ kho no, bhante, antarākathā vippakatā. Atha bhagavā anuppatto”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “This is the conversation that was unfinished when the Buddha arrived.”

root-pli-ms: “Iccheyyātha no tumhe, bhikkhave, pubbenivāsapaṭisaṁyuttaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ sotun”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “Would you like to hear a Dhamma talk on the subject of past lives?”
reference: bj8.4, csp1ed7.2, csp2ed7.2, mc10.2, ms7D_5, msdiv3, ndp7.4, pts-cs1.3, sc4

root-pli-ms: “Etassa, bhagavā, kālo; etassa, sugata, kālo;
translation-en-sujato: “Now is the time, Blessed One! Now is the time, Holy One!

root-pli-ms: yaṁ bhagavā pubbenivāsapaṭisaṁyuttaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ kareyya, bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressantī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Let the Buddha give a Dhamma talk on the subject of past lives. The mendicants will listen and remember it.”

root-pli-ms: “Tena hi, bhikkhave, suṇātha sādhukaṁ manasi karotha bhāsissāmī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Well then, mendicants, listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” they replied.

root-pli-ms: Bhagavā etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: The Buddha said this:

root-pli-ms: “Ito so, bhikkhave, ekanavutikappe yaṁ vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho loke udapādi.
translation-en-sujato: “Ninety-one eons ago, the Buddha Vipassī arose in the world, perfected and fully awakened.
variant-pli-ms: ekanavutikappe → ekanavuto kappo (bj, sya-all, km, pts1ed)

root-pli-ms: Ito so, bhikkhave, ekatiṁse kappe yaṁ sikhī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho loke udapādi.
translation-en-sujato: Thirty-one eons ago, the Buddha Sikhī arose in the world, perfected and fully awakened.
variant-pli-ms: ekatiṁse kappe → ekatiṁso kappo (bj, sya-all, km, pts1ed)

root-pli-ms: Tasmiññeva kho, bhikkhave, ekatiṁse kappe vessabhū bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho loke udapādi.
translation-en-sujato: In the same thirty-first eon, the Buddha Vessabhū arose in the world, perfected and fully awakened.

root-pli-ms: Imasmiññeva kho, bhikkhave, bhaddakappe kakusandho bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho loke udapādi.
translation-en-sujato: In the present fortunate eon, the Buddhas Kakusandha,

root-pli-ms: Imasmiññeva kho, bhikkhave, bhaddakappe koṇāgamano bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho loke udapādi.
translation-en-sujato: Koṇāgamana,

root-pli-ms: Imasmiññeva kho, bhikkhave, bhaddakappe kassapo bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho loke udapādi.
translation-en-sujato: and Kassapa arose in the world, perfected and fully awakened.

root-pli-ms: Imasmiññeva kho, bhikkhave, bhaddakappe ahaṁ etarahi arahaṁ sammāsambuddho loke uppanno.
translation-en-sujato: And in the present fortunate eon, I have arisen in the world, perfected and fully awakened.

root-pli-ms: Vipassī, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho khattiyo jātiyā ahosi, khattiyakule udapādi.
translation-en-sujato: The Buddhas Vipassī,
reference: dr10.3, ms7D_7, msdiv5, pts-cs1.5, pts-vp-pli2.3, sc6, sya10.3, vri2.3

root-pli-ms: Sikhī, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho khattiyo jātiyā ahosi, khattiyakule udapādi.
translation-en-sujato: Sikhī,

root-pli-ms: Vessabhū, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho khattiyo jātiyā ahosi, khattiyakule udapādi.
translation-en-sujato: and Vessabhū were born as aristocrats into aristocrat families.

root-pli-ms: Kakusandho, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho brāhmaṇo jātiyā ahosi, brāhmaṇakule udapādi.
translation-en-sujato: The Buddhas Kakusandha,

root-pli-ms: Koṇāgamano, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho brāhmaṇo jātiyā ahosi, brāhmaṇakule udapādi.
translation-en-sujato: Koṇāgamana,

root-pli-ms: Kassapo, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho brāhmaṇo jātiyā ahosi, brāhmaṇakule udapādi.
translation-en-sujato: and Kassapa were born as brahmins into brahmin families.

root-pli-ms: Ahaṁ, bhikkhave, etarahi arahaṁ sammāsambuddho khattiyo jātiyā ahosiṁ, khattiyakule uppanno.
translation-en-sujato: I was born as an aristocrat into an aristocrat family.

root-pli-ms: Vipassī, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho koṇḍañño gottena ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: Koṇḍañña was the clan of Vipassī,
reference: bj8.6, cck10.4, csp1ed7.3, csp2ed7.3, mc10.3, ms7D_8, msdiv6, ndp7.5, pts-cs1.6, sc7

root-pli-ms: Sikhī, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho koṇḍañño gottena ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: Sikhī,

root-pli-ms: Vessabhū, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho koṇḍañño gottena ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: and Vessabhū.

root-pli-ms: Kakusandho, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho kassapo gottena ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: Kassapa was the clan of Kakusandha,

root-pli-ms: Koṇāgamano, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho kassapo gottena ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: Koṇāgamana,

root-pli-ms: Kassapo, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho kassapo gottena ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: and Kassapa.

root-pli-ms: Ahaṁ, bhikkhave, etarahi arahaṁ sammāsambuddho gotamo gottena ahosiṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Gotama is my clan.

root-pli-ms: Vipassissa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa asītivassasahassāni āyuppamāṇaṁ ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: Vipassī lived for 80,000 years.
comment-en-sujato: Both RD and MW say this is the lifespan in that eon. And it is true that this is the normal usage of ayuppamana. However, in such cases the subject in genitive is given as plural, to denote the entire generation, etc. Here it is singular, and specifies only Vipassi. Sure, it’s likely that this would have been typical, but I don’t think that’s what the text is saying. Note that when the Buddha speaks of his own life, he uses a different phrasing. If ayuppamana here referred to the lifespan of the current generation, there would be no reason for the Buddha to not apply it to himself. But if it means that of the individual, then it makes sense why he would shift to a more indirect statement.
reference: dr10.4, ms7D_9, msdiv7, pts-cs1.7, pts-vp-pli2.4, sc8, sya10.4

root-pli-ms: Sikhissa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa sattativassasahassāni āyuppamāṇaṁ ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: Sikhī lived for 70,000 years.

root-pli-ms: Vessabhussa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa saṭṭhivassasahassāni āyuppamāṇaṁ ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: Vessabhū lived for 60,000 years.

root-pli-ms: Kakusandhassa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa cattālīsavassasahassāni āyuppamāṇaṁ ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: Kakusandha lived for 40,000 years.

root-pli-ms: Koṇāgamanassa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa tiṁsavassasahassāni āyuppamāṇaṁ ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: Koṇāgamana lived for 30,000 years.

root-pli-ms: Kassapassa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa vīsativassasahassāni āyuppamāṇaṁ ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: Kassapa lived for 20,000 years.

root-pli-ms: Mayhaṁ, bhikkhave, etarahi appakaṁ āyuppamāṇaṁ parittaṁ lahukaṁ; yo ciraṁ jīvati, so vassasataṁ appaṁ vā bhiyyo.
translation-en-sujato: For me these days the life-span is short, brief, and fleeting. A long-lived person lives for a century or a little more.

root-pli-ms: Vipassī, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho pāṭaliyā mūle abhisambuddho.
translation-en-sujato: Vipassī was awakened at the root of a trumpet flower tree.

root-pli-ms: Sikhī, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho puṇḍarīkassa mūle abhisambuddho.
translation-en-sujato: Sikhī was awakened at the root of a white-mango tree.
comment-en-sujato: puṇḍarīka is the white lotus; Comm says this is setamba, which must have been a tree with lotus-like flowers, I guess.

root-pli-ms: Vessabhū, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho sālassa mūle abhisambuddho.
translation-en-sujato: Vessabhū was awakened at the root of a sal tree.

root-pli-ms: Kakusandho, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho sirīsassa mūle abhisambuddho.
translation-en-sujato: Kakusandha was awakened at the root of an acacia tree.

root-pli-ms: Koṇāgamano, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho udumbarassa mūle abhisambuddho.
translation-en-sujato: Koṇāgamana was awakened at the root of a cluster fig tree.

root-pli-ms: Kassapo, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho nigrodhassa mūle abhisambuddho.
translation-en-sujato: Kassapa was awakened at the root of a banyan tree.

root-pli-ms: Ahaṁ, bhikkhave, etarahi arahaṁ sammāsambuddho assatthassa mūle abhisambuddho.
translation-en-sujato: I was awakened at the root of a peepul tree.
comment-en-sujato: peepul seems to be the most common of the many words for the Bodhi tree.

root-pli-ms: Vipassissa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa khaṇḍatissaṁ nāma sāvakayugaṁ ahosi aggaṁ bhaddayugaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Vipassī had a fine pair of chief disciples named Khaṇḍa and Tissa.
reference: csp1ed7.4, csp2ed7.4, dr10.5, mc10.4, ms7D_11, msdiv9, ndp7.6, pts-cs1.9, pts-vp-pli2.5, sc10, sya10.5, vri2.4

root-pli-ms: Sikhissa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa abhibhūsambhavaṁ nāma sāvakayugaṁ ahosi aggaṁ bhaddayugaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Sikhī had a fine pair of chief disciples named Abhibhū and Sambhava.

root-pli-ms: Vessabhussa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa soṇuttaraṁ nāma sāvakayugaṁ ahosi aggaṁ bhaddayugaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Vessabhū had a fine pair of chief disciples named Soṇa and Uttara.

root-pli-ms: Kakusandhassa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa vidhurasañjīvaṁ nāma sāvakayugaṁ ahosi aggaṁ bhaddayugaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Kakusandha had a fine pair of chief disciples named Vidhura and Sañjīva.

root-pli-ms: Koṇāgamanassa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa bhiyyosuttaraṁ nāma sāvakayugaṁ ahosi aggaṁ bhaddayugaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Koṇāgamana had a fine pair of chief disciples named Bhiyyosa and Uttara.

root-pli-ms: Kassapassa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa tissabhāradvājaṁ nāma sāvakayugaṁ ahosi aggaṁ bhaddayugaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Kassapa had a fine pair of chief disciples named Tissa and Bhāradvāja.

root-pli-ms: Mayhaṁ, bhikkhave, etarahi sāriputtamoggallānaṁ nāma sāvakayugaṁ ahosi aggaṁ bhaddayugaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: I have a fine pair of chief disciples named Sāriputta and Moggallāna.

root-pli-ms: Vipassissa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa tayo sāvakānaṁ sannipātā ahesuṁ. Eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi aṭṭhasaṭṭhibhikkhusatasahassaṁ, eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi bhikkhusatasahassaṁ, eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi asītibhikkhusahassāni. Vipassissa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa ime tayo sāvakānaṁ sannipātā ahesuṁ sabbesaṁyeva khīṇāsavānaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Vipassī had three gatherings of disciples—one of 6,800,000, one of 100,000, and one of 80,000—all of them mendicants who had ended their defilements.
comment-en-sujato: Both RD and MW have “assemblies”, which is a little misleading. It doesn’t refer to permanent groupings, but events.
reference: bj8.8, cck10.6, ms7D_12, msdiv10, pts-cs1.10, sc11

root-pli-ms: Sikhissa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa tayo sāvakānaṁ sannipātā ahesuṁ. Eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi bhikkhusatasahassaṁ, eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi asītibhikkhusahassāni, eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi sattatibhikkhusahassāni. Sikhissa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa ime tayo sāvakānaṁ sannipātā ahesuṁ sabbesaṁyeva khīṇāsavānaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Sikhī had three gatherings of disciples—one of 100,000, one of 80,000, and one of 70,000—all of them mendicants who had ended their defilements.

root-pli-ms: Vessabhussa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa tayo sāvakānaṁ sannipātā ahesuṁ. Eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi asītibhikkhusahassāni, eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi sattatibhikkhusahassāni, eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi saṭṭhibhikkhusahassāni. Vessabhussa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa ime tayo sāvakānaṁ sannipātā ahesuṁ sabbesaṁyeva khīṇāsavānaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Vessabhū had three gatherings of disciples—one of 80,000, one of 70,000, and one of 60,000—all of them mendicants who had ended their defilements.

root-pli-ms: Kakusandhassa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi cattālīsabhikkhusahassāni. Kakusandhassa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa ayaṁ eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi sabbesaṁyeva khīṇāsavānaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Kakusandha had one gathering of disciples—40,000 mendicants who had ended their defilements.

root-pli-ms: Koṇāgamanassa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi tiṁsabhikkhusahassāni. Koṇāgamanassa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa ayaṁ eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi sabbesaṁyeva khīṇāsavānaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Koṇāgamana had one gathering of disciples—30,000 mendicants who had ended their defilements.

root-pli-ms: Kassapassa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi vīsatibhikkhusahassāni. Kassapassa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa ayaṁ eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi sabbesaṁyeva khīṇāsavānaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Kassapa had one gathering of disciples—20,000 mendicants who had ended their defilements.

root-pli-ms: Mayhaṁ, bhikkhave, etarahi eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi aḍḍhateḷasāni bhikkhusatāni. Mayhaṁ, bhikkhave, ayaṁ eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi sabbesaṁyeva khīṇāsavānaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: I have had one gathering of disciples—1,250 mendicants who had ended their defilements.

root-pli-ms: Vipassissa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa asoko nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhāko ahosi aggupaṭṭhāko.
translation-en-sujato: Vipassī had as chief attendant a mendicant named Asoka.
reference: bj8.10, cck10.8, csp1ed7.6, csp2ed7.6, dr10.7, ms7D_19, msdiv11, pts-cs1.11, sc18

root-pli-ms: Sikhissa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa khemaṅkaro nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhāko ahosi aggupaṭṭhāko.
translation-en-sujato: Sikhī had as chief attendant a mendicant named Khemaṅkara.

root-pli-ms: Vessabhussa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa upasanto nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhāko ahosi aggupaṭṭhāko.
translation-en-sujato: Vessabhū had as chief attendant a mendicant named Upasanta.

root-pli-ms: Kakusandhassa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa buddhijo nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhāko ahosi aggupaṭṭhāko.
translation-en-sujato: Kakusandha had as chief attendant a mendicant named Buddhija.

root-pli-ms: Koṇāgamanassa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa sotthijo nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhāko ahosi aggupaṭṭhāko.
translation-en-sujato: Koṇāgamana had as chief attendant a mendicant named Sotthija.

root-pli-ms: Kassapassa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa sabbamitto nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhāko ahosi aggupaṭṭhāko.
translation-en-sujato: Kassapa had as chief attendant a mendicant named Sabbamitta.

root-pli-ms: Mayhaṁ, bhikkhave, etarahi ānando nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhāko ahosi aggupaṭṭhāko.
translation-en-sujato: I have as chief attendant a mendicant named Ānanda.

root-pli-ms: Vipassissa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa bandhumā nāma rājā pitā ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: Vipassī’s father was King Bandhuma,
reference: mc10.6, ms7D_20, msdiv12, pts-cs1.12, pts-vp-pli2.7, sc19

root-pli-ms: Bandhumatī nāma devī mātā ahosi janetti.
translation-en-sujato: his birth mother was Queen Bandhumatī,

root-pli-ms: Bandhumassa rañño bandhumatī nāma nagaraṁ rājadhānī ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: and their capital city was named Bandhumatī.

root-pli-ms: Sikhissa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa aruṇo nāma rājā pitā ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: Sikhī’s father was King Aruṇa,

root-pli-ms: Pabhāvatī nāma devī mātā ahosi janetti.
translation-en-sujato: his birth mother was Queen Pabhāvatī,

root-pli-ms: Aruṇassa rañño aruṇavatī nāma nagaraṁ rājadhānī ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: and their capital city was named Aruṇavatī.

root-pli-ms: Vessabhussa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa suppatito nāma rājā pitā ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: Vessabhū’s father was King Suppatīta,
variant-pli-ms: suppatito nāma → suppatīto nāma (bj, sya-all, pts1ed)

root-pli-ms: Vassavatī nāma devī mātā ahosi janetti.
translation-en-sujato: his birth mother was Queen Vassavatī,
variant-pli-ms: Vassavatī nāma → yasavatī nāma (bj, sya-all, km, pts1ed)

root-pli-ms: Suppatitassa rañño anomaṁ nāma nagaraṁ rājadhānī ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: and their capital city was named Anoma.

root-pli-ms: Kakusandhassa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa aggidatto nāma brāhmaṇo pitā ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: Kakusandha’s father was the brahmin Aggidatta,

root-pli-ms: Visākhā nāma brāhmaṇī mātā ahosi janetti.
translation-en-sujato: and his birth mother was the brahmin lady Visākhā.

root-pli-ms: Tena kho pana, bhikkhave, samayena khemo nāma rājā ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: At that time the king was Khema,

root-pli-ms: Khemassa rañño khemavatī nāma nagaraṁ rājadhānī ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: whose capital city was named Khemavatī.

root-pli-ms: Koṇāgamanassa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa yaññadatto nāma brāhmaṇo pitā ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: Koṇāgamana’s father was the brahmin Yaññadatta,

root-pli-ms: Uttarā nāma brāhmaṇī mātā ahosi janetti.
translation-en-sujato: and his birth mother was the brahmin lady Uttarā.

root-pli-ms: Tena kho pana, bhikkhave, samayena sobho nāma rājā ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: At that time the king was Sobha,

root-pli-ms: Sobhassa rañño sobhavatī nāma nagaraṁ rājadhānī ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: whose capital city was named Sobhavatī.

root-pli-ms: Kassapassa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa brahmadatto nāma brāhmaṇo pitā ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: Kassapa’s father was the brahmin Brahmadatta,

root-pli-ms: Dhanavatī nāma brāhmaṇī mātā ahosi janetti.
translation-en-sujato: and his birth mother was the brahmin lady Dhanavatī.

root-pli-ms: Tena kho pana, bhikkhave, samayena kikī nāma rājā ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: At that time the king was Kikī,

root-pli-ms: Kikissa rañño bārāṇasī nāma nagaraṁ rājadhānī ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: whose capital city was named Benares.

root-pli-ms: Mayhaṁ, bhikkhave, etarahi suddhodano nāma rājā pitā ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: My father was King Suddhodana,

root-pli-ms: Māyā nāma devī mātā ahosi janetti.
translation-en-sujato: my birth mother was Queen Māyā,

root-pli-ms: Kapilavatthu nāma nagaraṁ rājadhānī ahosī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: and our capital city was Kapilavatthu.”

root-pli-ms: Idamavoca bhagavā.
translation-en-sujato: That is what the Buddha said.

root-pli-ms: Idaṁ vatvāna sugato uṭṭhāyāsanā vihāraṁ pāvisi.
translation-en-sujato: When he had spoken, the Holy One got up from his seat and entered his dwelling.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho tesaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ acirapakkantassa bhagavato ayamantarākathā udapādi:
translation-en-sujato: Soon after the Buddha left, those mendicants discussed among themselves:
reference: bj8.12, cck10.10, dr10.9, ms7D_27, msdiv13, pts-cs1.13, pts-vp-pli2.8, sc26, vri2.7

root-pli-ms: “acchariyaṁ, āvuso, abbhutaṁ, āvuso, tathāgatassa mahiddhikatā mahānubhāvatā.
translation-en-sujato: “It’s incredible, reverends, it’s amazing, the power and might of a Realized One!

root-pli-ms: Yatra hi nāma tathāgato atīte buddhe parinibbute chinnapapañce chinnavaṭume pariyādinnavaṭṭe sabbadukkhavītivatte jātitopi anussarissati, nāmatopi anussarissati, gottatopi anussarissati, āyuppamāṇatopi anussarissati, sāvakayugatopi anussarissati, sāvakasannipātatopi anussarissati:
translation-en-sujato: For he is able to recollect the caste, names, clans, life-span, chief disciples, and gatherings of disciples of the Buddhas of the past who have become completely extinguished, cut off proliferation, cut off the track, finished off the cycle, and transcended suffering.

root-pli-ms: ‘evaṁjaccā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ itipi, evaṁnāmā evaṅgottā evaṁsīlā evaṁdhammā evaṁpaññā evaṁvihārī evaṁvimuttā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ itipī’”ti.
translation-en-sujato: He knows the caste they were born in, and also their names, clans, conduct, qualities, wisdom, meditation, and freedom.

root-pli-ms: “Kiṁ nu kho, āvuso, tathāgatasseva nu kho esā dhammadhātu suppaṭividdhā, yassā dhammadhātuyā suppaṭividdhattā tathāgato atīte buddhe parinibbute chinnapapañce chinnavaṭume pariyādinnavaṭṭe sabbadukkhavītivatte jātitopi anussarati, nāmatopi anussarati, gottatopi anussarati, āyuppamāṇatopi anussarati, sāvakayugatopi anussarati, sāvakasannipātatopi anussarati: ‘evaṁjaccā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ itipi, evaṁnāmā evaṅgottā evaṁsīlā evaṁdhammā evaṁpaññā evaṁvihārī evaṁvimuttā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ itipī’ti,
translation-en-sujato: Is it because the Realized One has clearly comprehended the principle of the teachings that he can recollect all these things?
reference: cck10.11, csp1ed7.8, csp2ed7.8, mc10.8, ms7D_28, ndp7.9, pts-vp-pli2.9, sc27, sya10.10

root-pli-ms: udāhu devatā tathāgatassa etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ, yena tathāgato atīte buddhe parinibbute chinnapapañce chinnavaṭume pariyādinnavaṭṭe sabbadukkhavītivatte jātitopi anussarati, nāmatopi anussarati, gottatopi anussarati, āyuppamāṇatopi anussarati, sāvakayugatopi anussarati, sāvakasannipātatopi anussarati: ‘evaṁjaccā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ itipi, evaṁnāmā evaṅgottā evaṁsīlā evaṁdhammā evaṁpaññā evaṁvihārī evaṁvimuttā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ itipī’”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Or did deities tell him?”

root-pli-ms: Ayañca hidaṁ tesaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ antarākathā vippakatā hoti.
translation-en-sujato: But this conversation among those mendicants was left unfinished.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā sāyanhasamayaṁ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito yena karerimaṇḍalamāḷo tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
translation-en-sujato: Then in the late afternoon, the Buddha came out of retreat and went to the pavilion by the kari tree, where he sat on the seat spread out

root-pli-ms: Nisajja kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: and addressed the mendicants,

root-pli-ms: “kāya nuttha, bhikkhave, etarahi kathāya sannisinnā; kā ca pana vo antarākathā vippakatā”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “Mendicants, what were you sitting talking about just now? What conversation was unfinished?”

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vutte, te bhikkhū bhagavantaṁ etadavocuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: The mendicants told him what had happened, adding,
reference: bj8.14, cck10.12, csp1ed7.9, csp2ed7.9, dr10.11, mc10.9, ms7D_30, ndp7.10, pts-vp-pli2.10, sc29, sya10.11, vri2.8

root-pli-ms: “idha, bhante, amhākaṁ acirapakkantassa bhagavato ayaṁ antarākathā udapādi:
‘acchariyaṁ, āvuso, abbhutaṁ, āvuso, tathāgatassa mahiddhikatā mahānubhāvatā.

Yatra hi nāma tathāgato atīte buddhe parinibbute chinnapapañce chinnavaṭume pariyādinnavaṭṭe sabbadukkhavītivatte jātitopi anussarissati, nāmatopi anussarissati, gottatopi anussarissati, āyuppamāṇatopi anussarissati, sāvakayugatopi anussarissati, sāvakasannipātatopi anussarissati:
“evaṁjaccā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ itipi, evaṁnāmā evaṅgottā evaṁsīlā evaṁdhammā evaṁpaññā evaṁvihārī evaṁvimuttā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ itipī”ti.

Kiṁ nu kho, āvuso, tathāgatasseva nu kho esā dhammadhātu suppaṭividdhā, yassā dhammadhātuyā suppaṭividdhattā tathāgato atīte buddhe parinibbute chinnapapañce chinnavaṭume pariyādinnavaṭṭe sabbadukkhavītivatte jātitopi anussarati, nāmatopi anussarati, gottatopi anussarati, āyuppamāṇatopi anussarati, sāvakayugatopi anussarati, sāvakasannipātatopi anussarati:
“evaṁjaccā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ itipi, evaṁnāmā evaṅgottā evaṁsīlā evaṁdhammā evaṁpaññā evaṁvihārī evaṁvimuttā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ itipī”ti.

Udāhu devatā tathāgatassa etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ, yena tathāgato atīte buddhe parinibbute chinnapapañce chinnavaṭume pariyādinnavaṭṭe sabbadukkhavītivatte jātitopi anussarati, nāmatopi anussarati, gottatopi anussarati, āyuppamāṇatopi anussarati, sāvakayugatopi anussarati, sāvakasannipātatopi anussarati:
“evaṁjaccā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ itipi, evaṁnāmā evaṅgottā evaṁsīlā evaṁdhammā evaṁpaññā evaṁvihārī evaṁvimuttā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ itipī”’ti?
Ayaṁ kho no, bhante, antarākathā vippakatā, atha bhagavā anuppatto”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “This was our conversation that was unfinished when the Buddha arrived.”

root-pli-ms: “Tathāgatassevesā, bhikkhave, dhammadhātu suppaṭividdhā, yassā dhammadhātuyā suppaṭividdhattā tathāgato atīte buddhe parinibbute chinnapapañce chinnavaṭume pariyādinnavaṭṭe sabbadukkhavītivatte jātitopi anussarati, nāmatopi anussarati, gottatopi anussarati, āyuppamāṇatopi anussarati, sāvakayugatopi anussarati, sāvakasannipātatopi anussarati:
translation-en-sujato: “It is because the Realized One has clearly comprehended the principle of the teachings that he can recollect all these things.
reference: cck10.13, ms7D_31, msdiv15, pts-cs1.15, sc30, sya10.12

root-pli-ms: ‘evaṁjaccā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ itipi, evaṁnāmā evaṅgottā evaṁsīlā evaṁdhammā evaṁpaññā evaṁvihārī evaṁvimuttā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ itipī’ti.

Devatāpi tathāgatassa etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ, yena tathāgato atīte buddhe parinibbute chinnapapañce chinnavaṭume pariyādinnavaṭṭe sabbadukkhavītivatte jātitopi anussarati, nāmatopi anussarati, gottatopi anussarati, āyuppamāṇatopi anussarati, sāvakayugatopi anussarati, sāvakasannipātatopi anussarati:
translation-en-sujato: And the deities also told me.

root-pli-ms: ‘evaṁjaccā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ itipi, evaṁnāmā evaṅgottā evaṁsīlā evaṁdhammā evaṁpaññā evaṁvihārī evaṁvimuttā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ itipī’ti.
Iccheyyātha no tumhe, bhikkhave, bhiyyoso mattāya pubbenivāsapaṭisaṁyuttaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ sotun”ti?
translation-en-sujato: Would you like to hear a further Dhamma talk on the subject of past lives?”
reference: bj8.16, ms7D_32, ndp7.11, pts-vp-pli2.11, sc31, vri2.9

root-pli-ms: “Etassa, bhagavā, kālo; etassa, sugata, kālo;
translation-en-sujato: “Now is the time, Blessed One! Now is the time, Holy One!

root-pli-ms: yaṁ bhagavā bhiyyoso mattāya pubbenivāsapaṭisaṁyuttaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ kareyya, bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressantī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Let the Buddha give a further Dhamma talk on the subject of past lives. The mendicants will listen and remember it.”

root-pli-ms: “Tena hi, bhikkhave, suṇātha, sādhukaṁ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Well then, mendicants, listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” they replied.

root-pli-ms: Bhagavā etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: The Buddha said this:

root-pli-ms: “Ito so, bhikkhave, ekanavutikappe yaṁ vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho loke udapādi.
translation-en-sujato: “Ninety-one eons ago, the Buddha Vipassī arose in the world, perfected and fully awakened.
reference: cck10.14, csp1ed7.10, csp2ed7.10, dr10.12, mc10.10, ms7D_33, msdiv16, pts-cs1.16, pts-vp-pli2.12, sc32, sya10.13

root-pli-ms: Vipassī, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho khattiyo jātiyā ahosi, khattiyakule udapādi.
translation-en-sujato: He was born as an aristocrat into an aristocrat family.

root-pli-ms: Vipassī, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho koṇḍañño gottena ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: His clan was Koṇḍañña.

root-pli-ms: Vipassissa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa asītivassasahassāni āyuppamāṇaṁ ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: He lived for 80,000 years.

root-pli-ms: Vipassī, bhikkhave, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho pāṭaliyā mūle abhisambuddho.
translation-en-sujato: He was awakened at the root of a trumpet flower tree.

root-pli-ms: Vipassissa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa khaṇḍatissaṁ nāma sāvakayugaṁ ahosi aggaṁ bhaddayugaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: He had a fine pair of chief disciples named Khaṇḍa and Tissa.

root-pli-ms: Vipassissa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa tayo sāvakānaṁ sannipātā ahesuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: He had three gatherings of disciples—

root-pli-ms: Eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi aṭṭhasaṭṭhibhikkhusatasahassaṁ, eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi bhikkhusatasahassaṁ, eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi asītibhikkhusahassāni.
translation-en-sujato: one of 6,800,000, one of 100,000, and one of 80,000—

root-pli-ms: Vipassissa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa ime tayo sāvakānaṁ sannipātā ahesuṁ sabbesaṁyeva khīṇāsavānaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: all of them mendicants who had ended their defilements.

root-pli-ms: Vipassissa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa asoko nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhāko ahosi aggupaṭṭhāko.
translation-en-sujato: He had as chief attendant a mendicant named Asoka.

root-pli-ms: Vipassissa, bhikkhave, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa bandhumā nāma rājā pitā ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: His father was King Bandhuma,

root-pli-ms: Bandhumatī nāma devī mātā ahosi janetti.
translation-en-sujato: his birth mother was Queen Bandhumatī,

root-pli-ms: Bandhumassa rañño bandhumatī nāma nagaraṁ rājadhānī ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: and their capital city was named Bandhumatī.

root-pli-ms: 2. Bodhisattadhammatā
translation-en-sujato: 2. What’s Normal For One Intent on Awakening

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassī bodhisatto tusitā kāyā cavitvā sato sampajāno mātukucchiṁ okkami.
translation-en-sujato: When Vipassī, the being intent on awakening, passed away from the host of Joyful Gods, he was conceived in his mother’s womb, mindful and aware.

root-pli-ms: Ayamettha dhammatā. (1)
translation-en-sujato: This is normal in such a case.

root-pli-ms: Dhammatā esā, bhikkhave, yadā bodhisatto tusitā kāyā cavitvā mātukucchiṁ okkamati.
translation-en-sujato: It’s normal that, when the being intent on awakening passes away from the host of Joyful Gods, he is conceived in his mother’s womb.

root-pli-ms: Atha sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya appamāṇo uḷāro obhāso pātubhavati atikkammeva devānaṁ devānubhāvaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: And then—in this world with its gods, Māras and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, gods and humans—an immeasurable, magnificent light appears, surpassing the glory of the gods.

root-pli-ms: Yāpi tā lokantarikā aghā asaṁvutā andhakārā andhakāratimisā, yatthapime candimasūriyā evaṁmahiddhikā evaṁmahānubhāvā ābhāya nānubhonti, tatthapi appamāṇo uḷāro obhāso pātubhavati atikkammeva devānaṁ devānubhāvaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Even in the boundless desolation of interstellar space—so utterly dark that even the light of the moon and the sun, so mighty and powerful, makes no impression—an immeasurable, magnificent light appears, surpassing the glory of the gods.

root-pli-ms: Yepi tattha sattā upapannā, tepi tenobhāsena aññamaññaṁ sañjānanti: ‘aññepi kira, bho, santi sattā idhūpapannā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: And the sentient beings reborn there recognize each other by that light: ‘So, it seems other sentient beings have been reborn here!’

root-pli-ms: Ayañca dasasahassī lokadhātu saṅkampati sampakampati sampavedhati. Appamāṇo ca uḷāro obhāso loke pātubhavati atikkammeva devānaṁ devānubhāvaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: And this galaxy shakes and rocks and trembles. And an immeasurable, magnificent light appears in the world, surpassing the glory of the gods.

root-pli-ms: Ayamettha dhammatā. (2)
translation-en-sujato: This is normal in such a case.

root-pli-ms: Dhammatā esā, bhikkhave, yadā bodhisatto mātukucchiṁ okkanto hoti, cattāro naṁ devaputtā catuddisaṁ rakkhāya upagacchanti: ‘mā naṁ bodhisattaṁ vā bodhisattamātaraṁ vā manusso vā amanusso vā koci vā viheṭhesī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: It’s normal that, when the being intent on awakening is conceived in his mother’s belly, four gods approach to guard the four directions, so that no human or non-human or anyone at all shall harm the being intent on awakening or his mother.
reference: csp1ed7.11, csp2ed7.11, mc10.11, ms7D_36, msdiv19, sc35

root-pli-ms: Ayamettha dhammatā. (3)
translation-en-sujato: This is normal in such a case.

root-pli-ms: Dhammatā esā, bhikkhave, yadā bodhisatto mātukucchiṁ okkanto hoti, pakatiyā sīlavatī bodhisattamātā hoti, viratā pāṇātipātā, viratā adinnādānā, viratā kāmesumicchācārā, viratā musāvādā, viratā surāmerayamajjappamādaṭṭhānā.
translation-en-sujato: It’s normal that, when the being intent on awakening is conceived in his mother’s belly, she becomes naturally ethical. She refrains from killing living creatures, stealing, sexual misconduct, lying, and alcoholic drinks that cause negligence.

root-pli-ms: Ayamettha dhammatā. (4)
translation-en-sujato: This is normal in such a case.

root-pli-ms: Dhammatā esā, bhikkhave, yadā bodhisatto mātukucchiṁ okkanto hoti, na bodhisattamātu purisesu mānasaṁ uppajjati kāmaguṇūpasaṁhitaṁ, anatikkamanīyā ca bodhisattamātā hoti kenaci purisena rattacittena.
translation-en-sujato: It’s normal that, when the being intent on awakening is conceived in his mother’s belly, she no longer feels sexual desire for men, and she cannot be violated by a man of lustful intent.
reference: cck10.16, dr10.14, ms7D_38, msdiv21, pts-cs1.19, sc37

root-pli-ms: Ayamettha dhammatā. (5)
translation-en-sujato: This is normal in such a case.

root-pli-ms: Dhammatā esā, bhikkhave, yadā bodhisatto mātukucchiṁ okkanto hoti, lābhinī bodhisattamātā hoti pañcannaṁ kāmaguṇānaṁ. Sā pañcahi kāmaguṇehi samappitā samaṅgībhūtā paricāreti.
translation-en-sujato: It’s normal that, when the being intent on awakening is conceived in his mother’s belly, she obtains the five kinds of sensual stimulation and amuses herself, supplied and provided with them.

root-pli-ms: Ayamettha dhammatā. (6)
translation-en-sujato: This is normal in such a case.

root-pli-ms: Dhammatā esā, bhikkhave, yadā bodhisatto mātukucchiṁ okkanto hoti, na bodhisattamātu kocideva ābādho uppajjati. Sukhinī bodhisattamātā hoti akilantakāyā, bodhisattañca bodhisattamātā tirokucchigataṁ passati sabbaṅgapaccaṅgiṁ ahīnindriyaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: It’s normal that, when the being intent on awakening is conceived in his mother’s belly, no afflictions beset her. She’s happy and free of bodily fatigue. And she sees the being intent on awakening in her womb, complete with all his various parts, not deficient in any faculty.
reference: cck10.17, csp1ed7.12, csp2ed7.12, dr10.15, mc10.12, ms7D_40, msdiv23, ndp7.13, pts-cs1.21, pts-vp-pli2.14, sc39, vri2.11

root-pli-ms: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, maṇi veḷuriyo subho jātimā aṭṭhaṁso suparikammakato accho vippasanno anāvilo sabbākārasampanno. Tatrāssa suttaṁ āvutaṁ nīlaṁ vā pītaṁ vā lohitaṁ vā odātaṁ vā paṇḍusuttaṁ vā.
translation-en-sujato: Suppose there was a beryl gem that was naturally beautiful, eight-faceted, well-worked, transparent, clear, and unclouded, endowed with all good qualities. And it was strung with a thread of blue, yellow, red, white, or golden brown.
variant-pli-ms: Tatrāssa → tatra yaṁ (bj); tatrassa (sya-all, km, pts1ed)

root-pli-ms: Tamenaṁ cakkhumā puriso hatthe karitvā paccavekkheyya: ‘ayaṁ kho maṇi veḷuriyo subho jātimā aṭṭhaṁso suparikammakato accho vippasanno anāvilo sabbākārasampanno. Tatridaṁ suttaṁ āvutaṁ nīlaṁ vā pītaṁ vā lohitaṁ vā odātaṁ vā paṇḍusuttaṁ vā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: And someone with good eyesight were to take it in their hand and examine it: ‘This beryl gem is naturally beautiful, eight-faceted, well-worked, transparent, clear, and unclouded, endowed with all good qualities. And it’s strung with a thread of blue, yellow, red, white, or golden brown.’

root-pli-ms: Evameva kho, bhikkhave, yadā bodhisatto mātukucchiṁ okkanto hoti, na bodhisattamātu kocideva ābādho uppajjati, sukhinī bodhisattamātā hoti akilantakāyā, bodhisattañca bodhisattamātā tirokucchigataṁ passati sabbaṅgapaccaṅgiṁ ahīnindriyaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: In the same way, when the being intent on awakening is conceived in his mother’s belly, no afflictions beset her. She’s happy and free of bodily fatigue. And she sees the being intent on awakening in her womb, complete with all his various parts, not deficient in any faculty.

root-pli-ms: Ayamettha dhammatā. (7)
translation-en-sujato: This is normal in such a case.

root-pli-ms: Dhammatā esā, bhikkhave, sattāhajāte bodhisatte bodhisattamātā kālaṁ karoti tusitaṁ kāyaṁ upapajjati.
translation-en-sujato: It’s normal that, seven days after the being intent on awakening is born, his mother passes away and is reborn in the host of Joyful Gods.

root-pli-ms: Ayamettha dhammatā. (8)
translation-en-sujato: This is normal in such a case.

root-pli-ms: Dhammatā esā, bhikkhave, yathā aññā itthikā nava vā dasa vā māse gabbhaṁ kucchinā pariharitvā vijāyanti, na hevaṁ bodhisattaṁ bodhisattamātā vijāyati. Daseva māsāni bodhisattaṁ bodhisattamātā kucchinā pariharitvā vijāyati.
translation-en-sujato: It’s normal that, while other women carry the infant in the womb for nine or ten months before giving birth, not so the mother of the being intent on awakening. She gives birth after exactly ten months.

root-pli-ms: Ayamettha dhammatā. (9)
translation-en-sujato: This is normal in such a case.

root-pli-ms: Dhammatā esā, bhikkhave, yathā aññā itthikā nisinnā vā nipannā vā vijāyanti, na hevaṁ bodhisattaṁ bodhisattamātā vijāyati. Ṭhitāva bodhisattaṁ bodhisattamātā vijāyati.
translation-en-sujato: It’s normal that, while other women give birth while sitting or lying down, not so the mother of the being intent on awakening. She only gives birth standing up.

root-pli-ms: Ayamettha dhammatā. (10)
translation-en-sujato: This is normal in such a case.

root-pli-ms: Dhammatā esā, bhikkhave, yadā bodhisatto mātukucchimhā nikkhamati, devā paṭhamaṁ paṭiggaṇhanti, pacchā manussā.
translation-en-sujato: It’s normal that, when the being intent on awakening emerges from his mother’s womb, gods receive him first, then humans.

root-pli-ms: Ayamettha dhammatā. (11)
translation-en-sujato: This is normal in such a case.

root-pli-ms: Dhammatā esā, bhikkhave, yadā bodhisatto mātukucchimhā nikkhamati, appattova bodhisatto pathaviṁ hoti, cattāro naṁ devaputtā paṭiggahetvā mātu purato ṭhapenti: ‘attamanā, devi, hohi; mahesakkho te putto uppanno’ti.
translation-en-sujato: It’s normal that, when the being intent on awakening emerges from his mother’s womb, before he reaches the ground, four gods receive him and place him before his mother, saying: ‘Rejoice, O Queen! An illustrious child is born to you.’

root-pli-ms: Ayamettha dhammatā. (12)
translation-en-sujato: This is normal in such a case.

root-pli-ms: Dhammatā esā, bhikkhave, yadā bodhisatto mātukucchimhā nikkhamati, visadova nikkhamati amakkhito udena amakkhito semhena amakkhito ruhirena amakkhito kenaci asucinā suddho visado.
translation-en-sujato: It’s normal that, when the being intent on awakening emerges from his mother’s womb, he emerges already clean, unsoiled by waters, mucus, blood, or any other kind of impurity, pure and clean.
reference: csp1ed7.13, csp2ed7.13, dr10.16, mc10.13, ms7D_46, msdiv29, pts-cs1.27, pts-vp-pli2.15, sc45, sya10.17
variant-pli-ms: udena → uddena (bj, sya-all, km, pts1ed); udarena (katthaci) | asucinā suddho → visuddho (sya-all)

root-pli-ms: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, maṇiratanaṁ kāsike vatthe nikkhittaṁ neva maṇiratanaṁ kāsikaṁ vatthaṁ makkheti, nāpi kāsikaṁ vatthaṁ maṇiratanaṁ makkheti.
translation-en-sujato: Suppose a jewel-treasure was placed on a cloth from Kāsī. The jewel would not soil the cloth, nor would the cloth soil the jewel.

root-pli-ms: Taṁ kissa hetu?
translation-en-sujato: Why is that?

root-pli-ms: Ubhinnaṁ suddhattā.
translation-en-sujato: Because of the cleanliness of them both.

root-pli-ms: Evameva kho, bhikkhave, yadā bodhisatto mātukucchimhā nikkhamati, visadova nikkhamati amakkhito, udena amakkhito semhena amakkhito ruhirena amakkhito kenaci asucinā suddho visado.
translation-en-sujato: In the same way, when the being intent on awakening emerges from his mother’s womb, he emerges already clean, unsoiled by waters, mucus, blood, or any other kind of impurity, pure and clean.

root-pli-ms: Ayamettha dhammatā. (13)
translation-en-sujato: This is normal in such a case.

root-pli-ms: Dhammatā esā, bhikkhave, yadā bodhisatto mātukucchimhā nikkhamati, dve udakassa dhārā antalikkhā pātubhavanti—ekā sītassa ekā uṇhassa yena bodhisattassa udakakiccaṁ karonti mātu ca.
translation-en-sujato: It’s normal that, when the being intent on awakening emerges from his mother’s womb, two streams of water appear in the sky, one cool, one warm, for bathing the being intent on awakening and his mother.

root-pli-ms: Ayamettha dhammatā. (14)
translation-en-sujato: This is normal in such a case.

root-pli-ms: Dhammatā esā, bhikkhave, sampatijāto bodhisatto samehi pādehi patiṭṭhahitvā uttarābhimukho sattapadavītihārena gacchati setamhi chatte anudhāriyamāne, sabbā ca disā anuviloketi, āsabhiṁ vācaṁ bhāsati ‘aggohamasmi lokassa, jeṭṭhohamasmi lokassa, seṭṭhohamasmi lokassa, ayamantimā jāti, natthi dāni punabbhavo’ti.
translation-en-sujato: It’s normal that, as soon as he’s born, the being intent on awakening stands firm with his own feet on the ground. Facing north, he takes seven strides with a white parasol held above him, surveys all quarters, and makes this dramatic statement: ‘I am the foremost in the world! I am the eldest in the world! I am the best in the world! This is my last rebirth. Now there are no more future lives.’
reference: bj8.22, cck10.19, ms7D_48, msdiv31, ndp7.14, pts-cs1.29, sc47

root-pli-ms: Ayamettha dhammatā. (15)
translation-en-sujato: This is normal in such a case.

root-pli-ms: Dhammatā esā, bhikkhave, yadā bodhisatto mātukucchimhā nikkhamati, atha sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya appamāṇo uḷāro obhāso pātubhavati, atikkammeva devānaṁ devānubhāvaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: It’s normal that, when the being intent on awakening emerges from his mother’s womb, then—in this world with its gods, Māras and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, gods and humans—an immeasurable, magnificent light appears, surpassing the glory of the gods.

root-pli-ms: Yāpi tā lokantarikā aghā asaṁvutā andhakārā andhakāratimisā, yatthapime candimasūriyā evaṁmahiddhikā evaṁmahānubhāvā ābhāya nānubhonti, tatthapi appamāṇo uḷāro obhāso pātubhavati atikkammeva devānaṁ devānubhāvaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Even in the boundless desolation of interstellar space—so utterly dark that even the light of the moon and the sun, so mighty and powerful, makes no impression—an immeasurable, magnificent light appears, surpassing the glory of the gods.

root-pli-ms: Yepi tattha sattā upapannā, tepi tenobhāsena aññamaññaṁ sañjānanti: ‘aññepi kira, bho, santi sattā idhūpapannā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: And the sentient beings reborn there recognize each other by that light: ‘So, it seems other sentient beings have been reborn here!’

root-pli-ms: Ayañca dasasahassī lokadhātu saṅkampati sampakampati sampavedhati appamāṇo ca uḷāro obhāso loke pātubhavati atikkammeva devānaṁ devānubhāvaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: And this galaxy shakes and rocks and trembles. And an immeasurable, magnificent light appears in the world, surpassing the glory of the gods.

root-pli-ms: Ayamettha dhammatā. (16)
translation-en-sujato: This is normal in such a case.

root-pli-ms: 3. Dvattiṁsamahāpurisalakkhaṇā
translation-en-sujato: 3. The Thirty-Two Marks of a Great Man

root-pli-ms: Jāte kho pana, bhikkhave, vipassimhi kumāre bandhumato rañño paṭivedesuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: When Prince Vipassī was born, they announced it to King Bandhumata,
reference: cck10.20, csp1ed7.14, csp2ed7.14, dr10.18, ms7D_50, msdiv33, ndp7.15, pts-cs1.31, pts-vp-pli2.16, sc49, sya10.19, vri2.13

root-pli-ms: ‘putto te, deva, jāto, taṁ devo passatū’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Sire, your son is born! Let your majesty examine him!’

root-pli-ms: Addasā kho, bhikkhave, bandhumā rājā vipassiṁ kumāraṁ, disvā nemitte brāhmaṇe āmantāpetvā etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: When the king had examined the prince, he had the brahmin soothsayers summoned and said to them,

root-pli-ms: ‘passantu bhonto nemittā brāhmaṇā kumāran’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Gentlemen, please examine the prince.’

root-pli-ms: Addasaṁsu kho, bhikkhave, nemittā brāhmaṇā vipassiṁ kumāraṁ, disvā bandhumantaṁ rājānaṁ etadavocuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: When they had examined him they said to the king,

root-pli-ms: ‘attamano, deva, hohi, mahesakkho te putto uppanno, lābhā te, mahārāja, suladdhaṁ te, mahārāja, yassa te kule evarūpo putto uppanno.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Rejoice, O King! An illustrious son is born to you. You are fortunate, so very fortunate, to have a son such as this born in this family!’

root-pli-ms: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro dvattiṁsamahāpurisalakkhaṇehi samannāgato, yehi samannāgatassa mahāpurisassa dveva gatiyo bhavanti anaññā.
translation-en-sujato: For the prince has the thirty-two marks of a great man. A great man who possesses these has only two possible destinies, no other.

root-pli-ms: Sace agāraṁ ajjhāvasati, rājā hoti cakkavattī dhammiko dhammarājā cāturanto vijitāvī janapadatthāvariyappatto sattaratanasamannāgato.
translation-en-sujato: If he stays at home he becomes a king, a wheel-turning monarch, a just and principled king. His dominion extends to all four sides, he achieves stability in the country, and he possesses the seven treasures.

root-pli-ms: Tassimāni sattaratanāni bhavanti.
translation-en-sujato: He has the following seven treasures:

root-pli-ms: Seyyathidaṁ—cakkaratanaṁ hatthiratanaṁ assaratanaṁ maṇiratanaṁ itthiratanaṁ gahapatiratanaṁ pariṇāyakaratanameva sattamaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: the wheel, the elephant, the horse, the jewel, the woman, the treasurer, and the counselor as the seventh treasure.

root-pli-ms: Parosahassaṁ kho panassa puttā bhavanti sūrā vīraṅgarūpā parasenappamaddanā.
translation-en-sujato: He has over a thousand sons who are valiant and heroic, crushing the armies of his enemies.

root-pli-ms: So imaṁ pathaviṁ sāgarapariyantaṁ adaṇḍena asatthena dhammena abhivijiya ajjhāvasati.
translation-en-sujato: After conquering this land girt by sea, he reigns by principle, without rod or sword.

root-pli-ms: Sace kho pana agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajati, arahaṁ hoti sammāsambuddho loke vivaṭacchado.
translation-en-sujato: But if he goes forth from the lay life to homelessness, he becomes a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha, who draws back the veil from the world.

root-pli-ms: Katamehi cāyaṁ, deva, kumāro dvattiṁsamahāpurisalakkhaṇehi samannāgato, yehi samannāgatassa mahāpurisassa dveva gatiyo bhavanti anaññā.
translation-en-sujato: And what are the marks which he possesses?
reference: cck10.21, mc10.15, ms7D_51, msdiv34, pts-cs1.32, pts-vp-pli2.17, sc50

root-pli-ms: Sace agāraṁ ajjhāvasati, rājā hoti cakkavattī dhammiko dhammarājā cāturanto vijitāvī janapadatthāvariyappatto sattaratanasamannāgato.
Tassimāni sattaratanāni bhavanti.
Seyyathidaṁ—cakkaratanaṁ hatthiratanaṁ assaratanaṁ maṇiratanaṁ itthiratanaṁ gahapatiratanaṁ pariṇāyakaratanameva sattamaṁ.
Parosahassaṁ kho panassa puttā bhavanti sūrā vīraṅgarūpā parasenappamaddanā.
So imaṁ pathaviṁ sāgarapariyantaṁ adaṇḍena asatthena dhammena abhivijiya ajjhāvasati.
translation-en-sujato: After conquering this land girt by sea, he reigns by principle, without rod or sword.

root-pli-ms: Sace kho pana agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajati, arahaṁ hoti sammāsambuddho loke vivaṭacchado. Ayañhi, deva, kumāro suppatiṭṭhitapādo. Yaṁ pāyaṁ, deva, kumāro suppatiṭṭhitapādo. Idampissa mahāpurisassa mahāpurisalakkhaṇaṁ bhavati. (1)
translation-en-sujato: He has well-planted feet.

root-pli-ms: Imassa, deva, kumārassa heṭṭhā pādatalesu cakkāni jātāni sahassārāni sanemikāni sanābhikāni sabbākāraparipūrāni. Yampi imassa, deva, kumārassa heṭṭhā pādatalesu cakkāni jātāni sahassārāni sanemikāni sanābhikāni sabbākāraparipūrāni, idampissa mahāpurisassa mahāpurisalakkhaṇaṁ bhavati. (2)
translation-en-sujato: On the soles of his feet there are thousand-spoked wheels, with rims and hubs, complete in every detail.

root-pli-ms: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro āyatapaṇhī …pe… (3)
translation-en-sujato: He has projecting heels.

root-pli-ms: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro dīghaṅgulī …pe… (4)
translation-en-sujato: He has long fingers.

root-pli-ms: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro mudutalunahatthapādo …pe… (5)
translation-en-sujato: His hands and feet are tender.

root-pli-ms: Ayañhi, deva kumāro jālahatthapādo …pe… (6)
translation-en-sujato: His hands and feet cling gracefully.

root-pli-ms: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro ussaṅkhapādo …pe… (7)
translation-en-sujato: His feet are arched.

root-pli-ms: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro eṇijaṅgho …pe… (8)
translation-en-sujato: His calves are like those of an antelope.

root-pli-ms: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro ṭhitakova anonamanto ubhohi pāṇitalehi jaṇṇukāni parimasati parimajjati …pe… (9)
translation-en-sujato: When standing upright and not bending over, the palms of both hands touch the knees.

root-pli-ms: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro kosohitavatthaguyho …pe… (10)
translation-en-sujato: His private parts are retracted.

root-pli-ms: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro suvaṇṇavaṇṇo kañcanasannibhattaco …pe… (11)
translation-en-sujato: He is gold colored; his skin has a golden sheen.

root-pli-ms: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro sukhumacchavī; sukhumattā chaviyā rajojallaṁ kāye na upalimpati …pe… (12)
translation-en-sujato: He has delicate skin, so delicate that dust and dirt don’t stick to his body.

root-pli-ms: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro ekekalomo; ekekāni lomāni lomakūpesu jātāni …pe… (13)
translation-en-sujato: His hairs grow one per pore.

root-pli-ms: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro uddhaggalomo; uddhaggāni lomāni jātāni nīlāni añjanavaṇṇāni kuṇḍalāvaṭṭāni dakkhiṇāvaṭṭakajātāni …pe… (14)
translation-en-sujato: His hairs stand up; they’re blue-black and curl clockwise.

root-pli-ms: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro brahmujugatto …pe… (15)
translation-en-sujato: His body is as straight as Brahmā’s.

root-pli-ms: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro sattussado …pe… (16)
translation-en-sujato: He has bulging muscles in seven places.

root-pli-ms: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro sīhapubbaddhakāyo …pe… (17)
translation-en-sujato: His chest is like that of a lion.

root-pli-ms: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro citantaraṁso …pe… (18)
translation-en-sujato: The gap between the shoulder-blades is filled in.

root-pli-ms: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro nigrodhaparimaṇḍalo yāvatakvassa kāyo tāvatakvassa byāmo, yāvatakvassa byāmo, tāvatakvassa kāyo …pe… (19)
translation-en-sujato: He has the proportional circumference of a banyan tree: the span of his arms equals the height of his body.

root-pli-ms: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro samavaṭṭakkhandho …pe… (20)
translation-en-sujato: His torso is cylindrical.

root-pli-ms: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro rasaggasaggī …pe… (21)
translation-en-sujato: He has an excellent sense of taste.

root-pli-ms: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro sīhahanu …pe… (22)
translation-en-sujato: His jaw is like that of a lion.

root-pli-ms: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro cattālīsadanto …pe… (23)
translation-en-sujato: He has forty teeth.

root-pli-ms: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro samadanto …pe… (24)
translation-en-sujato: His teeth are even.

root-pli-ms: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro aviraḷadanto …pe… (25)
translation-en-sujato: His teeth have no gaps.

root-pli-ms: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro susukkadāṭho …pe… (26)
translation-en-sujato: His teeth are perfectly white.

root-pli-ms: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro pahūtajivho …pe… (27)
translation-en-sujato: He has a large tongue.

root-pli-ms: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro brahmassaro karavīkabhāṇī …pe… (28)
translation-en-sujato: He has the voice of Brahmā, like a cuckoo’s call.

root-pli-ms: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro abhinīlanetto …pe… (29)
translation-en-sujato: His eyes are deep blue.

root-pli-ms: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro gopakhumo …pe… (30)
translation-en-sujato: He has eyelashes like a cow’s.

root-pli-ms: Imassa, deva, kumārassa uṇṇā bhamukantare jātā odātā mudutūlasannibhā. Yampi imassa, deva, kumārassa uṇṇā bhamukantare jātā odātā mudutūlasannibhā, idampimassa mahāpurisassa mahāpurisalakkhaṇaṁ bhavati. (31)
translation-en-sujato: Between his eyebrows there grows a tuft, soft and white like cotton-wool.

root-pli-ms: Ayañhi, deva, kumāro uṇhīsasīso. Yaṁ pāyaṁ, deva, kumāro uṇhīsasīso, idampissa mahāpurisassa mahāpurisalakkhaṇaṁ bhavati. (32)
translation-en-sujato: His head is shaped like a turban.

root-pli-ms: Imehi kho ayaṁ, deva, kumāro dvattiṁsamahāpurisalakkhaṇehi samannāgato, yehi samannāgatassa mahāpurisassa dveva gatiyo bhavanti anaññā.
translation-en-sujato: These are the thirty-two marks of a great man that the prince has. A great man who possesses these has only two possible destinies, no other.
reference: cck10.24, csp1ed7.17, csp2ed7.17, ms7D_84, msdiv36, pts-cs1.33, sc83

root-pli-ms: Sace agāraṁ ajjhāvasati, rājā hoti cakkavattī dhammiko dhammarājā cāturanto vijitāvī janapadatthāvariyappatto sattaratanasamannāgato.
translation-en-sujato: If he stays at home he becomes a king, a wheel-turning monarch.

root-pli-ms: Tassimāni sattaratanāni bhavanti.
Seyyathidaṁ—cakkaratanaṁ hatthiratanaṁ assaratanaṁ maṇiratanaṁ itthiratanaṁ gahapatiratanaṁ pariṇāyakaratanameva sattamaṁ.
Parosahassaṁ kho panassa puttā bhavanti sūrā vīraṅgarūpā parasenappamaddanā.
So imaṁ pathaviṁ sāgarapariyantaṁ adaṇḍena asatthena dhammena abhivijiya ajjhāvasati.
Sace kho pana agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajati, arahaṁ hoti sammāsambuddho loke vivaṭacchado’ti.
translation-en-sujato: But if he goes forth from the lay life to homelessness, he becomes a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha, who draws back the veil from the world.’

root-pli-ms: 4. Vipassīsamaññā
translation-en-sujato: 4. How He Came to be Known as Vipassī

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhikkhave, bandhumā rājā nemitte brāhmaṇe ahatehi vatthehi acchādāpetvā sabbakāmehi santappesi.
translation-en-sujato: Then King Bandhuma had the brahmin soothsayers dressed in fresh clothes and satisfied all their needs.
reference: cck10.25, dr10.22, mc10.18, ms7D_85, msdiv37, ndp7.17, pts-vp-pli2.20, sc84, sya10.23

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhikkhave, bandhumā rājā vipassissa kumārassa dhātiyo upaṭṭhāpesi.
translation-en-sujato: Then the king appointed nurses for Prince Vipassī.

root-pli-ms: Aññā khīraṁ pāyenti, aññā nhāpenti, aññā dhārenti, aññā aṅkena pariharanti.
translation-en-sujato: Some suckled him, some bathed him, some held him, and some carried him on their hip.

root-pli-ms: Jātassa kho pana, bhikkhave, vipassissa kumārassa setacchattaṁ dhārayittha divā ceva rattiñca:
translation-en-sujato: From when he was born, a white parasol was held over him night and day, with the thought,

root-pli-ms: ‘mā naṁ sītaṁ vā uṇhaṁ vā tiṇaṁ vā rajo vā ussāvo vā bādhayitthā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Don’t let cold, heat, grass, dust, or damp bother him.’

root-pli-ms: Jāto kho pana, bhikkhave, vipassī kumāro bahuno janassa piyo ahosi manāpo.
translation-en-sujato: He was dear and beloved by many people,

root-pli-ms: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, uppalaṁ vā padumaṁ vā puṇḍarīkaṁ vā bahuno janassa piyaṁ manāpaṁ;
translation-en-sujato: like a blue water lily, or a pink or white lotus.

root-pli-ms: evameva kho, bhikkhave, vipassī kumāro bahuno janassa piyo ahosi manāpo.
Svāssudaṁ aṅkeneva aṅkaṁ parihariyati.
translation-en-sujato: He was always passed from hip to hip.

root-pli-ms: Jāto kho pana, bhikkhave, vipassī kumāro mañjussaro ca ahosi vaggussaro ca madhurassaro ca pemaniyassaro ca.
translation-en-sujato: From when he was born, his voice was charming, graceful, sweet, and lovely.
variant-pli-ms: kho pana, bhikkhave, vipassī kumāro mañjussaro ca → kumāro brahmassaro mañjussaro ca (mr)

root-pli-ms: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, himavante pabbate karavīkā nāma sakuṇajāti mañjussarā ca vaggussarā ca madhurassarā ca pemaniyassarā ca;
translation-en-sujato: It was as sweet as the song of a cuckoo-bird found in the Himalayas.

root-pli-ms: evameva kho, bhikkhave, vipassī kumāro mañjussaro ca ahosi vaggussaro ca madhurassaro ca pemaniyassaro ca.
Jātassa kho pana, bhikkhave, vipassissa kumārassa kammavipākajaṁ dibbacakkhu pāturahosi yena sudaṁ samantā yojanaṁ passati divā ceva rattiñca.
translation-en-sujato: From when he was born, Prince Vipassī had the power of clairvoyance which manifested as a result of past deeds. He could see for a league all around both by day and by night.

root-pli-ms: Jāto kho pana, bhikkhave, vipassī kumāro animisanto pekkhati seyyathāpi devā tāvatiṁsā.
translation-en-sujato: And he was unblinkingly watchful, like the gods of the Thirty-Three.

root-pli-ms: ‘Animisanto kumāro pekkhatī’ti kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa kumārassa ‘vipassī vipassī’ tveva samaññā udapādi.
translation-en-sujato: And because it was said that he was unblinkingly watchful, he came to be known as ‘Vipassī’.
variant-pli-ms: Animisanto kumāro pekkhatī’ti kho, bhikkhave → jātassa kho pana bhikkhave (sya-all); animmissantā pekkhāti evameva kho bhikkheve (km); jātassa kho pana bhikkhave (mr)

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhikkhave, bandhumā rājā atthakaraṇe nisinno vipassiṁ kumāraṁ aṅke nisīdāpetvā atthe anusāsati.
translation-en-sujato: Then while King Bandhuma was sitting in judgment, he’d sit Prince Vipassī in his lap and explain the case to him.
reference: cck10.26, csp1ed7.18, csp2ed7.18, ms7D_89, msdiv41, pts-vp-pli2.21, sc88, sya10.24

root-pli-ms: Tatra sudaṁ, bhikkhave, vipassī kumāro pituaṅke nisinno viceyya viceyya atthe panāyati ñāyena.
translation-en-sujato: And sitting there in his father’s lap, Vipassī would thoroughly consider the case and draw a conclusion using a logical procedure.
comment-en-sujato: MW is wrong here.

root-pli-ms: Viceyya viceyya kumāro atthe panāyati ñāyenāti kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa kumārassa bhiyyoso mattāya ‘vipassī vipassī’ tveva samaññā udapādi.
translation-en-sujato: So this was all the more reason for him to be known as ‘Vipassī’.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhikkhave, bandhumā rājā vipassissa kumārassa tayo pāsāde kārāpesi, ekaṁ vassikaṁ ekaṁ hemantikaṁ ekaṁ gimhikaṁ;
translation-en-sujato: Then King Bandhuma had three stilt longhouses built for him—one for the winter, one for the summer, and one for the rainy season,

root-pli-ms: pañca kāmaguṇāni upaṭṭhāpesi.
translation-en-sujato: and provided him with the five kinds of sensual stimulation.

root-pli-ms: Tatra sudaṁ, bhikkhave, vipassī kumāro vassike pāsāde cattāro māse nippurisehi tūriyehi paricārayamāno na heṭṭhāpāsādaṁ orohatīti.
translation-en-sujato: Prince Vipassī stayed in a stilt longhouse without coming downstairs for the four months of the rainy season, where he was entertained by musicians—none of them men.
variant-pli-ms: Tatra sudaṁ, bhikkhave, vipassī kumāro vassike pāsāde cattāro māse → vassike pāsāde vassike cattāro māse (bj, pts1ed)

root-pli-ms: Paṭhamabhāṇavāro.
5. Jiṇṇapurisa
translation-en-sujato: 5. The Old Man

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassī kumāro bahūnaṁ vassānaṁ bahūnaṁ vassasatānaṁ bahūnaṁ vassasahassānaṁ accayena sārathiṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: Then, after many thousand years had passed, Prince Vipassī addressed his charioteer,

root-pli-ms: ‘yojehi, samma sārathi, bhaddāni bhaddāni yānāni uyyānabhūmiṁ gacchāma subhūmidassanāyā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘My dear charioteer, harness the finest chariots. We will go to a park and see the scenery.’

root-pli-ms: ‘Evaṁ, devā’ti kho, bhikkhave, sārathi vipassissa kumārassa paṭissutvā bhaddāni bhaddāni yānāni yojetvā vipassissa kumārassa paṭivedesi:
translation-en-sujato: ‘Yes, sir,’ replied the charioteer. He harnessed the chariots and informed the prince,

root-pli-ms: ‘yuttāni kho te, deva, bhaddāni bhaddāni yānāni,
translation-en-sujato: ‘Sire, the finest chariots are harnessed.

root-pli-ms: yassadāni kālaṁ maññasī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: Please go at your convenience.’

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassī kumāro bhaddaṁ bhaddaṁ yānaṁ abhiruhitvā bhaddehi bhaddehi yānehi uyyānabhūmiṁ niyyāsi.
translation-en-sujato: Then Prince Vipassī mounted a fine carriage and, along with other fine carriages, set out for the park.

root-pli-ms: Addasā kho, bhikkhave, vipassī kumāro uyyānabhūmiṁ niyyanto purisaṁ jiṇṇaṁ gopānasivaṅkaṁ bhoggaṁ daṇḍaparāyanaṁ pavedhamānaṁ gacchantaṁ āturaṁ gatayobbanaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Along the way he saw an elderly man, bent double, crooked, leaning on a staff, trembling as he walked, ailing, past his prime.
reference: cck10.27, csp1ed7.19, csp2ed7.19, dr10.25, ms7D_93, msdiv44, pts-cs2.2, pts-vp-pli2.22, sc91, sya10.25

root-pli-ms: Disvā sārathiṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: He addressed his charioteer,

root-pli-ms: ‘ayaṁ pana, samma sārathi, puriso kiṅkato?
translation-en-sujato: ‘My dear charioteer, what has that man done?

root-pli-ms: Kesāpissa na yathā aññesaṁ, kāyopissa na yathā aññesan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: For his hair and his body are unlike those of other men.’

root-pli-ms: ‘Eso kho, deva, jiṇṇo nāmā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘That, Your Majesty, is called an old man.’

root-pli-ms: ‘Kiṁ paneso, samma sārathi, jiṇṇo nāmā’ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘But why is he called an old man?’

root-pli-ms: ‘Eso kho, deva, jiṇṇo nāma. Na dāni tena ciraṁ jīvitabbaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘He’s called an old man because now he has not long to live.’

root-pli-ms: ‘Kiṁ pana, samma sārathi, ahampi jarādhammo, jaraṁ anatīto’ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘But my dear charioteer, am I liable to grow old? Am I not exempt from old age?’

root-pli-ms: ‘Tvañca, deva, mayañcamha sabbe jarādhammā, jaraṁ anatītā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Everyone is liable to grow old, Your Majesty, including you. No-one is exempt from old age.’

root-pli-ms: ‘Tena hi, samma sārathi, alaṁ dānajja uyyānabhūmiyā. Itova antepuraṁ paccaniyyāhī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Well then, my dear charioteer, that’s enough of the park for today. Let’s return to the royal compound.’

root-pli-ms: ‘Evaṁ, devā’ti kho, bhikkhave, sārathi vipassissa kumārassa paṭissutvā tatova antepuraṁ paccaniyyāsi.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Yes, Your Majesty,’ replied the charioteer and did so.

root-pli-ms: Tatra sudaṁ, bhikkhave, vipassī kumāro antepuraṁ gato dukkhī dummano pajjhāyati:
translation-en-sujato: Back at the royal compound, the prince brooded, miserable and sad:

root-pli-ms: ‘dhiratthu kira, bho, jāti nāma, yatra hi nāma jātassa jarā paññāyissatī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Damn this thing called rebirth, since old age will come to anyone who’s born.’

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhikkhave, bandhumā rājā sārathiṁ āmantāpetvā etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: Then King Bandhuma summoned the charioteer and said,
reference: bj8.34, cck10.28, dr10.26, mc10.20, ms7D_94, msdiv45, ndp7.19, pts-cs2.3, pts-vp-pli2.23, sc92, sya10.26

root-pli-ms: ‘kacci, samma sārathi, kumāro uyyānabhūmiyā abhiramittha? Kacci, samma sārathi, kumāro uyyānabhūmiyā attamano ahosī’ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘My dear charioteer, I hope the prince enjoyed himself at the park? I hope he was happy there?’

root-pli-ms: ‘Na kho, deva, kumāro uyyānabhūmiyā abhiramittha, na kho, deva, kumāro uyyānabhūmiyā attamano ahosī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘No, Your Majesty, the prince didn’t enjoy himself at the park.’

root-pli-ms: ‘Kiṁ pana, samma sārathi, addasa kumāro uyyānabhūmiṁ niyyanto’ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘But what did he see on the way to the park?’

root-pli-ms: ‘Addasā kho, deva, kumāro uyyānabhūmiṁ niyyanto purisaṁ jiṇṇaṁ gopānasivaṅkaṁ bhoggaṁ daṇḍaparāyanaṁ pavedhamānaṁ gacchantaṁ āturaṁ gatayobbanaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: And the charioteer told the king about seeing the old man and the prince’s reaction.

root-pli-ms: Disvā maṁ etadavoca:
“ayaṁ pana, samma sārathi, puriso kiṅkato, kesāpissa na yathā aññesaṁ, kāyopissa na yathā aññesan”ti?
“Eso kho, deva, jiṇṇo nāmā”ti.
“Kiṁ paneso, samma sārathi, jiṇṇo nāmā”ti?
“Eso kho, deva, jiṇṇo nāma na dāni tena ciraṁ jīvitabbaṁ bhavissatī”ti.
“Kiṁ pana, samma sārathi, ahampi jarādhammo, jaraṁ anatīto”ti?
“Tvañca, deva, mayañcamha sabbe jarādhammā, jaraṁ anatītā”ti.
“Tena hi, samma sārathi, alaṁ dānajja uyyānabhūmiyā, itova antepuraṁ paccaniyyāhī”ti.
“Evaṁ, devā”ti kho ahaṁ, deva, vipassissa kumārassa paṭissutvā tatova antepuraṁ paccaniyyāsiṁ.
So kho, deva, kumāro antepuraṁ gato dukkhī dummano pajjhāyati:
“dhiratthu kira, bho, jāti nāma, yatra hi nāma jātassa jarā paññāyissatī”’ti.
6. Byādhitapurisa
translation-en-sujato: 6. The Sick Man

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhikkhave, bandhumassa rañño etadahosi:
translation-en-sujato: Then King Bandhuma thought,
reference: csp1ed7.20, csp2ed7.20, ms7D_96, msdiv46, pts-cs2.4, sc94

root-pli-ms: ‘Mā heva kho vipassī kumāro na rajjaṁ kāresi, mā heva vipassī kumāro agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbaji, mā heva nemittānaṁ brāhmaṇānaṁ saccaṁ assa vacanan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Prince Vipassī must not renounce the throne. He must not go forth from the lay life to homelessness. And the words of the brahmin soothsayers must not come true.’

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhikkhave, bandhumā rājā vipassissa kumārassa bhiyyoso mattāya pañca kāmaguṇāni upaṭṭhāpesi:
translation-en-sujato: To this end he provided the prince with even more of the five kinds of sensual stimulation,

root-pli-ms: ‘yathā vipassī kumāro rajjaṁ kareyya, yathā vipassī kumāro na agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajeyya, yathā nemittānaṁ brāhmaṇānaṁ micchā assa vacanan’ti.
Tatra sudaṁ, bhikkhave, vipassī kumāro pañcahi kāmaguṇehi samappito samaṅgībhūto paricāreti.
translation-en-sujato: with which the prince amused himself.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassī kumāro bahūnaṁ vassānaṁ …pe…
translation-en-sujato: Then, after many thousand years had passed, Prince Vipassī had his charioteer drive him to the park once more.

root-pli-ms: Addasā kho, bhikkhave, vipassī kumāro uyyānabhūmiṁ niyyanto purisaṁ ābādhikaṁ dukkhitaṁ bāḷhagilānaṁ sake muttakarīse palipannaṁ semānaṁ aññehi vuṭṭhāpiyamānaṁ aññehi saṁvesiyamānaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Along the way he saw a man who was ill, suffering, gravely ill, collapsed in his own urine and feces, being picked up by some and put down by others.
reference: bj8.36, cck10.30, dr10.27, mc10.21, ms7D_99, msdiv47, ndp7.20, pts-cs2.6, pts-vp-pli2.24, sc97, sya10.27

root-pli-ms: Disvā sārathiṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: He addressed his charioteer,

root-pli-ms: ‘ayaṁ pana, samma sārathi, puriso kiṅkato?
translation-en-sujato: ‘My dear charioteer, what has that man done?

root-pli-ms: Akkhīnipissa na yathā aññesaṁ, saropissa na yathā aññesan’ti?
translation-en-sujato: For his eyes and his voice are unlike those of other men.’

root-pli-ms: ‘Eso kho, deva, byādhito nāmā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘That, Your Majesty, is called a sick man.’
