root-pli-ms: ‘adhigato kho myāyaṁ maggo sambodhāya yadidaṁ—
translation-en-sujato: ‘I have discovered the path to awakening. That is:
comment-en-sujato: The PTS’s inclusion of vipassana here, unaccountably followed by RD and MW, is an egregious and embarassing error. No manuscript contains this reading, and the PTS edition itself states that the word is found only in the commentary. To be clear, there it is obviously presented not as a reading but as an explanation: “Maggoti vipassanāmaggo.”

root-pli-ms: nāmarūpanirodhā viññāṇanirodho, viññāṇanirodhā nāmarūpanirodho, nāmarūpanirodhā saḷāyatananirodho, saḷāyatananirodhā phassanirodho, phassanirodhā vedanānirodho, vedanānirodhā taṇhānirodho, taṇhānirodhā upādānanirodho, upādānanirodhā bhavanirodho, bhavanirodhā jātinirodho, jātinirodhā jarāmaraṇaṁ sokaparidevadukkhadomanassupāyāsā nirujjhanti.
translation-en-sujato: When name and form cease, consciousness ceases. When consciousness ceases, name and form cease. When name and form cease, the six sense fields cease. When the six sense fields cease, contact ceases. When contact ceases, feeling ceases. When feeling ceases, craving ceases. When craving ceases, grasping ceases. When grasping ceases, continued existence ceases. When continued existence ceases, rebirth ceases. When rebirth ceases, old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress cease.

root-pli-ms: Evametassa kevalassa dukkhakkhandhassa nirodho hoti’.
translation-en-sujato: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.’

root-pli-ms: ‘Nirodho nirodho’ti kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bodhisattassa pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhuṁ udapādi, ñāṇaṁ udapādi, paññā udapādi, vijjā udapādi, āloko udapādi.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Cessation, cessation.’ Such was the vision, knowledge, wisdom, realization, and light that arose in Vipassī, the one intent on awakening, regarding teachings not learned before from another.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassī bodhisatto aparena samayena pañcasu upādānakkhandhesu udayabbayānupassī vihāsi:
translation-en-sujato: Some time later Vipassī meditated observing rise and fall in the five grasping aggregates.

root-pli-ms: ‘iti rūpaṁ, iti rūpassa samudayo, iti rūpassa atthaṅgamo;
translation-en-sujato: ‘Such is form, such is the origin of form, such is the ending of form.

root-pli-ms: iti vedanā, iti vedanāya samudayo, iti vedanāya atthaṅgamo;
translation-en-sujato: Such is feeling, such is the origin of feeling, such is the ending of feeling.

root-pli-ms: iti saññā, iti saññāya samudayo, iti saññāya atthaṅgamo;
translation-en-sujato: Such is perception, such is the origin of perception, such is the ending of perception.

root-pli-ms: iti saṅkhārā, iti saṅkhārānaṁ samudayo, iti saṅkhārānaṁ atthaṅgamo;
translation-en-sujato: Such are choices, such is the origin of choices, such is the ending of choices.

root-pli-ms: iti viññāṇaṁ, iti viññāṇassa samudayo, iti viññāṇassa atthaṅgamo’ti,
translation-en-sujato: Such is consciousness, such is the origin of consciousness, such is the ending of consciousness.’

root-pli-ms: tassa pañcasu upādānakkhandhesu udayabbayānupassino viharato na cirasseva anupādāya āsavehi cittaṁ vimuccīti.
translation-en-sujato: Meditating like this his mind was soon freed from defilements by not grasping.

root-pli-ms: Dutiyabhāṇavāro.
12. Brahmayācanakathā
translation-en-sujato: 12. The Appeal of Brahmā

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa etadahosi:
translation-en-sujato: Then the Blessed One Vipassī, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha, thought,
reference: bj8.54, cck10.45, csp1ed7.31, csp2ed7.31, dr10.42, mc10.32, ms7D_139, msdiv64, pts-cs3.1, pts-vp-pli2.36, sc136, sya10.41

root-pli-ms: ‘yannūnāhaṁ dhammaṁ deseyyan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Why don’t I teach the Dhamma?’

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa etadahosi:
translation-en-sujato: Then he thought,

root-pli-ms: ‘adhigato kho myāyaṁ dhammo gambhīro duddaso duranubodho santo paṇīto atakkāvacaro nipuṇo paṇḍitavedanīyo.
translation-en-sujato: ‘This principle I have discovered is deep, hard to see, hard to understand, peaceful, sublime, beyond the scope of reason, subtle, comprehensible to the astute.

root-pli-ms: Ālayarāmā kho panāyaṁ pajā ālayaratā ālayasammuditā.
translation-en-sujato: But people like attachment, they love it and enjoy it.

root-pli-ms: Ālayarāmāya kho pana pajāya ālayaratāya ālayasammuditāya duddasaṁ idaṁ ṭhānaṁ yadidaṁ idappaccayatāpaṭiccasamuppādo.
translation-en-sujato: It’s hard for them to see this thing; that is, specific conditionality, dependent origination.

root-pli-ms: Idampi kho ṭhānaṁ duddasaṁ yadidaṁ sabbasaṅkhārasamatho sabbūpadhipaṭinissaggo taṇhākkhayo virāgo nirodho nibbānaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: It’s also hard for them to see this thing; that is, the stilling of all activities, the letting go of all attachments, the ending of craving, fading away, cessation, extinguishment.

root-pli-ms: Ahañceva kho pana dhammaṁ deseyyaṁ, pare ca me na ājāneyyuṁ; so mamassa kilamatho, sā mamassa vihesā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: And if I were to teach the Dhamma, others might not understand me, which would be wearying and troublesome for me.’

root-pli-ms: Apissu, bhikkhave, vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ imā anacchariyā gāthāyo paṭibhaṁsu pubbe assutapubbā:
translation-en-sujato: And then these verses, which were neither supernaturally inspired, nor learned before in the past, occurred to him:

root-pli-ms: ‘Kicchena me adhigataṁ,
translation-en-sujato: ‘I’ve struggled hard to realize this,

root-pli-ms: halaṁ dāni pakāsituṁ;
translation-en-sujato: enough with trying to explain it!

root-pli-ms: Rāgadosaparetehi,
translation-en-sujato: This teaching is not easily understood

root-pli-ms: nāyaṁ dhammo susambudho.
translation-en-sujato: by those mired in greed and hate.

root-pli-ms: Paṭisotagāmiṁ nipuṇaṁ,
translation-en-sujato: Those caught up in greed can’t see

root-pli-ms: gambhīraṁ duddasaṁ aṇuṁ;
translation-en-sujato: what’s subtle, going against the stream,

root-pli-ms: Rāgarattā na dakkhanti,
translation-en-sujato: deep, hard to see, and very fine,

root-pli-ms: tamokhandhena āvuṭā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: for they’re shrouded in a mass of darkness.’

root-pli-ms: Itiha, bhikkhave, vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa paṭisañcikkhato appossukkatāya cittaṁ nami, no dhammadesanāya.
translation-en-sujato: So, as the Buddha Vipassī reflected like this, his mind inclined to remaining passive, not to teaching the Dhamma.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhikkhave, aññatarassa mahābrahmuno vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa cetasā cetoparivitakkamaññāya etadahosi:
translation-en-sujato: Then a certain Great Brahmā, knowing what the Buddha Vipassī was thinking, thought,
reference: cck10.46, csp1ed7.32, csp2ed7.32, dr10.43, ms7D_144, msdiv66, pts-vp-pli2.37, sc141, sya10.42

root-pli-ms: ‘nassati vata bho loko, vinassati vata bho loko, yatra hi nāma vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa appossukkatāya cittaṁ namati, no dhammadesanāyā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Oh my goodness! The world will be lost, the world will perish! For the mind of the Realized One Vipassī, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha, inclines to remaining passive, not to teaching the Dhamma.’

root-pli-ms: Atha kho so, bhikkhave, mahābrahmā seyyathāpi nāma balavā puriso samiñjitaṁ vā bāhaṁ pasāreyya, pasāritaṁ vā bāhaṁ samiñjeyya; evameva—brahmaloke antarahito vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa purato pāturahosi.
translation-en-sujato: Then, as easily as a strong person would extend or contract their arm, he vanished from the Brahmā realm and reappeared in front of the Buddha Vipassī.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho so, bhikkhave, mahābrahmā ekaṁsaṁ uttarāsaṅgaṁ karitvā dakkhiṇaṁ jāṇumaṇḍalaṁ pathaviyaṁ nihantvā yena vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho tenañjaliṁ paṇāmetvā vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: He arranged his robe over one shoulder, knelt on his right knee, raised his joined palms toward the Buddha Vipassī, and said,

root-pli-ms: ‘desetu, bhante, bhagavā dhammaṁ, desetu sugato dhammaṁ,
translation-en-sujato: ‘Sir, let the Blessed One teach the Dhamma! Let the Holy One teach the Dhamma!

root-pli-ms: santi sattā apparajakkhajātikā; assavanatā dhammassa parihāyanti,
translation-en-sujato: There are beings with little dust in their eyes. They’re in decline because they haven’t heard the teaching.

root-pli-ms: bhavissanti dhammassa aññātāro’ti.
translation-en-sujato: There will be those who understand the teaching!’

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vutte, bhikkhave, vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho taṁ mahābrahmānaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: When he said this, the Buddha Vipassī said to him,
reference: bj8.56, cck10.47, mc10.33, ms7D_145, msdiv67, ndp7.31, pts-cs3.4, pts-vp-pli2.38, sc142, sya10.43

root-pli-ms: ‘mayhampi kho, brahme, etadahosi:
translation-en-sujato: ‘I too thought this, Brahmā,

root-pli-ms: “yannūnāhaṁ dhammaṁ deseyyan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Why don’t I teach the Dhamma?”

root-pli-ms: Tassa mayhaṁ, brahme, etadahosi:
translation-en-sujato: Then it occurred to me,

root-pli-ms: “adhigato kho myāyaṁ dhammo gambhīro duddaso duranubodho santo paṇīto atakkāvacaro nipuṇo paṇḍitavedanīyo.
Ālayarāmā kho panāyaṁ pajā ālayaratā ālayasammuditā.
Ālayarāmāya kho pana pajāya ālayaratāya ālayasammuditāya duddasaṁ idaṁ ṭhānaṁ yadidaṁ idappaccayatāpaṭiccasamuppādo.
Idampi kho ṭhānaṁ duddasaṁ yadidaṁ sabbasaṅkhārasamatho sabbūpadhipaṭinissaggo taṇhākkhayo virāgo nirodho nibbānaṁ.
Ahañceva kho pana dhammaṁ deseyyaṁ, pare ca me na ājāneyyuṁ; so mamassa kilamatho, sā mamassa vihesā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “If I were to teach the Dhamma, others might not understand me, which would be wearying and troublesome for me.”

root-pli-ms: Apissu maṁ, brahme, imā anacchariyā gāthāyo paṭibhaṁsu pubbe assutapubbā:
“Kicchena me adhigataṁ,
halaṁ dāni pakāsituṁ;
Rāgadosaparetehi,
nāyaṁ dhammo susambudho.
Paṭisotagāmiṁ nipuṇaṁ,
gambhīraṁ duddasaṁ aṇuṁ;
Rāgarattā na dakkhanti,
tamokhandhena āvuṭā”ti.
Itiha me, brahme, paṭisañcikkhato appossukkatāya cittaṁ nami, no dhammadesanāyā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: So, as I reflected like this, my mind inclined to remaining passive, not to teaching the Dhamma.’

root-pli-ms: Dutiyampi kho, bhikkhave, so mahābrahmā …pe…
translation-en-sujato: For a second time,

root-pli-ms: tatiyampi kho, bhikkhave, so mahābrahmā vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: and a third time that Great Brahmā begged the Buddha to teach.

root-pli-ms: ‘desetu, bhante, bhagavā dhammaṁ, desetu sugato dhammaṁ, santi sattā apparajakkhajātikā, assavanatā dhammassa parihāyanti, bhavissanti dhammassa aññātāro’ti.
Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho brahmuno ca ajjhesanaṁ viditvā sattesu ca kāruññataṁ paṭicca buddhacakkhunā lokaṁ volokesi.
translation-en-sujato: Then, understanding Brahmā’s invitation, the Buddha Vipassī surveyed the world with the eye of a Buddha, because of his compassion for sentient beings.
reference: bj8.58, cck10.48, csp1ed7.33, csp2ed7.33, dr10.45, mc10.34, ms7D_150, msdiv69, pts-cs3.6, pts-vp-pli2.39, sc147, sya10.44

root-pli-ms: Addasā kho, bhikkhave, vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho buddhacakkhunā lokaṁ volokento satte apparajakkhe mahārajakkhe tikkhindriye mudindriye svākāre dvākāre suviññāpaye duviññāpaye appekacce paralokavajjabhayadassāvine viharante, appekacce na paralokavajjabhayadassāvine viharante.
translation-en-sujato: And he saw sentient beings with little dust in their eyes, and some with much dust in their eyes; with keen faculties and with weak faculties, with good qualities and with bad qualities, easy to teach and hard to teach. And some of them lived seeing the danger in the fault to do with the next world, while others did not.
variant-pli-ms: suviññāpaye duviññāpaye → duviññāpaye bhabbe abhabbe (sya-all, km) | appekacce na paralokavajjabhayadassāvine viharante → ayaṁ pāṭho sya-all, km potthakesu natthi

root-pli-ms: Seyyathāpi nāma uppaliniyaṁ vā paduminiyaṁ vā puṇḍarīkiniyaṁ vā appekaccāni uppalāni vā padumāni vā puṇḍarīkāni vā udake jātāni udake saṁvaḍḍhāni udakānuggatāni anto nimuggaposīni. Appekaccāni uppalāni vā padumāni vā puṇḍarīkāni vā udake jātāni udake saṁvaḍḍhāni samodakaṁ ṭhitāni. Appekaccāni uppalāni vā padumāni vā puṇḍarīkāni vā udake jātāni udake saṁvaḍḍhāni udakā accuggamma ṭhitāni anupalittāni udakena.
translation-en-sujato: It’s like a pool with blue water lilies, or pink or white lotuses. Some of them sprout and grow in the water without rising above it, thriving underwater. Some of them sprout and grow in the water reaching the water’s surface. And some of them sprout and grow in the water but rise up above the water and stand with no water clinging to them.

root-pli-ms: Evameva kho, bhikkhave, vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho buddhacakkhunā lokaṁ volokento addasa satte apparajakkhe mahārajakkhe tikkhindriye mudindriye svākāre dvākāre suviññāpaye duviññāpaye appekacce paralokavajjabhayadassāvine viharante, appekacce na paralokavajjabhayadassāvine viharante.
translation-en-sujato: In the same way, the Buddha Vipassī saw sentient beings with little dust in their eyes, and some with much dust in their eyes.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho so, bhikkhave, mahābrahmā vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa cetasā cetoparivitakkamaññāya vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ gāthāhi ajjhabhāsi:
translation-en-sujato: Then that Great Brahmā, knowing what the Buddha Vipassī was thinking, addressed him in verse:

root-pli-ms: ‘Sele yathā pabbatamuddhaniṭṭhito,
translation-en-sujato: ‘Standing high on a rocky mountain,

root-pli-ms: Yathāpi passe janataṁ samantato;
translation-en-sujato: you can see the people all around.

root-pli-ms: Tathūpamaṁ dhammamayaṁ sumedha,
translation-en-sujato: In just the same way, all-seer, wise one,

root-pli-ms: Pāsādamāruyha samantacakkhu;
translation-en-sujato: having ascended the Temple of Truth,

root-pli-ms: Sokāvatiṇṇaṁ janatamapetasoko,
translation-en-sujato: rid of sorrow, look upon the people

root-pli-ms: Avekkhassu jātijarābhibhūtaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: swamped with sorrow, oppressed by rebirth and old age.

root-pli-ms: Uṭṭhehi vīra vijitasaṅgāma,
translation-en-sujato: Rise, hero! Victor in battle, leader of the caravan,

root-pli-ms: Satthavāha aṇaṇa vicara loke;
translation-en-sujato: wander the world without obligation.

root-pli-ms: Desassu bhagavā dhammaṁ,
translation-en-sujato: Let the Blessed One teach the Dhamma!

root-pli-ms: Aññātāro bhavissantī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: There will be those who understand!’

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho taṁ mahābrahmānaṁ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi:
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha Vipassī addressed that Great Brahmā in verse:

root-pli-ms: ‘Apārutā tesaṁ amatassa dvārā,
translation-en-sujato: ‘Flung open are the doors to the deathless!

root-pli-ms: Ye sotavanto pamuñcantu saddhaṁ;
translation-en-sujato: Let those with ears to hear decide their faith.

root-pli-ms: Vihiṁsasaññī paguṇaṁ na bhāsiṁ,
translation-en-sujato: Thinking it would be troublesome, Brahmā, I did not teach

root-pli-ms: Dhammaṁ paṇītaṁ manujesu brahme’ti.
translation-en-sujato: the sophisticated, sublime Dhamma among humans.’

root-pli-ms: Atha kho so, bhikkhave, mahābrahmā: ‘katāvakāso khomhi vipassinā bhagavatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena dhammadesanāyā’ti vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā tattheva antaradhāyi.
translation-en-sujato: Then the Great Brahmā, knowing that his request for the Buddha Vipassī to teach the Dhamma had been granted, bowed and respectfully circled him, keeping him on his right, before vanishing right there.

root-pli-ms: 13. Aggasāvakayuga
translation-en-sujato: 13. The Chief Disciples

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa etadahosi:
translation-en-sujato: Then the Blessed One Vipassī, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha, thought,
reference: bj8.60, cck10.50, ms7D_157, msdiv72, ndp7.33, pts-cs3.8, sc154, sya10.46

root-pli-ms: ‘kassa nu kho ahaṁ paṭhamaṁ dhammaṁ deseyyaṁ,
translation-en-sujato: ‘Who should I teach first of all?

root-pli-ms: ko imaṁ dhammaṁ khippameva ājānissatī’ti?
translation-en-sujato: Who will quickly understand this teaching?’

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa etadahosi:
translation-en-sujato: Then he thought,

root-pli-ms: ‘ayaṁ kho khaṇḍo ca rājaputto tisso ca purohitaputto bandhumatiyā rājadhāniyā paṭivasanti paṇḍitā viyattā medhāvino dīgharattaṁ apparajakkhajātikā.
translation-en-sujato: ‘That Khaṇḍa, the king’s son, and Tissa, the high priest’s son, are astute, competent, clever, and have long had little dust in their eyes.

root-pli-ms: Yannūnāhaṁ khaṇḍassa ca rājaputtassa, tissassa ca purohitaputtassa paṭhamaṁ dhammaṁ deseyyaṁ, te imaṁ dhammaṁ khippameva ājānissantī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: Why don’t I teach them first of all? They will quickly understand this teaching.’

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho seyyathāpi nāma balavā puriso samiñjitaṁ vā bāhaṁ pasāreyya, pasāritaṁ vā bāhaṁ samiñjeyya; evameva—bodhirukkhamūle antarahito bandhumatiyā rājadhāniyā kheme migadāye pāturahosi.
translation-en-sujato: Then, as easily as a strong person would extend or contract their arm, he vanished from the tree of awakening and reappeared near the capital city of Bandhumatī, in the deer park named Sanctuary.
comment-en-sujato: Comm takes khema as a proper name; it is a common name for sanctuaries in the Jatakas.
reference: csp1ed7.35, csp2ed7.35, dr10.47, mc10.36, ms7D_158, msdiv73, pts-cs3.9, sc155, vri2.32

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho dāyapālaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha Vipassī addressed the park keeper,

root-pli-ms: ‘ehi tvaṁ, samma dāyapāla, bandhumatiṁ rājadhāniṁ pavisitvā khaṇḍañca rājaputtaṁ tissañca purohitaputtaṁ evaṁ vadehi—
translation-en-sujato: ‘My dear park keeper, please enter the city and say this to the king’s son Khaṇḍa and the high priest’s son Tissa:

root-pli-ms: vipassī, bhante, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho bandhumatiṁ rājadhāniṁ anuppatto kheme migadāye viharati, so tumhākaṁ dassanakāmo’ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Sirs, the Blessed One Vipassī, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha, has arrived at Bandhumatī and is staying in the deer park named Sanctuary. He wishes to see you.”’

root-pli-ms: ‘Evaṁ, bhante’ti kho, bhikkhave, dāyapālo vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa paṭissutvā bandhumatiṁ rājadhāniṁ pavisitvā khaṇḍañca rājaputtaṁ tissañca purohitaputtaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: ‘Yes, sir,’ replied the park keeper, and did as he was asked.

root-pli-ms: ‘vipassī, bhante, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho bandhumatiṁ rājadhāniṁ anuppatto kheme migadāye viharati; so tumhākaṁ dassanakāmo’ti.

Atha kho, bhikkhave, khaṇḍo ca rājaputto tisso ca purohitaputto bhaddāni bhaddāni yānāni yojāpetvā bhaddaṁ bhaddaṁ yānaṁ abhiruhitvā bhaddehi bhaddehi yānehi bandhumatiyā rājadhāniyā niyyiṁsu. Yena khemo migadāyo tena pāyiṁsu.
translation-en-sujato: Then the king’s son Khaṇḍa and the high priest’s son Tissa had the finest carriages harnessed. Then they mounted a fine carriage and, along with other fine carriages, set out from Bandhumatī for the Sanctuary.
reference: cck10.51, ms7D_159, msdiv74, pts-cs3.10, pts-vp-pli2.41, sc156, sya10.47

root-pli-ms: Yāvatikā yānassa bhūmi, yānena gantvā yānā paccorohitvā pattikāva yena vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho tenupasaṅkamiṁsu. upasaṅkamitvā vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu.
translation-en-sujato: They went by carriage as far as the terrain allowed, then descended and approached the Buddha Vipassī on foot. They bowed and sat down to one side.

root-pli-ms: Tesaṁ vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho anupubbiṁ kathaṁ kathesi, seyyathidaṁ—
translation-en-sujato: The Buddha Vipassī taught them step by step, with

root-pli-ms: dānakathaṁ sīlakathaṁ saggakathaṁ kāmānaṁ ādīnavaṁ okāraṁ saṅkilesaṁ nekkhamme ānisaṁsaṁ pakāsesi.
translation-en-sujato: a talk on giving, ethical conduct, and heaven. He explained the drawbacks of sensual pleasures, so sordid and corrupt, and the benefit of renunciation.

root-pli-ms: Yadā te bhagavā aññāsi kallacitte muducitte vinīvaraṇacitte udaggacitte pasannacitte, atha yā buddhānaṁ sāmukkaṁsikā dhammadesanā, taṁ pakāsesi—
translation-en-sujato: And when he knew that their minds were ready, pliable, rid of hindrances, joyful, and confident he explained the special teaching of the Buddhas:

root-pli-ms: dukkhaṁ samudayaṁ nirodhaṁ maggaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path.

root-pli-ms: Seyyathāpi nāma suddhaṁ vatthaṁ apagatakāḷakaṁ sammadeva rajanaṁ paṭiggaṇheyya;
translation-en-sujato: Just as a clean cloth rid of stains would properly absorb dye,

root-pli-ms: evameva khaṇḍassa ca rājaputtassa tissassa ca purohitaputtassa tasmiṁyeva āsane virajaṁ vītamalaṁ dhammacakkhuṁ udapādi:
translation-en-sujato: in that very seat the stainless, immaculate vision of the Dhamma arose in the king’s son Khaṇḍa and the high priest’s son Tissa:

root-pli-ms: ‘yaṁ kiñci samudayadhammaṁ sabbaṁ taṁ nirodhadhamman’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Everything that has a beginning has an end.’

root-pli-ms: Te diṭṭhadhammā pattadhammā viditadhammā pariyogāḷhadhammā tiṇṇavicikicchā vigatakathaṅkathā vesārajjappattā aparappaccayā satthusāsane vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ etadavocuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: They saw, attained, understood, and fathomed the Dhamma. They went beyond doubt, got rid of indecision, and became self-assured and independent of others regarding the Teacher’s instructions. They said to the Buddha Vipassī,
reference: bj8.62, cck10.52, csp1ed7.36, csp2ed7.36, ms7D_161, msdiv76, pts-cs3.12, pts-vp-pli2.42, sc158, vri2.33

root-pli-ms: ‘abhikkantaṁ, bhante, abhikkantaṁ, bhante.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Excellent, sir! Excellent!

root-pli-ms: Seyyathāpi, bhante, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṁ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṁ dhāreyya: “cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī”ti; evamevaṁ bhagavatā anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
translation-en-sujato: As if he were righting the overturned, or revealing the hidden, or pointing out the path to the lost, or lighting a lamp in the dark so people with good eyes can see what’s there, the Buddha has made the teaching clear in many ways.

root-pli-ms: Ete mayaṁ, bhante, bhagavantaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāma dhammañca.
translation-en-sujato: We go for refuge to the Blessed One, to the teaching, and to the mendicant Saṅgha.

root-pli-ms: Labheyyāma mayaṁ, bhante, bhagavato santike pabbajjaṁ, labheyyāma upasampadan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: Sir, may we receive the going forth and ordination in the Buddha’s presence?’

root-pli-ms: Alatthuṁ kho, bhikkhave, khaṇḍo ca rājaputto, tisso ca purohitaputto vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa santike pabbajjaṁ alatthuṁ upasampadaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: And they received the going forth, the ordination in the Buddha Vipassī’s presence.

root-pli-ms: Te vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi;
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha Vipassī educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired them with a Dhamma talk.

root-pli-ms: saṅkhārānaṁ ādīnavaṁ okāraṁ saṅkilesaṁ nibbāne ānisaṁsaṁ pakāsesi.
translation-en-sujato: He explained the drawbacks of conditioned phenomena, so sordid and corrupt, and the benefit of extinguishment.

root-pli-ms: Tesaṁ vipassinā bhagavatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena dhammiyā kathāya sandassiyamānānaṁ samādapiyamānānaṁ samuttejiyamānānaṁ sampahaṁsiyamānānaṁ nacirasseva anupādāya āsavehi cittāni vimucciṁsu.
translation-en-sujato: Being taught like this their minds were soon freed from defilements by not grasping.

root-pli-ms: 14. Mahājanakāyapabbajjā
translation-en-sujato: 14. The Going Forth of the Large Crowd

root-pli-ms: Assosi kho, bhikkhave, bandhumatiyā rājadhāniyā mahājanakāyo caturāsītipāṇasahassāni:
translation-en-sujato: A large crowd of 84,000 people in the capital of Bandhumatī heard

root-pli-ms: ‘vipassī kira bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho bandhumatiṁ rājadhāniṁ anuppatto kheme migadāye viharati.
translation-en-sujato: that the Blessed One Vipassī, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha, had arrived at Bandhumatī and was staying in the deer park named Sanctuary.

root-pli-ms: Khaṇḍo ca kira rājaputto tisso ca purohitaputto vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa santike kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajitā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: And they heard that the king’s son Khaṇḍa and the high priest’s son Tissa had shaved off their hair and beard, dressed in ocher robes, and gone forth from the lay life to homelessness in the Buddha’s presence.

root-pli-ms: Sutvāna nesaṁ etadahosi:
translation-en-sujato: It occurred to them,

root-pli-ms: ‘na hi nūna so orako dhammavinayo, na sā orakā pabbajjā, yattha khaṇḍo ca rājaputto tisso ca purohitaputto kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajitā.
translation-en-sujato: ‘This must be no ordinary teaching and training, no ordinary going forth in which the king’s son Khaṇḍa and the high priest’s son Tissa have gone forth.

root-pli-ms: Khaṇḍo ca rājaputto tisso ca purohitaputto kesamassuṁ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajissanti, kimaṅgaṁ pana mayan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: If even they go forth, why don’t we do the same?’

root-pli-ms: Atha kho so, bhikkhave, mahājanakāyo caturāsītipāṇasahassāni bandhumatiyā rājadhāniyā nikkhamitvā yena khemo migadāyo yena vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu.
translation-en-sujato: Then those 84,000 people left Bandhumatī for the deer park named Sanctuary, where they approached the Buddha Vipassī, bowed and sat down to one side.

root-pli-ms: Tesaṁ vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho anupubbiṁ kathaṁ kathesi.
translation-en-sujato: The Buddha Vipassī taught them step by step, with
reference: cck10.54, csp1ed7.37, csp2ed7.37, dr10.50, ms7D_164, msdiv79, pts-cs3.15, sc161, vri2.34

root-pli-ms: Seyyathidaṁ—dānakathaṁ sīlakathaṁ saggakathaṁ kāmānaṁ ādīnavaṁ okāraṁ saṅkilesaṁ nekkhamme ānisaṁsaṁ pakāsesi.
translation-en-sujato: a talk on giving, ethical conduct, and heaven. He explained the drawbacks of sensual pleasures, so sordid and corrupt, and the benefit of renunciation.

root-pli-ms: Yadā te bhagavā aññāsi kallacitte muducitte vinīvaraṇacitte udaggacitte pasannacitte, atha yā buddhānaṁ sāmukkaṁsikā dhammadesanā, taṁ pakāsesi—
translation-en-sujato: And when he knew that their minds were ready, pliable, rid of hindrances, joyful, and confident he explained the special teaching of the Buddhas:

root-pli-ms: dukkhaṁ samudayaṁ nirodhaṁ maggaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the path.

root-pli-ms: Seyyathāpi nāma suddhaṁ vatthaṁ apagatakāḷakaṁ sammadeva rajanaṁ paṭiggaṇheyya;
translation-en-sujato: Just as a clean cloth rid of stains would properly absorb dye,

root-pli-ms: evameva tesaṁ caturāsītipāṇasahassānaṁ tasmiṁyeva āsane virajaṁ vītamalaṁ dhammacakkhuṁ udapādi:
translation-en-sujato: in that very seat the stainless, immaculate vision of the Dhamma arose in those 84,000 people:

root-pli-ms: ‘yaṁ kiñci samudayadhammaṁ sabbaṁ taṁ nirodhadhamman’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Everything that has a beginning has an end.’

root-pli-ms: Te diṭṭhadhammā pattadhammā viditadhammā pariyogāḷhadhammā tiṇṇavicikicchā vigatakathaṅkathā vesārajjappattā aparappaccayā satthusāsane vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ etadavocuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: They saw, attained, understood, and fathomed the Dhamma. They went beyond doubt, got rid of indecision, and became self-assured and independent of others regarding the Teacher’s instructions. They said to the Buddha Vipassī,

root-pli-ms: ‘abhikkantaṁ, bhante, abhikkantaṁ, bhante.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Excellent, sir! Excellent!’

root-pli-ms: Seyyathāpi, bhante, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṁ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṁ dhāreyya: “cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī”ti; evamevaṁ bhagavatā anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
translation-en-sujato: And just like Khaṇḍa and Tissa they asked for and received ordination. Then the Buddha taught them further.

root-pli-ms: Ete mayaṁ, bhante, bhagavantaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāma dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
Labheyyāma mayaṁ, bhante, bhagavato santike pabbajjaṁ labheyyāma upasampadan’ti.
Alatthuṁ kho, bhikkhave, tāni caturāsītipāṇasahassāni vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa santike pabbajjaṁ, alatthuṁ upasampadaṁ.
reference: mc10.39, ms7D_166, msdiv81, pts-cs3.17, pts-vp-pli2.44, sc163

root-pli-ms: Te vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi;
saṅkhārānaṁ ādīnavaṁ okāraṁ saṅkilesaṁ nibbāne ānisaṁsaṁ pakāsesi.
Tesaṁ vipassinā bhagavatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena dhammiyā kathāya sandassiyamānānaṁ samādapiyamānānaṁ samuttejiyamānānaṁ sampahaṁsiyamānānaṁ nacirasseva anupādāya āsavehi cittāni vimucciṁsu.
translation-en-sujato: Being taught like this their minds were soon freed from defilements by not grasping.

root-pli-ms: 15. Purimapabbajitānaṁ dhammābhisamaya
translation-en-sujato: 15. The 84,000 Who Had Gone Forth Previously

root-pli-ms: Assosuṁ kho, bhikkhave, tāni purimāni caturāsītipabbajitasahassāni:
translation-en-sujato: The 84,000 people who had gone forth previously also heard:
reference: bj8.66, cck10.55, csp1ed7.38, csp2ed7.38, dr10.51, ms7D_167, msdiv82, ndp7.36, pts-cs3.18, sc164

root-pli-ms: ‘vipassī kira bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho bandhumatiṁ rājadhāniṁ anuppatto kheme migadāye viharati, dhammañca kira desetī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘It seems the Blessed One Vipassī, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha, has arrived at Bandhumatī and is staying in the deer park named Sanctuary. And he is teaching the Dhamma!’

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhikkhave, tāni caturāsītipabbajitasahassāni yena bandhumatī rājadhānī yena khemo migadāyo yena vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu.
translation-en-sujato: Then they too went to see the Buddha Vipassī, realized the Dhamma, went forth, and became freed from defilements.

root-pli-ms: Tesaṁ vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho anupubbiṁ kathaṁ kathesi.
reference: ms7D_168, msdiv83, pts-cs3.19, sc165, sya10.51, vri2.35

root-pli-ms: Seyyathidaṁ—dānakathaṁ sīlakathaṁ saggakathaṁ kāmānaṁ ādīnavaṁ okāraṁ saṅkilesaṁ nekkhamme ānisaṁsaṁ pakāsesi.
Yadā te bhagavā aññāsi kallacitte muducitte vinīvaraṇacitte udaggacitte pasannacitte, atha yā buddhānaṁ sāmukkaṁsikā dhammadesanā, taṁ pakāsesi—
dukkhaṁ samudayaṁ nirodhaṁ maggaṁ.
Seyyathāpi nāma suddhaṁ vatthaṁ apagatakāḷakaṁ sammadeva rajanaṁ paṭiggaṇheyya;
evameva tesaṁ caturāsītipabbajitasahassānaṁ tasmiṁyeva āsane virajaṁ vītamalaṁ dhammacakkhuṁ udapādi:
‘yaṁ kiñci samudayadhammaṁ sabbaṁ taṁ nirodhadhamman’ti.
Te diṭṭhadhammā pattadhammā viditadhammā pariyogāḷhadhammā tiṇṇavicikicchā vigatakathaṅkathā vesārajjappattā aparappaccayā satthusāsane vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ etadavocuṁ:
reference: cck10.56, dr10.52, mc10.40, ms7D_169, msdiv84, pts-cs3.20, pts-vp-pli2.45, sc166

root-pli-ms: ‘abhikkantaṁ, bhante, abhikkantaṁ, bhante.

Seyyathāpi, bhante, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṁ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṁ dhāreyya: “cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī”ti; evamevaṁ bhagavatā anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
Ete mayaṁ, bhante, bhagavantaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāma dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
Labheyyāma mayaṁ, bhante, bhagavato santike pabbajjaṁ labheyyāma upasampadan’ti.
Alatthuṁ kho, bhikkhave, tāni caturāsītipabbajitasahassāni vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa santike pabbajjaṁ alatthuṁ upasampadaṁ.
reference: csp1ed7.39, csp2ed7.39, ms7D_170, msdiv85, pts-cs3.21, sc167, sya10.52

root-pli-ms: Te vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi;
saṅkhārānaṁ ādīnavaṁ okāraṁ saṅkilesaṁ nibbāne ānisaṁsaṁ pakāsesi.
Tesaṁ vipassinā bhagavatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena dhammiyā kathāya sandassiyamānānaṁ samādapiyamānānaṁ samuttejiyamānānaṁ sampahaṁsiyamānānaṁ nacirasseva anupādāya āsavehi cittāni vimucciṁsu.
16. Cārikāanujānana
translation-en-sujato: 16. The Allowance to Wander

root-pli-ms: Tena kho pana, bhikkhave, samayena bandhumatiyā rājadhāniyā mahābhikkhusaṅgho paṭivasati aṭṭhasaṭṭhibhikkhusatasahassaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Now at that time a large Saṅgha of 6,800,000 mendicants were residing at Bandhumatī.
reference: bj8.68, cck10.57, dr10.53, ms7D_171, msdiv86, ndp7.37, pts-cs3.22, pts-vp-pli2.46, sc168, vri2.36

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṁ cetaso parivitakko udapādi:
translation-en-sujato: As the Buddha Vipassī was in private retreat this thought came to his mind,

root-pli-ms: ‘mahā kho etarahi bhikkhusaṅgho bandhumatiyā rājadhāniyā paṭivasati aṭṭhasaṭṭhibhikkhusatasahassaṁ, yannūnāhaṁ bhikkhū anujāneyyaṁ:
translation-en-sujato: ‘The Saṅgha residing at Bandhumatī now is large. What if I was to urge them:

root-pli-ms: “caratha, bhikkhave, cārikaṁ bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṁ;
translation-en-sujato: “Wander forth, mendicants, for the welfare and happiness of the people, out of compassion for the world, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.

root-pli-ms: mā ekena dve agamittha;
translation-en-sujato: Let not two go by one road.

root-pli-ms: desetha, bhikkhave, dhammaṁ ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāsetha.
translation-en-sujato: Teach the Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And reveal a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure.

root-pli-ms: Santi sattā apparajakkhajātikā, assavanatā dhammassa parihāyanti,
translation-en-sujato: There are beings with little dust in their eyes. They’re in decline because they haven’t heard the teaching.

root-pli-ms: bhavissanti dhammassa aññātāro.
translation-en-sujato: There will be those who understand the teaching!

root-pli-ms: Api ca channaṁ channaṁ vassānaṁ accayena bandhumatī rājadhānī upasaṅkamitabbā pātimokkhuddesāyā”’ti.
translation-en-sujato: But when six years have passed, you must all come to Bandhumatī to recite the monastic code.”’

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhikkhave, aññataro mahābrahmā vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa cetasā cetoparivitakkamaññāya seyyathāpi nāma balavā puriso samiñjitaṁ vā bāhaṁ pasāreyya, pasāritaṁ vā bāhaṁ samiñjeyya; evameva—brahmaloke antarahito vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa purato pāturahosi.
translation-en-sujato: Then a certain Great Brahmā, knowing what the Buddha Vipassī was thinking, as easily as a strong person would extend or contract their arm, vanished from the Brahmā realm and reappeared in front of the Buddha Vipassī.
reference: cck10.58, csp1ed7.40, csp2ed7.40, dr10.54, mc10.41, ms7D_172, msdiv87, pts-cs3.23, pts-vp-pli2.47, sc169, sya10.53

root-pli-ms: Atha kho so, bhikkhave, mahābrahmā ekaṁsaṁ uttarāsaṅgaṁ karitvā yena vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho tenañjaliṁ paṇāmetvā vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: He arranged his robe over one shoulder, knelt on his right knee, raised his joined palms toward the Buddha Vipassī, and said,

root-pli-ms: ‘evametaṁ, bhagavā, evametaṁ, sugata.
translation-en-sujato: ‘That’s so true, Blessed One! That’s so true, Holy One!

root-pli-ms: Mahā kho, bhante, etarahi bhikkhusaṅgho bandhumatiyā rājadhāniyā paṭivasati aṭṭhasaṭṭhibhikkhusatasahassaṁ, anujānātu, bhante, bhagavā bhikkhū:
translation-en-sujato: The Saṅgha residing at Bandhumatī now is large. Please urge them to wander, as you thought.

root-pli-ms: “caratha, bhikkhave, cārikaṁ bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṁ;
mā ekena dve agamittha;
desetha, bhikkhave, dhammaṁ ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāsetha.
Santi sattā apparajakkhajātikā, assavanatā dhammassa parihāyanti, bhavissanti dhammassa aññātāro”ti.
Api ca, bhante, mayaṁ tathā karissāma yathā bhikkhū channaṁ channaṁ vassānaṁ accayena bandhumatiṁ rājadhāniṁ upasaṅkamissanti pātimokkhuddesāyā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: And sir, I’ll make sure that when six years have passed the mendicants will return to Bandhumatī to recite the monastic code.’

root-pli-ms: Idamavoca, bhikkhave, so mahābrahmā.
translation-en-sujato: That’s what that Great Brahmā said.

root-pli-ms: Idaṁ vatvā vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā tattheva antaradhāyi.
translation-en-sujato: Then he bowed and respectfully circled the Buddha Vipassī, keeping him on his right side, before vanishing right there.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhikkhave, vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho sāyanhasamayaṁ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito bhikkhū āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: Then in the late afternoon, the Buddha Vipassī came out of retreat and addressed the mendicants, telling them all that had happened. Then he said,

root-pli-ms: ‘idha mayhaṁ, bhikkhave, rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṁ cetaso parivitakko udapādi:
“mahā kho etarahi bhikkhusaṅgho bandhumatiyā rājadhāniyā paṭivasati aṭṭhasaṭṭhibhikkhusatasahassaṁ.
Yannūnāhaṁ bhikkhū anujāneyyaṁ—
caratha, bhikkhave, cārikaṁ bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṁ;
mā ekena dve agamittha;
desetha, bhikkhave, dhammaṁ ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāsetha.
Santi sattā apparajakkhajātikā, assavanatā dhammassa parihāyanti, bhavissanti dhammassa aññātāro.
Api ca channaṁ channaṁ vassānaṁ accayena bandhumatī rājadhānī upasaṅkamitabbā pātimokkhuddesāyā”’ti.

Atha kho, bhikkhave, aññataro mahābrahmā mama cetasā cetoparivitakkamaññāya seyyathāpi nāma balavā puriso samiñjitaṁ vā bāhaṁ pasāreyya, pasāritaṁ vā bāhaṁ samiñjeyya; evameva—brahmaloke antarahito mama purato pāturahosi.
reference: cck10.60, csp1ed7.41, csp2ed7.41, dr10.55, ms7D_174, pts-cs3.25, pts-vp-pli2.48, sc171, sya10.55

root-pli-ms: Atha kho so, bhikkhave, mahābrahmā ekaṁsaṁ uttarāsaṅgaṁ karitvā yenāhaṁ tenañjaliṁ paṇāmetvā maṁ etadavoca:
‘evametaṁ, bhagavā, evametaṁ, sugata.
Mahā kho, bhante, etarahi bhikkhusaṅgho bandhumatiyā rājadhāniyā paṭivasati aṭṭhasaṭṭhibhikkhusatasahassaṁ.
Anujānātu, bhante, bhagavā bhikkhū—
caratha, bhikkhave, cārikaṁ bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṁ;
mā ekena dve agamittha;
desetha, bhikkhave, dhammaṁ …pe…
santi sattā apparajakkhajātikā, assavanatā dhammassa parihāyanti, bhavissanti dhammassa aññātāroti.
Api ca, bhante, mayaṁ tathā karissāma, yathā bhikkhū channaṁ channaṁ vassānaṁ accayena bandhumatiṁ rājadhāniṁ upasaṅkamissanti pātimokkhuddesāyā’ti.
Idamavoca, bhikkhave, so mahābrahmā.
Idaṁ vatvā maṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā tattheva antaradhāyi.
‘Anujānāmi, bhikkhave, caratha cārikaṁ bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṁ;
translation-en-sujato: ‘Wander forth, mendicants, for the welfare and happiness of the people, out of compassion for the world, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.

root-pli-ms: mā ekena dve agamittha;
translation-en-sujato: Let not two go by one road.

root-pli-ms: desetha, bhikkhave, dhammaṁ ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāsetha.
translation-en-sujato: Teach the Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And reveal a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure.

root-pli-ms: Santi sattā apparajakkhajātikā, assavanatā dhammassa parihāyanti,
translation-en-sujato: There are beings with little dust in their eyes. They’re in decline because they haven’t heard the teaching.

root-pli-ms: bhavissanti dhammassa aññātāro.
translation-en-sujato: There will be those who understand the teaching!

root-pli-ms: Api ca, bhikkhave, channaṁ channaṁ vassānaṁ accayena bandhumatī rājadhānī upasaṅkamitabbā pātimokkhuddesāyā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: But when six years have passed, you must all come to Bandhumatī to recite the monastic code.’

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhū yebhuyyena ekāheneva janapadacārikaṁ pakkamiṁsu.
translation-en-sujato: Then most of the mendicants departed to wander the country that very day.

root-pli-ms: Tena kho pana samayena jambudīpe caturāsīti āvāsasahassāni honti.
translation-en-sujato: Now at that time there were 84,000 monasteries in India.

root-pli-ms: Ekamhi hi vasse nikkhante devatā saddamanussāvesuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: And when the first year came to an end the deities raised the cry:

root-pli-ms: ‘nikkhantaṁ kho, mārisā, ekaṁ vassaṁ;
translation-en-sujato: ‘Good sirs, the first year has ended.

root-pli-ms: pañca dāni vassāni sesāni;
translation-en-sujato: Now five years remain.

root-pli-ms: pañcannaṁ vassānaṁ accayena bandhumatī rājadhānī upasaṅkamitabbā pātimokkhuddesāyā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: When five years have passed, you must all go to Bandhumatī to recite the monastic code.’

root-pli-ms: Dvīsu vassesu nikkhantesu …
translation-en-sujato: And when the second year …

root-pli-ms: tīsu vassesu nikkhantesu …
translation-en-sujato: the third year …

root-pli-ms: catūsu vassesu nikkhantesu …
translation-en-sujato: the fourth year …

root-pli-ms: pañcasu vassesu nikkhantesu devatā saddamanussāvesuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: the fifth year came to an end, the deities raised the cry:

root-pli-ms: ‘nikkhantāni kho, mārisā, pañcavassāni;
translation-en-sujato: ‘Good sirs, the fifth year has ended.

root-pli-ms: ekaṁ dāni vassaṁ sesaṁ;
translation-en-sujato: Now one year remains.

root-pli-ms: ekassa vassassa accayena bandhumatī rājadhānī upasaṅkamitabbā pātimokkhuddesāyā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: When one year has passed, you must all go to Bandhumatī to recite the monastic code.’

root-pli-ms: Chasu vassesu nikkhantesu devatā saddamanussāvesuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: And when the sixth year came to an end the deities raised the cry:

root-pli-ms: ‘nikkhantāni kho, mārisā, chabbassāni,
translation-en-sujato: ‘Good sirs, the sixth year has ended.

root-pli-ms: samayo dāni bandhumatiṁ rājadhāniṁ upasaṅkamituṁ pātimokkhuddesāyā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: Now is the time that you must go to Bandhumatī to recite the monastic code.’

root-pli-ms: Atha kho te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū appekacce sakena iddhānubhāvena appekacce devatānaṁ iddhānubhāvena ekāheneva bandhumatiṁ rājadhāniṁ upasaṅkamiṁsu pātimokkhuddesāyāti.
translation-en-sujato: Then that very day the mendicants went to Bandhumatī to recite the monastic code. Some went by their own psychic power, and some by the psychic power of the deities.

root-pli-ms: Tatra sudaṁ, bhikkhave, vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho bhikkhusaṅghe evaṁ pātimokkhaṁ uddisati:
translation-en-sujato: And there the Blessed One Vipassī, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha, recited the monastic code thus:
reference: csp1ed7.42, csp2ed7.42, ms7D_177, msdiv90, pts-cs3.28, sc174

root-pli-ms: ‘Khantī paramaṁ tapo titikkhā,
translation-en-sujato: ‘Patient acceptance is the highest austerity.

root-pli-ms: Nibbānaṁ paramaṁ vadanti buddhā;
translation-en-sujato: Extinguishment is the highest, say the Buddhas.

root-pli-ms: Na hi pabbajito parūpaghātī,
translation-en-sujato: No true renunciate injures another,

root-pli-ms: Na samaṇo hoti paraṁ viheṭhayanto.
translation-en-sujato: nor does an ascetic hurt another.
variant-pli-ms: Na samaṇo → samaṇo (si, sya-all, km, pts1ed)

root-pli-ms: Sabbapāpassa akaraṇaṁ,
translation-en-sujato: Not to do any evil;

root-pli-ms: kusalassa upasampadā;
translation-en-sujato: to embrace the good;

root-pli-ms: Sacittapariyodapanaṁ,
translation-en-sujato: to purify one’s mind:

root-pli-ms: etaṁ buddhānasāsanaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: this is the instruction of the Buddhas.

root-pli-ms: Anūpavādo anūpaghāto,
translation-en-sujato: Not speaking ill nor doing harm;

root-pli-ms: Pātimokkhe ca saṁvaro;
translation-en-sujato: restraint in the monastic code;

root-pli-ms: Mattaññutā ca bhattasmiṁ,
translation-en-sujato: moderation in eating;

root-pli-ms: Pantañca sayanāsanaṁ;
translation-en-sujato: staying in remote lodgings;

root-pli-ms: Adhicitte ca āyogo,
translation-en-sujato: commitment to the higher mind—

root-pli-ms: Etaṁ buddhānasāsanan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: this is the instruction of the Buddhas.’

root-pli-ms: 17. Devatārocana
translation-en-sujato: 17. Being Informed by Deities

root-pli-ms: Ekamidāhaṁ, bhikkhave, samayaṁ ukkaṭṭhāyaṁ viharāmi subhagavane sālarājamūle.
translation-en-sujato: At one time, mendicants, I was staying near Ukkaṭṭhā, in the Subhaga Forest at the root of a magnificent sal tree.

root-pli-ms: Tassa mayhaṁ, bhikkhave, rahogatassa paṭisallīnassa evaṁ cetaso parivitakko udapādi:
translation-en-sujato: As I was in private retreat this thought came to mind,

root-pli-ms: ‘na kho so sattāvāso sulabharūpo, yo mayā anāvutthapubbo iminā dīghena addhunā aññatra suddhāvāsehi devehi.
translation-en-sujato: ‘It’s not easy to find an abode of sentient beings where I haven’t previously abided in all this long time, except for the gods of the pure abodes.

root-pli-ms: Yannūnāhaṁ yena suddhāvāsā devā tenupasaṅkameyyan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: Why don’t I go to see them?’

root-pli-ms: Atha khvāhaṁ, bhikkhave, seyyathāpi nāma balavā puriso samiñjitaṁ vā bāhaṁ pasāreyya, pasāritaṁ vā bāhaṁ samiñjeyya; evameva—ukkaṭṭhāyaṁ subhagavane sālarājamūle antarahito avihesu devesu pāturahosiṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Then, as easily as a strong person would extend or contract their arm, I vanished from the Subhaga Forest and reappeared with the Aviha gods.

root-pli-ms: Tasmiṁ, bhikkhave, devanikāye anekāni devatāsahassāni anekāni devatāsatasahassāni yenāhaṁ tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā maṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhaṁsu. Ekamantaṁ ṭhitā kho, bhikkhave, tā devatā maṁ etadavocuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: In that order of gods, many thousands, many hundreds of thousands of deities approached me, bowed, stood to one side, and said to me,

root-pli-ms: ‘ito so, mārisā, ekanavutikappe yaṁ vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho loke udapādi.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Ninety-one eons ago, good sir, the Buddha Vipassī arose in the world, perfected and fully awakened.

root-pli-ms: Vipassī, mārisā, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho khattiyo jātiyā ahosi, khattiyakule udapādi.
translation-en-sujato: He was born as an aristocrat into an aristocrat family.

root-pli-ms: Vipassī, mārisā, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho koṇḍañño gottena ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: Koṇḍañña was his clan.

root-pli-ms: Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa asītivassasahassāni āyuppamāṇaṁ ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: He lived for 80,000 years.

root-pli-ms: Vipassī, mārisā, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho pāṭaliyā mūle abhisambuddho.
translation-en-sujato: He was awakened at the root of a trumpet flower tree.

root-pli-ms: Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa khaṇḍatissaṁ nāma sāvakayugaṁ ahosi aggaṁ bhaddayugaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: He had a fine pair of chief disciples named Khaṇḍa and Tissa.

root-pli-ms: Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa tayo sāvakānaṁ sannipātā ahesuṁ. Eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi aṭṭhasaṭṭhibhikkhusatasahassaṁ. Eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi bhikkhusatasahassaṁ. Eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi asītibhikkhusahassāni. Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa ime tayo sāvakānaṁ sannipātā ahesuṁ sabbesaṁyeva khīṇāsavānaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: He had three gatherings of disciples—one of 6,800,000, one of 100,000, and one of 80,000—all of them mendicants who had ended their defilements.

root-pli-ms: Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa asoko nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhāko ahosi aggupaṭṭhāko.
translation-en-sujato: He had as chief attendant a mendicant named Asoka.

root-pli-ms: Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa bandhumā nāma rājā pitā ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: His father was King Bandhuma,

root-pli-ms: Bandhumatī nāma devī mātā ahosi janetti.
translation-en-sujato: his birth mother was Queen Bandhumatī,

root-pli-ms: Bandhumassa rañño bandhumatī nāma nagaraṁ rājadhānī ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: and their capital city was named Bandhumatī.

root-pli-ms: Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa evaṁ abhinikkhamanaṁ ahosi evaṁ pabbajjā evaṁ padhānaṁ evaṁ abhisambodhi evaṁ dhammacakkappavattanaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: And such was his renunciation, such his going forth, such his striving, such his awakening, and such his rolling forth of the wheel of Dhamma.
comment-en-sujato: This is basically a table of contents for any Buddha biography.

root-pli-ms: Te mayaṁ, mārisā, vipassimhi bhagavati brahmacariyaṁ caritvā kāmesu kāmacchandaṁ virājetvā idhūpapannā’ti …
translation-en-sujato: And good sir, after leading the spiritual life under that Buddha Vipassī we lost our desire for sensual pleasures and were reborn here.’

root-pli-ms: pe…
translation-en-sujato: And other deities came and similarly recounted the details of the Buddhas Sikhī, Vessabhū, Kakusandha, Koṇāgamana, and Kassapa.
comment-en-sujato: While this is absent here, they are all mentioned below, and comm says they should be included here. This must be just a clumsy abbreviation.

root-pli-ms: Tasmiṁyeva kho, bhikkhave, devanikāye anekāni devatāsahassāni anekāni devatāsatasahassāni yenāhaṁ tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā maṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhaṁsu. Ekamantaṁ ṭhitā kho, bhikkhave, tā devatā maṁ etadavocuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: In that order of gods, many hundreds of deities approached me, bowed, stood to one side, and said to me,
comment-en-sujato: In PTS, unlike MS, the deities who came to see the Buddha are numbered as “hundreds”, which seems more reasonable. RD has this, while MW does not.

root-pli-ms: ‘imasmiṁyeva kho, mārisā, bhaddakappe bhagavā etarahi arahaṁ sammāsambuddho loke uppanno.
translation-en-sujato: ‘In the present fortunate eon, good sir, you have arisen in the world, perfected and fully awakened.

root-pli-ms: Bhagavā, mārisā, khattiyo jātiyā khattiyakule uppanno.
translation-en-sujato: You were born as an aristocrat into an aristocrat family.

root-pli-ms: Bhagavā, mārisā, gotamo gottena.
translation-en-sujato: Gotama is your clan.

root-pli-ms: Bhagavato, mārisā, appakaṁ āyuppamāṇaṁ parittaṁ lahukaṁ yo ciraṁ jīvati, so vassasataṁ appaṁ vā bhiyyo.
translation-en-sujato: For you the life-span is short, brief, and fleeting. A long-lived person lives for a century or a little more.

root-pli-ms: Bhagavā, mārisā, assatthassa mūle abhisambuddho.
translation-en-sujato: You were awakened at the root of a peepul tree.

root-pli-ms: Bhagavato, mārisā, sāriputtamoggallānaṁ nāma sāvakayugaṁ ahosi aggaṁ bhaddayugaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: You have a fine pair of chief disciples named Sāriputta and Moggallāna.

root-pli-ms: Bhagavato, mārisā, eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi aḍḍhateḷasāni bhikkhusatāni. Bhagavato, mārisā, ayaṁ eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi sabbesaṁyeva khīṇāsavānaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: You have had one gathering of disciples—1,250 mendicants who had ended their defilements.

root-pli-ms: Bhagavato, mārisā, ānando nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhāko ahosi aggupaṭṭhāko.
translation-en-sujato: You have as chief attendant a mendicant named Ānanda.

root-pli-ms: Bhagavato, mārisā, suddhodano nāma rājā pitā ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: Your father is King Suddhodana,

root-pli-ms: Māyā nāma devī mātā ahosi janetti.
translation-en-sujato: your birth mother was Queen Māyā,

root-pli-ms: Kapilavatthu nāma nagaraṁ rājadhānī ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: and your capital city was Kapilavatthu.

root-pli-ms: Bhagavato, mārisā, evaṁ abhinikkhamanaṁ ahosi evaṁ pabbajjā evaṁ padhānaṁ evaṁ abhisambodhi evaṁ dhammacakkappavattanaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: And such was your renunciation, such your going forth, such your striving, such your awakening, and such your rolling forth of the wheel of Dhamma.

root-pli-ms: Te mayaṁ, mārisā, bhagavati brahmacariyaṁ caritvā kāmesu kāmacchandaṁ virājetvā idhūpapannā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: And good sir, after leading the spiritual life under you we lost our desire for sensual pleasures and were reborn here.’

root-pli-ms: Atha khvāhaṁ, bhikkhave, avihehi devehi saddhiṁ yena atappā devā tenupasaṅkamiṁ …pe…
translation-en-sujato: Then together with the Aviha gods I went to see the Atappa gods …
reference: cck10.66, ms7D_183, msdiv92, pts-cs3.31, sc180, sya10.61

root-pli-ms: atha khvāhaṁ, bhikkhave, avihehi ca devehi atappehi ca devehi saddhiṁ yena sudassā devā tenupasaṅkamiṁ.
translation-en-sujato: the Gods Fair to See …

root-pli-ms: Atha khvāhaṁ, bhikkhave, avihehi ca devehi atappehi ca devehi sudassehi ca devehi saddhiṁ yena sudassī devā tenupasaṅkamiṁ. Atha khvāhaṁ, bhikkhave, avihehi ca devehi atappehi ca devehi sudassehi ca devehi sudassīhi ca devehi saddhiṁ yena akaniṭṭhā devā tenupasaṅkamiṁ. Tasmiṁ, bhikkhave, devanikāye anekāni devatāsahassāni anekāni devatāsatasahassāni yenāhaṁ tenupasaṅkamiṁsu, upasaṅkamitvā maṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhaṁsu. Ekamantaṁ ṭhitā kho, bhikkhave, tā devatā maṁ etadavocuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: and the Fair Seeing Gods. Then together with all these gods I went to see the Gods of Akaniṭṭha, where we had a similar conversation.

root-pli-ms: ‘ito so, mārisā, ekanavutikappe yaṁ vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho loke udapādi.
Vipassī, mārisā, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho khattiyo jātiyā ahosi.
Khattiyakule udapādi.
Vipassī, mārisā, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho koṇḍañño gottena ahosi.

Vipassī, mārisā, bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho pāṭaliyā mūle abhisambuddho.
Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa khaṇḍatissaṁ nāma sāvakayugaṁ ahosi aggaṁ bhaddayugaṁ.
Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa tayo sāvakānaṁ sannipātā ahesuṁ.
Eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi aṭṭhasaṭṭhibhikkhusatasahassaṁ.
Eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi bhikkhusatasahassaṁ.
Eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi asītibhikkhusahassāni.
Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa ime tayo sāvakānaṁ sannipātā ahesuṁ sabbesaṁyeva khīṇāsavānaṁ.
Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa asoko nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhāko ahosi aggupaṭṭhāko.

Bandhumassa rañño bandhumatī nāma nagaraṁ rājadhānī ahosi.
Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa evaṁ abhinikkhamanaṁ ahosi evaṁ pabbajjā evaṁ padhānaṁ evaṁ abhisambodhi, evaṁ dhammacakkappavattanaṁ.
Te mayaṁ, mārisā, vipassimhi bhagavati brahmacariyaṁ caritvā kāmesu kāmacchandaṁ virājetvā idhūpapannā’ti.

Tasmiṁyeva kho, bhikkhave, devanikāye anekāni devatāsahassāni anekāni devatāsatasahassāni yenāhaṁ tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā maṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhaṁsu. Ekamantaṁ ṭhitā kho, bhikkhave, tā devatā maṁ etadavocuṁ:
‘ito so, mārisā, ekatiṁse kappe yaṁ sikhī bhagavā …pe…
te mayaṁ, mārisā, sikhimhi bhagavati tasmiññeva kho, mārisā, ekatiṁse kappe yaṁ vessabhū bhagavā …pe…
te mayaṁ, mārisā, vessabhumhi bhagavati …pe…
imasmiṁyeva kho, mārisā, bhaddakappe kakusandho koṇāgamano kassapo bhagavā …pe…
te mayaṁ, mārisā, kakusandhamhi koṇāgamanamhi kassapamhi bhagavati brahmacariyaṁ caritvā kāmesu kāmacchandaṁ virājetvā idhūpapannā’ti.

Tasmiṁyeva kho, bhikkhave, devanikāye anekāni devatāsahassāni anekāni devatāsatasahassāni yenāhaṁ tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā maṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhaṁsu. Ekamantaṁ ṭhitā kho, bhikkhave, tā devatā maṁ etadavocuṁ:
‘imasmiṁyeva kho, mārisā, bhaddakappe bhagavā etarahi arahaṁ sammāsambuddho loke uppanno.
Bhagavā, mārisā, khattiyo jātiyā, khattiyakule uppanno.
Bhagavā, mārisā, gotamo gottena.
Bhagavato, mārisā, appakaṁ āyuppamāṇaṁ parittaṁ lahukaṁ yo ciraṁ jīvati, so vassasataṁ appaṁ vā bhiyyo.
Bhagavā, mārisā, assatthassa mūle abhisambuddho.
Bhagavato, mārisā, sāriputtamoggallānaṁ nāma sāvakayugaṁ ahosi aggaṁ bhaddayugaṁ.
Bhagavato, mārisā, eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi aḍḍhateḷasāni bhikkhusatāni.
Bhagavato, mārisā, ayaṁ eko sāvakānaṁ sannipāto ahosi sabbesaṁyeva khīṇāsavānaṁ.
Bhagavato, mārisā, ānando nāma bhikkhu upaṭṭhāko aggupaṭṭhāko ahosi.
Bhagavato, mārisā, suddhodano nāma rājā pitā ahosi.
Māyā nāma devī mātā ahosi janetti.
Kapilavatthu nāma nagaraṁ rājadhānī ahosi.
Bhagavato, mārisā, evaṁ abhinikkhamanaṁ ahosi, evaṁ pabbajjā, evaṁ padhānaṁ, evaṁ abhisambodhi, evaṁ dhammacakkappavattanaṁ.
Te mayaṁ, mārisā, bhagavati brahmacariyaṁ caritvā kāmesu kāmacchandaṁ virājetvā idhūpapannā’ti.

Iti kho, bhikkhave, tathāgatassevesā dhammadhātu suppaṭividdhā, yassā dhammadhātuyā suppaṭividdhattā tathāgato atīte buddhe parinibbute chinnapapañce chinnavaṭume pariyādinnavaṭṭe sabbadukkhavītivatte jātitopi anussarati, nāmatopi anussarati, gottatopi anussarati, āyuppamāṇatopi anussarati, sāvakayugatopi anussarati, sāvakasannipātatopi anussarati ‘evaṁjaccā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ’ itipi.
translation-en-sujato: And that is how the Realized One is able to recollect the caste, names, clans, life-span, chief disciples, and gatherings of disciples of the Buddhas of the past who have become completely extinguished, cut off proliferation, cut off the track, finished off the cycle, and transcended suffering. It is both because I have clearly comprehended the principle of the teachings,
reference: ms7D_186, msdiv94, pts-cs3.33, pts-vp-pli2.54, sc183, vri2.42

root-pli-ms: ‘Evaṁnāmā evaṅgottā evaṁsīlā evaṁdhammā evaṁpaññā evaṁvihārī evaṁvimuttā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ’ itipīti.

Devatāpi tathāgatassa etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ, yena tathāgato atīte buddhe parinibbute chinnapapañce chinnavaṭume pariyādinnavaṭṭe sabbadukkhavītivatte jātitopi anussarati, nāmatopi anussarati, gottatopi anussarati, āyuppamāṇatopi anussarati, sāvakayugatopi anussarati, sāvakasannipātatopi anussarati ‘evaṁjaccā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ’ itipi.
translation-en-sujato: and also because the deities told me.”

root-pli-ms: ‘Evaṁnāmā evaṅgottā evaṁsīlā evaṁdhammā evaṁpaññā evaṁvihārī evaṁvimuttā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ’ itipī”ti.
Idamavoca bhagavā.
translation-en-sujato: That is what the Buddha said.

root-pli-ms: Attamanā te bhikkhū bhagavato bhāsitaṁ abhinandunti.
translation-en-sujato: Satisfied, the mendicants were happy with what the Buddha said.

root-pli-ms: Mahāpadānasuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ paṭhamaṁ.
