root-pli-ms: Etarahi vā so rūpiṁ anantaṁ attānaṁ na paññapento na paññapeti, tattha bhāviṁ vā so rūpiṁ anantaṁ attānaṁ na paññapento na paññapeti, ‘atathaṁ vā pana santaṁ tathattāya upakappessāmī’ti iti vā panassa na hoti.
Evaṁ santaṁ kho, ānanda, rūpiṁ anantattānudiṭṭhi nānusetīti iccālaṁ vacanāya.
Tatrānanda, yo so arūpiṁ parittaṁ attānaṁ na paññapento na paññapeti.
translation-en-sujato: formless and limited …

root-pli-ms: Etarahi vā so arūpiṁ parittaṁ attānaṁ na paññapento na paññapeti, tattha bhāviṁ vā so arūpiṁ parittaṁ attānaṁ na paññapento na paññapeti, ‘atathaṁ vā pana santaṁ tathattāya upakappessāmī’ti iti vā panassa na hoti.
Evaṁ santaṁ kho, ānanda, arūpiṁ parittattānudiṭṭhi nānusetīti iccālaṁ vacanāya.
Tatrānanda, yo so arūpiṁ anantaṁ attānaṁ na paññapento na paññapeti.
translation-en-sujato: formless and infinite.

root-pli-ms: Etarahi vā so arūpiṁ anantaṁ attānaṁ na paññapento na paññapeti, tattha bhāviṁ vā so arūpiṁ anantaṁ attānaṁ na paññapento na paññapeti, ‘atathaṁ vā pana santaṁ tathattāya upakappessāmī’ti iti vā panassa na hoti.
translation-en-sujato: They don’t describe the self as formless and infinite in the present; or in some future life; and they don’t think: ‘Though it is not like that, I will ensure it is provided with what it needs to become like that.’

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ santaṁ kho, ānanda, arūpiṁ anantattānudiṭṭhi nānusetīti iccālaṁ vacanāya.
translation-en-sujato: This being so, it’s appropriate to say that a view of self as formless and infinite doesn’t underlie them.

root-pli-ms: Ettāvatā kho, ānanda, attānaṁ na paññapento na paññapeti.
translation-en-sujato: That’s how those who don’t describe the self don’t describe it.

root-pli-ms: 4. Attasamanupassanā
translation-en-sujato: 4. Regarding a Self

root-pli-ms: Kittāvatā ca, ānanda, attānaṁ samanupassamāno samanupassati?
translation-en-sujato: How do those who regard the self regard it?
reference: dr10.79, ms7D_230, msdiv121, pts-cs27, sc41, vri2.52

root-pli-ms: Vedanaṁ vā hi, ānanda, attānaṁ samanupassamāno samanupassati:
translation-en-sujato: They regard feeling as self:

root-pli-ms: ‘vedanā me attā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Feeling is my self.’

root-pli-ms: ‘Na heva kho me vedanā attā, appaṭisaṁvedano me attā’ti iti vā hi, ānanda, attānaṁ samanupassamāno samanupassati.
translation-en-sujato: Or they regard it like this: ‘Feeling is definitely not my self. My self does not experience feeling.’

root-pli-ms: ‘Na heva kho me vedanā attā, nopi appaṭisaṁvedano me attā, attā me vediyati, vedanādhammo hi me attā’ti iti vā hi, ānanda, attānaṁ samanupassamāno samanupassati.
translation-en-sujato: Or they regard it like this: ‘Feeling is definitely not my self. But it’s not that my self does not experience feeling. My self feels, for my self is liable to feel.’

root-pli-ms: Tatrānanda, yo so evamāha:
translation-en-sujato: Now, as to those who say:
reference: bj8.100, cck10.85, csp1ed7.57, csp2ed7.57, ms7D_231, msdiv122, pts-cs28, sc42, sya10.79

root-pli-ms: ‘vedanā me attā’ti,
translation-en-sujato: ‘Feeling is my self.’

root-pli-ms: so evamassa vacanīyo:
translation-en-sujato: You should say this to them:

root-pli-ms: ‘tisso kho imā, āvuso, vedanā—
translation-en-sujato: ‘Reverend, there are three feelings:

root-pli-ms: sukhā vedanā dukkhā vedanā adukkhamasukhā vedanā.
translation-en-sujato: pleasant, painful, and neutral.

root-pli-ms: Imāsaṁ kho tvaṁ tissannaṁ vedanānaṁ katamaṁ attato samanupassasī’ti?
translation-en-sujato: Which one of these do you regard as self?’

root-pli-ms: Yasmiṁ, ānanda, samaye sukhaṁ vedanaṁ vedeti, neva tasmiṁ samaye dukkhaṁ vedanaṁ vedeti, na adukkhamasukhaṁ vedanaṁ vedeti;
translation-en-sujato: Ānanda, at a time when you feel a pleasant feeling, you don’t feel a painful or neutral feeling;

root-pli-ms: sukhaṁyeva tasmiṁ samaye vedanaṁ vedeti.
translation-en-sujato: you only feel a pleasant feeling.

root-pli-ms: Yasmiṁ, ānanda, samaye dukkhaṁ vedanaṁ vedeti, neva tasmiṁ samaye sukhaṁ vedanaṁ vedeti, na adukkhamasukhaṁ vedanaṁ vedeti;
translation-en-sujato: At a time when you feel a painful feeling, you don’t feel a pleasant or neutral feeling;

root-pli-ms: dukkhaṁyeva tasmiṁ samaye vedanaṁ vedeti.
translation-en-sujato: you only feel a painful feeling.

root-pli-ms: Yasmiṁ, ānanda, samaye adukkhamasukhaṁ vedanaṁ vedeti, neva tasmiṁ samaye sukhaṁ vedanaṁ vedeti, na dukkhaṁ vedanaṁ vedeti;
translation-en-sujato: At a time when you feel a neutral feeling, you don’t feel a pleasant or painful feeling;

root-pli-ms: adukkhamasukhaṁyeva tasmiṁ samaye vedanaṁ vedeti.
translation-en-sujato: you only feel a neutral feeling.

root-pli-ms: Sukhāpi kho, ānanda, vedanā aniccā saṅkhatā paṭiccasamuppannā khayadhammā vayadhammā virāgadhammā nirodhadhammā.
translation-en-sujato: Pleasant feelings, painful feelings, and neutral feelings are all impermanent, conditioned, dependently originated, liable to end, vanish, fade away, and cease.
reference: dr10.80, mc10.60, ms7D_232, msdiv123, ndp7.54, pts-cs29, pts-vp-pli2.67, sc43

root-pli-ms: Dukkhāpi kho, ānanda, vedanā aniccā saṅkhatā paṭiccasamuppannā khayadhammā vayadhammā virāgadhammā nirodhadhammā.
Adukkhamasukhāpi kho, ānanda, vedanā aniccā saṅkhatā paṭiccasamuppannā khayadhammā vayadhammā virāgadhammā nirodhadhammā.
Tassa sukhaṁ vedanaṁ vediyamānassa ‘eso me attā’ti hoti.
translation-en-sujato: When feeling a pleasant feeling they think: ‘This is my self.’

root-pli-ms: Tassāyeva sukhāya vedanāya nirodhā ‘byagā me attā’ti hoti.
translation-en-sujato: When their pleasant feeling ceases they think: ‘My self has disappeared.’

root-pli-ms: Dukkhaṁ vedanaṁ vediyamānassa ‘eso me attā’ti hoti.
translation-en-sujato: When feeling a painful feeling they think: ‘This is my self.’

root-pli-ms: Tassāyeva dukkhāya vedanāya nirodhā ‘byagā me attā’ti hoti.
translation-en-sujato: When their painful feeling ceases they think: ‘My self has disappeared.’

root-pli-ms: Adukkhamasukhaṁ vedanaṁ vediyamānassa ‘eso me attā’ti hoti.
translation-en-sujato: When feeling a neutral feeling they think: ‘This is my self.’

root-pli-ms: Tassāyeva adukkhamasukhāya vedanāya nirodhā ‘byagā me attā’ti hoti.
translation-en-sujato: When their neutral feeling ceases they think: ‘My self has disappeared.’

root-pli-ms: Iti so diṭṭheva dhamme aniccasukhadukkhavokiṇṇaṁ uppādavayadhammaṁ attānaṁ samanupassamāno samanupassati, yo so evamāha: ‘vedanā me attā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: So those who say ‘feeling is my self’ regard as self that which is evidently impermanent, a mixture of pleasure and pain, and liable to rise and fall.

root-pli-ms: Tasmātihānanda, etena petaṁ nakkhamati: ‘vedanā me attā’ti samanupassituṁ.
translation-en-sujato: That’s why it’s not acceptable to regard feeling as self.

root-pli-ms: Tatrānanda, yo so evamāha:
translation-en-sujato: Now, as to those who say:
reference: cck10.86, ms7D_233, msdiv124, pts-cs30, sc44, sya10.80, vri2.53

root-pli-ms: ‘na heva kho me vedanā attā, appaṭisaṁvedano me attā’ti, so evamassa vacanīyo:
translation-en-sujato: ‘Feeling is definitely not my self. My self does not experience feeling.’ You should say this to them,

root-pli-ms: ‘yattha panāvuso, sabbaso vedayitaṁ natthi api nu kho, tattha “ayamahamasmī”ti siyā’”ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘But reverend, where there is nothing felt at all, would the thought “I am” occur there?’”
comment-en-sujato: Comm appears to support the PTS reading “asmiti”

root-pli-ms: “No hetaṁ, bhante”.
translation-en-sujato: “No, sir.”

root-pli-ms: “Tasmātihānanda, etena petaṁ nakkhamati: ‘na heva kho me vedanā attā, appaṭisaṁvedano me attā’ti samanupassituṁ.
translation-en-sujato: “That’s why it’s not acceptable to regard self as that which does not experience feeling.

root-pli-ms: Tatrānanda, yo so evamāha:
translation-en-sujato: Now, as to those who say:
reference: bj8.102, csp1ed7.58, csp2ed7.58, ms7D_234, msdiv125, pts-cs31, pts-vp-pli2.68, sc45

root-pli-ms: ‘na heva kho me vedanā attā, nopi appaṭisaṁvedano me attā, attā me vediyati, vedanādhammo hi me attā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Feeling is definitely not my self. But it’s not that my self does not experience feeling. My self feels, for my self is liable to feel.’

root-pli-ms: So evamassa vacanīyo—
translation-en-sujato: You should say this to them,

root-pli-ms: vedanā ca hi, āvuso, sabbena sabbaṁ sabbathā sabbaṁ aparisesā nirujjheyyuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Suppose feelings were to totally and utterly cease without anything left over.

root-pli-ms: Sabbaso vedanāya asati vedanānirodhā api nu kho tattha ‘ayamahamasmī’ti siyā”ti?
translation-en-sujato: When there’s no feeling at all, with the cessation of feeling, would the thought “I am this” occur there?’”

root-pli-ms: “No hetaṁ, bhante”.
translation-en-sujato: “No, sir.”

root-pli-ms: “Tasmātihānanda, etena petaṁ nakkhamati: ‘na heva kho me vedanā attā, nopi appaṭisaṁvedano me attā, attā me vediyati, vedanādhammo hi me attā’ti samanupassituṁ.
translation-en-sujato: “That’s why it’s not acceptable to regard self as that which is liable to feel.

root-pli-ms: Yato kho, ānanda, bhikkhu neva vedanaṁ attānaṁ samanupassati, nopi appaṭisaṁvedanaṁ attānaṁ samanupassati, nopi ‘attā me vediyati, vedanādhammo hi me attā’ti samanupassati.
So evaṁ na samanupassanto na ca kiñci loke upādiyati,
translation-en-sujato: Not regarding anything in this way, they don’t grasp at anything in the world.

root-pli-ms: anupādiyaṁ na paritassati, aparitassaṁ paccattaññeva parinibbāyati,
translation-en-sujato: Not grasping, they’re not anxious. Not being anxious, they personally become extinguished.

root-pli-ms: ‘khīṇā jāti, vusitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ, kataṁ karaṇīyaṁ, nāparaṁ itthattāyā’ti pajānāti.
translation-en-sujato: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vimuttacittaṁ kho, ānanda, bhikkhuṁ yo evaṁ vadeyya:
translation-en-sujato: It wouldn’t be appropriate to say that a mendicant whose mind is freed like this holds the following views:

root-pli-ms: ‘hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā itissa diṭṭhī’ti, tadakallaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: ‘A Realized One exists after death’;

root-pli-ms: ‘Na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā itissa diṭṭhī’ti, tadakallaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: ‘A Realized One doesn’t exist after death’;

root-pli-ms: ‘Hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā itissa diṭṭhī’ti, tadakallaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: ‘A Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death’;

root-pli-ms: ‘Neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā itissa diṭṭhī’ti, tadakallaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: ‘A Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death’.

root-pli-ms: Taṁ kissa hetu?
translation-en-sujato: Why is that?

root-pli-ms: Yāvatā, ānanda, adhivacanaṁ yāvatā adhivacanapatho, yāvatā nirutti yāvatā niruttipatho, yāvatā paññatti yāvatā paññattipatho, yāvatā paññā yāvatā paññāvacaraṁ, yāvatā vaṭṭaṁ, yāvatā vaṭṭati, tadabhiññāvimutto bhikkhu, tadabhiññāvimuttaṁ bhikkhuṁ ‘na jānāti na passati itissa diṭṭhī’ti, tadakallaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: A mendicant is freed by directly knowing this: how far language and the scope of language extend; how far terminology and the scope of terminology extend; how far description and the scope of description extend; how far wisdom and the sphere of wisdom extend; how far the cycle of rebirths and its continuation extend. It wouldn’t be appropriate to say that a mendicant freed by directly knowing this holds the view: ‘There is no such thing as knowing and seeing.’
variant-pli-ms: yāvatā vaṭṭaṁ, yāvatā vaṭṭati → yāvatā vaṭṭaṁ vaṭṭati (si), vattati tāvatā vaṭṭaṁ vattati (km), yavatā vaṭṭaṁ yāvatā vaṭṭaṁ vaṭṭati (pts1ed)

root-pli-ms: 5. Sattaviññāṇaṭṭhiti
translation-en-sujato: 5. Planes of Consciousness

root-pli-ms: Satta kho, ānanda, viññāṇaṭṭhitiyo, dve āyatanāni.
translation-en-sujato: Ānanda, there are seven planes of consciousness and two dimensions.
reference: bj8.104, cck10.88, csp1ed7.59, csp2ed7.59, dr10.82, mc10.62, ms7D_236, msdiv127, pts-cs33, pts-vp-pli2.69, sc47, sya10.82, vri2.54
variant-pli-ms: Satta kho, ānanda → satta kho imā ānanda (bj, sya-all, km, pts1ed)

root-pli-ms: Katamā satta?
translation-en-sujato: What seven?

root-pli-ms: Santānanda, sattā nānattakāyā nānattasaññino, seyyathāpi manussā, ekacce ca devā, ekacce ca vinipātikā.
translation-en-sujato: There are sentient beings that are diverse in body and diverse in perception, such as human beings, some gods, and some beings in the underworld.

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ paṭhamā viññāṇaṭṭhiti.
translation-en-sujato: This is the first plane of consciousness.

root-pli-ms: Santānanda, sattā nānattakāyā ekattasaññino, seyyathāpi devā brahmakāyikā paṭhamābhinibbattā.
translation-en-sujato: There are sentient beings that are diverse in body and unified in perception, such as the gods reborn in Brahmā’s Host through the first absorption.

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ dutiyā viññāṇaṭṭhiti.
translation-en-sujato: This is the second plane of consciousness.

root-pli-ms: Santānanda, sattā ekattakāyā nānattasaññino, seyyathāpi devā ābhassarā.
translation-en-sujato: There are sentient beings that are unified in body and diverse in perception, such as the gods of streaming radiance.

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ tatiyā viññāṇaṭṭhiti.
translation-en-sujato: This is the third plane of consciousness.

root-pli-ms: Santānanda, sattā ekattakāyā ekattasaññino, seyyathāpi devā subhakiṇhā.
translation-en-sujato: There are sentient beings that are unified in body and unified in perception, such as the gods replete with glory.

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ catutthī viññāṇaṭṭhiti.
translation-en-sujato: This is the fourth plane of consciousness.

root-pli-ms: Santānanda, sattā sabbaso rūpasaññānaṁ samatikkamā paṭighasaññānaṁ atthaṅgamā nānattasaññānaṁ amanasikārā ‘ananto ākāso’ti ākāsānañcāyatanūpagā.
translation-en-sujato: There are sentient beings that have gone totally beyond perceptions of form. With the ending of perceptions of impingement, not focusing on perceptions of diversity, aware that ‘space is infinite’, they have been reborn in the dimension of infinite space.

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ pañcamī viññāṇaṭṭhiti.
translation-en-sujato: This is the fifth plane of consciousness.

root-pli-ms: Santānanda, sattā sabbaso ākāsānañcāyatanaṁ samatikkamma ‘anantaṁ viññāṇan’ti viññāṇañcāyatanūpagā.
translation-en-sujato: There are sentient beings that have gone totally beyond the dimension of infinite space. Aware that ‘consciousness is infinite’, they have been reborn in the dimension of infinite consciousness.

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ chaṭṭhī viññāṇaṭṭhiti.
translation-en-sujato: This is the sixth plane of consciousness.

root-pli-ms: Santānanda, sattā sabbaso viññāṇañcāyatanaṁ samatikkamma ‘natthi kiñcī’ti ākiñcaññāyatanūpagā.
translation-en-sujato: There are sentient beings that have gone totally beyond the dimension of infinite consciousness. Aware that ‘there is nothing at all’, they have been reborn in the dimension of nothingness.

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ sattamī viññāṇaṭṭhiti.
translation-en-sujato: This is the seventh plane of consciousness.

root-pli-ms: Asaññasattāyatanaṁ nevasaññānāsaññāyatanameva dutiyaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Then there’s the dimension of non-percipient beings, and secondly, the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.

root-pli-ms: Tatrānanda, yāyaṁ paṭhamā viññāṇaṭṭhiti nānattakāyā nānattasaññino, seyyathāpi manussā, ekacce ca devā, ekacce ca vinipātikā.
translation-en-sujato: Now, regarding these seven planes of consciousness and two dimensions,

root-pli-ms: Yo nu kho, ānanda, tañca pajānāti, tassā ca samudayaṁ pajānāti, tassā ca atthaṅgamaṁ pajānāti, tassā ca assādaṁ pajānāti, tassā ca ādīnavaṁ pajānāti, tassā ca nissaraṇaṁ pajānāti, kallaṁ nu tena tadabhinanditun”ti?
translation-en-sujato: is it appropriate for someone who understands them—and their origin, ending, gratification, drawback, and escape—to take pleasure in them?”

root-pli-ms: “No hetaṁ, bhante” …pe…
translation-en-sujato: “No, sir.”

root-pli-ms: “tatrānanda, yamidaṁ asaññasattāyatanaṁ.

Yo nu kho, ānanda, tañca pajānāti, tassa ca samudayaṁ pajānāti, tassa ca atthaṅgamaṁ pajānāti, tassa ca assādaṁ pajānāti, tassa ca ādīnavaṁ pajānāti, tassa ca nissaraṇaṁ pajānāti, kallaṁ nu tena tadabhinanditun”ti?
“No hetaṁ, bhante”.
“Tatrānanda, yamidaṁ nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṁ.

Yo nu kho, ānanda, tañca pajānāti, tassa ca samudayaṁ pajānāti, tassa ca atthaṅgamaṁ pajānāti, tassa ca assādaṁ pajānāti, tassa ca ādīnavaṁ pajānāti, tassa ca nissaraṇaṁ pajānāti, kallaṁ nu tena tadabhinanditun”ti?
“No hetaṁ, bhante”.

“Yato kho, ānanda, bhikkhu imāsañca sattannaṁ viññāṇaṭṭhitīnaṁ imesañca dvinnaṁ āyatanānaṁ samudayañca atthaṅgamañca assādañca ādīnavañca nissaraṇañca yathābhūtaṁ viditvā anupādā vimutto hoti, ayaṁ vuccatānanda, bhikkhu paññāvimutto.
translation-en-sujato: “When a mendicant, having truly understood the origin, ending, gratification, drawback, and escape regarding these seven planes of consciousness and these two dimensions, is freed by not grasping, they’re called a mendicant who is freed by wisdom.

root-pli-ms: 6. Aṭṭhavimokkha
translation-en-sujato: 6. The Eight Liberations

root-pli-ms: Aṭṭha kho ime, ānanda, vimokkhā.
translation-en-sujato: Ānanda, there are these eight liberations.
reference: cck10.90, csp1ed7.60, csp2ed7.60, dr10.85, ms7D_238, msdiv129, pts-cs35, pts-vp-pli2.71, sc49, sya10.84, vri2.55

root-pli-ms: Katame aṭṭha?
translation-en-sujato: What eight?

root-pli-ms: Rūpī rūpāni passati
translation-en-sujato: Having physical form, they see visions.

root-pli-ms: ayaṁ paṭhamo vimokkho.
translation-en-sujato: This is the first liberation.

root-pli-ms: Ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī bahiddhā rūpāni passati,
translation-en-sujato: Not perceiving form internally, they see visions externally.

root-pli-ms: ayaṁ dutiyo vimokkho.
translation-en-sujato: This is the second liberation.

root-pli-ms: Subhanteva adhimutto hoti,
translation-en-sujato: They’re focused only on beauty.

root-pli-ms: ayaṁ tatiyo vimokkho.
translation-en-sujato: This is the third liberation.

root-pli-ms: Sabbaso rūpasaññānaṁ samatikkamā paṭighasaññānaṁ atthaṅgamā nānattasaññānaṁ amanasikārā ‘ananto ākāso’ti ākāsānañcāyatanaṁ upasampajja viharati,
translation-en-sujato: Going totally beyond perceptions of form, with the ending of perceptions of impingement, not focusing on perceptions of diversity, aware that ‘space is infinite’, they enter and remain in the dimension of infinite space.

root-pli-ms: ayaṁ catuttho vimokkho.
translation-en-sujato: This is the fourth liberation.

root-pli-ms: Sabbaso ākāsānañcāyatanaṁ samatikkamma ‘anantaṁ viññāṇan’ti viññāṇañcāyatanaṁ upasampajja viharati,
translation-en-sujato: Going totally beyond the dimension of infinite space, aware that ‘consciousness is infinite’, they enter and remain in the dimension of infinite consciousness.

root-pli-ms: ayaṁ pañcamo vimokkho.
translation-en-sujato: This is the fifth liberation.

root-pli-ms: Sabbaso viññāṇañcāyatanaṁ samatikkamma ‘natthi kiñcī’ti ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ upasampajja viharati,
translation-en-sujato: Going totally beyond the dimension of infinite consciousness, aware that ‘there is nothing at all’, they enter and remain in the dimension of nothingness.

root-pli-ms: ayaṁ chaṭṭho vimokkho.
translation-en-sujato: This is the sixth liberation.

root-pli-ms: Sabbaso ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ samatikkamma nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṁ upasampajja viharati,
translation-en-sujato: Going totally beyond the dimension of nothingness, they enter and remain in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.

root-pli-ms: ayaṁ sattamo vimokkho.
translation-en-sujato: This is the seventh liberation.

root-pli-ms: Sabbaso nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṁ samatikkamma saññāvedayitanirodhaṁ upasampajja viharati,
translation-en-sujato: Going totally beyond the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception, they enter and remain in the cessation of perception and feeling.

root-pli-ms: ayaṁ aṭṭhamo vimokkho.
translation-en-sujato: This is the eighth liberation.

root-pli-ms: Ime kho, ānanda, aṭṭha vimokkhā.
translation-en-sujato: These are the eight liberations.

root-pli-ms: Yato kho, ānanda, bhikkhu ime aṭṭha vimokkhe anulomampi samāpajjati, paṭilomampi samāpajjati, anulomapaṭilomampi samāpajjati, yatthicchakaṁ yadicchakaṁ yāvaticchakaṁ samāpajjatipi vuṭṭhātipi.
translation-en-sujato: When a mendicant enters into and withdraws from these eight liberations—in forward order, in reverse order, and in forward and reverse order—wherever they wish, whenever they wish, and for as long as they wish;
comment-en-sujato: Cp. AN 9.41
reference: bj8.108, mc10.64, ms7D_239, msdiv130, ndp7.57, pts-cs36, sc50

root-pli-ms: Āsavānañca khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati, ayaṁ vuccatānanda, bhikkhu ubhatobhāgavimutto.
translation-en-sujato: and when they realize the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, and live having realized it with their own insight due to the ending of defilements, they’re called a mendicant who is freed both ways.

root-pli-ms: Imāya ca, ānanda, ubhatobhāgavimuttiyā aññā ubhatobhāgavimutti uttaritarā vā paṇītatarā vā natthī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: And, Ānanda, there is no other freedom both ways that is better or finer than this.”

root-pli-ms: Idamavoca bhagavā.
translation-en-sujato: That is what the Buddha said.

root-pli-ms: Attamano āyasmā ānando bhagavato bhāsitaṁ abhinandīti.
translation-en-sujato: Satisfied, Venerable Ānanda was happy with what the Buddha said.

root-pli-ms: Mahānidānasuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ dutiyaṁ.
Dīgha Nikāya 16
translation-en-sujato: Long Discourses 16

root-pli-ms: Mahāparinibbānasutta
translation-en-sujato: The Great Discourse on the Buddha’s Extinguishment

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
translation-en-sujato: So I have heard.
reference: bj8.110, cck10.91, csp1ed7.61, csp2ed7.61, dr10.86, mc10.65, ms7D_242, msdiv131, ndp7.58, pts-cs1.1, pts-vp-pli2.72, sc1, sya10.85, vri2.56

root-pli-ms: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā rājagahe viharati gijjhakūṭe pabbate.
translation-en-sujato: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, on the Vulture’s Peak Mountain.

root-pli-ms: Tena kho pana samayena rājā māgadho ajātasattu vedehiputto vajjī abhiyātukāmo hoti.
translation-en-sujato: Now at that time King Ajātasattu Vedehiputta of Māgadha wanted to invade the Vajjis.

root-pli-ms: So evamāha:
translation-en-sujato: He declared:

root-pli-ms: “ahaṁ hime vajjī evaṁmahiddhike evaṁmahānubhāve ucchecchāmi vajjī, vināsessāmi vajjī, anayabyasanaṁ āpādessāmī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “I shall wipe out these Vajjis, so mighty and powerful! I shall destroy them, and lay ruin and devastation upon them!”
variant-pli-ms: ucchecchāmi → ucchejjāmi (sya-all, km, pts1ed); ucchijjāmi (mr) | anayabyasanaṁ āpādessāmī”ti → āpādessāmi vajjīti (bj); āpādessāmi vajjinti (sya-all, km)

root-pli-ms: Atha kho rājā māgadho ajātasattu vedehiputto vassakāraṁ brāhmaṇaṁ magadhamahāmattaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: And then King Ajātasattu addressed Vassakāra the brahmin minister of Māgadha,

root-pli-ms: “ehi tvaṁ, brāhmaṇa, yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkama; upasaṅkamitvā mama vacanena bhagavato pāde sirasā vandāhi, appābādhaṁ appātaṅkaṁ lahuṭṭhānaṁ balaṁ phāsuvihāraṁ puccha:
translation-en-sujato: “Please, brahmin, go to the Buddha, and in my name bow with your head to his feet. Ask him if he is healthy and well, nimble, strong, and living comfortably.

root-pli-ms: ‘rājā, bhante, māgadho ajātasattu vedehiputto bhagavato pāde sirasā vandati, appābādhaṁ appātaṅkaṁ lahuṭṭhānaṁ balaṁ phāsuvihāraṁ pucchatī’ti.
Evañca vadehi:
translation-en-sujato: And then say:

root-pli-ms: ‘rājā, bhante, māgadho ajātasattu vedehiputto vajjī abhiyātukāmo.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Sir, King Ajātasattu Vedehiputta of Māgadha wants to invade the Vajjis.

root-pli-ms: So evamāha:
translation-en-sujato: He says,

root-pli-ms: “ahaṁ hime vajjī evaṁmahiddhike evaṁmahānubhāve ucchecchāmi vajjī, vināsessāmi vajjī, anayabyasanaṁ āpādessāmī”’ti.
translation-en-sujato: “I shall wipe out these Vajjis, so mighty and powerful! I shall destroy them, and lay ruin and devastation upon them!”’

root-pli-ms: Yathā te bhagavā byākaroti, taṁ sādhukaṁ uggahetvā mama āroceyyāsi.
translation-en-sujato: Remember well how the Buddha answers and tell it to me.

root-pli-ms: Na hi tathāgatā vitathaṁ bhaṇantī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: For Realized Ones say nothing that is not so.”

root-pli-ms: 1. Vassakārabrāhmaṇa
translation-en-sujato: 1. The Brahmin Vassakāra

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bho”ti kho vassakāro brāhmaṇo magadhamahāmatto rañño māgadhassa ajātasattussa vedehiputtassa paṭissutvā bhaddāni bhaddāni yānāni yojetvā bhaddaṁ bhaddaṁ yānaṁ abhiruhitvā bhaddehi bhaddehi yānehi rājagahamhā niyyāsi, yena gijjhakūṭo pabbato tena pāyāsi.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” Vassakāra replied. He had the finest carriages harnessed. Then he mounted a fine carriage and, along with other fine carriages, set out from Rājagaha for the Vulture’s Peak Mountain.
comment-en-sujato: Reading yojapetva as per PTS.

root-pli-ms: Yāvatikā yānassa bhūmi, yānena gantvā, yānā paccorohitvā pattikova yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodi.
translation-en-sujato: He went by carriage as far as the terrain allowed, then descended and approached the Buddha on foot, and exchanged greetings with him.

root-pli-ms: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho vassakāro brāhmaṇo magadhamahāmatto bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side and said to the Buddha,

root-pli-ms: “rājā, bho gotama, māgadho ajātasattu vedehiputto bhoto gotamassa pāde sirasā vandati, appābādhaṁ appātaṅkaṁ lahuṭṭhānaṁ balaṁ phāsuvihāraṁ pucchati.
translation-en-sujato: “Master Gotama, King Ajātasattu Vedehiputta of Māgadha bows with his head to your feet. He asks if you are healthy and well, nimble, strong, and living comfortably.

root-pli-ms: Rājā, bho gotama, māgadho ajātasattu vedehiputto vajjī abhiyātukāmo.
translation-en-sujato: Master Gotama, King Ajātasattu wants to invade the Vajjis.

root-pli-ms: So evamāha:
translation-en-sujato: He has declared:

root-pli-ms: ‘ahaṁ hime vajjī evaṁmahiddhike evaṁmahānubhāve ucchecchāmi vajjī, vināsessāmi vajjī, anayabyasanaṁ āpādessāmī’”ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘I shall wipe out these Vajjis, so mighty and powerful! I shall destroy them, and lay ruin and devastation upon them!’”

root-pli-ms: 2. Rājaaparihāniyadhamma
translation-en-sujato: 2. Principles That Prevent Decline

root-pli-ms: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā ānando bhagavato piṭṭhito ṭhito hoti bhagavantaṁ bījayamāno.
translation-en-sujato: Now at that time Venerable Ānanda was standing behind the Buddha fanning him.
reference: cck10.93, ms7D_245, msdiv134, pts-cs1.4, sc4, sya10.87

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha said to him,

root-pli-ms: “kinti te, ānanda, sutaṁ, ‘vajjī abhiṇhaṁ sannipātā sannipātabahulā’”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “Ānanda, have you heard that the Vajjis meet frequently and have many meetings?”

root-pli-ms: “Sutaṁ metaṁ, bhante: ‘vajjī abhiṇhaṁ sannipātā sannipātabahulā’”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “I have heard that, sir.”

root-pli-ms: “Yāvakīvañca, ānanda, vajjī abhiṇhaṁ sannipātā sannipātabahulā bhavissanti, vuddhiyeva, ānanda, vajjīnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni. (1)
translation-en-sujato: “As long as the Vajjis meet frequently and have many meetings, they can expect growth, not decline.

root-pli-ms: Kinti te, ānanda, sutaṁ, ‘vajjī samaggā sannipatanti, samaggā vuṭṭhahanti, samaggā vajjikaraṇīyāni karontī’”ti?
translation-en-sujato: Ānanda, have you heard that the Vajjis meet in harmony, leave in harmony, and carry on their business in harmony?”

root-pli-ms: “Sutaṁ metaṁ, bhante: ‘vajjī samaggā sannipatanti, samaggā vuṭṭhahanti, samaggā vajjikaraṇīyāni karontī’”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “I have heard that, sir.”

root-pli-ms: “Yāvakīvañca, ānanda, vajjī samaggā sannipatissanti, samaggā vuṭṭhahissanti, samaggā vajjikaraṇīyāni karissanti, vuddhiyeva, ānanda, vajjīnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni. (2)
translation-en-sujato: “As long as the Vajjis meet in harmony, leave in harmony, and carry on their business in harmony, they can expect growth, not decline.

root-pli-ms: Kinti te, ānanda, sutaṁ, ‘vajjī apaññattaṁ na paññapenti, paññattaṁ na samucchindanti, yathāpaññatte porāṇe vajjidhamme samādāya vattantī’”ti?
translation-en-sujato: Ānanda, have you heard that the Vajjis don’t make new decrees or abolish existing decrees, but proceed having undertaken the traditional Vajjian principles as they have been decreed?”

root-pli-ms: “Sutaṁ metaṁ, bhante: ‘vajjī apaññattaṁ na paññapenti, paññattaṁ na samucchindanti, yathāpaññatte porāṇe vajjidhamme samādāya vattantī’”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “I have heard that, sir.”

root-pli-ms: “Yāvakīvañca, ānanda, vajjī apaññattaṁ na paññapessanti, paññattaṁ na samucchindissanti, yathāpaññatte porāṇe vajjidhamme samādāya vattissanti, vuddhiyeva, ānanda, vajjīnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni. (3)
translation-en-sujato: “As long as the Vajjis don’t make new decrees or abolish existing decrees, but proceed having undertaken the traditional Vajjian principles as they have been decreed, they can expect growth, not decline.

root-pli-ms: Kinti te, ānanda, sutaṁ, ‘vajjī ye te vajjīnaṁ vajjimahallakā, te sakkaronti garuṁ karonti mānenti pūjenti, tesañca sotabbaṁ maññantī’”ti?
translation-en-sujato: Ānanda, have you heard that the Vajjis honor, respect, esteem, and venerate Vajjian elders, and think them worth listening to?”
variant-pli-ms: garuṁ karonti → garukaronti (bj, sya-all, km, pts1ed)

root-pli-ms: “Sutaṁ metaṁ, bhante: ‘vajjī ye te vajjīnaṁ vajjimahallakā, te sakkaronti garuṁ karonti mānenti pūjenti, tesañca sotabbaṁ maññantī’”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “I have heard that, sir.”

root-pli-ms: “Yāvakīvañca, ānanda, vajjī ye te vajjīnaṁ vajjimahallakā, te sakkarissanti garuṁ karissanti mānessanti pūjessanti, tesañca sotabbaṁ maññissanti, vuddhiyeva, ānanda, vajjīnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni. (4)
translation-en-sujato: “As long as the Vajjis honor, respect, esteem, and venerate Vajjian elders, and think them worth listening to, they can expect growth, not decline.

root-pli-ms: Kinti te, ānanda, sutaṁ, ‘vajjī yā tā kulitthiyo kulakumāriyo, tā na okkassa pasayha vāsentī’”ti?
translation-en-sujato: Ānanda, have you heard that the Vajjis don’t rape or abduct women or girls from their families and force them to live with them?”

root-pli-ms: “Sutaṁ metaṁ, bhante: ‘vajjī yā tā kulitthiyo kulakumāriyo tā na okkassa pasayha vāsentī’”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “I have heard that, sir.”

root-pli-ms: “Yāvakīvañca, ānanda, vajjī yā tā kulitthiyo kulakumāriyo, tā na okkassa pasayha vāsessanti, vuddhiyeva, ānanda, vajjīnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni. (5)
translation-en-sujato: “As long as the Vajjis don’t rape or abduct women or girls from their families and force them to live with them, they can expect growth, not decline.

root-pli-ms: Kinti te, ānanda, sutaṁ, ‘vajjī yāni tāni vajjīnaṁ vajjicetiyāni abbhantarāni ceva bāhirāni ca, tāni sakkaronti garuṁ karonti mānenti pūjenti, tesañca dinnapubbaṁ katapubbaṁ dhammikaṁ baliṁ no parihāpentī’”ti?
translation-en-sujato: Ānanda, have you heard that the Vajjis honor, respect, esteem, and venerate the Vajjian shrines, whether inner or outer, not neglecting the proper spirit-offerings that were given and made in the past?”

root-pli-ms: “Sutaṁ metaṁ, bhante: ‘vajjī yāni tāni vajjīnaṁ vajjicetiyāni abbhantarāni ceva bāhirāni ca, tāni sakkaronti garuṁ karonti mānenti pūjenti tesañca dinnapubbaṁ katapubbaṁ dhammikaṁ baliṁ no parihāpentī’”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “I have heard that, sir.”

root-pli-ms: “Yāvakīvañca, ānanda, vajjī yāni tāni vajjīnaṁ vajjicetiyāni abbhantarāni ceva bāhirāni ca, tāni sakkarissanti garuṁ karissanti mānessanti pūjessanti, tesañca dinnapubbaṁ katapubbaṁ dhammikaṁ baliṁ no parihāpessanti, vuddhiyeva, ānanda, vajjīnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni. (6)
translation-en-sujato: “As long as the Vajjis honor, respect, esteem, and venerate the Vajjian shrines, whether inner or outer, not neglecting the proper spirit-offerings that were given and made in the past, they can expect growth, not decline.

root-pli-ms: Kinti te, ānanda, sutaṁ, ‘vajjīnaṁ arahantesu dhammikā rakkhāvaraṇagutti susaṁvihitā, kinti anāgatā ca arahanto vijitaṁ āgaccheyyuṁ, āgatā ca arahanto vijite phāsu vihareyyun’”ti?
translation-en-sujato: Ānanda, have you heard that the Vajjis arrange for proper protection, shelter, and security for perfected ones, so that more perfected ones might come to the realm and those already here may live in comfort?”

root-pli-ms: “Sutaṁ metaṁ, bhante ‘vajjīnaṁ arahantesu dhammikā rakkhāvaraṇagutti susaṁvihitā kinti anāgatā ca arahanto vijitaṁ āgaccheyyuṁ, āgatā ca arahanto vijite phāsu vihareyyun’”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “I have heard that, sir.”

root-pli-ms: “Yāvakīvañca, ānanda, vajjīnaṁ arahantesu dhammikā rakkhāvaraṇagutti susaṁvihitā bhavissati, kinti anāgatā ca arahanto vijitaṁ āgaccheyyuṁ, āgatā ca arahanto vijite phāsu vihareyyunti. Vuddhiyeva, ānanda, vajjīnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihānī”ti. (7)
translation-en-sujato: “As long as the Vajjis arrange for proper protection, shelter, and security for perfected ones, so that more perfected ones might come to the realm and those already here may live in comfort, they can expect growth, not decline.”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā vassakāraṁ brāhmaṇaṁ magadhamahāmattaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha said to Vassakāra,
reference: cck10.96, ms7D_252, msdiv135, ndp7.61, pts-cs1.5, sc11, vri2.59

root-pli-ms: “ekamidāhaṁ, brāhmaṇa, samayaṁ vesāliyaṁ viharāmi sārandade cetiye.
translation-en-sujato: “Brahmin, this one time I was staying near Vesālī at the Sārandada woodland shrine.

root-pli-ms: Tatrāhaṁ vajjīnaṁ ime satta aparihāniye dhamme desesiṁ.
translation-en-sujato: There I taught the Vajjis these seven principles that prevent decline.

root-pli-ms: Yāvakīvañca, brāhmaṇa, ime satta aparihāniyā dhammā vajjīsu ṭhassanti, imesu ca sattasu aparihāniyesu dhammesu vajjī sandississanti, vuddhiyeva, brāhmaṇa, vajjīnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihānī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: As long as these seven principles that prevent decline last among the Vajjis, and as long as the Vajjis are seen following them, they can expect growth, not decline.”

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vutte, vassakāro brāhmaṇo magadhamahāmatto bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: When the Buddha had spoken, Vassakāra said to him,

root-pli-ms: “ekamekenapi, bho gotama, aparihāniyena dhammena samannāgatānaṁ vajjīnaṁ vuddhiyeva pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
translation-en-sujato: “Master Gotama, if the Vajjis follow even a single one of these principles they can expect growth, not decline.

root-pli-ms: Ko pana vādo sattahi aparihāniyehi dhammehi.
translation-en-sujato: How much more so all seven!

root-pli-ms: Akaraṇīyāva, bho gotama, vajjī raññā māgadhena ajātasattunā vedehiputtena yadidaṁ yuddhassa, aññatra upalāpanāya aññatra mithubhedā.
translation-en-sujato: King Ajātasattu cannot defeat the Vajjis in war, unless by diplomacy or by sowing dissension.
variant-pli-ms: Akaraṇīyāva → akaraṇīyā ca (bj, sya-all, km, mr)

root-pli-ms: Handa ca dāni mayaṁ, bho gotama, gacchāma, bahukiccā mayaṁ bahukaraṇīyā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Well, now, Master Gotama, I must go. I have many duties, and much to do.”

root-pli-ms: “Yassadāni tvaṁ, brāhmaṇa, kālaṁ maññasī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Please, brahmin, go at your convenience.”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho vassakāro brāhmaṇo magadhamahāmatto bhagavato bhāsitaṁ abhinanditvā anumoditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
translation-en-sujato: Then Vassakāra the brahmin, having approved and agreed with what the Buddha said, got up from his seat and left.

root-pli-ms: 3. Bhikkhuaparihāniyadhamma
translation-en-sujato: 3. Principles That Prevent Decline Among the Mendicants

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā acirapakkante vassakāre brāhmaṇe magadhamahāmatte āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: Soon after he had left, the Buddha said to Ānanda,
reference: cck10.97, mc10.69, ms7D_254, msdiv136, pts-cs1.6, sc13

root-pli-ms: “gaccha tvaṁ, ānanda, yāvatikā bhikkhū rājagahaṁ upanissāya viharanti, te sabbe upaṭṭhānasālāyaṁ sannipātehī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Go, Ānanda, gather all the mendicants staying in the vicinity of Rājagaha together in the assembly hall.”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paṭissutvā yāvatikā bhikkhū rājagahaṁ upanissāya viharanti, te sabbe upaṭṭhānasālāyaṁ sannipātetvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhāsi. Ekamantaṁ ṭhito kho āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” replied Ānanda. He did what the Buddha asked. Then he went back, bowed, stood to one side, and said to him,

root-pli-ms: “sannipatito, bhante, bhikkhusaṅgho, yassadāni, bhante, bhagavā kālaṁ maññatī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, the mendicant Saṅgha has assembled. Please, sir, go at your convenience.”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā uṭṭhāyāsanā yena upaṭṭhānasālā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha went to the assembly hall, where he sat on the seat spread out

root-pli-ms: Nisajja kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: and addressed the mendicants:

root-pli-ms: “satta vo, bhikkhave, aparihāniye dhamme desessāmi,
translation-en-sujato: “Mendicants, I will teach you these seven principles that prevent decline.

root-pli-ms: taṁ suṇātha, sādhukaṁ manasikarotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” they replied.

root-pli-ms: Bhagavā etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: The Buddha said this:

root-pli-ms: “Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū abhiṇhaṁ sannipātā sannipātabahulā bhavissanti, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni. (1)
translation-en-sujato: “As long as the mendicants meet frequently and have many meetings, they can expect growth, not decline.

root-pli-ms: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū samaggā sannipatissanti, samaggā vuṭṭhahissanti, samaggā saṅghakaraṇīyāni karissanti, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni. (2)
translation-en-sujato: As long as the mendicants meet in harmony, leave in harmony, and carry on their business in harmony, they can expect growth, not decline.

root-pli-ms: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū apaññattaṁ na paññapessanti, paññattaṁ na samucchindissanti, yathāpaññattesu sikkhāpadesu samādāya vattissanti, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni. (3)
translation-en-sujato: As long as the mendicants don’t make new decrees or abolish existing decrees, but undertake and follow the training rules as they have been decreed, they can expect growth, not decline.

root-pli-ms: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū ye te bhikkhū therā rattaññū cirapabbajitā saṅghapitaro saṅghapariṇāyakā, te sakkarissanti garuṁ karissanti mānessanti pūjessanti, tesañca sotabbaṁ maññissanti, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni. (4)
translation-en-sujato: As long as the mendicants honor, respect, esteem, and venerate the senior mendicants—of long standing, long gone forth, fathers and leaders of the Saṅgha—and think them worth listening to, they can expect growth, not decline.

root-pli-ms: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū uppannāya taṇhāya ponobbhavikāya na vasaṁ gacchissanti, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni. (5)
translation-en-sujato: As long as the mendicants don’t fall under the sway of arisen craving for future lives, they can expect growth, not decline.

root-pli-ms: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū āraññakesu senāsanesu sāpekkhā bhavissanti, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni. (6)
translation-en-sujato: As long as the mendicants take care to live in wilderness lodgings, they can expect growth, not decline.

root-pli-ms: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū paccattaññeva satiṁ upaṭṭhapessanti: ‘kinti anāgatā ca pesalā sabrahmacārī āgaccheyyuṁ, āgatā ca pesalā sabrahmacārī phāsu vihareyyun’ti. Vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni. (7)
translation-en-sujato: As long as the mendicants individually establish mindfulness, so that more good-hearted spiritual companions might come, and those that have already come may live comfortably, they can expect growth, not decline.

root-pli-ms: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, ime satta aparihāniyā dhammā bhikkhūsu ṭhassanti, imesu ca sattasu aparihāniyesu dhammesu bhikkhū sandississanti, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
translation-en-sujato: As long as these seven principles that prevent decline last among the mendicants, and as long as the mendicants are seen following them, they can expect growth, not decline.

root-pli-ms: Aparepi vo, bhikkhave, satta aparihāniye dhamme desessāmi, taṁ suṇātha, sādhukaṁ manasikarotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: I will teach you seven more principles that prevent decline. …
reference: csp1ed7.66, csp2ed7.66, ms7D_264, msdiv137, pts-cs1.7, sc23, sya10.92, vri2.61

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṁ.
Bhagavā etadavoca:
“Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū na kammārāmā bhavissanti na kammaratā na kammārāmatamanuyuttā, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni. (1)
translation-en-sujato: As long as the mendicants don’t relish work, loving it and liking to relish it, they can expect growth, not decline.

root-pli-ms: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū na bhassārāmā bhavissanti na bhassaratā na bhassārāmatamanuyuttā, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni. (2)
translation-en-sujato: As long as they don’t enjoy talk …

root-pli-ms: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū na niddārāmā bhavissanti na niddāratā na niddārāmatamanuyuttā, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni. (3)
translation-en-sujato: sleep …

root-pli-ms: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū na saṅgaṇikārāmā bhavissanti na saṅgaṇikaratā na saṅgaṇikārāmatamanuyuttā, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni. (4)
translation-en-sujato: company …

root-pli-ms: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū na pāpicchā bhavissanti na pāpikānaṁ icchānaṁ vasaṁ gatā, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni. (5)
translation-en-sujato: they don’t have wicked desires, falling under the sway of wicked desires …

root-pli-ms: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū na pāpamittā bhavissanti na pāpasahāyā na pāpasampavaṅkā, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni. (6)
translation-en-sujato: they don’t have bad friends, companions, and associates …

root-pli-ms: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū na oramattakena visesādhigamena antarāvosānaṁ āpajjissanti, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni. (7)
translation-en-sujato: they don’t stop half-way after achieving some insignificant distinction, they can expect growth, not decline.

root-pli-ms: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, ime satta aparihāniyā dhammā bhikkhūsu ṭhassanti, imesu ca sattasu aparihāniyesu dhammesu bhikkhū sandississanti, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
translation-en-sujato: As long as these seven principles that prevent decline last among the mendicants, and as long as the mendicants are seen following them, they can expect growth, not decline.

root-pli-ms: Aparepi vo, bhikkhave, satta aparihāniye dhamme desessāmi …pe….
translation-en-sujato: I will teach you seven more principles that prevent decline. …

translation-en-sujato: prudent …

root-pli-ms: paññavanto bhavissanti, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
translation-en-sujato: wise, they can expect growth, not decline.

root-pli-ms: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, ime satta aparihāniyā dhammā bhikkhūsu ṭhassanti, imesu ca sattasu aparihāniyesu dhammesu bhikkhū sandississanti, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
translation-en-sujato: As long as these seven principles that prevent decline last among the mendicants, and as long as the mendicants are seen following them, they can expect growth, not decline.

translation-en-sujato: I will teach you seven more principles that prevent decline. …

Bhagavā etadavoca:
“Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu satisambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāvessanti …pe…
translation-en-sujato: As long as the mendicants develop the awakening factors of mindfulness …

root-pli-ms: dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāvessanti …
translation-en-sujato: investigation of principles …

root-pli-ms: vīriyasambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāvessanti …
translation-en-sujato: energy …

root-pli-ms: pītisambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāvessanti …
translation-en-sujato: rapture …

root-pli-ms: passaddhisambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāvessanti …
translation-en-sujato: tranquility …

root-pli-ms: samādhisambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāvessanti …
translation-en-sujato: immersion …

root-pli-ms: upekkhāsambojjhaṅgaṁ bhāvessanti, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
translation-en-sujato: equanimity, they can expect growth, not decline.

root-pli-ms: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, ime satta aparihāniyā dhammā bhikkhūsu ṭhassanti, imesu ca sattasu aparihāniyesu dhammesu bhikkhū sandississanti, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā no parihāni.
translation-en-sujato: As long as these seven principles that prevent decline last among the mendicants, and as long as the mendicants are seen following them, they can expect growth, not decline.

root-pli-ms: Aparepi vo, bhikkhave, satta aparihāniye dhamme desessāmi, taṁ suṇātha, sādhukaṁ manasikarotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: I will teach you seven more principles that prevent decline. …

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṁ.
Bhagavā etadavoca:
“Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū aniccasaññaṁ bhāvessanti …pe…
translation-en-sujato: As long as the mendicants develop the perceptions of impermanence …

root-pli-ms: anattasaññaṁ bhāvessanti …
translation-en-sujato: not-self …

root-pli-ms: asubhasaññaṁ bhāvessanti …
translation-en-sujato: ugliness …

root-pli-ms: ādīnavasaññaṁ bhāvessanti …
translation-en-sujato: drawbacks …

root-pli-ms: pahānasaññaṁ bhāvessanti …
translation-en-sujato: giving up …

root-pli-ms: virāgasaññaṁ bhāvessanti …
translation-en-sujato: fading away …

root-pli-ms: nirodhasaññaṁ bhāvessanti, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
translation-en-sujato: cessation, they can expect growth, not decline.

root-pli-ms: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, ime satta aparihāniyā dhammā bhikkhūsu ṭhassanti, imesu ca sattasu aparihāniyesu dhammesu bhikkhū sandississanti, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni.
translation-en-sujato: As long as these seven principles that prevent decline last among the mendicants, and as long as the mendicants are seen following them, they can expect growth, not decline.

root-pli-ms: Cha vo, bhikkhave, aparihāniye dhamme desessāmi, taṁ suṇātha, sādhukaṁ manasikarotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: I will teach you six principles that prevent decline. …

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṁ.
Bhagavā etadavoca:
“Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū mettaṁ kāyakammaṁ paccupaṭṭhāpessanti sabrahmacārīsu āvi ceva raho ca, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni. (1)
translation-en-sujato: As long as the mendicants consistently treat their spiritual companions with bodily kindness …

root-pli-ms: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū mettaṁ vacīkammaṁ paccupaṭṭhāpessanti …pe… (2)
translation-en-sujato: verbal kindness …

root-pli-ms: mettaṁ manokammaṁ paccupaṭṭhāpessanti sabrahmacārīsu āvi ceva raho ca, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni. (3)
translation-en-sujato: and mental kindness both in public and in private, they can expect growth, not decline.

root-pli-ms: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū, ye te lābhā dhammikā dhammaladdhā antamaso pattapariyāpannamattampi tathārūpehi lābhehi appaṭivibhattabhogī bhavissanti sīlavantehi sabrahmacārīhi sādhāraṇabhogī, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni. (4)
translation-en-sujato: As long as the mendicants share without reservation any material possessions they have gained by legitimate means, even the food placed in the alms-bowl, using them in common with their ethical spiritual companions, they can expect growth, not decline.

root-pli-ms: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū yāni tāni sīlāni akhaṇḍāni acchiddāni asabalāni akammāsāni bhujissāni viññūpasatthāni aparāmaṭṭhāni samādhisaṁvattanikāni tathārūpesu sīlesu sīlasāmaññagatā viharissanti sabrahmacārīhi āvi ceva raho ca, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni. (5)
translation-en-sujato: As long as the mendicants live according to the precepts shared with their spiritual companions, both in public and in private—such precepts as are unbroken, impeccable, spotless, and unmarred, liberating, praised by sensible people, not mistaken, and leading to immersion—they can expect growth, not decline.

root-pli-ms: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū yāyaṁ diṭṭhi ariyā niyyānikā, niyyāti takkarassa sammā dukkhakkhayāya, tathārūpāya diṭṭhiyā diṭṭhisāmaññagatā viharissanti sabrahmacārīhi āvi ceva raho ca, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihāni. (6)
translation-en-sujato: As long as the mendicants live according to the view shared with their spiritual companions, both in public and in private—the view that is noble and emancipating, and leads one who practices it to the complete end of suffering—they can expect growth, not decline.

root-pli-ms: Yāvakīvañca, bhikkhave, ime cha aparihāniyā dhammā bhikkhūsu ṭhassanti, imesu ca chasu aparihāniyesu dhammesu bhikkhū sandississanti, vuddhiyeva, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ pāṭikaṅkhā, no parihānī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: As long as these six principles that prevent decline last among the mendicants, and as long as the mendicants are seen following them, they can expect growth, not decline.”

root-pli-ms: Tatra sudaṁ bhagavā rājagahe viharanto gijjhakūṭe pabbate etadeva bahulaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ karoti:
translation-en-sujato: And while staying there at the Vulture’s Peak the Buddha often gave this Dhamma talk to the mendicants:
reference: ms7D_288, msdiv142, pts-cs1.12, sc46, sya10.96, vri2.64

root-pli-ms: “iti sīlaṁ, iti samādhi, iti paññā.
translation-en-sujato: “Such is ethics, such is immersion, such is wisdom.

root-pli-ms: Sīlaparibhāvito samādhi mahapphalo hoti mahānisaṁso.
translation-en-sujato: When immersion is imbued with ethics it’s very fruitful and beneficial.

root-pli-ms: Samādhiparibhāvitā paññā mahapphalā hoti mahānisaṁsā.
translation-en-sujato: When wisdom is imbued with immersion it’s very fruitful and beneficial.

root-pli-ms: Paññāparibhāvitaṁ cittaṁ sammadeva āsavehi vimuccati, seyyathidaṁ—
translation-en-sujato: When the mind is imbued with wisdom it is rightly freed from the defilements, namely,

root-pli-ms: kāmāsavā, bhavāsavā, avijjāsavā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: the defilements of sensuality, desire to be reborn, and ignorance.”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā rājagahe yathābhirantaṁ viharitvā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: When the Buddha had stayed in Rājagaha as long as he wished, he addressed Venerable Ānanda,
reference: cck10.103, csp1ed7.69, csp2ed7.69, mc10.74, ms7D_289, msdiv143, ndp7.66, pts-cs1.13, sc47

root-pli-ms: “āyāmānanda, yena ambalaṭṭhikā tenupasaṅkamissāmā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Come, Ānanda, let’s go to Ambalaṭṭhikā.”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paccassosi.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” Ānanda replied.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ yena ambalaṭṭhikā tadavasari.
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha together with a large Saṅgha of mendicants arrived at Ambalaṭṭhikā,

root-pli-ms: Tatra sudaṁ bhagavā ambalaṭṭhikāyaṁ viharati rājāgārake.
translation-en-sujato: where he stayed in the royal rest-house.

root-pli-ms: Tatrāpi sudaṁ bhagavā ambalaṭṭhikāyaṁ viharanto rājāgārake etadeva bahulaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ karoti:
translation-en-sujato: And while staying there, too, he often gave this Dhamma talk to the mendicants:

root-pli-ms: “iti sīlaṁ iti samādhi iti paññā.
translation-en-sujato: “Such is ethics, such is immersion, such is wisdom.

root-pli-ms: Sīlaparibhāvito samādhi mahapphalo hoti mahānisaṁso.
translation-en-sujato: When immersion is imbued with ethics it’s very fruitful and beneficial.

root-pli-ms: Samādhiparibhāvitā paññā mahapphalā hoti mahānisaṁsā.
translation-en-sujato: When wisdom is imbued with immersion it’s very fruitful and beneficial.

root-pli-ms: Paññāparibhāvitaṁ cittaṁ sammadeva āsavehi vimuccati, seyyathidaṁ—
translation-en-sujato: When the mind is imbued with wisdom it is rightly freed from the defilements, namely,

root-pli-ms: kāmāsavā, bhavāsavā, avijjāsavā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: the defilements of sensuality, desire to be reborn, and ignorance.”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā ambalaṭṭhikāyaṁ yathābhirantaṁ viharitvā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: When the Buddha had stayed in Ambalaṭṭhikā as long as he wished, he addressed Venerable Ānanda,

root-pli-ms: “āyāmānanda, yena nāḷandā tenupasaṅkamissāmā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Come, Ānanda, let’s go to Nāḷandā.”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paccassosi.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” Ānanda replied.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ yena nāḷandā tadavasari,
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha together with a large Saṅgha of mendicants arrived at Nāḷandā,

root-pli-ms: tatra sudaṁ bhagavā nāḷandāyaṁ viharati pāvārikambavane.
translation-en-sujato: where he stayed in Pāvārika’s mango grove.

root-pli-ms: 4. Sāriputtasīhanāda
translation-en-sujato: 4. Sāriputta’s Lion’s Roar

root-pli-ms: Atha kho āyasmā sāriputto yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho āyasmā sāriputto bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: Then Sāriputta went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him,
reference: cck10.104, ms7D_291, msdiv145, pts-cs1.16, pts-vp-pli2.82, sc49

root-pli-ms: “evaṁ pasanno ahaṁ, bhante, bhagavati;
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, I have such confidence in the Buddha that

root-pli-ms: na cāhu na ca bhavissati na cetarahi vijjati añño samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā bhagavatā bhiyyobhiññataro yadidaṁ sambodhiyan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: I believe there’s no other ascetic or brahmin—whether past, future, or present—whose direct knowledge is superior to the Buddha when it comes to awakening.”

root-pli-ms: “Uḷārā kho te ayaṁ, sāriputta, āsabhī vācā bhāsitā, ekaṁso gahito, sīhanādo nadito:
translation-en-sujato: “That’s a grand and dramatic statement, Sāriputta. You’ve roared a definitive, categorical lion’s roar, saying:

root-pli-ms: ‘evaṁpasanno ahaṁ, bhante, bhagavati;
translation-en-sujato: ‘I have such confidence in the Buddha that

root-pli-ms: na cāhu na ca bhavissati na cetarahi vijjati añño samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā bhagavatā bhiyyobhiññataro yadidaṁ sambodhiyan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: I believe there’s no other ascetic or brahmin—whether past, future, or present—whose direct knowledge is superior to the Buddha when it comes to awakening.’

root-pli-ms: Kiṁ te, sāriputta, ye te ahesuṁ atītamaddhānaṁ arahanto sammāsambuddhā, sabbe te bhagavanto cetasā ceto paricca viditā:
translation-en-sujato: What about all the perfected ones, the fully awakened Buddhas who lived in the past? Have you comprehended their minds to know that
variant-pli-ms: te → kiṁ nu (sya-all, km, pts1ed, mr)

root-pli-ms: ‘evaṁsīlā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ itipi, evaṁdhammā evaṁpaññā evaṁvihārī evaṁvimuttā te bhagavanto ahesuṁ itipī’”ti?
translation-en-sujato: those Buddhas had such ethics, or such qualities, or such wisdom, or such meditation, or such freedom?”

root-pli-ms: “No hetaṁ, bhante”.
translation-en-sujato: “No, sir.”

root-pli-ms: “Kiṁ pana te, sāriputta, ye te bhavissanti anāgatamaddhānaṁ arahanto sammāsambuddhā, sabbe te bhagavanto cetasā ceto paricca viditā:
translation-en-sujato: “And what about all the perfected ones, the fully awakened Buddhas who will live in the future? Have you comprehended their minds to know that
variant-pli-ms: pana te → kiṁ pana (sya-all, km, pts1ed, mr)

root-pli-ms: ‘evaṁsīlā te bhagavanto bhavissanti itipi, evaṁdhammā evaṁpaññā evaṁvihārī evaṁvimuttā te bhagavanto bhavissanti itipī’”ti?
translation-en-sujato: those Buddhas will have such ethics, or such qualities, or such wisdom, or such meditation, or such freedom?”

root-pli-ms: “No hetaṁ, bhante”.
translation-en-sujato: “No, sir.”

root-pli-ms: “Kiṁ pana te, sāriputta, ahaṁ etarahi arahaṁ sammāsambuddho cetasā ceto paricca vidito:
translation-en-sujato: “And what about me, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha at present? Have you comprehended my mind to know that

root-pli-ms: ‘evaṁsīlo bhagavā itipi, evaṁdhammo evaṁpañño evaṁvihārī evaṁvimutto bhagavā itipī’”ti?
translation-en-sujato: I have such ethics, or such teachings, or such wisdom, or such meditation, or such freedom?”

root-pli-ms: “No hetaṁ, bhante”.
translation-en-sujato: “No, sir.”

root-pli-ms: “Ettha ca hi te, sāriputta, atītānāgatapaccuppannesu arahantesu sammāsambuddhesu cetopariyañāṇaṁ natthi.
translation-en-sujato: “Well then, Sāriputta, given that you don’t comprehend the minds of Buddhas past, future, or present,

root-pli-ms: Atha kiñcarahi te ayaṁ, sāriputta, uḷārā āsabhī vācā bhāsitā, ekaṁso gahito, sīhanādo nadito:
translation-en-sujato: what exactly are you doing, making such a grand and dramatic statement, roaring such a definitive, categorical lion’s roar?”

root-pli-ms: ‘evaṁpasanno ahaṁ, bhante, bhagavati; na cāhu na ca bhavissati na cetarahi vijjati añño samaṇo vā brāhmaṇo vā bhagavatā bhiyyobhiññataro yadidaṁ sambodhiyan’”ti?
“Na kho me, bhante, atītānāgatapaccuppannesu arahantesu sammāsambuddhesu cetopariyañāṇaṁ atthi,
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, though I don’t comprehend the minds of Buddhas past, future, and present,

root-pli-ms: api ca me dhammanvayo vidito.
translation-en-sujato: still I understand this by inference from the teaching.

root-pli-ms: Seyyathāpi, bhante, rañño paccantimaṁ nagaraṁ daḷhuddhāpaṁ daḷhapākāratoraṇaṁ ekadvāraṁ,
translation-en-sujato: Suppose there was a king’s frontier citadel with fortified embankments, ramparts, and arches, and a single gate.

root-pli-ms: tatrassa dovāriko paṇḍito viyatto medhāvī aññātānaṁ nivāretā ñātānaṁ pavesetā.
translation-en-sujato: And it has a gatekeeper who is astute, competent, and intelligent. He keeps strangers out and lets known people in.

root-pli-ms: So tassa nagarassa samantā anupariyāyapathaṁ anukkamamāno na passeyya pākārasandhiṁ vā pākāravivaraṁ vā, antamaso biḷāranikkhamanamattampi.
translation-en-sujato: As he walks around the patrol path, he doesn’t see a hole or cleft in the wall, not even one big enough for a cat to slip out.

root-pli-ms: Tassa evamassa:
translation-en-sujato: He thinks:
variant-pli-ms: Tassa evamassa → na passeyya tassa evamassa (sya-all, km)

root-pli-ms: ‘ye kho keci oḷārikā pāṇā imaṁ nagaraṁ pavisanti vā nikkhamanti vā, sabbe te imināva dvārena pavisanti vā nikkhamanti vā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Whatever sizable creatures enter or leave the citadel, all of them do so via this gate.’

root-pli-ms: Evameva kho me, bhante, dhammanvayo vidito:
translation-en-sujato: In the same way, I understand this by inference from the teaching:

root-pli-ms: ‘ye te, bhante, ahesuṁ atītamaddhānaṁ arahanto sammāsambuddhā, sabbe te bhagavanto pañca nīvaraṇe pahāya cetaso upakkilese paññāya dubbalīkaraṇe catūsu satipaṭṭhānesu supatiṭṭhitacittā sattabojjhaṅge yathābhūtaṁ bhāvetvā anuttaraṁ sammāsambodhiṁ abhisambujjhiṁsu.
translation-en-sujato: ‘All the perfected ones, fully awakened Buddhas—whether past, future, or present—give up the five hindrances, corruptions of the heart that weaken wisdom. Their mind is firmly established in the four kinds of mindfulness meditation. They correctly develop the seven awakening factors. And they wake up to the supreme perfect awakening.’”

root-pli-ms: Yepi te, bhante, bhavissanti anāgatamaddhānaṁ arahanto sammāsambuddhā, sabbe te bhagavanto pañca nīvaraṇe pahāya cetaso upakkilese paññāya dubbalīkaraṇe catūsu satipaṭṭhānesu supatiṭṭhitacittā satta bojjhaṅge yathābhūtaṁ bhāvetvā anuttaraṁ sammāsambodhiṁ abhisambujjhissanti.

Bhagavāpi, bhante, etarahi arahaṁ sammāsambuddho pañca nīvaraṇe pahāya cetaso upakkilese paññāya dubbalīkaraṇe catūsu satipaṭṭhānesu supatiṭṭhitacitto satta bojjhaṅge yathābhūtaṁ bhāvetvā anuttaraṁ sammāsambodhiṁ abhisambuddho’”ti.
Tatrapi sudaṁ bhagavā nāḷandāyaṁ viharanto pāvārikambavane etadeva bahulaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ karoti:
translation-en-sujato: And while staying at Nāḷandā, too, the Buddha often gave this Dhamma talk to the mendicants:
reference: bj8.132, ms7D_297, msdiv147, ndp7.68, pts-cs1.18, pts-vp-pli2.84, sc55

root-pli-ms: “iti sīlaṁ, iti samādhi, iti paññā.
translation-en-sujato: “Such is ethics, such is immersion, such is wisdom.

root-pli-ms: Sīlaparibhāvito samādhi mahapphalo hoti mahānisaṁso.
translation-en-sujato: When immersion is imbued with ethics it’s very fruitful and beneficial.

root-pli-ms: Samādhiparibhāvitā paññā mahapphalā hoti mahānisaṁsā.
translation-en-sujato: When wisdom is imbued with immersion it’s very fruitful and beneficial.

root-pli-ms: Paññāparibhāvitaṁ cittaṁ sammadeva āsavehi vimuccati, seyyathidaṁ—
translation-en-sujato: When the mind is imbued with wisdom it is rightly freed from the defilements, namely,

root-pli-ms: kāmāsavā, bhavāsavā, avijjāsavā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: the defilements of sensuality, desire to be reborn, and ignorance.”

root-pli-ms: 5. Dussīlaādīnava
translation-en-sujato: 5. The Drawbacks of Unethical Conduct

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā nāḷandāyaṁ yathābhirantaṁ viharitvā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: When the Buddha had stayed in Nāḷandā as long as he wished, he addressed Venerable Ānanda,

root-pli-ms: “āyāmānanda, yena pāṭaligāmo tenupasaṅkamissāmā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Come, Ānanda, let’s go to Pāṭaligāma.”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paccassosi.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” Ānanda replied.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ yena pāṭaligāmo tadavasari.
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha together with a large Saṅgha of mendicants arrived at Pāṭaligāma.

root-pli-ms: Assosuṁ kho pāṭaligāmikā upāsakā: “bhagavā kira pāṭaligāmaṁ anuppatto”ti.
translation-en-sujato: The lay followers of Pāṭaligāma heard that he had arrived.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho pāṭaligāmikā upāsakā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu. Ekamantaṁ nisinnā kho pāṭaligāmikā upāsakā bhagavantaṁ etadavocuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: So they went to see him, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him,

root-pli-ms: “adhivāsetu no, bhante, bhagavā āvasathāgāran”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, please consent to come to our guest house.”

root-pli-ms: Adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena.
translation-en-sujato: The Buddha consented in silence.
comment-en-sujato: Brahmali: tuṇhībhāvena is instrumental, suggesting that the silence itself constituted the consent.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho pāṭaligāmikā upāsakā bhagavato adhivāsanaṁ viditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā yena āvasathāgāraṁ tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā sabbasanthariṁ āvasathāgāraṁ santharitvā āsanāni paññapetvā udakamaṇikaṁ patiṭṭhāpetvā telapadīpaṁ āropetvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṁsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhaṁsu. Ekamantaṁ ṭhitā kho pāṭaligāmikā upāsakā bhagavantaṁ etadavocuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: Then, knowing that the Buddha had consented, the lay followers of Pāṭaligāma got up from their seat, bowed, and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on their right. Then they went to the guest house, where they spread carpets all over, prepared seats, set up a water jar, and placed a lamp. Then they went back to the Buddha, bowed, stood to one side, and told him of their preparations, saying:
variant-pli-ms: sabbasanthariṁ → sabbasantharitaṁ santhataṁ (sya-all, km); sabbasanthariṁ santhataṁ (mr)

root-pli-ms: “sabbasantharisanthataṁ, bhante, āvasathāgāraṁ, āsanāni paññattāni, udakamaṇiko patiṭṭhāpito, telapadīpo āropito;
yassadāni, bhante, bhagavā kālaṁ maññatī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Please, sir, come at your convenience.”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā sāyanhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghena yena āvasathāgāraṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā pāde pakkhāletvā āvasathāgāraṁ pavisitvā majjhimaṁ thambhaṁ nissāya puratthābhimukho nisīdi.
translation-en-sujato: In the morning, the Buddha robed up and, taking his bowl and robe, went to the guest house together with the Saṅgha of mendicants. Having washed his feet he entered the guest house and sat against the central column facing east.

root-pli-ms: Bhikkhusaṅghopi kho pāde pakkhāletvā āvasathāgāraṁ pavisitvā pacchimaṁ bhittiṁ nissāya puratthābhimukho nisīdi bhagavantameva purakkhatvā.
translation-en-sujato: The Saṅgha of mendicants also washed their feet, entered the guest house, and sat against the west wall facing east, with the Buddha right in front of them.

root-pli-ms: Pāṭaligāmikāpi kho upāsakā pāde pakkhāletvā āvasathāgāraṁ pavisitvā puratthimaṁ bhittiṁ nissāya pacchimābhimukhā nisīdiṁsu bhagavantameva purakkhatvā.
translation-en-sujato: The lay followers of Pāṭaligāma also washed their feet, entered the guest house, and sat against the east wall facing west, with the Buddha right in front of them.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā pāṭaligāmike upāsake āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha addressed them:
reference: bj8.134, ms7D_300, msdiv149, ndp7.69, pts-cs1.23, sc57

root-pli-ms: “pañcime, gahapatayo, ādīnavā dussīlassa sīlavipattiyā.
translation-en-sujato: “Householders, there are these five drawbacks for an unethical person because of their failure in ethics.

root-pli-ms: Katame pañca?
translation-en-sujato: What five?

root-pli-ms: Idha, gahapatayo, dussīlo sīlavipanno pamādādhikaraṇaṁ mahatiṁ bhogajāniṁ nigacchati.
translation-en-sujato: Firstly, an unethical person loses substantial wealth on account of negligence.

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ paṭhamo ādīnavo dussīlassa sīlavipattiyā.
translation-en-sujato: This is the first drawback for an unethical person because of their failure in ethics.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, gahapatayo, dussīlassa sīlavipannassa pāpako kittisaddo abbhuggacchati.
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, an unethical person gets a bad reputation.

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ dutiyo ādīnavo dussīlassa sīlavipattiyā.
translation-en-sujato: This is the second drawback.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, gahapatayo, dussīlo sīlavipanno yaññadeva parisaṁ upasaṅkamati—yadi khattiyaparisaṁ yadi brāhmaṇaparisaṁ yadi gahapatiparisaṁ yadi samaṇaparisaṁ—avisārado upasaṅkamati maṅkubhūto.
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, an unethical person enters any kind of assembly timid and embarrassed, whether it’s an assembly of aristocrats, brahmins, householders, or ascetics.

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ tatiyo ādīnavo dussīlassa sīlavipattiyā.
translation-en-sujato: This is the third drawback.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, gahapatayo, dussīlo sīlavipanno sammūḷho kālaṁ karoti.
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, an unethical person dies feeling lost.

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ catuttho ādīnavo dussīlassa sīlavipattiyā.
translation-en-sujato: This is the fourth drawback.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, gahapatayo, dussīlo sīlavipanno kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapajjati.
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, an unethical person, when their body breaks up, after death, is reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ pañcamo ādīnavo dussīlassa sīlavipattiyā.
translation-en-sujato: This is the fifth drawback.

root-pli-ms: Ime kho, gahapatayo, pañca ādīnavā dussīlassa sīlavipattiyā.
translation-en-sujato: These are the five drawbacks for an unethical person because of their failure in ethics.

root-pli-ms: 6. Sīlavantaānisaṁsa
translation-en-sujato: 6. The Benefits of Ethical Conduct

root-pli-ms: Pañcime, gahapatayo, ānisaṁsā sīlavato sīlasampadāya.
translation-en-sujato: There are these five benefits for an ethical person because of their accomplishment in ethics.
reference: dr10.103, ms7D_305, msdiv150, pts-cs1.24, pts-vp-pli2.86, sc62, sya10.102

root-pli-ms: Katame pañca?
translation-en-sujato: What five?

root-pli-ms: Idha, gahapatayo, sīlavā sīlasampanno appamādādhikaraṇaṁ mahantaṁ bhogakkhandhaṁ adhigacchati.
translation-en-sujato: Firstly, an ethical person gains substantial wealth on account of diligence.

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ paṭhamo ānisaṁso sīlavato sīlasampadāya.
translation-en-sujato: This is the first benefit.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, gahapatayo, sīlavato sīlasampannassa kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbhuggacchati.
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, an ethical person gets a good reputation.

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ dutiyo ānisaṁso sīlavato sīlasampadāya.
translation-en-sujato: This is the second benefit.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, gahapatayo, sīlavā sīlasampanno yaññadeva parisaṁ upasaṅkamati—yadi khattiyaparisaṁ yadi brāhmaṇaparisaṁ yadi gahapatiparisaṁ yadi samaṇaparisaṁ visārado upasaṅkamati amaṅkubhūto.
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, an ethical person enters any kind of assembly bold and self-assured, whether it’s an assembly of aristocrats, brahmins, householders, or ascetics.

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ tatiyo ānisaṁso sīlavato sīlasampadāya.
translation-en-sujato: This is the third benefit.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, gahapatayo, sīlavā sīlasampanno asammūḷho kālaṁ karoti.
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, an ethical person dies not feeling lost.

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ catuttho ānisaṁso sīlavato sīlasampadāya.
translation-en-sujato: This is the fourth benefit.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, gahapatayo, sīlavā sīlasampanno kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjati.
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, when an ethical person’s body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ pañcamo ānisaṁso sīlavato sīlasampadāya.
translation-en-sujato: This is the fifth benefit.

root-pli-ms: Ime kho, gahapatayo, pañca ānisaṁsā sīlavato sīlasampadāyā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: These are the five benefits for an ethical person because of their accomplishment in ethics.”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā pāṭaligāmike upāsake bahudeva rattiṁ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṁsetvā uyyojesi:
translation-en-sujato: The Buddha spent most of the night educating, encouraging, firing up, and inspiring the lay followers of Pāṭaligāma with a Dhamma talk. Then he dismissed them,

root-pli-ms: “abhikkantā kho, gahapatayo, ratti, yassadāni tumhe kālaṁ maññathā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “The night is getting late, householders. Please go at your convenience.”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho pāṭaligāmikā upāsakā bhagavato paṭissutvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā pakkamiṁsu.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” replied the lay followers of Pāṭaligāma. They got up from their seat, bowed, and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on their right, before leaving.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā acirapakkantesu pāṭaligāmikesu upāsakesu suññāgāraṁ pāvisi.
translation-en-sujato: Soon after they left the Buddha entered a private cubicle.
comment-en-sujato: Brahmali: Suññāgāra normally means an empty dwelling, but here the context suggests another meaning is intended. DA.1.151 says: Suññāgāranti pāṭiyekkaṁ suññāgāraṁ nāma natthi, tattheva pana ekapasse sāṇipākārena parikkhipitvā–‘idha satthā vissamissatī’ti mañcakaṁ paññapesuṁ, “Suññāgāra: it is not a distinct (dwelling) that is called a suññāgāra. But they prepared a bed to one side right there, having surrounded it with a curtain, thinking, ‘The Teacher will rest here’.”

root-pli-ms: 7. Pāṭaliputtanagaramāpana
translation-en-sujato: 7. Building a Citadel

root-pli-ms: Tena kho pana samayena sunidhavassakārā magadhamahāmattā pāṭaligāme nagaraṁ māpenti vajjīnaṁ paṭibāhāya.
translation-en-sujato: Now at that time the Magadhan ministers Sunidha and Vassakāra were building a citadel at Pāṭaligāma to keep the Vajjis out.
comment-en-sujato: Note nagara here, as often, means “citadel, fortress”, not “city”.
reference: csp1ed7.74, csp2ed7.74, ms7D_311, msdiv152, pts-cs1.26, pts-vp-pli2.87, sc68, vri2.69

root-pli-ms: Tena samayena sambahulā devatāyo sahasseva pāṭaligāme vatthūni pariggaṇhanti.
translation-en-sujato: At that time thousands of deities were taking possession of building sites in Pāṭaligāma.
variant-pli-ms: sahasseva → sahassasahasseva (bj udānaṭṭhakathā); sahassasseva (pts1ed, mr); sahassaseva (ṭīkāyaṁ pāṭhantaraṁ)

root-pli-ms: Yasmiṁ padese mahesakkhā devatā vatthūni pariggaṇhanti, mahesakkhānaṁ tattha raññaṁ rājamahāmattānaṁ cittāni namanti nivesanāni māpetuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Illustrious rulers or royal ministers inclined to build houses at sites possessed by illustrious deities.

root-pli-ms: Yasmiṁ padese majjhimā devatā vatthūni pariggaṇhanti, majjhimānaṁ tattha raññaṁ rājamahāmattānaṁ cittāni namanti nivesanāni māpetuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Middling rulers or royal ministers inclined to build houses at sites possessed by middling deities.

root-pli-ms: Yasmiṁ padese nīcā devatā vatthūni pariggaṇhanti, nīcānaṁ tattha raññaṁ rājamahāmattānaṁ cittāni namanti nivesanāni māpetuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Lesser rulers or royal ministers inclined to build houses at sites possessed by lesser deities.

root-pli-ms: Addasā kho bhagavā dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena tā devatāyo sahasseva pāṭaligāme vatthūni pariggaṇhantiyo.
translation-en-sujato: With clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman, the Buddha saw those deities taking possession of building sites in Pāṭaligāma.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā rattiyā paccūsasamayaṁ paccuṭṭhāya āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: The Buddha rose at the crack of dawn and addressed Ānanda,

root-pli-ms: “Ke nu kho, ānanda, pāṭaligāme nagaraṁ māpentī”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “Ānanda, who is building a citadel at Pāṭaligāma?”
variant-pli-ms: kho → ko nu kho (bj, sya-all, km, pts1ed, mr) | māpentī”ti → māpeti (si); māpetīti (sya-all, km, pts1ed, mr)

root-pli-ms: “Sunidhavassakārā, bhante, magadhamahāmattā pāṭaligāme nagaraṁ māpenti vajjīnaṁ paṭibāhāyā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, the Magadhan ministers Sunidha and Vassakāra are building a citadel to keep the Vajjis out.”

root-pli-ms: “Seyyathāpi, ānanda, devehi tāvatiṁsehi saddhiṁ mantetvā;
translation-en-sujato: “It’s as if they were building the citadel in consultation with the gods of the Thirty-Three.

root-pli-ms: evameva kho, ānanda, sunidhavassakārā magadhamahāmattā pāṭaligāme nagaraṁ māpenti vajjīnaṁ paṭibāhāya.
Idhāhaṁ, ānanda, addasaṁ dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena sambahulā devatāyo sahasseva pāṭaligāme vatthūni pariggaṇhantiyo.
translation-en-sujato: With clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman, I saw those deities taking possession of building sites.

root-pli-ms: Yasmiṁ, ānanda, padese mahesakkhā devatā vatthūni pariggaṇhanti, mahesakkhānaṁ tattha raññaṁ rājamahāmattānaṁ cittāni namanti nivesanāni māpetuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Illustrious rulers or royal ministers inclined to build houses at sites possessed by illustrious deities.

root-pli-ms: Yasmiṁ padese majjhimā devatā vatthūni pariggaṇhanti, majjhimānaṁ tattha raññaṁ rājamahāmattānaṁ cittāni namanti nivesanāni māpetuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Middling rulers or royal ministers inclined to build houses at sites possessed by middling deities.

root-pli-ms: Yasmiṁ padese nīcā devatā vatthūni pariggaṇhanti, nīcānaṁ tattha raññaṁ rājamahāmattānaṁ cittāni namanti nivesanāni māpetuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Lesser rulers or royal ministers inclined to build houses at sites possessed by lesser deities.

root-pli-ms: Yāvatā, ānanda, ariyaṁ āyatanaṁ yāvatā vaṇippatho idaṁ agganagaraṁ bhavissati pāṭaliputtaṁ puṭabhedanaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: As far as the civilized region extends, as far as the trading zone extends, this will be the chief city: the Pāṭaliputta trade center.
comment-en-sujato: Comm. is surely correct here: putabhedana refers to the breaking of packages, i.e. a trade center.

root-pli-ms: Pāṭaliputtassa kho, ānanda, tayo antarāyā bhavissanti—
translation-en-sujato: But Pāṭaliputta will face three threats:

root-pli-ms: aggito vā udakato vā mithubhedā vā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: from fire, flood, and dissension.”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho sunidhavassakārā magadhamahāmattā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodiṁsu,
translation-en-sujato: Then the Magadhan ministers Sunidha and Vassakāra approached the Buddha, and exchanged greetings with him.
reference: cck10.112, csp1ed7.75, csp2ed7.75, dr10.106, ms7D_313, msdiv153, pts-cs1.29, sc70

root-pli-ms: sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhaṁsu, ekamantaṁ ṭhitā kho sunidhavassakārā magadhamahāmattā bhagavantaṁ etadavocuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, they stood to one side and said,

root-pli-ms: “adhivāsetu no bhavaṁ gotamo ajjatanāya bhattaṁ saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Would Master Gotama together with the mendicant Saṅgha please accept today’s meal from me?”

root-pli-ms: Adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena.
translation-en-sujato: The Buddha consented in silence.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho sunidhavassakārā magadhamahāmattā bhagavato adhivāsanaṁ viditvā yena sako āvasatho tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā sake āvasathe paṇītaṁ khādanīyaṁ bhojanīyaṁ paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavato kālaṁ ārocāpesuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: Then, knowing that the Buddha had consented, they went to their own guest house, where they had a variety of delicious foods prepared. Then they had the Buddha informed of the time, saying,

root-pli-ms: “kālo, bho gotama, niṭṭhitaṁ bhattan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Itʼs time, Master Gotama, the meal is ready.”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghena yena sunidhavassakārānaṁ magadhamahāmattānaṁ āvasatho tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, went to their guest house together with the mendicant Saṅgha, where he sat on the seat spread out.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho sunidhavassakārā magadhamahāmattā buddhappamukhaṁ bhikkhusaṅghaṁ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappesuṁ sampavāresuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Then Sunidha and Vassakāra served and satisfied the mendicant Saṅgha headed by the Buddha with their own hands with a variety of delicious foods.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho sunidhavassakārā magadhamahāmattā bhagavantaṁ bhuttāviṁ onītapattapāṇiṁ aññataraṁ nīcaṁ āsanaṁ gahetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu.
translation-en-sujato: When the Buddha had eaten and washed his hand and bowl, Sunidha and Vassakāra took a low seat and sat to one side.

root-pli-ms: Ekamantaṁ nisinne kho sunidhavassakāre magadhamahāmatte bhagavā imāhi gāthāhi anumodi:
translation-en-sujato: The Buddha expressed his appreciation with these verses:

root-pli-ms: “Yasmiṁ padese kappeti,
translation-en-sujato: “In the place he makes his dwelling,

root-pli-ms: vāsaṁ paṇḍitajātiyo;
translation-en-sujato: having fed the astute

root-pli-ms: Sīlavantettha bhojetvā,
