translation-en-sujato: and the virtuous here,

root-pli-ms: saññate brahmacārayo.
translation-en-sujato: the restrained spiritual practitioners,

root-pli-ms: Yā tattha devatā āsuṁ,
translation-en-sujato: he should dedicate an offering

root-pli-ms: tāsaṁ dakkhiṇamādise;
translation-en-sujato: to the deities there.

root-pli-ms: Tā pūjitā pūjayanti,
translation-en-sujato: Venerated, they venerate him;

root-pli-ms: mānitā mānayanti naṁ.
translation-en-sujato: honored, they honor him.

root-pli-ms: Tato naṁ anukampanti,
translation-en-sujato: After that they have compassion for him,

root-pli-ms: mātā puttaṁva orasaṁ;
translation-en-sujato: like a mother for the child at her breast.

root-pli-ms: Devatānukampito poso,
translation-en-sujato: A man beloved of the deities

root-pli-ms: sadā bhadrāni passatī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: always sees nice things.”
comment-en-sujato: I think it’s unlikely bhadrani means “auspcious'. Most commonly it” s used to describe chariots. And the similar line at AN 4.67 is applied to animals.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā sunidhavassakāre magadhamahāmatte imāhi gāthāhi anumoditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
translation-en-sujato: When the Buddha had expressed his appreciation to Sunidha and Vassakāra with these verses, he got up from his seat and left.

root-pli-ms: Tena kho pana samayena sunidhavassakārā magadhamahāmattā bhagavantaṁ piṭṭhito piṭṭhito anubandhā honti:
translation-en-sujato: Sunidha and Vassakāra followed behind the Buddha, thinking,
reference: csp1ed7.76, csp2ed7.76, dr10.107, ms7D_319, msdiv154, ndp7.72, pts-cs1.32, sc76

root-pli-ms: “yenajja samaṇo gotamo dvārena nikkhamissati, taṁ gotamadvāraṁ nāma bhavissati.
translation-en-sujato: “The gate through which the ascetic Gotama departs today shall be named the Gotama Gate.

root-pli-ms: Yena titthena gaṅgaṁ nadiṁ tarissati, taṁ gotamatitthaṁ nāma bhavissatī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: The ford at which he crosses the Ganges River shall be named the Gotama Ford.”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā yena dvārena nikkhami, taṁ gotamadvāraṁ nāma ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: Then the gate through which the Buddha departed was named the Gotama Gate.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā yena gaṅgā nadī tenupasaṅkami.
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha came to the Ganges River.

root-pli-ms: Tena kho pana samayena gaṅgā nadī pūrā hoti samatittikā kākapeyyā.
translation-en-sujato: Now at that time the Ganges was full to the brim so a crow could drink from it.

root-pli-ms: Appekacce manussā nāvaṁ pariyesanti, appekacce uḷumpaṁ pariyesanti, appekacce kullaṁ bandhanti apārā, pāraṁ gantukāmā.
translation-en-sujato: Wanting to cross from the near to the far shore, some people were seeking a boat, some a dinghy, while some were tying up a raft.
comment-en-sujato: Dinghy is a Hindi word: “any of various rowing or sailing boats used in sheltered waters along the Indian coasts to transport passengers and freight.”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā—seyyathāpi nāma balavā puriso samiñjitaṁ vā bāhaṁ pasāreyya, pasāritaṁ vā bāhaṁ samiñjeyya; evameva—gaṅgāya nadiyā orimatīre antarahito pārimatīre paccuṭṭhāsi saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghena.
translation-en-sujato: But, as easily as a strong person would extend or contract their arm, the Buddha, together with the mendicant Saṅgha, vanished from the near shore and landed on the far shore.
comment-en-sujato: Brahmali: Yes, it's a different verb, but from what I have seen they are used synonymously.

root-pli-ms: Addasā kho bhagavā te manusse appekacce nāvaṁ pariyesante appekacce uḷumpaṁ pariyesante appekacce kullaṁ bandhante apārā pāraṁ gantukāme.
translation-en-sujato: He saw all those people wanting to cross over.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā etamatthaṁ viditvā tāyaṁ velāyaṁ imaṁ udānaṁ udānesi:
translation-en-sujato: Knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:

root-pli-ms: “Ye taranti aṇṇavaṁ saraṁ,
translation-en-sujato: “Those who cross a river or stream
comment-en-sujato: annava can hardly mean “sea” here, if it is to be crossed with a bridge. Note the Sanskrit parallels at https://staging.suttacentral.net/sf245/san/waldschmidt#7.9 and https://staging.suttacentral.net/divy3/san/vaidya#034.012

root-pli-ms: Setuṁ katvāna visajja pallalāni;
translation-en-sujato: have built a bridge and left the marshes behind.

root-pli-ms: Kullañhi jano bandhati,
translation-en-sujato: While some people are still tying a raft,
variant-pli-ms: Kullañhi jano bandhati → kullaṁ hi jano pabandhati (bj, pts1ed, mr); kullaṁ jano ca bandhati (sya-all, km)

root-pli-ms: Tiṇṇā medhāvino janā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: intelligent people have crossed over.”

root-pli-ms: Paṭhamabhāṇavāro.
8. Ariyasaccakathā
translation-en-sujato: 8. Talk on the Noble Truths

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha said to Venerable Ānanda,

root-pli-ms: “āyāmānanda, yena koṭigāmo tenupasaṅkamissāmā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Come, Ānanda, let’s go to Koṭigāma.”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paccassosi.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” Ānanda replied.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ yena koṭigāmo tadavasari.
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha together with a large Saṅgha of mendicants arrived at Koṭigāma,

root-pli-ms: Tatra sudaṁ bhagavā koṭigāme viharati.
translation-en-sujato: and stayed there.

root-pli-ms: Tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: There he addressed the mendicants:

root-pli-ms: “Catunnaṁ, bhikkhave, ariyasaccānaṁ ananubodhā appaṭivedhā evamidaṁ dīghamaddhānaṁ sandhāvitaṁ saṁsaritaṁ mamañceva tumhākañca.
translation-en-sujato: “Mendicants, not understanding and not penetrating four noble truths, both you and I have wandered and transmigrated for such a very long time.

root-pli-ms: Katamesaṁ catunnaṁ?
translation-en-sujato: What four?

root-pli-ms: Dukkhassa, bhikkhave, ariyasaccassa ananubodhā appaṭivedhā evamidaṁ dīghamaddhānaṁ sandhāvitaṁ saṁsaritaṁ mamañceva tumhākañca.
translation-en-sujato: The noble truths of suffering,

root-pli-ms: Dukkhasamudayassa, bhikkhave, ariyasaccassa ananubodhā appaṭivedhā evamidaṁ dīghamaddhānaṁ sandhāvitaṁ saṁsaritaṁ mamañceva tumhākañca.
translation-en-sujato: the origin of suffering,

root-pli-ms: Dukkhanirodhassa, bhikkhave, ariyasaccassa ananubodhā appaṭivedhā evamidaṁ dīghamaddhānaṁ sandhāvitaṁ saṁsaritaṁ mamañceva tumhākañca.
translation-en-sujato: the cessation of suffering,

root-pli-ms: Dukkhanirodhagāminiyā paṭipadāya, bhikkhave, ariyasaccassa ananubodhā appaṭivedhā evamidaṁ dīghamaddhānaṁ sandhāvitaṁ saṁsaritaṁ mamañceva tumhākañca.
translation-en-sujato: and the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering.

root-pli-ms: Tayidaṁ, bhikkhave, dukkhaṁ ariyasaccaṁ anubuddhaṁ paṭividdhaṁ, dukkhasamudayaṁ ariyasaccaṁ anubuddhaṁ paṭividdhaṁ, dukkhanirodhaṁ ariyasaccaṁ anubuddhaṁ paṭividdhaṁ, dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā ariyasaccaṁ anubuddhaṁ paṭividdhaṁ, ucchinnā bhavataṇhā, khīṇā bhavanetti, natthi dāni punabbhavo”ti.
translation-en-sujato: These noble truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and the path have been understood and comprehended. Craving for continued existence has been cut off; the attachment to continued existence is ended; now there are no more future lives.”

root-pli-ms: Idamavoca bhagavā.
translation-en-sujato: That is what the Buddha said.

root-pli-ms: Idaṁ vatvāna sugato athāparaṁ etadavoca satthā:
translation-en-sujato: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:

root-pli-ms: “Catunnaṁ ariyasaccānaṁ,
translation-en-sujato: “Because of not truly seeing

root-pli-ms: yathābhūtaṁ adassanā;
translation-en-sujato: the four noble truths,

root-pli-ms: Saṁsitaṁ dīghamaddhānaṁ,
translation-en-sujato: we have transmigrated for a long time

root-pli-ms: tāsu tāsveva jātisu.
translation-en-sujato: from one rebirth to the next.

root-pli-ms: Tāni etāni diṭṭhāni,
translation-en-sujato: But now that these truths have been seen,

root-pli-ms: bhavanetti samūhatā;
translation-en-sujato: the attachment to rebirth is eradicated.

root-pli-ms: Ucchinnaṁ mūlaṁ dukkhassa,
translation-en-sujato: The root of suffering is cut off,

root-pli-ms: natthi dāni punabbhavo”ti.
translation-en-sujato: now there are no more future lives.”

root-pli-ms: Tatrapi sudaṁ bhagavā koṭigāme viharanto etadeva bahulaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ karoti:
translation-en-sujato: And while staying at Koṭigāma, too, the Buddha often gave this Dhamma talk to the mendicants:

root-pli-ms: “iti sīlaṁ, iti samādhi, iti paññā.
translation-en-sujato: “Such is ethics, such is immersion, such is wisdom.

root-pli-ms: Sīlaparibhāvito samādhi mahapphalo hoti mahānisaṁso.
translation-en-sujato: When immersion is imbued with ethics it’s very fruitful and beneficial.

root-pli-ms: Samādhiparibhāvitā paññā mahapphalā hoti mahānisaṁsā.
translation-en-sujato: When wisdom is imbued with immersion it’s very fruitful and beneficial.

root-pli-ms: Paññāparibhāvitaṁ cittaṁ sammadeva āsavehi vimuccati, seyyathidaṁ—
translation-en-sujato: When the mind is imbued with wisdom it is rightly freed from the defilements, namely,

root-pli-ms: kāmāsavā, bhavāsavā, avijjāsavā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: the defilements of sensuality, desire to be reborn, and ignorance.”

root-pli-ms: 9. Anāvattidhammasambodhiparāyaṇa
translation-en-sujato: 9. The Deaths in Nādika

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā koṭigāme yathābhirantaṁ viharitvā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: When the Buddha had stayed in Koṭigāma as long as he wished, he said to Ānanda,
reference: bj8.144, cck10.117, csp1ed7.78, csp2ed7.78, dr10.110, ms7D_330, msdiv156, ndp7.74, pts-cs2.5, pts-vp-pli2.92, sc86, sya10.109, vri2.72

root-pli-ms: “āyāmānanda, yena nātikā tenupaṅkamissāmā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Come, Ānanda, let’s go to Nādika.”
comment-en-sujato: The plural is used here, so strictly speaking “(the land of the) Nadikas”.

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paccassosi.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” Ānanda replied.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ yena nātikā tadavasari.
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha together with a large Saṅgha of mendicants arrived at Nādika,

root-pli-ms: Tatrapi sudaṁ bhagavā nātike viharati giñjakāvasathe.
translation-en-sujato: where he stayed in the brick house.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho āyasmā ānando yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him,

root-pli-ms: “sāḷho nāma, bhante, bhikkhu nātike kālaṅkato, tassa kā gati, ko abhisamparāyo?
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, the monk named Sāḷha has passed away in Nādika. Where has he been reborn in his next life?

root-pli-ms: Nandā nāma, bhante, bhikkhunī nātike kālaṅkatā, tassā kā gati, ko abhisamparāyo?
translation-en-sujato: The nun named Nandā,

root-pli-ms: Sudatto nāma, bhante, upāsako nātike kālaṅkato, tassa kā gati, ko abhisamparāyo?
translation-en-sujato: the layman named Sudatta,

root-pli-ms: Sujātā nāma, bhante, upāsikā nātike kālaṅkatā, tassā kā gati, ko abhisamparāyo?
translation-en-sujato: and the laywoman named Sujātā have passed away in Nādika. Where have they been reborn in the next life?

root-pli-ms: Kukkuṭo nāma, bhante, upāsako nātike kālaṅkato, tassa kā gati, ko abhisamparāyo?
translation-en-sujato: The laymen named Kakkaṭa,
comment-en-sujato: I spell the names the same as at SN 55.10.

root-pli-ms: Kāḷimbo nāma, bhante, upāsako …pe…
translation-en-sujato: Kaḷibha,

root-pli-ms: nikaṭo nāma, bhante, upāsako …
translation-en-sujato: Nikata,

root-pli-ms: kaṭissaho nāma, bhante, upāsako …
translation-en-sujato: Kaṭissaha,

root-pli-ms: tuṭṭho nāma, bhante, upāsako …
translation-en-sujato: Tuṭṭha,

root-pli-ms: santuṭṭho nāma, bhante, upāsako …
translation-en-sujato: Santuṭṭha,

root-pli-ms: bhaddo nāma, bhante, upāsako …
translation-en-sujato: Bhadda, and

root-pli-ms: subhaddo nāma, bhante, upāsako nātike kālaṅkato, tassa kā gati, ko abhisamparāyo”ti?
translation-en-sujato: Subhadda have passed away in Nādika. Where have they been reborn in the next life?”

root-pli-ms: “Sāḷho, ānanda, bhikkhu āsavānaṁ khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihāsi.
translation-en-sujato: “Ānanda, the monk Sāḷha had realized the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life, having realized it with his own insight due to the ending of defilements.

root-pli-ms: Nandā, ānanda, bhikkhunī pañcannaṁ orambhāgiyānaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ parikkhayā opapātikā tattha parinibbāyinī anāvattidhammā tasmā lokā.
translation-en-sujato: The nun Nandā had ended the five lower fetters. She’s been reborn spontaneously, and will be extinguished there, not liable to return from that world.

root-pli-ms: Sudatto, ānanda, upāsako tiṇṇaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ parikkhayā rāgadosamohānaṁ tanuttā sakadāgāmī sakideva imaṁ lokaṁ āgantvā dukkhassantaṁ karissati.
translation-en-sujato: The layman Sudatta had ended three fetters, and weakened greed, hate, and delusion. He’s a once-returner; he will come back to this world once only, then make an end of suffering.

root-pli-ms: Sujātā, ānanda, upāsikā tiṇṇaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ parikkhayā sotāpannā avinipātadhammā niyatā sambodhiparāyaṇā.
translation-en-sujato: The laywoman Sujātā had ended three fetters. She’s a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.

root-pli-ms: Kukkuṭo, ānanda, upāsako pañcannaṁ orambhāgiyānaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ parikkhayā opapātiko tattha parinibbāyī anāvattidhammo tasmā lokā.
translation-en-sujato: The laymen Kakkaṭa,

root-pli-ms: Kāḷimbo, ānanda, upāsako …pe…
translation-en-sujato: Kaḷibha,

root-pli-ms: nikaṭo, ānanda, upāsako …
translation-en-sujato: Nikata,

root-pli-ms: kaṭissaho, ānanda, upāsako …
translation-en-sujato: Kaṭissaha,

root-pli-ms: tuṭṭho, ānanda, upāsako …
translation-en-sujato: Tuṭṭha,

root-pli-ms: santuṭṭho, ānanda, upāsako …
translation-en-sujato: Santuṭṭha,

root-pli-ms: bhaddo, ānanda, upāsako …
translation-en-sujato: Bhadda, and

root-pli-ms: subhaddo, ānanda, upāsako pañcannaṁ orambhāgiyānaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ parikkhayā opapātiko tattha parinibbāyī anāvattidhammo tasmā lokā.
translation-en-sujato: and Subhadda had ended the five lower fetters. They’ve been reborn spontaneously, and will be extinguished there, not liable to return from that world.

root-pli-ms: Paropaññāsaṁ, ānanda, nātike upāsakā kālaṅkatā, pañcannaṁ orambhāgiyānaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ parikkhayā opapātikā tattha parinibbāyino anāvattidhammā tasmā lokā.
translation-en-sujato: Over fifty laymen in Nādika have passed away having ended the five lower fetters. They’ve been reborn spontaneously, and will be extinguished there, not liable to return from that world.

root-pli-ms: Sādhikā navuti, ānanda, nātike upāsakā kālaṅkatā tiṇṇaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ parikkhayā rāgadosamohānaṁ tanuttā sakadāgāmino sakideva imaṁ lokaṁ āgantvā dukkhassantaṁ karissanti.
translation-en-sujato: More than ninety laymen in Nādika have passed away having ended three fetters, and weakened greed, hate, and delusion. They’re once-returners, who will come back to this world once only, then make an end of suffering.
variant-pli-ms: Sādhikā navuti → chādhikā navuti (sya-all); nādhikā navuti (km)

root-pli-ms: Sātirekāni, ānanda, pañcasatāni nātike upāsakā kālaṅkatā, tiṇṇaṁ saṁyojanānaṁ parikkhayā sotāpannā avinipātadhammā niyatā sambodhiparāyaṇā.
translation-en-sujato: In excess of five hundred laymen in Nādika have passed away having ended three fetters. They’re stream-enterers, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.

root-pli-ms: 10. Dhammādāsadhammapariyāya
translation-en-sujato: 10. The Mirror of the Teaching

root-pli-ms: Anacchariyaṁ kho panetaṁ, ānanda, yaṁ manussabhūto kālaṁ kareyya.
translation-en-sujato: It’s hardly surprising that a human being should pass away.

root-pli-ms: Tasmiṁyeva kālaṅkate tathāgataṁ upasaṅkamitvā etamatthaṁ pucchissatha, vihesā hesā, ānanda, tathāgatassa.
translation-en-sujato: But if you should come and ask me about it each and every time someone passes away, that would be a bother for me.
variant-pli-ms: Tasmiṁyeva → tasmiṁ tasmiṁ kho (sya-all, km); tasmiṁ tasmiṁ ce (pts1ed)

root-pli-ms: Tasmātihānanda, dhammādāsaṁ nāma dhammapariyāyaṁ desessāmi, yena samannāgato ariyasāvako ākaṅkhamāno attanāva attānaṁ byākareyya:
translation-en-sujato: So Ānanda, I will teach you the explanation of the Dhamma called ‘the mirror of the teaching’. A noble disciple who has this may declare of themselves:

root-pli-ms: ‘khīṇanirayomhi khīṇatiracchānayoni khīṇapettivisayo khīṇāpāyaduggativinipāto, sotāpannohamasmi avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyaṇo’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘I’ve finished with rebirth in hell, the animal realm, and the ghost realm. I’ve finished with all places of loss, bad places, the underworld. I am a stream-enterer! I’m not liable to be reborn in the underworld, and am bound for awakening.’

root-pli-ms: Katamo ca so, ānanda, dhammādāso dhammapariyāyo, yena samannāgato ariyasāvako ākaṅkhamāno attanāva attānaṁ byākareyya:
translation-en-sujato: And what is that mirror of the teaching?

root-pli-ms: ‘khīṇanirayomhi khīṇatiracchānayoni khīṇapettivisayo khīṇāpāyaduggativinipāto, sotāpannohamasmi avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyaṇo’ti?
Idhānanda, ariyasāvako buddhe aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti:
translation-en-sujato: It’s when a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Buddha:

root-pli-ms: ‘itipi so bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṁ buddho bhagavā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘That Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those who wish to train, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.’

root-pli-ms: Dhamme aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti:
translation-en-sujato: They have experiential confidence in the teaching:

root-pli-ms: ‘svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo sandiṭṭhiko akāliko ehipassiko opaneyyiko paccattaṁ veditabbo viññūhī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘The teaching is well explained by the Buddha—visible in this very life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves.’

root-pli-ms: Saṅghe aveccappasādena samannāgato hoti:
translation-en-sujato: They have experiential confidence in the Saṅgha:

root-pli-ms: ‘suppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, ujuppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, ñāyappaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, sāmīcippaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho yadidaṁ cattāri purisayugāni aṭṭha purisapuggalā, esa bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho āhuneyyo pāhuneyyo dakkhiṇeyyo añjalikaraṇīyo anuttaraṁ puññakkhettaṁ lokassā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘The Saṅgha of the Buddha’s disciples is practicing the way that’s good, straightforward, methodical, and proper. It consists of the four pairs, the eight individuals. This is the Saṅgha of the Buddha’s disciples that is worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a religious donation, worthy of greeting with joined palms, and is the supreme field of merit for the world.’

root-pli-ms: Ariyakantehi sīlehi samannāgato hoti akhaṇḍehi acchiddehi asabalehi akammāsehi bhujissehi viññūpasatthehi aparāmaṭṭhehi samādhisaṁvattanikehi.
translation-en-sujato: And a noble disciple’s ethical conduct is loved by the noble ones, unbroken, impeccable, spotless, and unmarred, liberating, praised by sensible people, not mistaken, and leading to immersion.

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ kho so, ānanda, dhammādāso dhammapariyāyo, yena samannāgato ariyasāvako ākaṅkhamāno attanāva attānaṁ byākareyya:
translation-en-sujato: This is that mirror of the teaching.”

root-pli-ms: ‘khīṇanirayomhi khīṇatiracchānayoni khīṇapettivisayo khīṇāpāyaduggativinipāto, sotāpannohamasmi avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyaṇo’”ti.
Tatrapi sudaṁ bhagavā nātike viharanto giñjakāvasathe etadeva bahulaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ karoti:
translation-en-sujato: And while staying there in Nādika the Buddha often gave this Dhamma talk to the mendicants:

root-pli-ms: “Iti sīlaṁ iti samādhi iti paññā.
translation-en-sujato: “Such is ethics, such is immersion, such is wisdom.

root-pli-ms: Sīlaparibhāvito samādhi mahapphalo hoti mahānisaṁso.
translation-en-sujato: When immersion is imbued with ethics it’s very fruitful and beneficial.

root-pli-ms: Samādhiparibhāvitā paññā mahapphalā hoti mahānisaṁsā.
translation-en-sujato: When wisdom is imbued with immersion it’s very fruitful and beneficial.

root-pli-ms: Paññāparibhāvitaṁ cittaṁ sammadeva āsavehi vimuccati, seyyathidaṁ—
translation-en-sujato: When the mind is imbued with wisdom it is rightly freed from the defilements, namely,

root-pli-ms: kāmāsavā, bhavāsavā, avijjāsavā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: the defilements of sensuality, desire to be reborn, and ignorance.”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā nātike yathābhirantaṁ viharitvā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: When the Buddha had stayed in Nādika as long as he wished, he addressed Venerable Ānanda,
reference: bj8.150, csp1ed7.81, csp2ed7.81, dr10.114, ms7D_341, msdiv160, pts-cs2.11, sc96

root-pli-ms: “āyāmānanda, yena vesālī tenupasaṅkamissāmā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Come, Ānanda, let’s go to Vesālī.”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paccassosi.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” Ānanda replied.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ yena vesālī tadavasari.
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha together with a large Saṅgha of mendicants arrived at Vesālī,

root-pli-ms: Tatra sudaṁ bhagavā vesāliyaṁ viharati ambapālivane.
translation-en-sujato: where he stayed in Ambapālī’s mango grove.

root-pli-ms: Tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:

root-pli-ms: “Sato, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vihareyya sampajāno,
translation-en-sujato: “Mendicants, a mendicant should live mindful and aware.

root-pli-ms: ayaṁ vo amhākaṁ anusāsanī.
translation-en-sujato: This is my instruction to you.

root-pli-ms: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sato hoti?
translation-en-sujato: And how is a mendicant mindful?

root-pli-ms: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu kāye kāyānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: It’s when a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.

root-pli-ms: Vedanāsu vedanānupassī …pe…
translation-en-sujato: They meditate observing an aspect of feelings …

root-pli-ms: citte cittānupassī …pe…
translation-en-sujato: mind …

root-pli-ms: dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sato hoti.
translation-en-sujato: That’s how a mendicant is mindful.

root-pli-ms: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sampajāno hoti?
translation-en-sujato: And how is a mendicant aware?

root-pli-ms: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu abhikkante paṭikkante sampajānakārī hoti, ālokite vilokite sampajānakārī hoti, samiñjite pasārite sampajānakārī hoti, saṅghāṭipattacīvaradhāraṇe sampajānakārī hoti, asite pīte khāyite sāyite sampajānakārī hoti, uccārapassāvakamme sampajānakārī hoti, gate ṭhite nisinne sutte jāgarite bhāsite tuṇhībhāve sampajānakārī hoti.
translation-en-sujato: It’s when a mendicant acts with situational awareness when going out and coming back; when looking ahead and aside; when bending and extending the limbs; when bearing the outer robe, bowl and robes; when eating, drinking, chewing, and tasting; when urinating and defecating; when walking, standing, sitting, sleeping, waking, speaking, and keeping silent.

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sampajāno hoti.
translation-en-sujato: That’s how a mendicant is aware.

root-pli-ms: Sato, bhikkhave, bhikkhu vihareyya sampajāno,
translation-en-sujato: A mendicant should live mindful and aware.

root-pli-ms: ayaṁ vo amhākaṁ anusāsanī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: This is my instruction to you.”

root-pli-ms: 11. Ambapālīgaṇikā
translation-en-sujato: 11. Ambapālī the Courtesan

root-pli-ms: Assosi kho ambapālī gaṇikā: “bhagavā kira vesāliṁ anuppatto vesāliyaṁ viharati mayhaṁ ambavane”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Ambapālī the courtesan heard that the Buddha had arrived and was staying in her mango grove.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho ambapālī gaṇikā bhaddāni bhaddāni yānāni yojāpetvā bhaddaṁ bhaddaṁ yānaṁ abhiruhitvā bhaddehi bhaddehi yānehi vesāliyā niyyāsi. Yena sako ārāmo tena pāyāsi.
translation-en-sujato: She had the finest carriages harnessed. Then she mounted a fine carriage and, along with other fine carriages, set out from Vesālī for her own park.

root-pli-ms: Yāvatikā yānassa bhūmi, yānena gantvā, yānā paccorohitvā pattikāva yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
translation-en-sujato: She went by carriage as far as the terrain allowed, then descended and approached the Buddha on foot. She bowed and sat down to one side.

root-pli-ms: Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho ambapāliṁ gaṇikaṁ bhagavā dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi.
translation-en-sujato: The Buddha educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired her with a Dhamma talk.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho ambapālī gaṇikā bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya sandassitā samādapitā samuttejitā sampahaṁsitā bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: Then she said to the Buddha,

root-pli-ms: “adhivāsetu me, bhante, bhagavā svātanāya bhattaṁ saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, may the Buddha together with the mendicant Saṅgha please accept tomorrow’s meal from me.”

root-pli-ms: Adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena.
translation-en-sujato: The Buddha consented in silence.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho ambapālī gaṇikā bhagavato adhivāsanaṁ viditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā pakkāmi.
translation-en-sujato: Then, knowing that the Buddha had consented, Ambapālī got up from her seat, bowed, and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on her right, before leaving.

root-pli-ms: Assosuṁ kho vesālikā licchavī: “bhagavā kira vesāliṁ anuppatto vesāliyaṁ viharati ambapālivane”ti.
translation-en-sujato: The Licchavis of Vesālī also heard that the Buddha had arrived and was staying in Ambapālī’s mango grove.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho te licchavī bhaddāni bhaddāni yānāni yojāpetvā bhaddaṁ bhaddaṁ yānaṁ abhiruhitvā bhaddehi bhaddehi yānehi vesāliyā niyyiṁsu.
translation-en-sujato: They had the finest carriages harnessed. Then they mounted a fine carriage and, along with other fine carriages, set out from Vesālī.

root-pli-ms: Tatra ekacce licchavī nīlā honti nīlavaṇṇā nīlavatthā nīlālaṅkārā, ekacce licchavī pītā honti pītavaṇṇā pītavatthā pītālaṅkārā, ekacce licchavī lohitā honti lohitavaṇṇā lohitavatthā lohitālaṅkārā, ekacce licchavī odātā honti odātavaṇṇā odātavatthā odātālaṅkārā.
translation-en-sujato: Some of the Licchavis were in blue, of blue color, clad in blue, adorned with blue. And some were similarly colored in yellow, red, or white.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho ambapālī gaṇikā daharānaṁ daharānaṁ licchavīnaṁ akkhena akkhaṁ cakkena cakkaṁ yugena yugaṁ paṭivaṭṭesi.
translation-en-sujato: Then Ambapālī the courtesan collided with those Licchavi youths, axle to axle, wheel to wheel, yoke to yoke.
comment-en-sujato: There are various reading for pativattesi. I quite like that reading “forced them back”. Anandajoti has “rolled alongside” evidently reading parivattesi. Comm, however, has “Parivaṭṭesīti pahari”.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho te licchavī ambapāliṁ gaṇikaṁ etadavocuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: The Licchavis said to her,

root-pli-ms: “kiṁ, je ambapāli, daharānaṁ daharānaṁ licchavīnaṁ akkhena akkhaṁ cakkena cakkaṁ yugena yugaṁ paṭivaṭṭesī”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “What the hell, Ambapālī, are you doing colliding with us axle to axle, wheel to wheel, yoke to yoke?”
comment-en-sujato: I don’t know if it’s possible to be very literal, but i think it’s important to preserve something of the flavor of the insulting vocative je here, otherwise used of the “bad girl” Kali in MN 21.

root-pli-ms: “Tathā hi pana me, ayyaputtā, bhagavā nimantito svātanāya bhattaṁ saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Well, my lords, it’s because I’ve invited the Buddha for tomorrow’s meal together with the mendicant Saṅgha.”

root-pli-ms: “Dehi, je ambapāli, etaṁ bhattaṁ satasahassenā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Girl, give us that meal for a hundred thousand!”

root-pli-ms: “Sacepi me, ayyaputtā, vesāliṁ sāhāraṁ dassatha, evamahaṁ taṁ bhattaṁ na dassāmī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “My lords, even if you were to give me Vesālī with her fiefdoms, I still wouldn’t give that meal to you.”
variant-pli-ms: evamahaṁ taṁ → evaṁ mahantaṁ (bj, pts1ed); evaṁpi mahantaṁ (sya-all, km)

root-pli-ms: Atha kho te licchavī aṅguliṁ phoṭesuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: Then the Licchavis snapped their fingers, saying,

root-pli-ms: “jitamha vata bho ambakāya, jitamha vata bho ambakāyā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “We’ve been beaten by the mango-matron! We’ve been beaten by the mango-matron!”
variant-pli-ms: jitamha → jitamhā (bahūsu) | vata bho ambakāya, jitamha vata bho ambakāyā”ti → (?)

root-pli-ms: Atha kho te licchavī yena ambapālivanaṁ tena pāyiṁsu.
translation-en-sujato: Then they continued on to Ambapālī’s grove.

root-pli-ms: Addasā kho bhagavā te licchavī dūratova āgacchante.
translation-en-sujato: The Buddha saw them coming off in the distance,

root-pli-ms: Disvāna bhikkhū āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: and addressed the mendicants:

root-pli-ms: “yesaṁ, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṁ devā tāvatiṁsā adiṭṭhapubbā, oloketha, bhikkhave, licchaviparisaṁ;
translation-en-sujato: “Any of the mendicants who’ve never seen the gods of the Thirty-Three, just have a look at the assembly of Licchavis.

root-pli-ms: apaloketha, bhikkhave, licchaviparisaṁ;
translation-en-sujato: See the assembly of Licchavis,

root-pli-ms: upasaṁharatha, bhikkhave, licchaviparisaṁ—
translation-en-sujato: check them out:

root-pli-ms: tāvatiṁsasadisan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: they’re just like the Thirty-Three!”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho te licchavī yāvatikā yānassa bhūmi, yānena gantvā, yānā paccorohitvā pattikāva yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu.
translation-en-sujato: The Licchavis went by carriage as far as the terrain allowed, then descended and approached the Buddha on foot. They bowed to the Buddha, sat down to one side,

root-pli-ms: Ekamantaṁ nisinne kho te licchavī bhagavā dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi.
translation-en-sujato: and the Buddha educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired them with a Dhamma talk.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho te licchavī bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya sandassitā samādapitā samuttejitā sampahaṁsitā bhagavantaṁ etadavocuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: Then they said to the Buddha,

root-pli-ms: “adhivāsetu no, bhante, bhagavā svātanāya bhattaṁ saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, may the Buddha together with the mendicant Saṅgha please accept tomorrow’s meal from us.”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā te licchavī etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha said to the Licchavis,

root-pli-ms: “adhivutthaṁ kho me, licchavī, svātanāya ambapāliyā gaṇikāya bhattan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “I have already accepted tomorrow’s meal from Ambapālī the courtesan.”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho te licchavī aṅguliṁ phoṭesuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: Then the Licchavis snapped their fingers, saying,

root-pli-ms: “jitamha vata bho ambakāya, jitamha vata bho ambakāyā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “We’ve been beaten by the mango-matron! We’ve been beaten by the mango-matron!”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho te licchavī bhagavato bhāsitaṁ abhinanditvā anumoditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā pakkamiṁsu.
translation-en-sujato: And then those Licchavis approved and agreed with what the Buddha said. They got up from their seat, bowed, and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on their right, before leaving.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho ambapālī gaṇikā tassā rattiyā accayena sake ārāme paṇītaṁ khādanīyaṁ bhojanīyaṁ paṭiyādāpetvā bhagavato kālaṁ ārocāpesi:
translation-en-sujato: And when the night had passed Ambapālī had a variety of delicious foods prepared in her own park. Then she had the Buddha informed of the time, saying,

root-pli-ms: “kālo, bhante, niṭṭhitaṁ bhattan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, it’s time. The meal is ready.”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghena yena ambapāliyā gaṇikāya nivesanaṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, went to the home of Ambapālī together with the mendicant Saṅgha, where he sat on the seat spread out.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho ambapālī gaṇikā buddhappamukhaṁ bhikkhusaṅghaṁ paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sahatthā santappesi sampavāresi.
translation-en-sujato: Then Ambapālī served and satisfied the mendicant Saṅgha headed by the Buddha with her own hands with a variety of delicious foods.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho ambapālī gaṇikā bhagavantaṁ bhuttāviṁ onītapattapāṇiṁ aññataraṁ nīcaṁ āsanaṁ gahetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
translation-en-sujato: When the Buddha had eaten and washed his hands and bowl, Ambapālī took a low seat, sat to one side,

root-pli-ms: Ekamantaṁ nisinnā kho ambapālī gaṇikā bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: and said to the Buddha,

root-pli-ms: “imāhaṁ, bhante, ārāmaṁ buddhappamukhassa bhikkhusaṅghassa dammī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, I present this park to the mendicant Saṅgha headed by the Buddha.”

root-pli-ms: Paṭiggahesi bhagavā ārāmaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: The Buddha accepted the park.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā ambapāliṁ gaṇikaṁ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṁsetvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired her with a Dhamma talk, after which he got up from his seat and left.

root-pli-ms: Tatrapi sudaṁ bhagavā vesāliyaṁ viharanto ambapālivane etadeva bahulaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ karoti:
translation-en-sujato: And while staying at Vesālī, too, the Buddha often gave this Dhamma talk to the mendicants:

root-pli-ms: “iti sīlaṁ, iti samādhi, iti paññā.
translation-en-sujato: “Such is ethics, such is immersion, such is wisdom.

root-pli-ms: Sīlaparibhāvito samādhi mahapphalo hoti mahānisaṁso.
translation-en-sujato: When immersion is imbued with ethics it’s very fruitful and beneficial.

root-pli-ms: Samādhiparibhāvitā paññā mahapphalā hoti mahānisaṁsā.
translation-en-sujato: When wisdom is imbued with immersion it’s very fruitful and beneficial.

root-pli-ms: Paññāparibhāvitaṁ cittaṁ sammadeva āsavehi vimuccati, seyyathidaṁ—
translation-en-sujato: When the mind is imbued with wisdom it is rightly freed from the defilements, namely,

root-pli-ms: kāmāsavā, bhavāsavā, avijjāsavā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: the defilements of sensuality, desire to be reborn, and ignorance.”

root-pli-ms: 12. Veḷuvagāmavassūpagamana
translation-en-sujato: 12. Commencing the Rains at Beluva

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā ambapālivane yathābhirantaṁ viharitvā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: When the Buddha had stayed in Ambapālī’s grove as long as he wished, he addressed Venerable Ānanda,

root-pli-ms: “āyāmānanda, yena veḷuvagāmako tenupasaṅkamissāmā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Come, Ānanda, let’s go to the little village of Beluva.”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paccassosi.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” Ānanda replied.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ yena veḷuvagāmako tadavasari.
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha together with a large Saṅgha of mendicants arrived at the little village of Beluva,

root-pli-ms: Tatra sudaṁ bhagavā veḷuvagāmake viharati.
translation-en-sujato: and stayed there.

root-pli-ms: Tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:

root-pli-ms: “etha tumhe, bhikkhave, samantā vesāliṁ yathāmittaṁ yathāsandiṭṭhaṁ yathāsambhattaṁ vassaṁ upetha.
translation-en-sujato: “Mendicants, please enter the rainy season residence with whatever friends or acquaintances you have around Vesālī.

root-pli-ms: Ahaṁ pana idheva veḷuvagāmake vassaṁ upagacchāmī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: I’ll commence the rainy season residence right here in the little village of Beluva.”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paṭissutvā samantā vesāliṁ yathāmittaṁ yathāsandiṭṭhaṁ yathāsambhattaṁ vassaṁ upagacchiṁsu.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” those mendicants replied. They did as the Buddha said,

root-pli-ms: Bhagavā pana tattheva veḷuvagāmake vassaṁ upagacchi.
translation-en-sujato: while the Buddha commenced the rainy season residence right there in the little village of Beluva.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavato vassūpagatassa kharo ābādho uppajji, bāḷhā vedanā vattanti māraṇantikā.
translation-en-sujato: After the Buddha had commenced the rainy season residence, he fell severely ill, struck by dreadful pains, close to death.

root-pli-ms: Tā sudaṁ bhagavā sato sampajāno adhivāsesi avihaññamāno.
translation-en-sujato: But he endured with mindfulness and situational awareness, without worrying.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavato etadahosi:
translation-en-sujato: Then it occurred to the Buddha,

root-pli-ms: “na kho metaṁ patirūpaṁ, yvāhaṁ anāmantetvā upaṭṭhāke anapaloketvā bhikkhusaṅghaṁ parinibbāyeyyaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: “It would not be appropriate for me to become fully extinguished before informing my attendants and taking leave of the mendicant Saṅgha.

root-pli-ms: Yannūnāhaṁ imaṁ ābādhaṁ vīriyena paṭipaṇāmetvā jīvitasaṅkhāraṁ adhiṭṭhāya vihareyyan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Why don’t I forcefully suppress this illness, stabilize the life force, and live on?”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā taṁ ābādhaṁ vīriyena paṭipaṇāmetvā jīvitasaṅkhāraṁ adhiṭṭhāya vihāsi.
translation-en-sujato: So that is what he did.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavato so ābādho paṭippassambhi.
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha’s illness died down.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā gilānā vuṭṭhito aciravuṭṭhito gelaññā vihārā nikkhamma vihārapacchāyāyaṁ paññatte āsane nisīdi.
translation-en-sujato: Soon after the Buddha had recovered from that sickness, he came out from his dwelling and sat in the shade of the porch on the seat spread out.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho āyasmā ānando yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him,

root-pli-ms: “diṭṭho me, bhante, bhagavato phāsu; diṭṭhaṁ me, bhante, bhagavato khamanīyaṁ, api ca me, bhante, madhurakajāto viya kāyo.
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, it’s fantastic that the Buddha is comfortable and well.

root-pli-ms: Disāpi me na pakkhāyanti;
translation-en-sujato: Because when the Buddha was sick, my body felt like it was drugged. I was disorientated, and the teachings weren’t clear to me.

root-pli-ms: dhammāpi maṁ na paṭibhanti bhagavato gelaññena, api ca me, bhante, ahosi kācideva assāsamattā:
translation-en-sujato: Still, at least I was consoled by the thought that

root-pli-ms: ‘na tāva bhagavā parinibbāyissati, na yāva bhagavā bhikkhusaṅghaṁ ārabbha kiñcideva udāharatī’”ti.
translation-en-sujato: the Buddha won’t become fully extinguished without making some statement regarding the Saṅgha of mendicants.”

root-pli-ms: “Kiṁ panānanda, bhikkhusaṅgho mayi paccāsīsati?
translation-en-sujato: “But what could the mendicant Saṅgha expect from me, Ānanda?

root-pli-ms: Desito, ānanda, mayā dhammo anantaraṁ abāhiraṁ karitvā.
translation-en-sujato: I’ve taught the Dhamma without making any distinction between secret and public teachings.

root-pli-ms: Natthānanda, tathāgatassa dhammesu ācariyamuṭṭhi.
translation-en-sujato: The Realized One doesn’t have the closed fist of a teacher when it comes to the teachings.

root-pli-ms: Yassa nūna, ānanda, evamassa:
translation-en-sujato: If there’s anyone who thinks:

root-pli-ms: ‘ahaṁ bhikkhusaṅghaṁ pariharissāmī’ti vā ‘mamuddesiko bhikkhusaṅgho’ti vā, so nūna, ānanda, bhikkhusaṅghaṁ ārabbha kiñcideva udāhareyya.
translation-en-sujato: ‘I’ll take charge of the Saṅgha of mendicants,’ or ‘the Saṅgha of mendicants is meant for me,’ let them make a statement regarding the Saṅgha.

root-pli-ms: Tathāgatassa kho, ānanda, na evaṁ hoti:
translation-en-sujato: But the Realized One doesn’t think like this,

root-pli-ms: ‘ahaṁ bhikkhusaṅghaṁ pariharissāmī’ti vā ‘mamuddesiko bhikkhusaṅgho’ti vā.
Sakiṁ, ānanda, tathāgato bhikkhusaṅghaṁ ārabbha kiñcideva udāharissati.
translation-en-sujato: so why should he make some statement regarding the Saṅgha?

root-pli-ms: Ahaṁ kho panānanda, etarahi jiṇṇo vuddho mahallako addhagato vayo anuppatto.
translation-en-sujato: I’m now old, elderly and senior. I’m advanced in years and have reached the final stage of life.

root-pli-ms: Āsītiko me vayo vattati.
translation-en-sujato: I’m currently eighty years old.

root-pli-ms: Seyyathāpi, ānanda, jajjarasakaṭaṁ veṭhamissakena yāpeti;
translation-en-sujato: Just as a decrepit cart keeps going by relying on straps,
comment-en-sujato: Reading vedhanissayena following Levman
variant-pli-ms: veṭhamissakena → vekkhamissakena (bj); veḷumissakena (sya-all, km); veghamissakena (pts1ed); vekhamissakena (mr)

root-pli-ms: evameva kho, ānanda, veṭhamissakena maññe tathāgatassa kāyo yāpeti.
translation-en-sujato: in the same way, the Realized One’s body keeps going by relying on straps, or so you’d think.

root-pli-ms: Yasmiṁ, ānanda, samaye tathāgato sabbanimittānaṁ amanasikārā ekaccānaṁ vedanānaṁ nirodhā animittaṁ cetosamādhiṁ upasampajja viharati, phāsutaro, ānanda, tasmiṁ samaye tathāgatassa kāyo hoti.
translation-en-sujato: Sometimes the Realized One, not focusing on any signs, and with the cessation of certain feelings, enters and remains in the signless immersion of the heart. Only then does the Realized One’s body become more comfortable.

root-pli-ms: Tasmātihānanda, attadīpā viharatha attasaraṇā anaññasaraṇā, dhammadīpā dhammasaraṇā anaññasaraṇā.
translation-en-sujato: So Ānanda, be your own island, your own refuge, with no other refuge. Let the teaching be your island and your refuge, with no other refuge.

root-pli-ms: Kathañcānanda, bhikkhu attadīpo viharati attasaraṇo anaññasaraṇo, dhammadīpo dhammasaraṇo anaññasaraṇo?
translation-en-sujato: And how does a mendicant do this?

root-pli-ms: Idhānanda, bhikkhu kāye kāyānupassī viharati atāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: It’s when a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.

root-pli-ms: Vedanāsu …pe…
translation-en-sujato: They meditate observing an aspect of feelings …

root-pli-ms: citte …pe…
translation-en-sujato: mind …

root-pli-ms: dhammesu dhammānupassī viharati ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ kho, ānanda, bhikkhu attadīpo viharati attasaraṇo anaññasaraṇo, dhammadīpo dhammasaraṇo anaññasaraṇo.
translation-en-sujato: That’s how a mendicant is their own island, their own refuge, with no other refuge. That’s how the teaching is their island and their refuge, with no other refuge.

root-pli-ms: Ye hi keci, ānanda, etarahi vā mama vā accayena attadīpā viharissanti attasaraṇā anaññasaraṇā, dhammadīpā dhammasaraṇā anaññasaraṇā, tamatagge me te, ānanda, bhikkhū bhavissanti ye keci sikkhākāmā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Whether now or after I have passed, any who shall live as their own island, their own refuge, with no other refuge; with the teaching as their island and their refuge, with no other refuge—those mendicants of mine who want to train shall be among the best of the best.”

root-pli-ms: Dutiyabhāṇavāro.
13. Nimittobhāsakathā
translation-en-sujato: 13. An Obvious Hint

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya vesāliṁ piṇḍāya pāvisi.
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, entered Vesālī for alms.

root-pli-ms: Vesāliyaṁ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṁ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: Then, after the meal, on his return from alms-round, he addressed Venerable Ānanda:

root-pli-ms: “gaṇhāhi, ānanda, nisīdanaṁ,
translation-en-sujato: “Ānanda, get your sitting cloth.

root-pli-ms: yena cāpālaṁ cetiyaṁ tenupasaṅkamissāma divā vihārāyā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Let’s go to the Cāpāla shrine for the day’s meditation.”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paṭissutvā nisīdanaṁ ādāya bhagavantaṁ piṭṭhito piṭṭhito anubandhi.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” replied Ānanda. Taking his sitting cloth he followed behind the Buddha.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā yena cāpālaṁ cetiyaṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha went up to the Cāpāla shrine, where he sat on the seat spread out.

root-pli-ms: Āyasmāpi kho ānando bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
translation-en-sujato: Ānanda bowed to the Buddha and sat down to one side.

root-pli-ms: Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ bhagavā etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: The Buddha said to him:

root-pli-ms: “ramaṇīyā, ānanda, vesālī, ramaṇīyaṁ udenaṁ cetiyaṁ, ramaṇīyaṁ gotamakaṁ cetiyaṁ, ramaṇīyaṁ sattambaṁ cetiyaṁ, ramaṇīyaṁ bahuputtaṁ cetiyaṁ, ramaṇīyaṁ sārandadaṁ cetiyaṁ, ramaṇīyaṁ cāpālaṁ cetiyaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: “Ānanda, Vesālī is lovely. And the Udena, Gotamaka, Sattamba, Bahuputta, Sārandada, and Cāpāla shrines are all lovely.

root-pli-ms: Yassa kassaci, ānanda, cattāro iddhipādā bhāvitā bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā, so ākaṅkhamāno kappaṁ vā tiṭṭheyya kappāvasesaṁ vā.
translation-en-sujato: Whoever has developed and cultivated the four bases of psychic power—made them a vehicle and a basis, kept them up, consolidated them, and properly implemented them—may, if they wish, live on for the eon or what’s left of the eon.

root-pli-ms: Tathāgatassa kho, ānanda, cattāro iddhipādā bhāvitā bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā, so ākaṅkhamāno, ānanda, tathāgato kappaṁ vā tiṭṭheyya kappāvasesaṁ vā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: The Realized One has developed and cultivated the four bases of psychic power, made them a vehicle and a basis, kept them up, consolidated them, and properly implemented them. If he wished, the Realized One could live on for the eon or what’s left of the eon.”

root-pli-ms: Evampi kho āyasmā ānando bhagavatā oḷārike nimitte kayiramāne oḷārike obhāse kayiramāne nāsakkhi paṭivijjhituṁ;
translation-en-sujato: But Ānanda didn’t get it, even though the Buddha dropped such an obvious hint, such a clear sign.

root-pli-ms: na bhagavantaṁ yāci:
translation-en-sujato: He didn’t beg the Buddha:

root-pli-ms: “tiṭṭhatu, bhante, bhagavā kappaṁ, tiṭṭhatu sugato kappaṁ bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānan”ti, yathā taṁ mārena pariyuṭṭhitacitto.
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, may the Blessed One please remain for the eon! May the Holy One please remain for the eon! That would be for the welfare and happiness of the people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.” For his mind was as if possessed by Māra.

root-pli-ms: Dutiyampi kho bhagavā …pe…
translation-en-sujato: For a second time …

root-pli-ms: tatiyampi kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: And for a third time, the Buddha said to Ānanda:

root-pli-ms: “ramaṇīyā, ānanda, vesālī, ramaṇīyaṁ udenaṁ cetiyaṁ, ramaṇīyaṁ gotamakaṁ cetiyaṁ, ramaṇīyaṁ sattambaṁ cetiyaṁ, ramaṇīyaṁ bahuputtaṁ cetiyaṁ, ramaṇīyaṁ sārandadaṁ cetiyaṁ, ramaṇīyaṁ cāpālaṁ cetiyaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: “Ānanda, Vesālī is lovely. And the Udena, Gotamaka, Sattamba, Bahuputta, Sārandada, and Cāpāla shrines are all lovely.

root-pli-ms: Yassa kassaci, ānanda, cattāro iddhipādā bhāvitā bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā, so ākaṅkhamāno kappaṁ vā tiṭṭheyya kappāvasesaṁ vā.
translation-en-sujato: Whoever has developed and cultivated the four bases of psychic power—made them a vehicle and a basis, kept them up, consolidated them, and properly implemented them—may, if they wish, live on for the eon, or what’s left of it.

root-pli-ms: Tathāgatassa kho, ānanda, cattāro iddhipādā bhāvitā bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā, so ākaṅkhamāno, ānanda, tathāgato kappaṁ vā tiṭṭheyya kappāvasesaṁ vā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: The Realized One has developed and cultivated the four bases of psychic power, made them a vehicle and a basis, kept them up, consolidated them, and properly implemented them. If he wished, the Realized One could live on for the eon, or what’s left of it.”

root-pli-ms: Evampi kho āyasmā ānando bhagavatā oḷārike nimitte kayiramāne oḷārike obhāse kayiramāne nāsakkhi paṭivijjhituṁ;
translation-en-sujato: But Ānanda didn’t get it, even though the Buddha dropped such an obvious hint, such a clear sign.

root-pli-ms: na bhagavantaṁ yāci:
translation-en-sujato: He didn’t beg the Buddha:

root-pli-ms: “tiṭṭhatu, bhante, bhagavā kappaṁ, tiṭṭhatu sugato kappaṁ bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānan”ti, yathā taṁ mārena pariyuṭṭhitacitto.
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, may the Blessed One please remain for the eon! May the Holy One please remain for the eon! That would be for the welfare and happiness of the people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.” For his mind was as if possessed by Māra.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha got up and said to Venerable Ānanda,

root-pli-ms: “gaccha tvaṁ, ānanda,
translation-en-sujato: “Go now, Ānanda,

root-pli-ms: yassadāni kālaṁ maññasī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: at your convenience.”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paṭissutvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā avidūre aññatarasmiṁ rukkhamūle nisīdi.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” replied Ānanda. He rose from his seat, bowed, and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on his right, before sitting at the root of a tree close by.

root-pli-ms: 14. Mārayācanakathā
translation-en-sujato: 14. The Appeal of Māra

root-pli-ms: Atha kho māro pāpimā acirapakkante āyasmante ānande yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhāsi. Ekamantaṁ ṭhito kho māro pāpimā bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: And then, not long after Ānanda had left, Māra the Wicked went up to the Buddha, stood to one side, and said to him:

root-pli-ms: “parinibbātu dāni, bhante, bhagavā, parinibbātu sugato, parinibbānakālo dāni, bhante, bhagavato.
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, may the Blessed One now become fully extinguished! May the Holy One now become fully extinguished! Now is the time for the Buddha to become fully extinguished.

root-pli-ms: Bhāsitā kho panesā, bhante, bhagavatā vācā:
translation-en-sujato: Sir, you once made this statement:

root-pli-ms: ‘na tāvāhaṁ, pāpima, parinibbāyissāmi, yāva me bhikkhū na sāvakā bhavissanti viyattā vinītā visāradā bahussutā dhammadharā dhammānudhammappaṭipannā sāmīcippaṭipannā anudhammacārino, sakaṁ ācariyakaṁ uggahetvā ācikkhissanti desessanti paññapessanti paṭṭhapessanti vivarissanti vibhajissanti uttānīkarissanti, uppannaṁ parappavādaṁ sahadhammena suniggahitaṁ niggahetvā sappāṭihāriyaṁ dhammaṁ desessantī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Wicked One, I will not become fully extinguished until I have monk disciples who are competent, educated, assured, learned, have memorized the teachings, and practice in line with the teachings. Not until they practice properly, living in line with the teaching. Not until they’ve learned their tradition, and explain, teach, assert, establish, disclose, analyze, and make it clear. Not until they can legitimately and completely refute the doctrines of others that come up, and teach with a demonstrable basis.’

root-pli-ms: Etarahi kho pana, bhante, bhikkhū bhagavato sāvakā viyattā vinītā visāradā bahussutā dhammadharā dhammānudhammappaṭipannā sāmīcippaṭipannā anudhammacārino, sakaṁ ācariyakaṁ uggahetvā ācikkhanti desenti paññapenti paṭṭhapenti vivaranti vibhajanti uttānīkaronti, uppannaṁ parappavādaṁ sahadhammena suniggahitaṁ niggahetvā sappāṭihāriyaṁ dhammaṁ desenti.
translation-en-sujato: Today you do have such monk disciples.

root-pli-ms: Parinibbātu dāni, bhante, bhagavā, parinibbātu sugato, parinibbānakālo dāni, bhante, bhagavato.
translation-en-sujato: May the Blessed One now become fully extinguished! May the Holy One now become fully extinguished! Now is the time for the Buddha to become fully extinguished.

root-pli-ms: Bhāsitā kho panesā, bhante, bhagavatā vācā:
translation-en-sujato: Sir, you once made this statement:

root-pli-ms: ‘na tāvāhaṁ, pāpima, parinibbāyissāmi, yāva me bhikkhuniyo na sāvikā bhavissanti viyattā vinītā visāradā bahussutā dhammadharā dhammānudhammappaṭipannā sāmīcippaṭipannā anudhammacāriniyo, sakaṁ ācariyakaṁ uggahetvā ācikkhissanti desessanti paññapessanti paṭṭhapessanti vivarissanti vibhajissanti uttānīkarissanti, uppannaṁ parappavādaṁ sahadhammena suniggahitaṁ niggahetvā sappāṭihāriyaṁ dhammaṁ desessantī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Wicked One, I will not become fully extinguished until I have nun disciples who are competent, educated, assured, learned …’

root-pli-ms: Etarahi kho pana, bhante, bhikkhuniyo bhagavato sāvikā viyattā vinītā visāradā bahussutā dhammadharā dhammānudhammappaṭipannā sāmīcippaṭipannā anudhammacāriniyo, sakaṁ ācariyakaṁ uggahetvā ācikkhanti desenti paññapenti paṭṭhapenti vivaranti vibhajanti uttānīkaronti, uppannaṁ parappavādaṁ sahadhammena suniggahitaṁ niggahetvā sappāṭihāriyaṁ dhammaṁ desenti.
translation-en-sujato: Today you do have such nun disciples.

root-pli-ms: Parinibbātu dāni, bhante, bhagavā, parinibbātu sugato, parinibbānakālo dāni, bhante, bhagavato.
translation-en-sujato: May the Blessed One now become fully extinguished! May the Holy One now become fully extinguished! Now is the time for the Buddha to become fully extinguished.

root-pli-ms: Bhāsitā kho panesā, bhante, bhagavatā vācā:
translation-en-sujato: Sir, you once made this statement:

root-pli-ms: ‘na tāvāhaṁ, pāpima, parinibbāyissāmi, yāva me upāsakā na sāvakā bhavissanti viyattā vinītā visāradā bahussutā dhammadharā dhammānudhammappaṭipannā sāmīcippaṭipannā anudhammacārino, sakaṁ ācariyakaṁ uggahetvā ācikkhissanti desessanti paññapessanti paṭṭhapessanti vivarissanti vibhajissanti uttānīkarissanti, uppannaṁ parappavādaṁ sahadhammena suniggahitaṁ niggahetvā sappāṭihāriyaṁ dhammaṁ desessantī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Wicked One, I will not become fully extinguished until I have layman disciples who are competent, educated, assured, learned …’

root-pli-ms: Etarahi kho pana, bhante, upāsakā bhagavato sāvakā viyattā vinītā visāradā bahussutā dhammadharā dhammānudhammappaṭipannā sāmīcippaṭipannā anudhammacārino, sakaṁ ācariyakaṁ uggahetvā ācikkhanti desenti paññapenti paṭṭhapenti vivaranti vibhajanti uttānīkaronti, uppannaṁ parappavādaṁ sahadhammena suniggahitaṁ niggahetvā sappāṭihāriyaṁ dhammaṁ desenti.
translation-en-sujato: Today you do have such layman disciples.

root-pli-ms: Parinibbātu dāni, bhante, bhagavā, parinibbātu sugato, parinibbānakālo dāni, bhante, bhagavato.
translation-en-sujato: May the Blessed One now become fully extinguished! May the Holy One now become fully extinguished! Now is the time for the Buddha to become fully extinguished.

root-pli-ms: Bhāsitā kho panesā, bhante, bhagavatā vācā:
translation-en-sujato: Sir, you once made this statement:

root-pli-ms: ‘na tāvāhaṁ, pāpima, parinibbāyissāmi, yāva me upāsikā na sāvikā bhavissanti viyattā vinītā visāradā bahussutā dhammadharā dhammānudhammappaṭipannā sāmīcippaṭipannā anudhammacāriniyo, sakaṁ ācariyakaṁ uggahetvā ācikkhissanti desessanti paññapessanti paṭṭhapessanti vivarissanti vibhajissanti uttānīkarissanti, uppannaṁ parappavādaṁ sahadhammena suniggahitaṁ niggahetvā sappāṭihāriyaṁ dhammaṁ desessantī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Wicked One, I will not become fully extinguished until I have laywoman disciples who are competent, educated, assured, learned …’

root-pli-ms: Etarahi kho pana, bhante, upāsikā bhagavato sāvikā viyattā vinītā visāradā bahussutā dhammadharā dhammānudhammappaṭipannā sāmīcippaṭipannā anudhammacāriniyo, sakaṁ ācariyakaṁ uggahetvā ācikkhanti desenti paññapenti paṭṭhapenti vivaranti vibhajanti uttānīkaronti, uppannaṁ parappavādaṁ sahadhammena suniggahitaṁ niggahetvā sappāṭihāriyaṁ dhammaṁ desenti.
translation-en-sujato: Today you do have such laywoman disciples.

root-pli-ms: Parinibbātu dāni, bhante, bhagavā, parinibbātu sugato, parinibbānakālo dāni, bhante, bhagavato.
translation-en-sujato: May the Blessed One now become fully extinguished! May the Holy One now become fully extinguished! Now is the time for the Buddha to become fully extinguished.

root-pli-ms: Bhāsitā kho panesā, bhante, bhagavatā vācā:
translation-en-sujato: Sir, you once made this statement:

root-pli-ms: ‘na tāvāhaṁ, pāpima, parinibbāyissāmi, yāva me idaṁ brahmacariyaṁ na iddhañceva bhavissati phītañca vitthārikaṁ bāhujaññaṁ puthubhūtaṁ yāva devamanussehi suppakāsitan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Wicked One, I will not become fully extinguished until my spiritual life is successful and prosperous, extensive, popular, widespread, and well proclaimed wherever there are gods and humans.’

root-pli-ms: Etarahi kho pana, bhante, bhagavato brahmacariyaṁ iddhañceva phītañca vitthārikaṁ bāhujaññaṁ puthubhūtaṁ, yāva devamanussehi suppakāsitaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Today your spiritual life is successful and prosperous, extensive, popular, widespread, and well proclaimed wherever there are gods and humans.

root-pli-ms: Parinibbātu dāni, bhante, bhagavā, parinibbātu sugato, parinibbānakālo dāni, bhante, bhagavato”ti.
translation-en-sujato: May the Blessed One now become fully extinguished! May the Holy One now become fully extinguished! Now is the time for the Buddha to become fully extinguished.”

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vutte, bhagavā māraṁ pāpimantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: When this was said, the Buddha said to Māra,

root-pli-ms: “appossukko tvaṁ, pāpima, hohi, na ciraṁ tathāgatassa parinibbānaṁ bhavissati.
translation-en-sujato: “Relax, Wicked One. The final extinguishment of the Realized One will be soon.

root-pli-ms: Ito tiṇṇaṁ māsānaṁ accayena tathāgato parinibbāyissatī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Three months from now the Realized One will finally be extinguished.”

root-pli-ms: 15. Āyusaṅkhāraossajjana
translation-en-sujato: 15. Surrendering the Life Force

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā cāpāle cetiye sato sampajāno āyusaṅkhāraṁ ossaji.
translation-en-sujato: So at the Cāpāla tree shrine the Buddha, mindful and aware, surrendered the life force.
reference: csp1ed7.90, csp2ed7.90, dr10.126, mc10.96, ms7D_362, msdiv169, pts-cs3.10, pts-vp-pli2.107, sc116

root-pli-ms: Ossaṭṭhe ca bhagavatā āyusaṅkhāre mahābhūmicālo ahosi bhiṁsanako salomahaṁso, devadundubhiyo ca phaliṁsu.
translation-en-sujato: When he did so there was a great earthquake, awe-inspiring and hair-raising, and thunder cracked the sky.
variant-pli-ms: salomahaṁso → lomahaṁso (sya-all, km); lomahaṁsano (pts1ed) | devadundubhiyo → devadundabhiyo (sya-all); devadudrabhiyo (mr)

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā etamatthaṁ viditvā tāyaṁ velāyaṁ imaṁ udānaṁ udānesi:
translation-en-sujato: Then, knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:

root-pli-ms: “Tulamatulañca sambhavaṁ,
translation-en-sujato: “Weighing up the incomparable against an extension of life,

root-pli-ms: Bhavasaṅkhāramavassaji muni;
translation-en-sujato: the sage surrendered the life force.

root-pli-ms: Ajjhattarato samāhito,
translation-en-sujato: Happy inside, serene,

root-pli-ms: Abhindi kavacamivattasambhavan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: he burst out of this self-made chain like a suit of armor.”

root-pli-ms: 16. Mahābhūmicālahetu
translation-en-sujato: 16. The Causes of Earthquakes

root-pli-ms: Atha kho āyasmato ānandassa etadahosi:
translation-en-sujato: Then Venerable Ānanda thought,

root-pli-ms: “acchariyaṁ vata bho, abbhutaṁ vata bho, mahā vatāyaṁ bhūmicālo;
translation-en-sujato: “How incredible, how amazing! That was a really big earthquake!

root-pli-ms: sumahā vatāyaṁ bhūmicālo bhiṁsanako salomahaṁso; devadundubhiyo ca phaliṁsu.
translation-en-sujato: That was really a very big earthquake; awe-inspiring and hair-raising, and thunder cracked the sky!

root-pli-ms: Ko nu kho hetu ko paccayo mahato bhūmicālassa pātubhāvāyā”ti?
translation-en-sujato: What’s the cause, what’s the reason for a great earthquake?”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho āyasmā ānando yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami,
translation-en-sujato: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha,

root-pli-ms: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi,
translation-en-sujato: bowed, sat down to one side,

root-pli-ms: ekamantaṁ nisinno kho āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: and said to him,

root-pli-ms: “acchariyaṁ, bhante, abbhutaṁ, bhante.
translation-en-sujato: “How incredible, sir, how amazing!

root-pli-ms: Mahā vatāyaṁ, bhante, bhūmicālo;
translation-en-sujato: That was a really big earthquake!

root-pli-ms: sumahā vatāyaṁ, bhante, bhūmicālo bhiṁsanako salomahaṁso; devadundubhiyo ca phaliṁsu.
translation-en-sujato: That was really a very big earthquake; awe-inspiring and hair-raising, and thunder cracked the sky!

root-pli-ms: Ko nu kho, bhante, hetu ko paccayo mahato bhūmicālassa pātubhāvāyā”ti?
translation-en-sujato: What’s the cause, what’s the reason for a great earthquake?”

root-pli-ms: “Aṭṭha kho ime, ānanda, hetū, aṭṭha paccayā mahato bhūmicālassa pātubhāvāya.
translation-en-sujato: “Ānanda, there are these eight causes and reasons for a great earthquake.
reference: bj8.168, dr10.127, ms7D_366, msdiv171, ndp7.85, pts-cs3.13, pts-vp-pli2.108, sc120

root-pli-ms: Katame aṭṭha?
translation-en-sujato: What eight?

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ, ānanda, mahāpathavī udake patiṭṭhitā, udakaṁ vāte patiṭṭhitaṁ, vāto ākāsaṭṭho. Hoti kho so, ānanda, samayo, yaṁ mahāvātā vāyanti. Mahāvātā vāyantā udakaṁ kampenti. Udakaṁ kampitaṁ pathaviṁ kampeti.
translation-en-sujato: This great earth is grounded on water, the water is grounded on air, and the air stands in space. At a time when a great wind blows, it stirs the water, and the water stirs the earth.

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ paṭhamo hetu paṭhamo paccayo mahato bhūmicālassa pātubhāvāya.
translation-en-sujato: This is the first cause and reason for a great earthquake.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, ānanda, samaṇo vā hoti brāhmaṇo vā iddhimā cetovasippatto, devo vā mahiddhiko mahānubhāvo, tassa parittā pathavīsaññā bhāvitā hoti, appamāṇā āposaññā. So imaṁ pathaviṁ kampeti saṅkampeti sampakampeti sampavedheti.
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, there is an ascetic or brahmin with psychic power who has achieved mastery of the mind, or a god who is mighty and powerful. They’ve developed a limited perception of earth and a limitless perception of water. They make the earth shake and rock and tremble.

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ dutiyo hetu dutiyo paccayo mahato bhūmicālassa pātubhāvāya.
translation-en-sujato: This is the second cause and reason for a great earthquake.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, ānanda, yadā bodhisatto tusitakāyā cavitvā sato sampajāno mātukucchiṁ okkamati, tadāyaṁ pathavī kampati saṅkampati sampakampati sampavedhati.
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, when the being intent on awakening passes away from the host of Joyful Gods, he’s conceived in his mother’s belly, mindful and aware. Then the earth shakes and rocks and trembles.

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ tatiyo hetu tatiyo paccayo mahato bhūmicālassa pātubhāvāya.
translation-en-sujato: This is the third cause and reason for a great earthquake.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, ānanda, yadā bodhisatto sato sampajāno mātukucchismā nikkhamati, tadāyaṁ pathavī kampati saṅkampati sampakampati sampavedhati.
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, when the being intent on awakening comes out of his mother’s belly mindful and aware, the earth shakes and rocks and trembles.

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ catuttho hetu catuttho paccayo mahato bhūmicālassa pātubhāvāya.
translation-en-sujato: This is the fourth cause and reason for a great earthquake.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, ānanda, yadā tathāgato anuttaraṁ sammāsambodhiṁ abhisambujjhati, tadāyaṁ pathavī kampati saṅkampati sampakampati sampavedhati.
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, when the Realized One realizes the supreme perfect awakening, the earth shakes and rocks and trembles.

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ pañcamo hetu pañcamo paccayo mahato bhūmicālassa pātubhāvāya.
translation-en-sujato: This is the fifth cause and reason for a great earthquake.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, ānanda, yadā tathāgato anuttaraṁ dhammacakkaṁ pavatteti, tadāyaṁ pathavī kampati saṅkampati sampakampati sampavedhati.
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, when the Realized One rolls forth the supreme Wheel of Dhamma, the earth shakes and rocks and trembles.

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ chaṭṭho hetu chaṭṭho paccayo mahato bhūmicālassa pātubhāvāya.
translation-en-sujato: This is the sixth cause and reason for a great earthquake.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, ānanda, yadā tathāgato sato sampajāno āyusaṅkhāraṁ ossajjati, tadāyaṁ pathavī kampati saṅkampati sampakampati sampavedhati.
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, when the Realized One, mindful and aware, surrenders the life force, the earth shakes and rocks and trembles.

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ sattamo hetu sattamo paccayo mahato bhūmicālassa pātubhāvāya.
translation-en-sujato: This is the seventh cause and reason for a great earthquake.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, ānanda, yadā tathāgato anupādisesāya nibbānadhātuyā parinibbāyati, tadāyaṁ pathavī kampati saṅkampati sampakampati sampavedhati.
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, when the Realized One becomes fully extinguished through the natural principle of extinguishment, without anything left over, the earth shakes and rocks and trembles.

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ aṭṭhamo hetu aṭṭhamo paccayo mahato bhūmicālassa pātubhāvāya.
translation-en-sujato: This is the eighth cause and reason for a great earthquake.

root-pli-ms: Ime kho, ānanda, aṭṭha hetū, aṭṭha paccayā mahato bhūmicālassa pātubhāvāya.
translation-en-sujato: These are the eight causes and reasons for a great earthquake.

root-pli-ms: 17. Aṭṭhaparisā
translation-en-sujato: 17. Eight Assemblies

root-pli-ms: Aṭṭha kho imā, ānanda, parisā.
translation-en-sujato: There are, Ānanda, these eight assemblies.

root-pli-ms: Katamā aṭṭha?
translation-en-sujato: What eight?

root-pli-ms: Khattiyaparisā, brāhmaṇaparisā, gahapatiparisā, samaṇaparisā, cātumahārājikaparisā, tāvatiṁsaparisā, māraparisā, brahmaparisā.
translation-en-sujato: The assemblies of aristocrats, brahmins, householders, and ascetics. An assembly of the gods of the Four Great Kings. An assembly of the gods of the Thirty-Three. An assembly of Māras. An assembly of Brahmās.

root-pli-ms: Abhijānāmi kho panāhaṁ, ānanda, anekasataṁ khattiyaparisaṁ upasaṅkamitā.
translation-en-sujato: I recall having approached an assembly of hundreds of aristocrats.

root-pli-ms: Tatrapi mayā sannisinnapubbañceva sallapitapubbañca sākacchā ca samāpajjitapubbā.
translation-en-sujato: There I used to sit with them, converse, and engage in discussion.

root-pli-ms: Tattha yādisako tesaṁ vaṇṇo hoti, tādisako mayhaṁ vaṇṇo hoti. Yādisako tesaṁ saro hoti, tādisako mayhaṁ saro hoti.
translation-en-sujato: And my appearance and voice became just like theirs.

root-pli-ms: Dhammiyā kathāya sandassemi samādapemi samuttejemi sampahaṁsemi.
translation-en-sujato: I educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired them with a Dhamma talk.

root-pli-ms: Bhāsamānañca maṁ na jānanti:
translation-en-sujato: But when I spoke they didn’t know:

root-pli-ms: ‘ko nu kho ayaṁ bhāsati devo vā manusso vā’ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘Who is this that speaks? Is it a god or a human?’

root-pli-ms: Dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṁsetvā antaradhāyāmi.
translation-en-sujato: And when my Dhamma talk was finished I vanished.

root-pli-ms: Antarahitañca maṁ na jānanti:
translation-en-sujato: But when I vanished they didn’t know:

root-pli-ms: ‘ko nu kho ayaṁ antarahito devo vā manusso vā’ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘Who was that who vanished? Was it a god or a human?’

root-pli-ms: Abhijānāmi kho panāhaṁ, ānanda, anekasataṁ brāhmaṇaparisaṁ …pe…
translation-en-sujato: I recall having approached an assembly of hundreds of brahmins …

root-pli-ms: gahapatiparisaṁ …
translation-en-sujato: householders …

root-pli-ms: samaṇaparisaṁ …
translation-en-sujato: ascetics …

root-pli-ms: cātumahārājikaparisaṁ …
translation-en-sujato: the gods of the Four Great Kings …

root-pli-ms: tāvatiṁsaparisaṁ …
translation-en-sujato: the gods of the Thirty-Three …

root-pli-ms: māraparisaṁ …
translation-en-sujato: Māras …

root-pli-ms: brahmaparisaṁ upasaṅkamitā.
translation-en-sujato: Brahmās.

root-pli-ms: Tatrapi mayā sannisinnapubbañceva sallapitapubbañca sākacchā ca samāpajjitapubbā.
translation-en-sujato: There too I used to sit with them, converse, and engage in discussion.

root-pli-ms: Tattha yādisako tesaṁ vaṇṇo hoti, tādisako mayhaṁ vaṇṇo hoti.
translation-en-sujato: And my appearance and voice became just like theirs.

root-pli-ms: Yādisako tesaṁ saro hoti, tādisako mayhaṁ saro hoti.
Dhammiyā kathāya sandassemi samādapemi samuttejemi sampahaṁsemi.
translation-en-sujato: I educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired them with a Dhamma talk.

root-pli-ms: Bhāsamānañca maṁ na jānanti:
translation-en-sujato: But when I spoke they didn’t know:

root-pli-ms: ‘ko nu kho ayaṁ bhāsati devo vā manusso vā’ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘Who is this that speaks? Is it a god or a human?’

root-pli-ms: Dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṁsetvā antaradhāyāmi.
translation-en-sujato: And when my Dhamma talk was finished I vanished.

root-pli-ms: Antarahitañca maṁ na jānanti:
translation-en-sujato: But when I vanished they didn’t know:

root-pli-ms: ‘ko nu kho ayaṁ antarahito devo vā manusso vā’ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘Who was that who vanished? Was it a god or a human?’

root-pli-ms: Imā kho, ānanda, aṭṭha parisā.
translation-en-sujato: These are the eight assemblies.

root-pli-ms: 18. Aṭṭhaabhibhāyatana
translation-en-sujato: 18. Eight Dimensions of Mastery

root-pli-ms: Aṭṭha kho imāni, ānanda, abhibhāyatanāni.
translation-en-sujato: Ānanda, there are these eight dimensions of mastery.

root-pli-ms: Katamāni aṭṭha?
translation-en-sujato: What eight?

root-pli-ms: Ajjhattaṁ rūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati parittāni suvaṇṇadubbaṇṇāni.
translation-en-sujato: Perceiving form internally, someone sees visions externally, limited, both pretty and ugly.

root-pli-ms: ‘Tāni abhibhuyya jānāmi passāmī’ti evaṁsaññī hoti.
translation-en-sujato: Mastering them, they perceive: ‘I know and see.’

root-pli-ms: Idaṁ paṭhamaṁ abhibhāyatanaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: This is the first dimension of mastery.

root-pli-ms: Ajjhattaṁ rūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati appamāṇāni suvaṇṇadubbaṇṇāni.
translation-en-sujato: Perceiving form internally, someone sees visions externally, limitless, both pretty and ugly.

root-pli-ms: ‘Tāni abhibhuyya jānāmi passāmī’ti evaṁsaññī hoti.
translation-en-sujato: Mastering them, they perceive: ‘I know and see.’

root-pli-ms: Idaṁ dutiyaṁ abhibhāyatanaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: This is the second dimension of mastery.

root-pli-ms: Ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati parittāni suvaṇṇadubbaṇṇāni.
translation-en-sujato: Not perceiving form internally, someone sees visions externally, limited, both pretty and ugly.

root-pli-ms: ‘Tāni abhibhuyya jānāmi passāmī’ti evaṁsaññī hoti.
translation-en-sujato: Mastering them, they perceive: ‘I know and see.’

root-pli-ms: Idaṁ tatiyaṁ abhibhāyatanaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: This is the third dimension of mastery.

root-pli-ms: Ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati appamāṇāni suvaṇṇadubbaṇṇāni.
translation-en-sujato: Not perceiving form internally, someone sees visions externally, limitless, both pretty and ugly.
reference: cck10.139, csp1ed7.93, csp2ed7.93, ms7D_378, pts-cs3.28, sc132

root-pli-ms: ‘Tāni abhibhuyya jānāmi passāmī’ti evaṁsaññī hoti.
translation-en-sujato: Mastering them, they perceive: ‘I know and see.’

root-pli-ms: Idaṁ catutthaṁ abhibhāyatanaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: This is the fourth dimension of mastery.

root-pli-ms: Ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati nīlāni nīlavaṇṇāni nīlanidassanāni nīlanibhāsāni.
translation-en-sujato: Not perceiving form internally, someone sees visions externally that are blue, with blue color, blue hue, and blue tint.

root-pli-ms: Seyyathāpi nāma umāpupphaṁ nīlaṁ nīlavaṇṇaṁ nīlanidassanaṁ nīlanibhāsaṁ. Seyyathā vā pana taṁ vatthaṁ bārāṇaseyyakaṁ ubhatobhāgavimaṭṭhaṁ nīlaṁ nīlavaṇṇaṁ nīlanidassanaṁ nīlanibhāsaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: They’re like a flax flower that’s blue, with blue color, blue hue, and blue tint. Or a cloth from Bāraṇasī that’s smoothed on both sides, blue, with blue color, blue hue, and blue tint.

root-pli-ms: Evameva ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati nīlāni nīlavaṇṇāni nīlanidassanāni nīlanibhāsāni.
translation-en-sujato: In the same way, not perceiving form internally, someone sees visions externally, blue, with blue color, blue hue, and blue tint.

root-pli-ms: ‘Tāni abhibhuyya jānāmi passāmī’ti evaṁsaññī hoti.
translation-en-sujato: Mastering them, they perceive: ‘I know and see.’

root-pli-ms: Idaṁ pañcamaṁ abhibhāyatanaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: This is the fifth dimension of mastery.

root-pli-ms: Ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati pītāni pītavaṇṇāni pītanidassanāni pītanibhāsāni.
translation-en-sujato: Not perceiving form internally, someone sees visions externally that are yellow, with yellow color, yellow hue, and yellow tint.

root-pli-ms: Seyyathāpi nāma kaṇikārapupphaṁ pītaṁ pītavaṇṇaṁ pītanidassanaṁ pītanibhāsaṁ. Seyyathā vā pana taṁ vatthaṁ bārāṇaseyyakaṁ ubhatobhāgavimaṭṭhaṁ pītaṁ pītavaṇṇaṁ pītanidassanaṁ pītanibhāsaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: They’re like a champak flower that’s yellow, with yellow color, yellow hue, and yellow tint. Or a cloth from Bāraṇasī that’s smoothed on both sides, yellow, with yellow color, yellow hue, and yellow tint.

root-pli-ms: Evameva ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati pītāni pītavaṇṇāni pītanidassanāni pītanibhāsāni.
translation-en-sujato: In the same way, not perceiving form internally, someone sees visions externally that are yellow, with yellow color, yellow hue, and yellow tint.

root-pli-ms: ‘Tāni abhibhuyya jānāmi passāmī’ti evaṁsaññī hoti.
translation-en-sujato: Mastering them, they perceive: ‘I know and see.’

root-pli-ms: Idaṁ chaṭṭhaṁ abhibhāyatanaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: This is the sixth dimension of mastery.

root-pli-ms: Ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati lohitakāni lohitakavaṇṇāni lohitakanidassanāni lohitakanibhāsāni.
translation-en-sujato: Not perceiving form internally, someone sees visions externally that are red, with red color, red hue, and red tint.

root-pli-ms: Seyyathāpi nāma bandhujīvakapupphaṁ lohitakaṁ lohitakavaṇṇaṁ lohitakanidassanaṁ lohitakanibhāsaṁ. Seyyathā vā pana taṁ vatthaṁ bārāṇaseyyakaṁ ubhatobhāgavimaṭṭhaṁ lohitakaṁ lohitakavaṇṇaṁ lohitakanidassanaṁ lohitakanibhāsaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: They’re like a scarlet mallow flower that’s red, with red color, red hue, and red tint. Or a cloth from Bāraṇasī that’s smoothed on both sides, red, with red color, red hue, and red tint.

root-pli-ms: Evameva ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati lohitakāni lohitakavaṇṇāni lohitakanidassanāni lohitakanibhāsāni.
translation-en-sujato: In the same way, not perceiving form internally, someone sees visions externally that are red, with red color, red hue, and red tint.

root-pli-ms: ‘Tāni abhibhuyya jānāmi passāmī’ti evaṁsaññī hoti.
translation-en-sujato: Mastering them, they perceive: ‘I know and see.’

root-pli-ms: Idaṁ sattamaṁ abhibhāyatanaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: This is the seventh dimension of mastery.

root-pli-ms: Ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati odātāni odātavaṇṇāni odātanidassanāni odātanibhāsāni.
translation-en-sujato: Not perceiving form internally, someone sees visions externally that are white, with white color, white hue, and white tint.
reference: csp1ed7.94, csp2ed7.94, ms7D_382, ndp7.88, pts-cs3.32, sc136, sya10.131

root-pli-ms: Seyyathāpi nāma osadhitārakā odātā odātavaṇṇā odātanidassanā odātanibhāsā. Seyyathā vā pana taṁ vatthaṁ bārāṇaseyyakaṁ ubhatobhāgavimaṭṭhaṁ odātaṁ odātavaṇṇaṁ odātanidassanaṁ odātanibhāsaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: They’re like the morning star that’s white, with white color, white hue, and white tint. Or a cloth from Bāraṇasī that’s smoothed on both sides, white, with white color, white hue, and white tint.

root-pli-ms: Evameva ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati odātāni odātavaṇṇāni odātanidassanāni odātanibhāsāni.
translation-en-sujato: In the same way, not perceiving form internally, someone sees visions externally that are white, with white color, white hue, and white tint.

root-pli-ms: ‘Tāni abhibhuyya jānāmi passāmī’ti evaṁsaññī hoti.
translation-en-sujato: Mastering them, they perceive: ‘I know and see.’

root-pli-ms: Idaṁ aṭṭhamaṁ abhibhāyatanaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: This is the eighth dimension of mastery.

root-pli-ms: Imāni kho, ānanda, aṭṭha abhibhāyatanāni.
translation-en-sujato: These are the eight dimensions of mastery.

root-pli-ms: 19. Aṭṭhavimokkha
translation-en-sujato: 19. The Eight Liberations

root-pli-ms: Aṭṭha kho ime, ānanda, vimokkhā.
translation-en-sujato: Ānanda, there are these eight liberations.

root-pli-ms: Katame aṭṭha?
translation-en-sujato: What eight?

root-pli-ms: Rūpī rūpāni passati,
translation-en-sujato: Having physical form, they see visions.

root-pli-ms: ayaṁ paṭhamo vimokkho.
translation-en-sujato: This is the first liberation.

root-pli-ms: Ajjhattaṁ arūpasaññī bahiddhā rūpāni passati,
translation-en-sujato: Not perceiving form internally, they see visions externally.

root-pli-ms: ayaṁ dutiyo vimokkho.
translation-en-sujato: This is the second liberation.

root-pli-ms: Subhanteva adhimutto hoti,
translation-en-sujato: They’re focused only on beauty.

root-pli-ms: ayaṁ tatiyo vimokkho.
translation-en-sujato: This is the third liberation.

root-pli-ms: Sabbaso rūpasaññānaṁ samatikkamā paṭighasaññānaṁ atthaṅgamā nānattasaññānaṁ amanasikārā ‘ananto ākāso’ti ākāsānañcāyatanaṁ upasampajja viharati,
translation-en-sujato: Going totally beyond perceptions of form, with the ending of perceptions of impingement, not focusing on perceptions of diversity, aware that ‘space is infinite’, they enter and remain in the dimension of infinite space.

root-pli-ms: ayaṁ catuttho vimokkho.
translation-en-sujato: This is the fourth liberation.
