root-pli-ms: Sabbaso ākāsānañcāyatanaṁ samatikkamma ‘anantaṁ viññāṇan’ti viññāṇañcāyatanaṁ upasampajja viharati,
translation-en-sujato: Going totally beyond the dimension of infinite space, aware that ‘consciousness is infinite’, they enter and remain in the dimension of infinite consciousness.

root-pli-ms: ayaṁ pañcamo vimokkho.
translation-en-sujato: This is the fifth liberation.

root-pli-ms: Sabbaso viññāṇañcāyatanaṁ samatikkamma ‘natthi kiñcī’ti ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ upasampajja viharati,
translation-en-sujato: Going totally beyond the dimension of infinite consciousness, aware that ‘there is nothing at all’, they enter and remain in the dimension of nothingness.

root-pli-ms: ayaṁ chaṭṭho vimokkho.
translation-en-sujato: This is the sixth liberation.

root-pli-ms: Sabbaso ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ samatikkamma nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṁ upasampajja viharati,
translation-en-sujato: Going totally beyond the dimension of nothingness, they enter and remain in the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception.

root-pli-ms: ayaṁ sattamo vimokkho.
translation-en-sujato: This is the seventh liberation.

root-pli-ms: Sabbaso nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṁ samatikkamma saññāvedayitanirodhaṁ upasampajja viharati,
translation-en-sujato: Going totally beyond the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception, they enter and remain in the cessation of perception and feeling.

root-pli-ms: ayaṁ aṭṭhamo vimokkho.
translation-en-sujato: This is the eighth liberation.

root-pli-ms: Ime kho, ānanda, aṭṭha vimokkhā.
translation-en-sujato: These are the eight liberations.

root-pli-ms: Ekamidāhaṁ, ānanda, samayaṁ uruvelāyaṁ viharāmi najjā nerañjarāya tīre ajapālanigrodhe paṭhamābhisambuddho.
translation-en-sujato: Ānanda, this one time, when I was first awakened, I was staying near Uruvelā at the goatherd’s banyan tree on the bank of the Nerañjarā River.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, ānanda, māro pāpimā yenāhaṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhāsi. Ekamantaṁ ṭhito kho, ānanda, māro pāpimā maṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: Then Māra the wicked approached me, stood to one side, and said:

root-pli-ms: ‘parinibbātu dāni, bhante, bhagavā; parinibbātu sugato, parinibbānakālo dāni, bhante, bhagavato’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Sir, may the Blessed One now become fully extinguished! May the Holy One now become fully extinguished! Now is the time for the Buddha to become fully extinguished.’

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vutte, ahaṁ, ānanda, māraṁ pāpimantaṁ etadavocaṁ:
translation-en-sujato: When he had spoken, I said to Māra:

root-pli-ms: ‘Na tāvāhaṁ, pāpima, parinibbāyissāmi, yāva me bhikkhū na sāvakā bhavissanti viyattā vinītā visāradā bahussutā dhammadharā dhammānudhammappaṭipannā sāmīcippaṭipannā anudhammacārino, sakaṁ ācariyakaṁ uggahetvā ācikkhissanti desessanti paññapessanti paṭṭhapessanti vivarissanti vibhajissanti uttānīkarissanti, uppannaṁ parappavādaṁ sahadhammena suniggahitaṁ niggahetvā sappāṭihāriyaṁ dhammaṁ desessanti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Wicked One, I will not become fully extinguished until I have monk disciples …
reference: csp1ed7.95, csp2ed7.95, dr10.133, ms7D_386, ndp7.89, pts-cs3.35, pts-vp-pli2.113, sc139

root-pli-ms: Na tāvāhaṁ, pāpima, parinibbāyissāmi, yāva me bhikkhuniyo na sāvikā bhavissanti viyattā vinītā visāradā bahussutā dhammadharā dhammānudhammappaṭipannā sāmīcippaṭipannā anudhammacāriniyo, sakaṁ ācariyakaṁ uggahetvā ācikkhissanti desessanti paññapessanti paṭṭhapessanti vivarissanti vibhajissanti uttānīkarissanti, uppannaṁ parappavādaṁ sahadhammena suniggahitaṁ niggahetvā sappāṭihāriyaṁ dhammaṁ desessanti.
translation-en-sujato: nun disciples …

root-pli-ms: Na tāvāhaṁ, pāpima, parinibbāyissāmi, yāva me upāsakā na sāvakā bhavissanti viyattā vinītā visāradā bahussutā dhammadharā dhammānudhammappaṭipannā sāmīcippaṭipannā anudhammacārino, sakaṁ ācariyakaṁ uggahetvā ācikkhissanti desessanti paññapessanti paṭṭhapessanti vivarissanti vibhajissanti uttānīkarissanti, uppannaṁ parappavādaṁ sahadhammena suniggahitaṁ niggahetvā sappāṭihāriyaṁ dhammaṁ desessanti.
translation-en-sujato: layman disciples …

root-pli-ms: Na tāvāhaṁ, pāpima, parinibbāyissāmi, yāva me upāsikā na sāvikā bhavissanti viyattā vinītā visāradā bahussutā dhammadharā dhammānudhammappaṭipannā sāmīcippaṭipannā anudhammacāriniyo, sakaṁ ācariyakaṁ uggahetvā ācikkhissanti desessanti paññapessanti paṭṭhapessanti vivarissanti vibhajissanti uttānīkarissanti, uppannaṁ parappavādaṁ sahadhammena suniggahitaṁ niggahetvā sappāṭihāriyaṁ dhammaṁ desessanti.
translation-en-sujato: laywoman disciples who are competent, educated, assured, learned.

root-pli-ms: Na tāvāhaṁ, pāpima, parinibbāyissāmi, yāva me idaṁ brahmacariyaṁ na iddhañceva bhavissati phītañca vitthārikaṁ bāhujaññaṁ puthubhūtaṁ yāva devamanussehi suppakāsitan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: Not until my spiritual life is successful and prosperous, extensive, popular, widespread, and well proclaimed wherever there are gods and humans.’

root-pli-ms: Idāneva kho, ānanda, ajja cāpāle cetiye māro pāpimā yenāhaṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhāsi. Ekamantaṁ ṭhito kho, ānanda, māro pāpimā maṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: Today, just now at the Cāpāla shrine Māra the Wicked approached me once more with the same request, reminding me of my former statement, and saying that those conditions had been fulfilled.
reference: cck10.144, csp1ed7.96, csp2ed7.96, ms7D_391, msdiv176, ndp7.90, pts-cs3.36, pts-vp-pli2.114, sc144, sya10.134

root-pli-ms: ‘parinibbātu dāni, bhante, bhagavā, parinibbātu sugato, parinibbānakālo dāni, bhante, bhagavato.
Bhāsitā kho panesā, bhante, bhagavatā vācā:
“na tāvāhaṁ, pāpima, parinibbāyissāmi, yāva me bhikkhū na sāvakā bhavissanti …pe…
yāva me bhikkhuniyo na sāvikā bhavissanti …pe…
yāva me upāsakā na sāvakā bhavissanti …pe…
yāva me upāsikā na sāvikā bhavissanti …pe…
yāva me idaṁ brahmacariyaṁ na iddhañceva bhavissati phītañca vitthārikaṁ bāhujaññaṁ puthubhūtaṁ, yāva devamanussehi suppakāsitan”ti.
Etarahi kho pana, bhante, bhagavato brahmacariyaṁ iddhañceva phītañca vitthārikaṁ bāhujaññaṁ puthubhūtaṁ, yāva devamanussehi suppakāsitaṁ.
Parinibbātu dāni, bhante, bhagavā, parinibbātu sugato, parinibbānakālo dāni, bhante, bhagavato’ti.
Evaṁ vutte, ahaṁ, ānanda, māraṁ pāpimantaṁ etadavocaṁ:
translation-en-sujato: When he had spoken, I said to Māra:

root-pli-ms: ‘appossukko tvaṁ, pāpima, hohi, na ciraṁ tathāgatassa parinibbānaṁ bhavissati.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Relax, Wicked One. The final extinguishment of the Realized One will be soon.

root-pli-ms: Ito tiṇṇaṁ māsānaṁ accayena tathāgato parinibbāyissatī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: Three months from now the Realized One will finally be extinguished.’

root-pli-ms: Idāneva kho, ānanda, ajja cāpāle cetiye tathāgatena satena sampajānena āyusaṅkhāro ossaṭṭho”ti.
translation-en-sujato: So today, just now at the Cāpāla tree shrine, mindful and aware, I surrendered the life force.”

root-pli-ms: 20. Ānandayācanakathā
translation-en-sujato: 20. The Appeal of Ānanda

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vutte, āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: When he said this, Venerable Ānanda said to the Buddha,

root-pli-ms: “tiṭṭhatu, bhante, bhagavā kappaṁ, tiṭṭhatu sugato kappaṁ bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, may the Blessed One please remain for the eon! May the Holy One please remain for the eon! That would be for the welfare and happiness of the people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.”

root-pli-ms: “Alaṁ dāni, ānanda.
translation-en-sujato: “Enough now, Ānanda.

root-pli-ms: Mā tathāgataṁ yāci, akālo dāni, ānanda, tathāgataṁ yācanāyā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Do not beg the Realized One. Now is not the time to beg the Realized One.”

root-pli-ms: Dutiyampi kho āyasmā ānando …pe…
translation-en-sujato: For a second time …

root-pli-ms: tatiyampi kho āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: For a third time, Ānanda said to the Buddha,

root-pli-ms: “tiṭṭhatu, bhante, bhagavā kappaṁ, tiṭṭhatu sugato kappaṁ bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, may the Blessed One please remain for the eon! May the Holy One please remain for the eon! That would be for the welfare and happiness of the people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.”

root-pli-ms: “Saddahasi tvaṁ, ānanda, tathāgatassa bodhin”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “Ānanda, do you have faith in the Realized One’s awakening?”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir.”

root-pli-ms: “Atha kiñcarahi tvaṁ, ānanda, tathāgataṁ yāvatatiyakaṁ abhinippīḷesī”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “Then why do you keep pressing me up to the third time?”

root-pli-ms: “Sammukhā metaṁ, bhante, bhagavato sutaṁ sammukhā paṭiggahitaṁ:
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, I have heard and learned this in the presence of the Buddha:

root-pli-ms: ‘yassa kassaci, ānanda, cattāro iddhipādā bhāvitā bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā, so ākaṅkhamāno kappaṁ vā tiṭṭheyya kappāvasesaṁ vā.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Whoever has developed and cultivated the four bases of psychic power—made them a vehicle and a basis, kept them up, consolidated them, and properly implemented them—may, if they wish, live on for the eon or what’s left of the eon.

root-pli-ms: Tathāgatassa kho, ānanda, cattāro iddhipādā bhāvitā bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā. So ākaṅkhamāno, ānanda, tathāgato kappaṁ vā tiṭṭheyya kappāvasesaṁ vā’”ti.
translation-en-sujato: The Realized One has developed and cultivated the four bases of psychic power, made them a vehicle and a basis, kept them up, consolidated them, and properly implemented them. If he wished, the Realized One could live on for the eon or what’s left of the eon.’”

root-pli-ms: “Saddahasi tvaṁ, ānandā”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “Do you have faith, Ānanda?”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir.”

root-pli-ms: “Tasmātihānanda, tuyhevetaṁ dukkaṭaṁ, tuyhevetaṁ aparaddhaṁ, yaṁ tvaṁ tathāgatena evaṁ oḷārike nimitte kayiramāne oḷārike obhāse kayiramāne nāsakkhi paṭivijjhituṁ, na tathāgataṁ yāci:
translation-en-sujato: “Therefore, Ānanda, the misdeed is yours alone, the mistake is yours alone. For even though the Realized One dropped such an obvious hint, such a clear sign, you didn’t beg me to remain for the eon, or what’s left of it.

root-pli-ms: ‘tiṭṭhatu, bhante, bhagavā kappaṁ, tiṭṭhatu sugato kappaṁ bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānan’ti.
Sace tvaṁ, ānanda, tathāgataṁ yāceyyāsi, dveva te vācā tathāgato paṭikkhipeyya, atha tatiyakaṁ adhivāseyya.
translation-en-sujato: If you had begged me, I would have refused you twice, but consented on the third time.

root-pli-ms: Tasmātihānanda, tuyhevetaṁ dukkaṭaṁ, tuyhevetaṁ aparaddhaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Therefore, Ānanda, the misdeed is yours alone, the mistake is yours alone.

root-pli-ms: Ekamidāhaṁ, ānanda, samayaṁ rājagahe viharāmi gijjhakūṭe pabbate.
translation-en-sujato: Ānanda, this one time I was staying near Rājagaha, on the Vulture’s Peak Mountain.

root-pli-ms: Tatrāpi kho tāhaṁ, ānanda, āmantesiṁ:
translation-en-sujato: There I said to you:

root-pli-ms: ‘ramaṇīyaṁ, ānanda, rājagahaṁ, ramaṇīyo, ānanda, gijjhakūṭo pabbato.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Ānanda, Rājagaha is lovely, and so is the Vulture’s Peak.

root-pli-ms: Yassa kassaci, ānanda, cattāro iddhipādā bhāvitā bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā, so ākaṅkhamāno kappaṁ vā tiṭṭheyya kappāvasesaṁ vā.
translation-en-sujato: Whoever has developed and cultivated the four bases of psychic power—made them a vehicle and a basis, kept them up, consolidated them, and properly implemented them—may, if they wish, live on for the eon or what’s left of the eon.

root-pli-ms: Tathāgatassa kho, ānanda, cattāro iddhipādā bhāvitā bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā, so ākaṅkhamāno, ānanda, tathāgato kappaṁ vā tiṭṭheyya kappāvasesaṁ vā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: The Realized One has developed and cultivated the four bases of psychic power, made them a vehicle and a basis, kept them up, consolidated them, and properly implemented them. If he wished, the Realized One could live on for the eon or what’s left of the eon.’

root-pli-ms: Evampi kho tvaṁ, ānanda, tathāgatena oḷārike nimitte kayiramāne oḷārike obhāse kayiramāne nāsakkhi paṭivijjhituṁ, na tathāgataṁ yāci:
translation-en-sujato: But you didn’t get it, even though I dropped such an obvious hint, such a clear sign. You didn’t beg me to remain for the eon, or what’s left of it.

root-pli-ms: ‘tiṭṭhatu, bhante, bhagavā kappaṁ, tiṭṭhatu sugato kappaṁ bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānan’ti.
Sace tvaṁ, ānanda, tathāgataṁ yāceyyāsi, dveva te vācā tathāgato paṭikkhipeyya, atha tatiyakaṁ adhivāseyya.
translation-en-sujato: If you had begged me, I would have refused you twice, but consented on the third time.

root-pli-ms: Tasmātihānanda, tuyhevetaṁ dukkaṭaṁ, tuyhevetaṁ aparaddhaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Therefore, Ānanda, the misdeed is yours alone, the mistake is yours alone.

root-pli-ms: Ekamidāhaṁ, ānanda, samayaṁ tattheva rājagahe viharāmi gotamanigrodhe …pe…
translation-en-sujato: Ānanda, this one time I was staying right there near Rājagaha, at the Gotama banyan tree …

root-pli-ms: tattheva rājagahe viharāmi corapapāte …
translation-en-sujato: at Bandit’s Cliff …

root-pli-ms: tattheva rājagahe viharāmi vebhārapasse sattapaṇṇiguhāyaṁ …
translation-en-sujato: in the Sattapaṇṇi cave on the slopes of Vebhara …

root-pli-ms: tattheva rājagahe viharāmi isigilipasse kāḷasilāyaṁ …
translation-en-sujato: at the Black rock on the slopes of Isigili …

root-pli-ms: tattheva rājagahe viharāmi sītavane sappasoṇḍikapabbhāre …
translation-en-sujato: in the Cool Wood, under the Snake’s Hood Grotto …

root-pli-ms: tattheva rājagahe viharāmi tapodārāme …
translation-en-sujato: in the Hot Springs Monastery …

root-pli-ms: tattheva rājagahe viharāmi veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe …
translation-en-sujato: in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground …

root-pli-ms: tattheva rājagahe viharāmi jīvakambavane …
translation-en-sujato: in Jīvaka’s mango grove …

root-pli-ms: tattheva rājagahe viharāmi maddakucchismiṁ migadāye.
translation-en-sujato: in the Maddakucchi deer park …

root-pli-ms: Tatrāpi kho tāhaṁ, ānanda, āmantesiṁ:
translation-en-sujato: And in each place I said to you:

root-pli-ms: ‘ramaṇīyaṁ, ānanda, rājagahaṁ, ramaṇīyo gijjhakūṭo pabbato, ramaṇīyo gotamanigrodho, ramaṇīyo corapapāto, ramaṇīyā vebhārapasse sattapaṇṇiguhā, ramaṇīyā isigilipasse kāḷasilā, ramaṇīyo sītavane sappasoṇḍikapabbhāro, ramaṇīyo tapodārāmo, ramaṇīyo veḷuvane kalandakanivāpo, ramaṇīyaṁ jīvakambavanaṁ, ramaṇīyo maddakucchismiṁ migadāyo.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Ānanda, Rājagaha is lovely, and so are all these places. …

root-pli-ms: Yassa kassaci, ānanda, cattāro iddhipādā bhāvitā bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā …pe…
ākaṅkhamāno, ānanda, tathāgato kappaṁ vā tiṭṭheyya kappāvasesaṁ vā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: If he wished, the Realized One could live on for the eon or what’s left of the eon.’

root-pli-ms: Evampi kho tvaṁ, ānanda, tathāgatena oḷārike nimitte kayiramāne oḷārike obhāse kayiramāne nāsakkhi paṭivijjhituṁ, na tathāgataṁ yāci:
translation-en-sujato: But you didn’t get it, even though I dropped such an obvious hint, such a clear sign. You didn’t beg me to remain for the eon, or what’s left of it.

root-pli-ms: ‘tiṭṭhatu, bhante, bhagavā kappaṁ, tiṭṭhatu sugato kappaṁ bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānan’ti.
Sace tvaṁ, ānanda, tathāgataṁ yāceyyāsi, dveva te vācā tathāgato paṭikkhipeyya, atha tatiyakaṁ adhivāseyya.
Tasmātihānanda, tuyhevetaṁ dukkaṭaṁ, tuyhevetaṁ aparaddhaṁ.
Ekamidāhaṁ, ānanda, samayaṁ idheva vesāliyaṁ viharāmi udene cetiye.
translation-en-sujato: Ānanda, this one time I was staying right here near Vesālī, at the Udena shrine …

root-pli-ms: Tatrāpi kho tāhaṁ, ānanda, āmantesiṁ:
‘ramaṇīyā, ānanda, vesālī, ramaṇīyaṁ udenaṁ cetiyaṁ.
Yassa kassaci, ānanda, cattāro iddhipādā bhāvitā bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā, so ākaṅkhamāno kappaṁ vā tiṭṭheyya kappāvasesaṁ vā.
Tathāgatassa kho, ānanda, cattāro iddhipādā bhāvitā bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā, so ākaṅkhamāno, ānanda, tathāgato kappaṁ vā tiṭṭheyya kappāvasesaṁ vā’ti.
Evampi kho tvaṁ, ānanda, tathāgatena oḷārike nimitte kayiramāne oḷārike obhāse kayiramāne nāsakkhi paṭivijjhituṁ, na tathāgataṁ yāci:
‘tiṭṭhatu, bhante, bhagavā kappaṁ, tiṭṭhatu sugato kappaṁ bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānan’ti.
Sace tvaṁ, ānanda, tathāgataṁ yāceyyāsi, dveva te vācā tathāgato paṭikkhipeyya, atha tatiyakaṁ adhivāseyya, tasmātihānanda, tuyhevetaṁ dukkaṭaṁ, tuyhevetaṁ aparaddhaṁ.
Ekamidāhaṁ, ānanda, samayaṁ idheva vesāliyaṁ viharāmi gotamake cetiye …pe…
translation-en-sujato: at the Gotamaka shrine …
reference: cck10.149, csp1ed7.99, csp2ed7.99, mc10.106, ms7D_399, msdiv182, ndp7.93, pts-cs3.46, pts-vp-pli2.118, sc152, sya10.139, vri2.91

root-pli-ms: idheva vesāliyaṁ viharāmi sattambe cetiye …
translation-en-sujato: at the Sattamba shrine …

root-pli-ms: idheva vesāliyaṁ viharāmi bahuputte cetiye …
translation-en-sujato: at the Many Sons shrine …

root-pli-ms: idheva vesāliyaṁ viharāmi sārandade cetiye …
translation-en-sujato: at the Sārandada shrine …

root-pli-ms: idāneva kho tāhaṁ, ānanda, ajja cāpāle cetiye āmantesiṁ:
translation-en-sujato: and just now, today at the Cāpāla shrine. There I said to you:

root-pli-ms: ‘ramaṇīyā, ānanda, vesālī, ramaṇīyaṁ udenaṁ cetiyaṁ, ramaṇīyaṁ gotamakaṁ cetiyaṁ, ramaṇīyaṁ sattambaṁ cetiyaṁ, ramaṇīyaṁ bahuputtaṁ cetiyaṁ, ramaṇīyaṁ sārandadaṁ cetiyaṁ, ramaṇīyaṁ cāpālaṁ cetiyaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Ānanda, Vesālī is lovely. And the Udena, Gotamaka, Sattamba, Bahuputta, Sārandada, and Cāpāla shrines are all lovely.

root-pli-ms: Yassa kassaci, ānanda, cattāro iddhipādā bhāvitā bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā, so ākaṅkhamāno kappaṁ vā tiṭṭheyya kappāvasesaṁ vā.
translation-en-sujato: Whoever has developed and cultivated the four bases of psychic power—made them a vehicle and a basis, kept them up, consolidated them, and properly implemented them—may, if they wish, live on for the eon or what’s left of the eon.

root-pli-ms: Tathāgatassa kho, ānanda, cattāro iddhipādā bhāvitā bahulīkatā yānīkatā vatthukatā anuṭṭhitā paricitā susamāraddhā, so ākaṅkhamāno, ānanda, tathāgato kappaṁ vā tiṭṭheyya kappāvasesaṁ vā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: The Realized One has developed and cultivated the four bases of psychic power, made them a vehicle and a basis, kept them up, consolidated them, and properly implemented them. If he wished, the Realized One could live on for the eon or what’s left of the eon.’

root-pli-ms: Evampi kho tvaṁ, ānanda, tathāgatena oḷārike nimitte kayiramāne oḷārike obhāse kayiramāne nāsakkhi paṭivijjhituṁ, na tathāgataṁ yāci:
translation-en-sujato: But you didn’t get it, even though I dropped such an obvious hint, such a clear sign. You didn’t beg me to remain for the eon, or what’s left of it, saying:

root-pli-ms: ‘tiṭṭhatu bhagavā kappaṁ, tiṭṭhatu sugato kappaṁ bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Sir, may the Blessed One please remain for the eon! May the Holy One please remain for the eon! That would be for the welfare and happiness of the people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.’

root-pli-ms: Sace tvaṁ, ānanda, tathāgataṁ yāceyyāsi, dveva te vācā tathāgato paṭikkhipeyya, atha tatiyakaṁ adhivāseyya.
translation-en-sujato: If you had begged me, I would have refused you twice, but consented on the third time.

root-pli-ms: Tasmātihānanda, tuyhevetaṁ dukkaṭaṁ, tuyhevetaṁ aparaddhaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Therefore, Ānanda, the misdeed is yours alone, the mistake is yours alone.

root-pli-ms: Nanu etaṁ, ānanda, mayā paṭikacceva akkhātaṁ:
translation-en-sujato: Did I not prepare for this when I explained that
variant-pli-ms: paṭikacceva → paṭigacceva (bj, pts1ed) | etaṁ → evaṁ (sya-all, km, pts1ed)

root-pli-ms: ‘sabbeheva piyehi manāpehi nānābhāvo vinābhāvo aññathābhāvo.
translation-en-sujato: we must be parted and separated from all we hold dear and beloved?

root-pli-ms: Taṁ kutettha, ānanda, labbhā, yaṁ taṁ jātaṁ bhūtaṁ saṅkhataṁ palokadhammaṁ, taṁ vata mā palujjīti netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati’.
translation-en-sujato: How could it possibly be so that what is born, created, conditioned, and liable to fall apart should not fall apart?

root-pli-ms: Yaṁ kho panetaṁ, ānanda, tathāgatena cattaṁ vantaṁ muttaṁ pahīnaṁ paṭinissaṭṭhaṁ ossaṭṭho āyusaṅkhāro, ekaṁsena vācā bhāsitā:
translation-en-sujato: The Realized One has discarded, eliminated, released, given up, relinquished, and surrendered the life force. He has definitively stated:

root-pli-ms: ‘na ciraṁ tathāgatassa parinibbānaṁ bhavissati.
translation-en-sujato: ‘The final extinguishment of the Realized One will be soon.

root-pli-ms: Ito tiṇṇaṁ māsānaṁ accayena tathāgato parinibbāyissatī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: Three months from now the Realized One will finally be extinguished.’

root-pli-ms: Tañca tathāgato jīvitahetu puna paccāvamissatīti netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
translation-en-sujato: It’s not possible for the Realized One, for the sake of life, to take back the life force once it has been given up like that.
comment-en-sujato: paccāvamissati has several variants, but this should be the correct one. It occurs in Ja 69 and Ja 509, where it is the opposite of vamati (which is in the passage above), i.e. you wouldn’t swallow back what you have vomited out. Comm: Puna paccāvamissatīti yaṁ cattaṁ vantaṁ, taṁ vata puna paṭikhādissatīti attho

root-pli-ms: Āyāmānanda, yena mahāvanaṁ kūṭāgārasālā tenupasaṅkamissāmā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Come, Ānanda, let’s go to the Great Wood, the hall with the peaked roof.”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paccassosi.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” Ānanda replied.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmatā ānandena saddhiṁ yena mahāvanaṁ kūṭāgārasālā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: So the Buddha went with Ānanda to the hall with the peaked roof, and said to him,

root-pli-ms: “gaccha tvaṁ, ānanda, yāvatikā bhikkhū vesāliṁ upanissāya viharanti, te sabbe upaṭṭhānasālāyaṁ sannipātehī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Go, Ānanda, gather all the mendicants staying in the vicinity of Vesālī together in the assembly hall.”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paṭissutvā yāvatikā bhikkhū vesāliṁ upanissāya viharanti, te sabbe upaṭṭhānasālāyaṁ sannipātetvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhāsi. Ekamantaṁ ṭhito kho āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” replied Ānanda. He did what the Buddha asked, went up to him, bowed, stood to one side, and said to him,

root-pli-ms: “sannipatito, bhante, bhikkhusaṅgho, yassadāni, bhante, bhagavā kālaṁ maññatī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, the mendicant Saṅgha has assembled. Please, sir, go at your convenience.”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā yenupaṭṭhānasālā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha went to the assembly hall, where he sat on the seat spread out

root-pli-ms: Nisajja kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: and addressed the mendicants:

root-pli-ms: “tasmātiha, bhikkhave, ye te mayā dhammā abhiññā desitā, te vo sādhukaṁ uggahetvā āsevitabbā bhāvetabbā bahulīkātabbā, yathayidaṁ brahmacariyaṁ addhaniyaṁ assa ciraṭṭhitikaṁ, tadassa bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: “So, mendicants, having carefully memorized those things I have taught you from my direct knowledge, you should cultivate, develop, and make much of them so that this spiritual practice may last for a long time. That would be for the welfare and happiness of the people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.

root-pli-ms: Katame ca te, bhikkhave, dhammā mayā abhiññā desitā, ye vo sādhukaṁ uggahetvā āsevitabbā bhāvetabbā bahulīkātabbā, yathayidaṁ brahmacariyaṁ addhaniyaṁ assa ciraṭṭhitikaṁ, tadassa bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: And what are those things I have taught from my direct knowledge?

root-pli-ms: Seyyathidaṁ—cattāro satipaṭṭhānā, cattāro sammappadhānā, cattāro iddhipādā, pañcindriyāni, pañca balāni, satta bojjhaṅgā, ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo.
translation-en-sujato: They are: the four kinds of mindfulness meditation, the four right efforts, the four bases of psychic power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven awakening factors, and the noble eightfold path.

root-pli-ms: Ime kho te, bhikkhave, dhammā mayā abhiññā desitā, ye vo sādhukaṁ uggahetvā āsevitabbā bhāvetabbā bahulīkātabbā, yathayidaṁ brahmacariyaṁ addhaniyaṁ assa ciraṭṭhitikaṁ, tadassa bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: These are the things I have taught from my direct knowledge. Having carefully memorized them, you should cultivate, develop, and make much of them so that this spiritual practice may last for a long time. That would be for the welfare and happiness of the people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha said to the mendicants:
reference: cck10.152, csp1ed7.101, csp2ed7.101, ms7D_404, msdiv185, sc156

root-pli-ms: “handa dāni, bhikkhave, āmantayāmi vo,
translation-en-sujato: “Come now, mendicants, I say to you all:

root-pli-ms: vayadhammā saṅkhārā, appamādena sampādetha.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Conditions fall apart. Persist with diligence.’

root-pli-ms: Naciraṁ tathāgatassa parinibbānaṁ bhavissati.
translation-en-sujato: The final extinguishment of the Realized One will be soon.

root-pli-ms: Ito tiṇṇaṁ māsānaṁ accayena tathāgato parinibbāyissatī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Three months from now the Realized One will finally be extinguished.”

root-pli-ms: Idamavoca bhagavā.
translation-en-sujato: That is what the Buddha said.

root-pli-ms: Idaṁ vatvāna sugato athāparaṁ etadavoca satthā:
translation-en-sujato: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:
variant-pli-ms: satthā → ito paraṁ sya-all potthakesu evampi pāṭho dissati

root-pli-ms: “Paripakko vayo mayhaṁ,
translation-en-sujato: “I’ve reached a ripe old age,

root-pli-ms: parittaṁ mama jīvitaṁ;
translation-en-sujato: and little of my life is left.

root-pli-ms: Pahāya vo gamissāmi,
translation-en-sujato: Having given it up, I’ll depart;

root-pli-ms: kataṁ me saraṇamattano.
translation-en-sujato: I’ve made a refuge for myself.

root-pli-ms: Appamattā satīmanto,
translation-en-sujato: Diligent and mindful,

root-pli-ms: susīlā hotha bhikkhavo;
translation-en-sujato: be of good virtues, mendicants!

root-pli-ms: Susamāhitasaṅkappā,
translation-en-sujato: With well-settled thoughts,
comment-en-sujato: Cp. AN 4.22

root-pli-ms: sacittamanurakkhatha.
translation-en-sujato: take good care of your minds.

root-pli-ms: Yo imasmiṁ dhammavinaye,
translation-en-sujato: Whoever meditates diligently

root-pli-ms: appamatto vihassati;
translation-en-sujato: in this teaching and training,

root-pli-ms: Pahāya jātisaṁsāraṁ,
translation-en-sujato: giving up transmigration through rebirths,

root-pli-ms: dukkhassantaṁ karissatī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: will make an end to suffering.”

root-pli-ms: Tatiyo bhāṇavāro.
21. Nāgāpalokita
translation-en-sujato: 21. The Elephant Look

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya vesāliṁ piṇḍāya pāvisi.
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, entered Vesālī for alms.

root-pli-ms: Vesāliyaṁ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṁ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto nāgāpalokitaṁ vesāliṁ apaloketvā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: Then, after the meal, on his return from alms-round, he turned his whole body, the way that elephants do, to look back at Vesālī. He said to Venerable Ānanda:

root-pli-ms: “idaṁ pacchimakaṁ, ānanda, tathāgatassa vesāliyā dassanaṁ bhavissati.
translation-en-sujato: “Ānanda, this will be the last time the Realized One sees Vesālī.

root-pli-ms: Āyāmānanda, yena bhaṇḍagāmo tenupasaṅkamissāmā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Come, Ānanda, let’s go to Bhaṇḍagāma.”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paccassosi.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” Ānanda replied.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ yena bhaṇḍagāmo tadavasari.
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha together with a large Saṅgha of mendicants arrived at Bhaṇḍagāma,

root-pli-ms: Tatra sudaṁ bhagavā bhaṇḍagāme viharati.
translation-en-sujato: and stayed there.

root-pli-ms: Tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:

root-pli-ms: “catunnaṁ, bhikkhave, dhammānaṁ ananubodhā appaṭivedhā evamidaṁ dīghamaddhānaṁ sandhāvitaṁ saṁsaritaṁ mamañceva tumhākañca.
translation-en-sujato: “Mendicants, not understanding and not penetrating four things, both you and I have wandered and transmigrated for such a very long time.

root-pli-ms: Katamesaṁ catunnaṁ?
translation-en-sujato: What four?

root-pli-ms: Ariyassa, bhikkhave, sīlassa ananubodhā appaṭivedhā evamidaṁ dīghamaddhānaṁ sandhāvitaṁ saṁsaritaṁ mamañceva tumhākañca.
translation-en-sujato: Noble ethics,

root-pli-ms: Ariyassa, bhikkhave, samādhissa ananubodhā appaṭivedhā evamidaṁ dīghamaddhānaṁ sandhāvitaṁ saṁsaritaṁ mamañceva tumhākañca.
translation-en-sujato: immersion,

root-pli-ms: Ariyāya, bhikkhave, paññāya ananubodhā appaṭivedhā evamidaṁ dīghamaddhānaṁ sandhāvitaṁ saṁsaritaṁ mamañceva tumhākañca.
translation-en-sujato: wisdom,

root-pli-ms: Ariyāya, bhikkhave, vimuttiyā ananubodhā appaṭivedhā evamidaṁ dīghamaddhānaṁ sandhāvitaṁ saṁsaritaṁ mamañceva tumhākañca.
translation-en-sujato: and freedom.

root-pli-ms: Tayidaṁ, bhikkhave, ariyaṁ sīlaṁ anubuddhaṁ paṭividdhaṁ, ariyo samādhi anubuddho paṭividdho, ariyā paññā anubuddhā paṭividdhā, ariyā vimutti anubuddhā paṭividdhā, ucchinnā bhavataṇhā, khīṇā bhavanetti, natthi dāni punabbhavo”ti.
translation-en-sujato: These noble ethics, immersion, wisdom, and freedom have been understood and comprehended. Craving for continued existence has been cut off; the attachment to continued existence is ended; now there are no more future lives.”

root-pli-ms: Idamavoca bhagavā.
translation-en-sujato: That is what the Buddha said.

root-pli-ms: Idaṁ vatvāna sugato athāparaṁ etadavoca satthā:
translation-en-sujato: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:

root-pli-ms: “Sīlaṁ samādhi paññā ca,
translation-en-sujato: “Ethics, immersion, and wisdom,

root-pli-ms: vimutti ca anuttarā;
translation-en-sujato: and the supreme freedom:

root-pli-ms: Anubuddhā ime dhammā,
translation-en-sujato: these things have been understood

root-pli-ms: gotamena yasassinā.
translation-en-sujato: by Gotama the renowned.

root-pli-ms: Iti buddho abhiññāya,
translation-en-sujato: And so the Buddha, having insight,

root-pli-ms: dhammamakkhāsi bhikkhunaṁ;
translation-en-sujato: explained this teaching to the mendicants.

root-pli-ms: Dukkhassantakaro satthā,
translation-en-sujato: The teacher made an end of suffering,

root-pli-ms: cakkhumā parinibbuto”ti.
translation-en-sujato: seeing clearly, he is extinguished.”

root-pli-ms: Tatrāpi sudaṁ bhagavā bhaṇḍagāme viharanto etadeva bahulaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ karoti:
translation-en-sujato: And while staying there, too, he often gave this Dhamma talk to the mendicants:

root-pli-ms: “iti sīlaṁ, iti samādhi, iti paññā.
translation-en-sujato: “Such is ethics, such is immersion, such is wisdom.

root-pli-ms: Sīlaparibhāvito samādhi mahapphalo hoti mahānisaṁso.
translation-en-sujato: When immersion is imbued with ethics it’s very fruitful and beneficial.

root-pli-ms: Samādhiparibhāvitā paññā mahapphalā hoti mahānisaṁsā.
translation-en-sujato: When wisdom is imbued with immersion it’s very fruitful and beneficial.

root-pli-ms: Paññāparibhāvitaṁ cittaṁ sammadeva āsavehi vimuccati, seyyathidaṁ—
translation-en-sujato: When the mind is imbued with wisdom it is rightly freed from the defilements, namely,

root-pli-ms: kāmāsavā, bhavāsavā, avijjāsavā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: the defilements of sensuality, desire to be reborn, and ignorance.”

root-pli-ms: 22. Catumahāpadesakathā
translation-en-sujato: 22. The Four Great References

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā bhaṇḍagāme yathābhirantaṁ viharitvā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: When the Buddha had stayed in Bhaṇḍagāma as long as he wished, he addressed Ānanda,
reference: cck10.155, csp1ed7.103, csp2ed7.103, ms7D_414, msdiv187, pts-cs4.5, pts-vp-pli2.124, sc165, sya10.144

root-pli-ms: “āyāmānanda, yena hatthigāmo,
translation-en-sujato: “Come, Ānanda, let’s go to Hatthigāma.”…

root-pli-ms: yena ambagāmo,
translation-en-sujato: “Let’s go to Ambagāma.”…

root-pli-ms: yena jambugāmo,
translation-en-sujato: “Let’s go to Jambugāma.”…

root-pli-ms: yena bhoganagaraṁ tenupasaṅkamissāmā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Let’s go to Bhoganagara.”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paccassosi.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” Ānanda replied.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ yena bhoganagaraṁ tadavasari.
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha together with a large Saṅgha of mendicants arrived at Bhoganagara,

root-pli-ms: Tatra sudaṁ bhagavā bhoganagare viharati ānande cetiye.
translation-en-sujato: where he stayed at the Ānanda shrine.

root-pli-ms: Tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:

root-pli-ms: “cattārome, bhikkhave, mahāpadese desessāmi,
translation-en-sujato: “Mendicants, I will teach you the four great references.

root-pli-ms: taṁ suṇātha, sādhukaṁ manasikarotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” they replied.

root-pli-ms: Bhagavā etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: The Buddha said this:

root-pli-ms: “Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṁ vadeyya:
translation-en-sujato: “Take a mendicant who says:

root-pli-ms: ‘sammukhā metaṁ, āvuso, bhagavato sutaṁ sammukhā paṭiggahitaṁ,
translation-en-sujato: ‘Reverend, I have heard and learned this in the presence of the Buddha:

root-pli-ms: ayaṁ dhammo ayaṁ vinayo idaṁ satthusāsanan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: this is the teaching, this is the training, this is the Teacher’s instruction.’

root-pli-ms: Tassa, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno bhāsitaṁ neva abhinanditabbaṁ nappaṭikkositabbaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: You should neither approve nor dismiss that mendicant’s statement.

root-pli-ms: Anabhinanditvā appaṭikkositvā tāni padabyañjanāni sādhukaṁ uggahetvā sutte osāretabbāni, vinaye sandassetabbāni.
translation-en-sujato: Instead, you should carefully memorize those words and phrases, then check if they’re included in the discourses or found in the texts on monastic training.

root-pli-ms: Tāni ce sutte osāriyamānāni vinaye sandassiyamānāni na ceva sutte osaranti, na ca vinaye sandissanti, niṭṭhamettha gantabbaṁ:
translation-en-sujato: If they’re not included in the discourses or found in the texts on monastic training, you should draw the conclusion:
variant-pli-ms: osaranti → otaranti (bj, pts1ed) | osāriyamānāni → otāriyamānāni (bj, pts1ed)

root-pli-ms: ‘addhā idaṁ na ceva tassa bhagavato vacanaṁ;
translation-en-sujato: ‘Clearly this is not the word of the Buddha.

root-pli-ms: imassa ca bhikkhuno duggahitan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: It has been incorrectly memorized by that mendicant.’

root-pli-ms: Iti hetaṁ, bhikkhave, chaḍḍeyyātha.
translation-en-sujato: And so you should reject it.

root-pli-ms: Tāni ce sutte osāriyamānāni vinaye sandassiyamānāni sutte ceva osaranti, vinaye ca sandissanti, niṭṭhamettha gantabbaṁ:
translation-en-sujato: If they are included in the discourses or found in the texts on monastic training, you should draw the conclusion:

root-pli-ms: ‘addhā idaṁ tassa bhagavato vacanaṁ;
translation-en-sujato: ‘Clearly this is the word of the Buddha.

root-pli-ms: imassa ca bhikkhuno suggahitan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: It has been correctly memorized by that mendicant.’

root-pli-ms: Idaṁ, bhikkhave, paṭhamaṁ mahāpadesaṁ dhāreyyātha. (1)
translation-en-sujato: You should remember it. This is the first great reference.
comment-en-sujato: See my note on this phrase in AN 4.180.

translation-en-sujato: Take another mendicant who says:

root-pli-ms: ‘amukasmiṁ nāma āvāse saṅgho viharati sathero sapāmokkho.
translation-en-sujato: ‘In such-and-such monastery lives a Saṅgha with seniors and leaders.

root-pli-ms: Tassa me saṅghassa sammukhā sutaṁ sammukhā paṭiggahitaṁ,
translation-en-sujato: I’ve heard and learned this in the presence of that Saṅgha:

root-pli-ms: ayaṁ dhammo ayaṁ vinayo idaṁ satthusāsanan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: this is the teaching, this is the training, this is the Teacher’s instruction.’

translation-en-sujato: You should neither approve nor dismiss that mendicant’s statement.

root-pli-ms: Anabhinanditvā appaṭikkositvā tāni padabyañjanāni sādhukaṁ uggahetvā sutte osāretabbāni, vinaye sandassetabbāni.

translation-en-sujato: If they’re not included in the discourses or found in the texts on monastic training, you should draw the conclusion:

root-pli-ms: tassa ca saṅghassa duggahitan’ti.

root-pli-ms: tassa ca saṅghassa suggahitan’ti.

translation-en-sujato: You should remember it. This is the fourth great reference.

root-pli-ms: Tatrapi sudaṁ bhagavā bhoganagare viharanto ānande cetiye etadeva bahulaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ karoti:
translation-en-sujato: And while staying at the Ānanda shrine, too, the Buddha often gave this Dhamma talk to the mendicants:

root-pli-ms: “iti sīlaṁ, iti samādhi, iti paññā.
translation-en-sujato: “Such is ethics, such is immersion, such is wisdom.

root-pli-ms: Sīlaparibhāvito samādhi mahapphalo hoti mahānisaṁso.
translation-en-sujato: When immersion is imbued with ethics it’s very fruitful and beneficial.

root-pli-ms: Samādhiparibhāvitā paññā mahapphalā hoti mahānisaṁsā.
translation-en-sujato: When wisdom is imbued with immersion it’s very fruitful and beneficial.

root-pli-ms: Paññāparibhāvitaṁ cittaṁ sammadeva āsavehi vimuccati, seyyathidaṁ—
translation-en-sujato: When the mind is imbued with wisdom it is rightly freed from the defilements, namely,

root-pli-ms: kāmāsavā, bhavāsavā, avijjāsavā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: the defilements of sensuality, desire to be reborn, and ignorance.”

root-pli-ms: 23. Kammāraputtacundavatthu
translation-en-sujato: 23. On Cunda the Smith

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā bhoganagare yathābhirantaṁ viharitvā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: When the Buddha had stayed in Bhoganagara as long as he wished, he addressed Ānanda,

root-pli-ms: “āyāmānanda, yena pāvā tenupasaṅkamissāmā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Come, Ānanda, let’s go to Pāvā.”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paccassosi.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” Ānanda replied.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ yena pāvā tadavasari.
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha together with a large Saṅgha of mendicants arrived at Pāvā,

root-pli-ms: Tatra sudaṁ bhagavā pāvāyaṁ viharati cundassa kammāraputtassa ambavane.
translation-en-sujato: where he stayed in Cunda the smith’s mango grove.

root-pli-ms: Assosi kho cundo kammāraputto: “bhagavā kira pāvaṁ anuppatto, pāvāyaṁ viharati mayhaṁ ambavane”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Cunda heard that the Buddha had arrived and was staying in his mango grove.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho cundo kammāraputto yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
translation-en-sujato: Then he went to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side.

root-pli-ms: Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho cundaṁ kammāraputtaṁ bhagavā dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi.
translation-en-sujato: The Buddha educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired him with a Dhamma talk.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho cundo kammāraputto bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya sandassito samādapito samuttejito sampahaṁsito bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: Then Cunda said to the Buddha,

root-pli-ms: “adhivāsetu me, bhante, bhagavā svātanāya bhattaṁ saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghenā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, may the Buddha together with the mendicant Saṅgha please accept tomorrow’s meal from me.”

root-pli-ms: Adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena.
translation-en-sujato: The Buddha consented in silence.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho cundo kammāraputto bhagavato adhivāsanaṁ viditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā pakkāmi.
translation-en-sujato: Then, knowing that the Buddha had consented, Cunda got up from his seat, bowed, and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on his right, before leaving.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho cundo kammāraputto tassā rattiyā accayena sake nivesane paṇītaṁ khādanīyaṁ bhojanīyaṁ paṭiyādāpetvā pahūtañca sūkaramaddavaṁ bhagavato kālaṁ ārocāpesi:
translation-en-sujato: And when the night had passed Cunda had a variety of delicious foods prepared in his own home, and plenty of pork on the turn. Then he had the Buddha informed of the time, saying,
comment-en-sujato: https://discourse.suttacentral.net/t/putting-the-tender-in-tender-pork/5762

root-pli-ms: “kālo, bhante, niṭṭhitaṁ bhattan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, it’s time. The meal is ready.”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghena yena cundassa kammāraputtassa nivesanaṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā paññatte āsane nisīdi.
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, went to the home of Cunda together with the mendicant Saṅgha, where he sat on the seat spread out

root-pli-ms: Nisajja kho bhagavā cundaṁ kammāraputtaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: and addressed Cunda,

root-pli-ms: “yaṁ te, cunda, sūkaramaddavaṁ paṭiyattaṁ, tena maṁ parivisa.
translation-en-sujato: “Cunda, please serve me with the pork on the turn that you’ve prepared.

root-pli-ms: Yaṁ panaññaṁ khādanīyaṁ bhojanīyaṁ paṭiyattaṁ, tena bhikkhusaṅghaṁ parivisā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: And serve the mendicant Saṅgha with the other foods.”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho cundo kammāraputto bhagavato paṭissutvā yaṁ ahosi sūkaramaddavaṁ paṭiyattaṁ, tena bhagavantaṁ parivisi.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” replied Cunda, and did as he was asked.

root-pli-ms: Yaṁ panaññaṁ khādanīyaṁ bhojanīyaṁ paṭiyattaṁ, tena bhikkhusaṅghaṁ parivisi.
Atha kho bhagavā cundaṁ kammāraputtaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha addressed Cunda,

root-pli-ms: “yaṁ te, cunda, sūkaramaddavaṁ avasiṭṭhaṁ, taṁ sobbhe nikhaṇāhi.
translation-en-sujato: “Cunda, any pork on the turn that’s left over, you should bury it in a pond.

root-pli-ms: Nāhaṁ taṁ, cunda, passāmi sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya, yassa taṁ paribhuttaṁ sammā pariṇāmaṁ gaccheyya aññatra tathāgatassā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: I don’t see anyone in this world—with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, its gods and humans—who could properly digest it except for the Realized One.”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho cundo kammāraputto bhagavato paṭissutvā yaṁ ahosi sūkaramaddavaṁ avasiṭṭhaṁ, taṁ sobbhe nikhaṇitvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” replied Cunda. He did as he was asked, then came back to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side.

root-pli-ms: Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho cundaṁ kammāraputtaṁ bhagavā dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṁsetvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired him with a Dhamma talk, after which he got up from his seat and left.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavato cundassa kammāraputtassa bhattaṁ bhuttāvissa kharo ābādho uppajji, lohitapakkhandikā pabāḷhā vedanā vattanti māraṇantikā.
translation-en-sujato: After the Buddha had eaten Cunda’s meal, he fell severely ill with bloody dysentery, struck by dreadful pains, close to death.
reference: dr10.149, ms7D_423, msdiv190, pts-cs4.20, pts-vp-pli2.128, sc173

root-pli-ms: Tā sudaṁ bhagavā sato sampajāno adhivāsesi avihaññamāno.
translation-en-sujato: But he endured with mindfulness and situational awareness, without worrying.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: Then he addressed Ānanda,

root-pli-ms: “āyāmānanda, yena kusinārā tenupasaṅkamissāmā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Come, Ānanda, let’s go to Kusinārā.”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paccassosi.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” Ānanda replied.

root-pli-ms: Cundassa bhattaṁ bhuñjitvā,
translation-en-sujato: I’ve heard that after eating

root-pli-ms: kammārassāti me sutaṁ;
translation-en-sujato: the meal of Cunda the smith,

root-pli-ms: Ābādhaṁ samphusī dhīro,
translation-en-sujato: the wise one fell severely ill,

root-pli-ms: pabāḷhaṁ māraṇantikaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: with pains, close to death.

root-pli-ms: Bhuttassa ca sūkaramaddavena,
translation-en-sujato: A severe sickness attacked the Teacher

root-pli-ms: Byādhippabāḷho udapādi satthuno;
translation-en-sujato: who had eaten the pork on the turn.

root-pli-ms: Virecamāno bhagavā avoca,
translation-en-sujato: While still purging the Buddha said:

root-pli-ms: “Gacchāmahaṁ kusināraṁ nagaran”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “I’ll go to the citadel of Kusinārā.”

root-pli-ms: 24. Pānīyāharaṇa
translation-en-sujato: 24. Bringing a Drink

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā maggā okkamma yena aññataraṁ rukkhamūlaṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha left the road and went to the root of a tree, where he addressed Ānanda,

root-pli-ms: “iṅgha me tvaṁ, ānanda, catugguṇaṁ saṅghāṭiṁ paññapehi, kilantosmi, ānanda, nisīdissāmī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Please, Ānanda, fold my outer robe in four and spread it out for me. I am tired and will sit down.”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paṭissutvā catugguṇaṁ saṅghāṭiṁ paññapesi.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” replied Ānanda, and did as he was asked.

root-pli-ms: Nisīdi bhagavā paññatte āsane.
translation-en-sujato: The Buddha sat on the seat spread out.

root-pli-ms: Nisajja kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: When he was seated he said to Venerable Ānanda,

root-pli-ms: “iṅgha me tvaṁ, ānanda, pānīyaṁ āhara, pipāsitosmi, ānanda, pivissāmī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Please, Ānanda, fetch me some water. I am thirsty and will drink.”

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vutte, āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: When he said this, Venerable Ānanda said to the Buddha,

root-pli-ms: “idāni, bhante, pañcamattāni sakaṭasatāni atikkantāni, taṁ cakkacchinnaṁ udakaṁ parittaṁ luḷitaṁ āvilaṁ sandati.
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, just now around five hundred carts have passed by. The shallow water has been churned up by their wheels, and it flows cloudy and murky.

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ, bhante, kakudhā nadī avidūre acchodakā sātodakā sītodakā setodakā suppatitthā ramaṇīyā.
translation-en-sujato: The Kakutthā river is not far away, with clear, sweet, cool water, clean, with smooth banks, delightful.

root-pli-ms: Ettha bhagavā pānīyañca pivissati, gattāni ca sītī karissatī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: There the Buddha can drink and cool his limbs.”

root-pli-ms: Dutiyampi kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: For a second time, the Buddha asked Ānanda for a drink,

root-pli-ms: “iṅgha me tvaṁ, ānanda, pānīyaṁ āhara, pipāsitosmi, ānanda, pivissāmī”ti.
Dutiyampi kho āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: and for a second time Ānanda suggested going to the Kakutthā river.

root-pli-ms: “idāni, bhante, pañcamattāni sakaṭasatāni atikkantāni, taṁ cakkacchinnaṁ udakaṁ parittaṁ luḷitaṁ āvilaṁ sandati.
Ayaṁ, bhante, kakudhā nadī avidūre acchodakā sātodakā sītodakā setodakā suppatitthā ramaṇīyā.
Ettha bhagavā pānīyañca pivissati, gattāni ca sītīkarissatī”ti.
Tatiyampi kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: And for a third time, the Buddha said to Ānanda,

root-pli-ms: “iṅgha me tvaṁ, ānanda, pānīyaṁ āhara, pipāsitosmi, ānanda, pivissāmī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Please, Ānanda, fetch me some water. I am thirsty and will drink.”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paṭissutvā pattaṁ gahetvā yena sā nadikā tenupasaṅkami.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” replied Ānanda. Taking his bowl he went to the river.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho sā nadikā cakkacchinnā parittā luḷitā āvilā sandamānā, āyasmante ānande upasaṅkamante acchā vippasannā anāvilā sandittha.
translation-en-sujato: Now, though the shallow water in that creek had been churned up by wheels, and flowed cloudy and murky, when Ānanda approached it flowed transparent, clear, and unclouded.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho āyasmato ānandassa etadahosi:
translation-en-sujato: Then Ānanda thought,

root-pli-ms: “acchariyaṁ vata bho, abbhutaṁ vata bho, tathāgatassa mahiddhikatā mahānubhāvatā.
translation-en-sujato: “It’s incredible, it’s amazing! The Realized One has such psychic power and might!

root-pli-ms: Ayañhi sā nadikā cakkacchinnā parittā luḷitā āvilā sandamānā mayi upasaṅkamante acchā vippasannā anāvilā sandatī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: For though the shallow water in that creek had been churned up by wheels, and flowed cloudy and murky, when I approached it flowed transparent, clear, and unclouded.”

root-pli-ms: Pattena pānīyaṁ ādāya yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: Gathering a bowl of drinking water he went back to the Buddha, and said to him,

root-pli-ms: “acchariyaṁ, bhante, abbhutaṁ, bhante, tathāgatassa mahiddhikatā mahānubhāvatā.
translation-en-sujato: “It’s incredible, sir, it’s amazing! The Realized One has such psychic power and might!

root-pli-ms: Idāni sā bhante nadikā cakkacchinnā parittā luḷitā āvilā sandamānā mayi upasaṅkamante acchā vippasannā anāvilā sandittha.
translation-en-sujato: Just now, though the shallow water in that creek had been churned up by wheels, and flowed cloudy and murky, when I approached it flowed transparent, clear, and unclouded.

root-pli-ms: Pivatu bhagavā pānīyaṁ pivatu sugato pānīyan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Drink the water, Blessed One! Drink the water, Holy One!”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā pānīyaṁ apāyi.
translation-en-sujato: So the Buddha drank the water.

root-pli-ms: 25. Pukkusamallaputtavatthu
translation-en-sujato: 25. On Pukkusa the Malla

root-pli-ms: Tena kho pana samayena pukkuso mallaputto āḷārassa kālāmassa sāvako kusinārāya pāvaṁ addhānamaggappaṭipanno hoti.
translation-en-sujato: Now at that time Pukkusa the Malla, a disciple of Āḷāra Kālāma, was traveling along the road from Kusinārā and Pāvā.

root-pli-ms: Addasā kho pukkuso mallaputto bhagavantaṁ aññatarasmiṁ rukkhamūle nisinnaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: He saw the Buddha sitting at the root of a certain tree.

root-pli-ms: Disvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho pukkuso mallaputto bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: He went up to him, bowed, sat down to one side, and said,

root-pli-ms: “acchariyaṁ, bhante, abbhutaṁ, bhante, santena vata, bhante, pabbajitā vihārena viharanti.
translation-en-sujato: “It’s incredible, sir, it’s amazing! Those who have gone forth remain in such peaceful meditations.

root-pli-ms: Bhūtapubbaṁ, bhante, āḷāro kālāmo addhānamaggappaṭipanno maggā okkamma avidūre aññatarasmiṁ rukkhamūle divāvihāraṁ nisīdi.
translation-en-sujato: Once it so happened that Āḷāra Kālāma, while traveling along a road, left the road and sat at the root of a nearby tree for the day’s meditation.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhante, pañcamattāni sakaṭasatāni āḷāraṁ kālāmaṁ nissāya nissāya atikkamiṁsu.
translation-en-sujato: Then around five hundred carts passed by right next to Āḷāra Kālāma.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhante, aññataro puriso tassa sakaṭasatthassa piṭṭhito piṭṭhito āgacchanto yena āḷāro kālāmo tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āḷāraṁ kālāmaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: Then a certain person coming behind those carts went up to Āḷāra Kālāma and said to him:

root-pli-ms: ‘api, bhante, pañcamattāni sakaṭasatāni atikkantāni addasā’ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘Sir, didn’t you see the five hundred carts pass by?’

root-pli-ms: ‘Na kho ahaṁ, āvuso, addasan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘No, friend, I didn’t see them.’

root-pli-ms: ‘Kiṁ pana, bhante, saddaṁ assosī’ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘But sir, didn’t you hear a sound?’

root-pli-ms: ‘Na kho ahaṁ, āvuso, saddaṁ assosin’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘No, friend, I didn’t hear a sound.’

root-pli-ms: ‘Kiṁ pana, bhante, sutto ahosī’ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘But sir, were you asleep?’

root-pli-ms: ‘Na kho ahaṁ, āvuso, sutto ahosin’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘No, friend, I wasn’t asleep.’

root-pli-ms: ‘Kiṁ pana, bhante, saññī ahosī’ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘But sir, were you conscious?’

root-pli-ms: ‘Evamāvuso’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Yes, friend.’

root-pli-ms: ‘So tvaṁ, bhante, saññī samāno jāgaro pañcamattāni sakaṭasatāni nissāya nissāya atikkantāni neva addasa, na pana saddaṁ assosi;
translation-en-sujato: ‘So, sir, while conscious and awake you neither saw nor heard a sound as five hundred carts passed by right next to you?

root-pli-ms: apisu te, bhante, saṅghāṭi rajena okiṇṇā’ti?
translation-en-sujato: Why sir, even your outer robe is covered with dust!’
comment-en-sujato: As were Mahapajapati’s limbs, AN 8.51
variant-pli-ms: apisu → apissu (bj); api hi (sya-all, km, pts1ed)

root-pli-ms: ‘Evamāvuso’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Yes, friend.’

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhante, tassa purisassa etadahosi:
translation-en-sujato: Then that person thought:

root-pli-ms: ‘acchariyaṁ vata bho, abbhutaṁ vata bho, santena vata bho pabbajitā vihārena viharanti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘It’s incredible, it’s amazing! Those who have gone forth remain in such peaceful meditations,

root-pli-ms: Yatra hi nāma saññī samāno jāgaro pañcamattāni sakaṭasatāni nissāya nissāya atikkantāni neva dakkhati, na pana saddaṁ sossatī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: in that, while conscious and awake he neither saw nor heard a sound as five hundred carts passed by right next to him.’

root-pli-ms: Āḷāre kālāme uḷāraṁ pasādaṁ pavedetvā pakkāmī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: And after declaring his lofty confidence in Āḷāra Kālāma, he left.”
comment-en-sujato: Anandajotis’ “having gained” is incorrect.

root-pli-ms: “Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, pukkusa,
translation-en-sujato: “What do you think, Pukkusa?

root-pli-ms: katamaṁ nu kho dukkarataraṁ vā durabhisambhavataraṁ vā—
translation-en-sujato: Which is harder and more challenging to do while conscious and awake:

root-pli-ms: yo vā saññī samāno jāgaro pañcamattāni sakaṭasatāni nissāya nissāya atikkantāni neva passeyya, na pana saddaṁ suṇeyya;
translation-en-sujato: to neither see nor hear a sound as five hundred carts pass by right next to you?

root-pli-ms: yo vā saññī samāno jāgaro deve vassante deve gaḷagaḷāyante vijjullatāsu niccharantīsu asaniyā phalantiyā neva passeyya, na pana saddaṁ suṇeyyā”ti?
translation-en-sujato: Or to neither see nor hear a sound as it’s raining and pouring, lightning’s flashing, and thunder’s cracking?”

root-pli-ms: “Kiñhi, bhante, karissanti pañca vā sakaṭasatāni cha vā sakaṭasatāni satta vā sakaṭasatāni aṭṭha vā sakaṭasatāni nava vā sakaṭasatāni, sakaṭasahassaṁ vā sakaṭasatasahassaṁ vā.
translation-en-sujato: “What do five hundred carts matter, or six hundred, or seven hundred, or eight hundred, or nine hundred, or a thousand, or even a hundred thousand carts?
variant-pli-ms: aṭṭha vā sakaṭasatāni nava vā sakaṭasatāni → nava vā sakaṭasatāni dasa vā sakaṭasatāni (sya-all, km, pts1ed)

root-pli-ms: Atha kho etadeva dukkaratarañceva durabhisambhavatarañca yo saññī samāno jāgaro deve vassante deve gaḷagaḷāyante vijjullatāsu niccharantīsu asaniyā phalantiyā neva passeyya, na pana saddaṁ suṇeyyā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: It’s far harder and more challenging to neither see nor hear a sound as it’s raining and pouring, lightning’s flashing, and thunder’s cracking!”

root-pli-ms: “Ekamidāhaṁ, pukkusa, samayaṁ ātumāyaṁ viharāmi bhusāgāre.
translation-en-sujato: “This one time, Pukkusa, I was staying near Ātumā in a threshing-hut.

root-pli-ms: Tena kho pana samayena deve vassante deve gaḷagaḷāyante vijjullatāsu niccharantīsu asaniyā phalantiyā avidūre bhusāgārassa dve kassakā bhātaro hatā cattāro ca balibaddā.
translation-en-sujato: At that time it was raining and pouring, lightning was flashing, and thunder was cracking. And not far from the threshing-hut two farmers who were brothers were killed, as well as four oxen.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, pukkusa, ātumāya mahājanakāyo nikkhamitvā yena te dve kassakā bhātaro hatā cattāro ca balibaddā tenupasaṅkami.
translation-en-sujato: Then a large crowd came from Ātumā to the place where that happened.

root-pli-ms: Tena kho panāhaṁ, pukkusa, samayena bhusāgārā nikkhamitvā bhusāgāradvāre abbhokāse caṅkamāmi.
translation-en-sujato: Now at that time I came out of the threshing-hut and was walking mindfully in the open near the door of the hut.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, pukkusa, aññataro puriso tamhā mahājanakāyā yenāhaṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā maṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhāsi. Ekamantaṁ ṭhitaṁ kho ahaṁ, pukkusa, taṁ purisaṁ etadavocaṁ:
translation-en-sujato: Then having left that crowd, a certain person approached me, bowed, and stood to one side. I said to them,

root-pli-ms: ‘kiṁ nu kho eso, āvuso, mahājanakāyo sannipatito’ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘Why, friend, has this crowd gathered?’

root-pli-ms: ‘Idāni, bhante, deve vassante deve gaḷagaḷāyante vijjullatāsu niccharantīsu asaniyā phalantiyā dve kassakā bhātaro hatā cattāro ca balibaddā.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Just now, sir, it was raining and pouring, lightning was flashing, and thunder was cracking. And two farmers who were brothers were killed, as well as four oxen.

root-pli-ms: Ettheso mahājanakāyo sannipatito.
translation-en-sujato: Then this crowd gathered here.

root-pli-ms: Tvaṁ pana, bhante, kva ahosī’ti?
translation-en-sujato: But sir, where were you?’

root-pli-ms: ‘Idheva kho ahaṁ, āvuso, ahosin’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘I was right here, friend.’

root-pli-ms: ‘Kiṁ pana, bhante, addasā’ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘But sir, did you see?’

root-pli-ms: ‘Na kho ahaṁ, āvuso, addasan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘No, friend, I didn’t see anything.’

root-pli-ms: ‘Kiṁ pana, bhante, saddaṁ assosī’ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘But sir, didn’t you hear a sound?’

root-pli-ms: ‘Na kho ahaṁ, āvuso, saddaṁ assosin’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘No, friend, I didn’t hear a sound.’

root-pli-ms: ‘Kiṁ pana, bhante, sutto ahosī’ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘But sir, were you asleep?’

root-pli-ms: ‘Na kho ahaṁ, āvuso, sutto ahosin’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘No, friend, I wasn’t asleep.’

root-pli-ms: ‘Kiṁ pana, bhante, saññī ahosī’ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘But sir, were you conscious?’

root-pli-ms: ‘Evamāvuso’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Yes, friend.’

root-pli-ms: ‘So tvaṁ, bhante, saññī samāno jāgaro deve vassante deve gaḷagaḷāyante vijjullatāsu niccharantīsu asaniyā phalantiyā neva addasa, na pana saddaṁ assosī’ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘So, sir, while conscious and awake you neither saw nor heard a sound as it was raining and pouring, lightning was flashing, and thunder was cracking?’

root-pli-ms: ‘Evamāvuso’ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘Yes, friend.’
comment-en-sujato: Question mark is wrong.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, pukkusa, tassa purisassa etadahosi:
translation-en-sujato: Then that person thought:

root-pli-ms: ‘acchariyaṁ vata bho, abbhutaṁ vata bho, santena vata bho pabbajitā vihārena viharanti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘It’s incredible, it’s amazing! Those who have gone forth remain in such peaceful meditations,

root-pli-ms: Yatra hi nāma saññī samāno jāgaro deve vassante deve gaḷagaḷāyante vijjullatāsu niccharantīsu asaniyā phalantiyā neva dakkhati, na pana saddaṁ sossatī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: in that, while conscious and awake he neither saw nor heard a sound as it was raining and pouring, lightning was flashing, and thunder was cracking.’

root-pli-ms: Mayi uḷāraṁ pasādaṁ pavedetvā maṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā pakkāmī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: And after declaring their lofty confidence in me, they bowed and respectfully circled me, keeping me on their right, before leaving.”

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vutte, pukkuso mallaputto bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: When he said this, Pukkusa said to him,
reference: ms7D_433, pts-cs4.34, pts-vp-pli2.133, sc183, sya10.155, vri2.101

root-pli-ms: “esāhaṁ, bhante, yo me āḷāre kālāme pasādo taṁ mahāvāte vā ophuṇāmi sīghasotāya vā nadiyā pavāhemi.
translation-en-sujato: “Any confidence I had in Āḷāra Kālāma I sweep away as in a strong wind, or float away as down a swift stream.

root-pli-ms: Abhikkantaṁ, bhante, abhikkantaṁ, bhante.
translation-en-sujato: Excellent, sir! Excellent!

root-pli-ms: Seyyathāpi, bhante, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṁ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṁ dhāreyya: ‘cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī’ti; evamevaṁ bhagavatā anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
translation-en-sujato: As if he were righting the overturned, or revealing the hidden, or pointing out the path to the lost, or lighting a lamp in the dark so people with good eyes can see what’s there, the Buddha has made the teaching clear in many ways.

root-pli-ms: Esāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavantaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
translation-en-sujato: I go for refuge to the Buddha, to the teaching, and to the mendicant Saṅgha.

root-pli-ms: Upāsakaṁ maṁ bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gatan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: From this day forth, may the Buddha remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho pukkuso mallaputto aññataraṁ purisaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: Then Pukkusa addressed a certain man,

root-pli-ms: “iṅgha me tvaṁ, bhaṇe, siṅgīvaṇṇaṁ yugamaṭṭhaṁ dhāraṇīyaṁ āharā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Please, my man, fetch a pair of ready to wear polished golden garments.”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho so puriso pukkusassa mallaputtassa paṭissutvā taṁ siṅgīvaṇṇaṁ yugamaṭṭhaṁ dhāraṇīyaṁ āhari.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” replied that man, and did as he was asked.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho pukkuso mallaputto taṁ siṅgīvaṇṇaṁ yugamaṭṭhaṁ dhāraṇīyaṁ bhagavato upanāmesi:
translation-en-sujato: Then Pukkusa brought the garments to the Buddha,
comment-en-sujato: I think the use of verbs for the garments is corrupt through this passage. Skt uses acchadeti throughout. Here upanameti means “brings close” cf Pj1. Below, it means “place on his body”, cf. SN 10.3

root-pli-ms: “idaṁ, bhante, siṅgīvaṇṇaṁ yugamaṭṭhaṁ dhāraṇīyaṁ, taṁ me bhagavā paṭiggaṇhātu anukampaṁ upādāyā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, please accept this pair of ready to wear polished golden garments from me out of compassion.”

root-pli-ms: “Tena hi, pukkusa, ekena maṁ acchādehi, ekena ānandan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Well then, Pukkusa, clothe me in one, and Ānanda in the other.”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho pukkuso mallaputto bhagavato paṭissutvā ekena bhagavantaṁ acchādeti, ekena āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” replied Pukkusa, and did so.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā pukkusaṁ mallaputtaṁ dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi.
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired Pukkusa the Malla with a Dhamma talk,

root-pli-ms: Atha kho pukkuso mallaputto bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya sandassito samādapito samuttejito sampahaṁsito uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā pakkāmi.
translation-en-sujato: after which he got up from his seat, bowed, and respectfully circled the Buddha before leaving.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho āyasmā ānando acirapakkante pukkuse mallaputte taṁ siṅgīvaṇṇaṁ yugamaṭṭhaṁ dhāraṇīyaṁ bhagavato kāyaṁ upanāmesi.
translation-en-sujato: Then, not long after Pukkusa had left, Ānanda placed the pair of golden garments on the Buddha’s body.

root-pli-ms: Taṁ bhagavato kāyaṁ upanāmitaṁ hataccikaṁ viya khāyati.
translation-en-sujato: But when placed on the Buddha’s body they seemed to lose their shine.
variant-pli-ms: hataccikaṁ viya → vītaccikaṁ viya (bj, pts1ed); hatacchikaṁ viya (sya-all)

root-pli-ms: Atha kho āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: Then Ānanda said to the Buddha,

root-pli-ms: “acchariyaṁ, bhante, abbhutaṁ, bhante, yāva parisuddho, bhante, tathāgatassa chavivaṇṇo pariyodāto.
translation-en-sujato: “It’s incredible, sir, it’s amazing, how pure and bright is the color of the Realized One’s skin.

root-pli-ms: Idaṁ, bhante, siṅgīvaṇṇaṁ yugamaṭṭhaṁ dhāraṇīyaṁ bhagavato kāyaṁ upanāmitaṁ hataccikaṁ viya khāyatī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: When this pair of ready to wear polished golden garments is placed on the Buddha’s body they seem to lose their shine.”

root-pli-ms: “Evametaṁ, ānanda, evametaṁ, ānanda, dvīsu kālesu ativiya tathāgatassa kāyo parisuddho hoti chavivaṇṇo pariyodāto.
translation-en-sujato: “That’s so true, Ānanda, that’s so true! There are two times when the color of the Realized One’s skin becomes extra pure and bright.

root-pli-ms: Katamesu dvīsu?
translation-en-sujato: What two?

root-pli-ms: Yañca, ānanda, rattiṁ tathāgato anuttaraṁ sammāsambodhiṁ abhisambujjhati, yañca rattiṁ anupādisesāya nibbānadhātuyā parinibbāyati.
translation-en-sujato: The night when a Realized One understands the supreme perfect awakening; and the night he becomes fully extinguished through the natural principle of extinguishment, without anything left over.

root-pli-ms: Imesu kho, ānanda, dvīsu kālesu ativiya tathāgatassa kāyo parisuddho hoti chavivaṇṇo pariyodāto.
translation-en-sujato: These are the are two times when the color of the Realized One’s skin becomes extra pure and bright.

root-pli-ms: Ajja kho panānanda, rattiyā pacchime yāme kusinārāyaṁ upavattane mallānaṁ sālavane antarena yamakasālānaṁ tathāgatassa parinibbānaṁ bhavissati.
translation-en-sujato: Today, Ānanda, in the last watch of the night, between a pair of sal trees in the sal forest of the Mallas at Upavattana near Kusinārā, shall be the Realized One’s full extinguishment.

root-pli-ms: Āyāmānanda, yena kakudhā nadī tenupasaṅkamissāmā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Come, Ānanda, let’s go to the Kakutthā River.”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paccassosi.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” Ānanda replied.

root-pli-ms: Siṅgīvaṇṇaṁ yugamaṭṭhaṁ,
translation-en-sujato: A pair of golden polished garments

root-pli-ms: pukkuso abhihārayi;
translation-en-sujato: was presented by Pukkusa;

root-pli-ms: Tena acchādito satthā,
translation-en-sujato: when the teacher was clothed with them,

root-pli-ms: hemavaṇṇo asobhathāti.
translation-en-sujato: his golden skin glowed bright.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ yena kakudhā nadī tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā kakudhaṁ nadiṁ ajjhogāhetvā nhatvā ca pivitvā ca paccuttaritvā yena ambavanaṁ tenupasaṅkami.
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha together with a large Saṅgha of mendicants went to the Kakutthā River. He plunged into the river and bathed and drank. And when he had emerged, he went to the mango grove,

root-pli-ms: Upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ cundakaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: where he addressed Venerable Cundaka,

root-pli-ms: “iṅgha me tvaṁ, cundaka, catugguṇaṁ saṅghāṭiṁ paññapehi, kilantosmi, cundaka, nipajjissāmī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Please, Cundaka, fold my outer robe in four and spread it out for me. I am tired and will lie down.”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā cundako bhagavato paṭissutvā catugguṇaṁ saṅghāṭiṁ paññapesi.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” replied Cundaka, and did as he was asked.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā dakkhiṇena passena sīhaseyyaṁ kappesi pāde pādaṁ accādhāya sato sampajāno uṭṭhānasaññaṁ manasikaritvā.
translation-en-sujato: And then the Buddha laid down in the lion’s posture—on the right side, placing one foot on top of the other—mindful and aware, and focused on the time of getting up.

root-pli-ms: Āyasmā pana cundako tattheva bhagavato purato nisīdi.
translation-en-sujato: But Cundaka sat down right there in front of the Buddha.

root-pli-ms: Gantvāna buddho nadikaṁ kakudhaṁ,
translation-en-sujato: Having gone to Kakutthā Creek,

root-pli-ms: Acchodakaṁ sātudakaṁ vippasannaṁ;
translation-en-sujato: whose water was transparent, sweet, and clear,

root-pli-ms: Ogāhi satthā akilantarūpo,
translation-en-sujato: the Teacher, being tired, plunged in,

root-pli-ms: Tathāgato appaṭimo ca loke.
translation-en-sujato: the Realized One, without compare in the world.

root-pli-ms: Nhatvā ca pivitvā cudatāri satthā,
translation-en-sujato: And after bathing and drinking the Teacher emerged.
variant-pli-ms: Nhatvā ca pivitvā cudatāri satthā → nhātvā ca pivitvā cudakāni sutvā (sya-all); nahatvā pitvā cudatāri satthā (pts1ed); pivitvā ca uttari (mr)

root-pli-ms: Purakkhato bhikkhugaṇassa majjhe;
translation-en-sujato: Before the group of mendicants, in the middle, the Buddha,

root-pli-ms: Vattā pavattā bhagavā idha dhamme,
translation-en-sujato: the Teacher who rolled forth the present dispensation,
comment-en-sujato: Adopt PTS reading. Comm: “pavattā bhagavā idha dhammeti bhagavā idha sāsane dhamme pavattā, caturāsīti dhammakkhandhasahassāni pavattānīti attho”

root-pli-ms: Upāgami ambavanaṁ mahesi.
translation-en-sujato: the great hermit went to the mango grove.

root-pli-ms: Āmantayi cundakaṁ nāma bhikkhuṁ,
translation-en-sujato: He addressed the mendicant named Cundaka:

root-pli-ms: Catugguṇaṁ santhara me nipajjaṁ;
translation-en-sujato: “Spread out my folded robe so I can lie down.”

root-pli-ms: So codito bhāvitattena cundo,
translation-en-sujato: The self-developed one urged Cunda,

root-pli-ms: Catugguṇaṁ santhari khippameva;
translation-en-sujato: who quickly spread the folded robe.

root-pli-ms: Nipajji satthā akilantarūpo,
translation-en-sujato: Teacher, being tired, lay down,

root-pli-ms: Cundopi tattha pamukhe nisīdīti.
translation-en-sujato: while Cunda sat there before him.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha said to Venerable Ānanda:

root-pli-ms: “siyā kho panānanda, cundassa kammāraputtassa koci vippaṭisāraṁ uppādeyya:
translation-en-sujato: “Now it may happen, Ānanda, that others may give rise to some regret for Cunda the smith:
comment-en-sujato: The subject is unspecified in the Pali. It is not koci, for that forms a regular idiom with vippatisara. The Skt says vipratisāraḥ pareṣām āpāditaḥ

root-pli-ms: ‘tassa te, āvuso cunda, alābhā tassa te dulladdhaṁ, yassa te tathāgato pacchimaṁ piṇḍapātaṁ paribhuñjitvā parinibbuto’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘It’s your loss, friend Cunda, it’s your misfortune, in that the Realized One became fully extinguished after eating his last meal from you.’

root-pli-ms: Cundassa, ānanda, kammāraputtassa evaṁ vippaṭisāro paṭivinetabbo:
translation-en-sujato: You should get rid of remorse in Cunda the smith like this:

root-pli-ms: ‘tassa te, āvuso cunda, lābhā tassa te suladdhaṁ,
translation-en-sujato: ‘You’re fortunate, friend Cunda, you’re so very fortunate,

root-pli-ms: yassa te tathāgato pacchimaṁ piṇḍapātaṁ paribhuñjitvā parinibbuto.
translation-en-sujato: in that the Realized One became fully extinguished after eating his last meal from you.

root-pli-ms: Sammukhā metaṁ, āvuso cunda, bhagavato sutaṁ sammukhā paṭiggahitaṁ:
translation-en-sujato: I have heard and learned this in the presence of the Buddha.

root-pli-ms: dveme piṇḍapātā samasamaphalā samavipākā, ativiya aññehi piṇḍapātehi mahapphalatarā ca mahānisaṁsatarā ca.
translation-en-sujato: There are two meal offerings that have identical fruit and result, and are more fruitful and beneficial than other meal offerings.
variant-pli-ms: samasamaphalā → samaphalā (bj); samā samaphalā (mr) | samavipākā → samasamavipākā (sya-all, km, pts1ed)

root-pli-ms: Katame dve?
translation-en-sujato: What two?

root-pli-ms: Yañca piṇḍapātaṁ paribhuñjitvā tathāgato anuttaraṁ sammāsambodhiṁ abhisambujjhati, yañca piṇḍapātaṁ paribhuñjitvā tathāgato anupādisesāya nibbānadhātuyā parinibbāyati.
translation-en-sujato: The meal after eating which a Realized One understands the supreme perfect awakening; and the meal after eating which he becomes fully extinguished through the natural principle of extinguishment, without anything left over.

root-pli-ms: Ime dve piṇḍapātā samasamaphalā samavipākā, ativiya aññehi piṇḍapātehi mahapphalatarā ca mahānisaṁsatarā ca.
translation-en-sujato: These two meal offerings have identical fruit and result, and are more fruitful and beneficial than other meal offerings.

root-pli-ms: Āyusaṁvattanikaṁ āyasmatā cundena kammāraputtena kammaṁ upacitaṁ, vaṇṇasaṁvattanikaṁ āyasmatā cundena kammāraputtena kammaṁ upacitaṁ, sukhasaṁvattanikaṁ āyasmatā cundena kammāraputtena kammaṁ upacitaṁ, yasasaṁvattanikaṁ āyasmatā cundena kammāraputtena kammaṁ upacitaṁ, saggasaṁvattanikaṁ āyasmatā cundena kammāraputtena kammaṁ upacitaṁ, ādhipateyyasaṁvattanikaṁ āyasmatā cundena kammāraputtena kammaṁ upacitan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: You’ve accumulated a deed that leads to long life, beauty, happiness, fame, heaven, and sovereignty.’
comment-en-sujato: Note the text starts to use ayasma here for Cunda. There seems to be some confusion felt between the monk attendant Cundaka and Cunda. But the usage here seems to be driven by grammar. Earlier avuso was used, but as an indeclinable it doesn’t work in instrumental, so apparently ayasmata is the fallback instrumental form; they are both from the same root. It is a nice reminder of the fluidity of such usages. The sanskrit too has saṁmukhaṁ ma āyuṣmaṁś cunda

root-pli-ms: Cundassa, ānanda, kammāraputtassa evaṁ vippaṭisāro paṭivinetabbo”ti.
translation-en-sujato: That’s how you should get rid of remorse in Cunda the smith.”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā etamatthaṁ viditvā tāyaṁ velāyaṁ imaṁ udānaṁ udānesi:
translation-en-sujato: Then, knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:

root-pli-ms: “Dadato puññaṁ pavaḍḍhati,
translation-en-sujato: “A giver’s merit grows;

root-pli-ms: Saṁyamato veraṁ na cīyati;
translation-en-sujato: enmity doesn’t build up when you have self-control.

root-pli-ms: Kusalo ca jahāti pāpakaṁ,
translation-en-sujato: A skillful person gives up bad things—

root-pli-ms: Rāgadosamohakkhayā sanibbuto”ti.
translation-en-sujato: with the end of greed, hate, and delusion, they’re extinguished.”

root-pli-ms: Catuttho bhāṇavāro.
26. Yamakasālā
translation-en-sujato: 26. The Pair of Sal Trees

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha said to Ānanda,

root-pli-ms: “āyāmānanda, yena hiraññavatiyā nadiyā pārimaṁ tīraṁ, yena kusinārā upavattanaṁ mallānaṁ sālavanaṁ tenupasaṅkamissāmā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Come, Ānanda, let’s go to the far shore of the Golden River, and on to the sal forest of the Mallas at Upavattana near Kusinārā.”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paccassosi.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” Ānanda replied.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ yena hiraññavatiyā nadiyā pārimaṁ tīraṁ, yena kusinārā upavattanaṁ mallānaṁ sālavanaṁ tenupasaṅkami. upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: And that’s where they went. Then the Buddha addressed Ānanda,

root-pli-ms: “iṅgha me tvaṁ, ānanda, antarena yamakasālānaṁ uttarasīsakaṁ mañcakaṁ paññapehi, kilantosmi, ānanda, nipajjissāmī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Please, Ānanda, set up a cot for me between the twin sal trees, with my head to the north. I am tired and will lie down.”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paṭissutvā antarena yamakasālānaṁ uttarasīsakaṁ mañcakaṁ paññapesi.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” replied Ānanda, and did as he was asked.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā dakkhiṇena passena sīhaseyyaṁ kappesi pāde pādaṁ accādhāya sato sampajāno.
translation-en-sujato: And then the Buddha laid down in the lion’s posture—on the right side, placing one foot on top of the other—mindful and aware.
comment-en-sujato: A sad detail here: previously when lying down, his mind was focused on getting up. Sob!

root-pli-ms: Tena kho pana samayena yamakasālā sabbaphāliphullā honti akālapupphehi.
translation-en-sujato: Now at that time the twin sal trees were in full blossom with flowers out of season.
reference: cck10.172, csp1ed7.114, csp2ed7.114, ms7D_447, ndp7.107, pts-cs5.2, pts-vp-pli2.138, sc195

root-pli-ms: Te tathāgatassa sarīraṁ okiranti ajjhokiranti abhippakiranti tathāgatassa pūjāya.
translation-en-sujato: They sprinkled and bestrewed the Realized One’s body in honor of the Realized One.

root-pli-ms: Dibbānipi mandāravapupphāni antalikkhā papatanti, tāni tathāgatassa sarīraṁ okiranti ajjhokiranti abhippakiranti tathāgatassa pūjāya.
translation-en-sujato: And the flowers of the heavenly Flame Tree fell from the sky, and they too sprinkled and bestrewed the Realized One’s body in honor of the Realized One.

root-pli-ms: Dibbānipi candanacuṇṇāni antalikkhā papatanti, tāni tathāgatassa sarīraṁ okiranti ajjhokiranti abhippakiranti tathāgatassa pūjāya.
translation-en-sujato: And heavenly sandalwood powder fell from the sky, and it too sprinkled and bestrewed the Realized One’s body in honor of the Realized One.

root-pli-ms: Dibbānipi tūriyāni antalikkhe vajjanti tathāgatassa pūjāya.
translation-en-sujato: And heavenly music played in the sky in honor of the Realized One.

root-pli-ms: Dibbānipi saṅgītāni antalikkhe vattanti tathāgatassa pūjāya.
translation-en-sujato: And heavenly choirs sang in the sky in honor of the Realized One.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha pointed out to Ānanda what was happening, adding:

root-pli-ms: “sabbaphāliphullā kho, ānanda, yamakasālā akālapupphehi.
Te tathāgatassa sarīraṁ okiranti ajjhokiranti abhippakiranti tathāgatassa pūjāya.
Dibbānipi mandāravapupphāni antalikkhā papatanti, tāni tathāgatassa sarīraṁ okiranti ajjhokiranti abhippakiranti tathāgatassa pūjāya.
Dibbānipi candanacuṇṇāni antalikkhā papatanti, tāni tathāgatassa sarīraṁ okiranti ajjhokiranti abhippakiranti tathāgatassa pūjāya.
Dibbānipi tūriyāni antalikkhe vajjanti tathāgatassa pūjāya.
Dibbānipi saṅgītāni antalikkhe vattanti tathāgatassa pūjāya.
Na kho, ānanda, ettāvatā tathāgato sakkato vā hoti garukato vā mānito vā pūjito vā apacito vā.
translation-en-sujato: “That’s not how the Realized One is honored, respected, revered, venerated, and esteemed.
