root-pli-ms: Yo kho, ānanda, bhikkhu vā bhikkhunī vā upāsako vā upāsikā vā dhammānudhammappaṭipanno viharati sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī, so tathāgataṁ sakkaroti garuṁ karoti māneti pūjeti apaciyati, paramāya pūjāya.
translation-en-sujato: Any monk or nun or male or female lay follower who practices in line with the teachings, practicing properly, living in line with the teachings—they honor, respect, revere, venerate, and esteem the Realized One with the highest honor.
comment-en-sujato: This calls back to the description of the fourfold assembly in the Mara section above.
variant-pli-ms: apaciyati → idaṁ padaṁ bj, sya-all, km, pts1ed potthakesu na

root-pli-ms: Tasmātihānanda, dhammānudhammappaṭipannā viharissāma sāmīcippaṭipannā anudhammacārinoti.
translation-en-sujato: So Ānanda, you should train like this: ‘We shall practice in line with the teachings, practicing properly, living in line with the teaching.’

root-pli-ms: Evañhi vo, ānanda, sikkhitabban”ti.
27. Upavāṇatthera
translation-en-sujato: 27. The Monk Upavāṇa

root-pli-ms: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā upavāṇo bhagavato purato ṭhito hoti bhagavantaṁ bījayamāno.
translation-en-sujato: Now at that time Venerable Upavāṇa was standing in front of the Buddha fanning him.
reference: bj8.216, csp1ed7.115, csp2ed7.115, ms7D_449, msdiv200, pts-cs5.4, pts-vp-pli2.139, sc197, vri2.105

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ upavāṇaṁ apasāresi:
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha made him move,

root-pli-ms: “apehi, bhikkhu, mā me purato aṭṭhāsī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Move over, mendicant, don’t stand in front of me.”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho āyasmato ānandassa etadahosi:
translation-en-sujato: Ānanda thought,

root-pli-ms: “ayaṁ kho āyasmā upavāṇo dīgharattaṁ bhagavato upaṭṭhāko santikāvacaro samīpacārī.
translation-en-sujato: “This Venerable Upavāṇa has been the Buddha’s attendant for a long time, close to him, living in his presence.
comment-en-sujato: In AN 5.166, Ananda goes to Upavana for support when he feels he has disappointed the Buddha.

root-pli-ms: Atha ca pana bhagavā pacchime kāle āyasmantaṁ upavāṇaṁ apasāreti:
translation-en-sujato: Yet in his final hour the Buddha makes him move, saying:

root-pli-ms: ‘apehi, bhikkhu, mā me purato aṭṭhāsī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Move over, mendicant, don’t stand in front of me.’

root-pli-ms: Ko nu kho hetu, ko paccayo, yaṁ bhagavā āyasmantaṁ upavāṇaṁ apasāreti:
translation-en-sujato: What is the cause, what is the reason for this?”

root-pli-ms: ‘apehi, bhikkhu, mā me purato aṭṭhāsī’”ti?
Atha kho āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: Then Ānanda said to the Buddha,

root-pli-ms: “ayaṁ, bhante, āyasmā upavāṇo dīgharattaṁ bhagavato upaṭṭhāko santikāvacaro samīpacārī.
translation-en-sujato: “This Venerable Upavāṇa has been the Buddha’s attendant for a long time, close to him, living in his presence.

root-pli-ms: Atha ca pana bhagavā pacchime kāle āyasmantaṁ upavāṇaṁ apasāreti:
translation-en-sujato: Yet in his final hour the Buddha makes him move, saying:

root-pli-ms: ‘apehi, bhikkhu, mā me purato aṭṭhāsī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Move over, mendicant, don’t stand in front of me.’

root-pli-ms: Ko nu kho, bhante, hetu, ko paccayo, yaṁ bhagavā āyasmantaṁ upavāṇaṁ apasāreti:
translation-en-sujato: What is the cause, sir, what is the reason for this?”

root-pli-ms: ‘apehi, bhikkhu, mā me purato aṭṭhāsī’”ti?
“Yebhuyyena, ānanda, dasasu lokadhātūsu devatā sannipatitā tathāgataṁ dassanāya.
translation-en-sujato: “Most of the deities from ten solar systems have gathered to see the Realized One.

root-pli-ms: Yāvatā, ānanda, kusinārā upavattanaṁ mallānaṁ sālavanaṁ samantato dvādasa yojanāni, natthi so padeso vālaggakoṭinittudanamattopi mahesakkhāhi devatāhi apphuṭo.
translation-en-sujato: For twelve leagues all around this sal grove there’s no spot, not even a fraction of a hair’s tip, that’s not crowded full of illustrious deities.
comment-en-sujato: For this usage of phuta, cp AN 3.56

root-pli-ms: Devatā, ānanda, ujjhāyanti:
translation-en-sujato: The deities are complaining:

root-pli-ms: ‘dūrā ca vatamha āgatā tathāgataṁ dassanāya.
translation-en-sujato: ‘We’ve come such a long way to see the Realized One!
comment-en-sujato: Sounding much like whinging tourists!

root-pli-ms: Kadāci karahaci tathāgatā loke uppajjanti arahanto sammāsambuddhā.
translation-en-sujato: Only rarely do Realized Ones arise in the world, perfected ones, fully awakened Buddhas.

root-pli-ms: Ajjeva rattiyā pacchime yāme tathāgatassa parinibbānaṁ bhavissati.
translation-en-sujato: This very day, in the last watch of the night, the Realized One will become fully extinguished.

root-pli-ms: Ayañca mahesakkho bhikkhu bhagavato purato ṭhito ovārento, na mayaṁ labhāma pacchime kāle tathāgataṁ dassanāyā’”ti.
translation-en-sujato: And this illustrious mendicant is standing in front of the Buddha blocking the view. We won’t get to see the Realized One in his final hour!’”

root-pli-ms: “Kathaṁbhūtā pana, bhante, bhagavā devatā manasikarotī”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “But sir, what kind of deities are you thinking of?”

root-pli-ms: “Santānanda, devatā ākāse pathavīsaññiniyo kese pakiriya kandanti, bāhā paggayha kandanti, chinnapātaṁ papatanti, āvaṭṭanti, vivaṭṭanti:
translation-en-sujato: “There are, Ānanda, deities—both in the sky and on the earth—who are percipient of the earth. With hair disheveled and arms raised, they fall down like their feet were chopped off, rolling back and forth, lamenting:
comment-en-sujato: reading chinnaṁpādaṁ viya papatanti
variant-pli-ms: chinnapātaṁ papatanti → chinnaṁpādaṁ viya papatanti (sya-all); chinnapātaṁ viyapapatanti (km); chinnapapātaṁ papatanti (pts1ed)

root-pli-ms: ‘atikhippaṁ bhagavā parinibbāyissati, atikhippaṁ sugato parinibbāyissati, atikhippaṁ cakkhuṁ loke antaradhāyissatī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Too soon the Blessed One will become fully extinguished! Too soon the Holy One will become fully extinguished! Too soon the seer will vanish from the world!’
comment-en-sujato: Following Anandajoti, cakkhuma is the most obvious reading. Note that while antaradhayi usually takes the locative, the English idiom makes more sense with ablative.

root-pli-ms: Santānanda, devatā pathaviyaṁ pathavīsaññiniyo kese pakiriya kandanti, bāhā paggayha kandanti, chinnapātaṁ papatanti, āvaṭṭanti, vivaṭṭanti:
‘atikhippaṁ bhagavā parinibbāyissati, atikhippaṁ sugato parinibbāyissati, atikhippaṁ cakkhuṁ loke antaradhāyissatī’ti.
Yā pana tā devatā vītarāgā, tā satā sampajānā adhivāsenti:
translation-en-sujato: But the deities who are free of desire endure, mindful and aware, thinking:

root-pli-ms: ‘aniccā saṅkhārā, taṁ kutettha labbhā’”ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Conditions are impermanent. How could it possibly be otherwise?’”
comment-en-sujato: Thus quoting from the sutta itself.

root-pli-ms: 28. Catusaṁvejanīyaṭhāna
translation-en-sujato: 28. The Four Inspiring Places

root-pli-ms: “Pubbe, bhante, disāsu vassaṁvuṭṭhā bhikkhū āgacchanti tathāgataṁ dassanāya.
translation-en-sujato: “Previously, sir, when mendicants had completed the rainy season residence in various districts they came to see the Realized One.
variant-pli-ms: vassaṁvuṭṭhā → vassaṁ vutthā (bj, sya-all, km, pts1ed)

root-pli-ms: Te mayaṁ labhāma manobhāvanīye bhikkhū dassanāya, labhāma payirupāsanāya.
translation-en-sujato: We got to see the esteemed mendicants, and to pay homage to them.

root-pli-ms: Bhagavato pana mayaṁ, bhante, accayena na labhissāma manobhāvanīye bhikkhū dassanāya, na labhissāma payirupāsanāyā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: But when the Buddha has passed, we won’t get to see the esteemed mendicants or to pay homage to them.”

root-pli-ms: “Cattārimāni, ānanda, saddhassa kulaputtassa dassanīyāni saṁvejanīyāni ṭhānāni.
translation-en-sujato: “Ānanda, a faithful gentleman should go to see these four inspiring places.

root-pli-ms: Katamāni cattāri?
translation-en-sujato: What four?

root-pli-ms: ‘Idha tathāgato jāto’ti, ānanda, saddhassa kulaputtassa dassanīyaṁ saṁvejanīyaṁ ṭhānaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Thinking: ‘Here the Realized One was born!’—that is an inspiring place.

root-pli-ms: ‘Idha tathāgato anuttaraṁ sammāsambodhiṁ abhisambuddho’ti, ānanda, saddhassa kulaputtassa dassanīyaṁ saṁvejanīyaṁ ṭhānaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Thinking: ‘Here the Realized One became awakened as a supreme fully awakened Buddha!’—that is an inspiring place.

root-pli-ms: ‘Idha tathāgatena anuttaraṁ dhammacakkaṁ pavattitan’ti, ānanda, saddhassa kulaputtassa dassanīyaṁ saṁvejanīyaṁ ṭhānaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Thinking: ‘Here the supreme Wheel of Dhamma was rolled forth by the Realized One!’—that is an inspiring place.
comment-en-sujato: Note that this is in passive voice, whereas the parallel at AN 4.118 is active.

root-pli-ms: ‘Idha tathāgato anupādisesāya nibbānadhātuyā parinibbuto’ti, ānanda, saddhassa kulaputtassa dassanīyaṁ saṁvejanīyaṁ ṭhānaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Thinking: ‘Here the Realized One became fully extinguished through the natural principle of extinguishment, without anything left over!’—that is an inspiring place.

root-pli-ms: Imāni kho, ānanda, cattāri saddhassa kulaputtassa dassanīyāni saṁvejanīyāni ṭhānāni.
translation-en-sujato: These are the four inspiring places that a faithful gentleman should go to see.

root-pli-ms: Āgamissanti kho, ānanda, saddhā bhikkhū bhikkhuniyo upāsakā upāsikāyo:
translation-en-sujato: Faithful monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen will come, and think:

root-pli-ms: ‘idha tathāgato jāto’tipi, ‘idha tathāgato anuttaraṁ sammāsambodhiṁ abhisambuddho’tipi, ‘idha tathāgatena anuttaraṁ dhammacakkaṁ pavattitan’tipi, ‘idha tathāgato anupādisesāya nibbānadhātuyā parinibbuto’tipi.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Here the Realized One was born!’ and ‘Here the Realized One became awakened as a supreme fully awakened Buddha!’ and ‘Here the supreme Wheel of Dhamma was rolled forth by the Realized One!’ and ‘Here the Realized One became fully extinguished through the natural principle of extinguishment, without anything left over!’

root-pli-ms: Ye hi keci, ānanda, cetiyacārikaṁ āhiṇḍantā pasannacittā kālaṁ karissanti, sabbe te kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjissantī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Anyone who passes away while on pilgrimage to these shrines will, when their body breaks up, after death, be reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.”

root-pli-ms: 29. Ānandapucchākathā
translation-en-sujato: 29. Ānanda’s Questions

root-pli-ms: “Kathaṁ mayaṁ, bhante, mātugāme paṭipajjāmā”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, how do we proceed when it comes to females?”
comment-en-sujato: https://discourse.suttacentral.net/t/what-the-buddha-said-to-ananda-about-women/5779
reference: bj8.220, csp1ed7.117, csp2ed7.117, ms7D_457, msdiv203, pts-cs5.9, sc205, sya10.164

root-pli-ms: “Adassanaṁ, ānandā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Without seeing, Ānanda.”

root-pli-ms: “Dassane, bhagavā, sati kathaṁ paṭipajjitabban”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “But when seeing, how to proceed?”
comment-en-sujato: https://discourse.suttacentral.net/t/what-the-buddha-said-to-ananda-about-women-some-textual-issues/5788

root-pli-ms: “Anālāpo, ānandā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Without getting into conversation, Ānanda.”

root-pli-ms: “Ālapantena pana, bhante, kathaṁ paṭipajjitabban”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “But when in a conversation, how to proceed?”

root-pli-ms: “Sati, ānanda, upaṭṭhāpetabbā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Be mindful, Ānanda.”

root-pli-ms: “Kathaṁ mayaṁ, bhante, tathāgatassa sarīre paṭipajjāmā”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, how do we proceed when it comes to the Realized One’s corpse?”
comment-en-sujato: I think it is important to specify corpse here, as “body” is too vague, and “remains” might be felt to include relics.

root-pli-ms: “Abyāvaṭā tumhe, ānanda, hotha tathāgatassa sarīrapūjāya.
translation-en-sujato: “Don’t get involved in the rites for venerating the Realized One’s corpse, Ānanda.
comment-en-sujato: For Abyāvaṭā, see Samaṇena bhavitabbaṁ abyāvaṭena at SS 5. More don’t get involved “than” don’t worry “. Normally I render puja as” venerate, honor'but here it refers to specific rites, as below.

root-pli-ms: Iṅgha tumhe, ānanda, sāratthe ghaṭatha anuyuñjatha, sāratthe appamattā ātāpino pahitattā viharatha.
translation-en-sujato: Please, Ānanda, you must all strive and practice for your own goal! Meditate diligent, keen, and resolute for your own goal!
comment-en-sujato: Read sadattha.
variant-pli-ms: ghaṭatha anuyuñjatha → sadatthamanuyujjatha (bj); sadatthe anuyuñjatha (sya-all, km); sadattham anuyuñjatha (pts1ed); sāratthe anuyuñjatha (mr) | sāratthe → sadatthe (bj, sya-all, pts1ed)

root-pli-ms: Santānanda, khattiyapaṇḍitāpi brāhmaṇapaṇḍitāpi gahapatipaṇḍitāpi tathāgate abhippasannā, te tathāgatassa sarīrapūjaṁ karissantī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: There are astute aristocrats, brahmins, and householders who are devoted to the Realized One. They will perform the rites for venerating the Realized One’s corpse.”

root-pli-ms: “Kathaṁ pana, bhante, tathāgatassa sarīre paṭipajjitabban”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “But sir, how to proceed when it comes to the Realized One’s corpse?”

root-pli-ms: “Yathā kho, ānanda, rañño cakkavattissa sarīre paṭipajjanti, evaṁ tathāgatassa sarīre paṭipajjitabban”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Proceed in the same way as they do for the corpse of a wheel-turning monarch.”

root-pli-ms: “Kathaṁ pana, bhante, rañño cakkavattissa sarīre paṭipajjantī”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “But how do they proceed with a wheel-turning monarch’s corpse?”

root-pli-ms: “Rañño, ānanda, cakkavattissa sarīraṁ ahatena vatthena veṭhenti, ahatena vatthena veṭhetvā vihatena kappāsena veṭhenti, vihatena kappāsena veṭhetvā ahatena vatthena veṭhenti.
translation-en-sujato: “They wrap a wheel-turning monarch’s corpse with unworn cloth, then with uncarded cotton, then again with unworn cloth.

root-pli-ms: Etenupāyena pañcahi yugasatehi rañño cakkavattissa sarīraṁ veṭhetvā āyasāya teladoṇiyā pakkhipitvā aññissā āyasāya doṇiyā paṭikujjitvā sabbagandhānaṁ citakaṁ karitvā rañño cakkavattissa sarīraṁ jhāpenti.
translation-en-sujato: In this way they wrap the corpse with five hundred double-layers. Then they place it in an iron case filled with oil and close it up with another case. Then, having built a funeral pyre out of all kinds of fragrant substances, they cremate the corpse.
comment-en-sujato: https://discourse.suttacentral.net/t/the-first-fisk-casket/2245

root-pli-ms: Cātumahāpathe rañño cakkavattissa thūpaṁ karonti.
translation-en-sujato: They build a monument for the wheel-turning monarch at the crossroads.

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ kho, ānanda, rañño cakkavattissa sarīre paṭipajjanti.
translation-en-sujato: That’s how they proceed with a wheel-turning monarch’s corpse.

root-pli-ms: Yathā kho, ānanda, rañño cakkavattissa sarīre paṭipajjanti, evaṁ tathāgatassa sarīre paṭipajjitabbaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Proceed in the same way with the Realized One’s corpse.

root-pli-ms: Cātumahāpathe tathāgatassa thūpo kātabbo.
translation-en-sujato: A monument for the Realized One is to be built at the crossroads.

root-pli-ms: Tattha ye mālaṁ vā gandhaṁ vā cuṇṇakaṁ vā āropessanti vā abhivādessanti vā cittaṁ vā pasādessanti tesaṁ taṁ bhavissati dīgharattaṁ hitāya sukhāya.
translation-en-sujato: When someone there lifts up garlands or fragrance or powder, or bows, or inspires confidence in their heart, that will be for their lasting welfare and happiness.

root-pli-ms: 30. Thūpārahapuggala
translation-en-sujato: 30. Persons Worthy of Monument

root-pli-ms: Cattārome, ānanda, thūpārahā.
translation-en-sujato: Ānanda, these four are worthy of a monument.

root-pli-ms: Katame cattāro?
translation-en-sujato: What four?

root-pli-ms: Tathāgato arahaṁ sammāsambuddho thūpāraho, paccekasambuddho thūpāraho, tathāgatassa sāvako thūpāraho, rājā cakkavattī thūpārahoti.
translation-en-sujato: A Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha; a Buddha awakened for themselves; a disciple of a Realized One; and a wheel-turning monarch.

root-pli-ms: Kiñcānanda, atthavasaṁ paṭicca tathāgato arahaṁ sammāsambuddho thūpāraho?
translation-en-sujato: And for what reason is a Realized One worthy of a monument?

root-pli-ms: ‘Ayaṁ tassa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa thūpo’ti, ānanda, bahujanā cittaṁ pasādenti.
translation-en-sujato: So that many people will inspire confidence in their hearts, thinking: ‘This is the monument for that Blessed One, perfected and fully awakened!’

root-pli-ms: Te tattha cittaṁ pasādetvā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjanti.
translation-en-sujato: And having done so, when their body breaks up, after death, they are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.

root-pli-ms: Idaṁ kho, ānanda, atthavasaṁ paṭicca tathāgato arahaṁ sammāsambuddho thūpāraho.
translation-en-sujato: It is for this reason that a Realized One is worthy of a monument.

root-pli-ms: Kiñcānanda, atthavasaṁ paṭicca paccekasambuddho thūpāraho?
translation-en-sujato: And for what reason is a Buddha awakened for themselves worthy of a monument?

root-pli-ms: ‘Ayaṁ tassa bhagavato paccekasambuddhassa thūpo’ti, ānanda, bahujanā cittaṁ pasādenti.
translation-en-sujato: So that many people will inspire confidence in their hearts, thinking: ‘This is the monument for that Buddha awakened for himself!’

root-pli-ms: Te tattha cittaṁ pasādetvā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjanti.
translation-en-sujato: And having done so, when their body breaks up, after death, they are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.

root-pli-ms: Idaṁ kho, ānanda, atthavasaṁ paṭicca paccekasambuddho thūpāraho.
translation-en-sujato: It is for this reason that a Buddha awakened for himself is worthy of a monument.

root-pli-ms: Kiñcānanda, atthavasaṁ paṭicca tathāgatassa sāvako thūpāraho?
translation-en-sujato: And for what reason is a Realized One’s disciple worthy of a monument?

root-pli-ms: ‘Ayaṁ tassa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa sāvakassa thūpo’ti, ānanda, bahujanā cittaṁ pasādenti.
translation-en-sujato: So that many people will inspire confidence in their hearts, thinking: ‘This is the monument for that Blessed One’s disciple!’

root-pli-ms: Te tattha cittaṁ pasādetvā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjanti.
translation-en-sujato: And having done so, when their body breaks up, after death, they are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.

root-pli-ms: Idaṁ kho, ānanda, atthavasaṁ paṭicca tathāgatassa sāvako thūpāraho.
translation-en-sujato: It is for this reason that a Realized One’s disciple is worthy of a monument.

root-pli-ms: Kiñcānanda, atthavasaṁ paṭicca rājā cakkavattī thūpāraho?
translation-en-sujato: And for what reason is a wheel-turning monarch worthy of a monument?

root-pli-ms: ‘Ayaṁ tassa dhammikassa dhammarañño thūpo’ti, ānanda, bahujanā cittaṁ pasādenti.
translation-en-sujato: So that many people will inspire confidence in their hearts, thinking: ‘This is the monument for that just and principled king!’

root-pli-ms: Te tattha cittaṁ pasādetvā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjanti.
translation-en-sujato: And having done so, when their body breaks up, after death, they are reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.

root-pli-ms: Idaṁ kho, ānanda, atthavasaṁ paṭicca rājā cakkavattī thūpāraho.
translation-en-sujato: It is for this reason that a wheel-turning monarch is worthy of a monument.

root-pli-ms: Ime kho, ānanda, cattāro thūpārahā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: These four are worthy of a monument.”

root-pli-ms: 31. Ānandaacchariyadhamma
translation-en-sujato: 31. Ānanda’s Incredible Qualities

root-pli-ms: Atha kho āyasmā ānando vihāraṁ pavisitvā kapisīsaṁ ālambitvā rodamāno aṭṭhāsi:
translation-en-sujato: Then Venerable Ānanda entered a dwelling, and stood there leaning against the door-jamb and crying,
comment-en-sujato: kapisisa is door jamb, not lintel.

root-pli-ms: “ahañca vatamhi sekho sakaraṇīyo, satthu ca me parinibbānaṁ bhavissati, yo mama anukampako”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Oh! I’m still only a trainee with work left to do; and my Teacher’s about to become fully extinguished, he who is so kind to me!”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha said to the mendicants,

root-pli-ms: “kahaṁ nu kho, bhikkhave, ānando”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “Mendicants, where is Ānanda?”

root-pli-ms: “Eso, bhante, āyasmā ānando vihāraṁ pavisitvā kapisīsaṁ ālambitvā rodamāno ṭhito:
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, Ānanda has entered a dwelling, and stands there leaning against the door-jamb and crying:

root-pli-ms: ‘ahañca vatamhi sekho sakaraṇīyo, satthu ca me parinibbānaṁ bhavissati, yo mama anukampako’”ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Oh! I’m still only a trainee with work left to do; and my Teacher’s about to become fully extinguished, he who is so kind to me!’”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā aññataraṁ bhikkhuṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: So the Buddha said to a certain monk,

root-pli-ms: “ehi tvaṁ, bhikkhu, mama vacanena ānandaṁ āmantehi:
translation-en-sujato: “Please, monk, in my name tell Ānanda that

root-pli-ms: ‘satthā taṁ, āvuso ānanda, āmantetī’”ti.
translation-en-sujato: the teacher summons him.”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho so bhikkhu bhagavato paṭissutvā yenāyasmā ānando tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” that monk replied. He went to Ānanda and said to him,

root-pli-ms: “satthā taṁ, āvuso ānanda, āmantetī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Reverend Ānanda, the teacher summons you.”

root-pli-ms: “Evamāvuso”ti kho āyasmā ānando tassa bhikkhuno paṭissutvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ bhagavā etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, reverend,” Ānanda replied. He went to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side. The Buddha said to him:

root-pli-ms: “alaṁ, ānanda, mā soci mā paridevi, nanu etaṁ, ānanda, mayā paṭikacceva akkhātaṁ:
translation-en-sujato: “Enough, Ānanda! Do not grieve, do not lament. Did I not prepare for this when I explained that

root-pli-ms: ‘sabbeheva piyehi manāpehi nānābhāvo vinābhāvo aññathābhāvo’;
translation-en-sujato: we must be parted and separated from all we hold dear and beloved?

root-pli-ms: taṁ kutettha, ānanda, labbhā. Yaṁ taṁ jātaṁ bhūtaṁ saṅkhataṁ palokadhammaṁ, ‘taṁ vata tathāgatassāpi sarīraṁ mā palujjī’ti netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
translation-en-sujato: How could it possibly be so that what is born, created, conditioned, and liable to fall apart should not fall apart, even the Realized One’s body?

root-pli-ms: Dīgharattaṁ kho te, ānanda, tathāgato paccupaṭṭhito mettena kāyakammena hitena sukhena advayena appamāṇena, mettena vacīkammena hitena sukhena advayena appamāṇena, mettena manokammena hitena sukhena advayena appamāṇena.
translation-en-sujato: For a long time, Ānanda, you’ve treated the Realized One with deeds of body, speech, and mind that are loving, beneficial, pleasant, whole-hearted, and limitless.
comment-en-sujato: advayena appamāṇena seem out of place here, normally they describe jhana, AN 10.25. But it is also found in the Skt: ānanda maitreṇa kāyakarmaṇā hitena sukhenādvayenāpramāṇena

root-pli-ms: Katapuññosi tvaṁ, ānanda, padhānamanuyuñja, khippaṁ hohisi anāsavo”ti.
translation-en-sujato: You have done good deeds, Ānanda. Devote yourself to meditation, and you will soon be free of defilements.”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha said to the mendicants:

root-pli-ms: “yepi te, bhikkhave, ahesuṁ atītamaddhānaṁ arahanto sammāsambuddhā, tesampi bhagavantānaṁ etapparamāyeva upaṭṭhākā ahesuṁ, seyyathāpi mayhaṁ ānando.
translation-en-sujato: “The Buddhas of the past or the future have attendants who are no better than Ānanda is for me.
comment-en-sujato: Cp SN 47.14, DN 20

root-pli-ms: Yepi te, bhikkhave, bhavissanti anāgatamaddhānaṁ arahanto sammāsambuddhā, tesampi bhagavantānaṁ etapparamāyeva upaṭṭhākā bhavissanti, seyyathāpi mayhaṁ ānando.
Paṇḍito, bhikkhave, ānando;
translation-en-sujato: Ānanda is astute,

root-pli-ms: medhāvī, bhikkhave, ānando.
translation-en-sujato: he is intelligent.

root-pli-ms: Jānāti ‘ayaṁ kālo tathāgataṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ bhikkhūnaṁ, ayaṁ kālo bhikkhunīnaṁ, ayaṁ kālo upāsakānaṁ, ayaṁ kālo upāsikānaṁ, ayaṁ kālo rañño rājamahāmattānaṁ titthiyānaṁ titthiyasāvakānan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: He knows the time for monks, nuns, laymen, laywomen, king’s ministers, religious founders, and the disciples of religious founders to visit the Realized One.

root-pli-ms: Cattārome, bhikkhave, acchariyā abbhutā dhammā ānande.
translation-en-sujato: There are these four incredible and amazing things about Ānanda.

root-pli-ms: Katame cattāro?
translation-en-sujato: What four?

root-pli-ms: Sace, bhikkhave, bhikkhuparisā ānandaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamati, dassanena sā attamanā hoti.
translation-en-sujato: If an assembly of monks goes to see Ānanda, they’re uplifted by seeing him

root-pli-ms: Tatra ce ānando dhammaṁ bhāsati, bhāsitenapi sā attamanā hoti.
translation-en-sujato: and uplifted by hearing him speak.

root-pli-ms: Atittāva, bhikkhave, bhikkhuparisā hoti, atha kho ānando tuṇhī hoti.
translation-en-sujato: And when he falls silent, they’ve never had enough.

root-pli-ms: Sace, bhikkhave, bhikkhunīparisā ānandaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamati, dassanena sā attamanā hoti.
translation-en-sujato: If an assembly of nuns …

root-pli-ms: Tatra ce ānando dhammaṁ bhāsati, bhāsitenapi sā attamanā hoti.
Atittāva, bhikkhave, bhikkhunīparisā hoti, atha kho ānando tuṇhī hoti.
Sace, bhikkhave, upāsakaparisā ānandaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamati, dassanena sā attamanā hoti.
translation-en-sujato: laymen …

root-pli-ms: Tatra ce ānando dhammaṁ bhāsati, bhāsitenapi sā attamanā hoti.
Atittāva, bhikkhave, upāsakaparisā hoti, atha kho ānando tuṇhī hoti.
Sace, bhikkhave, upāsikāparisā ānandaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamati, dassanena sā attamanā hoti.
translation-en-sujato: or laywomen goes to see Ānanda, they’re uplifted by seeing him

root-pli-ms: Tatra ce ānando dhammaṁ bhāsati, bhāsitenapi sā attamanā hoti.
translation-en-sujato: and uplifted by hearing him speak.

root-pli-ms: Atittāva, bhikkhave, upāsikāparisā hoti, atha kho ānando tuṇhī hoti.
translation-en-sujato: And when he falls silent, they’ve never had enough.

root-pli-ms: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro acchariyā abbhutā dhammā ānande.
translation-en-sujato: These are the four incredible and amazing things about Ānanda.

root-pli-ms: Cattārome, bhikkhave, acchariyā abbhutā dhammā raññe cakkavattimhi.
translation-en-sujato: There are these four incredible and amazing things about a wheel-turning monarch.

root-pli-ms: Katame cattāro?
translation-en-sujato: What four?

root-pli-ms: Sace, bhikkhave, khattiyaparisā rājānaṁ cakkavattiṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamati, dassanena sā attamanā hoti.
translation-en-sujato: If an assembly of aristocrats goes to see a wheel-turning monarch, they’re uplifted by seeing him

root-pli-ms: Tatra ce rājā cakkavattī bhāsati, bhāsitenapi sā attamanā hoti.
translation-en-sujato: and uplifted by hearing him speak.

root-pli-ms: Atittāva, bhikkhave, khattiyaparisā hoti. Atha kho rājā cakkavattī tuṇhī hoti.
translation-en-sujato: And when he falls silent, they’ve never had enough.

root-pli-ms: Sace bhikkhave, brāhmaṇaparisā …pe…
translation-en-sujato: If an assembly of brahmins …

root-pli-ms: gahapatiparisā …pe…
translation-en-sujato: householders …

root-pli-ms: samaṇaparisā rājānaṁ cakkavattiṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamati, dassanena sā attamanā hoti.
translation-en-sujato: or ascetics goes to see a wheel-turning monarch, they’re uplifted by seeing him

root-pli-ms: Tatra ce rājā cakkavattī bhāsati, bhāsitenapi sā attamanā hoti.
translation-en-sujato: and uplifted by hearing him speak.

root-pli-ms: Atittāva, bhikkhave, samaṇaparisā hoti. Atha kho rājā cakkavattī tuṇhī hoti.
translation-en-sujato: And when he falls silent, they’ve never had enough.

root-pli-ms: Evameva kho, bhikkhave, cattārome acchariyā abbhutā dhammā ānande.
translation-en-sujato: In the same way, there are those four incredible and amazing things about Ānanda.”

root-pli-ms: Sace, bhikkhave, bhikkhuparisā ānandaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamati, dassanena sā attamanā hoti.
Tatra ce ānando dhammaṁ bhāsati, bhāsitenapi sā attamanā hoti.
Atittāva, bhikkhave, bhikkhuparisā hoti.
Atha kho ānando tuṇhī hoti.
Sace, bhikkhave bhikkhunīparisā …pe…
upāsakaparisā …pe…
upāsikāparisā ānandaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamati, dassanena sā attamanā hoti.
Tatra ce ānando dhammaṁ bhāsati, bhāsitenapi sā attamanā hoti.
Atittāva, bhikkhave, upāsikāparisā hoti.
Atha kho ānando tuṇhī hoti.
Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro acchariyā abbhutā dhammā ānande”ti.
32. Mahāsudassanasuttadesanā
translation-en-sujato: 32. Teaching the Discourse on Mahāsudassana

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vutte, āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: When he said this, Venerable Ānanda said to the Buddha:

root-pli-ms: “mā, bhante, bhagavā imasmiṁ khuddakanagarake ujjaṅgalanagarake sākhānagarake parinibbāyi.
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, please don’t become fully extinguished in this little hamlet, this jungle hamlet, this branch hamlet.

root-pli-ms: Santi, bhante, aññāni mahānagarāni, seyyathidaṁ—
translation-en-sujato: There are other great cities such as

root-pli-ms: campā rājagahaṁ sāvatthī sāketaṁ kosambī bārāṇasī;
translation-en-sujato: Campā, Rājagaha, Sāvatthī, Sāketa, Kosambī, and Benares.

root-pli-ms: ettha bhagavā parinibbāyatu.
translation-en-sujato: Let the Buddha become fully extinguished there.

root-pli-ms: Ettha bahū khattiyamahāsālā, brāhmaṇamahāsālā gahapatimahāsālā tathāgate abhippasannā.
translation-en-sujato: There are many well-to-do aristocrats, brahmins, and householders there who are devoted to the Buddha.

root-pli-ms: Te tathāgatassa sarīrapūjaṁ karissantī”ti
translation-en-sujato: They will perform the rites of venerating the Realized One’s corpse.”

root-pli-ms: “mā hevaṁ, ānanda, avaca, mā hevaṁ, ānanda, avaca:
translation-en-sujato: “Don’t say that Ānanda! Don’t say that

root-pli-ms: ‘khuddakanagarakaṁ ujjaṅgalanagarakaṁ sākhānagarakan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: this is a little hamlet, a jungle hamlet, a branch hamlet.

root-pli-ms: Bhūtapubbaṁ, ānanda, rājā mahāsudassano nāma ahosi cakkavattī dhammiko dhammarājā cāturanto vijitāvī janapadatthāvariyappatto sattaratanasamannāgato.
translation-en-sujato: Once upon a time there was a king named Mahāsudassana who was a wheel-turning monarch, a just and principled king. His dominion extended to all four sides, he achieved stability in the country, and he possessed the seven treasures.

root-pli-ms: Rañño, ānanda, mahāsudassanassa ayaṁ kusinārā kusāvatī nāma rājadhānī ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: His capital was this Kusinārā, which at the time was named Kusāvatī.

root-pli-ms: puratthimena ca pacchimena ca dvādasayojanāni āyāmena; uttarena ca dakkhiṇena ca sattayojanāni vitthārena.
translation-en-sujato: It stretched for twelve leagues from east to west, and seven leagues from north to south.

root-pli-ms: Kusāvatī, ānanda, rājadhānī iddhā ceva ahosi phītā ca bahujanā ca ākiṇṇamanussā ca subhikkhā ca.
translation-en-sujato: The royal capital of Kusāvatī was successful, prosperous, populous, full of people, with plenty of food.

root-pli-ms: Seyyathāpi, ānanda, devānaṁ āḷakamandā nāma rājadhānī iddhā ceva hoti phītā ca bahujanā ca ākiṇṇayakkhā ca subhikkhā ca;
translation-en-sujato: It was just like Āḷakamandā, the royal capital of the gods, which is successful, prosperous, populous, full of spirits, with plenty of food.

root-pli-ms: evameva kho, ānanda, kusāvatī rājadhānī iddhā ceva ahosi phītā ca bahujanā ca ākiṇṇamanussā ca subhikkhā ca.
Kusāvatī, ānanda, rājadhānī dasahi saddehi avivittā ahosi divā ceva rattiñca, seyyathidaṁ—
translation-en-sujato: Kusāvatī was never free of ten sounds by day or night, namely:

root-pli-ms: hatthisaddena assasaddena rathasaddena bherisaddena mudiṅgasaddena vīṇāsaddena gītasaddena saṅkhasaddena sammasaddena pāṇitāḷasaddena ‘asnātha pivatha khādathā’ti dasamena saddena.
translation-en-sujato: the sound of elephants, horses, chariots, drums, clay drums, arched harps, singing, horns, gongs, and handbells; and the cry: ‘Eat, drink, be merry!’ as the tenth.

root-pli-ms: Gaccha tvaṁ, ānanda, kusināraṁ pavisitvā kosinārakānaṁ mallānaṁ ārocehi:
translation-en-sujato: Go, Ānanda, into Kusinārā and inform the Mallas:

root-pli-ms: ‘ajja kho, vāseṭṭhā, rattiyā pacchime yāme tathāgatassa parinibbānaṁ bhavissati.
translation-en-sujato: ‘This very day, Vāseṭṭhas, in the last watch of the night, the Realized One will become fully extinguished.

root-pli-ms: Abhikkamatha, vāseṭṭhā, abhikkamatha, vāseṭṭhā.
translation-en-sujato: Come forth, Vāseṭṭhas! Come forth, Vāseṭṭhas!

root-pli-ms: Mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha—
translation-en-sujato: Don’t regret it later, thinking:

root-pli-ms: amhākañca no gāmakkhette tathāgatassa parinibbānaṁ ahosi, na mayaṁ labhimhā pacchime kāle tathāgataṁ dassanāyā’”ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘The Realized One became fully extinguished in our own village district, but we didn’t get a chance to see him in his final hour.’”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paṭissutvā nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya attadutiyo kusināraṁ pāvisi.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” replied Ānanda. Then he robed up and, taking his bowl and robe, entered Kusinārā with a companion.

root-pli-ms: 33. Mallānaṁvandanā
translation-en-sujato: 33. The Mallas Pay Homage

root-pli-ms: Tena kho pana samayena kosinārakā mallā sandhāgāre sannipatitā honti kenacideva karaṇīyena.
translation-en-sujato: Now at that time the Mallas of Kusinārā were sitting together at the meeting hall on some business.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho āyasmā ānando yena kosinārakānaṁ mallānaṁ sandhāgāraṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā kosinārakānaṁ mallānaṁ ārocesi:
translation-en-sujato: Ānanda went up to them, and announced:

root-pli-ms: “ajja kho, vāseṭṭhā, rattiyā pacchime yāme tathāgatassa parinibbānaṁ bhavissati.
translation-en-sujato: “This very day, Vāseṭṭhas, in the last watch of the night, the Realized One will become fully extinguished.

root-pli-ms: Abhikkamatha, vāseṭṭhā, abhikkamatha, vāseṭṭhā.
translation-en-sujato: Come forth, Vāseṭṭhas! Come forth, Vāseṭṭhas!

root-pli-ms: Mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha:
translation-en-sujato: Don’t regret it later, thinking:

root-pli-ms: ‘amhākañca no gāmakkhette tathāgatassa parinibbānaṁ ahosi, na mayaṁ labhimhā pacchime kāle tathāgataṁ dassanāyā’”ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘The Realized One became fully extinguished in our own village district, but we didn’t get a chance to see him in his final hour.’”

root-pli-ms: Idamāyasmato ānandassa vacanaṁ sutvā mallā ca mallaputtā ca mallasuṇisā ca mallapajāpatiyo ca aghāvino dummanā cetodukkhasamappitā appekacce kese pakiriya kandanti, bāhā paggayha kandanti, chinnapātaṁ papatanti, āvaṭṭanti vivaṭṭanti:
translation-en-sujato: When they heard what Ānanda had to say, the Mallas, their sons, daughters-in-law, and wives became distraught, saddened, and grief-stricken. And some, with hair disheveled and arms raised, falling down like their feet were chopped off, rolling back and forth, lamented,

root-pli-ms: “atikhippaṁ bhagavā parinibbāyissati, atikhippaṁ sugato parinibbāyissati, atikhippaṁ cakkhuṁ loke antaradhāyissatī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Too soon the Blessed One will become fully extinguished! Too soon the Holy One will become fully extinguished! Too soon the seer will vanish from the world!”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho mallā ca mallaputtā ca mallasuṇisā ca mallapajāpatiyo ca aghāvino dummanā cetodukkhasamappitā yena upavattanaṁ mallānaṁ sālavanaṁ yenāyasmā ānando tenupasaṅkamiṁsu.
translation-en-sujato: Then the Mallas, their sons, daughters-in-law, and wives, distraught, saddened, and grief-stricken went to the Mallian sal grove at Upavattana and approached Ānanda.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho āyasmato ānandassa etadahosi:
translation-en-sujato: Then Ānanda thought,

root-pli-ms: “sace kho ahaṁ kosinārake malle ekamekaṁ bhagavantaṁ vandāpessāmi, avandito bhagavā kosinārakehi mallehi bhavissati, athāyaṁ ratti vibhāyissati.
translation-en-sujato: “If I have the Mallas pay homage to the Buddha one by one, they won’t be finished before first light.

root-pli-ms: Yannūnāhaṁ kosinārake malle kulaparivattaso kulaparivattaso ṭhapetvā bhagavantaṁ vandāpeyyaṁ:
translation-en-sujato: I’d better separate them family by family and then have them pay homage, saying:

root-pli-ms: ‘itthannāmo, bhante, mallo saputto sabhariyo sapariso sāmacco bhagavato pāde sirasā vandatī’”ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Sir, the Malla named so-and-so with children, wives, retinue, and ministers bows with his head at your feet.’”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho āyasmā ānando kosinārake malle kulaparivattaso kulaparivattaso ṭhapetvā bhagavantaṁ vandāpesi:
translation-en-sujato: And so that’s what he did.

root-pli-ms: “itthannāmo, bhante, mallo saputto sabhariyo sapariso sāmacco bhagavato pāde sirasā vandatī”ti.
Atha kho āyasmā ānando etena upāyena paṭhameneva yāmena kosinārake malle bhagavantaṁ vandāpesi.
translation-en-sujato: So by this means Ānanda got the Mallas to finish paying homage to the Buddha in the first watch of the night.

root-pli-ms: 34. Subhaddaparibbājakavatthu
translation-en-sujato: 34. On Subhadda the Wanderer

root-pli-ms: Tena kho pana samayena subhaddo nāma paribbājako kusinārāyaṁ paṭivasati.
translation-en-sujato: Now at that time a wanderer named Subhadda was residing near Kusinārā.

root-pli-ms: Assosi kho subhaddo paribbājako:
translation-en-sujato: He heard that

root-pli-ms: “ajja kira rattiyā pacchime yāme samaṇassa gotamassa parinibbānaṁ bhavissatī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: on that very day, in the last watch of the night, the ascetic Gotama would become fully extinguished.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho subhaddassa paribbājakassa etadahosi:
translation-en-sujato: He thought:

root-pli-ms: “sutaṁ kho pana metaṁ paribbājakānaṁ vuḍḍhānaṁ mahallakānaṁ ācariyapācariyānaṁ bhāsamānānaṁ:
translation-en-sujato: “I have heard that brahmins of the past who were elderly and senior, the teachers of teachers, said:

root-pli-ms: ‘kadāci karahaci tathāgatā loke uppajjanti arahanto sammāsambuddhā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Only rarely do Realized Ones arise in the world, perfected ones, fully awakened Buddhas.’

root-pli-ms: Ajjeva rattiyā pacchime yāme samaṇassa gotamassa parinibbānaṁ bhavissati.
translation-en-sujato: And this very day, in the last watch of the night, the ascetic Gotama will become fully extinguished.

root-pli-ms: Atthi ca me ayaṁ kaṅkhādhammo uppanno,
translation-en-sujato: This state of uncertainty has come up in me.

root-pli-ms: evaṁ pasanno ahaṁ samaṇe gotame, ‘pahoti me samaṇo gotamo tathā dhammaṁ desetuṁ, yathāhaṁ imaṁ kaṅkhādhammaṁ pajaheyyan’”ti.
translation-en-sujato: I am quite confident that the Buddha is capable of teaching me so that I can give up this state of uncertainty.”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho subhaddo paribbājako yena upavattanaṁ mallānaṁ sālavanaṁ, yenāyasmā ānando tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: Then Subhadda went to the Mallian sal grove at Upavattana, approached Ānanda, and said to him,

root-pli-ms: “sutaṁ metaṁ, bho ānanda, paribbājakānaṁ vuḍḍhānaṁ mahallakānaṁ ācariyapācariyānaṁ bhāsamānānaṁ:
translation-en-sujato: “Master Ānanda, I have heard that brahmins of the past who were elderly and senior, the teachers of teachers, said:

root-pli-ms: ‘kadāci karahaci tathāgatā loke uppajjanti arahanto sammāsambuddhā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Only rarely do Realized Ones arise in the world, perfected ones, fully awakened Buddhas.’

root-pli-ms: Ajjeva rattiyā pacchime yāme samaṇassa gotamassa parinibbānaṁ bhavissati.
translation-en-sujato: And this very day, in the last watch of the night, the ascetic Gotama will become fully extinguished.

root-pli-ms: Atthi ca me ayaṁ kaṅkhādhammo uppanno—
translation-en-sujato: This state of uncertainty has come up in me.

root-pli-ms: evaṁ pasanno ahaṁ samaṇe gotame ‘pahoti me samaṇo gotamo tathā dhammaṁ desetuṁ, yathāhaṁ imaṁ kaṅkhādhammaṁ pajaheyyan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: I am quite confident that the Buddha is capable of teaching me so that I can give up this state of uncertainty.

root-pli-ms: Sādhāhaṁ, bho ānanda, labheyyaṁ samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāyā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Master Ānanda, please let me see the ascetic Gotama.”

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vutte, āyasmā ānando subhaddaṁ paribbājakaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: When he had spoken, Ānanda said,

root-pli-ms: “alaṁ, āvuso subhadda, mā tathāgataṁ viheṭhesi, kilanto bhagavā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Enough, Reverend Subhadda, do not trouble the Realized One. He is tired.”

root-pli-ms: Dutiyampi kho subhaddo paribbājako …pe…
translation-en-sujato: For a second time,

root-pli-ms: tatiyampi kho subhaddo paribbājako āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: and a third time, Subhadda asked Ānanda, and a third time Ānanda refused.

root-pli-ms: “sutaṁ metaṁ, bho ānanda, paribbājakānaṁ vuḍḍhānaṁ mahallakānaṁ ācariyapācariyānaṁ bhāsamānānaṁ:
‘kadāci karahaci tathāgatā loke uppajjanti arahanto sammāsambuddhā’ti.
Ajjeva rattiyā pacchime yāme samaṇassa gotamassa parinibbānaṁ bhavissati.
Atthi ca me ayaṁ kaṅkhādhammo uppanno—
evaṁ pasanno ahaṁ samaṇe gotame, ‘pahoti me samaṇo gotamo tathā dhammaṁ desetuṁ, yathāhaṁ imaṁ kaṅkhādhammaṁ pajaheyyan’ti.
Sādhāhaṁ, bho ānanda, labheyyaṁ samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāyā”ti.
Tatiyampi kho āyasmā ānando subhaddaṁ paribbājakaṁ etadavoca:
“alaṁ, āvuso subhadda, mā tathāgataṁ viheṭhesi, kilanto bhagavā”ti.
Assosi kho bhagavā āyasmato ānandassa subhaddena paribbājakena saddhiṁ imaṁ kathāsallāpaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: The Buddha heard that discussion between Ānanda and Subhadda.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: He said to Ānanda,

root-pli-ms: “alaṁ, ānanda, mā subhaddaṁ vāresi, labhataṁ, ānanda, subhaddo tathāgataṁ dassanāya.
translation-en-sujato: “Enough, Ānanda, don’t obstruct Subhadda; let him see the Realized One.

root-pli-ms: Yaṁ kiñci maṁ subhaddo pucchissati, sabbaṁ taṁ aññāpekkhova pucchissati, no vihesāpekkho.
translation-en-sujato: For whatever he asks me, he will only be looking for understanding, not trouble.

root-pli-ms: Yañcassāhaṁ puṭṭho byākarissāmi, taṁ khippameva ājānissatī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: And he will quickly understand any answer I give to his question.”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho āyasmā ānando subhaddaṁ paribbājakaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: So Ānanda said to the wanderer Subhadda,

root-pli-ms: “gacchāvuso subhadda, karoti te bhagavā okāsan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Go, Reverend Subhadda, the Buddha is taking the time for you.”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho subhaddo paribbājako yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodi, sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho subhaddo paribbājako bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: Then the wanderer Subhadda went up to the Buddha, and exchanged greetings with him. When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side and said to the Buddha:

root-pli-ms: “yeme, bho gotama, samaṇabrāhmaṇā saṅghino gaṇino gaṇācariyā ñātā yasassino titthakarā sādhusammatā bahujanassa,
translation-en-sujato: “Master Gotama, there are those ascetics and brahmins who lead an order and a community, and teach a community. They’re well-known and famous religious founders, regarded as holy by many people.

root-pli-ms: seyyathidaṁ—pūraṇo kassapo, makkhali gosālo, ajito kesakambalo, pakudho kaccāyano, sañcayo belaṭṭhaputto, nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto,
translation-en-sujato: Namely: Pūraṇa Kassapa, Makkhali Gosāla, Nigaṇṭha Nāṭaputta, Sañjaya Belaṭṭhiputta, Pakudha Kaccāyana, and Ajita Kesakambala.
comment-en-sujato: See my note on the parallel at MN 30.

root-pli-ms: sabbete sakāya paṭiññāya abbhaññiṁsu, sabbeva na abbhaññiṁsu, udāhu ekacce abbhaññiṁsu, ekacce na abbhaññiṁsū”ti?
translation-en-sujato: According to their own claims, did all of them have direct knowledge, or none of them, or only some?”

root-pli-ms: “Alaṁ, subhadda, tiṭṭhatetaṁ:
translation-en-sujato: “Enough, Subhadda, let that be.

root-pli-ms: ‘sabbete sakāya paṭiññāya abbhaññiṁsu, sabbeva na abbhaññiṁsu, udāhu ekacce abbhaññiṁsu, ekacce na abbhaññiṁsū’ti.
Dhammaṁ te, subhadda, desessāmi;
translation-en-sujato: I shall teach you the Dhamma.

root-pli-ms: taṁ suṇāhi sādhukaṁ manasikarohi, bhāsissāmī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho subhaddo paribbājako bhagavato paccassosi.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” Subhadda replied.

root-pli-ms: Bhagavā etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: The Buddha said this:

root-pli-ms: “Yasmiṁ kho, subhadda, dhammavinaye ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo na upalabbhati, samaṇopi tattha na upalabbhati. Dutiyopi tattha samaṇo na upalabbhati. Tatiyopi tattha samaṇo na upalabbhati. Catutthopi tattha samaṇo na upalabbhati.
translation-en-sujato: “Subhadda, in whatever teaching and training the noble eightfold path is not found, there is no true ascetic found, no second ascetic, no third ascetic, and no fourth ascetic.

root-pli-ms: Yasmiñca kho, subhadda, dhammavinaye ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo upalabbhati, samaṇopi tattha upalabbhati, dutiyopi tattha samaṇo upalabbhati, tatiyopi tattha samaṇo upalabbhati, catutthopi tattha samaṇo upalabbhati.
translation-en-sujato: In whatever teaching and training the noble eightfold path is found, there is a true ascetic found, a second ascetic, a third ascetic, and a fourth ascetic.

root-pli-ms: Imasmiṁ kho, subhadda, dhammavinaye ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo upalabbhati, idheva, subhadda, samaṇo, idha dutiyo samaṇo, idha tatiyo samaṇo, idha catuttho samaṇo, suññā parappavādā samaṇebhi aññehi.
translation-en-sujato: In this teaching and training the noble eightfold path is found. Only here is there a true ascetic, here a second ascetic, here a third ascetic, and here a fourth ascetic. Other sects are empty of ascetics.

root-pli-ms: Ime ca, subhadda, bhikkhū sammā vihareyyuṁ, asuñño loko arahantehi assāti.
translation-en-sujato: Were these mendicants to practice well, the world would not be empty of perfected ones.

root-pli-ms: Ekūnatiṁso vayasā subhadda,
translation-en-sujato: I was twenty-nine years of age, Subaddha,

root-pli-ms: Yaṁ pabbajiṁ kiṅkusalānuesī;
translation-en-sujato: when I went forth to discover what is skillful.

root-pli-ms: Vassāni paññāsa samādhikāni,
translation-en-sujato: It’s been over fifty years

root-pli-ms: Yato ahaṁ pabbajito subhadda;
translation-en-sujato: since I went forth.

root-pli-ms: Ñāyassa dhammassa padesavattī,
translation-en-sujato: I am the one who points out the proper teaching:
comment-en-sujato: Padesavattī is difficult. Anandajoti has “Existing in the realm of the right Teaching” evidently taking vatti in the sense of exist, be present, and padesa as a place. Walshe more poetically has “To roam the realm of wisdom’s law”. Neither of these agree with comm, which has “Padesavattīti padese vipassanāmagge pavattanto”. However the Sanskrit has āryasya dharmasya pradeśavaktā, where vaktā means “speaker” and pradeśa presumably has the sense “pointing out”. Thus, “I have been the teacher who points out the noble teaching.” While disagreeing in details, this agrees with the thrust of the comm, in that it is to do with teaching. BTW, note that the Skt text has complete verses here and is far more satisfactory. It looks like the Pali has suffered loss of a couple of padas.

root-pli-ms: Ito bahiddhā samaṇopi natthi.
translation-en-sujato: Outside of here there is no true ascetic.

root-pli-ms: Dutiyopi samaṇo natthi.
Tatiyopi samaṇo natthi.
Catutthopi samaṇo natthi.
Suññā parappavādā samaṇebhi aññehi.
Ime ca, subhadda, bhikkhū sammā vihareyyuṁ, asuñño loko arahantehi assā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Were these mendicants to practice well, the world would not be empty of perfected ones.”

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vutte, subhaddo paribbājako bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: When he had spoken, Subhadda said to the Buddha,

root-pli-ms: “abhikkantaṁ, bhante, abhikkantaṁ, bhante.
translation-en-sujato: “Excellent, sir! Excellent!

root-pli-ms: Seyyathāpi, bhante, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṁ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṁ dhāreyya: ‘cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī’ti; evamevaṁ bhagavatā anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
translation-en-sujato: As if he were righting the overturned, or revealing the hidden, or pointing out the path to the lost, or lighting a lamp in the dark so people with good eyes can see what’s there, the Buddha has made the teaching clear in many ways.

root-pli-ms: Esāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavantaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
translation-en-sujato: I go for refuge to the Buddha, to the teaching, and to the mendicant Saṅgha.

root-pli-ms: Labheyyāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavato santike pabbajjaṁ, labheyyaṁ upasampadan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Sir, may I receive the going forth, the ordination in the Buddha’s presence?”

root-pli-ms: “Yo kho, subhadda, aññatitthiyapubbo imasmiṁ dhammavinaye ākaṅkhati pabbajjaṁ, ākaṅkhati upasampadaṁ, so cattāro māse parivasati. Catunnaṁ māsānaṁ accayena āraddhacittā bhikkhū pabbājenti upasampādenti bhikkhubhāvāya.
translation-en-sujato: “Subhadda, if someone formerly ordained in another sect wishes to take the going forth, the ordination in this teaching and training, they must spend four months on probation. When four months have passed, if the mendicants are satisfied, they’ll give the going forth, the ordination into monkhood.

root-pli-ms: Api ca mettha puggalavemattatā viditā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: However, I have recognized individual differences in this matter.”

root-pli-ms: “Sace, bhante, aññatitthiyapubbā imasmiṁ dhammavinaye ākaṅkhantā pabbajjaṁ ākaṅkhantā upasampadaṁ cattāro māse parivasanti, catunnaṁ māsānaṁ accayena āraddhacittā bhikkhū pabbājenti upasampādenti bhikkhubhāvāya. Ahaṁ cattāri vassāni parivasissāmi, catunnaṁ vassānaṁ accayena āraddhacittā bhikkhū pabbājentu upasampādentu bhikkhubhāvāyā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, if four months probation are required in such a case, I’ll spend four years on probation. When four years have passed, if the mendicants are satisfied, let them give me the going forth, the ordination into monkhood.”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha said to Ānanda,

root-pli-ms: “tenahānanda, subhaddaṁ pabbājehī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Well then, Ānanda, give Subhadda the going forth.”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paccassosi.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” Ānanda replied.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho subhaddo paribbājako āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: Then Subhadda said to Ānanda,

root-pli-ms: “lābhā vo, āvuso ānanda; suladdhaṁ vo, āvuso ānanda,
translation-en-sujato: “You’re so fortunate, Reverand Ānanda, so very fortunate,

root-pli-ms: ye ettha satthu sammukhā antevāsikābhisekena abhisittā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: to be anointed here in the Teacher’s presence as his pupil!”

root-pli-ms: Alattha kho subhaddo paribbājako bhagavato santike pabbajjaṁ, alattha upasampadaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: And the wanderer Subhadda received the going forth, the ordination in the Buddha’s presence.

root-pli-ms: Acirūpasampanno kho panāyasmā subhaddo eko vūpakaṭṭho appamatto ātāpī pahitatto viharanto nacirasseva—yassatthāya kulaputtā sammadeva agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajanti—tadanuttaraṁ brahmacariyapariyosānaṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihāsi.
translation-en-sujato: Not long after his ordination, Venerable Subhadda, living alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and resolute, soon realized the supreme end of the spiritual path in this very life. He lived having achieved with his own insight the goal for which gentlemen rightly go forth from the lay life to homelessness.

root-pli-ms: “Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ, kataṁ karaṇīyaṁ, nāparaṁ itthattāyā”ti abbhaññāsi.
translation-en-sujato: He understood: “Rebirth is ended; the spiritual journey has been completed; what had to be done has been done; there is no return to any state of existence.”

root-pli-ms: Aññataro kho panāyasmā subhaddo arahataṁ ahosi.
translation-en-sujato: And Venerable Subhadda became one of the perfected.

root-pli-ms: So bhagavato pacchimo sakkhisāvako ahosīti.
translation-en-sujato: He was the last personal disciple of the Buddha.

root-pli-ms: Pañcamo bhāṇavāro.
35. Tathāgatapacchimavācā
translation-en-sujato: 35. The Buddha’s Last Words

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha addressed Venerable Ānanda:
reference: bj8.242, cck10.192, csp1ed7.127, csp2ed7.127, mc10.135, ms7D_484, msdiv216, pts-cs6.1, pts-vp-pli2.154, sc231

root-pli-ms: “siyā kho panānanda, tumhākaṁ evamassa:
translation-en-sujato: “Now, Ānanda, some of you might think:

root-pli-ms: ‘atītasatthukaṁ pāvacanaṁ, natthi no satthā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘The teacher’s dispensation has passed. Now we have no Teacher.’

root-pli-ms: Na kho panetaṁ, ānanda, evaṁ daṭṭhabbaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: But you should not see it like this.

root-pli-ms: Yo vo, ānanda, mayā dhammo ca vinayo ca desito paññatto, so vo mamaccayena satthā.
translation-en-sujato: The teaching and training that I have taught and pointed out for you shall be your Teacher after my passing.
comment-en-sujato: It’s tempting to read pannatta here as “laid down”, as per Anandajoti, but see eg DN 9 “‘Sassato loko’ti kho, poṭṭhapāda, mayā anekaṁsiko dhammo desito paññatto;”

root-pli-ms: Yathā kho panānanda, etarahi bhikkhū aññamaññaṁ āvusovādena samudācaranti, na kho mamaccayena evaṁ samudācaritabbaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: After my passing, mendicants ought not address each other as ‘reverend’, as they do today.

root-pli-ms: Theratarena, ānanda, bhikkhunā navakataro bhikkhu nāmena vā gottena vā āvusovādena vā samudācaritabbo.
translation-en-sujato: A more senior mendicant ought to address a more junior mendicant by name or clan, or by saying ‘reverend’.

root-pli-ms: Navakatarena bhikkhunā therataro bhikkhu ‘bhante’ti vā ‘āyasmā’ti vā samudācaritabbo.
translation-en-sujato: A more junior mendicant ought to address a more senior mendicant using ‘sir’ or ‘venerable’.

root-pli-ms: Ākaṅkhamāno, ānanda, saṅgho mamaccayena khuddānukhuddakāni sikkhāpadāni samūhanatu.
translation-en-sujato: If it wishes, after my passing the Saṅgha may abolish the lesser and minor training rules.

root-pli-ms: Channassa, ānanda, bhikkhuno mamaccayena brahmadaṇḍo dātabbo”ti.
translation-en-sujato: After my passing, give the prime punishment to the mendicant Channa.”

root-pli-ms: “Katamo pana, bhante, brahmadaṇḍo”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “But sir, what is the prime punishment?”

root-pli-ms: “Channo, ānanda, bhikkhu yaṁ iccheyya, taṁ vadeyya.
translation-en-sujato: “Channa may say what he likes,

root-pli-ms: So bhikkhūhi neva vattabbo, na ovaditabbo, na anusāsitabbo”ti.
translation-en-sujato: but the mendicants should not advise or instruct him.”
comment-en-sujato: the pair vattabba anusasitabba is found quite frequently, eg An 4.111, AN 10.18, MN 15, etc. These are all similar contexts. However, it seems that the more limited sense of vattabba as “advise, correct, admonish” is applicable in such cases, for which especially see MN 15. It seems, therefore, unlikely that the brahmadanda involved actually refusing to speak to him. Normally I render ovada as “advice” or “instructions”, which is also what I use for vattabba in this context, so I just have two terms in the translation.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha said to the mendicants,

root-pli-ms: “siyā kho pana, bhikkhave, ekabhikkhussāpi kaṅkhā vā vimati vā buddhe vā dhamme vā saṅghe vā magge vā paṭipadāya vā, pucchatha, bhikkhave, mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha:
translation-en-sujato: “Perhaps even a single mendicant has doubt or uncertainty regarding the Buddha, the teaching, the Saṅgha, the path, or the practice. So ask, mendicants! Don’t regret it later, thinking:

root-pli-ms: ‘sammukhībhūto no satthā ahosi, na mayaṁ sakkhimhā bhagavantaṁ sammukhā paṭipucchitun’”ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘We were in the Teacher’s presence and we weren’t able to ask the Buddha a question.’”

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vutte, te bhikkhū tuṇhī ahesuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: When this was said, the mendicants kept silent.

root-pli-ms: Dutiyampi kho bhagavā …pe…
translation-en-sujato: For a second time,

root-pli-ms: tatiyampi kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: and a third time the Buddha addressed the mendicants:

root-pli-ms: “siyā kho pana, bhikkhave, ekabhikkhussāpi kaṅkhā vā vimati vā buddhe vā dhamme vā saṅghe vā magge vā paṭipadāya vā, pucchatha, bhikkhave, mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha:
translation-en-sujato: “Perhaps even a single mendicant has doubt or uncertainty regarding the Buddha, the teaching, the Saṅgha, the path, or the practice. So ask, mendicants! Don’t regret it later, thinking:

root-pli-ms: ‘sammukhībhūto no satthā ahosi, na mayaṁ sakkhimhā bhagavantaṁ sammukhā paṭipucchitun’”ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘We were in the Teacher’s presence and we weren’t able to ask the Buddha a question.’”

root-pli-ms: Tatiyampi kho te bhikkhū tuṇhī ahesuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: For a third time, the mendicants kept silent.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha said to the mendicants,

root-pli-ms: “siyā kho pana, bhikkhave, satthugāravenapi na puccheyyātha. Sahāyakopi, bhikkhave, sahāyakassa ārocetū”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Mendicants, perhaps you don’t ask out of respect for the Teacher. So let a friend tell a friend.”

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vutte, te bhikkhū tuṇhī ahesuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: When this was said, the mendicants kept silent.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: Then Venerable Ānanda said to the Buddha,

root-pli-ms: “acchariyaṁ, bhante, abbhutaṁ, bhante, evaṁ pasanno ahaṁ, bhante, imasmiṁ bhikkhusaṅghe, ‘natthi ekabhikkhussāpi kaṅkhā vā vimati vā buddhe vā dhamme vā saṅghe vā magge vā paṭipadāya vā’”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “It’s incredible, sir, it’s amazing! I am quite confident that there’s not even a single mendicant in this Saṅgha who has doubt or uncertainty regarding the Buddha, the teaching, the Saṅgha, the path, or the practice.”

root-pli-ms: “Pasādā kho tvaṁ, ānanda, vadesi, ñāṇameva hettha, ānanda, tathāgatassa. Natthi imasmiṁ bhikkhusaṅghe ekabhikkhussāpi kaṅkhā vā vimati vā buddhe vā dhamme vā saṅghe vā magge vā paṭipadāya vā.
translation-en-sujato: “Ānanda, you speak from faith. But the Realized One knows that there’s not even a single mendicant in this Saṅgha who has doubt or uncertainty regarding the Buddha, the teaching, the Saṅgha, the path, or the practice.

root-pli-ms: Imesañhi, ānanda, pañcannaṁ bhikkhusatānaṁ yo pacchimako bhikkhu, so sotāpanno avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyaṇo”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Even the last of these five hundred mendicants is a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha said to the mendicants:
reference: csp1ed7.128, csp2ed7.128, dr10.181, ms7D_486, msdiv218, pts-cs6.7, pts-vp-pli2.156, sc233, sya10.180

root-pli-ms: “handa dāni, bhikkhave, āmantayāmi vo,
translation-en-sujato: “Come now, mendicants, I say to you all:

root-pli-ms: vayadhammā saṅkhārā appamādena sampādethā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Conditions fall apart. Persist with diligence.’”

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ tathāgatassa pacchimā vācā.
translation-en-sujato: These were the Realized One’s last words.

root-pli-ms: 36. Parinibbutakathā
translation-en-sujato: 36. The Full Extinguishment

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ samāpajji, paṭhamajjhānā vuṭṭhahitvā dutiyaṁ jhānaṁ samāpajji, dutiyajjhānā vuṭṭhahitvā tatiyaṁ jhānaṁ samāpajji, tatiyajjhānā vuṭṭhahitvā catutthaṁ jhānaṁ samāpajji, catutthajjhānā vuṭṭhahitvā ākāsānañcāyatanaṁ samāpajji, ākāsānañcāyatanasamāpattiyā vuṭṭhahitvā viññāṇañcāyatanaṁ samāpajji, viññāṇañcāyatanasamāpattiyā vuṭṭhahitvā ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ samāpajji, ākiñcaññāyatanasamāpattiyā vuṭṭhahitvā nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṁ samāpajji, nevasaññānāsaññāyatanasamāpattiyā vuṭṭhahitvā saññāvedayitanirodhaṁ samāpajji.
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha entered the first absorption. Emerging from that, he entered the second absorption. Emerging from that, he successively entered into and emerged from the third absorption, the fourth absorption, the dimension of infinite space, the dimension of infinite consciousness, the dimension of nothingness, and the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception. Then he entered the cessation of perception and feeling.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho āyasmā ānando āyasmantaṁ anuruddhaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: Then Venerable Ānanda said to Venerable Anuruddha,

root-pli-ms: “parinibbuto, bhante anuruddha, bhagavā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Venerable Anuruddha, has the Buddha become fully extinguished?”
comment-en-sujato: Following Anandajoti, who folows comm in seeing this as a question.

root-pli-ms: “Nāvuso ānanda, bhagavā parinibbuto, saññāvedayitanirodhaṁ samāpanno”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “No, Reverend Ānanda. He has entered the cessation of perception and feeling.”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā saññāvedayitanirodhasamāpattiyā vuṭṭhahitvā nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṁ samāpajji, nevasaññānāsaññāyatanasamāpattiyā vuṭṭhahitvā ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ samāpajji, ākiñcaññāyatanasamāpattiyā vuṭṭhahitvā viññāṇañcāyatanaṁ samāpajji, viññāṇañcāyatanasamāpattiyā vuṭṭhahitvā ākāsānañcāyatanaṁ samāpajji, ākāsānañcāyatanasamāpattiyā vuṭṭhahitvā catutthaṁ jhānaṁ samāpajji, catutthajjhānā vuṭṭhahitvā tatiyaṁ jhānaṁ samāpajji, tatiyajjhānā vuṭṭhahitvā dutiyaṁ jhānaṁ samāpajji, dutiyajjhānā vuṭṭhahitvā paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ samāpajji, paṭhamajjhānā vuṭṭhahitvā dutiyaṁ jhānaṁ samāpajji, dutiyajjhānā vuṭṭhahitvā tatiyaṁ jhānaṁ samāpajji, tatiyajjhānā vuṭṭhahitvā catutthaṁ jhānaṁ samāpajji, catutthajjhānā vuṭṭhahitvā samanantarā bhagavā parinibbāyi.
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha emerged from the cessation of perception and feeling and entered the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception. Emerging from that, he successively entered into and emerged from the dimension of nothingness, the dimension of infinite consciousness, the dimension of infinite space, the fourth absorption, the third absorption, the second absorption, and the first absorption. Emerging from that, he successively entered into and emerged from the second absorption and the third absorption. Then he entered the fourth absorption. Emerging from that the Buddha immediately became fully extinguished.

root-pli-ms: Parinibbute bhagavati saha parinibbānā mahābhūmicālo ahosi bhiṁsanako salomahaṁso. Devadundubhiyo ca phaliṁsu.
translation-en-sujato: When the Buddha became fully extinguished, along with the full extinguishment there was a great earthquake, awe-inspiring and hair-raising, and thunder cracked the sky.

root-pli-ms: Parinibbute bhagavati saha parinibbānā brahmāsahampati imaṁ gāthaṁ abhāsi:
translation-en-sujato: When the Buddha became fully extinguished, Brahmā Sahampati recited this verse:

root-pli-ms: “Sabbeva nikkhipissanti,
translation-en-sujato: “All creatures in this world

root-pli-ms: bhūtā loke samussayaṁ;
translation-en-sujato: must lay down this bag of bones.

root-pli-ms: Yattha etādiso satthā,
translation-en-sujato: For even a Teacher such as this,

root-pli-ms: loke appaṭipuggalo;
translation-en-sujato: unrivaled in the world,

root-pli-ms: Tathāgato balappatto,
translation-en-sujato: the Realized One, attained to power,

root-pli-ms: sambuddho parinibbuto”ti.
translation-en-sujato: the Buddha became fully extinguished.”

root-pli-ms: Parinibbute bhagavati saha parinibbānā sakko devānamindo imaṁ gāthaṁ abhāsi:
translation-en-sujato: When the Buddha became fully extinguished, Sakka, lord of gods, recited this verse:

root-pli-ms: “Aniccā vata saṅkhārā,
translation-en-sujato: “Oh! Conditions are impermanent,

root-pli-ms: uppādavayadhammino;
translation-en-sujato: their nature is to rise and fall;

root-pli-ms: Uppajjitvā nirujjhanti,
translation-en-sujato: having arisen, they cease;

root-pli-ms: tesaṁ vūpasamo sukho”ti.
translation-en-sujato: their stilling is true bliss.”

root-pli-ms: Parinibbute bhagavati saha parinibbānā āyasmā anuruddho imā gāthāyo abhāsi:
translation-en-sujato: When the Buddha became fully extinguished, Venerable Anuruddha recited this verse:

root-pli-ms: “Nāhu assāsapassāso,
translation-en-sujato: “There was no more breathing

root-pli-ms: ṭhitacittassa tādino;
translation-en-sujato: for the poised one of steady heart.

root-pli-ms: Anejo santimārabbha,
translation-en-sujato: Imperturbable, committed to peace,

root-pli-ms: yaṁ kālamakarī muni.
translation-en-sujato: the sage has done his time.
comment-en-sujato: Of the two variants of this line, note that Skt attributes ’ackkhuma'to Sahampati, and kalamakari to Anuruddha.

root-pli-ms: Asallīnena cittena,
translation-en-sujato: He put up with painful feelings

root-pli-ms: vedanaṁ ajjhavāsayi;
translation-en-sujato: without flinching.

root-pli-ms: Pajjotasseva nibbānaṁ,
translation-en-sujato: The liberation of his heart

root-pli-ms: vimokkho cetaso ahū”ti.
translation-en-sujato: was like the extinguishing of a lamp.”

root-pli-ms: Parinibbute bhagavati saha parinibbānā āyasmā ānando imaṁ gāthaṁ abhāsi:
translation-en-sujato: When the Buddha became fully extinguished, Venerable Ānanda recited this verse:

root-pli-ms: “Tadāsi yaṁ bhiṁsanakaṁ,
translation-en-sujato: “Then there was terror!

root-pli-ms: tadāsi lomahaṁsanaṁ;
translation-en-sujato: Then they had goosebumps!

root-pli-ms: Sabbākāravarūpete,
translation-en-sujato: When the Buddha, endowed with all fine qualities,

root-pli-ms: sambuddhe parinibbute”ti.
translation-en-sujato: became fully extinguished.”

root-pli-ms: Parinibbute bhagavati ye te tattha bhikkhū avītarāgā appekacce bāhā paggayha kandanti, chinnapātaṁ papatanti, āvaṭṭanti vivaṭṭanti, “atikhippaṁ bhagavā parinibbuto, atikhippaṁ sugato parinibbuto, atikhippaṁ cakkhuṁ loke antarahito”ti.
translation-en-sujato: When the Buddha became fully extinguished, some of the mendicants there, with arms raised, falling down like their feet were chopped off, rolling back and forth, lamented: “Too soon the Blessed One has become fully extinguished! Too soon the Holy One has become fully extinguished! Too soon the seer has vanished from the world!”
comment-en-sujato: Note that here the text omits kese pakiriya, for obvious reasons. The Pali is almost always incredibly precise in such tiny details!

root-pli-ms: Ye pana te bhikkhū vītarāgā, te satā sampajānā adhivāsenti:
translation-en-sujato: But the mendicants who were free of desire endured, mindful and aware, thinking,

root-pli-ms: “aniccā saṅkhārā, taṁ kutettha labbhā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Conditions are impermanent. How could it possibly be otherwise?”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho āyasmā anuruddho bhikkhū āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: Then Anuruddha addressed the mendicants:

root-pli-ms: “alaṁ, āvuso, mā socittha mā paridevittha.
translation-en-sujato: “Enough, reverends, do not grieve or lament.

root-pli-ms: Nanu etaṁ, āvuso, bhagavatā paṭikacceva akkhātaṁ:
translation-en-sujato: Did the Buddha not prepare us for this when he explained that

root-pli-ms: ‘sabbeheva piyehi manāpehi nānābhāvo vinābhāvo aññathābhāvo’.
translation-en-sujato: we must be parted and separated from all we hold dear and beloved?

root-pli-ms: Taṁ kutettha, āvuso, labbhā. ‘Yaṁ taṁ jātaṁ bhūtaṁ saṅkhataṁ palokadhammaṁ, taṁ vata mā palujjī’ti, netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
translation-en-sujato: How could it possibly be so that what is born, created, conditioned, and liable to fall apart should not fall apart?

root-pli-ms: Devatā, āvuso, ujjhāyantī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: The deities are complaining.”

root-pli-ms: “Kathaṁbhūtā pana, bhante, āyasmā anuruddho devatā manasi karotī”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “But sir, what kind of deities are you thinking of?”
variant-pli-ms: bhante, āyasmā anuruddho devatā manasi karotī”ti → bhante anuruddha devatā manasi karoti (bj); bhante anuruddha devatā manasikarontīti (sya-all, km, mr)

root-pli-ms: “Santāvuso ānanda, devatā ākāse pathavīsaññiniyo kese pakiriya kandanti, bāhā paggayha kandanti, chinnapātaṁ papatanti, āvaṭṭanti, vivaṭṭanti:
translation-en-sujato: “There are, Ānanda, deities—both in the sky and on the earth—who are percipient of the earth. With hair disheveled and arms raised, they fall down like their feet were chopped off, rolling back and forth, lamenting:

root-pli-ms: ‘atikhippaṁ bhagavā parinibbuto, atikhippaṁ sugato parinibbuto, atikhippaṁ cakkhuṁ loke antarahito’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Too soon the Blessed One has become fully extinguished! Too soon the Holy One has become fully extinguished! Too soon the seer has vanished from the world!’

root-pli-ms: Santāvuso ānanda, devatā pathaviyā pathavīsaññiniyo kese pakiriya kandanti, bāhā paggayha kandanti, chinnapātaṁ papatanti, āvaṭṭanti, vivaṭṭanti:
‘atikhippaṁ bhagavā parinibbuto, atikhippaṁ sugato parinibbuto, atikhippaṁ cakkhuṁ loke antarahito’ti.
Yā pana tā devatā vītarāgā, tā satā sampajānā adhivāsenti:
translation-en-sujato: But the deities who are free of desire endure, mindful and aware, thinking:

root-pli-ms: ‘aniccā saṅkhārā, taṁ kutettha labbhā’”ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Conditions are impermanent. How could it possibly be otherwise?’”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho āyasmā ca anuruddho āyasmā ca ānando taṁ rattāvasesaṁ dhammiyā kathāya vītināmesuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Ānanda and Anuruddha spent the rest of the night talking about Dhamma.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho āyasmā anuruddho āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: Then Anuruddha said to Ānanda,
reference: cck10.198, ms7D_502, msdiv226, ndp7.122, pts-cs6.12, pts-vp-pli2.159, sc249, sya10.184

root-pli-ms: “gacchāvuso ānanda, kusināraṁ pavisitvā kosinārakānaṁ mallānaṁ ārocehi:
translation-en-sujato: “Go, Ānanda, into Kusinārā and inform the Mallas:

root-pli-ms: ‘parinibbuto, vāseṭṭhā, bhagavā,
translation-en-sujato: ‘Vāseṭṭhas, the Buddha has become fully extinguished.

root-pli-ms: yassadāni kālaṁ maññathā’”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Please come at your convenience.’”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando āyasmato anuruddhassa paṭissutvā pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya attadutiyo kusināraṁ pāvisi.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” replied Ānanda. Then, in the morning, he robed up and, taking his bowl and robe, entered Kusinārā with a companion.

root-pli-ms: Tena kho pana samayena kosinārakā mallā sandhāgāre sannipatitā honti teneva karaṇīyena.
translation-en-sujato: Now at that time the Mallas of Kusinārā were sitting together at the meeting hall on some business.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho āyasmā ānando yena kosinārakānaṁ mallānaṁ sandhāgāraṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā kosinārakānaṁ mallānaṁ ārocesi:
translation-en-sujato: Ānanda went up to them, and announced,

root-pli-ms: “parinibbuto, vāseṭṭhā, bhagavā,
translation-en-sujato: “Vāseṭṭhas, the Buddha has become fully extinguished.

root-pli-ms: yassadāni kālaṁ maññathā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Please come at your convenience.”

root-pli-ms: Idamāyasmato ānandassa vacanaṁ sutvā mallā ca mallaputtā ca mallasuṇisā ca mallapajāpatiyo ca aghāvino dummanā cetodukkhasamappitā appekacce kese pakiriya kandanti, bāhā paggayha kandanti, chinnapātaṁ papatanti, āvaṭṭanti, vivaṭṭanti:
translation-en-sujato: When they heard what Ānanda had to say, the Mallas, their sons, daughters-in-law, and wives became distraught, saddened, and grief-stricken. And some, with hair disheveled and arms raised, falling down like their feet were chopped off, rolling back and forth, lamented,

root-pli-ms: “atikhippaṁ bhagavā parinibbuto, atikhippaṁ sugato parinibbuto, atikhippaṁ cakkhuṁ loke antarahito”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Too soon the Blessed One has become fully extinguished! Too soon the Holy One has become fully extinguished! Too soon the seer has vanished from the world!”

root-pli-ms: 37. Buddhasarīrapūjā
translation-en-sujato: 37. The Rites of Venerating the Buddha’s Corpse

root-pli-ms: Atha kho kosinārakā mallā purise āṇāpesuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: Then the Mallas ordered their men,

root-pli-ms: “tena hi, bhaṇe, kusinārāyaṁ gandhamālañca sabbañca tāḷāvacaraṁ sannipātethā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “So then, my men, collect fragrances and garlands, and all the musical instruments in Kusinārā.”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho kosinārakā mallā gandhamālañca sabbañca tāḷāvacaraṁ pañca ca dussayugasatāni ādāya yena upavattanaṁ mallānaṁ sālavanaṁ, yena bhagavato sarīraṁ tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato sarīraṁ naccehi gītehi vāditehi mālehi gandhehi sakkarontā garuṁ karontā mānentā pūjentā celavitānāni karontā maṇḍalamāḷe paṭiyādentā ekadivasaṁ vītināmesuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Then—taking those fragrances and garlands, all the musical instruments, and five hundred pairs of garments—they went to the Mallian sal grove at Upavattana and approached the Buddha’s corpse. They spent the day honoring, respecting, revering, and venerating the Buddha’s corpse with dance and song and music and garlands and fragrances, and making awnings and setting up pavilions.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho kosinārakānaṁ mallānaṁ etadahosi:
translation-en-sujato: Then they thought,

root-pli-ms: “ativikālo kho ajja bhagavato sarīraṁ jhāpetuṁ, sve dāni mayaṁ bhagavato sarīraṁ jhāpessāmā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “It’s too late to cremate the Buddha’s corpse today. Let’s do it tomorrow.”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho kosinārakā mallā bhagavato sarīraṁ naccehi gītehi vāditehi mālehi gandhehi sakkarontā garuṁ karontā mānentā pūjentā celavitānāni karontā maṇḍalamāḷe paṭiyādentā dutiyampi divasaṁ vītināmesuṁ, tatiyampi divasaṁ vītināmesuṁ, catutthampi divasaṁ vītināmesuṁ, pañcamampi divasaṁ vītināmesuṁ, chaṭṭhampi divasaṁ vītināmesuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: But they spent the next day the same way, and so too the third, fourth, fifth, and sixth days.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho sattamaṁ divasaṁ kosinārakānaṁ mallānaṁ etadahosi:
translation-en-sujato: Then on the seventh day they thought,

root-pli-ms: “mayaṁ bhagavato sarīraṁ naccehi gītehi vāditehi mālehi gandhehi sakkarontā garuṁ karontā mānentā pūjentā dakkhiṇena dakkhiṇaṁ nagarassa haritvā bāhirena bāhiraṁ dakkhiṇato nagarassa bhagavato sarīraṁ jhāpessāmā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Honoring, respecting, revering, and venerating the Buddha’s corpse with dance and song and music and garlands and fragrances, let us carry it to the south of the town, and cremate it there outside the town.”
comment-en-sujato: Both MW and Anandajoti take it that this means to carry it out of the city to the south. But I can’t see how this is justified either by context or syntax. They are already outside the town.

root-pli-ms: Tena kho pana samayena aṭṭha mallapāmokkhā sīsaṁnhātā ahatāni vatthāni nivatthā:
translation-en-sujato: Now at that time eight of the leading Mallas, having bathed their heads and dressed in unworn clothes, said,
comment-en-sujato: Note that this context confirms the sense of ahata and unworn. Elsewhere we have sīsaṁnhāto navaṁ khomayugaṁ nivattho

root-pli-ms: “mayaṁ bhagavato sarīraṁ uccāressāmā”ti na sakkonti uccāretuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: “We shall lift the Buddha’s corpse.” But they were unable to do so.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho kosinārakā mallā āyasmantaṁ anuruddhaṁ etadavocuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: The Mallas said to Anuruddha,

root-pli-ms: “ko nu kho, bhante anuruddha, hetu ko paccayo, yenime aṭṭha mallapāmokkhā sīsaṁnhātā ahatāni vatthāni nivatthā:
translation-en-sujato: “What is the cause, Venerable Anuruddha, what is the reason why these eight Mallian leaders are unable to lift the Buddha’s corpse?”

root-pli-ms: ‘mayaṁ bhagavato sarīraṁ uccāressāmā’ti na sakkonti uccāretun”ti?
“Aññathā kho, vāseṭṭhā, tumhākaṁ adhippāyo, aññathā devatānaṁ adhippāyo”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Vāseṭṭhas, you have one plan, but the deities have a different one.”

root-pli-ms: “Kathaṁ pana, bhante, devatānaṁ adhippāyo”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “But sir, what is the deities’ plan?”

root-pli-ms: “Tumhākaṁ kho, vāseṭṭhā, adhippāyo:
translation-en-sujato: “You plan to

root-pli-ms: ‘mayaṁ bhagavato sarīraṁ naccehi gītehi vāditehi mālehi gandhehi sakkarontā garuṁ karontā mānentā pūjentā dakkhiṇena dakkhiṇaṁ nagarassa haritvā bāhirena bāhiraṁ dakkhiṇato nagarassa bhagavato sarīraṁ jhāpessāmā’ti;
translation-en-sujato: carry the Buddha’s corpse to the south of the town while venerating it with dance and song and music and garlands and fragrances, and cremate it there outside the town.

root-pli-ms: devatānaṁ kho, vāseṭṭhā, adhippāyo:
translation-en-sujato: The deities plan to

root-pli-ms: ‘mayaṁ bhagavato sarīraṁ dibbehi naccehi gītehi vāditehi mālehi gandhehi sakkarontā garuṁ karontā mānentā pūjentā uttarena uttaraṁ nagarassa haritvā uttarena dvārena nagaraṁ pavesetvā majjhena majjhaṁ nagarassa haritvā puratthimena dvārena nikkhamitvā puratthimato nagarassa makuṭabandhanaṁ nāma mallānaṁ cetiyaṁ ettha bhagavato sarīraṁ jhāpessāmā’”ti.
translation-en-sujato: carry the Buddha’s corpse to the north of the town while venerating it with heavenly dance and song and music and garlands and fragrances. Then they plan to enter the town by the northern gate, carry it through the center of the town, leave by the eastern gate, and cremate it there at the Mallian shrine named Makuṭabandhana.”

root-pli-ms: “Yathā, bhante, devatānaṁ adhippāyo, tathā hotū”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, let it be as the deities plan.”

root-pli-ms: Tena kho pana samayena kusinārā yāva sandhisamalasaṅkaṭīrā jaṇṇumattena odhinā mandāravapupphehi santhatā hoti.
translation-en-sujato: Now at that time the whole of Kusinārā was covered knee-deep with the flowers of the Flame Tree, without gaps even on the filth and rubbish heaps.
comment-en-sujato: The sense of sandhi here is obscure. I think it means “covered without gaps”.
reference: cck10.201, dr10.187, ms7D_507, msdiv229, pts-cs6.16, pts-vp-pli2.161, sc254

root-pli-ms: Atha kho devatā ca kosinārakā ca mallā bhagavato sarīraṁ dibbehi ca mānusakehi ca naccehi gītehi vāditehi mālehi gandhehi sakkarontā garuṁ karontā mānentā pūjentā uttarena uttaraṁ nagarassa haritvā uttarena dvārena nagaraṁ pavesetvā majjhena majjhaṁ nagarassa haritvā puratthimena dvārena nikkhamitvā puratthimato nagarassa makuṭabandhanaṁ nāma mallānaṁ cetiyaṁ ettha ca bhagavato sarīraṁ nikkhipiṁsu.
translation-en-sujato: Then the deities and the Mallas of Kusinārā carried the Buddha’s corpse to the north of the town while venerating it with heavenly and human dance and song and music and garlands and fragrances. Then they entered the town by the northern gate, carried it through the center of the town, left by the eastern gate, and deposited the corpse there at the Mallian shrine named Makuṭabandhana.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho kosinārakā mallā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ etadavocuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: Then the Mallas said to Anuruddha,

root-pli-ms: “kathaṁ mayaṁ, bhante ānanda, tathāgatassa sarīre paṭipajjāmā”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, how do we proceed when it comes to the Realized One’s corpse?”

root-pli-ms: “Yathā kho, vāseṭṭhā, rañño cakkavattissa sarīre paṭipajjanti, evaṁ tathāgatassa sarīre paṭipajjitabban”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Proceed in the same way as they do for the corpse of a wheel-turning monarch.”
