root-pli-ms: Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, sunakkhatta,
translation-en-sujato: What do you think, Sunakkhatta?

root-pli-ms: paññatte vā aggaññe, apaññatte vā aggaññe, yassatthāya mayā dhammo desito, so niyyāti takkarassa sammā dukkhakkhayāyā’ti?
translation-en-sujato: Whether or not the origin of the world is described, does my teaching lead someone who practices it to the goal of the complete ending of suffering?’

root-pli-ms: ‘Paññatte vā, bhante, aggaññe, apaññatte vā aggaññe, yassatthāya bhagavatā dhammo desito, so niyyāti takkarassa sammā dukkhakkhayāyā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘It does, sir.’

root-pli-ms: ‘Iti kira, sunakkhatta, paññatte vā aggaññe, apaññatte vā aggaññe, yassatthāya mayā dhammo desito, so niyyāti takkarassa sammā dukkhakkhayāya.
translation-en-sujato: ‘So it seems that whether or not the origin of the world is described, my teaching leads someone who practices it to the goal of the complete ending of suffering.

root-pli-ms: Tatra, sunakkhatta, kiṁ aggaññaṁ paññattaṁ karissati?
translation-en-sujato: In that case, what is the point of describing the origin of the world?

root-pli-ms: Passa, moghapurisa, yāvañca te idaṁ aparaddhaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: See how far you have strayed, you silly man!

root-pli-ms: Anekapariyāyena kho te, sunakkhatta, mama vaṇṇo bhāsito vajjigāme—
translation-en-sujato: In many ways, Sunakkhatta, you have praised me like this in the Vajjian capital:
reference: csp1ed8.4, csp2ed8.4, ms8D_9, msdiv6, pts-cs1.6, sc8

root-pli-ms: itipi so bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṁ buddho bhagavāti.
translation-en-sujato: “That Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those who wish to train, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.”

root-pli-ms: Iti kho te, sunakkhatta, anekapariyāyena mama vaṇṇo bhāsito vajjigāme.
Anekapariyāyena kho te, sunakkhatta, dhammassa vaṇṇo bhāsito vajjigāme—
translation-en-sujato: In many ways you have praised the teaching like this in the Vajjian capital:

root-pli-ms: svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo sandiṭṭhiko akāliko ehipassiko opaneyyiko paccattaṁ veditabbo viññūhīti.
translation-en-sujato: “The teaching is well explained by the Buddha—visible in this very life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves.”

root-pli-ms: Iti kho te, sunakkhatta, anekapariyāyena dhammassa vaṇṇo bhāsito vajjigāme.
Anekapariyāyena kho te, sunakkhatta, saṅghassa vaṇṇo bhāsito vajjigāme—
translation-en-sujato: In many ways you have praised the Saṅgha like this in the Vajjian capital:

root-pli-ms: suppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, ujuppaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, ñāyappaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, sāmīcippaṭipanno bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, yadidaṁ cattāri purisayugāni aṭṭha purisapuggalā, esa bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, āhuneyyo pāhuneyyo dakkhiṇeyyo añjalikaraṇīyo anuttaraṁ puññakkhettaṁ lokassāti.
translation-en-sujato: “The Saṅgha of the Buddha’s disciples is practicing the way that’s good, straightforward, methodical, and proper. It consists of the four pairs, the eight individuals. This is the Saṅgha of the Buddha’s disciples that is worthy of offerings dedicated to the gods, worthy of hospitality, worthy of a religious donation, worthy of greeting with joined palms, and is the supreme field of merit for the world.”

root-pli-ms: Iti kho te, sunakkhatta, anekapariyāyena saṅghassa vaṇṇo bhāsito vajjigāme.
Ārocayāmi kho te, sunakkhatta, paṭivedayāmi kho te, sunakkhatta.
translation-en-sujato: I declare this to you, Sunakkhatta, I announce this to you!

root-pli-ms: Bhavissanti kho te, sunakkhatta, vattāro, no visahi sunakkhatto licchaviputto samaṇe gotame brahmacariyaṁ carituṁ, so avisahanto sikkhaṁ paccakkhāya hīnāyāvattoti.
translation-en-sujato: There will be those who say that Sunakkhatta was unable to lead the spiritual life under the ascetic Gotama. That’s why he rejected the training and returned to a lesser life.

root-pli-ms: Iti kho te, sunakkhatta, bhavissanti vattāro’ti.
translation-en-sujato: That’s what they’ll say.’

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ kho, bhaggava, sunakkhatto licchaviputto mayā vuccamāno apakkameva imasmā dhammavinayā, yathā taṁ āpāyiko nerayiko.
translation-en-sujato: Though I spoke to Sunakkhatta like this, he still left this teaching and training, like someone on the highway to hell.

root-pli-ms: 2. Korakkhattiyavatthu
translation-en-sujato: 2. On Korakkhattiya

root-pli-ms: Ekamidāhaṁ, bhaggava, samayaṁ thūlūsu viharāmi uttarakā nāma thūlūnaṁ nigamo.
translation-en-sujato: Bhaggava, this one time I was staying in the land of the Thūlus where they have a town named Uttarakā.
comment-en-sujato: DPPN gives the following variants for the name: Thūlū, Bumū, Būmū, Thulū, Khulū, Khūlū, Khuhū
reference: bj9.10, csp1ed8.5, csp2ed8.5, dr11.6, ms8D_14, msdiv7, ndp8.7, pts-cs1.7, sc13
variant-pli-ms: thūlūsu → bumūsu (bj, pts1ed) | ayaṁ → arahaṁ (bj, sya-all, pts1ed)

root-pli-ms: Atha khvāhaṁ, bhaggava, pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya sunakkhattena licchaviputtena pacchāsamaṇena uttarakaṁ piṇḍāya pāvisiṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Then I robed up in the morning and, taking my bowl and robe, entered Uttarakā for alms with Sunakkhatta the Licchavi as my second monk.

root-pli-ms: Tena kho pana samayena acelo korakkhattiyo kukkuravatiko catukkuṇḍiko chamānikiṇṇaṁ bhakkhasaṁ mukheneva khādati, mukheneva bhuñjati.
translation-en-sujato: Now at that time the naked ascetic Korakkhattiya had taken a vow to behave like a dog. When food is tossed on the ground, he gets down on all fours, eating and devouring it just with his mouth.
comment-en-sujato: At MN 57: chamānikkhittaṁ bhojanaṁ bhuñjati
variant-pli-ms: catukkuṇḍiko → catukuṇḍiko (bj, pts1ed); catukoṇḍiko (cck, csp1ed); catukkoṇḍiko (sya1ed, sya2ed)

root-pli-ms: Addasā kho, bhaggava, sunakkhatto licchaviputto acelaṁ korakkhattiyaṁ kukkuravatikaṁ catukkuṇḍikaṁ chamānikiṇṇaṁ bhakkhasaṁ mukheneva khādantaṁ mukheneva bhuñjantaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Sunakkhatta saw him doing this

root-pli-ms: Disvānassa etadahosi:
translation-en-sujato: and thought,

root-pli-ms: ‘sādhurūpo vata bho ayaṁ samaṇo catukkuṇḍiko chamānikiṇṇaṁ bhakkhasaṁ mukheneva khādati, mukheneva bhuñjatī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘That ascetic is a true holy man!’

root-pli-ms: Atha khvāhaṁ, bhaggava, sunakkhattassa licchaviputtassa cetasā cetoparivitakkamaññāya sunakkhattaṁ licchaviputtaṁ etadavocaṁ:
translation-en-sujato: Then, knowing what Sunakkhatta was thinking, I said to him,
reference: cck11.7, ms8D_15, pts-vp-pli3.7, sc14, sya11.7, vri3.5

root-pli-ms: ‘tvampi nāma, moghapurisa, samaṇo sakyaputtiyo paṭijānissasī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Don’t you claim to be an ascetic, a follower of the Sakyan, you silly man?’
variant-pli-ms: moghapurisa, samaṇo sakyaputtiyo → moghapurisa sakyaputtiyo (sya-all, pts1ed)

root-pli-ms: ‘Kiṁ pana maṁ, bhante, bhagavā evamāha:
translation-en-sujato: ‘But why does the Buddha say this to me?’

root-pli-ms: “tvampi nāma, moghapurisa, samaṇo sakyaputtiyo paṭijānissasī”’ti?
‘Nanu te, sunakkhatta, imaṁ acelaṁ korakkhattiyaṁ kukkuravatikaṁ catukkuṇḍikaṁ chamānikiṇṇaṁ bhakkhasaṁ mukheneva khādantaṁ mukheneva bhuñjantaṁ disvāna etadahosi—
translation-en-sujato: ‘When you saw that naked ascetic Korakkhattiya, didn’t you think,

root-pli-ms: sādhurūpo vata bho ayaṁ samaṇo catukkuṇḍiko chamānikiṇṇaṁ bhakkhasaṁ mukheneva khādati, mukheneva bhuñjatī’ti?
translation-en-sujato: “That ascetic is a true holy man!”?’

root-pli-ms: ‘Evaṁ, bhante.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Yes, sir.

root-pli-ms: Kiṁ pana, bhante, bhagavā arahattassa maccharāyatī’ti?
translation-en-sujato: But sir, are you jealous of the perfected ones?’

root-pli-ms: ‘Na kho ahaṁ, moghapurisa, arahattassa maccharāyāmi.
translation-en-sujato: ‘I’m not jealous of the perfected ones, you silly man.

root-pli-ms: Api ca tuyhevetaṁ pāpakaṁ diṭṭhigataṁ uppannaṁ, taṁ pajaha.
translation-en-sujato: Rather, you should give up this harmful misconception that has arisen in you.

root-pli-ms: Mā te ahosi dīgharattaṁ ahitāya dukkhāya.
translation-en-sujato: Don’t create lasting harm and suffering for yourself!

root-pli-ms: Yaṁ kho panetaṁ, sunakkhatta, maññasi acelaṁ korakkhattiyaṁ—sādhurūpo ayaṁ samaṇoti. So sattamaṁ divasaṁ alasakena kālaṁ karissati.
translation-en-sujato: That naked ascetic Korakkhattiya, who you imagine to be a true holy man, will die of flatulence in seven days.
comment-en-sujato: Comm: “Alasakenāti alasakabyādhinā” Tika: “Alasakenāti ajīraṇena āmarogena.”, CPD tympanitis, Cone: flatulence.

root-pli-ms: Kālaṅkato ca kālakañcikā nāma asurā sabbanihīno asurakāyo, tatra upapajjissati.
translation-en-sujato: And when he dies, he’ll be reborn in the very lowest rank of demons, named the Kālakañjas.
comment-en-sujato: The terrifying Kālakañjas are mentioned in DN 20.
variant-pli-ms: kālakañcikā → kālakañjikā (bj, sya-all); kālakañjā (pts1ed) | Kālaṅkato → kālakato (bj, sya-all, pts1ed)

root-pli-ms: Kālaṅkatañca naṁ bīraṇatthambake susāne chaḍḍessanti.
translation-en-sujato: And they’ll throw him in the charnel ground on a clump of vetiver.

root-pli-ms: Ākaṅkhamāno ca tvaṁ, sunakkhatta, acelaṁ korakkhattiyaṁ upasaṅkamitvā puccheyyāsi—
translation-en-sujato: If you wish, Sunakkhatta, go to Korakkhattiya and ask him

root-pli-ms: jānāsi, āvuso korakkhattiya, attano gatinti?
translation-en-sujato: whether he knows his own destiny.

root-pli-ms: Ṭhānaṁ kho panetaṁ, sunakkhatta, vijjati yaṁ te acelo korakkhattiyo byākarissati—
translation-en-sujato: It’s possible that he will answer:

root-pli-ms: jānāmi, āvuso sunakkhatta, attano gatiṁ;
translation-en-sujato: “Reverend Sunakkhatta, I know my own destiny.

root-pli-ms: kālakañcikā nāma asurā sabbanihīno asurakāyo, tatrāmhi upapanno’ti.
translation-en-sujato: I’ve been reborn in the very lowest rank of demons, named the Kālakañjas.”’

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhaggava, sunakkhatto licchaviputto yena acelo korakkhattiyo tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā acelaṁ korakkhattiyaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: So, Bhaggava, Sunakkhatta went to see Korakkhattiya and said to him,
reference: csp1ed8.6, csp2ed8.6, ms8D_17, ndp8.8, pts-cs1.8, pts-vp-pli3.8, sc16, sya11.8

root-pli-ms: ‘byākato khosi, āvuso korakkhattiya, samaṇena gotamena—
translation-en-sujato: ‘Reverend Korakkhattiya, the ascetic Gotama has declared

root-pli-ms: acelo korakkhattiyo sattamaṁ divasaṁ alasakena kālaṁ karissati.
translation-en-sujato: that you will die of flatulence in seven days.

root-pli-ms: Kālaṅkato ca kālakañcikā nāma asurā sabbanihīno asurakāyo, tatra upapajjissati.
translation-en-sujato: And when you die, you’ll be reborn in the very lowest rank of demons, named the Kālakañjas.

root-pli-ms: Kālaṅkatañca naṁ bīraṇatthambake susāne chaḍḍessantīti.
translation-en-sujato: And when you die, they’ll throw you in the charnel ground on a clump of vetiver.

root-pli-ms: Yena tvaṁ, āvuso korakkhattiya, mattaṁ mattañca bhattaṁ bhuñjeyyāsi, mattaṁ mattañca pānīyaṁ piveyyāsi.
translation-en-sujato: But by eating just a little food and drinking just a little water,

root-pli-ms: Yathā samaṇassa gotamassa micchā assa vacanan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: you’ll prove what the ascetic Gotama says to be false.’

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhaggava, sunakkhatto licchaviputto ekadvīhikāya sattarattindivāni gaṇesi, yathā taṁ tathāgatassa asaddahamāno.
translation-en-sujato: Then Sunakkhatta counted up the days until the seventh day, as happens when you have no faith in the Realized One.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhaggava, acelo korakkhattiyo sattamaṁ divasaṁ alasakena kālamakāsi.
translation-en-sujato: But on the seventh day, the naked ascetic Korakkhattiya died of flatulence.

root-pli-ms: kālaṅkato ca kālakañcikā nāma asurā sabbanihīno asurakāyo, tatra upapajji.
translation-en-sujato: And when he passed away, he was reborn in the very lowest rank of demons, named the Kālakañjas.

root-pli-ms: kālaṅkatañca naṁ bīraṇatthambake susāne chaḍḍesuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: And when he passed away, they threw him in the charnel ground on a clump of vetiver.

root-pli-ms: Assosi kho, bhaggava, sunakkhatto licchaviputto:
translation-en-sujato: Sunakkhatta the Licchavi heard about this.
reference: bj9.14, cck11.9, ms8D_19, msdiv9, pts-cs1.9, sc18, vri3.6

root-pli-ms: ‘acelo kira korakkhattiyo alasakena kālaṅkato bīraṇatthambake susāne chaḍḍito’ti.
Atha kho, bhaggava, sunakkhatto licchaviputto yena bīraṇatthambakaṁ susānaṁ, yena acelo korakkhattiyo tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā acelaṁ korakkhattiyaṁ tikkhattuṁ pāṇinā ākoṭesi:
translation-en-sujato: So he went to see Korakkhattiya in the charnel ground on the clump of vetiver. There he struck Korakkhattiya with his fist three times,

root-pli-ms: ‘jānāsi, āvuso korakkhattiya, attano gatin’ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘Reverend Korakkhattiya, do you know your destiny?’

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhaggava, acelo korakkhattiyo pāṇinā piṭṭhiṁ paripuñchanto vuṭṭhāsi.
translation-en-sujato: Then Korakkhattiya got up, rubbing his back with his hands, and said,
comment-en-sujato: Cp Pj 1, Sudinna: pāṇinā gattāni paripuñchanto vuṭṭhāsi.

root-pli-ms: ‘Jānāmi, āvuso sunakkhatta, attano gatiṁ.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Reverend Sunakkhatta, I know my own destiny.

root-pli-ms: Kālakañcikā nāma asurā sabbanihīno asurakāyo, tatrāmhi upapanno’ti vatvā tattheva uttāno papati.
translation-en-sujato: I’ve been reborn in the very lowest rank of demons, named the Kālakañjas.’ After speaking, he fell flat right there.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhaggava, sunakkhatto licchaviputto yenāhaṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā maṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho ahaṁ, bhaggava, sunakkhattaṁ licchaviputtaṁ etadavocaṁ:
translation-en-sujato: Then Sunakkhatta came to me, bowed, and sat down to one side. I said to him,
reference: csp1ed8.7, csp2ed8.7, dr11.9, ms8D_20, msdiv10, ndp8.9, pts-cs1.10, pts-vp-pli3.9, sc19, sya11.9

root-pli-ms: ‘Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, sunakkhatta,
translation-en-sujato: ‘What do you think, Sunakkhatta?

root-pli-ms: yatheva te ahaṁ acelaṁ korakkhattiyaṁ ārabbha byākāsiṁ, tatheva taṁ vipākaṁ, aññathā vā’ti?
translation-en-sujato: Did the declaration I made about Korakkhattiya turn out to be correct, or not?’

root-pli-ms: ‘Yatheva me, bhante, bhagavā acelaṁ korakkhattiyaṁ ārabbha byākāsi, tatheva taṁ vipākaṁ, no aññathā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘It turned out to be correct.’

root-pli-ms: ‘Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, sunakkhatta,
translation-en-sujato: ‘What do you think, Sunakkhatta?

root-pli-ms: yadi evaṁ sante kataṁ vā hoti uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ, akataṁ vā’ti?
translation-en-sujato: If that is so, has a superhuman demonstration of psychic power been performed or not?’

root-pli-ms: ‘Addhā kho, bhante, evaṁ sante kataṁ hoti uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ, no akatan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Clearly, sir, a superhuman demonstration of psychic power has been performed.’

root-pli-ms: ‘Evampi kho maṁ tvaṁ, moghapurisa, uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ karontaṁ evaṁ vadesi—
translation-en-sujato: ‘Though I performed such a superhuman demonstration of psychic power you say this:

root-pli-ms: na hi pana me, bhante, bhagavā uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ karotīti.
translation-en-sujato: “But sir, the Buddha never performs any superhuman demonstrations of psychic power for me.”

root-pli-ms: Passa, moghapurisa, yāvañca te idaṁ aparaddhan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: See how far you have strayed!’

root-pli-ms: Evampi kho, bhaggava, sunakkhatto licchaviputto mayā vuccamāno apakkameva imasmā dhammavinayā, yathā taṁ āpāyiko nerayiko.
translation-en-sujato: Though I spoke to Sunakkhatta like this, he still left this teaching and training, like someone on the highway to hell.

root-pli-ms: 3. Acelakaḷāramaṭṭakavatthu
translation-en-sujato: 3. On the Naked Ascetic Kaḷāramaṭṭaka

root-pli-ms: Ekamidāhaṁ, bhaggava, samayaṁ vesāliyaṁ viharāmi mahāvane kūṭāgārasālāyaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: This one time, Bhaggava, I was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.
reference: bj9.16, cck11.10, ms8D_21, msdiv11, pts-cs1.11, pts-vp-pli3.10, sc20, sya11.10, vri3.7

root-pli-ms: Tena kho pana samayena acelo kaḷāramaṭṭako vesāliyaṁ paṭivasati lābhaggappatto ceva yasaggappatto ca vajjigāme.
translation-en-sujato: Now at that time the naked ascetic Kaḷāramaṭṭaka was residing in Vesālī. And in the Vajjian capital he had reached the peak of material possessions and fame.
comment-en-sujato: Spellings uncertain here, I follow MS.

root-pli-ms: Tassa sattavatapadāni samattāni samādinnāni honti:
translation-en-sujato: He had undertaken these seven vows.

root-pli-ms: ‘yāvajīvaṁ acelako assaṁ, na vatthaṁ paridaheyyaṁ, yāvajīvaṁ brahmacārī assaṁ, na methunaṁ dhammaṁ paṭiseveyyaṁ, yāvajīvaṁ surāmaṁseneva yāpeyyaṁ, na odanakummāsaṁ bhuñjeyyaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: ‘As long as I live, I will be a naked ascetic, not wearing clothes. As long as I live, I will be celibate, not having sex. As long as I live, I will consume only meat and alcohol, not eating rice and porridge.

root-pli-ms: Puratthimena vesāliṁ udenaṁ nāma cetiyaṁ, taṁ nātikkameyyaṁ, dakkhiṇena vesāliṁ gotamakaṁ nāma cetiyaṁ, taṁ nātikkameyyaṁ, pacchimena vesāliṁ sattambaṁ nāma cetiyaṁ, taṁ nātikkameyyaṁ, uttarena vesāliṁ bahuputtaṁ nāma cetiyaṁ taṁ nātikkameyyan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: And I will not go past the following tree shrines near Vesālī: the Udena shrine to the east, the Gotamaka to the south, the Sattamba to the west, and the Bahuputta to the north.’

root-pli-ms: So imesaṁ sattannaṁ vatapadānaṁ samādānahetu lābhaggappatto ceva yasaggappatto ca vajjigāme.
translation-en-sujato: And it was due to undertaking these seven vows that he had reached the peak of material possessions and fame.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhaggava, sunakkhatto licchaviputto yena acelo kaḷāramaṭṭako tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā acelaṁ kaḷāramaṭṭakaṁ pañhaṁ apucchi.
translation-en-sujato: So, Bhaggava, Sunakkhatta went to see Kaḷāramaṭṭaka and asked him a question.

root-pli-ms: Tassa acelo kaḷāramaṭṭako pañhaṁ puṭṭho na sampāyāsi.
translation-en-sujato: But when he couldn’t answer it,

root-pli-ms: Asampāyanto kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātvākāsi.
translation-en-sujato: he displayed irritation, hate, and bitterness.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhaggava, sunakkhattassa licchaviputtassa etadahosi:
translation-en-sujato: So Sunakkhatta thought,

root-pli-ms: ‘sādhurūpaṁ vata bho arahantaṁ samaṇaṁ āsādimhase.
translation-en-sujato: ‘I’ve offended the holy man, the perfected one, the ascetic.
comment-en-sujato: āsādimhase is middle aorist plural; below Sunakkhatta refers to himself in plural, but as usual I render with singular.

root-pli-ms: Mā vata no ahosi dīgharattaṁ ahitāya dukkhāyā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: I mustn’t create lasting harm and suffering for myself!’

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhaggava, sunakkhatto licchaviputto yenāhaṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā maṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho ahaṁ, bhaggava, sunakkhattaṁ licchaviputtaṁ etadavocaṁ:
translation-en-sujato: Then Sunakkhatta came to me, bowed, and sat down to one side. I said to him,
reference: cck11.11, csp1ed8.8, csp2ed8.8, ms8D_23, msdiv13, ndp8.10, pts-cs1.13, sc22, sya11.11

root-pli-ms: ‘tvampi nāma, moghapurisa, samaṇo sakyaputtiyo paṭijānissasī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Don’t you claim to be an ascetic, a follower of the Sakyan, you silly man?’

root-pli-ms: ‘Kiṁ pana maṁ, bhante, bhagavā evamāha—
translation-en-sujato: ‘But why does the Buddha say this to me?’

root-pli-ms: tvampi nāma, moghapurisa, samaṇo sakyaputtiyo paṭijānissasī’ti?
‘Nanu tvaṁ, sunakkhatta, acelaṁ kaḷāramaṭṭakaṁ upasaṅkamitvā pañhaṁ apucchi.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Didn’t you go to see the naked ascetic Kaḷāramaṭṭaka and ask him a question?

root-pli-ms: Tassa te acelo kaḷāramaṭṭako pañhaṁ puṭṭho na sampāyāsi.
translation-en-sujato: But when he couldn’t answer it,

root-pli-ms: Asampāyanto kopañca dosañca appaccayañca pātvākāsi.
translation-en-sujato: he displayed irritation, hate, and bitterness.

root-pli-ms: Tassa te etadahosi:
translation-en-sujato: Then you thought,

root-pli-ms: “sādhurūpaṁ vata bho arahantaṁ samaṇaṁ āsādimhase.
translation-en-sujato: “I’ve offended the holy man, the perfected one, the ascetic.

root-pli-ms: Mā vata no ahosi dīgharattaṁ ahitāya dukkhāyā”’ti.
translation-en-sujato: I mustn’t create lasting harm and suffering for myself!”’

root-pli-ms: ‘Evaṁ, bhante.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Yes, sir.

root-pli-ms: Kiṁ pana, bhante, bhagavā arahattassa maccharāyatī’ti?
translation-en-sujato: But sir, are you jealous of perfected ones?’

root-pli-ms: ‘Na kho ahaṁ, moghapurisa, arahattassa maccharāyāmi,
translation-en-sujato: ‘I’m not jealous of the perfected ones, you silly man.

root-pli-ms: api ca tuyhevetaṁ pāpakaṁ diṭṭhigataṁ uppannaṁ, taṁ pajaha.
translation-en-sujato: Rather, you should give up this harmful misconception that has arisen in you.

root-pli-ms: Mā te ahosi dīgharattaṁ ahitāya dukkhāya.
translation-en-sujato: Don’t create lasting harm and suffering for yourself!

root-pli-ms: Yaṁ kho panetaṁ, sunakkhatta, maññasi acelaṁ kaḷāramaṭṭakaṁ—
translation-en-sujato: That naked ascetic Kaḷāramaṭṭaka, who you imagine to be a true holy man,

root-pli-ms: sādhurūpo ayaṁ samaṇoti, so nacirasseva parihito sānucāriko vicaranto odanakummāsaṁ bhuñjamāno sabbāneva vesāliyāni cetiyāni samatikkamitvā yasā nihīno kālaṁ karissatī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: will shortly be clothed, living with a partner, eating rice and porridge, having gone past all the shrines near Vesālī. And he will die after losing all his fame.’
variant-pli-ms: yasā nihīno → yasā nikiṇṇo (bj, pts1ed, mr) | ayaṁ → arahaṁ (bj, sya-all, pts1ed)

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhaggava, acelo kaḷāramaṭṭako nacirasseva parihito sānucāriko vicaranto odanakummāsaṁ bhuñjamāno sabbāneva vesāliyāni cetiyāni samatikkamitvā yasā nihīno kālamakāsi.
translation-en-sujato: And that’s exactly what happened.

root-pli-ms: Assosi kho, bhaggava, sunakkhatto licchaviputto:
translation-en-sujato: Sunakkhatta heard about this.
reference: cck11.12, csp1ed8.9, csp2ed8.9, ms8D_26, msdiv14, ndp8.11, pts-cs1.14, pts-vp-pli3.12, sc25, sya11.12, vri3.8

root-pli-ms: ‘acelo kira kaḷāramaṭṭako parihito sānucāriko vicaranto odanakummāsaṁ bhuñjamāno sabbāneva vesāliyāni cetiyāni samatikkamitvā yasā nihīno kālaṅkato’ti.
Atha kho, bhaggava, sunakkhatto licchaviputto yenāhaṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā maṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho ahaṁ, bhaggava, sunakkhattaṁ licchaviputtaṁ etadavocaṁ:
translation-en-sujato: He came to me, bowed, and sat down to one side. I said to him,

root-pli-ms: ‘Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, sunakkhatta,
translation-en-sujato: ‘What do you think, Sunakkhatta?

root-pli-ms: yatheva te ahaṁ acelaṁ kaḷāramaṭṭakaṁ ārabbha byākāsiṁ, tatheva taṁ vipākaṁ, aññathā vā’ti?
translation-en-sujato: Did the declaration I made about Kaḷāramaṭṭaka turn out to be correct, or not?’

root-pli-ms: ‘Yatheva me, bhante, bhagavā acelaṁ kaḷāramaṭṭakaṁ ārabbha byākāsi, tatheva taṁ vipākaṁ, no aññathā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘It turned out to be correct.’

root-pli-ms: ‘Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, sunakkhatta,
translation-en-sujato: ‘What do you think, Sunakkhatta?

root-pli-ms: yadi evaṁ sante kataṁ vā hoti uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ akataṁ vā’ti?
translation-en-sujato: If that is so, has a superhuman demonstration of psychic power been performed or not?’

root-pli-ms: ‘Addhā kho, bhante, evaṁ sante kataṁ hoti uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ, no akatan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Clearly, sir, a superhuman demonstration of psychic power has been performed.’

root-pli-ms: ‘Evampi kho maṁ tvaṁ, moghapurisa, uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ karontaṁ evaṁ vadesi:
translation-en-sujato: ‘Though I perform such a superhuman demonstration of psychic power you say this:

root-pli-ms: “na hi pana me, bhante, bhagavā uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ karotī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “But sir, the Buddha never performs any superhuman demonstrations of psychic power for me.”

root-pli-ms: Passa, moghapurisa, yāvañca te idaṁ aparaddhan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: See how far you have strayed!’

root-pli-ms: Evampi kho, bhaggava, sunakkhatto licchaviputto mayā vuccamāno apakkameva imasmā dhammavinayā, yathā taṁ āpāyiko nerayiko.
translation-en-sujato: Though I spoke to Sunakkhatta like this, he still left this teaching and training, like someone on the highway to hell.

root-pli-ms: 4. Acelapāthikaputtavatthu
translation-en-sujato: 4. On the Naked Ascetic Pāṭikaputta

root-pli-ms: Ekamidāhaṁ, bhaggava, samayaṁ tattheva vesāliyaṁ viharāmi mahāvane kūṭāgārasālāyaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: This one time, Bhaggava, I was staying right there near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.
reference: bj9.20, cck11.13, dr11.12, ms8D_27, msdiv15, pts-cs1.15, pts-vp-pli3.13, sc26, sya11.13

root-pli-ms: Tena kho pana samayena acelo pāthikaputto vesāliyaṁ paṭivasati lābhaggappatto ceva yasaggappatto ca vajjigāme.
translation-en-sujato: Now at that time the naked ascetic Pāṭikaputta was residing in Vesālī. And in the Vajjian capital he had reached the peak of material possessions and fame.

root-pli-ms: So vesāliyaṁ parisati evaṁ vācaṁ bhāsati:
translation-en-sujato: He was telling a crowd in Vesālī:

root-pli-ms: ‘samaṇopi gotamo ñāṇavādo, ahampi ñāṇavādo.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Both the ascetic Gotama and I speak from knowledge.

root-pli-ms: Ñāṇavādo kho pana ñāṇavādena arahati uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ dassetuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: One who speaks from knowledge ought to display a superhuman demonstration of psychic power to another who speaks from knowledge.

root-pli-ms: Samaṇo gotamo upaḍḍhapathaṁ āgaccheyya, ahampi upaḍḍhapathaṁ gaccheyyaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: If the ascetic Gotama meets me half-way,

root-pli-ms: Te tattha ubhopi uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ kareyyāma.
translation-en-sujato: there we should both perform a superhuman demonstration of psychic power.

root-pli-ms: Ekañce samaṇo gotamo uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ karissati, dvāhaṁ karissāmi.
translation-en-sujato: If he performs one demonstration of psychic power, I’ll perform two.

root-pli-ms: Dve ce samaṇo gotamo uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyāni karissati, cattārāhaṁ karissāmi.
translation-en-sujato: If he performs two, I’ll perform four.

root-pli-ms: Cattāri ce samaṇo gotamo uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyāni karissati, aṭṭhāhaṁ karissāmi.
translation-en-sujato: If he performs four, I’ll perform eight.

root-pli-ms: Iti yāvatakaṁ yāvatakaṁ samaṇo gotamo uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ karissati, taddiguṇaṁ taddiguṇāhaṁ karissāmī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: However many demonstrations of psychic power the ascetic Gotama performs, I’ll perform double.’

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhaggava, sunakkhatto licchaviputto yenāhaṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā maṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho, bhaggava, sunakkhatto licchaviputto maṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: Then Sunakkhatta came to me, bowed, sat down to one side, and told me of all this.
reference: cck11.14, csp1ed8.10, csp2ed8.10, dr11.13, ms8D_28, msdiv16, ndp8.12, pts-cs1.16, sc27, vri3.9

root-pli-ms: ‘acelo, bhante, pāthikaputto vesāliyaṁ paṭivasati lābhaggappatto ceva yasaggappatto ca vajjigāme.
So vesāliyaṁ parisati evaṁ vācaṁ bhāsati:
“samaṇopi gotamo ñāṇavādo, ahampi ñāṇavādo.
Ñāṇavādo kho pana ñāṇavādena arahati uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ dassetuṁ.
Samaṇo gotamo upaḍḍhapathaṁ āgaccheyya, ahampi upaḍḍhapathaṁ gaccheyyaṁ.
Te tattha ubhopi uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ kareyyāma.
Ekañce samaṇo gotamo uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ karissati, dvāhaṁ karissāmi.
Dve ce samaṇo gotamo uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyāni karissati, cattārāhaṁ karissāmi.
Cattāri ce samaṇo gotamo uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyāni karissati, aṭṭhāhaṁ karissāmi.
Iti yāvatakaṁ yāvatakaṁ samaṇo gotamo uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ karissati, taddiguṇaṁ taddiguṇāhaṁ karissāmī”’ti.
Evaṁ vutte, ahaṁ, bhaggava, sunakkhattaṁ licchaviputtaṁ etadavocaṁ:
translation-en-sujato: I said to him,

root-pli-ms: ‘abhabbo kho, sunakkhatta, acelo pāthikaputto taṁ vācaṁ appahāya taṁ cittaṁ appahāya taṁ diṭṭhiṁ appaṭinissajjitvā mama sammukhībhāvaṁ āgantuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Sunakkhatta, the naked ascetic Pāṭikaputta is not capable of coming into my presence, unless he gives up that statement and that intention, and lets go of that view.

root-pli-ms: Sacepissa evamassa—
translation-en-sujato: If he thinks he can

root-pli-ms: ahaṁ taṁ vācaṁ appahāya taṁ cittaṁ appahāya taṁ diṭṭhiṁ appaṭinissajjitvā samaṇassa gotamassa sammukhībhāvaṁ gaccheyyanti, muddhāpi tassa vipateyyā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: come into my presence without giving up those things, his head may explode.’

root-pli-ms: ‘Rakkhatetaṁ, bhante, bhagavā vācaṁ, rakkhatetaṁ sugato vācan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Careful what you say, Blessed One! Careful what you say, Holy One!’

root-pli-ms: ‘Kiṁ pana maṁ tvaṁ, sunakkhatta, evaṁ vadesi—
translation-en-sujato: ‘But why do you say this to me, Sunakkhatta?’

root-pli-ms: rakkhatetaṁ, bhante, bhagavā vācaṁ, rakkhatetaṁ sugato vācan’ti?
‘Bhagavatā cassa, bhante, esā vācā ekaṁsena odhāritā—
translation-en-sujato: ‘Sir, the Buddha has definitively asserted that

root-pli-ms: abhabbo acelo pāthikaputto taṁ vācaṁ appahāya taṁ cittaṁ appahāya taṁ diṭṭhiṁ appaṭinissajjitvā mama sammukhībhāvaṁ āgantuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Pāṭikaputta is not capable of coming into the Buddha’s presence, otherwise

root-pli-ms: Sacepissa evamassa—
ahaṁ taṁ vācaṁ appahāya taṁ cittaṁ appahāya taṁ diṭṭhiṁ appaṭinissajjitvā samaṇassa gotamassa sammukhībhāvaṁ gaccheyyanti, muddhāpi tassa vipateyyāti.
translation-en-sujato: his head may explode.

root-pli-ms: Acelo ca, bhante, pāthikaputto virūparūpena bhagavato sammukhībhāvaṁ āgaccheyya, tadassa bhagavato musā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: But Pāṭikaputta might come into the Buddha’s presence in disguise, proving the Buddha wrong.’

root-pli-ms: ‘Api nu, sunakkhatta, tathāgato taṁ vācaṁ bhāseyya yā sā vācā dvayagāminī’ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘Sunakkhatta, would the Realized One make an ambiguous statement?’
reference: cck11.15, csp1ed8.11, csp2ed8.11, dr11.14, ms8D_31, msdiv18, pts-cs1.18, sc30

root-pli-ms: ‘Kiṁ pana, bhante, bhagavatā acelo pāthikaputto cetasā ceto paricca vidito—
translation-en-sujato: ‘But sir, did you make that statement after comprehending Pāṭikaputta’s mind with your mind?

root-pli-ms: abhabbo acelo pāthikaputto taṁ vācaṁ appahāya taṁ cittaṁ appahāya taṁ diṭṭhiṁ appaṭinissajjitvā mama sammukhībhāvaṁ āgantuṁ.
Sacepissa evamassa—
ahaṁ taṁ vācaṁ appahāya taṁ cittaṁ appahāya taṁ diṭṭhiṁ appaṭinissajjitvā samaṇassa gotamassa sammukhībhāvaṁ gaccheyyanti, muddhāpi tassa vipateyyāti?
Udāhu, devatā bhagavato etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ—
translation-en-sujato: Or did deities tell you about it?’

root-pli-ms: abhabbo, bhante, acelo pāthikaputto taṁ vācaṁ appahāya taṁ cittaṁ appahāya taṁ diṭṭhiṁ appaṭinissajjitvā bhagavato sammukhībhāvaṁ āgantuṁ.
Sacepissa evamassa—
ahaṁ taṁ vācaṁ appahāya taṁ cittaṁ appahāya taṁ diṭṭhiṁ appaṭinissajjitvā samaṇassa gotamassa sammukhībhāvaṁ gaccheyyanti, muddhāpi tassa vipateyyā’ti?
‘Cetasā ceto paricca vidito ceva me, sunakkhatta, acelo pāthikaputto—
translation-en-sujato: ‘Both, Sunakkhatta.
reference: bj9.24, ms8D_33, msdiv19, ndp8.13, sc32, sya11.15

root-pli-ms: abhabbo acelo pāthikaputto taṁ vācaṁ appahāya taṁ cittaṁ appahāya taṁ diṭṭhiṁ appaṭinissajjitvā mama sammukhībhāvaṁ āgantuṁ.
Sacepissa evamassa—
ahaṁ taṁ vācaṁ appahāya taṁ cittaṁ appahāya taṁ diṭṭhiṁ appaṭinissajjitvā samaṇassa gotamassa sammukhībhāvaṁ gaccheyyanti, muddhāpi tassa vipateyyāti.
Devatāpi me etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ—
abhabbo, bhante, acelo pāthikaputto taṁ vācaṁ appahāya taṁ cittaṁ appahāya taṁ diṭṭhiṁ appaṭinissajjitvā bhagavato sammukhībhāvaṁ āgantuṁ.
Sacepissa evamassa—
ahaṁ taṁ vācaṁ appahāya taṁ cittaṁ appahāya taṁ diṭṭhiṁ appaṭinissajjitvā samaṇassa gotamassa sammukhībhāvaṁ gaccheyyanti, muddhāpi tassa vipateyyāti.
Ajitopi nāma licchavīnaṁ senāpati adhunā kālaṅkato tāvatiṁsakāyaṁ upapanno.
translation-en-sujato: For Ajita the Licchavi general has recently passed away and been reborn in the host of the Thirty-Three.

root-pli-ms: Sopi maṁ upasaṅkamitvā evamārocesi—
translation-en-sujato: He came and told me this,

root-pli-ms: alajjī, bhante, acelo pāthikaputto;
translation-en-sujato: “The naked ascetic Pāṭikaputta is shameless, sir,

root-pli-ms: musāvādī, bhante, acelo pāthikaputto.
translation-en-sujato: he is a liar.

root-pli-ms: Mampi, bhante, acelo pāthikaputto byākāsi vajjigāme—
translation-en-sujato: For he has declared of me in the Vajjian capital:

root-pli-ms: ajito licchavīnaṁ senāpati mahānirayaṁ upapannoti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Ajita the Licchavi general has been reborn in the Great Hell.’

root-pli-ms: Na kho panāhaṁ, bhante, mahānirayaṁ upapanno;
translation-en-sujato: But that is not true—

root-pli-ms: tāvatiṁsakāyamhi upapanno.
translation-en-sujato: I have been reborn in the host of the Thirty-Three.

root-pli-ms: Alajjī, bhante, acelo pāthikaputto;
translation-en-sujato: The naked ascetic Pāṭikaputta is shameless, sir,

root-pli-ms: musāvādī, bhante, acelo pāthikaputto;
translation-en-sujato: he is a liar.

root-pli-ms: abhabbo ca, bhante, acelo pāthikaputto taṁ vācaṁ appahāya taṁ cittaṁ appahāya taṁ diṭṭhiṁ appaṭinissajjitvā bhagavato sammukhībhāvaṁ āgantuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Pāṭikaputta is not capable of coming into the Buddha’s presence, otherwise

root-pli-ms: Sacepissa evamassa—
ahaṁ taṁ vācaṁ appahāya taṁ cittaṁ appahāya taṁ diṭṭhiṁ appaṭinissajjitvā samaṇassa gotamassa sammukhībhāvaṁ gaccheyyanti, muddhāpi tassa vipateyyāti.
translation-en-sujato: his head may explode.”

root-pli-ms: Iti kho, sunakkhatta, cetasā ceto paricca vidito ceva me acelo pāthikaputto abhabbo acelo pāthikaputto taṁ vācaṁ appahāya taṁ cittaṁ appahāya taṁ diṭṭhiṁ appaṭinissajjitvā mama sammukhībhāvaṁ āgantuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Thus I both made that statement after comprehending Pāṭikaputta’s mind with my mind,

root-pli-ms: Sacepissa evamassa—
ahaṁ taṁ vācaṁ appahāya taṁ cittaṁ appahāya taṁ diṭṭhiṁ appaṭinissajjitvā samaṇassa gotamassa sammukhībhāvaṁ gaccheyyanti, muddhāpi tassa vipateyyāti.
Devatāpi me etamatthaṁ ārocesuṁ—
translation-en-sujato: and deities told me about it.

root-pli-ms: abhabbo, bhante, acelo pāthikaputto taṁ vācaṁ appahāya taṁ cittaṁ appahāya taṁ diṭṭhiṁ appaṭinissajjitvā bhagavato sammukhībhāvaṁ āgantuṁ.
Sacepissa evamassa—
ahaṁ taṁ vācaṁ appahāya taṁ cittaṁ appahāya taṁ diṭṭhiṁ appaṭinissajjitvā samaṇassa gotamassa sammukhībhāvaṁ gaccheyyanti, muddhāpi tassa vipateyyāti.
So kho panāhaṁ, sunakkhatta, vesāliyaṁ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṁ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto yena acelassa pāthikaputtassa ārāmo tenupasaṅkamissāmi divāvihārāya.
translation-en-sujato: So Sunakkhatta, I’ll wander for alms in Vesālī. After the meal, on my return from alms-round, I’ll go to Pāṭikaputta’s monastery for the day’s meditation.

root-pli-ms: Yassadāni tvaṁ, sunakkhatta, icchasi, tassa ārocehī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: Now you may tell him, if you so wish.’

root-pli-ms: 5. Iddhipāṭihāriyakathā
translation-en-sujato: 5. On Demonstrations of Psychic Power

root-pli-ms: Atha khvāhaṁ, bhaggava, pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya vesāliṁ piṇḍāya pāvisiṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Then, Bhaggava, I robed up in the morning and, taking my bowl and robe, entered Vesālī for alms.
reference: bj9.26, cck11.17, csp1ed8.13, csp2ed8.13, dr11.16, ms8D_39, msdiv20, pts-cs1.19, pts-vp-pli3.16, sc38, sya11.17
variant-pli-ms: Atha khvāhaṁ → atha kho svāhaṁ (sya-all); atha kho’ haṁ (pts1ed)

root-pli-ms: Vesāliyaṁ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṁ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto yena acelassa pāthikaputtassa ārāmo tenupasaṅkamiṁ divāvihārāya.
translation-en-sujato: After the meal, on my return from alms-round, I went to Pāṭikaputta’s monastery for the day’s meditation.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhaggava, sunakkhatto licchaviputto taramānarūpo vesāliṁ pavisitvā yena abhiññātā abhiññātā licchavī tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā abhiññāte abhiññāte licchavī etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: Then Sunakkhatta rushed into Vesālī to see the very well-known Licchavis and said to them,

root-pli-ms: ‘esāvuso, bhagavā vesāliyaṁ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṁ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto yena acelassa pāthikaputtassa ārāmo tenupasaṅkami divāvihārāya.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Sirs, after his alms-round, the Buddha has gone to Pāṭikaputta’s monastery for the day’s meditation.

root-pli-ms: Abhikkamathāyasmanto abhikkamathāyasmanto, sādhurūpānaṁ samaṇānaṁ uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: Come forth, sirs, come forth! There will be a superhuman demonstration of psychic power by the holy ascetics!’

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhaggava, abhiññātānaṁ abhiññātānaṁ licchavīnaṁ etadahosi:
translation-en-sujato: So the very well-known Licchavis thought,

root-pli-ms: ‘sādhurūpānaṁ kira, bho, samaṇānaṁ uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ bhavissati;
translation-en-sujato: ‘It seems there will be a superhuman demonstration of psychic power by the holy ascetics!

root-pli-ms: handa vata, bho, gacchāmā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: Let’s go!’

root-pli-ms: Yena ca abhiññātā abhiññātā brāhmaṇamahāsālā gahapatinecayikā nānātitthiyā samaṇabrāhmaṇā tenupasaṅkami. upasaṅkamitvā abhiññāte abhiññāte nānātitthiye samaṇabrāhmaṇe etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: Then he went to see the very well-known well-to-do brahmins, rich householders, and ascetics and brahmins who follow various other paths, and said the same thing.

root-pli-ms: ‘esāvuso, bhagavā vesāliyaṁ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṁ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto yena acelassa pāthikaputtassa ārāmo tenupasaṅkami divāvihārāya.
Abhikkamathāyasmanto abhikkamathāyasmanto, sādhurūpānaṁ samaṇānaṁ uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ bhavissatī’ti.
Atha kho, bhaggava, abhiññātānaṁ abhiññātānaṁ nānātitthiyānaṁ samaṇabrāhmaṇānaṁ etadahosi:
translation-en-sujato: They all said,

root-pli-ms: ‘sādhurūpānaṁ kira, bho, samaṇānaṁ uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ bhavissati;
translation-en-sujato: ‘It seems there will be a superhuman demonstration of psychic power by the holy ascetics!

root-pli-ms: handa vata, bho, gacchāmā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: Let’s go!’

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhaggava, abhiññātā abhiññātā licchavī, abhiññātā abhiññātā ca brāhmaṇamahāsālā gahapatinecayikā nānātitthiyā samaṇabrāhmaṇā yena acelassa pāthikaputtassa ārāmo tenupasaṅkamiṁsu.
translation-en-sujato: Then all those very well-known people went to Pāṭikaputta’s monastery.

root-pli-ms: Sā esā, bhaggava, parisā mahā hoti anekasatā anekasahassā.
translation-en-sujato: That assembly was large, Bhaggava; there were many hundreds, many thousands of them.
variant-pli-ms: parisā mahā hoti → parisā hoti (bj, sya-all, pts1ed)

root-pli-ms: Assosi kho, bhaggava, acelo pāthikaputto:
translation-en-sujato: Pāṭikaputta heard,

root-pli-ms: ‘abhikkantā kira abhiññātā abhiññātā licchavī, abhikkantā abhiññātā abhiññātā ca brāhmaṇamahāsālā gahapatinecayikā nānātitthiyā samaṇabrāhmaṇā.
translation-en-sujato: ‘It seems that very well-known Licchavis, well-to-do brahmins, rich householders, and ascetics and brahmins who follow various other paths have come forth.

root-pli-ms: Samaṇopi gotamo mayhaṁ ārāme divāvihāraṁ nisinno’ti.
translation-en-sujato: And the ascetic Gotama is sitting in my monastery for the day’s meditation.’

root-pli-ms: Sutvānassa bhayaṁ chambhitattaṁ lomahaṁso udapādi.
translation-en-sujato: When he heard that, he became frightened, scared, his hair standing on end.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhaggava, acelo pāthikaputto bhīto saṁviggo lomahaṭṭhajāto yena tindukakhāṇuparibbājakārāmo tenupasaṅkami.
translation-en-sujato: In fear he went to the Pale-Moon Ebony Trunk Monastery of the wanderers.

root-pli-ms: Assosi kho, bhaggava, sā parisā:
translation-en-sujato: The assembly heard of this,

root-pli-ms: ‘acelo kira pāthikaputto bhīto saṁviggo lomahaṭṭhajāto yena tindukakhāṇuparibbājakārāmo tenupasaṅkanto’ti.
Atha kho, bhaggava, sā parisā aññataraṁ purisaṁ āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: and instructed a man,

root-pli-ms: ‘Ehi tvaṁ, bho purisa, yena tindukakhāṇuparibbājakārāmo, yena acelo pāthikaputto tenupasaṅkama. upasaṅkamitvā acelaṁ pāthikaputtaṁ evaṁ vadehi:
translation-en-sujato: ‘Come, my man, go to see Pāṭikaputta at the Pale-Moon Ebony Trunk Monastery and say to him,

root-pli-ms: “abhikkamāvuso, pāthikaputta, abhikkantā abhiññātā abhiññātā licchavī, abhikkantā abhiññātā abhiññātā ca brāhmaṇamahāsālā gahapatinecayikā nānātitthiyā samaṇabrāhmaṇā, samaṇopi gotamo āyasmato ārāme divāvihāraṁ nisinno;
translation-en-sujato: “Come forth, Reverend Pāṭikaputta! All these very well-known people have come forth, and the ascetic Gotama is sitting in your monastery for the day’s meditation.

root-pli-ms: bhāsitā kho pana te esā, āvuso pāthikaputta, vesāliyaṁ parisati vācā
translation-en-sujato: For you stated this in the assembly at Vesālī:

root-pli-ms: samaṇopi gotamo ñāṇavādo, ahampi ñāṇavādo.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Both the ascetic Gotama and I speak from knowledge.

root-pli-ms: Ñāṇavādo kho pana ñāṇavādena arahati uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ dassetuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: One who speaks from knowledge ought to display a superhuman demonstration of psychic power to another who speaks from knowledge.

root-pli-ms: Samaṇo gotamo upaḍḍhapathaṁ āgaccheyya ahampi upaḍḍhapathaṁ gaccheyyaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: If the ascetic Gotama meets me half-way,

root-pli-ms: Te tattha ubhopi uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ kareyyāma.
translation-en-sujato: there we should both perform a superhuman demonstration of psychic power.

root-pli-ms: Ekañce samaṇo gotamo uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ karissati, dvāhaṁ karissāmi.
translation-en-sujato: If he performs one demonstration of psychic power, I’ll perform two.

root-pli-ms: Dve ce samaṇo gotamo uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyāni karissati, cattārāhaṁ karissāmi.
translation-en-sujato: If he performs two, I’ll perform four.

root-pli-ms: Cattāri ce samaṇo gotamo uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyāni karissati, aṭṭhāhaṁ karissāmi.
translation-en-sujato: If he performs four, I’ll perform eight.

root-pli-ms: Iti yāvatakaṁ yāvatakaṁ samaṇo gotamo uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ karissati, taddiguṇaṁ taddiguṇāhaṁ karissāmī”ti
translation-en-sujato: However many demonstrations of psychic power the ascetic Gotama performs, I’ll perform double.’

root-pli-ms: abhikkamasseva kho āvuso pāthikaputta, upaḍḍhapathaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Come forth, Reverend Pāṭikaputta, half-way.

root-pli-ms: Sabbapaṭhamaṁyeva āgantvā samaṇo gotamo āyasmato ārāme divāvihāraṁ nisinno’ti.
translation-en-sujato: The ascetic Gotama has come the first half, and is sitting in your monastery.”’

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ, bhoti kho, bhaggava, so puriso tassā parisāya paṭissutvā yena tindukakhāṇuparibbājakārāmo, yena acelo pāthikaputto tenupasaṅkami. upasaṅkamitvā acelaṁ pāthikaputtaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: ‘Yes, sir,’ replied that man, and delivered the message.
reference: bj9.30, csp1ed8.15, csp2ed8.15, ms8D_45, msdiv22, ndp8.16, pts-cs1.21, sc44

root-pli-ms: ‘abhikkamāvuso pāthikaputta, abhikkantā abhiññātā abhiññātā licchavī, abhikkantā abhiññātā abhiññātā ca brāhmaṇamahāsālā gahapatinecayikā nānātitthiyā samaṇabrāhmaṇā.
Samaṇopi gotamo āyasmato ārāme divāvihāraṁ nisinno.
Bhāsitā kho pana te esā, āvuso pāthikaputta, vesāliyaṁ parisati vācā—
samaṇopi gotamo ñāṇavādo; ahampi ñāṇavādo.
Ñāṇavādo kho pana ñāṇavādena arahati uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ dassetuṁ …pe…
taddiguṇaṁ taddiguṇāhaṁ karissāmīti.
Abhikkamasseva kho, āvuso pāthikaputta, upaḍḍhapathaṁ.
Sabbapaṭhamaṁyeva āgantvā samaṇo gotamo āyasmato ārāme divāvihāraṁ nisinno’ti.
Evaṁ vutte, bhaggava, acelo pāthikaputto ‘āyāmi, āvuso, āyāmi, āvuso’ti vatvā tattheva saṁsappati, na sakkoti āsanāpi vuṭṭhātuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: When he had spoken, Pāṭika said: ‘I’m coming, sir, I’m coming!’ But wriggle as he might, he couldn’t get up from his seat.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho so, bhaggava, puriso acelaṁ pāthikaputtaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: Then that man said to Pāṭikaputta,

root-pli-ms: ‘kiṁ su nāma te, āvuso pāthikaputta, pāvaḷā su nāma te pīṭhakasmiṁ allīnā, pīṭhakaṁ su nāma te pāvaḷāsu allīnaṁ?
translation-en-sujato: ‘What’s up, Reverend Pāṭikaputta? Is your bottom stuck to the bench, or is the bench stuck to your bottom?

root-pli-ms: Āyāmi āvuso, āyāmi āvusoti vatvā tattheva saṁsappasi, na sakkosi āsanāpi vuṭṭhātun’ti.
translation-en-sujato: You say “I’m coming, sir, I’m coming!” But wriggle as you might, you can’t get up from your seat.’

root-pli-ms: Evampi kho, bhaggava, vuccamāno acelo pāthikaputto ‘āyāmi, āvuso, āyāmi, āvuso’ti vatvā tattheva saṁsappati, na sakkoti āsanāpi vuṭṭhātuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: And as he was speaking, Pāṭika said: ‘I’m coming, sir, I’m coming!’ But wriggle as he might, he couldn’t get up from his seat.

root-pli-ms: Yadā kho so, bhaggava, puriso aññāsi:
translation-en-sujato: When that man knew

root-pli-ms: ‘parābhūtarūpo ayaṁ acelo pāthikaputto.
translation-en-sujato: that Pāṭikaputta had lost,

root-pli-ms: Āyāmi, āvuso, āyāmi, āvusoti vatvā tattheva saṁsappati, na sakkoti āsanāpi vuṭṭhātun’ti.
Atha taṁ parisaṁ āgantvā evamārocesi:
translation-en-sujato: he returned to the assembly and said,

root-pli-ms: ‘parābhūtarūpo, bho, acelo pāthikaputto.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Pāṭikaputta has lost, sirs.
variant-pli-ms: parābhūtarūpo, bho → parābhūtarūpo ayaṁ (bj); parābhūtarūpo bho ayaṁ (sya-all, mr); parābhūtarūpo (pts1ed)

root-pli-ms: Āyāmi, āvuso, āyāmi, āvusoti vatvā tattheva saṁsappati, na sakkoti āsanāpi vuṭṭhātun’ti.
translation-en-sujato: He says “I’m coming, sir, I’m coming!” But wriggle as he might, he can’t get up from his seat.’

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vutte, ahaṁ, bhaggava, taṁ parisaṁ etadavocaṁ:
translation-en-sujato: When he said this, I said to the assembly,

root-pli-ms: ‘abhabbo kho, āvuso, acelo pāthikaputto taṁ vācaṁ appahāya taṁ cittaṁ appahāya taṁ diṭṭhiṁ appaṭinissajjitvā mama sammukhībhāvaṁ āgantuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: ‘The naked ascetic Pāṭikaputta is not capable of coming into my presence, unless he gives up that statement and that intention, and lets go of that view.

root-pli-ms: Sacepissa evamassa—
translation-en-sujato: If he thinks he can

root-pli-ms: ahaṁ taṁ vācaṁ appahāya taṁ cittaṁ appahāya taṁ diṭṭhiṁ appaṭinissajjitvā samaṇassa gotamassa sammukhībhāvaṁ gaccheyyanti, muddhāpi tassa vipateyyā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: come into my presence without giving up those things, his head may explode.’

root-pli-ms: Paṭhamabhāṇavāro niṭṭhito.
translation-en-sujato: The first recitation section is finished.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhaggava, aññataro licchavimahāmatto uṭṭhāyāsanā taṁ parisaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: Then, Bhaggava, a certain Licchavi minister stood up and said to the assembly,
reference: bj9.32, cck11.21, csp1ed8.16, csp2ed8.16, dr11.20, ms8D_49, msdiv24, pts-cs2.1, pts-vp-pli3.20, sc47

root-pli-ms: ‘tena hi, bho, muhuttaṁ tāva āgametha, yāvāhaṁ gacchāmi.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Well then, sirs, wait a moment, I’ll go.

root-pli-ms: Appeva nāma ahampi sakkuṇeyyaṁ acelaṁ pāthikaputtaṁ imaṁ parisaṁ ānetun’ti.
translation-en-sujato: Hopefully I’ll be able to lead Pāṭikaputta back to the assembly.’

root-pli-ms: Atha kho so, bhaggava, licchavimahāmatto yena tindukakhāṇuparibbājakārāmo, yena acelo pāthikaputto tenupasaṅkami. upasaṅkamitvā acelaṁ pāthikaputtaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: So that minister went to see Pāṭikaputta and said,

root-pli-ms: ‘abhikkamāvuso pāthikaputta, abhikkantaṁ te seyyo, abhikkantā abhiññātā abhiññātā licchavī, abhikkantā abhiññātā abhiññātā ca brāhmaṇamahāsālā gahapatinecayikā nānātitthiyā samaṇabrāhmaṇā. Samaṇopi gotamo āyasmato ārāme divāvihāraṁ nisinno.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Come forth, Reverend Pāṭikaputta! It’s best for you to come forth. All these very well-known people have come forth, and the ascetic Gotama is sitting in your monastery for the day’s meditation.

root-pli-ms: Bhāsitā kho pana te esā, āvuso pāthikaputta, vesāliyaṁ parisati vācā—
translation-en-sujato: You said you’d meet the ascetic Gotama half-way.

root-pli-ms: samaṇopi gotamo ñāṇavādo …pe…
taddiguṇaṁ taddiguṇāhaṁ karissāmīti.
Abhikkamasseva kho, āvuso pāthikaputta, upaḍḍhapathaṁ.
Sabbapaṭhamaṁyeva āgantvā samaṇo gotamo āyasmato ārāme divāvihāraṁ nisinno.
translation-en-sujato: The ascetic Gotama has come the first half, and is sitting in your monastery.

root-pli-ms: Bhāsitā kho panesā, āvuso pāthikaputta, samaṇena gotamena parisati vācā—
translation-en-sujato: The ascetic Gotama has told the assembly

root-pli-ms: abhabbo kho acelo pāthikaputto taṁ vācaṁ appahāya taṁ cittaṁ appahāya taṁ diṭṭhiṁ appaṭinissajjitvā mama sammukhībhāvaṁ āgantuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: that you’re not capable of coming into his presence.

root-pli-ms: Sacepissa evamassa—
ahaṁ taṁ vācaṁ appahāya taṁ cittaṁ appahāya taṁ diṭṭhiṁ appaṭinissajjitvā samaṇassa gotamassa sammukhībhāvaṁ gaccheyyanti, muddhāpi tassa vipateyyāti.
Abhikkamāvuso pāthikaputta, abhikkamaneneva te jayaṁ karissāma, samaṇassa gotamassa parājayan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: Come forth, Pāṭikaputta! When you come forth we’ll make you win and the ascetic Gotama lose.’

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vutte, bhaggava, acelo pāthikaputto ‘āyāmi, āvuso, āyāmi, āvuso’ti vatvā tattheva saṁsappati, na sakkoti āsanāpi vuṭṭhātuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: When he had spoken, Pāṭikaputta said: ‘I’m coming, sir, I’m coming!’ But wriggle as he might, he couldn’t get up from his seat.
reference: cck11.22, csp1ed8.17, csp2ed8.17, dr11.21, ms8D_51, pts-cs2.2, pts-vp-pli3.21, sc49, vri3.15

root-pli-ms: Atha kho so, bhaggava, licchavimahāmatto acelaṁ pāthikaputtaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: Then the minister said to Pāṭikaputta,

root-pli-ms: ‘kiṁ su nāma te, āvuso pāthikaputta, pāvaḷā su nāma te pīṭhakasmiṁ allīnā, pīṭhakaṁ su nāma te pāvaḷāsu allīnaṁ?
translation-en-sujato: ‘What’s up, Reverend Pāṭikaputta? Is your bottom stuck to the bench, or is the bench stuck to your bottom?

root-pli-ms: Āyāmi, āvuso, āyāmi, āvusoti vatvā tattheva saṁsappasi, na sakkosi āsanāpi vuṭṭhātun’ti.
translation-en-sujato: You say “I’m coming, sir, I’m coming!” But wriggle as you might, you can’t get up from your seat.’

root-pli-ms: Evampi kho, bhaggava, vuccamāno acelo pāthikaputto ‘āyāmi, āvuso, āyāmi, āvuso’ti vatvā tattheva saṁsappati, na sakkoti āsanāpi vuṭṭhātuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: And as he was speaking, Pāṭikaputta said: ‘I’m coming, sir, I’m coming!’ But wriggle as he might, he couldn’t get up from his seat.

root-pli-ms: Yadā kho so, bhaggava, licchavimahāmatto aññāsi:
translation-en-sujato: When the Licchavi minister knew
reference: bj9.34, cck11.23, ms8D_52, msdiv25, ndp8.18, pts-cs2.3, pts-vp-pli3.22, sc50, sya11.22

root-pli-ms: ‘parābhūtarūpo ayaṁ acelo pāthikaputto āyāmi, āvuso, āyāmi, āvusoti vatvā tattheva saṁsappati, na sakkoti āsanāpi vuṭṭhātun’ti.
translation-en-sujato: that Pāṭikaputta had lost,

root-pli-ms: Atha taṁ parisaṁ āgantvā evamārocesi:
translation-en-sujato: he returned to the assembly and said,

root-pli-ms: ‘parābhūtarūpo, bho, acelo pāthikaputto āyāmi, āvuso, āyāmi, āvusoti vatvā tattheva saṁsappati, na sakkoti āsanāpi vuṭṭhātun’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Pāṭikaputta has lost, sirs.’
variant-pli-ms: parābhūtarūpo, bho → parābhūtarūpo ayaṁ (sya-all); parābhūtarūpo so (pts1ed)

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vutte, ahaṁ, bhaggava, taṁ parisaṁ etadavocaṁ:
translation-en-sujato: When he said this, I said to the assembly,

root-pli-ms: ‘abhabbo kho, āvuso, acelo pāthikaputto taṁ vācaṁ appahāya taṁ cittaṁ appahāya taṁ diṭṭhiṁ appaṭinissajjitvā mama sammukhībhāvaṁ āgantuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Pāṭikaputta is not capable of coming into my presence, otherwise

root-pli-ms: Sacepissa evamassa—
ahaṁ taṁ vācaṁ appahāya taṁ cittaṁ appahāya taṁ diṭṭhiṁ appaṭinissajjitvā samaṇassa gotamassa sammukhībhāvaṁ gaccheyyanti, muddhāpi tassa vipateyya.
translation-en-sujato: his head may explode.

root-pli-ms: Sace pāyasmantānaṁ licchavīnaṁ evamassa—
translation-en-sujato: Even if the good Licchavis were to think,

root-pli-ms: mayaṁ acelaṁ pāthikaputtaṁ varattāhi bandhitvā goyugehi āviñcheyyāmāti, tā varattā chijjeyyuṁ pāthikaputto vā.
translation-en-sujato: “Let’s bind Pāṭikaputta with straps and drag him with a pair of oxen!” But either the straps will break or Pāṭikaputta will.’
variant-pli-ms: āviñcheyyāmāti → āviñjeyyāmāti (sya-all); āvijjheyyāmāti (pts1ed) | varattāhi → yāhi varattāhi (sya-all, mr)

root-pli-ms: Abhabbo pana acelo pāthikaputto taṁ vācaṁ appahāya taṁ cittaṁ appahāya taṁ diṭṭhiṁ appaṭinissajjitvā mama sammukhībhāvaṁ āgantuṁ.
Sacepissa evamassa—
ahaṁ taṁ vācaṁ appahāya taṁ cittaṁ appahāya taṁ diṭṭhiṁ appaṭinissajjitvā samaṇassa gotamassa sammukhībhāvaṁ gaccheyyanti, muddhāpi tassa vipateyyā’ti.
Atha kho, bhaggava, jāliyo dārupattikantevāsī uṭṭhāyāsanā taṁ parisaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: Then, Bhaggava, Jāliya, the pupil of the wood-bowl ascetic, stood up and said to the assembly,

root-pli-ms: ‘tena hi, bho, muhuttaṁ tāva āgametha, yāvāhaṁ gacchāmi;
translation-en-sujato: ‘Well then, sirs, wait a moment, I’ll go.

root-pli-ms: appeva nāma ahampi sakkuṇeyyaṁ acelaṁ pāthikaputtaṁ imaṁ parisaṁ ānetun’ti.
translation-en-sujato: Hopefully I’ll be able to lead Pāṭikaputta back to the assembly.’

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhaggava, jāliyo dārupattikantevāsī yena tindukakhāṇuparibbājakārāmo, yena acelo pāthikaputto tenupasaṅkami. upasaṅkamitvā acelaṁ pāthikaputtaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: So Jāliya went to see Pāṭikaputta and said,

root-pli-ms: ‘abhikkamāvuso pāthikaputta, abhikkantaṁ te seyyo. Abhikkantā abhiññātā abhiññātā licchavī, abhikkantā abhiññātā abhiññātā ca brāhmaṇamahāsālā gahapatinecayikā nānātitthiyā samaṇabrāhmaṇā. Samaṇopi gotamo āyasmato ārāme divāvihāraṁ nisinno.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Come forth, Reverend Pāṭikaputta! It’s best for you to come forth. All these very well-known people have come forth, and the ascetic Gotama is sitting in your monastery for the day’s meditation.

root-pli-ms: Bhāsitā kho pana te esā, āvuso pāthikaputta, vesāliyaṁ parisati vācā—
translation-en-sujato: You said you’d meet the ascetic Gotama half-way.

root-pli-ms: samaṇopi gotamo ñāṇavādo …pe…
taddiguṇaṁ taddiguṇāhaṁ karissāmīti.
Abhikkamasseva, kho āvuso pāthikaputta, upaḍḍhapathaṁ.
Sabbapaṭhamaṁyeva āgantvā samaṇo gotamo āyasmato ārāme divāvihāraṁ nisinno.
translation-en-sujato: The ascetic Gotama has come the first half, and is sitting in your monastery.

root-pli-ms: Bhāsitā kho panesā, āvuso pāthikaputta, samaṇena gotamena parisati vācā—
translation-en-sujato: The ascetic Gotama has told the assembly

root-pli-ms: abhabbo acelo pāthikaputto taṁ vācaṁ appahāya taṁ cittaṁ appahāya taṁ diṭṭhiṁ appaṭinissajjitvā mama sammukhībhāvaṁ āgantuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: that you’re not capable of coming into his presence.

root-pli-ms: Sacepissa evamassa—
ahaṁ taṁ vācaṁ appahāya taṁ cittaṁ appahāya taṁ diṭṭhiṁ appaṭinissajjitvā samaṇassa gotamassa sammukhībhāvaṁ gaccheyyanti, muddhāpi tassa vipateyya.
Sace pāyasmantānaṁ licchavīnaṁ evamassa—
translation-en-sujato: And he said that even if the Licchavis

root-pli-ms: mayaṁ acelaṁ pāthikaputtaṁ varattāhi bandhitvā goyugehi āviñcheyyāmāti. Tā varattā chijjeyyuṁ pāthikaputto vā.
translation-en-sujato: try to bind you with straps and drag you with a pair of oxen, either the straps will break or you will.

root-pli-ms: Abhabbo pana acelo pāthikaputto taṁ vācaṁ appahāya taṁ cittaṁ appahāya taṁ diṭṭhiṁ appaṭinissajjitvā mama sammukhībhāvaṁ āgantuṁ.
Sacepissa evamassa—
ahaṁ taṁ vācaṁ appahāya taṁ cittaṁ appahāya taṁ diṭṭhiṁ appaṭinissajjitvā samaṇassa gotamassa sammukhībhāvaṁ āgaccheyyanti, muddhāpi tassa vipateyyāti.
Abhikkamāvuso pāthikaputta, abhikkamaneneva te jayaṁ karissāma, samaṇassa gotamassa parājayan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: Come forth, Pāṭikaputta! When you come forth we’ll make you win and the ascetic Gotama lose.’

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vutte, bhaggava, acelo pāthikaputto ‘āyāmi, āvuso, āyāmi, āvuso’ti vatvā tattheva saṁsappati, na sakkoti āsanāpi vuṭṭhātuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: When he had spoken, Pāṭikaputta said: ‘I’m coming, sir, I’m coming!’ But wriggle as he might, he couldn’t get up from his seat.
reference: bj9.36, csp1ed8.19, csp2ed8.19, ms8D_55, pts-cs2.5, pts-vp-pli3.23, sc53, sya11.24

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhaggava, jāliyo dārupattikantevāsī acelaṁ pāthikaputtaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: Then Jāliya said to Pāṭikaputta,

root-pli-ms: ‘kiṁ su nāma te, āvuso pāthikaputta, pāvaḷā su nāma te pīṭhakasmiṁ allīnā, pīṭhakaṁ su nāma te pāvaḷāsu allīnaṁ?
translation-en-sujato: ‘What’s up, Reverend Pāṭikaputta? Is your bottom stuck to the bench, or is the bench stuck to your bottom?

root-pli-ms: Āyāmi, āvuso, āyāmi, āvusoti vatvā tattheva saṁsappasi, na sakkosi āsanāpi vuṭṭhātun’ti.
translation-en-sujato: You say “I’m coming, sir, I’m coming!” But wriggle as you might, you can’t get up from your seat.’

root-pli-ms: Evampi kho, bhaggava, vuccamāno acelo pāthikaputto ‘āyāmi, āvuso, āyāmi, āvuso’ti vatvā tattheva saṁsappati, na sakkoti āsanāpi vuṭṭhātunti.
translation-en-sujato: And as he was speaking, Pāṭikaputta said: ‘I’m coming, sir, I’m coming!’ But wriggle as he might, he couldn’t get up from his seat.

root-pli-ms: Yadā kho, bhaggava, jāliyo dārupattikantevāsī aññāsi:
translation-en-sujato: When Jāliya knew

root-pli-ms: ‘parābhūtarūpo ayaṁ acelo pāthikaputto āyāmi, āvuso, āyāmi, āvusoti vatvā tattheva saṁsappati, na sakkoti āsanāpi vuṭṭhātun’ti, atha naṁ etadavoca—
translation-en-sujato: that Pāṭikaputta had lost, he said to him,

root-pli-ms: Bhūtapubbaṁ, āvuso pāthikaputta, sīhassa migarañño etadahosi:
translation-en-sujato: ‘Once upon a time, Reverend Pāṭikaputta, it occurred to a lion, king of beasts,

root-pli-ms: ‘yannūnāhaṁ aññataraṁ vanasaṇḍaṁ nissāya āsayaṁ kappeyyaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: “Why don’t I make my lair near a certain forest?

root-pli-ms: Tatrāsayaṁ kappetvā sāyanhasamayaṁ āsayā nikkhameyyaṁ, āsayā nikkhamitvā vijambheyyaṁ, vijambhitvā samantā catuddisā anuvilokeyyaṁ, samantā catuddisā anuviloketvā tikkhattuṁ sīhanādaṁ nadeyyaṁ, tikkhattuṁ sīhanādaṁ naditvā gocarāya pakkameyyaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Towards evening I can emerge from my den, yawn, look all around the four directions, roar my lion’s roar three times, and set out on the hunt.

root-pli-ms: So varaṁ varaṁ migasaṅghe vadhitvā mudumaṁsāni mudumaṁsāni bhakkhayitvā tameva āsayaṁ ajjhupeyyan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: Having slain the very best of the deer herd, and eaten the most tender flesh, I could return to my den.”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, āvuso, so sīho migarājā aññataraṁ vanasaṇḍaṁ nissāya āsayaṁ kappesi.
translation-en-sujato: And so that’s what he did.

root-pli-ms: Tatrāsayaṁ kappetvā sāyanhasamayaṁ āsayā nikkhami, āsayā nikkhamitvā vijambhi, vijambhitvā samantā catuddisā anuvilokesi, samantā catuddisā anuviloketvā tikkhattuṁ sīhanādaṁ nadi, tikkhattuṁ sīhanādaṁ naditvā gocarāya pakkāmi.
So varaṁ varaṁ migasaṅghe vadhitvā mudumaṁsāni mudumaṁsāni bhakkhayitvā tameva āsayaṁ ajjhupesi.
Tasseva kho, āvuso pāthikaputta, sīhassa migarañño vighāsasaṁvaḍḍho jarasiṅgālo ditto ceva balavā ca.
translation-en-sujato: Now, there was an old jackal who had grown fat on the lion’s leavings, becoming arrogant and strong.
reference: bj9.38, cck11.26, csp1ed8.20, csp2ed8.20, ms8D_59, msdiv28, pts-vp-pli3.24, sc57

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, āvuso, tassa jarasiṅgālassa etadahosi:
translation-en-sujato: He thought,

root-pli-ms: ‘ko cāhaṁ, ko sīho migarājā.
translation-en-sujato: “What does the lion, king of beasts, have that I don’t?

root-pli-ms: Yannūnāhampi aññataraṁ vanasaṇḍaṁ nissāya āsayaṁ kappeyyaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Why don’t I make my lair near a certain forest?

root-pli-ms: Tatrāsayaṁ kappetvā sāyanhasamayaṁ āsayā nikkhameyyaṁ, āsayā nikkhamitvā vijambheyyaṁ, vijambhitvā samantā catuddisā anuvilokeyyaṁ, samantā catuddisā anuviloketvā tikkhattuṁ sīhanādaṁ nadeyyaṁ, tikkhattuṁ sīhanādaṁ naditvā gocarāya pakkameyyaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Towards evening I can emerge from my den, yawn, look all around the four directions, roar my lion’s roar three times, and set out on the hunt.

root-pli-ms: So varaṁ varaṁ migasaṅghe vadhitvā mudumaṁsāni mudumaṁsāni bhakkhayitvā tameva āsayaṁ ajjhupeyyan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: Having slain the very best of the deer herd, and eaten the most tender flesh, I could return to my den.”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho so, āvuso, jarasiṅgālo aññataraṁ vanasaṇḍaṁ nissāya āsayaṁ kappesi.
translation-en-sujato: And so that’s what he did.

root-pli-ms: Tatrāsayaṁ kappetvā sāyanhasamayaṁ āsayā nikkhami, āsayā nikkhamitvā vijambhi, vijambhitvā samantā catuddisā anuvilokesi, samantā catuddisā anuviloketvā tikkhattuṁ sīhanādaṁ nadissāmīti siṅgālakaṁyeva anadi bheraṇḍakaṁyeva anadi, ke ca chave siṅgāle, ke pana sīhanādeti.
translation-en-sujato: But when he tried to roar a lion’s roar, he only managed to squeal and yelp like a jackal. And what is a pathetic jackal’s squeal next to the roar of a lion?

root-pli-ms: Evameva kho tvaṁ, āvuso pāthikaputta, sugatāpadānesu jīvamāno sugatātirittāni bhuñjamāno tathāgate arahante sammāsambuddhe āsādetabbaṁ maññasi.
translation-en-sujato: In the same way, reverend, while living on the harvest of the Holy One, enjoying the leftovers of the Holy One, you presume to attack the Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha!
comment-en-sujato: Here apadāna = “result, outcome, harvest, not” exploits, achievements'.

root-pli-ms: Ke ca chave pāthikaputte, kā ca tathāgatānaṁ arahantānaṁ sammāsambuddhānaṁ āsādanāti.
translation-en-sujato: Who are the pathetic Pāṭikaputtas to attack the Realized Ones, the perfected ones, the fully awakened Buddhas?’

root-pli-ms: Yato kho, bhaggava, jāliyo dārupattikantevāsī iminā opammena neva asakkhi acelaṁ pāthikaputtaṁ tamhā āsanā cāvetuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: When Jāliya couldn’t get Pāṭikaputta to shift from his seat even with this simile,

root-pli-ms: Atha naṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: he said to him:

root-pli-ms: ‘Sīhoti attānaṁ samekkhiyāna,
translation-en-sujato: ‘Seeing himself as equal to the lion,

root-pli-ms: Amaññi kotthu migarājāhamasmi;
translation-en-sujato: the jackal presumed “I’m the king of the beasts!”

root-pli-ms: Tatheva so siṅgālakaṁ anadi,
translation-en-sujato: But in reality he only managed to yelp,

root-pli-ms: Ke ca chave siṅgāle ke pana sīhanādeti.
translation-en-sujato: and what’s a sad jackal’s squeal to the roar of a lion?

root-pli-ms: Evameva kho tvaṁ, āvuso pāthikaputta, sugatāpadānesu jīvamāno sugatātirittāni bhuñjamāno tathāgate arahante sammāsambuddhe āsādetabbaṁ maññasi.
translation-en-sujato: In the same way, reverend, while living on the harvest of the Holy One, you presume to attack him!’

root-pli-ms: Ke ca chave pāthikaputte, kā ca tathāgatānaṁ arahantānaṁ sammāsambuddhānaṁ āsādanā’ti.
Yato kho, bhaggava, jāliyo dārupattikantevāsī imināpi opammena neva asakkhi acelaṁ pāthikaputtaṁ tamhā āsanā cāvetuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: When Jāliya couldn’t get Pāṭikaputta to shift from his seat even with this simile,

root-pli-ms: Atha naṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: he said to him:

root-pli-ms: ‘Aññaṁ anucaṅkamanaṁ,
translation-en-sujato: ‘Following in the steps of another,

root-pli-ms: Attānaṁ vighāse samekkhiya;
translation-en-sujato: seeing himself grown fat on scraps,

root-pli-ms: Yāva attānaṁ na passati,
translation-en-sujato: until he doesn’t even see himself,

root-pli-ms: Kotthu tāva byagghoti maññati.
translation-en-sujato: the jackal presumes he’s a tiger.

root-pli-ms: Tatheva so siṅgālakaṁ anadi,
translation-en-sujato: But in reality he only managed to yelp,

root-pli-ms: Ke ca chave siṅgāle ke pana sīhanādeti.
translation-en-sujato: and what’s a sad jackal’s squeal to the roar of a lion?

root-pli-ms: Evameva kho tvaṁ, āvuso pāthikaputta, sugatāpadānesu jīvamāno sugatātirittāni bhuñjamāno tathāgate arahante sammāsambuddhe āsādetabbaṁ maññasi.
translation-en-sujato: In the same way, reverend, while living on the harvest of the Holy One, you presume to attack him!’

root-pli-ms: Ke ca chave pāthikaputte, kā ca tathāgatānaṁ arahantānaṁ sammāsambuddhānaṁ āsādanā’ti.
Yato kho, bhaggava, jāliyo dārupattikantevāsī imināpi opammena neva asakkhi acelaṁ pāthikaputtaṁ tamhā āsanā cāvetuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: When Jāliya couldn’t get Pāṭikaputta to shift from his seat even with this simile,

root-pli-ms: Atha naṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: he said to him:

root-pli-ms: ‘Bhutvāna bheke khalamūsikāyo,
translation-en-sujato: ‘Gorged on frogs, and mice from the barn,

root-pli-ms: Kaṭasīsu khittāni ca koṇapāni;
translation-en-sujato: and carcasses tossed in the cemetery,

root-pli-ms: Mahāvane suññavane vivaḍḍho,
translation-en-sujato: thriving in the great, empty wood,

root-pli-ms: Amaññi kotthu migarājāhamasmi;
translation-en-sujato: the jackal presumed “I’m the king of the beasts!”

root-pli-ms: Tatheva so siṅgālakaṁ anadi,
translation-en-sujato: But in reality he only managed to yelp,

root-pli-ms: Ke ca chave siṅgāle ke pana sīhanādeti.
translation-en-sujato: and what’s a sad jackal’s squeal to the roar of a lion?

root-pli-ms: Evameva kho tvaṁ, āvuso pāthikaputta, sugatāpadānesu jīvamāno sugatātirittāni bhuñjamāno tathāgate arahante sammāsambuddhe āsādetabbaṁ maññasi.
translation-en-sujato: In the same way, reverend, while living on the harvest of the Holy One, enjoying the leftovers of the Holy One, you presume to attack the Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha!

root-pli-ms: Ke ca chave pāthikaputte, kā ca tathāgatānaṁ arahantānaṁ sammāsambuddhānaṁ āsādanā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: Who are the pathetic Pāṭikaputtas to attack the Realized Ones, the perfected ones, the fully awakened Buddhas?’

root-pli-ms: Yato kho, bhaggava, jāliyo dārupattikantevāsī imināpi opammena neva asakkhi acelaṁ pāthikaputtaṁ tamhā āsanā cāvetuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: When Jāliya couldn’t get Pāṭikaputta to shift from his seat even with this simile,

root-pli-ms: Atha taṁ parisaṁ āgantvā evamārocesi:
translation-en-sujato: he returned to the assembly and said,

root-pli-ms: ‘parābhūtarūpo, bho, acelo pāthikaputto āyāmi āvuso, āyāmi, āvusoti vatvā tattheva saṁsappati, na sakkoti āsanāpi vuṭṭhātun’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Pāṭikaputta has lost, sirs. He says “I’m coming, sir, I’m coming!” But wriggle as he might, he can’t get up from his seat.’

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vutte, ahaṁ, bhaggava, taṁ parisaṁ etadavocaṁ:
translation-en-sujato: When he said this, I said to the assembly,
reference: csp1ed8.22, csp2ed8.22, ms8D_73, msdiv33, pts-cs2.12, pts-vp-pli3.27, sc71

root-pli-ms: ‘abhabbo kho, āvuso, acelo pāthikaputto taṁ vācaṁ appahāya taṁ cittaṁ appahāya taṁ diṭṭhiṁ appaṭinissajjitvā mama sammukhībhāvaṁ āgantuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: ‘The naked ascetic Pāṭikaputta is not capable of coming into my presence, unless he gives up that statement and that intention, and lets go of that view.

root-pli-ms: Sacepissa evamassa—
translation-en-sujato: If he thinks he can

root-pli-ms: ahaṁ taṁ vācaṁ appahāya taṁ cittaṁ appahāya taṁ diṭṭhiṁ appaṭinissajjitvā samaṇassa gotamassa sammukhībhāvaṁ gaccheyyanti, muddhāpi tassa vipateyya.
translation-en-sujato: come into my presence without giving up those things, his head may explode.

root-pli-ms: Sacepāyasmantānaṁ licchavīnaṁ evamassa—
translation-en-sujato: The good Licchavis might even think,

root-pli-ms: mayaṁ acelaṁ pāthikaputtaṁ varattāhi bandhitvā nāgehi āviñcheyyāmāti. Tā varattā chijjeyyuṁ pāthikaputto vā.
translation-en-sujato: “Let’s bind Pāṭikaputta with straps and drag him with a pair of oxen!” But either the straps will break or Pāṭikaputta will.

root-pli-ms: Abhabbo pana acelo pāthikaputto taṁ vācaṁ appahāya taṁ cittaṁ appahāya taṁ diṭṭhiṁ appaṭinissajjitvā mama sammukhībhāvaṁ āgantuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Pāṭikaputta is not capable of coming into my presence, otherwise

root-pli-ms: Sacepissa evamassa—ahaṁ taṁ vācaṁ appahāya taṁ cittaṁ appahāya taṁ diṭṭhiṁ appaṭinissajjitvā samaṇassa gotamassa sammukhībhāvaṁ gaccheyyanti, muddhāpi tassa vipateyyā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: his head may explode.’

root-pli-ms: Atha khvāhaṁ, bhaggava, taṁ parisaṁ dhammiyā kathāya sandassesiṁ samādapesiṁ samuttejesiṁ sampahaṁsesiṁ, taṁ parisaṁ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṁsetvā mahābandhanā mokkhaṁ karitvā caturāsītipāṇasahassāni mahāviduggā uddharitvā tejodhātuṁ samāpajjitvā sattatālaṁ vehāsaṁ abbhuggantvā aññaṁ sattatālampi acciṁ abhinimminitvā pajjalitvā dhūmāyitvā mahāvane kūṭāgārasālāyaṁ paccuṭṭhāsiṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Then, Bhaggava, I educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired that assembly with a Dhamma talk. I released that assembly from the great bondage, and lifted 84,000 beings from the great swamp. Next I entered upon the fire element, rose into the sky to the height of seven palm trees, and created a flame another seven palm trees high, blazing and smoking. Finally I landed at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.
reference: cck11.29, ms8D_74, msdiv34, pts-cs2.13, sc72, sya11.29

root-pli-ms: Atha kho, bhaggava, sunakkhatto licchaviputto yenāhaṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā maṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho ahaṁ, bhaggava, sunakkhattaṁ licchaviputtaṁ etadavocaṁ:
translation-en-sujato: Then Sunakkhatta came to me, bowed, and sat down to one side. I said to him,

root-pli-ms: ‘Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, sunakkhatta,
translation-en-sujato: ‘What do you think, Sunakkhatta?

root-pli-ms: yatheva te ahaṁ acelaṁ pāthikaputtaṁ ārabbha byākāsiṁ, tatheva taṁ vipākaṁ aññathā vā’ti?
translation-en-sujato: Did the declaration I made about Pāṭikaputta turn out to be correct, or not?’

root-pli-ms: ‘Yatheva me, bhante, bhagavā acelaṁ pāthikaputtaṁ ārabbha byākāsi, tatheva taṁ vipākaṁ, no aññathā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘It turned out to be correct.’

root-pli-ms: ‘Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, sunakkhatta,
translation-en-sujato: ‘What do you think, Sunakkhatta?
reference: bj9.44, csp1ed8.23, csp2ed8.23, ms8D_76, ndp8.23, pts-vp-pli3.28, sc74, vri3.20

root-pli-ms: yadi evaṁ sante kataṁ vā hoti uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ, akataṁ vā’ti?
translation-en-sujato: If that is so, has a superhuman demonstration of psychic power been performed or not?’

root-pli-ms: ‘Addhā kho, bhante, evaṁ sante kataṁ hoti uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ, no akatan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Clearly, sir, a superhuman demonstration of psychic power has been performed.’

root-pli-ms: ‘Evampi kho maṁ tvaṁ, moghapurisa, uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ karontaṁ evaṁ vadesi—
translation-en-sujato: ‘Though I perform such a superhuman demonstration of psychic power you say this:

root-pli-ms: na hi pana me, bhante, bhagavā uttari manussadhammā iddhipāṭihāriyaṁ karotīti.
translation-en-sujato: “But sir, the Buddha never performs any superhuman demonstrations of psychic power for me.”

root-pli-ms: Passa, moghapurisa, yāvañca te idaṁ aparaddhan’ti.
translation-en-sujato: See how far you have strayed!’

root-pli-ms: Evampi kho, bhaggava, sunakkhatto licchaviputto mayā vuccamāno apakkameva imasmā dhammavinayā, yathā taṁ āpāyiko nerayiko.
translation-en-sujato: Though I spoke to Sunakkhatta like this, he still left this teaching and training, like someone on the highway to hell.

root-pli-ms: 6. Aggaññapaññattikathā
translation-en-sujato: 6. On Describing the Origin of the World

root-pli-ms: Aggaññañcāhaṁ, bhaggava, pajānāmi.
translation-en-sujato: Bhaggava, I understand the origin of the world.

root-pli-ms: Tañca pajānāmi, tato ca uttaritaraṁ pajānāmi, tañca pajānaṁ na parāmasāmi, aparāmasato ca me paccattaññeva nibbuti viditā, yadabhijānaṁ tathāgato no anayaṁ āpajjati.
translation-en-sujato: I understand this, and what goes beyond it. Yet since I do not misapprehend that understanding, I have realized extinguishment within myself. Directly knowing this, the Realized One does not come to ruin.
comment-en-sujato: Cf DN 1.

root-pli-ms: Santi, bhaggava, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā issarakuttaṁ brahmakuttaṁ ācariyakaṁ aggaññaṁ paññapenti.
translation-en-sujato: There are some ascetics and brahmins who describe the origin of the world in their tradition as created by the Lord God, by Brahmā.

root-pli-ms: Tyāhaṁ upasaṅkamitvā evaṁ vadāmi:
translation-en-sujato: I go up to them and say,

root-pli-ms: ‘saccaṁ kira tumhe āyasmanto issarakuttaṁ brahmakuttaṁ ācariyakaṁ aggaññaṁ paññapethā’ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘Is it really true that this is the venerables’ view?’

root-pli-ms: Te ca me evaṁ puṭṭhā, ‘āmo’ti paṭijānanti.
translation-en-sujato: And they answer, ‘Yes’.

root-pli-ms: Tyāhaṁ evaṁ vadāmi:
translation-en-sujato: I say to them,

root-pli-ms: ‘kathaṁvihitakaṁ pana tumhe āyasmanto issarakuttaṁ brahmakuttaṁ ācariyakaṁ aggaññaṁ paññapethā’ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘But how do you describe in your tradition that the origin of the world came about as created by the Lord God, by Brahmā?’

root-pli-ms: Te mayā puṭṭhā na sampāyanti, asampāyantā mamaññeva paṭipucchanti.
translation-en-sujato: But they cannot answer, and they even question me in return.

root-pli-ms: Tesāhaṁ puṭṭho byākaromi:
translation-en-sujato: So I answer them,

root-pli-ms: ‘Hoti kho so, āvuso, samayo yaṁ kadāci karahaci dīghassa addhuno accayena ayaṁ loko saṁvaṭṭati.
translation-en-sujato: ‘There comes a time when, reverends, after a very long period has passed, this cosmos contracts.

root-pli-ms: Saṁvaṭṭamāne loke yebhuyyena sattā ābhassarasaṁvattanikā honti.
translation-en-sujato: As the cosmos contracts, sentient beings are mostly headed for the realm of streaming radiance.

root-pli-ms: Te tattha honti manomayā pītibhakkhā sayaṁpabhā antalikkhacarā subhaṭṭhāyino ciraṁ dīghamaddhānaṁ tiṭṭhanti.
translation-en-sujato: There they are mind-made, feeding on rapture, self-luminous, moving through the sky, steadily glorious, and they remain like that for a very long time.

root-pli-ms: Hoti kho so, āvuso, samayo yaṁ kadāci karahaci dīghassa addhuno accayena ayaṁ loko vivaṭṭati.
translation-en-sujato: There comes a time when, after a very long period has passed, this cosmos expands.
reference: cck11.31, csp1ed8.24, csp2ed8.24, ms8D_81, pts-cs2.15, pts-vp-pli3.29, sc79, vri3.21

root-pli-ms: Vivaṭṭamāne loke suññaṁ brahmavimānaṁ pātubhavati.
translation-en-sujato: As it expands an empty mansion of Brahmā appears.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho aññataro satto āyukkhayā vā puññakkhayā vā ābhassarakāyā cavitvā suññaṁ brahmavimānaṁ upapajjati.
translation-en-sujato: Then a certain sentient being—due to the running out of their life-span or merit—passes away from that host of radiant deities and is reborn in that empty mansion of Brahmā.

root-pli-ms: So tattha hoti manomayo pītibhakkho sayampabho antalikkhacaro subhaṭṭhāyī, ciraṁ dīghamaddhānaṁ tiṭṭhati.
translation-en-sujato: There they are mind-made, feeding on rapture, self-luminous, moving through the sky, steadily glorious, and they remain like that for a very long time.

root-pli-ms: Tassa tattha ekakassa dīgharattaṁ nivusitattā anabhirati paritassanā uppajjati—
translation-en-sujato: But after staying there all alone for a long time, they become dissatisfied and anxious,

root-pli-ms: aho vata aññepi sattā itthattaṁ āgaccheyyunti.
translation-en-sujato: “Oh, if only another being would come to this state of existence.”

root-pli-ms: Atha aññepi sattā āyukkhayā vā puññakkhayā vā ābhassarakāyā cavitvā suññaṁ brahmavimānaṁ upapajjanti tassa sattassa sahabyataṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Then other sentient beings—due to the running out of their life-span or merit—pass away from that host of radiant deities and are reborn in that empty mansion of Brahmā in company with that being.

root-pli-ms: Tepi tattha honti manomayā pītibhakkhā sayaṁpabhā antalikkhacarā subhaṭṭhāyino, ciraṁ dīghamaddhānaṁ tiṭṭhanti.
translation-en-sujato: There they too are mind-made, feeding on rapture, self-luminous, moving through the sky, steadily glorious, and they remain like that for a very long time.

root-pli-ms: Tatrāvuso, yo so satto paṭhamaṁ upapanno, tassa evaṁ hoti—
translation-en-sujato: Now, the being who was reborn there first thinks,

root-pli-ms: ahamasmi brahmā mahābrahmā abhibhū anabhibhūto aññadatthudaso vasavattī issaro kattā nimmātā seṭṭho sajitā vasī pitā bhūtabhabyānaṁ, mayā ime sattā nimmitā.
translation-en-sujato: “I am Brahmā, the Great Brahmā, the Undefeated, the Champion, the Universal Seer, the Wielder of Power, the Lord God, the Maker, the Author, the Best, the Begetter, the Controller, the Father of those who have been born and those yet to be born.
variant-pli-ms: sajitā → sajjitā (sya-all, km); sañjitā (pts1ed) | seṭṭho → saṭṭhā (bj)

root-pli-ms: Taṁ kissa hetu?
translation-en-sujato: Why is that?

root-pli-ms: Mamañhi pubbe etadahosi—
translation-en-sujato: Because first I thought,

root-pli-ms: aho vata aññepi sattā itthattaṁ āgaccheyyunti;
translation-en-sujato: ‘Oh, if only another being would come to this state of existence.’

root-pli-ms: iti mama ca manopaṇidhi. Ime ca sattā itthattaṁ āgatāti.
translation-en-sujato: Such was my heart’s wish, and then these creatures came to this state of existence.”

root-pli-ms: Yepi te sattā pacchā upapannā, tesampi evaṁ hoti—
translation-en-sujato: And the beings who were reborn there later also think,

root-pli-ms: ayaṁ kho bhavaṁ brahmā mahābrahmā abhibhū anabhibhūto aññadatthudaso vasavattī issaro kattā nimmātā seṭṭho sajitā vasī pitā bhūtabhabyānaṁ;
translation-en-sujato: “This must be Brahmā, the Great Brahmā, the Undefeated, the Champion, the Universal Seer, the Wielder of Power, the Lord God, the Maker, the Author, the Best, the Begetter, the Controller, the Father of those who have been born and those yet to be born.

root-pli-ms: iminā mayaṁ bhotā brahmunā nimmitā.
translation-en-sujato: And we have been created by him.

root-pli-ms: Taṁ kissa hetu?
translation-en-sujato: Why is that?

root-pli-ms: Imañhi mayaṁ addasāma idha paṭhamaṁ upapannaṁ; mayaṁ panāmha pacchā upapannāti.
translation-en-sujato: Because we see that he was reborn here first, and we arrived later.”

root-pli-ms: Tatrāvuso, yo so satto paṭhamaṁ upapanno, so dīghāyukataro ca hoti vaṇṇavantataro ca mahesakkhataro ca.
translation-en-sujato: And the being who was reborn first is more long-lived, beautiful, and illustrious than those who arrived later.

root-pli-ms: Ye pana te sattā pacchā upapannā, te appāyukatarā ca honti dubbaṇṇatarā ca appesakkhatarā ca.
Ṭhānaṁ kho panetaṁ, āvuso, vijjati, yaṁ aññataro satto tamhā kāyā cavitvā itthattaṁ āgacchati.
translation-en-sujato: It’s possible that one of those beings passes away from that host and is reborn in this state of existence.

root-pli-ms: Itthattaṁ āgato samāno agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajati.
translation-en-sujato: Having done so, they go forth from the lay life to homelessness.

root-pli-ms: Agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajito samāno ātappamanvāya padhānamanvāya anuyogamanvāya appamādamanvāya sammāmanasikāramanvāya tathārūpaṁ cetosamādhiṁ phusati, yathāsamāhite citte taṁ pubbenivāsaṁ anussarati; tato paraṁ nānussarati.
translation-en-sujato: By dint of keen, resolute, committed, and diligent effort, and right focus, they experience an immersion of the heart of such a kind that they recollect that past life, but no further.

root-pli-ms: So evamāha:
translation-en-sujato: They say:

root-pli-ms: “yo kho so bhavaṁ brahmā mahābrahmā abhibhū anabhibhūto aññadatthudaso vasavattī issaro kattā nimmātā seṭṭho sajitā vasī pitā bhūtabhabyānaṁ, yena mayaṁ bhotā brahmunā nimmitā. So nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo sassatisamaṁ tatheva ṭhassati.
