translation-en-sujato: “He who is Brahmā—the Great Brahmā, the Undefeated, the Champion, the Universal Seer, the Wielder of Power, the Lord God, the Maker, the Author, the Best, the Begetter, the Controller, the Father of those who have been born and those yet to be born—is permanent, everlasting, eternal, imperishable, remaining the same for all eternity.

root-pli-ms: Ye pana mayaṁ ahumhā tena bhotā brahmunā nimmitā, te mayaṁ aniccā addhuvā appāyukā cavanadhammā itthattaṁ āgatā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: We who were created by that Brahmā are impermanent, not lasting, short-lived, perishable, and have come to this state of existence.”

root-pli-ms: Evaṁvihitakaṁ no tumhe āyasmanto issarakuttaṁ brahmakuttaṁ ācariyakaṁ aggaññaṁ paññapethā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: This is how you describe in your tradition that the origin of the world came about as created by the Lord God, by Brahmā.’

root-pli-ms: Te evamāhaṁsu:
translation-en-sujato: They say,

root-pli-ms: ‘evaṁ kho no, āvuso gotama, sutaṁ, yathevāyasmā gotamo āhā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘That is what we have heard, Reverend Gotama, just as you say.’

root-pli-ms: Aggaññañcāhaṁ, bhaggava, pajānāmi.
translation-en-sujato: Bhaggava, I understand the origin of the world.

root-pli-ms: Tañca pajānāmi, tato ca uttaritaraṁ pajānāmi, tañca pajānaṁ na parāmasāmi, aparāmasato ca me paccattaññeva nibbuti viditā. Yadabhijānaṁ tathāgato no anayaṁ āpajjati.
translation-en-sujato: I understand this, and what goes beyond it. Yet since I do not misapprehend that understanding, I have realized extinguishment within myself. Directly knowing this, the Realized One does not come to ruin.

root-pli-ms: Santi, bhaggava, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā khiḍḍāpadosikaṁ ācariyakaṁ aggaññaṁ paññapenti.
translation-en-sujato: There are some ascetics and brahmins who describe the origin of the world in their tradition as due to those depraved by play.
reference: bj9.50, cck11.33, dr11.32, ms8D_89, msdiv41, pts-cs2.18, pts-vp-pli3.31, sc87, sya11.33

root-pli-ms: Tyāhaṁ upasaṅkamitvā evaṁ vadāmi:
translation-en-sujato: I go up to them and say,

root-pli-ms: ‘saccaṁ kira tumhe āyasmanto khiḍḍāpadosikaṁ ācariyakaṁ aggaññaṁ paññapethā’ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘Is it really true that this is the venerables’ view?’

root-pli-ms: Te ca me evaṁ puṭṭhā ‘āmo’ti paṭijānanti.
translation-en-sujato: And they answer, ‘Yes’.

root-pli-ms: Tyāhaṁ evaṁ vadāmi:
translation-en-sujato: I say to them,

root-pli-ms: ‘kathaṁvihitakaṁ pana tumhe āyasmanto khiḍḍāpadosikaṁ ācariyakaṁ aggaññaṁ paññapethā’ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘But how do you describe in your tradition that the origin of the world came about due to those depraved by play?’

root-pli-ms: Te mayā puṭṭhā na sampāyanti, asampāyantā mamaññeva paṭipucchanti,
translation-en-sujato: But they cannot answer, and they even question me in return.

root-pli-ms: tesāhaṁ puṭṭho byākaromi:
translation-en-sujato: So I answer them,

root-pli-ms: ‘Santāvuso, khiḍḍāpadosikā nāma devā. Te ativelaṁ hassakhiḍḍāratidhammasamāpannā viharanti. Tesaṁ ativelaṁ hassakhiḍḍāratidhammasamāpannānaṁ viharataṁ sati sammussati, satiyā sammosā te devā tamhā kāyā cavanti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Reverends, there are gods named “depraved by play”. They spend too much time laughing, playing, and making merry. And in doing so, they lose their mindfulness, and they pass away from that host of gods.

root-pli-ms: Ṭhānaṁ kho panetaṁ, āvuso, vijjati, yaṁ aññataro satto tamhā kāyā cavitvā itthattaṁ āgacchati,
translation-en-sujato: It’s possible that one of those beings passes away from that host and is reborn in this state of existence.

root-pli-ms: itthattaṁ āgato samāno agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajati,
translation-en-sujato: Having done so, they go forth from the lay life to homelessness.

root-pli-ms: agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajito samāno ātappamanvāya padhānamanvāya anuyogamanvāya appamādamanvāya sammāmanasikāramanvāya tathārūpaṁ cetosamādhiṁ phusati, yathāsamāhite citte taṁ pubbenivāsaṁ anussarati; tato paraṁ nānussarati.
translation-en-sujato: By dint of keen, resolute, committed, and diligent effort, and right focus, they experience an immersion of the heart of such a kind that they recollect that past life, but no further.

root-pli-ms: So evamāha:
translation-en-sujato: They say,

root-pli-ms: “ye kho te bhonto devā na khiḍḍāpadosikā te na ativelaṁ hassakhiḍḍāratidhammasamāpannā viharanti. Tesaṁ nātivelaṁ hassakhiḍḍāratidhammasamāpannānaṁ viharataṁ sati na sammussati, satiyā asammosā te devā tamhā kāyā na cavanti,
translation-en-sujato: “The gods not depraved by play don’t spend too much time laughing, playing, and making merry. So they don’t lose their mindfulness, and don’t pass away from that host of gods.

root-pli-ms: niccā dhuvā sassatā avipariṇāmadhammā sassatisamaṁ tatheva ṭhassanti.
translation-en-sujato: They are permanent, everlasting, eternal, imperishable, remaining the same for all eternity.

root-pli-ms: Ye pana mayaṁ ahumhā khiḍḍāpadosikā te mayaṁ ativelaṁ hassakhiḍḍāratidhammasamāpannā viharimhā, tesaṁ no ativelaṁ hassakhiḍḍāratidhammasamāpannānaṁ viharataṁ sati sammussati, satiyā sammosā evaṁ mayaṁ tamhā kāyā cutā,
translation-en-sujato: But we who were depraved by play spent too much time laughing, playing, and making merry. In doing so, we lost our mindfulness, and passed away from that host of gods.
variant-pli-ms: satiyā sammosā evaṁ → sammosāya te (sya-all, mr); sammosā eva (pts1ed)

root-pli-ms: aniccā addhuvā appāyukā cavanadhammā itthattaṁ āgatā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: We are impermanent, not lasting, short-lived, perishable, and have come to this state of existence.”

root-pli-ms: Evaṁvihitakaṁ no tumhe āyasmanto khiḍḍāpadosikaṁ ācariyakaṁ aggaññaṁ paññapethā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: This is how you describe in your tradition that the origin of the world came about due to those depraved by play.’

root-pli-ms: Te evamāhaṁsu:
translation-en-sujato: They say,

root-pli-ms: ‘evaṁ kho no, āvuso gotama, sutaṁ, yathevāyasmā gotamo āhā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘That is what we have heard, Reverend Gotama, just as you say.’

root-pli-ms: Aggaññañcāhaṁ, bhaggava, pajānāmi …pe…
translation-en-sujato: Bhaggava, I understand the origin of the world.

root-pli-ms: yadabhijānaṁ tathāgato no anayaṁ āpajjati.
translation-en-sujato: Directly knowing this, the Realized One does not come to ruin.

root-pli-ms: Santi, bhaggava, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā manopadosikaṁ ācariyakaṁ aggaññaṁ paññapenti.
translation-en-sujato: There are some ascetics and brahmins who describe the origin of the world in their tradition as due to those who are malevolent.

root-pli-ms: Tyāhaṁ upasaṅkamitvā evaṁ vadāmi:
translation-en-sujato: I go up to them and say,

root-pli-ms: ‘saccaṁ kira tumhe āyasmanto manopadosikaṁ ācariyakaṁ aggaññaṁ paññapethā’ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘Is it really true that this is the venerables’ view?’

root-pli-ms: Te ca me evaṁ puṭṭhā ‘āmo’ti paṭijānanti.
translation-en-sujato: And they answer, ‘Yes’.

root-pli-ms: Tyāhaṁ evaṁ vadāmi:
translation-en-sujato: I say to them,

root-pli-ms: ‘kathaṁvihitakaṁ pana tumhe āyasmanto manopadosikaṁ ācariyakaṁ aggaññaṁ paññapethā’ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘But how do you describe in your tradition that the origin of the world came about due to those who are malevolent?’

root-pli-ms: Te mayā puṭṭhā na sampāyanti, asampāyantā mamaññeva paṭipucchanti.
translation-en-sujato: But they cannot answer, and they even question me in return.

root-pli-ms: Tesāhaṁ puṭṭho byākaromi:
translation-en-sujato: So I answer them,

root-pli-ms: ‘Santāvuso, manopadosikā nāma devā. Te ativelaṁ aññamaññaṁ upanijjhāyanti. Te ativelaṁ aññamaññaṁ upanijjhāyantā aññamaññamhi cittāni padūsenti. Te aññamaññaṁ paduṭṭhacittā kilantakāyā kilantacittā. Te devā tamhā kāyā cavanti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Reverends, there are gods named “malevolent”. They spend too much time gazing at each other, so they grow angry with each other, and their bodies and minds get tired. They pass away from that host of gods.
reference: cck11.35, csp1ed8.27, csp2ed8.27, dr11.34, ms8D_95, msdiv44, sc93

root-pli-ms: Ṭhānaṁ kho panetaṁ, āvuso, vijjati, yaṁ aññataro satto tamhā kāyā cavitvā itthattaṁ āgacchati.
translation-en-sujato: It’s possible that one of those beings passes away from that host and is reborn in this state of existence.

root-pli-ms: Itthattaṁ āgato samāno agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajati.
translation-en-sujato: Having done so, they go forth from the lay life to homelessness.

root-pli-ms: Agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajito samāno ātappamanvāya padhānamanvāya anuyogamanvāya appamādamanvāya sammāmanasikāramanvāya tathārūpaṁ cetosamādhiṁ phusati, yathāsamāhite citte taṁ pubbenivāsaṁ anussarati, tato paraṁ nānussarati.
translation-en-sujato: By dint of keen, resolute, committed, and diligent effort, and right focus, they experience an immersion of the heart of such a kind that they recollect that past life, but no further.

root-pli-ms: So evamāha:
translation-en-sujato: They say,

root-pli-ms: “ye kho te bhonto devā na manopadosikā te nātivelaṁ aññamaññaṁ upanijjhāyanti. Te nātivelaṁ aññamaññaṁ upanijjhāyantā aññamaññamhi cittāni nappadūsenti. Te aññamaññaṁ appaduṭṭhacittā akilantakāyā akilantacittā. Te devā tamhā kāyā na cavanti,
translation-en-sujato: “The gods who are not malevolent don’t spend too much time gazing at each other, so they don’t grow angry with each other, their bodies and minds don’t get tired, and they don’t pass away from that host of gods.

root-pli-ms: niccā dhuvā sassatā avipariṇāmadhammā sassatisamaṁ tatheva ṭhassanti.
translation-en-sujato: They are permanent, everlasting, eternal, imperishable, remaining the same for all eternity.

root-pli-ms: Ye pana mayaṁ ahumhā manopadosikā, te mayaṁ ativelaṁ aññamaññaṁ upanijjhāyimhā. Te mayaṁ ativelaṁ aññamaññaṁ upanijjhāyantā aññamaññamhi cittāni padūsimhā. Te mayaṁ aññamaññaṁ paduṭṭhacittā kilantakāyā kilantacittā. Evaṁ mayaṁ tamhā kāyā cutā,
translation-en-sujato: But we who were malevolent spent too much time gazing at each other, so our minds grew angry with each other, our bodies and minds got tired, and we passed away from that host of gods.
variant-pli-ms: padūsimhā → padūsayimhā (bj); padosiyimhā (sya-all); padūsimha (pts1ed) | Evaṁ mayaṁ → kilantacittāeva mayaṁ (pts1ed); kilantacittā (csp1ed)

root-pli-ms: aniccā addhuvā appāyukā cavanadhammā itthattaṁ āgatā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: We are impermanent, not lasting, short-lived, perishable, and have come to this state of existence.”

root-pli-ms: Evaṁvihitakaṁ no tumhe āyasmanto manopadosikaṁ ācariyakaṁ aggaññaṁ paññapethā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: This is how you describe in your tradition that the origin of the world came about due to those who are malevolent.’

root-pli-ms: Te evamāhaṁsu:
translation-en-sujato: They say,

root-pli-ms: ‘evaṁ kho no, āvuso gotama, sutaṁ, yathevāyasmā gotamo āhā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘That is what we have heard, Reverend Gotama, just as you say.’

root-pli-ms: Aggaññañcāhaṁ, bhaggava, pajānāmi …pe…
translation-en-sujato: Bhaggava, I understand the origin of the world.

root-pli-ms: yadabhijānaṁ tathāgato no anayaṁ āpajjati.
translation-en-sujato: Directly knowing this, the Realized One does not come to ruin.

root-pli-ms: Santi, bhaggava, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā adhiccasamuppannaṁ ācariyakaṁ aggaññaṁ paññapenti.
translation-en-sujato: There are some ascetics and brahmins who describe the origin of the world in their tradition as having arisen by chance.
reference: csp1ed8.28, csp2ed8.28, dr11.35, ms8D_99, msdiv45, pts-cs2.20, sc97, sya11.36

root-pli-ms: Tyāhaṁ upasaṅkamitvā evaṁ vadāmi:
translation-en-sujato: I go up to them and say,

root-pli-ms: ‘saccaṁ kira tumhe āyasmanto adhiccasamuppannaṁ ācariyakaṁ aggaññaṁ paññapethā’ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘Is it really true that this is the venerables’ view?’

root-pli-ms: Te ca me evaṁ puṭṭhā ‘āmo’ti paṭijānanti.
translation-en-sujato: And they answer, ‘Yes’.

root-pli-ms: Tyāhaṁ evaṁ vadāmi:
translation-en-sujato: I say to them,

root-pli-ms: ‘kathaṁvihitakaṁ pana tumhe āyasmanto adhiccasamuppannaṁ ācariyakaṁ aggaññaṁ paññapethā’ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘But how do you describe in your tradition that the origin of the world came about by chance?’

root-pli-ms: Te mayā puṭṭhā na sampāyanti, asampāyantā mamaññeva paṭipucchanti.
translation-en-sujato: But they cannot answer, and they even question me in return.

root-pli-ms: Tesāhaṁ puṭṭho byākaromi:
translation-en-sujato: So I answer them,

root-pli-ms: ‘Santāvuso, asaññasattā nāma devā.
translation-en-sujato: ‘Reverends, there are gods named “non-percipient beings”.

root-pli-ms: Saññuppādā ca pana te devā tamhā kāyā cavanti.
translation-en-sujato: When perception arises they pass away from that host of gods.

root-pli-ms: Ṭhānaṁ kho panetaṁ, āvuso, vijjati yaṁ aññataro satto tamhā kāyā cavitvā itthattaṁ āgacchati.
translation-en-sujato: It’s possible that one of those beings passes away from that host and is reborn in this state of existence.

root-pli-ms: Itthattaṁ āgato samāno agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajati.
translation-en-sujato: Having done so, they go forth from the lay life to homelessness.

root-pli-ms: Agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajito samāno ātappamanvāya padhānamanvāya anuyogamanvāya appamādamanvāya sammāmanasikāramanvāya tathārūpaṁ cetosamādhiṁ phusati, yathāsamāhite citte taṁ saññuppādaṁ anussarati, tato paraṁ nānussarati’.
translation-en-sujato: By dint of keen, resolute, committed, and diligent effort, and right focus, they experience an immersion of the heart of such a kind that they recollect the arising of perception, but no further.
variant-pli-ms: tathārūpaṁ cetosamādhiṁ phusati, yathāsamāhite citte taṁ → idaṁ padaṁ brahmajālasutte na dissati. evaṁ (mr)

root-pli-ms: So evamāha:
translation-en-sujato: They say,

root-pli-ms: ‘adhiccasamuppanno attā ca loko ca.
translation-en-sujato: “The self and the cosmos arose by chance.

root-pli-ms: Taṁ kissa hetu?
translation-en-sujato: Why is that?

root-pli-ms: Ahañhi pubbe nāhosiṁ, somhi etarahi ahutvā santatāya pariṇato’ti.
translation-en-sujato: Because formerly I didn’t exist. Now from not being I’ve changed into being.”

root-pli-ms: ‘Evaṁvihitakaṁ no tumhe āyasmanto adhiccasamuppannaṁ ācariyakaṁ aggaññaṁ paññapethā’ti?
translation-en-sujato: This is how you describe in your tradition that the origin of the world came about by chance.’
comment-en-sujato: Note MS’s inconsistent punctuation here, treating this statement, reasonably enough, as a question. perhaps this is better?

root-pli-ms: Te evamāhaṁsu:
translation-en-sujato: They say,

root-pli-ms: ‘evaṁ kho no, āvuso gotama, sutaṁ yathevāyasmā gotamo āhā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘That is what we have heard, Reverend Gotama, just as you say.’

root-pli-ms: Aggaññañcāhaṁ, bhaggava, pajānāmi tañca pajānāmi, tato ca uttaritaraṁ pajānāmi, tañca pajānaṁ na parāmasāmi, aparāmasato ca me paccattaññeva nibbuti viditā.
translation-en-sujato: I understand this, and what goes beyond it. Yet since I do not misapprehend that understanding, I have realized extinguishment within myself. Directly knowing this, the Realized One does not come to ruin.

root-pli-ms: Yadabhijānaṁ tathāgato no anayaṁ āpajjati.
Evaṁvādiṁ kho maṁ, bhaggava, evamakkhāyiṁ eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā asatā tucchā musā abhūtena abbhācikkhanti:
translation-en-sujato: Though I speak and explain like this, certain ascetics and brahmins misrepresent me with the false, hollow, lying, untruthful claim:
reference: bj9.56, ms8D_104, msdiv47, pts-cs2.21, sc102, sya11.37

root-pli-ms: ‘viparīto samaṇo gotamo bhikkhavo ca.
translation-en-sujato: ‘The ascetic Gotama has a distorted perspective, and so have his monks.

root-pli-ms: Samaṇo gotamo evamāha—
translation-en-sujato: He says,

root-pli-ms: yasmiṁ samaye subhaṁ vimokkhaṁ upasampajja viharati, sabbaṁ tasmiṁ samaye asubhantveva pajānātī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: “When one enters and remains in the liberation of the beautiful, at that time one only perceives what is ugly.”
variant-pli-ms: pajānātī’ti → sampajānātīti (sya-all); sañjānātīti (pts1ed) | asubhantveva → asubhanteva (sya-all, pts1ed)

root-pli-ms: Na kho panāhaṁ, bhaggava, evaṁ vadāmi:
translation-en-sujato: But I don’t say that.

root-pli-ms: ‘yasmiṁ samaye subhaṁ vimokkhaṁ upasampajja viharati, sabbaṁ tasmiṁ samaye asubhantveva pajānātī’ti.
Evañca khvāhaṁ, bhaggava, vadāmi:
translation-en-sujato: I say this:

root-pli-ms: ‘yasmiṁ samaye subhaṁ vimokkhaṁ upasampajja viharati, subhantveva tasmiṁ samaye pajānātī’”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “When one enters and remains in the liberation of the beautiful, at that time one only perceives what is beautiful.”’”

root-pli-ms: “Te ca, bhante, viparītā, ye bhagavantaṁ viparītato dahanti bhikkhavo ca.
translation-en-sujato: “They are the ones with a distorted perspective, sir, who regard the Buddha and the mendicants in this way.

root-pli-ms: Evaṁpasanno ahaṁ, bhante, bhagavati. Pahoti me bhagavā tathā dhammaṁ desetuṁ, yathā ahaṁ subhaṁ vimokkhaṁ upasampajja vihareyyan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Sir, I am quite confident that the Buddha is capable of teaching me so that I can enter and remain in the liberation on the beautiful.”

root-pli-ms: “Dukkaraṁ kho etaṁ, bhaggava, tayā aññadiṭṭhikena aññakhantikena aññarucikena aññatrāyogena aññatrācariyakena subhaṁ vimokkhaṁ upasampajja viharituṁ.
translation-en-sujato: “It’s hard for you to enter and remain in the liberation on the beautiful, since you have a different view, creed, preference, practice, and tradition.

root-pli-ms: Iṅgha tvaṁ, bhaggava, yo ca te ayaṁ mayi pasādo, tameva tvaṁ sādhukamanurakkhā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Come now, Bhaggava, carefully preserve the confidence that you have in me.”

root-pli-ms: “Sace taṁ, bhante, mayā dukkaraṁ aññadiṭṭhikena aññakhantikena aññarucikena aññatrāyogena aññatrācariyakena subhaṁ vimokkhaṁ upasampajja viharituṁ.
translation-en-sujato: “If it’s hard for me to enter and remain in the liberation on the beautiful, since I have a different view, creed, preference, practice, and tradition,

root-pli-ms: Yo ca me ayaṁ, bhante, bhagavati pasādo, tamevāhaṁ sādhukamanurakkhissāmī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: I shall carefully preserve the confidence that I have in the Buddha.”

root-pli-ms: Idamavoca bhagavā.
translation-en-sujato: That is what the Buddha said.

root-pli-ms: Attamano bhaggavagotto paribbājako bhagavato bhāsitaṁ abhinandīti.
translation-en-sujato: Satisfied, the wanderer Bhaggavagotta was happy with what the Buddha said.

root-pli-ms: Pāthikasuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ paṭhamaṁ.
Dīgha Nikāya 25
translation-en-sujato: Long Discourses 25

root-pli-ms: Udumbarikasutta
translation-en-sujato: The Lion’s Roar at Udumbarikā’s Monastery

root-pli-ms: 1. Nigrodhaparibbājakavatthu
translation-en-sujato: 1. On the Wanderer Nigrodha

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
translation-en-sujato: So I have heard.
reference: bj9.58, cck11.39, csp1ed8.30, csp2ed8.30, dr11.38, ms8D_109, msdiv49, ndp8.29, pts-cs1, pts-vp-pli3.36, sc1, sya11.38, vri3.26

root-pli-ms: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā rājagahe viharati gijjhakūṭe pabbate.
translation-en-sujato: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, on the Vulture’s Peak Mountain.

root-pli-ms: Tena kho pana samayena nigrodho paribbājako udumbarikāya paribbājakārāme paṭivasati mahatiyā paribbājakaparisāya saddhiṁ tiṁsamattehi paribbājakasatehi.
translation-en-sujato: Now at that time the wanderer Nigrodha was residing in the lady Udumbarikā’s monastery for wanderers, together with a large assembly of three thousand wanderers.
comment-en-sujato: RD and MW oddly have “discourse to the udumbarikans”. Comm explains the term as “Udumbarikāya paribbājakārāmeti udumbarikāya deviyā santake paribbājakārāme” In Chinese, DA 8 has “烏暫婆利梵志女林” The forest of the Udumbara brahmin lady “, MA 104 has” 優曇婆邏林 “Udumbara forest”, T 11 has “烏曇末梨園” “Udumbara park”.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho sandhāno gahapati divā divassa rājagahā nikkhami bhagavantaṁ dassanāya.
translation-en-sujato: Then the householder Sandhana left Rājagaha in the middle of the day to see the Buddha.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho sandhānassa gahapatissa etadahosi:
translation-en-sujato: Then it occurred to him,

root-pli-ms: “akālo kho bhagavantaṁ dassanāya.
translation-en-sujato: “It’s the wrong time to see the Buddha,

root-pli-ms: Paṭisallīno bhagavā.
translation-en-sujato: as he’s in retreat.

root-pli-ms: Manobhāvanīyānampi bhikkhūnaṁ asamayo dassanāya.
translation-en-sujato: And it’s the wrong time to see the esteemed mendicants,

root-pli-ms: Paṭisallīnā manobhāvanīyā bhikkhū.
translation-en-sujato: as they’re in retreat.

root-pli-ms: Yannūnāhaṁ yena udumbarikāya paribbājakārāmo, yena nigrodho paribbājako tenupasaṅkameyyan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Why don’t I visit the wanderer Nigrodha at the lady Udumbarikā’s monastery for wanderers?”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho sandhāno gahapati yena udumbarikāya paribbājakārāmo, tenupasaṅkami.
translation-en-sujato: So he went to the monastery of the wanderers.

root-pli-ms: Tena kho pana samayena nigrodho paribbājako mahatiyā paribbājakaparisāya saddhiṁ nisinno hoti unnādiniyā uccāsaddamahāsaddāya anekavihitaṁ tiracchānakathaṁ kathentiyā.
translation-en-sujato: Now at that time, Nigrodha was sitting together with a large assembly of wanderers making an uproar, a dreadful racket. They engaged in all kinds of unworthy talk, such as
reference: ms8D_110, msdiv50, pts-cs2, pts-vp-pli3.37, sc2, sya11.39

root-pli-ms: Seyyathidaṁ—rājakathaṁ corakathaṁ mahāmattakathaṁ senākathaṁ bhayakathaṁ yuddhakathaṁ annakathaṁ pānakathaṁ vatthakathaṁ sayanakathaṁ mālākathaṁ gandhakathaṁ ñātikathaṁ yānakathaṁ gāmakathaṁ nigamakathaṁ nagarakathaṁ janapadakathaṁ itthikathaṁ sūrakathaṁ visikhākathaṁ kumbhaṭṭhānakathaṁ pubbapetakathaṁ nānattakathaṁ lokakkhāyikaṁ samuddakkhāyikaṁ itibhavābhavakathaṁ iti vā.
translation-en-sujato: talk about kings, bandits, and ministers; talk about armies, threats, and wars; talk about food, drink, clothes, and beds; talk about garlands and fragrances; talk about family, vehicles, villages, towns, cities, and countries; talk about women and heroes; street talk and well talk; talk about the departed; motley talk; tales of land and sea; and talk about being reborn in this or that state of existence.

root-pli-ms: Addasā kho nigrodho paribbājako sandhānaṁ gahapatiṁ dūratova āgacchantaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Nigrodha saw Sandhāna coming off in the distance,
reference: csp1ed8.31, csp2ed8.31, dr11.39, ms8D_111, msdiv51, ndp8.30, pts-cs3, sc3, vri3.27

root-pli-ms: Disvā sakaṁ parisaṁ saṇṭhāpesi:
translation-en-sujato: and hushed his own assembly:

root-pli-ms: “appasaddā bhonto hontu, mā bhonto saddamakattha.
translation-en-sujato: “Be quiet, good sirs, don’t make a sound.

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ samaṇassa gotamassa sāvako āgacchati sandhāno gahapati.
translation-en-sujato: The householder Sandhāna, a disciple of the ascetic Gotama, is coming.

root-pli-ms: Yāvatā kho pana samaṇassa gotamassa sāvakā gihī odātavasanā rājagahe paṭivasanti, ayaṁ tesaṁ aññataro sandhāno gahapati.
translation-en-sujato: He is included among the white-clothed lay disciples of the ascetic Gotama, who is residing near Rājagaha.

root-pli-ms: Appasaddakāmā kho panete āyasmanto appasaddavinītā, appasaddassa vaṇṇavādino.
translation-en-sujato: Such venerables like the quiet, are educated to be quiet, and praise the quiet.

root-pli-ms: Appeva nāma appasaddaṁ parisaṁ viditvā upasaṅkamitabbaṁ maññeyyā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Hopefully if he sees that our assembly is quiet he’ll see fit to approach.”

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vutte, te paribbājakā tuṇhī ahesuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Then those wanderers fell silent.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho sandhāno gahapati yena nigrodho paribbājako tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā nigrodhena paribbājakena saddhiṁ sammodi.
translation-en-sujato: Then Sandhāna went up to the wanderer Nigrodha, and exchanged greetings with him.
reference: bj9.60, cck11.40, ms8D_112, msdiv52, pts-cs4, pts-vp-pli3.38, sc4

root-pli-ms: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho sandhāno gahapati nigrodhaṁ paribbājakaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side and said to Nigrodha,

root-pli-ms: “aññathā kho ime bhonto aññatitthiyā paribbājakā saṅgamma samāgamma unnādino uccāsaddamahāsaddā anekavihitaṁ tiracchānakathaṁ anuyuttā viharanti.
translation-en-sujato: “The way the wanderers make an uproar as they sit together and talk about all kinds of unworthy topics is one thing.

root-pli-ms: Seyyathidaṁ—rājakathaṁ …pe… itibhavābhavakathaṁ iti vā.
Aññathā kho pana so bhagavā araññavanapatthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevati appasaddāni appanigghosāni vijanavātāni manussarāhasseyyakāni paṭisallānasāruppānī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: It’s quite different to the way the Buddha frequents remote lodgings in the wilderness and the forest that are quiet and still, far from the madding crowd, remote from human settlements, and fit for retreat.”

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vutte, nigrodho paribbājako sandhānaṁ gahapatiṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: When Sandhāna said this, Nigrodha said to him,
reference: dr11.40, ms8D_113, msdiv53, pts-cs5, sc5, sya11.40

root-pli-ms: “yagghe, gahapati, jāneyyāsi, kena samaṇo gotamo saddhiṁ sallapati, kena sākacchaṁ samāpajjati, kena paññāveyyattiyaṁ samāpajjati?
translation-en-sujato: “Surely, householder, you should know better! With whom does the ascetic Gotama converse? With whom does he engage in discussion? With whom does he achieve lucidity of wisdom?

root-pli-ms: Suññāgārahatā samaṇassa gotamassa paññā aparisāvacaro samaṇo gotamo nālaṁ sallāpāya.
translation-en-sujato: Staying in empty huts has destroyed the ascetic Gotama’s wisdom. Not frequenting assemblies, he is unable to hold a discussion.

root-pli-ms: So antamantāneva sevati.
translation-en-sujato: He just lurks on the periphery.

root-pli-ms: Seyyathāpi nāma gokāṇā pariyantacārinī antamantāneva sevati.
translation-en-sujato: He’s just like the nilgai antelope, circling around and lurking on the periphery.

root-pli-ms: Evameva suññāgārahatā samaṇassa gotamassa paññā;
aparisāvacaro samaṇo gotamo;
nālaṁ sallāpāya.
So antamantāneva sevati.
Iṅgha, gahapati, samaṇo gotamo imaṁ parisaṁ āgaccheyya, ekapañheneva naṁ saṁsādeyyāma, tucchakumbhīva naṁ maññe orodheyyāmā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Please, householder, let the ascetic Gotama come to this assembly. I’ll sink him with just one question! I’ll roll him over and wrap him up like a hollow pot!”
comment-en-sujato: orodheyyāmā is unclear. I follow comm: Orodheyyāmāti vinandheyyāma. Pūritaghaṭo hi ito cito ca parivattetvā na suvinandhanīyo hoti. Rittako yathāruci parivattetvā sakkā hoti vinandhituṁ, evameva hatapaññatāya rittakumbhisadisaṁ samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ vādavinandhanena samantā vinandhissāmāti vadati.

root-pli-ms: Assosi kho bhagavā dibbāya sotadhātuyā visuddhāya atikkantamānusikāya sandhānassa gahapatissa nigrodhena paribbājakena saddhiṁ imaṁ kathāsallāpaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: With clairaudience that is purified and superhuman, the Buddha heard this discussion between the householder Sandhāna and the wanderer Nigrodha.
reference: cck11.41, csp1ed8.32, csp2ed8.32, dr11.41, ms8D_114, msdiv54, ndp8.31, pts-cs6, pts-vp-pli3.39, sc6, sya11.41, vri3.28

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā gijjhakūṭā pabbatā orohitvā yena sumāgadhāya tīre moranivāpo tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā sumāgadhāya tīre moranivāpe abbhokāse caṅkami.
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha descended Vulture’s Peak Mountain and went to the peacocks’ feeding ground on the bank of the Sumāgadhā, where he walked mindfully in the open air.

root-pli-ms: Addasā kho nigrodho paribbājako bhagavantaṁ sumāgadhāya tīre moranivāpe abbhokāse caṅkamantaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Nigrodha saw him,

root-pli-ms: Disvāna sakaṁ parisaṁ saṇṭhāpesi:
translation-en-sujato: and hushed his own assembly:

root-pli-ms: “appasaddā bhonto hontu, mā bhonto saddamakattha, ayaṁ samaṇo gotamo sumāgadhāya tīre moranivāpe abbhokāse caṅkamati.
translation-en-sujato: “Be quiet, good sirs, don’t make a sound. The ascetic Gotama is walking mindfully on the bank of the Sumāgadhā.

root-pli-ms: Appasaddakāmo kho pana so āyasmā, appasaddassa vaṇṇavādī.
translation-en-sujato: The venerable likes quiet and praises quiet.

root-pli-ms: Appeva nāma appasaddaṁ parisaṁ viditvā upasaṅkamitabbaṁ maññeyya.
translation-en-sujato: Hopefully if he sees that our assembly is quiet he’ll see fit to approach.

root-pli-ms: Sace samaṇo gotamo imaṁ parisaṁ āgaccheyya, imaṁ taṁ pañhaṁ puccheyyāma:
translation-en-sujato: If he comes, I’ll ask him this question:

root-pli-ms: ‘ko nāma so, bhante, bhagavato dhammo, yena bhagavā sāvake vineti, yena bhagavatā sāvakā vinītā assāsappattā paṭijānanti ajjhāsayaṁ ādibrahmacariyan’”ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘Sir, what teaching do you use to guide your disciples, through which they claim solace in the fundamental purpose of the spiritual life?’”

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vutte, te paribbājakā tuṇhī ahesuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Then those wanderers fell silent.

root-pli-ms: 2. Tapojigucchāvāda
translation-en-sujato: 2. Mortification in Disgust of Sin

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā yena nigrodho paribbājako tenupasaṅkami.
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha went up to the wanderer Nigrodha,
reference: bj9.62, cck11.42, ms8D_115, msdiv55, pts-cs7, pts-vp-pli3.40, sc7, sya11.42

root-pli-ms: Atha kho nigrodho paribbājako bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: who said to him,

root-pli-ms: “etu kho, bhante, bhagavā, svāgataṁ, bhante, bhagavato.
translation-en-sujato: “Come, Blessed One! Welcome, Blessed One!

root-pli-ms: Cirassaṁ kho, bhante, bhagavā imaṁ pariyāyamakāsi yadidaṁ idhāgamanāya.
translation-en-sujato: It’s been a long time since you took the opportunity to come here.

root-pli-ms: Nisīdatu, bhante, bhagavā, idamāsanaṁ paññattan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Please, sir, sit down, this seat is ready.”

root-pli-ms: Nisīdi bhagavā paññatte āsane.
translation-en-sujato: The Buddha sat on the seat spread out,

root-pli-ms: Nigrodhopi kho paribbājako aññataraṁ nīcāsanaṁ gahetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
translation-en-sujato: while Nigrodha took a low seat and sat to one side.

root-pli-ms: Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho nigrodhaṁ paribbājakaṁ bhagavā etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: The Buddha said to him,

root-pli-ms: “kāya nuttha, nigrodha, etarahi kathāya sannisinnā, kā ca pana vo antarākathā vippakatā”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “Nigrodha, what were you sitting talking about just now? What conversation was unfinished?”

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vutte, nigrodho paribbājako bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: Nigrodha said,

root-pli-ms: “idha mayaṁ, bhante, addasāma bhagavantaṁ sumāgadhāya tīre moranivāpe abbhokāse caṅkamantaṁ, disvāna evaṁ avocumhā:
translation-en-sujato: “Well, sir, I saw you walking mindfully and said:

root-pli-ms: ‘sace samaṇo gotamo imaṁ parisaṁ āgaccheyya, imaṁ taṁ pañhaṁ puccheyyāma:
translation-en-sujato: ‘If the ascetic Gotama comes, I’ll ask him this question:

root-pli-ms: “ko nāma so, bhante, bhagavato dhammo, yena bhagavā sāvake vineti, yena bhagavatā sāvakā vinītā assāsappattā paṭijānanti ajjhāsayaṁ ādibrahmacariyan”’ti?
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, what teaching do you use to guide your disciples, through which they claim solace in the fundamental purpose of the spiritual life?”’

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ kho no, bhante, antarākathā vippakatā; atha bhagavā anuppatto”ti.
translation-en-sujato: This is the conversation that was unfinished when the Buddha arrived.”

root-pli-ms: “Dujjānaṁ kho etaṁ, nigrodha, tayā aññadiṭṭhikena aññakhantikena aññarucikena aññatrāyogena aññatrācariyakena, yenāhaṁ sāvake vinemi, yena mayā sāvakā vinītā assāsappattā paṭijānanti ajjhāsayaṁ ādibrahmacariyaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: “It’s hard for you to understand this, Nigrodha, since you have a different view, creed, preference, practice, and tradition.
reference: csp1ed8.33, csp2ed8.33, dr11.42, ms8D_116, msdiv56, sc8

root-pli-ms: Iṅgha tvaṁ maṁ, nigrodha, sake ācariyake adhijegucche pañhaṁ puccha:
translation-en-sujato: Please ask me a question about the higher mortification in disgust of sin in your own tradition:

root-pli-ms: ‘kathaṁ santā nu kho, bhante, tapojigucchā paripuṇṇā hoti, kathaṁ aparipuṇṇā’”ti?
translation-en-sujato: ‘How are the conditions for the mortification in disgust of sin completed, and how are they incomplete?’”
comment-en-sujato: The idiom katham santā is unusual, but it clearly echoes evaṁ sante below

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ vutte, te paribbājakā unnādino uccāsaddamahāsaddā ahesuṁ:
translation-en-sujato: When he said this, those wanderers made an uproar,

root-pli-ms: “acchariyaṁ vata bho, abbhutaṁ vata bho, samaṇassa gotamassa mahiddhikatā mahānubhāvatā, yatra hi nāma sakavādaṁ ṭhapessati, paravādena pavāressatī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “It’s incredible, it’s amazing! The ascetic Gotama has such power and might! For he sets aside his own doctrine and invites discussion on the doctrine of others!”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho nigrodho paribbājako te paribbājake appasadde katvā bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: Then Nigrodha, having quieted those wanderers, said to the Buddha,
reference: cck11.43, ms8D_118, msdiv57, ndp8.32, pts-cs8, sc10, vri3.29

root-pli-ms: “mayaṁ kho, bhante, tapojigucchāvādā tapojigucchāsārā tapojigucchāallīnā viharāma.
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, we teach mortification in disgust of sin, regarding it as essential and clinging to it.

root-pli-ms: Kathaṁ santā nu kho, bhante, tapojigucchā paripuṇṇā hoti, kathaṁ aparipuṇṇā”ti?
translation-en-sujato: How are the conditions for the mortification in disgust of sin completed, and how are they incomplete?”

root-pli-ms: “Idha, nigrodha, tapassī acelako hoti muttācāro, hatthāpalekhano, naehibhaddantiko, natiṭṭhabhaddantiko, nābhihaṭaṁ, na uddissakataṁ, na nimantanaṁ sādiyati,
translation-en-sujato: “It’s when a mortifier goes naked, ignoring conventions. They lick their hands, and don’t come or wait when asked. They don’t consent to food brought to them, or food prepared on purpose for them, or an invitation for a meal.

root-pli-ms: so na kumbhimukhā paṭiggaṇhāti, na kaḷopimukhā paṭiggaṇhāti, na eḷakamantaraṁ, na daṇḍamantaraṁ, na musalamantaraṁ, na dvinnaṁ bhuñjamānānaṁ, na gabbhiniyā, na pāyamānāya, na purisantaragatāya, na saṅkittīsu, na yattha sā upaṭṭhito hoti, na yattha makkhikā saṇḍasaṇḍacārinī, na macchaṁ, na maṁsaṁ, na suraṁ, na merayaṁ, na thusodakaṁ pivati,
translation-en-sujato: They don’t receive anything from a pot or bowl; or from someone who keeps sheep, or who has a weapon or a shovel in their home; or where a couple is eating; or where there is a woman who is pregnant, breast-feeding, or who has a man in her home; or where there’s a dog waiting or flies buzzing. They accept no fish or meat or liquor or wine, and drink no beer.

root-pli-ms: so ekāgāriko vā hoti ekālopiko, dvāgāriko vā hoti dvālopiko, sattāgāriko vā hoti sattālopiko, ekissāpi dattiyā yāpeti, dvīhipi dattīhi yāpeti, sattahipi dattīhi yāpeti;
translation-en-sujato: They go to just one house for alms, taking just one mouthful, or two houses and two mouthfuls, up to seven houses and seven mouthfuls. They feed on one saucer a day, two saucers a day, up to seven saucers a day.

root-pli-ms: ekāhikampi āhāraṁ āhāreti, dvīhikampi āhāraṁ āhāreti, sattāhikampi āhāraṁ āhāreti, iti evarūpaṁ addhamāsikampi pariyāyabhattabhojanānuyogamanuyutto viharati.
translation-en-sujato: They eat once a day, once every second day, up to once a week, and so on, even up to once a fortnight. They live committed to the practice of eating food at set intervals.

root-pli-ms: So sākabhakkho vā hoti, sāmākabhakkho vā hoti, nīvārabhakkho vā hoti, daddulabhakkho vā hoti, haṭabhakkho vā hoti, kaṇabhakkho vā hoti, ācāmabhakkho vā hoti, piññākabhakkho vā hoti, tiṇabhakkho vā hoti, gomayabhakkho vā hoti; vanamūlaphalāhāro yāpeti pavattaphalabhojī.
translation-en-sujato: They eat herbs, millet, wild rice, poor rice, water lettuce, rice bran, scum from boiling rice, sesame flour, grass, or cow dung. They survive on forest roots and fruits, or eating fallen fruit.

root-pli-ms: So sāṇānipi dhāreti, masāṇānipi dhāreti, chavadussānipi dhāreti, paṁsukūlānipi dhāreti, tirīṭānipi dhāreti, ajinampi dhāreti, ajinakkhipampi dhāreti, kusacīrampi dhāreti, vākacīrampi dhāreti, phalakacīrampi dhāreti, kesakambalampi dhāreti, vāḷakambalampi dhāreti, ulūkapakkhampi dhāreti,
translation-en-sujato: They wear robes of sunn hemp, mixed hemp, corpse-wrapping cloth, rags, lodh tree bark, antelope hide (whole or in strips), kusa grass, bark, wood-chips, human hair, horse-tail hair, or owls’ wings.

root-pli-ms: kesamassulocakopi hoti kesamassulocanānuyogamanuyutto,
translation-en-sujato: They tear out their hair and beard, committed to this practice.

root-pli-ms: ubbhaṭṭhakopi hoti āsanapaṭikkhitto,
translation-en-sujato: They constantly stand, refusing seats.

root-pli-ms: ukkuṭikopi hoti ukkuṭikappadhānamanuyutto,
translation-en-sujato: They squat, committed to persisting in the squatting position.

root-pli-ms: kaṇṭakāpassayikopi hoti kaṇṭakāpassaye seyyaṁ kappeti,
translation-en-sujato: They lie on a mat of thorns, making a mat of thorns their bed.

root-pli-ms: phalakaseyyampi kappeti, thaṇḍilaseyyampi kappeti,
translation-en-sujato: They make their bed on a plank, or the bare ground.

root-pli-ms: ekapassayikopi hoti
translation-en-sujato: They lie only on one side.

root-pli-ms: rajojalladharo,
translation-en-sujato: They wear dust and dirt.

root-pli-ms: abbhokāsikopi hoti
translation-en-sujato: They stay in the open air.

root-pli-ms: yathāsanthatiko,
translation-en-sujato: They sleep wherever they lay their mat.

root-pli-ms: vekaṭikopi hoti vikaṭabhojanānuyogamanuyutto,
translation-en-sujato: They eat unnatural things, committed to the practice of eating unnatural foods.

root-pli-ms: apānakopi hoti apānakattamanuyutto,
translation-en-sujato: They don’t drink, committed to the practice of not drinking liquids.

root-pli-ms: sāyatatiyakampi udakorohanānuyogamanuyutto viharati.
translation-en-sujato: They’re committed to the practice of immersion in water three times a day, including the evening.

root-pli-ms: Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, nigrodha,
translation-en-sujato: What do you think, Nigrodha?

root-pli-ms: yadi evaṁ sante tapojigucchā paripuṇṇā vā hoti aparipuṇṇā vā”ti?
translation-en-sujato: If this is so, is the mortification in disgust of sin complete, or incomplete?”

root-pli-ms: “Addhā kho, bhante, evaṁ sante tapojigucchā paripuṇṇā hoti, no aparipuṇṇā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Clearly, sir, if that is so the mortification in disgust of sin is complete, not incomplete.”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ paripuṇṇāyapi kho ahaṁ, nigrodha, tapojigucchāya anekavihite upakkilese vadāmī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “But even such a completed mortification has many defects, I say.”

root-pli-ms: 2.1. Upakkilesa
translation-en-sujato: 2.1. Defects

root-pli-ms: “Yathā kathaṁ pana, bhante, bhagavā evaṁ paripuṇṇāya tapojigucchāya anekavihite upakkilese vadatī”ti?
translation-en-sujato: “But how does the Buddha say that even such a completed mortification has many defects?”

root-pli-ms: “Idha, nigrodha, tapassī tapaṁ samādiyati, so tena tapasā attamano hoti paripuṇṇasaṅkappo.
translation-en-sujato: “Firstly, a mortifier undertakes a practice of mortification. They’re happy with that, as they’ve got all they wished for.

root-pli-ms: Yampi, nigrodha, tapassī tapaṁ samādiyati, so tena tapasā attamano hoti paripuṇṇasaṅkappo.
Ayampi kho, nigrodha, tapassino upakkileso hoti.
translation-en-sujato: This is a defect in that mortifier.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, nigrodha, tapassī tapaṁ samādiyati, so tena tapasā attānukkaṁseti paraṁ vambheti.
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, a mortifier undertakes a practice of mortification. They glorify themselves and put others down on account of that.

root-pli-ms: Yampi, nigrodha, tapassī tapaṁ samādiyati, so tena tapasā attānukkaṁseti paraṁ vambheti.
Ayampi kho, nigrodha, tapassino upakkileso hoti.
translation-en-sujato: This too is a defect in that mortifier.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, nigrodha, tapassī tapaṁ samādiyati, so tena tapasā majjati mucchati pamādamāpajjati.
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, a mortifier undertakes a practice of mortification. They become indulgent and infatuated and fall into negligence on account of that.

root-pli-ms: Yampi, nigrodha, tapassī tapaṁ samādiyati, so tena tapasā majjati mucchati pamādamāpajjati.
Ayampi kho, nigrodha, tapassino upakkileso hoti.
translation-en-sujato: This too is a defect in that mortifier.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, nigrodha, tapassī tapaṁ samādiyati, so tena tapasā lābhasakkārasilokaṁ abhinibbatteti, so tena lābhasakkārasilokena attamano hoti paripuṇṇasaṅkappo.
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, a mortifier undertakes a practice of mortification. They generate possessions, honor, and popularity through that mortification. They’re happy with that, as they’ve got all they wished for.
reference: dr11.45, ms8D_124, msdiv59, pts-cs10, sc16, sya11.45

root-pli-ms: Yampi, nigrodha, tapassī tapaṁ samādiyati, so tena tapasā lābhasakkārasilokaṁ abhinibbatteti, so tena lābhasakkārasilokena attamano hoti paripuṇṇasaṅkappo.
Ayampi kho, nigrodha, tapassino upakkileso hoti.
translation-en-sujato: This too is a defect in that mortifier.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, nigrodha, tapassī tapaṁ samādiyati, so tena tapasā lābhasakkārasilokaṁ abhinibbatteti, so tena lābhasakkārasilokena attānukkaṁseti paraṁ vambheti.
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, a mortifier undertakes a practice of mortification. They generate possessions, honor, and popularity through that mortification. They glorify themselves and put others down on account of that.

root-pli-ms: Yampi, nigrodha, tapassī tapaṁ samādiyati, so tena tapasā lābhasakkārasilokaṁ abhinibbatteti, so tena lābhasakkārasilokena attānukkaṁseti paraṁ vambheti.
Ayampi kho, nigrodha, tapassino upakkileso hoti.
translation-en-sujato: This too is a defect in that mortifier.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, nigrodha, tapassī tapaṁ samādiyati, so tena tapasā lābhasakkārasilokaṁ abhinibbatteti, so tena lābhasakkārasilokena majjati mucchati pamādamāpajjati.
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, a mortifier undertakes a practice of mortification. They generate possessions, honor, and popularity through that mortification. They become indulgent and infatuated and fall into negligence on account of that.

root-pli-ms: Yampi, nigrodha, tapassī tapaṁ samādiyati, so tena tapasā lābhasakkārasilokaṁ abhinibbatteti, so tena lābhasakkārasilokena majjati mucchati pamādamāpajjati.
Ayampi kho, nigrodha, tapassino upakkileso hoti.
translation-en-sujato: This too is a defect in that mortifier.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, nigrodha, tapassī bhojanesu vodāsaṁ āpajjati:
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, a mortifier becomes fussy about food, saying,

root-pli-ms: ‘idaṁ me khamati, idaṁ me nakkhamatī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘This agrees with me, this doesn’t agree with me.’

root-pli-ms: So yañca khvassa nakkhamati, taṁ sāpekkho pajahati.
translation-en-sujato: What doesn’t agree with them they reluctantly give up.
comment-en-sujato: Usually sapekkha is used in the sense of missing something, or longing for it when it’s gone.

root-pli-ms: Yaṁ panassa khamati, taṁ gadhito mucchito ajjhāpanno anādīnavadassāvī anissaraṇapañño paribhuñjati …pe…
translation-en-sujato: But what does agree with them they eat tied, infatuated, attached, blind to the drawbacks, and not understanding the escape.

root-pli-ms: ayampi kho, nigrodha, tapassino upakkileso hoti.
translation-en-sujato: This too is a defect in that mortifier.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, nigrodha, tapassī tapaṁ samādiyati lābhasakkārasilokanikantihetu:
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, a mortifier undertakes a practice of mortification out of longing for possessions, honor, and popularity, thinking,
reference: bj9.70, csp1ed8.36, csp2ed8.36, dr11.46, ms8D_128, pts-vp-pli3.44, sc20, sya11.46

root-pli-ms: ‘sakkarissanti maṁ rājāno rājamahāmattā khattiyā brāhmaṇā gahapatikā titthiyā’ti …pe…
translation-en-sujato: ‘Kings, royal ministers, aristocrats, brahmins, householders, and sectarians will honor me!’

root-pli-ms: ayampi kho, nigrodha, tapassino upakkileso hoti.
translation-en-sujato: This too is a defect in that mortifier.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, nigrodha, tapassī aññataraṁ samaṇaṁ vā brāhmaṇaṁ vā apasādetā hoti:
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, a mortifier rebukes a certain ascetic or brahmin,

root-pli-ms: ‘kiṁ panāyaṁ sambahulājīvo sabbaṁ sambhakkheti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘But what is this one doing, living in abundance! According to this ascetic’s doctrine, everything—

root-pli-ms: Seyyathidaṁ—mūlabījaṁ khandhabījaṁ phaḷubījaṁ aggabījaṁ bījabījameva pañcamaṁ, asanivicakkaṁ dantakūṭaṁ, samaṇappavādenā’ti …pe…
translation-en-sujato: plants propagated from roots, stems, cuttings, or joints; and those from regular seeds as the fifth—is crunched together like the thunder of a tooth-hammer!’

root-pli-ms: ayampi kho, nigrodha, tapassino upakkileso hoti.
translation-en-sujato: This too is a defect in that mortifier.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, nigrodha, tapassī passati aññataraṁ samaṇaṁ vā brāhmaṇaṁ vā kulesu sakkariyamānaṁ garukariyamānaṁ māniyamānaṁ pūjiyamānaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, a mortifier sees a certain ascetic or brahmin being honored, respected, esteemed, and venerated among good families.

root-pli-ms: Disvā tassa evaṁ hoti:
translation-en-sujato: They think,

root-pli-ms: ‘imañhi nāma sambahulājīvaṁ kulesu sakkaronti garuṁ karonti mānenti pūjenti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘This one, who lives in abundance, is honored, respected, esteemed, and venerated among good families.

root-pli-ms: Maṁ pana tapassiṁ lūkhājīviṁ kulesu na sakkaronti na garuṁ karonti na mānenti na pūjentī’ti, iti so issāmacchariyaṁ kulesu uppādetā hoti …pe…
translation-en-sujato: But I, a self-mortifier who lives rough, am not honored, respected, esteemed, and venerated among good families.’ Thus they give rise to jealousy and stinginess regarding families.

root-pli-ms: ayampi kho, nigrodha, tapassino upakkileso hoti.
translation-en-sujato: This too is a defect in that mortifier.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, nigrodha, tapassī āpāthakanisādī hoti …pe…
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, a mortifier sits meditation only when people can see them.

root-pli-ms: ayampi kho, nigrodha, tapassino upakkileso hoti.
translation-en-sujato: This too is a defect in that mortifier.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, nigrodha, tapassī attānaṁ adassayamāno kulesu carati:
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, a mortifier sneaks about among families, thinking,
comment-en-sujato: As noted by MW, comm here says “adassayamānoti ettha a-kāro nipātamattaṁ, dassayamānoti attho”. But this seems odd. Tika says ‘‘Ādassayamāno’’ti vā pāṭho. Again, this seems odd. If the first explanation is good, why need another? And if it is a genuine reading, it does not seem to be attested. Further, ādassana doesn’t seem to be attested as a genuine Pali term.

root-pli-ms: ‘idampi me tapasmiṁ idampi me tapasmin’ti …pe…
translation-en-sujato: ‘This is part of my mortification; this is part of my mortification.’

root-pli-ms: ayampi kho, nigrodha, tapassino upakkileso hoti.
translation-en-sujato: This too is a defect in that mortifier.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, nigrodha, tapassī kiñcideva paṭicchannaṁ sevati.
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, a mortifier sometimes behaves in an underhand manner.

root-pli-ms: So ‘khamati te idan’ti puṭṭho samāno akkhamamānaṁ āha: ‘khamatī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: When asked whether something agrees with them, they say it does, even though it doesn’t.
comment-en-sujato: Note that comm applies this to views “Kiñcidevāti kiñci vajjaṁ diṭṭhigataṁ vā”, but earlier in the sutta “idaṁ me khamati, idaṁ me nakkhamatī’ti.” is applied to preferences regarding food.

root-pli-ms: Khamamānaṁ āha: ‘nakkhamatī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: Or they say it doesn’t, even though it does.

root-pli-ms: Iti so sampajānamusā bhāsitā hoti …pe…
translation-en-sujato: Thus they tell a deliberate lie.

root-pli-ms: ayampi kho, nigrodha, tapassino upakkileso hoti.
translation-en-sujato: This too is a defect in that mortifier.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, nigrodha, tapassī tathāgatassa vā tathāgatasāvakassa vā dhammaṁ desentassa santaṁyeva pariyāyaṁ anuññeyyaṁ nānujānāti …pe…
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, a mortifier disagrees with the way that the Realized One or their disciple teaches Dhamma, even when they make a valid point.

root-pli-ms: ayampi kho, nigrodha, tapassino upakkileso hoti.
translation-en-sujato: This too is a defect in that mortifier.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, nigrodha, tapassī kodhano hoti upanāhī.

translation-en-sujato: What do you think, Nigrodha?

root-pli-ms: yadime tapojigucchā upakkilesā vā anupakkilesā vā”ti?
translation-en-sujato: Are such mortifications defective or not?”

root-pli-ms: “Addhā kho ime, bhante, tapojigucchā upakkilesā, no anupakkilesā.
translation-en-sujato: “Clearly, sir, they’re defective.

root-pli-ms: Ṭhānaṁ kho panetaṁ, bhante, vijjati yaṁ idhekacco tapassī sabbeheva imehi upakkilesehi samannāgato assa;
translation-en-sujato: It’s possible that a mortifier might have all of these defects,

root-pli-ms: ko pana vādo aññataraññatarenā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: let alone one or other of them.”

root-pli-ms: 2.2. Parisuddhapapaṭikappattakathā
translation-en-sujato: 2.2. On Reaching the Shoots

root-pli-ms: “Idha, nigrodha, tapassī tapaṁ samādiyati, so tena tapasā na attamano hoti na paripuṇṇasaṅkappo.
translation-en-sujato: “Firstly, Nigrodha, a mortifier undertakes a practice of mortification. But they’re not happy with that, as they still haven’t got all they wished for.
reference: dr11.48, ms8D_138, msdiv64, ndp8.36, pts-cs13, pts-vp-pli3.46, sc30, sya11.48

root-pli-ms: Yampi, nigrodha, tapassī tapaṁ samādiyati, so tena tapasā na attamano hoti na paripuṇṇasaṅkappo.
Evaṁ so tasmiṁ ṭhāne parisuddho hoti.
translation-en-sujato: So they’re pure on that point.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, nigrodha, tapassī tapaṁ samādiyati, so tena tapasā na attānukkaṁseti na paraṁ vambheti …pe…
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, a mortifier undertakes a practice of mortification. They don’t glorify themselves or put others down on account of that.

root-pli-ms: evaṁ so tasmiṁ ṭhāne parisuddho hoti.
translation-en-sujato: So they’re pure on that point.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, nigrodha, tapassī tapaṁ samādiyati, so tena tapasā na majjati na mucchati na pamādamāpajjati …pe…
translation-en-sujato: They don’t become indulgent …

root-pli-ms: evaṁ so tasmiṁ ṭhāne parisuddho hoti.
Puna caparaṁ, nigrodha, tapassī tapaṁ samādiyati, so tena tapasā lābhasakkārasilokaṁ abhinibbatteti, so tena lābhasakkārasilokena na attamano hoti na paripuṇṇasaṅkappo …pe…
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, a mortifier undertakes a practice of mortification. They generate possessions, honor, and popularity through that mortification. They’re not happy with that, as they still haven’t got all they wished for …
reference: bj9.74, cck11.49, csp1ed8.38, csp2ed8.38, ms8D_141, msdiv65, sc33

root-pli-ms: evaṁ so tasmiṁ ṭhāne parisuddho hoti.
Puna caparaṁ, nigrodha, tapassī tapaṁ samādiyati, so tena tapasā lābhasakkārasilokaṁ abhinibbatteti, so tena lābhasakkārasilokena na attānukkaṁseti na paraṁ vambheti …pe…
translation-en-sujato: They don’t glorify themselves and put others down on account of possessions, honor, and popularity …

root-pli-ms: evaṁ so tasmiṁ ṭhāne parisuddho hoti.
Puna caparaṁ, nigrodha, tapassī tapaṁ samādiyati, so tena tapasā lābhasakkārasilokaṁ abhinibbatteti, so tena lābhasakkārasilokena na majjati na mucchati na pamādamāpajjati …pe…
translation-en-sujato: They don’t become indulgent because of it …

root-pli-ms: evaṁ so tasmiṁ ṭhāne parisuddho hoti.
translation-en-sujato: So they’re pure on that point.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, nigrodha, tapassī bhojanesu na vodāsaṁ āpajjati:
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, a mortifier doesn’t become fussy about food, saying,

root-pli-ms: ‘idaṁ me khamati, idaṁ me nakkhamatī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘This agrees with me, this doesn’t agree with me.’

root-pli-ms: So yañca khvassa nakkhamati, taṁ anapekkho pajahati.
translation-en-sujato: What doesn’t agree with them they readily give up.

root-pli-ms: Yaṁ panassa khamati, taṁ agadhito amucchito anajjhāpanno ādīnavadassāvī nissaraṇapañño paribhuñjati …pe…
translation-en-sujato: But what does agree with them they eat without being tied, infatuated, attached, blind to the drawbacks, and not understanding the escape.

root-pli-ms: evaṁ so tasmiṁ ṭhāne parisuddho hoti.
translation-en-sujato: So they’re pure on that point.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, nigrodha, tapassī na tapaṁ samādiyati lābhasakkārasilokanikantihetu:
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, a mortifier doesn’t undertake a practice of mortification out of longing for possessions, honor, and popularity …

root-pli-ms: ‘sakkarissanti maṁ rājāno rājamahāmattā khattiyā brāhmaṇā gahapatikā titthiyā’ti …pe…
translation-en-sujato: ‘Kings, royal ministers, aristocrats, brahmins, householders, and sectarians will honor me!’

root-pli-ms: evaṁ so tasmiṁ ṭhāne parisuddho hoti.
translation-en-sujato: So they’re pure on that point.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, nigrodha, tapassī aññataraṁ samaṇaṁ vā brāhmaṇaṁ vā nāpasādetā hoti:
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, a mortifier doesn’t rebuke a certain ascetic or brahmin,
reference: bj9.76, cck11.50, ms8D_146, msdiv67, pts-vp-pli3.47, sc38, vri3.34

root-pli-ms: ‘kiṁ panāyaṁ sambahulājīvo sabbaṁ sambhakkheti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘But what is this one doing, living in abundance! According to this ascetic’s doctrine, everything—

root-pli-ms: Seyyathidaṁ—mūlabījaṁ khandhabījaṁ phaḷubījaṁ aggabījaṁ bījabījameva pañcamaṁ, asanivicakkaṁ dantakūṭaṁ, samaṇappavādenā’ti …pe…
translation-en-sujato: plants propagated from roots, stems, cuttings, or joints; and those from regular seeds as the fifth—is crunched together like the thunder of a tooth-hammer!’

root-pli-ms: evaṁ so tasmiṁ ṭhāne parisuddho hoti.
translation-en-sujato: So they’re pure on that point.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, nigrodha, tapassī passati aññataraṁ samaṇaṁ vā brāhmaṇaṁ vā kulesu sakkariyamānaṁ garu kariyamānaṁ māniyamānaṁ pūjiyamānaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, a mortifier sees a certain ascetic or brahmin being honored, respected, esteemed, and venerated among good families.
reference: csp1ed8.39, csp2ed8.39, ms8D_147, ndp8.37, pts-cs14, sc39

root-pli-ms: Disvā tassa na evaṁ hoti:
translation-en-sujato: It never occurs to them,

root-pli-ms: ‘imañhi nāma sambahulājīvaṁ kulesu sakkaronti garuṁ karonti mānenti pūjenti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘This one, who lives in abundance, is honored, respected, esteemed, and venerated among good families.

root-pli-ms: Maṁ pana tapassiṁ lūkhājīviṁ kulesu na sakkaronti na garuṁ karonti na mānenti na pūjentī’ti, iti so issāmacchariyaṁ kulesu nuppādetā hoti …pe…
translation-en-sujato: But I, a self-mortifier who lives rough, am not honored, respected, esteemed, and venerated among good families.’ Thus they don’t give rise to jealousy and stinginess regarding families.

root-pli-ms: evaṁ so tasmiṁ ṭhāne parisuddho hoti.
translation-en-sujato: So they’re pure on that point.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, nigrodha, tapassī na āpāthakanisādī hoti …pe…
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, a mortifier doesn’t sit meditation only when people can see them.

root-pli-ms: evaṁ so tasmiṁ ṭhāne parisuddho hoti.
translation-en-sujato: So they’re pure on that point.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, nigrodha, tapassī na attānaṁ adassayamāno kulesu carati:
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, a mortifier doesn’t sneak about among families, thinking,

root-pli-ms: ‘idampi me tapasmiṁ, idampi me tapasmin’ti …pe…
translation-en-sujato: ‘This is part of my mortification; this is part of my mortification.’

root-pli-ms: evaṁ so tasmiṁ ṭhāne parisuddho hoti.
translation-en-sujato: So they’re pure on that point.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, nigrodha, tapassī na kiñcideva paṭicchannaṁ sevati, so:
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, a mortifier never behaves in an underhand manner.

root-pli-ms: ‘khamati te idan’ti puṭṭho samāno akkhamamānaṁ āha:
translation-en-sujato: When asked whether something agrees with them, they say it doesn’t when it doesn’t.

root-pli-ms: ‘nakkhamatī’ti.
Khamamānaṁ āha:
translation-en-sujato: Or they say it does when it does.

root-pli-ms: ‘khamatī’ti.
Iti so sampajānamusā na bhāsitā hoti …pe…
translation-en-sujato: Thus they don’t tell a deliberate lie.

root-pli-ms: evaṁ so tasmiṁ ṭhāne parisuddho hoti.
translation-en-sujato: So they’re pure on that point.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, nigrodha, tapassī tathāgatassa vā tathāgatasāvakassa vā dhammaṁ desentassa santaṁyeva pariyāyaṁ anuññeyyaṁ anujānāti …pe…
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, a mortifier agrees with the way that the Realized One or their disciple teaches Dhamma when they make a valid point.

root-pli-ms: evaṁ so tasmiṁ ṭhāne parisuddho hoti.
translation-en-sujato: So they’re pure on that point.

root-pli-ms: Puna caparaṁ, nigrodha, tapassī akkodhano hoti anupanāhī.
translation-en-sujato: Furthermore, a mortifier is not irritable and hostile …

root-pli-ms: Yampi, nigrodha, tapassī akkodhano hoti anupanāhī evaṁ so tasmiṁ ṭhāne parisuddho hoti.
Puna caparaṁ, nigrodha, tapassī amakkhī hoti apaḷāsī …pe…
translation-en-sujato: offensive and contemptuous …

root-pli-ms: anissukī hoti amaccharī …
translation-en-sujato: jealous and stingy …

root-pli-ms: asaṭho hoti amāyāvī …
translation-en-sujato: devious and deceitful …

root-pli-ms: atthaddho hoti anatimānī …
translation-en-sujato: obstinate and vain …

root-pli-ms: na pāpiccho hoti na pāpikānaṁ icchānaṁ vasaṁ gato …
translation-en-sujato: they don’t have wicked desires …

root-pli-ms: na micchādiṭṭhiko hoti na antaggāhikāya diṭṭhiyā samannāgato …
translation-en-sujato: and wrong view …

root-pli-ms: na sandiṭṭhiparāmāsī hoti na ādhānaggāhī suppaṭinissaggī.
translation-en-sujato: they’re not attached to their own views, holding them tight, and refusing to let go.

root-pli-ms: Yampi, nigrodha, tapassī na sandiṭṭhiparāmāsī hoti na ādhānaggāhī suppaṭinissaggī.
Evaṁ so tasmiṁ ṭhāne parisuddho hoti.
translation-en-sujato: So they’re pure on that point.

root-pli-ms: Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, nigrodha,
translation-en-sujato: What do you think, Nigrodha?

root-pli-ms: yadi evaṁ sante tapojigucchā parisuddhā vā hoti aparisuddhā vā”ti?
translation-en-sujato: If this is so, is the mortification in disgust of sin purified or not?”

root-pli-ms: “Addhā kho, bhante, evaṁ sante tapojigucchā parisuddhā hoti no aparisuddhā, aggappattā ca sārappattā cā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Clearly, sir, it is purified. It has reached the peak and the pith.”

root-pli-ms: “Na kho, nigrodha, ettāvatā tapojigucchā aggappattā ca hoti sārappattā ca;
translation-en-sujato: “No, Nigrodha, at this point the mortification in disgust of sin has not yet reached the peak and the pith.

root-pli-ms: api ca kho papaṭikappattā hotī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Rather, it has only reached the shoots.”

root-pli-ms: 2.3. Parisuddhatacappattakathā
translation-en-sujato: 2.3. On Reaching the Bark

root-pli-ms: “Kittāvatā pana, bhante, tapojigucchā aggappattā ca hoti sārappattā ca?
translation-en-sujato: “But at what point, sir, does the mortification in disgust of sin reach the peak and the pith?
variant-pli-ms: aggappattā ca hoti sārappattā ca → aggappattā ca sārappattā ca hoti (sya-all, csp1ed)

root-pli-ms: Sādhu me, bhante, bhagavā tapojigucchāya aggaññeva pāpetu, sāraññeva pāpetū”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Please help me reach the peak and the pith!”

root-pli-ms: “Idha, nigrodha, tapassī cātuyāmasaṁvarasaṁvuto hoti.
translation-en-sujato: “Nigrodha, take a mortifier who is restrained in the fourfold restraint.

root-pli-ms: Kathañca, nigrodha, tapassī cātuyāmasaṁvarasaṁvuto hoti?
translation-en-sujato: And how is a mortifier restrained in the fourfold restraint?

root-pli-ms: Idha, nigrodha, tapassī na pāṇaṁ atipāteti, na pāṇaṁ atipātayati, na pāṇamatipātayato samanuñño hoti.
translation-en-sujato: It’s when a mortifier doesn’t kill living creatures, doesn’t get others to kill, and doesn’t approve of killing.
comment-en-sujato: Cp AN 3.163

root-pli-ms: Na adinnaṁ ādiyati, na adinnaṁ ādiyāpeti, na adinnaṁ ādiyato samanuñño hoti.
translation-en-sujato: They don’t steal, get others to steal, or approve of stealing.

root-pli-ms: Na musā bhaṇati, na musā bhaṇāpeti, na musā bhaṇato samanuñño hoti.
translation-en-sujato: They don’t lie, get others to lie, or approve of lying.

root-pli-ms: Na bhāvitamāsīsati, na bhāvitamāsīsāpeti, na bhāvitamāsīsato samanuñño hoti.
translation-en-sujato: They don’t expect rewards from their practice, they don’t lead others to expect rewards, and they don’t approve of expecting rewards.
comment-en-sujato: This term is unique. Comm has “Na bhāvitamāsīsatīti bhāvitaṁ nāma tesaṁ saññāya pañca kāmaguṇā, te na āsīsati na sevatīti attho.”

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ kho, nigrodha, tapassī cātuyāmasaṁvarasaṁvuto hoti.
translation-en-sujato: That’s how a mortifier is restrained in the fourfold restraint.

root-pli-ms: Yato kho, nigrodha, tapassī cātuyāmasaṁvarasaṁvuto hoti, aduṁ cassa hoti tapassitāya.
translation-en-sujato: When a mortifier has the fourfold restraint, that is their mortification.

root-pli-ms: So abhiharati no hīnāyāvattati.
translation-en-sujato: They step forward, not falling back.

root-pli-ms: So vivittaṁ senāsanaṁ bhajati araññaṁ rukkhamūlaṁ pabbataṁ kandaraṁ giriguhaṁ susānaṁ vanapatthaṁ abbhokāsaṁ palālapuñjaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: They frequent a secluded lodging—a wilderness, the root of a tree, a hill, a ravine, a mountain cave, a charnel ground, a forest, the open air, a heap of straw.

root-pli-ms: So pacchābhattaṁ piṇḍapātapaṭikkanto nisīdati pallaṅkaṁ ābhujitvā ujuṁ kāyaṁ paṇidhāya parimukhaṁ satiṁ upaṭṭhapetvā.
translation-en-sujato: After the meal, they return from alms-round, sit down cross-legged with their body straight, and establish mindfulness right there.

root-pli-ms: So abhijjhaṁ loke pahāya vigatābhijjhena cetasā viharati, abhijjhāya cittaṁ parisodheti.
translation-en-sujato: Giving up desire for the world, they meditate with a heart rid of desire, cleansing the mind of desire.

root-pli-ms: Byāpādappadosaṁ pahāya abyāpannacitto viharati sabbapāṇabhūtahitānukampī, byāpādappadosā cittaṁ parisodheti.
translation-en-sujato: Giving up ill will and malevolence, they meditate with a mind rid of ill will, full of compassion for all living beings, cleansing the mind of ill will.

root-pli-ms: Thinamiddhaṁ pahāya vigatathinamiddho viharati ālokasaññī sato sampajāno, thinamiddhā cittaṁ parisodheti.
translation-en-sujato: Giving up dullness and drowsiness, they meditate with a mind rid of dullness and drowsiness, perceiving light, mindful and aware, cleansing the mind of dullness and drowsiness.

root-pli-ms: Uddhaccakukkuccaṁ pahāya anuddhato viharati ajjhattaṁ vūpasantacitto, uddhaccakukkuccā cittaṁ parisodheti.
translation-en-sujato: Giving up restlessness and remorse, they meditate without restlessness, their mind peaceful inside, cleansing the mind of restlessness and remorse.

root-pli-ms: Vicikicchaṁ pahāya tiṇṇavicikiccho viharati akathaṅkathī kusalesu dhammesu, vicikicchāya cittaṁ parisodheti.
translation-en-sujato: Giving up doubt, they meditate having gone beyond doubt, not undecided about skillful qualities, cleansing the mind of doubt.

root-pli-ms: So ime pañca nīvaraṇe pahāya cetaso upakkilese paññāya dubbalīkaraṇe
translation-en-sujato: They give up these five hindrances, corruptions of the heart that weaken wisdom.
reference: cck11.53, csp1ed8.41, csp2ed8.41, ms8D_158, msdiv71, ndp8.39, pts-cs17, pts-vp-pli3.50, sc50, vri3.36

root-pli-ms: mettāsahagatena cetasā ekaṁ disaṁ pharitvā viharati. Tathā dutiyaṁ. Tathā tatiyaṁ. Tathā catutthaṁ. Iti uddhamadho tiriyaṁ sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantaṁ lokaṁ mettāsahagatena cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena pharitvā viharati.
translation-en-sujato: Then they meditate spreading a heart full of love to one direction, and to the second, and to the third, and to the fourth. In the same way above, below, across, everywhere, all around, they spread a heart full of love to the whole world—abundant, expansive, limitless, free of enmity and ill will.

root-pli-ms: Karuṇāsahagatena cetasā …pe…
translation-en-sujato: They meditate spreading a heart full of compassion …

root-pli-ms: muditāsahagatena cetasā …pe…
translation-en-sujato: They meditate spreading a heart full of rejoicing …

root-pli-ms: upekkhāsahagatena cetasā ekaṁ disaṁ pharitvā viharati. Tathā dutiyaṁ. Tathā tatiyaṁ. Tathā catutthaṁ. Iti uddhamadho tiriyaṁ sabbadhi sabbattatāya sabbāvantaṁ lokaṁ upekkhāsahagatena cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena pharitvā viharati.
translation-en-sujato: They meditate spreading a heart full of equanimity to one direction, and to the second, and to the third, and to the fourth. In the same way above, below, across, everywhere, all around, they spread a heart full of equanimity to the whole world—abundant, expansive, limitless, free of enmity and ill will.

root-pli-ms: Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, nigrodha.
translation-en-sujato: What do you think, Nigrodha?

root-pli-ms: Yadi evaṁ sante tapojigucchā parisuddhā vā hoti aparisuddhā vā”ti?
translation-en-sujato: If this is so, is the mortification in disgust of sin purified or not?”

root-pli-ms: “Addhā kho, bhante, evaṁ sante tapojigucchā parisuddhā hoti no aparisuddhā, aggappattā ca sārappattā cā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Clearly, sir, it is purified. It has reached the peak and the pith.”

root-pli-ms: “Na kho, nigrodha, ettāvatā tapojigucchā aggappattā ca hoti sārappattā ca;
translation-en-sujato: “No, Nigrodha, at this point the mortification in disgust of sin has not yet reached the peak and the pith.

root-pli-ms: api ca kho tacappattā hotī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Rather, it has only reached the bark.”

root-pli-ms: 2.4. Parisuddhaphegguppattakathā
translation-en-sujato: 2.4. On Reaching the Softwood

root-pli-ms: “Kittāvatā pana, bhante, tapojigucchā aggappattā ca hoti sārappattā ca?
translation-en-sujato: “But at what point, sir, does the mortification in disgust of sin reach the peak and the pith?

root-pli-ms: Sādhu me, bhante, bhagavā tapojigucchāya aggaññeva pāpetu, sāraññeva pāpetū”ti.

translation-en-sujato: “Nigrodha, take a mortifier who is restrained in the fourfold restraint.

So vivittaṁ senāsanaṁ bhajati …pe…
so ime pañca nīvaraṇe pahāya cetaso upakkilese paññāya dubbalīkaraṇe
translation-en-sujato: They give up these five hindrances, corruptions of the heart that weaken wisdom.

root-pli-ms: mettāsahagatena cetasā …pe…
translation-en-sujato: Then they meditate spreading a heart full of love …

root-pli-ms: karuṇāsahagatena cetasā …pe…
translation-en-sujato: compassion …

root-pli-ms: muditāsahagatena cetasā …pe…
translation-en-sujato: rejoicing …

root-pli-ms: upekkhāsahagatena cetasā vipulena mahaggatena appamāṇena averena abyāpajjena pharitvā viharati.
translation-en-sujato: equanimity.

root-pli-ms: So anekavihitaṁ pubbenivāsaṁ anussarati seyyathidaṁ—ekampi jātiṁ dvepi jātiyo tissopi jātiyo catassopi jātiyo pañcapi jātiyo dasapi jātiyo vīsampi jātiyo tiṁsampi jātiyo cattālīsampi jātiyo paññāsampi jātiyo jātisatampi jātisahassampi jātisatasahassampi anekepi saṁvaṭṭakappe anekepi vivaṭṭakappe anekepi saṁvaṭṭavivaṭṭakappe: ‘amutrāsiṁ evaṁnāmo evaṅgotto evaṁvaṇṇo evamāhāro evaṁsukhadukkhappaṭisaṁvedī evamāyupariyanto, so tato cuto amutra udapādiṁ, tatrāpāsiṁ evaṁnāmo evaṅgotto evaṁvaṇṇo evamāhāro evaṁsukhadukkhappaṭisaṁvedī evamāyupariyanto, so tato cuto idhūpapanno’ti. Iti sākāraṁ sauddesaṁ anekavihitaṁ pubbenivāsaṁ anussarati.
translation-en-sujato: They recollect many kinds of past lives, that is, one, two, three, four, five, ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty, a hundred, a thousand, a hundred thousand rebirths; many eons of the world contracting, many eons of the world expanding, many eons of the world contracting and expanding. They remember: ‘There, I was named this, my clan was that, I looked like this, and that was my food. This was how I felt pleasure and pain, and that was how my life ended. When I passed away from that place I was reborn somewhere else. There, too, I was named this, my clan was that, I looked like this, and that was my food. This was how I felt pleasure and pain, and that was how my life ended. When I passed away from that place I was reborn here.’ And so they recollect their many kinds of past lives, with features and details.

root-pli-ms: Taṁ kiṁ maññasi, nigrodha,
translation-en-sujato: What do you think, Nigrodha?

root-pli-ms: yadi evaṁ sante tapojigucchā parisuddhā vā hoti aparisuddhā vā”ti?
translation-en-sujato: If this is so, is the mortification in disgust of sin purified or not?”

root-pli-ms: “Addhā kho, bhante, evaṁ sante tapojigucchā parisuddhā hoti, no aparisuddhā, aggappattā ca sārappattā cā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Clearly, sir, it is purified. It has reached the peak and the pith.”

root-pli-ms: “Na kho, nigrodha, ettāvatā tapojigucchā aggappattā ca hoti sārappattā ca;
translation-en-sujato: “No, Nigrodha, at this point the mortification in disgust of sin has not yet reached the peak and the pith.

root-pli-ms: api ca kho phegguppattā hotī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Rather, it has only reached the softwood.”

root-pli-ms: 3. Parisuddhaaggappattasārappattakathā
translation-en-sujato: 3. On Reaching the Heartwood

root-pli-ms: “Kittāvatā pana, bhante, tapojigucchā aggappattā ca hoti sārappattā ca?
translation-en-sujato: “But at what point, sir, does the mortification in disgust of sin reach the peak and the pith?

root-pli-ms: Sādhu me, bhante, bhagavā tapojigucchāya aggaññeva pāpetu, sāraññeva pāpetū”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Please help me reach the peak and the pith!”

translation-en-sujato: “Nigrodha, take a mortifier who is restrained in the fourfold restraint.

so ime pañca nīvaraṇe pahāya cetaso upakkilese paññāya dubbalīkaraṇe

root-pli-ms: So anekavihitaṁ pubbenivāsaṁ anussarati. Seyyathidaṁ—ekampi jātiṁ dvepi jātiyo tissopi jātiyo catassopi jātiyo pañcapi jātiyo …pe… iti sākāraṁ sauddesaṁ anekavihitaṁ pubbenivāsaṁ anussarati.
translation-en-sujato: They recollect many kinds of past lives, with features and details.

root-pli-ms: So dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena satte passati cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe sugate duggate, yathākammūpage satte pajānāti: ‘ime vata bhonto sattā kāyaduccaritena samannāgatā vacīduccaritena samannāgatā manoduccaritena samannāgatā ariyānaṁ upavādakā micchādiṭṭhikā micchādiṭṭhikammasamādānā. Te kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā apāyaṁ duggatiṁ vinipātaṁ nirayaṁ upapannā. Ime vā pana bhonto sattā kāyasucaritena samannāgatā vacīsucaritena samannāgatā manosucaritena samannāgatā ariyānaṁ anupavādakā sammādiṭṭhikā sammādiṭṭhikammasamādānā. Te kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapannā’ti. Iti dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena satte passati cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe sugate duggate, yathākammūpage satte pajānāti.
translation-en-sujato: With clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman, they see sentient beings passing away and being reborn—inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, in a good place or a bad place. They understand how sentient beings are reborn according to their deeds: ‘These dear beings did bad things by way of body, speech, and mind. They spoke ill of the noble ones; they had wrong view; and they chose to act out of that wrong view. When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell. These dear beings, however, did good things by way of body, speech, and mind. They never spoke ill of the noble ones; they had right view; and they chose to act out of that right view. When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.’ And so, with clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman, they see sentient beings passing away and being reborn—inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, in a good place or a bad place. They understand how sentient beings are reborn according to their deeds.

translation-en-sujato: If this is so, is the mortification in disgust of sin purified or not?”

translation-en-sujato: “Clearly, sir, it is purified. It has reached the peak and the pith.”

root-pli-ms: “Ettāvatā kho, nigrodha, tapojigucchā aggappattā ca hoti sārappattā ca.
translation-en-sujato: “Nigrodha, at this point the mortification in disgust of sin has reached the peak and the pith.
