translation-en-sujato: And what does he obtain as Buddha?

root-pli-ms: Suciparivāro hoti, sucissa honti parivārā, bhikkhū bhikkhuniyo upāsakā upāsikāyo devā manussā asurā nāgā gandhabbā.
translation-en-sujato: His retinue is pure. This includes monks, nuns, laymen, laywomen, gods, humans, demons, dragons, and fairies.

root-pli-ms: Buddho samāno idaṁ labhati”.
translation-en-sujato: That’s what he obtains as Buddha.”

root-pli-ms: Etamatthaṁ bhagavā avoca.
translation-en-sujato: That is what the Buddha said.

root-pli-ms: Tatthetaṁ vuccati:
translation-en-sujato: On this it is said:

root-pli-ms: “Micchājīvañca avassaji samena vuttiṁ,
translation-en-sujato: “He abandoned wrong livelihood, and created

root-pli-ms: Sucinā so janayittha dhammikena;
translation-en-sujato: a way of life that’s fair, pure, and just.

root-pli-ms: Ahitamapi ca apanudi,
translation-en-sujato: He eliminated what was useless,

root-pli-ms: Hitamapi ca bahujanasukhañca acari.
translation-en-sujato: and lived for the welfare and happiness of the people.

root-pli-ms: Sagge vedayati naro sukhapphalāni,
translation-en-sujato: Having done what’s praised by the clever, the wise, and the good,

root-pli-ms: Karitvā nipuṇebhi vidūhi sabbhi;
translation-en-sujato: that man experienced the fruit in heaven.

root-pli-ms: Vaṇṇitāni tidivapuravarasamo,
translation-en-sujato: Equal to the best in the heaven of Three and Thirty,

root-pli-ms: Abhiramati ratikhiḍḍāsamaṅgī.
translation-en-sujato: he enjoyed himself with pleasure and play.

root-pli-ms: Laddhāna mānusakaṁ bhavaṁ tato,
translation-en-sujato: From there he passed back to a human life.

root-pli-ms: Cavitvāna sukataphalavipākaṁ;
translation-en-sujato: With the remaining ripening of the fruit of good deeds,

root-pli-ms: Sesakena paṭilabhati lapanajaṁ,
translation-en-sujato: he obtained teeth that are even,

root-pli-ms: Samamapi sucisusukkaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: gleaming, bright, and white.
variant-pli-ms: Samamapi sucisusukkaṁ → suci ca suvisuddhasusukkaṁ. (sya-all); suvisuddhaṁ suvisukkaṁ. (pts1ed)

root-pli-ms: Taṁ veyyañjanikā samāgatā bahavo,
translation-en-sujato: Many soothsayers regarded as wise men

root-pli-ms: Byākaṁsu nipuṇasammatā manujā;
translation-en-sujato: gathered and predicted of him:

root-pli-ms: Sucijanaparivāragaṇo bhavati,
translation-en-sujato: ‘With twice-born teeth so even, so white, so clean and bright

root-pli-ms: Dijasamasukkasucisobhanadanto.
translation-en-sujato: his retinue will be so pure.

root-pli-ms: Rañño hoti bahujano,
translation-en-sujato: As king, his people will also be pure,

root-pli-ms: Suciparivāro mahatiṁ mahiṁ anusāsato;
translation-en-sujato: when he rules having conquered this earth so broad.

root-pli-ms: Pasayha na ca janapadatudanaṁ,
translation-en-sujato: They won’t harm the country,

root-pli-ms: Hitamapi ca bahujanasukhañca caranti.
translation-en-sujato: but will live for the welfare and happiness of the people.

root-pli-ms: Atha ce pabbajati bhavati vipāpo,
translation-en-sujato: But if he goes forth he’ll be an ascetic free of ill,

root-pli-ms: Samaṇo samitarajo vivaṭṭacchado;
translation-en-sujato: his passions quelled, the veil drawn back.

root-pli-ms: Vigatadarathakilamatho,
translation-en-sujato: Rid of stress and weariness,

root-pli-ms: Imamapi ca paramapi ca passati lokaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: he sees this world and the next.
variant-pli-ms: Imamapi ca paramapi ca → paraṁpi paramaṁpi ca (sya-all); imampi ca parampi ca (pts1ed)

root-pli-ms: Tassovādakarā bahugihī ca pabbajitā ca,
translation-en-sujato: Those who do his bidding, both lay and renunciate,

root-pli-ms: Asuciṁ garahitaṁ dhunanti pāpaṁ;
translation-en-sujato: shake off wickedness, impure and blameworthy.

root-pli-ms: Sa hi sucibhi parivuto bhavati,
translation-en-sujato: He’s surrounded by pure people, who dispel

root-pli-ms: Malakhilakalikilese panudehī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: stains, callousness, sin, and corruptions.’”

root-pli-ms: Idamavoca bhagavā.
translation-en-sujato: That is what the Buddha said.

root-pli-ms: Attamanā te bhikkhū bhagavato bhāsitaṁ abhinandunti.
translation-en-sujato: Satisfied, the mendicants were happy with what the Buddha said.

root-pli-ms: Lakkhaṇasuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ sattamaṁ.
Dīgha Nikāya 31
translation-en-sujato: Long Discourses 31

root-pli-ms: Siṅgālasutta
translation-en-sujato: Advice to Sigālaka

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
translation-en-sujato: So I have heard.

root-pli-ms: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā rājagahe viharati veḷuvane kalandakanivāpe.
translation-en-sujato: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.

root-pli-ms: Tena kho pana samayena siṅgālako gahapatiputto kālasseva uṭṭhāya rājagahā nikkhamitvā allavattho allakeso pañjaliko puthudisā namassati—
translation-en-sujato: Now at that time the householder’s son Sigālaka rose early and left Rājagaha. With his clothes and hair all wet, he raised his joined palms to revere the quarters—
variant-pli-ms: siṅgālako → sigālako (bj) | puthudisā → puthuddisā (bj, sya-all, pts1ed)

root-pli-ms: puratthimaṁ disaṁ dakkhiṇaṁ disaṁ pacchimaṁ disaṁ uttaraṁ disaṁ heṭṭhimaṁ disaṁ uparimaṁ disaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: east, south, west, north, below, and above.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya rājagahaṁ piṇḍāya pāvisi.
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, entered Rājagaha for alms.
reference: ms8D_576, msdiv243, pts-cs2, pts-vp-pli3.181, sc2, sya11.195

root-pli-ms: Addasā kho bhagavā siṅgālakaṁ gahapatiputtaṁ kālasseva vuṭṭhāya rājagahā nikkhamitvā allavatthaṁ allakesaṁ pañjalikaṁ puthudisā namassantaṁ—
translation-en-sujato: He saw Sigālaka revering the quarters

root-pli-ms: puratthimaṁ disaṁ dakkhiṇaṁ disaṁ pacchimaṁ disaṁ uttaraṁ disaṁ heṭṭhimaṁ disaṁ uparimaṁ disaṁ.
Disvā siṅgālakaṁ gahapatiputtaṁ etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: and said to him,

root-pli-ms: “kiṁ nu kho tvaṁ, gahapatiputta, kālasseva vuṭṭhāya rājagahā nikkhamitvā allavattho allakeso pañjaliko puthudisā namassasi—
translation-en-sujato: “Householder’s son, why are you revering the quarters in this way?”

root-pli-ms: puratthimaṁ disaṁ dakkhiṇaṁ disaṁ pacchimaṁ disaṁ uttaraṁ disaṁ heṭṭhimaṁ disaṁ uparimaṁ disan”ti?
“Pitā maṁ, bhante, kālaṁ karonto evaṁ avaca:
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, on his deathbed my father said to me:

root-pli-ms: ‘disā, tāta, namasseyyāsī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘My dear, please revere the quarters.’

root-pli-ms: So kho ahaṁ, bhante, pituvacanaṁ sakkaronto garuṁ karonto mānento pūjento kālasseva uṭṭhāya rājagahā nikkhamitvā allavattho allakeso pañjaliko puthudisā namassāmi—
translation-en-sujato: Honoring, respecting, and venerating my father’s words, I rose early and left Rājagaha and, with my clothes and hair all wet, raised my joined palms to revere the quarters—

root-pli-ms: puratthimaṁ disaṁ dakkhiṇaṁ disaṁ pacchimaṁ disaṁ uttaraṁ disaṁ heṭṭhimaṁ disaṁ uparimaṁ disan”ti.
translation-en-sujato: east, south, west, north, below, and above.”

root-pli-ms: 1. Cha disā
translation-en-sujato: 1. The Six Quarters

root-pli-ms: “Na kho, gahapatiputta, ariyassa vinaye evaṁ cha disā namassitabbā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Householder’s son, that’s not how the six quarters should be revered in the training of the noble one.”

root-pli-ms: “Yathā kathaṁ pana, bhante, ariyassa vinaye cha disā namassitabbā?
translation-en-sujato: “But sir, how should the six quarters be revered in the training of the noble one?

root-pli-ms: Sādhu me, bhante, bhagavā tathā dhammaṁ desetu, yathā ariyassa vinaye cha disā namassitabbā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Sir, please teach me this.”

root-pli-ms: “Tena hi, gahapatiputta, suṇohi sādhukaṁ manasikarohi bhāsissāmī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Well then, householder’s son, listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho siṅgālako gahapatiputto bhagavato paccassosi.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” replied Sigālaka.

root-pli-ms: Bhagavā etadavoca:
translation-en-sujato: The Buddha said this:

root-pli-ms: “Yato kho, gahapatiputta, ariyasāvakassa cattāro kammakilesā pahīnā honti, catūhi ca ṭhānehi pāpakammaṁ na karoti, cha ca bhogānaṁ apāyamukhāni na sevati, so evaṁ cuddasa pāpakāpagato chaddisāpaṭicchādī
translation-en-sujato: “Householder’s son, a noble disciple gives up four corrupt deeds, doesn’t do bad deeds on four grounds, and avoids six drains on wealth. When they’ve left these fourteen bad things behind they have the six quarters covered.

root-pli-ms: ubholokavijayāya paṭipanno hoti. Tassa ayañceva loko āraddho hoti paro ca loko.
translation-en-sujato: They’re practicing to win in both worlds, and they succeed in this world and the next.

root-pli-ms: So kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjati.
translation-en-sujato: When their body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.

root-pli-ms: 2. Cattāro kammakilesā
translation-en-sujato: 2. Four Corrupt Deeds

root-pli-ms: Katamassa cattāro kammakilesā pahīnā honti?
translation-en-sujato: What four corrupt deeds have they given up?

root-pli-ms: Pāṇātipāto kho, gahapatiputta, kammakileso, adinnādānaṁ kammakileso, kāmesumicchācāro kammakileso, musāvādo kammakileso.
translation-en-sujato: Killing living creatures, stealing, sexual misconduct, and lying: these are corrupt deeds.

root-pli-ms: Imassa cattāro kammakilesā pahīnā hontī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: These are the four corrupt deeds they’ve given up.”

root-pli-ms: Idamavoca bhagavā.
translation-en-sujato: That is what the Buddha said.

root-pli-ms: Idaṁ vatvāna sugato athāparaṁ etadavoca satthā:
translation-en-sujato: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:

root-pli-ms: “Pāṇātipāto adinnādānaṁ,
translation-en-sujato: “Killing, stealing,

root-pli-ms: Musāvādo ca vuccati;
translation-en-sujato: telling lies,

root-pli-ms: Paradāragamanañceva,
translation-en-sujato: and committing adultery:

root-pli-ms: Nappasaṁsanti paṇḍitā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: astute people don’t praise these things.”

root-pli-ms: 3. Catuṭhānaṁ
translation-en-sujato: 3. Four Grounds

root-pli-ms: “Katamehi catūhi ṭhānehi pāpakammaṁ na karoti?
translation-en-sujato: “On what four grounds do they not do bad deeds?
reference: cck11.190, ms8D_582, msdiv246, pts-cs5, sc8, sya11.196

root-pli-ms: Chandāgatiṁ gacchanto pāpakammaṁ karoti, dosāgatiṁ gacchanto pāpakammaṁ karoti, mohāgatiṁ gacchanto pāpakammaṁ karoti, bhayāgatiṁ gacchanto pāpakammaṁ karoti.
translation-en-sujato: One does bad deeds prejudiced by favoritism, hostility, stupidity, and cowardice.

root-pli-ms: Yato kho, gahapatiputta, ariyasāvako neva chandāgatiṁ gacchati, na dosāgatiṁ gacchati, na mohāgatiṁ gacchati, na bhayāgatiṁ gacchati;
translation-en-sujato: When a noble disciple is not prejudiced by favoritism, hostility, stupidity, and cowardice,

root-pli-ms: imehi catūhi ṭhānehi pāpakammaṁ na karotī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: they don’t do bad deeds on these four grounds.”

root-pli-ms: Idamavoca bhagavā.
translation-en-sujato: That is what the Buddha said.

root-pli-ms: Idaṁ vatvāna sugato athāparaṁ etadavoca satthā:
translation-en-sujato: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:

root-pli-ms: “Chandā dosā bhayā mohā,
translation-en-sujato: “If you act against the teaching

root-pli-ms: yo dhammaṁ ativattati;
translation-en-sujato: out of favoritism, hostility, cowardice, or stupidity,

root-pli-ms: Nihīyati yaso tassa,
translation-en-sujato: your fame shrinks,

root-pli-ms: kāḷapakkheva candimā.
translation-en-sujato: like the moon in the waning fortnight.

root-pli-ms: Chandā dosā bhayā mohā,
translation-en-sujato: If you don’t act against the teaching

root-pli-ms: yo dhammaṁ nātivattati;
translation-en-sujato: out of favoritism, hostility, cowardice, and stupidity,

root-pli-ms: Āpūrati yaso tassa,
translation-en-sujato: your fame swells,

root-pli-ms: sukkapakkheva candimā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: like the moon in the waxing fortnight.”

root-pli-ms: 4. Cha apāyamukhāni
translation-en-sujato: 4. Six Drains on Wealth

root-pli-ms: “Katamāni cha bhogānaṁ apāyamukhāni na sevati?
translation-en-sujato: “What six drains on wealth do they avoid?
reference: csp1ed8.148, csp2ed8.148, dr11.202, ms8D_585, msdiv247, pts-cs7, sc11

root-pli-ms: Surāmerayamajjappamādaṭṭhānānuyogo kho, gahapatiputta, bhogānaṁ apāyamukhaṁ, vikālavisikhācariyānuyogo bhogānaṁ apāyamukhaṁ, samajjābhicaraṇaṁ bhogānaṁ apāyamukhaṁ, jūtappamādaṭṭhānānuyogo bhogānaṁ apāyamukhaṁ, pāpamittānuyogo bhogānaṁ apāyamukhaṁ, ālasyānuyogo bhogānaṁ apāyamukhaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Habitually engaging in the following things is a drain on wealth: drinking alcohol; roaming the streets at night; frequenting festivals; gambling; bad friends; laziness.

root-pli-ms: 5. Surāmerayassa cha ādīnavā
translation-en-sujato: 5. Six Drawbacks of Drinking

root-pli-ms: Cha khome, gahapatiputta, ādīnavā surāmerayamajjappamādaṭṭhānānuyoge.
translation-en-sujato: There are these six drawbacks of habitually drinking alcohol.

root-pli-ms: Sandiṭṭhikā dhanajāni, kalahappavaḍḍhanī, rogānaṁ āyatanaṁ, akittisañjananī, kopīnanidaṁsanī, paññāya dubbalikaraṇītveva chaṭṭhaṁ padaṁ bhavati.
translation-en-sujato: Immediate loss of wealth, promotion of quarrels, susceptibility to illness, disrepute, indecent exposure; and weakened wisdom is the sixth thing.

root-pli-ms: Ime kho, gahapatiputta, cha ādīnavā surāmerayamajjappamādaṭṭhānānuyoge.
translation-en-sujato: These are the six drawbacks of habitually drinking alcohol.

root-pli-ms: 6. Vikālacariyāya cha ādīnavā
translation-en-sujato: 6. Six Drawbacks of Roaming the Streets at Night

root-pli-ms: Cha khome, gahapatiputta, ādīnavā vikālavisikhācariyānuyoge.
translation-en-sujato: There are these six drawbacks of roaming the streets at night.
reference: cck11.191, ms8D_587, msdiv249, pts-cs9, sc13, sya11.197

root-pli-ms: Attāpissa agutto arakkhito hoti, puttadāropissa agutto arakkhito hoti, sāpateyyampissa aguttaṁ arakkhitaṁ hoti, saṅkiyo ca hoti pāpakesu ṭhānesu, abhūtavacanañca tasmiṁ rūhati, bahūnañca dukkhadhammānaṁ purakkhato hoti.
translation-en-sujato: Yourself, your partners and children, and your property are all left unguarded. You’re suspected of bad deeds. Untrue rumors spread about you. You’re at the forefront of many things that entail suffering.
variant-pli-ms: ca hoti pāpakesu ṭhānesu → tesu tesu ṭhānesu (sya-all)

root-pli-ms: Ime kho, gahapatiputta, cha ādīnavā vikālavisikhācariyānuyoge.
translation-en-sujato: These are the six drawbacks of roaming the streets at night.

root-pli-ms: 7. Samajjābhicaraṇassa cha ādīnavā
translation-en-sujato: 7. Six Drawbacks of Festivals

root-pli-ms: Cha khome, gahapatiputta, ādīnavā samajjābhicaraṇe.
translation-en-sujato: There are these six drawbacks of frequenting festivals.

root-pli-ms: Kva naccaṁ, kva gītaṁ, kva vāditaṁ, kva akkhānaṁ, kva pāṇissaraṁ, kva kumbhathunanti.
translation-en-sujato: You’re always thinking: ‘Where’s the dancing? Where’s the singing? Where’s the music? Where are the stories? Where’s the applause? Where are the kettle-drums?’

root-pli-ms: Ime kho, gahapatiputta, cha ādīnavā samajjābhicaraṇe.
translation-en-sujato: These are the six drawbacks of frequenting festivals.

root-pli-ms: 8. Jūtappamādassa cha ādīnavā
translation-en-sujato: 8. Six Drawbacks of Gambling

root-pli-ms: Cha khome, gahapatiputta, ādīnavā jūtappamādaṭṭhānānuyoge.
translation-en-sujato: There are these six drawbacks of habitually gambling.
reference: bj9.294, csp1ed8.149, csp2ed8.149, ms8D_589, msdiv251, ndp8.142, pts-cs11, sc15, vri3.139

root-pli-ms: Jayaṁ veraṁ pasavati, jino vittamanusocati, sandiṭṭhikā dhanajāni, sabhāgatassa vacanaṁ na rūhati, mittāmaccānaṁ paribhūto hoti, āvāhavivāhakānaṁ apatthito hoti:
translation-en-sujato: Victory breeds enmity. The loser mourns their money. There is immediate loss of wealth. A gambler’s word carries no weight in public assembly. Friends and colleagues treat them with contempt. And no-one wants to marry a gambler, for they think:

root-pli-ms: ‘akkhadhutto ayaṁ purisapuggalo nālaṁ dārabharaṇāyā’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘This individual is a gambler—they’re not able to support a partner.’

root-pli-ms: Ime kho, gahapatiputta, cha ādīnavā jūtappamādaṭṭhānānuyoge.
translation-en-sujato: These are the six drawbacks of habitually gambling.

root-pli-ms: 9. Pāpamittatāya cha ādīnavā
translation-en-sujato: 9. Six Drawbacks of Bad Friends

root-pli-ms: Cha khome, gahapatiputta, ādīnavā pāpamittānuyoge.
translation-en-sujato: There are these six drawbacks of bad friends.

root-pli-ms: Ye dhuttā, ye soṇḍā, ye pipāsā, ye nekatikā, ye vañcanikā, ye sāhasikā. Tyāssa mittā honti te sahāyā.
translation-en-sujato: You become friends and companions with those who are scoundrels, drunkards, addicts, frauds, swindlers, and thugs.

root-pli-ms: Ime kho, gahapatiputta, cha ādīnavā pāpamittānuyoge.
translation-en-sujato: These are the six drawbacks of bad friends.

root-pli-ms: 10. Ālasyassa cha ādīnavā
translation-en-sujato: 10. Six Drawbacks of Laziness

root-pli-ms: Cha khome, gahapatiputta, ādīnavā ālasyānuyoge.
translation-en-sujato: There are these six drawbacks of habitual laziness.
reference: dr11.204, ms8D_591, msdiv253, pts-cs13, sc17, sya11.198

root-pli-ms: Atisītanti kammaṁ na karoti, atiuṇhanti kammaṁ na karoti, atisāyanti kammaṁ na karoti, atipātoti kammaṁ na karoti, atichātosmīti kammaṁ na karoti, atidhātosmīti kammaṁ na karoti.
translation-en-sujato: You don’t get your work done because you think: ‘It’s too cold! It’s too hot. It’s too late! It’s too early! I’m too hungry! I’m too full!’

root-pli-ms: Tassa evaṁ kiccāpadesabahulassa viharato anuppannā ceva bhogā nuppajjanti, uppannā ca bhogā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti.
translation-en-sujato: By dwelling on so many excuses for not working, you don’t make any more money, and the money you already have runs out.

root-pli-ms: Ime kho, gahapatiputta, cha ādīnavā ālasyānuyoge”ti.
translation-en-sujato: These are the six drawbacks of habitual laziness.”

root-pli-ms: Idamavoca bhagavā.
translation-en-sujato: That is what the Buddha said.

root-pli-ms: Idaṁ vatvāna sugato athāparaṁ etadavoca satthā:
translation-en-sujato: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:

root-pli-ms: “Hoti pānasakhā nāma,
translation-en-sujato: “Some are just drinking buddies,

root-pli-ms: hoti sammiyasammiyo;
translation-en-sujato: some call you their dear, dear friend,

root-pli-ms: Yo ca atthesu jātesu,
translation-en-sujato: but a true friend is one

root-pli-ms: sahāyo hoti so sakhā.
translation-en-sujato: who stands by you in need.

root-pli-ms: Ussūraseyyā paradārasevanā,
translation-en-sujato: Sleeping late, adultery,

root-pli-ms: Verappasavo ca anatthatā ca;
translation-en-sujato: making enemies, harmfulness,

root-pli-ms: Pāpā ca mittā sukadariyatā ca,
translation-en-sujato: bad friends, and avarice:

root-pli-ms: Ete cha ṭhānā purisaṁ dhaṁsayanti.
translation-en-sujato: these six grounds ruin a person.

root-pli-ms: Pāpamitto pāpasakho,
translation-en-sujato: With bad friends, bad companions,

root-pli-ms: pāpaācāragocaro;
translation-en-sujato: bad behavior and alms-resort,

root-pli-ms: Asmā lokā paramhā ca,
translation-en-sujato: a man falls to ruin

root-pli-ms: ubhayā dhaṁsate naro.
translation-en-sujato: in both this world and the next.

root-pli-ms: Akkhitthiyo vāruṇī naccagītaṁ,
translation-en-sujato: Dice, women, drink, song and dance;

root-pli-ms: Divā soppaṁ pāricariyā akāle;
translation-en-sujato: sleeping by day and roaming at night;

root-pli-ms: Pāpā ca mittā sukadariyatā ca,
translation-en-sujato: bad friends, and avarice:

root-pli-ms: Ete cha ṭhānā purisaṁ dhaṁsayanti.
translation-en-sujato: these six grounds ruin a person.

root-pli-ms: Akkhehi dibbanti suraṁ pivanti,
translation-en-sujato: They play dice and drink liquor,

root-pli-ms: Yantitthiyo pāṇasamā paresaṁ;
translation-en-sujato: and consort with women loved by others.

root-pli-ms: Nihīnasevī na ca vuddhasevī,
translation-en-sujato: Associating with the worse, not the better,

root-pli-ms: Nihīyate kāḷapakkheva cando.
translation-en-sujato: they diminish like the waning moon.

root-pli-ms: Yo vāruṇī addhano akiñcano,
translation-en-sujato: A drunkard, broke, and destitute,

root-pli-ms: Pipāso pivaṁ papāgato;
translation-en-sujato: thirsty, drinking in the bar,
variant-pli-ms: Pipāso pivaṁ papāgato → pipāsosi atthapāgato (sya-all); pipāso pibam papāgato (pts1ed); pipāsopi samappapāgato (mr)

root-pli-ms: Udakamiva iṇaṁ vigāhati,
translation-en-sujato: drowning in debt,

root-pli-ms: Akulaṁ kāhiti khippamattano.
translation-en-sujato: will quickly lose their way.
comment-en-sujato: kāhiti is 3 sg fut for karoti.

root-pli-ms: Na divā soppasīlena,
translation-en-sujato: When you’re in the habit of sleeping late,

root-pli-ms: rattimuṭṭhānadessinā;
translation-en-sujato: seeing night as time to rise,

root-pli-ms: Niccaṁ mattena soṇḍena,
translation-en-sujato: and always getting drunk,

root-pli-ms: sakkā āvasituṁ gharaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: you can’t keep up the household life.

root-pli-ms: Atisītaṁ atiuṇhaṁ,
translation-en-sujato: ‘Too cold, too hot,

root-pli-ms: atisāyamidaṁ ahu;
translation-en-sujato: too late,’ they say.

root-pli-ms: Iti vissaṭṭhakammante,
translation-en-sujato: When the young neglect their work like this,

root-pli-ms: atthā accenti māṇave.
translation-en-sujato: riches pass them by.
comment-en-sujato: Tika: Atthāti dhanāni

root-pli-ms: Yodha sītañca uṇhañca,
translation-en-sujato: But one who considers hot and cold

root-pli-ms: tiṇā bhiyyo na maññati;
translation-en-sujato: as nothing more than blades of grass—

root-pli-ms: Karaṁ purisakiccāni,
translation-en-sujato: he does his manly duty,

root-pli-ms: so sukhaṁ na vihāyatī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: and happiness never fails.”

root-pli-ms: 11. Mittapatirūpaka
translation-en-sujato: 11. Fake Friends

root-pli-ms: “Cattārome, gahapatiputta, amittā mittapatirūpakā veditabbā.
translation-en-sujato: “Householder’s son, you should recognize these four enemies disguised as friends:
reference: bj9.298, cck11.193, ms8D_602, msdiv254, pts-cs15, sc28

root-pli-ms: Aññadatthuharo amitto mittapatirūpako veditabbo, vacīparamo amitto mittapatirūpako veditabbo, anuppiyabhāṇī amitto mittapatirūpako veditabbo, apāyasahāyo amitto mittapatirūpako veditabbo.
translation-en-sujato: the taker, the talker, the flatterer, the spender.

root-pli-ms: Catūhi kho, gahapatiputta, ṭhānehi aññadatthuharo amitto mittapatirūpako veditabbo.
translation-en-sujato: You can recognize a fake friend who’s all take on four grounds.
reference: dr11.206, ms8D_603, msdiv255, pts-cs16, pts-vp-pli3.186, sc29

root-pli-ms: Aññadatthuharo hoti,
translation-en-sujato: Your possessions end up theirs.

root-pli-ms: appena bahumicchati;
translation-en-sujato: Giving little, they expect a lot.

root-pli-ms: Bhayassa kiccaṁ karoti,
translation-en-sujato: They do their duty out of fear.

root-pli-ms: sevati atthakāraṇā.
translation-en-sujato: They associate for their own advantage.

root-pli-ms: Imehi kho, gahapatiputta, catūhi ṭhānehi aññadatthuharo amitto mittapatirūpako veditabbo.
translation-en-sujato: You can recognize a fake friend who’s all take on these four grounds.

root-pli-ms: Catūhi kho, gahapatiputta, ṭhānehi vacīparamo amitto mittapatirūpako veditabbo.
translation-en-sujato: You can recognize a fake friend who’s all talk on four grounds.

root-pli-ms: Atītena paṭisantharati, anāgatena paṭisantharati, niratthakena saṅgaṇhāti, paccuppannesu kiccesu byasanaṁ dasseti.
translation-en-sujato: They’re hospitable in the past. They’re hospitable in the future. They’re full of meaningless pleasantries. When something needs doing in the present they point to their own misfortune.

root-pli-ms: Imehi kho, gahapatiputta, catūhi ṭhānehi vacīparamo amitto mittapatirūpako veditabbo.
translation-en-sujato: You can recognize a fake friend who’s all talk on these four grounds.

root-pli-ms: Catūhi kho, gahapatiputta, ṭhānehi anuppiyabhāṇī amitto mittapatirūpako veditabbo.
translation-en-sujato: You can recognize a fake friend who’s a flatterer on four grounds.

root-pli-ms: Pāpakampissa anujānāti, kalyāṇampissa anujānāti, sammukhāssa vaṇṇaṁ bhāsati, parammukhāssa avaṇṇaṁ bhāsati.
translation-en-sujato: They support you equally in doing bad and doing good. They praise you to your face, and put you down behind your back.

root-pli-ms: Imehi kho, gahapatiputta, catūhi ṭhānehi anuppiyabhāṇī amitto mittapatirūpako veditabbo.
translation-en-sujato: You can recognize a fake friend who’s a flatterer on these four grounds.

root-pli-ms: Catūhi kho, gahapatiputta, ṭhānehi apāyasahāyo amitto mittapatirūpako veditabbo.
translation-en-sujato: You can recognize a fake friend who’s a spender on four grounds.
reference: csp1ed8.152, csp2ed8.152, ms8D_608, msdiv258, pts-cs19, sc34, vri3.142

root-pli-ms: Surāmerayamajjappamādaṭṭhānānuyoge sahāyo hoti, vikālavisikhācariyānuyoge sahāyo hoti, samajjābhicaraṇe sahāyo hoti, jūtappamādaṭṭhānānuyoge sahāyo hoti.
translation-en-sujato: They accompany you when drinking, roaming the streets at night, frequenting festivals, and gambling.

root-pli-ms: Imehi kho, gahapatiputta, catūhi ṭhānehi apāyasahāyo amitto mittapatirūpako veditabbo”ti.
translation-en-sujato: You can recognize a fake friend who’s a spender on these four grounds.”

root-pli-ms: Idamavoca bhagavā.
translation-en-sujato: That is what the Buddha said.

root-pli-ms: Idaṁ vatvāna sugato athāparaṁ etadavoca satthā:
translation-en-sujato: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:

root-pli-ms: “Aññadatthuharo mitto,
translation-en-sujato: “One friend is all take,

root-pli-ms: yo ca mitto vacīparo;
translation-en-sujato: another all talk;

root-pli-ms: Anuppiyañca yo āha,
translation-en-sujato: one’s just a flatterer,

root-pli-ms: apāyesu ca yo sakhā.
translation-en-sujato: and one’s a friend who spends.

root-pli-ms: Ete amitte cattāro,
translation-en-sujato: An astute person understands

root-pli-ms: iti viññāya paṇḍito;
translation-en-sujato: these four enemies for what they are

root-pli-ms: Ārakā parivajjeyya,
translation-en-sujato: and keeps them at a distance,

root-pli-ms: maggaṁ paṭibhayaṁ yathā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: as they’d shun a risky road.”

root-pli-ms: 12. Suhadamitta
translation-en-sujato: 12. Good-Hearted Friends

root-pli-ms: “Cattārome, gahapatiputta, mittā suhadā veditabbā.
translation-en-sujato: “Householder’s son, you should recognize these four good-hearted friends:

root-pli-ms: Upakāro mitto suhado veditabbo, samānasukhadukkho mitto suhado veditabbo, atthakkhāyī mitto suhado veditabbo, anukampako mitto suhado veditabbo.
translation-en-sujato: the helper, the friend in good times and bad, the counselor, and the one who’s compassionate.

root-pli-ms: Catūhi kho, gahapatiputta, ṭhānehi upakāro mitto suhado veditabbo.
translation-en-sujato: You can recognize a good-hearted friend who’s a helper on four grounds.

root-pli-ms: Pamattaṁ rakkhati, pamattassa sāpateyyaṁ rakkhati, bhītassa saraṇaṁ hoti, uppannesu kiccakaraṇīyesu taddiguṇaṁ bhogaṁ anuppadeti.
translation-en-sujato: They guard you when you’re negligent. They guard your property when you’re negligent. They keep you safe in times of danger. When something needs doing, they supply you with twice the money you need.

root-pli-ms: Imehi kho, gahapatiputta, catūhi ṭhānehi upakāro mitto suhado veditabbo.
translation-en-sujato: You can recognize a good-hearted friend who’s a helper on these four grounds.

root-pli-ms: Catūhi kho, gahapatiputta, ṭhānehi samānasukhadukkho mitto suhado veditabbo.
translation-en-sujato: You can recognize a good-hearted friend who’s the same in good times and bad on four grounds.

root-pli-ms: Guyhamassa ācikkhati, guyhamassa parigūhati, āpadāsu na vijahati, jīvitaṁpissa atthāya pariccattaṁ hoti.
translation-en-sujato: They tell you secrets. They keep your secrets. They don’t abandon you in times of trouble. They’d even give their life for you.

root-pli-ms: Imehi kho, gahapatiputta, catūhi ṭhānehi samānasukhadukkho mitto suhado veditabbo.
translation-en-sujato: You can recognize a good-hearted friend who’s the same in good times and bad on these four grounds.

root-pli-ms: Catūhi kho, gahapatiputta, ṭhānehi atthakkhāyī mitto suhado veditabbo.
translation-en-sujato: You can recognize a good-hearted friend who’s a counselor on four grounds.
reference: cck11.195, csp1ed8.153, csp2ed8.153, ms8D_615, msdiv263, pts-cs24, sc41, sya11.202

root-pli-ms: Pāpā nivāreti, kalyāṇe niveseti, assutaṁ sāveti, saggassa maggaṁ ācikkhati.
translation-en-sujato: They keep you from doing bad. They support you in doing good. They teach you what you do not know. They explain the path to heaven.

root-pli-ms: Imehi kho, gahapatiputta, catūhi ṭhānehi atthakkhāyī mitto suhado veditabbo.
translation-en-sujato: You can recognize a good-hearted friend who’s a counselor on these four grounds.

root-pli-ms: Catūhi kho, gahapatiputta, ṭhānehi anukampako mitto suhado veditabbo.
translation-en-sujato: You can recognize a good-hearted friend who’s compassionate on four grounds.

root-pli-ms: Abhavenassa na nandati, bhavenassa nandati, avaṇṇaṁ bhaṇamānaṁ nivāreti, vaṇṇaṁ bhaṇamānaṁ pasaṁsati.
translation-en-sujato: They don’t delight in your misfortune. They delight in your good fortune. They keep others from criticizing you. They encourage praise of you.

root-pli-ms: Imehi kho, gahapatiputta, catūhi ṭhānehi anukampako mitto suhado veditabbo”ti.
translation-en-sujato: You can recognize a good-hearted friend who’s compassionate on these four grounds.”

root-pli-ms: Idamavoca bhagavā.
translation-en-sujato: That is what the Buddha said.

root-pli-ms: Idaṁ vatvāna sugato athāparaṁ etadavoca satthā:
translation-en-sujato: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:

root-pli-ms: “Upakāro ca yo mitto,
translation-en-sujato: “A friend who’s a helper,

root-pli-ms: sukhe dukkhe ca yo sakhā;
translation-en-sujato: one the same in both pleasure and pain,
variant-pli-ms: sukhe dukkhe → sukhadukkho (sya-all, mr) | ca yo sakhā → yo ca mitto sukhe dukhe (bj); yo ca mitto sukhe dukkhe (si, pts1ed)

root-pli-ms: Atthakkhāyī ca yo mitto,
translation-en-sujato: a friend of good counsel,

root-pli-ms: yo ca mittānukampako.
translation-en-sujato: and one of compassion;

root-pli-ms: Etepi mitte cattāro,
translation-en-sujato: an astute person understands

root-pli-ms: iti viññāya paṇḍito;
translation-en-sujato: these four friends for what they are

root-pli-ms: Sakkaccaṁ payirupāseyya,
translation-en-sujato: and carefully looks after them,

root-pli-ms: mātā puttaṁva orasaṁ;
translation-en-sujato: like a mother the child at her breast.

root-pli-ms: Paṇḍito sīlasampanno,
translation-en-sujato: The astute and virtuous

root-pli-ms: jalaṁ aggīva bhāsati.
translation-en-sujato: shine like a burning flame.

root-pli-ms: Bhoge saṁharamānassa,
translation-en-sujato: They pick up riches as bees

root-pli-ms: bhamarasseva irīyato;
translation-en-sujato: roaming round pick up pollen.
comment-en-sujato: Several translators have bees gathering honey, which must be a very different kind of bee! the point of the simile is that money just tends to stick to those of good conduct.

root-pli-ms: Bhogā sannicayaṁ yanti,
translation-en-sujato: And their riches proceed to grow,

root-pli-ms: vammikovupacīyati.
translation-en-sujato: like an ant-hill piling up.

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ bhoge samāhatvā,
translation-en-sujato: In gathering wealth like this,

root-pli-ms: alamatto kule gihī;
translation-en-sujato: a householder does enough for their family.

root-pli-ms: Catudhā vibhaje bhoge,
translation-en-sujato: And they’d hold on to friends

root-pli-ms: sa ve mittāni ganthati.
translation-en-sujato: by dividing their wealth in four.

root-pli-ms: Ekena bhoge bhuñjeyya,
translation-en-sujato: One portion is to enjoy.

root-pli-ms: dvīhi kammaṁ payojaye;
translation-en-sujato: Two parts invest in work.

root-pli-ms: Catutthañca nidhāpeyya,
translation-en-sujato: And the fourth should be kept

root-pli-ms: āpadāsu bhavissatī”ti.
translation-en-sujato: for times of trouble.”

root-pli-ms: 13. Chaddisāpaṭicchādanakaṇḍa
translation-en-sujato: 13. Covering the Six Quarters

root-pli-ms: “Kathañca, gahapatiputta, ariyasāvako chaddisāpaṭicchādī hoti?
translation-en-sujato: “And how, householder’s son, does a noble disciple cover the six quarters?
reference: cck11.196, csp1ed8.154, csp2ed8.154, ms8D_623, msdiv266, ndp8.146, pts-cs27, pts-vp-pli3.189, sc49, sya11.203

root-pli-ms: Cha imā, gahapatiputta, disā veditabbā.
translation-en-sujato: These six quarters should be recognized:

root-pli-ms: Puratthimā disā mātāpitaro veditabbā, dakkhiṇā disā ācariyā veditabbā, pacchimā disā puttadārā veditabbā, uttarā disā mittāmaccā veditabbā, heṭṭhimā disā dāsakammakarā veditabbā, uparimā disā samaṇabrāhmaṇā veditabbā.
translation-en-sujato: parents as the east, teachers as the south, partner and children as the west, friends and colleagues as the north, bondservants and workers as beneath, and ascetics and brahmins as above.

root-pli-ms: Pañcahi kho, gahapatiputta, ṭhānehi puttena puratthimā disā mātāpitaro paccupaṭṭhātabbā—
translation-en-sujato: A child should serve their parents as the eastern quarter in five ways, thinking:
reference: bj9.304, ms8D_624, msdiv267, pts-cs28, sc50, vri3.144

root-pli-ms: bhato ne bharissāmi, kiccaṁ nesaṁ karissāmi, kulavaṁsaṁ ṭhapessāmi, dāyajjaṁ paṭipajjāmi, atha vā pana petānaṁ kālaṅkatānaṁ dakkhiṇaṁ anuppadassāmīti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘I will support those who supported me. I’ll do my duty for them. I’ll maintain the family traditions. I’ll take care of the inheritance. When they have passed away, I’ll make an offering on their behalf.’

root-pli-ms: Imehi kho, gahapatiputta, pañcahi ṭhānehi puttena puratthimā disā mātāpitaro paccupaṭṭhitā pañcahi ṭhānehi puttaṁ anukampanti.
translation-en-sujato: Parents served by the children in these five ways show compassion to them in five ways.

root-pli-ms: Pāpā nivārenti, kalyāṇe nivesenti, sippaṁ sikkhāpenti, patirūpena dārena saṁyojenti, samaye dāyajjaṁ niyyādenti.
translation-en-sujato: They keep them from doing bad. They support them in doing good. They train them in a profession. They connect them with a suitable partner. They transfer the inheritance in due time.

root-pli-ms: Imehi kho, gahapatiputta, pañcahi ṭhānehi puttena puratthimā disā mātāpitaro paccupaṭṭhitā imehi pañcahi ṭhānehi puttaṁ anukampanti.
translation-en-sujato: Parents served by their children in these five ways show compassion to them in these five ways.

root-pli-ms: Evamassa esā puratthimā disā paṭicchannā hoti khemā appaṭibhayā.
translation-en-sujato: And that’s how the eastern quarter is covered, kept safe and free of peril.

root-pli-ms: Pañcahi kho, gahapatiputta, ṭhānehi antevāsinā dakkhiṇā disā ācariyā paccupaṭṭhātabbā—
translation-en-sujato: A student should serve their teacher as the southern quarter in five ways:
reference: cck11.197, dr11.210, ms8D_625, msdiv268, pts-cs29, pts-vp-pli3.190, sc51, sya11.204

root-pli-ms: uṭṭhānena upaṭṭhānena sussusāya pāricariyāya sakkaccaṁ sippapaṭiggahaṇena.
translation-en-sujato: by rising for them, by serving them, by listening well, by looking after them, and by carefully learning their profession.

root-pli-ms: Imehi kho, gahapatiputta, pañcahi ṭhānehi antevāsinā dakkhiṇā disā ācariyā paccupaṭṭhitā pañcahi ṭhānehi antevāsiṁ anukampanti—
translation-en-sujato: Teachers served by their students in these five ways show compassion to them in five ways.

root-pli-ms: suvinītaṁ vinenti, suggahitaṁ gāhāpenti, sabbasippassutaṁ samakkhāyino bhavanti, mittāmaccesu paṭiyādenti, disāsu parittāṇaṁ karonti.
translation-en-sujato: They make sure they’re well trained and well educated. They clearly explain all the knowledge of the profession. They introduce them to their friends and colleagues. They provide protection in every region.
comment-en-sujato: the last is a little obscure. I think it means that, when the student has completed their studies and goes off to travel, the teacher does what they can to ensure their protection in other regions.

root-pli-ms: Imehi kho, gahapatiputta, pañcahi ṭhānehi antevāsinā dakkhiṇā disā ācariyā paccupaṭṭhitā imehi pañcahi ṭhānehi antevāsiṁ anukampanti.
translation-en-sujato: Teachers served by their students in these five ways show compassion to them in these five ways.

root-pli-ms: Evamassa esā dakkhiṇā disā paṭicchannā hoti khemā appaṭibhayā.
translation-en-sujato: And that’s how the southern quarter is covered, kept safe and free of peril.

root-pli-ms: Pañcahi kho, gahapatiputta, ṭhānehi sāmikena pacchimā disā bhariyā paccupaṭṭhātabbā—
translation-en-sujato: A husband should serve his wife as the western quarter in five ways:
reference: bj9.306, csp1ed8.155, csp2ed8.155, ms8D_626, msdiv269, ndp8.147, pts-cs30, sc52

root-pli-ms: sammānanāya anavamānanāya anaticariyāya issariyavossaggena alaṅkārānuppadānena.
translation-en-sujato: by treating her with honor, by not looking down on her, by not being unfaithful, by relinquishing authority to her, and by presenting her with adornments.

root-pli-ms: Imehi kho, gahapatiputta, pañcahi ṭhānehi sāmikena pacchimā disā bhariyā paccupaṭṭhitā pañcahi ṭhānehi sāmikaṁ anukampati—
translation-en-sujato: A wife served by her husband in these five ways shows compassion to him in five ways.

root-pli-ms: susaṁvihitakammantā ca hoti, saṅgahitaparijanā ca, anaticārinī ca, sambhatañca anurakkhati, dakkhā ca hoti analasā sabbakiccesu.
translation-en-sujato: She’s well-organized in her work. She manages the domestic help. She’s not unfaithful. She preserves his earnings. She’s deft and tireless in all her duties.

root-pli-ms: Imehi kho, gahapatiputta, pañcahi ṭhānehi sāmikena pacchimā disā bhariyā paccupaṭṭhitā imehi pañcahi ṭhānehi sāmikaṁ anukampati.
translation-en-sujato: A wife served by her husband in these five ways shows compassion to him in these five ways.

root-pli-ms: Evamassa esā pacchimā disā paṭicchannā hoti khemā appaṭibhayā.
translation-en-sujato: And that’s how the western quarter is covered, kept safe and free of peril.

root-pli-ms: Pañcahi kho, gahapatiputta, ṭhānehi kulaputtena uttarā disā mittāmaccā paccupaṭṭhātabbā—
translation-en-sujato: A gentleman should serve his friends and colleagues as the northern quarter in five ways:

root-pli-ms: dānena peyyavajjena atthacariyāya samānattatāya avisaṁvādanatāya.
translation-en-sujato: giving, kindly words, taking care, equality, and not using tricky words.

root-pli-ms: Imehi kho, gahapatiputta, pañcahi ṭhānehi kulaputtena uttarā disā mittāmaccā paccupaṭṭhitā pañcahi ṭhānehi kulaputtaṁ anukampanti—
translation-en-sujato: Friends and colleagues served by a gentleman in these five ways show compassion to him in five ways.

root-pli-ms: pamattaṁ rakkhanti, pamattassa sāpateyyaṁ rakkhanti, bhītassa saraṇaṁ honti, āpadāsu na vijahanti, aparapajā cassa paṭipūjenti.
translation-en-sujato: They guard him when they’re negligent. They guard his property when they’re negligent. They keep him safe in times of danger. They don’t abandon him in times of trouble. They honor his descendants.

root-pli-ms: Imehi kho, gahapatiputta, pañcahi ṭhānehi kulaputtena uttarā disā mittāmaccā paccupaṭṭhitā imehi pañcahi ṭhānehi kulaputtaṁ anukampanti.
translation-en-sujato: Friends and colleagues served by a gentleman in these five ways show compassion to him in these five ways.

root-pli-ms: Imehi kho, gahapatiputta, pañcahi ṭhānehi kulaputtena uparimā disā samaṇabrāhmaṇā paccupaṭṭhitā imehi chahi ṭhānehi kulaputtaṁ anukampanti.

translation-en-sujato: Then, late at night, the Four Great Kings—with large armies of spirits, fairies, goblins, and dragons—set guards, troops, and wards at the four quarters and then, lighting up the entire Vulture’s Peak with their beauty, went up to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side.

translation-en-sujato: Before sitting down to one side, some spirits bowed, some exchanged greetings and polite conversation, some held up their joined palms toward the Buddha, some announced their name and clan, while some kept silent.

root-pli-ms: Santi hi, bhante, bhagavato sāvakā araññavanapatthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevanti appasaddāni appanigghosāni vijanavātāni manussarāhasseyyakāni paṭisallānasāruppāni.
translation-en-sujato: Sir, there are disciples of the Buddha who frequent remote lodgings in the wilderness and the forest that are quiet and still, far from the madding crowd, remote from human settlements, and fit for retreat.

root-pli-ms: Tattha santi uḷārā yakkhā nivāsino, ye imasmiṁ bhagavato pāvacane appasannā.

root-pli-ms: Tesaṁ pasādāya uggaṇhātu, bhante, bhagavā āṭānāṭiyaṁ rakkhaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ bhikkhunīnaṁ upāsakānaṁ upāsikānaṁ guttiyā rakkhāya avihiṁsāya phāsuvihārāyā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: To give them confidence, may the Buddha please learn the Āṭānāṭiya protection for the guarding, protection, safety, and comfort of the monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen.”

comment-en-sujato: Comm: Kusalena samekkhasīti anavajjena nipuṇena vā sabbaññutaññāṇena mahājanaṁ olokesi. I think this line is harking back to the problem the yakkhas have; they think the Buddha is judging and condemning them. By “kusala” here i understand that he sees them both “clearly”, as in he recognizes their misdeeds, and “kindly” in the sense that rather than condemning them he shows them skillfull and kindly how to be better.

root-pli-ms: tato bhuñjanti bhojanaṁ.

comment-en-sujato: This is a literal rendering of “Tuṇḍikīre”. Comm says “Tattha kira jotikapāsāṇā nāma honti” the kira indicating their uncertainty. MW suggests a relation with tandoori; but, while that is indeed an ancient word, it seems the root is to “mud”, so unlikely here. It’s possible, though, that the commentary, familiar with some variant on tandoori, took that as the explanation. Presumably it was a pot that looked like a parrot’s beak, or perhaps which cracked the rice like a parrot. But given the context we should not discount the possibility that it was meant literally. It would hardly be the most fantastic tale told of foreign lands.

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ kho sā, mārisa, āṭānāṭiyā rakkhā bhikkhūnaṁ bhikkhunīnaṁ upāsakānaṁ upāsikānaṁ guttiyā rakkhāya avihiṁsāya phāsuvihārāya.
translation-en-sujato: This, dear sir, is the Āṭānāṭiya protection for the guarding, protection, safety, and comfort of the monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen.

root-pli-ms: Yassa kassaci, mārisa, bhikkhussa vā bhikkhuniyā vā upāsakassa vā upāsikāya vā ayaṁ āṭānāṭiyā rakkhā suggahitā bhavissati samattā pariyāputā.
translation-en-sujato: The monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen should learn this Āṭānāṭiya protection well and completely memorize it.

root-pli-ms: Tañce amanusso yakkho vā yakkhinī vā yakkhapotako vā yakkhapotikā vā yakkhamahāmatto vā yakkhapārisajjo vā yakkhapacāro vā, gandhabbo vā gandhabbī vā gandhabbapotako vā gandhabbapotikā vā gandhabbamahāmatto vā gandhabbapārisajjo vā gandhabbapacāro vā, kumbhaṇḍo vā kumbhaṇḍī vā kumbhaṇḍapotako vā kumbhaṇḍapotikā vā kumbhaṇḍamahāmatto vā kumbhaṇḍapārisajjo vā kumbhaṇḍapacāro vā, nāgo vā nāgī vā nāgapotako vā nāgapotikā vā nāgamahāmatto vā nāgapārisajjo vā nāgapacāro vā, paduṭṭhacitto bhikkhuṁ vā bhikkhuniṁ vā upāsakaṁ vā upāsikaṁ vā gacchantaṁ vā anugaccheyya, ṭhitaṁ vā upatiṭṭheyya, nisinnaṁ vā upanisīdeyya, nipannaṁ vā upanipajjeyya.
translation-en-sujato: If anyone who does so is approached while walking, standing, sitting, or lying down by any non-human being with malicious intent—including males, females, boys, girls, ministers, counselors, and servants among the spirits, fairies, goblins, and dragons—

root-pli-ms: Na me so, mārisa, amanusso labheyya gāmesu vā nigamesu vā sakkāraṁ vā garukāraṁ vā.
translation-en-sujato: that non-human will receive no homage or respect in any village or town.

root-pli-ms: Na me so, mārisa, amanusso labheyya āḷakamandāya nāma rājadhāniyā vatthuṁ vā vāsaṁ vā.
translation-en-sujato: And they will receive no ground or dwelling in my capital of Ālakamandā.

root-pli-ms: Na me so, mārisa, amanusso labheyya yakkhānaṁ samitiṁ gantuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Nor will they get to go to the conference of the spirits.

root-pli-ms: Apissu naṁ, mārisa, amanussā anāvayhampi naṁ kareyyuṁ avivayhaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: In addition, the non-humans would not give or take them in marriage.

root-pli-ms: Apissu naṁ, mārisa, amanussā attāhipi paripuṇṇāhi paribhāsāhi paribhāseyyuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: They’d heap personal abuse on them,

root-pli-ms: Apissu naṁ, mārisa, amanussā rittampissa pattaṁ sīse nikkujjeyyuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: drop an empty bowl on their head,

root-pli-ms: Apissu naṁ, mārisa, amanussā sattadhāpissa muddhaṁ phāleyyuṁ.
translation-en-sujato: and even split their head into seven pieces!

root-pli-ms: Santi hi, mārisa, amanussā caṇḍā ruddhā rabhasā, te neva mahārājānaṁ ādiyanti, na mahārājānaṁ purisakānaṁ ādiyanti, na mahārājānaṁ purisakānaṁ purisakānaṁ ādiyanti.
translation-en-sujato: For there are, dear sir, non-humans who are fierce, cruel, and violent. They don’t obey the Great Kings or their men or their men’s men.

root-pli-ms: Te kho te, mārisa, amanussā mahārājānaṁ avaruddhā nāma vuccanti.
translation-en-sujato: They’re said to be rebelling against the Great Kings.

root-pli-ms: Seyyathāpi, mārisa, rañño māgadhassa vijite mahācorā.
translation-en-sujato: They’re just like the bandits in the king of Magadha’s realm

root-pli-ms: Te neva rañño māgadhassa ādiyanti, na rañño māgadhassa purisakānaṁ ādiyanti, na rañño māgadhassa purisakānaṁ purisakānaṁ ādiyanti.
translation-en-sujato: who don’t obey the king, his men, or his men’s men,

root-pli-ms: Te kho te, mārisa, mahācorā rañño māgadhassa avaruddhā nāma vuccanti.
translation-en-sujato: and are said to be rebelling against the king.

root-pli-ms: Evameva kho, mārisa, santi amanussā caṇḍā ruddhā rabhasā, te neva mahārājānaṁ ādiyanti, na mahārājānaṁ purisakānaṁ ādiyanti, na mahārājānaṁ purisakānaṁ purisakānaṁ ādiyanti.
Te kho te, mārisa, amanussā mahārājānaṁ avaruddhā nāma vuccanti.

Yo hi koci, mārisa, amanusso yakkho vā yakkhinī vā …pe… gandhabbo vā gandhabbī vā …pe… kumbhaṇḍo vā kumbhaṇḍī vā …pe… nāgo vā nāgī vā nāgapotako vā nāgapotikā vā nāgamahāmatto vā nāgapārisajjo vā nāgapacāro vā paduṭṭhacitto bhikkhuṁ vā bhikkhuniṁ vā upāsakaṁ vā upāsikaṁ vā gacchantaṁ vā anugaccheyya, ṭhitaṁ vā upatiṭṭheyya, nisinnaṁ vā upanisīdeyya, nipannaṁ vā upanipajjeyya.
translation-en-sujato: If any non-human being with malicious intent—including males, females, boys, girls, ministers, counselors, and servants among the spirits, fairies, goblins, and dragons—approaches a monk, nun, layman, or laywoman while walking, standing, sitting, or lying down,

root-pli-ms: Imesaṁ yakkhānaṁ mahāyakkhānaṁ senāpatīnaṁ mahāsenāpatīnaṁ ujjhāpetabbaṁ vikkanditabbaṁ viravitabbaṁ:
translation-en-sujato: one ought to yell, cry, and scream to the spirits, great spirits, generals, great generals:

root-pli-ms: ‘ayaṁ yakkho gaṇhāti, ayaṁ yakkho āvisati, ayaṁ yakkho heṭheti, ayaṁ yakkho viheṭheti, ayaṁ yakkho hiṁsati, ayaṁ yakkho vihiṁsati, ayaṁ yakkho na muñcatī’ti.
translation-en-sujato: ‘This spirit’s got me! This spirit’s entered me! This spirit’s annoying me! This spirit’s harassing me! This spirit’s hurting me! This spirit’s harming me! This spirit won’t let me go!’

root-pli-ms: Katamesaṁ yakkhānaṁ mahāyakkhānaṁ senāpatīnaṁ mahāsenāpatīnaṁ?
translation-en-sujato: To what spirits, great spirits, generals, great generals?

root-pli-ms: Indo somo varuṇo ca,
translation-en-sujato: ‘Inda, Soma, and Varuṇa,

root-pli-ms: bhāradvājo pajāpati;
translation-en-sujato: Bhāradvāja, Pajāpati,

root-pli-ms: Candano kāmaseṭṭho ca,
translation-en-sujato: Candana and Kāmaseṭṭha,

root-pli-ms: kinnughaṇḍu nighaṇḍu ca.
translation-en-sujato: Kinnughaṇḍu and Nighaṇḍu,

root-pli-ms: Panādo opamañño ca,
translation-en-sujato: Panāda and Opamañña,

root-pli-ms: devasūto ca mātali;
translation-en-sujato: and Mātali, the god’s charioteer.

root-pli-ms: Cittaseno ca gandhabbo,
translation-en-sujato: Cittasena the fairy,

root-pli-ms: naḷo rājā janesabho.
translation-en-sujato: and the kings Nala and Janesabha,

root-pli-ms: Sātāgiro hemavato,
translation-en-sujato: Sātāgira, Hemavata,

root-pli-ms: puṇṇako karatiyo guḷo;
translation-en-sujato: Puṇṇaka, Karatiya, and Guḷa;

root-pli-ms: Sivako mucalindo ca,
translation-en-sujato: Sivaka and Mucalinda,

root-pli-ms: vessāmitto yugandharo.
translation-en-sujato: Vessāmitta, Yugandhara,

root-pli-ms: Gopālo supparodho ca,
translation-en-sujato: Gopāla, Supparodha,
variant-pli-ms: supparodho ca → suppagedho ca (bj, sya-all, pts1ed)

root-pli-ms: Hiri netti ca mandiyo;
translation-en-sujato: Hiri, Netti, and Mandiya;

root-pli-ms: Pañcālacaṇḍo āḷavako,
translation-en-sujato: Pañcālacaṇḍa, Āḷavaka,

root-pli-ms: Pajjunno sumano sumukho;
translation-en-sujato: Pajjunna, Sumana, Sumukha,

root-pli-ms: Dadhimukho maṇi māṇivaro dīgho,
translation-en-sujato: Dadhimukha, Maṇi, Māṇivara, Dīgha,

root-pli-ms: Atho serīsako saha.
translation-en-sujato: together with Serīsaka.’

root-pli-ms: Imesaṁ yakkhānaṁ mahāyakkhānaṁ senāpatīnaṁ mahāsenāpatīnaṁ ujjhāpetabbaṁ vikkanditabbaṁ viravitabbaṁ:
‘ayaṁ yakkho gaṇhāti, ayaṁ yakkho āvisati, ayaṁ yakkho heṭheti, ayaṁ yakkho viheṭheti, ayaṁ yakkho hiṁsati, ayaṁ yakkho vihiṁsati, ayaṁ yakkho na muñcatī’ti.
Ayaṁ kho sā, mārisa, āṭānāṭiyā rakkhā bhikkhūnaṁ bhikkhunīnaṁ upāsakānaṁ upāsikānaṁ guttiyā rakkhāya avihiṁsāya phāsuvihārāya.
translation-en-sujato: This, dear sir, is the Āṭānāṭiya protection for the guarding, protection, safety, and comfort of the monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen.
reference: csp1ed8.166, csp2ed8.166, ms8D_704, pts-cs11, sc64, vri3.156

root-pli-ms: Handa ca dāni mayaṁ, mārisa, gacchāma bahukiccā mayaṁ bahukaraṇīyā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: Well, now, dear sir, I must go. I have many duties, and much to do.”

root-pli-ms: “Yassadāni tumhe, mahārājāno, kālaṁ maññathā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: “Please, Great Kings, go at your convenience.”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho cattāro mahārājā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā tatthevantaradhāyiṁsu.
translation-en-sujato: Then the Four Great Kings got up from their seats, bowed, and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on their right side, before vanishing right there.

root-pli-ms: Tepi kho yakkhā uṭṭhāyāsanā appekacce bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā tatthevantaradhāyiṁsu. Appekacce bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodiṁsu, sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā tatthevantaradhāyiṁsu. Appekacce yena bhagavā tenañjaliṁ paṇāmetvā tatthevantaradhāyiṁsu. Appekacce nāmagottaṁ sāvetvā tatthevantaradhāyiṁsu. Appekacce tuṇhībhūtā tatthevantaradhāyiṁsūti.
translation-en-sujato: And before the other spirits present vanished, some bowed and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on their right side, some exchanged greetings and polite conversation, some held up their joined palms toward the Buddha, some announced their name and clan, while some kept silent.

root-pli-ms: Paṭhamabhāṇavāro niṭṭhito.
translation-en-sujato: The first recitation section is finished.

root-pli-ms: 2. Dutiyabhāṇavāra
translation-en-sujato: 2. The Second Recitation Section

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā tassā rattiyā accayena bhikkhū āmantesi:
translation-en-sujato: Then, when the night had passed, the Buddha told the mendicants all that had happened, repeating all the verses spoken. Then he added:
reference: bj9.332, cck11.212, ms8D_707, msdiv285, pts-cs12, sc66

root-pli-ms: “imaṁ, bhikkhave, rattiṁ cattāro mahārājā mahatiyā ca yakkhasenāya mahatiyā ca gandhabbasenāya mahatiyā ca kumbhaṇḍasenāya mahatiyā ca nāgasenāya catuddisaṁ rakkhaṁ ṭhapetvā catuddisaṁ gumbaṁ ṭhapetvā catuddisaṁ ovaraṇaṁ ṭhapetvā abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇā kevalakappaṁ gijjhakūṭaṁ pabbataṁ obhāsetvā yenāhaṁ tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā maṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu.

Tepi kho, bhikkhave, yakkhā appekacce maṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu. Appekacce mayā saddhiṁ sammodiṁsu, sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu. Appekacce yenāhaṁ tenañjaliṁ paṇāmetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu. Appekacce nāmagottaṁ sāvetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu. Appekacce tuṇhībhūtā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu.
Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho, bhikkhave, vessavaṇo mahārājā maṁ etadavoca:
‘santi hi, bhante, uḷārā yakkhā bhagavato appasannā …pe… santi hi, bhante, nīcā yakkhā bhagavato pasannā.
Yebhuyyena kho pana, bhante, yakkhā appasannāyeva bhagavato.
Taṁ kissa hetu?
Bhagavā hi, bhante, pāṇātipātā veramaṇiyā dhammaṁ deseti … surāmerayamajjappamādaṭṭhānā veramaṇiyā dhammaṁ deseti.
Yebhuyyena kho pana, bhante, yakkhā appaṭiviratāyeva pāṇātipātā … appaṭiviratā surāmerayamajjappamādaṭṭhānā.
Tesaṁ taṁ hoti appiyaṁ amanāpaṁ.
Santi hi, bhante, bhagavato sāvakā araññavanapatthāni pantāni senāsanāni paṭisevanti appasaddāni appanigghosāni vijanavātāni manussarāhasseyyakāni paṭisallānasāruppāni.

Tattha santi uḷārā yakkhā nivāsino, ye imasmiṁ bhagavato pāvacane appasannā, tesaṁ pasādāya uggaṇhātu, bhante, bhagavā āṭānāṭiyaṁ rakkhaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ bhikkhunīnaṁ upāsakānaṁ upāsikānaṁ guttiyā rakkhāya avihiṁsāya phāsuvihārāyā’ti.
Adhivāsesiṁ kho ahaṁ, bhikkhave, tuṇhībhāvena.
Atha kho, bhikkhave, vessavaṇo mahārājā me adhivāsanaṁ viditvā tāyaṁ velāyaṁ imaṁ āṭānāṭiyaṁ rakkhaṁ abhāsi:
‘Vipassissa ca namatthu,
cakkhumantassa sirīmato;
Sikhissapi ca namatthu,
sabbabhūtānukampino.
Vessabhussa ca namatthu,
nhātakassa tapassino;
Namatthu kakusandhassa,
mārasenāpamaddino.
Koṇāgamanassa namatthu,
brāhmaṇassa vusīmato;
Kassapassa ca namatthu,
vippamuttassa sabbadhi.
Aṅgīrasassa namatthu,
sakyaputtassa sirīmato;
Yo imaṁ dhammaṁ desesi,
sabbadukkhāpanūdanaṁ.
Ye cāpi nibbutā loke,
yathābhūtaṁ vipassisuṁ;
Te janā apisuṇātha,
mahantā vītasāradā.
Hitaṁ devamanussānaṁ,
yaṁ namassanti gotamaṁ;
Vijjācaraṇasampannaṁ,
mahantaṁ vītasāradaṁ.
Yato uggacchati sūriyo,
ādicco maṇḍalī mahā;
Yassa cuggacchamānassa,
saṁvarīpi nirujjhati;
Yassa cuggate sūriye,
“divaso”ti pavuccati.
Rahadopi tattha gambhīro,
samuddo saritodako;
Evaṁ taṁ tattha jānanti,
“samuddo saritodako”.
Ito “sā purimā disā”,
iti naṁ ācikkhatī jano;
Yaṁ disaṁ abhipāleti,
mahārājā yasassi so.
Gandhabbānaṁ adhipati,
“dhataraṭṭho”ti nāmaso;
Ramatī naccagītehi,
gandhabbehi purakkhato.
Puttāpi tassa bahavo,
ekanāmāti me sutaṁ;
Asīti dasa eko ca,
indanāmā mahabbalā.
Te cāpi buddhaṁ disvāna,
buddhaṁ ādiccabandhunaṁ;
Dūratova namassanti,
mahantaṁ vītasāradaṁ.
Namo te purisājañña,
namo te purisuttama;
Kusalena samekkhasi,
amanussāpi taṁ vandanti;
Sutaṁ netaṁ abhiṇhaso,
tasmā evaṁ vademase.
“Jinaṁ vandatha gotamaṁ,
jinaṁ vandāma gotamaṁ;
Vijjācaraṇasampannaṁ,
buddhaṁ vandāma gotamaṁ”.
Yena petā pavuccanti,
pisuṇā piṭṭhimaṁsikā;
Pāṇātipātino luddā,
corā nekatikā janā.
Ito “sā dakkhiṇā disā”,
iti naṁ ācikkhatī jano;
Yaṁ disaṁ abhipāleti,
mahārājā yasassi so.
Kumbhaṇḍānaṁ adhipati,
“virūḷho” iti nāmaso;
Ramatī naccagītehi,
kumbhaṇḍehi purakkhato.
Puttāpi tassa bahavo,
ekanāmāti me sutaṁ;
Asīti dasa eko ca,
indanāmā mahabbalā.
Te cāpi buddhaṁ disvāna,
buddhaṁ ādiccabandhunaṁ;
Dūratova namassanti,
mahantaṁ vītasāradaṁ.
Namo te purisājañña,
namo te purisuttama;
Kusalena samekkhasi,
amanussāpi taṁ vandanti;
Sutaṁ netaṁ abhiṇhaso,
tasmā evaṁ vademase.
“Jinaṁ vandatha gotamaṁ,
jinaṁ vandāma gotamaṁ;
Vijjācaraṇasampannaṁ,
buddhaṁ vandāma gotamaṁ”.
Yattha coggacchati sūriyo,
ādicco maṇḍalī mahā;
Yassa coggacchamānassa,
divasopi nirujjhati;
Yassa coggate sūriye,
“saṁvarī”ti pavuccati.
Rahadopi tattha gambhīro,
samuddo saritodako;
Evaṁ taṁ tattha jānanti,
samuddo saritodako.
Ito “sā pacchimā disā”,
iti naṁ ācikkhatī jano;
Yaṁ disaṁ abhipāleti,
mahārājā yasassi so.
Nāgānañca adhipati,
“virūpakkho”ti nāmaso;
Ramatī naccagītehi,
nāgeheva purakkhato.
Puttāpi tassa bahavo,
ekanāmāti me sutaṁ;
Asīti dasa eko ca,
indanāmā mahabbalā.
Te cāpi buddhaṁ disvāna,
buddhaṁ ādiccabandhunaṁ;
Dūratova namassanti,
mahantaṁ vītasāradaṁ.
Namo te purisājañña,
namo te purisuttama;
Kusalena samekkhasi,
amanussāpi taṁ vandanti;
Sutaṁ netaṁ abhiṇhaso,
tasmā evaṁ vademase.
“Jinaṁ vandatha gotamaṁ,
jinaṁ vandāma gotamaṁ;
Vijjācaraṇasampannaṁ,
buddhaṁ vandāma gotamaṁ”.
Yena uttarakuruvho,
mahāneru sudassano;
Manussā tattha jāyanti,
amamā apariggahā.
Na te bījaṁ pavapanti,
nāpi nīyanti naṅgalā;
Akaṭṭhapākimaṁ sāliṁ,
paribhuñjanti mānusā.
Akaṇaṁ athusaṁ suddhaṁ,
sugandhaṁ taṇḍulapphalaṁ;
Tuṇḍikīre pacitvāna,
tato bhuñjanti bhojanaṁ.
Gāviṁ ekakhuraṁ katvā,
anuyanti disodisaṁ;
Pasuṁ ekakhuraṁ katvā,
anuyanti disodisaṁ.
Itthiṁ vā vāhanaṁ katvā,
anuyanti disodisaṁ;
Purisaṁ vāhanaṁ katvā,
anuyanti disodisaṁ.
Kumāriṁ vāhanaṁ katvā,
anuyanti disodisaṁ;
Kumāraṁ vāhanaṁ katvā,
anuyanti disodisaṁ.
Te yāne abhiruhitvā,
Sabbā disā anupariyāyanti;
Pacārā tassa rājino.
Hatthiyānaṁ assayānaṁ,
dibbaṁ yānaṁ upaṭṭhitaṁ;
Pāsādā sivikā ceva,
mahārājassa yasassino.
Tassa ca nagarā ahu,
Antalikkhe sumāpitā;
Āṭānāṭā kusināṭā parakusināṭā,
Nāṭasuriyā parakusiṭanāṭā.
Uttarena kasivanto,
Janoghamaparena ca;
Navanavutiyo ambaraambaravatiyo,
Āḷakamandā nāma rājadhānī.
Kuverassa kho pana mārisa,
Mahārājassa visāṇā nāma rājadhānī;
Tasmā kuvero mahārājā,
“Vessavaṇo”ti pavuccati.
Paccesanto pakāsenti,
Tatolā tattalā tatotalā;
Ojasi tejasi tatojasī,
Sūro rājā ariṭṭho nemi.
Rahadopi tattha dharaṇī nāma,
Yato meghā pavassanti;
Vassā yato patāyanti,
Sabhāpi tattha sālavatī nāma.
Yattha yakkhā payirupāsanti,
Tattha niccaphalā rukkhā;
Nānā dijagaṇā yutā,
Mayūrakoñcābhirudā;
Kokilādīhi vagguhi.
Jīvañjīvakasaddettha,
atho oṭṭhavacittakā;
Kukkuṭakā kuḷīrakā,
vane pokkharasātakā.
Sukasāḷika saddettha,
daṇḍamāṇavakāni ca;
Sobhati sabbakālaṁ sā,
kuveranaḷinī sadā.
Ito “sā uttarā disā”,
iti naṁ ācikkhatī jano;
Yaṁ disaṁ abhipāleti,
mahārājā yasassi so.
Yakkhānañca adhipati,
“kuvero” iti nāmaso;
Ramatī naccagītehi,
yakkheheva purakkhato.
Puttāpi tassa bahavo,
ekanāmāti me sutaṁ;
Asīti dasa eko ca,
indanāmā mahabbalā.
Te cāpi buddhaṁ disvāna,
buddhaṁ ādiccabandhunaṁ;
Dūratova namassanti,
mahantaṁ vītasāradaṁ.
Namo te purisājañña,
namo te purisuttama;
Kusalena samekkhasi,
amanussāpi taṁ vandanti;
Sutaṁ netaṁ abhiṇhaso,
tasmā evaṁ vademase.
“Jinaṁ vandatha gotamaṁ,
jinaṁ vandāma gotamaṁ;
Vijjācaraṇasampannaṁ,
buddhaṁ vandāma gotaman”ti.
Ayaṁ kho sā, mārisa, āṭānāṭiyā rakkhā bhikkhūnaṁ bhikkhunīnaṁ upāsakānaṁ upāsikānaṁ guttiyā rakkhāya avihiṁsāya phāsuvihārāya.

Yassa kassaci, mārisa, bhikkhussa vā bhikkhuniyā vā upāsakassa vā upāsikāya vā ayaṁ āṭānāṭiyā rakkhā suggahitā bhavissati samattā pariyāputā tañce amanusso yakkho vā yakkhinī vā …pe… gandhabbo vā gandhabbī vā …pe… kumbhaṇḍo vā kumbhaṇḍī vā …pe… nāgo vā nāgī vā nāgapotako vā nāgapotikā vā nāgamahāmatto vā nāgapārisajjo vā nāgapacāro vā, paduṭṭhacitto bhikkhuṁ vā bhikkhuniṁ vā upāsakaṁ vā upāsikaṁ vā gacchantaṁ vā anugaccheyya, ṭhitaṁ vā upatiṭṭheyya, nisinnaṁ vā upanisīdeyya, nipannaṁ vā upanipajjeyya.
Na me so, mārisa, amanusso labheyya gāmesu vā nigamesu vā sakkāraṁ vā garukāraṁ vā.
Na me so, mārisa, amanusso labheyya āḷakamandāya nāma rājadhāniyā vatthuṁ vā vāsaṁ vā.
Na me so, mārisa, amanusso labheyya yakkhānaṁ samitiṁ gantuṁ.
Apissu naṁ, mārisa, amanussā anāvayhampi naṁ kareyyuṁ avivayhaṁ.
Apissu naṁ, mārisa, amanussā attāhi paripuṇṇāhi paribhāsāhi paribhāseyyuṁ.
Apissu naṁ, mārisa, amanussā rittampissa pattaṁ sīse nikkujjeyyuṁ.
Apissu naṁ, mārisa, amanussā sattadhāpissa muddhaṁ phāleyyuṁ.
Santi hi, mārisa, amanussā caṇḍā ruddhā rabhasā, te neva mahārājānaṁ ādiyanti, na mahārājānaṁ purisakānaṁ ādiyanti, na mahārājānaṁ purisakānaṁ purisakānaṁ ādiyanti.
Te kho te, mārisa, amanussā mahārājānaṁ avaruddhā nāma vuccanti.
Seyyathāpi, mārisa, rañño māgadhassa vijite mahācorā.
Te neva rañño māgadhassa ādiyanti, na rañño māgadhassa purisakānaṁ ādiyanti, na rañño māgadhassa purisakānaṁ purisakānaṁ ādiyanti.
Te kho te, mārisa, mahācorā rañño māgadhassa avaruddhā nāma vuccanti.
Evameva kho, mārisa, santi amanussā caṇḍā ruddhā rabhasā, te neva mahārājānaṁ ādiyanti, na mahārājānaṁ purisakānaṁ ādiyanti, na mahārājānaṁ purisakānaṁ purisakānaṁ ādiyanti.
Te kho te, mārisa, amanussā mahārājānaṁ avaruddhā nāma vuccanti.

Yo hi koci, mārisa, amanusso yakkho vā yakkhinī vā …pe… gandhabbo vā gandhabbī vā …pe… kumbhaṇḍo vā kumbhaṇḍī vā …pe… nāgo vā nāgī vā …pe… paduṭṭhacitto bhikkhuṁ vā bhikkhuniṁ vā upāsakaṁ vā upāsikaṁ vā gacchantaṁ vā upagaccheyya, ṭhitaṁ vā upatiṭṭheyya, nisinnaṁ vā upanisīdeyya, nipannaṁ vā upanipajjeyya.
Imesaṁ yakkhānaṁ mahāyakkhānaṁ senāpatīnaṁ mahāsenāpatīnaṁ ujjhāpetabbaṁ vikkanditabbaṁ viravitabbaṁ:
“ayaṁ yakkho gaṇhāti, ayaṁ yakkho āvisati, ayaṁ yakkho heṭheti, ayaṁ yakkho viheṭheti, ayaṁ yakkho hiṁsati, ayaṁ yakkho vihiṁsati, ayaṁ yakkho na muñcatī”ti.
Katamesaṁ yakkhānaṁ mahāyakkhānaṁ senāpatīnaṁ mahāsenāpatīnaṁ?
Indo somo varuṇo ca,
bhāradvājo pajāpati;
Candano kāmaseṭṭho ca,
kinnughaṇḍu nighaṇḍu ca.
Panādo opamañño ca,
devasūto ca mātali;
Cittaseno ca gandhabbo,
naḷo rājā janesabho.
Sātāgiro hemavato,
puṇṇako karatiyo guḷo;
Sivako mucalindo ca,
vessāmitto yugandharo.
Gopālo supparodho ca,
Hiri netti ca mandiyo;
Pañcālacaṇḍo āḷavako,
Pajjunno sumano sumukho;
Dadhimukho maṇi māṇivaro dīgho,
Atho serīsako saha.
Imesaṁ yakkhānaṁ mahāyakkhānaṁ senāpatīnaṁ mahāsenāpatīnaṁ ujjhāpetabbaṁ vikkanditabbaṁ viravitabbaṁ:
“ayaṁ yakkho gaṇhāti, ayaṁ yakkho āvisati, ayaṁ yakkho heṭheti, ayaṁ yakkho viheṭheti, ayaṁ yakkho hiṁsati, ayaṁ yakkho vihiṁsati, ayaṁ yakkho na muñcatī”ti.
Ayaṁ kho, mārisa, āṭānāṭiyā rakkhā bhikkhūnaṁ bhikkhunīnaṁ upāsakānaṁ upāsikānaṁ guttiyā rakkhāya avihiṁsāya phāsuvihārāya.
Handa ca dāni mayaṁ, mārisa, gacchāma, bahukiccā mayaṁ bahukaraṇīyā’ti.
‘Yassadāni tumhe, mahārājāno, kālaṁ maññathā’ti.
Atha kho, bhikkhave, cattāro mahārājā uṭṭhāyāsanā maṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā tatthevantaradhāyiṁsu.
Tepi kho, bhikkhave, yakkhā uṭṭhāyāsanā appekacce maṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā tatthevantaradhāyiṁsu.
Appekacce mayā saddhiṁ sammodiṁsu, sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā tatthevantaradhāyiṁsu.
Appekacce yenāhaṁ tenañjaliṁ paṇāmetvā tatthevantaradhāyiṁsu.
Appekacce nāmagottaṁ sāvetvā tatthevantaradhāyiṁsu.
Appekacce tuṇhībhūtā tatthevantaradhāyiṁsu.
Uggaṇhātha, bhikkhave, āṭānāṭiyaṁ rakkhaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: “Mendicants, learn the Āṭānāṭiya protection!

root-pli-ms: Pariyāpuṇātha, bhikkhave, āṭānāṭiyaṁ rakkhaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Memorize the Āṭānāṭiya protection!

root-pli-ms: Dhāretha, bhikkhave, āṭānāṭiyaṁ rakkhaṁ.
translation-en-sujato: Remember the Āṭānāṭiya protection!

root-pli-ms: Atthasaṁhitā, bhikkhave, āṭānāṭiyā rakkhā bhikkhūnaṁ bhikkhunīnaṁ upāsakānaṁ upāsikānaṁ guttiyā rakkhāya avihiṁsāya phāsuvihārāyā”ti.
translation-en-sujato: The Āṭānāṭiya protection is beneficial, and is for the guarding, protection, safety, and comfort of the monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen.”

root-pli-ms: Idamavoca bhagavā.
translation-en-sujato: That is what the Buddha said.

root-pli-ms: Attamanā te bhikkhū bhagavato bhāsitaṁ abhinandunti.
translation-en-sujato: Satisfied, the mendicants were happy with what the Buddha said.

root-pli-ms: Āṭānāṭiyasuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ navamaṁ.
Dīgha Nikāya 33
translation-de-sabbamitta: Lange Lehrreden 33
translation-en-sujato: Long Discourses 33

root-pli-ms: Saṅgītisutta
translation-de-sabbamitta: Gemeinsam aufsagen
translation-en-sujato: Reciting in Concert

root-pli-ms: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
translation-de-sabbamitta: So habe ich es gehört.
translation-en-sujato: So I have heard.

root-pli-ms: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā mallesu cārikaṁ caramāno mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi yena pāvā nāma mallānaṁ nagaraṁ tadavasari.
translation-de-sabbamitta: Einmal wanderte der Buddha im Land der Mallas mit einem großen Saṅgha von fünfhundert Mönchen und Nonnen. Da kam er zu einer mallischen Stadt namens Pāvā.
translation-en-sujato: At one time the Buddha was wandering in the land of the Mallas together with a large Saṅgha of five hundred mendicants when he arrived at a Mallian town named Pāvā.

root-pli-ms: Tatra sudaṁ bhagavā pāvāyaṁ viharati cundassa kammāraputtassa ambavane.
translation-de-sabbamitta: Dort hielt er sich im Mangowäldchen Cundas des Schmieds auf.
translation-en-sujato: There he stayed in Cunda the smith’s mango grove.

root-pli-ms: Tena kho pana samayena pāveyyakānaṁ mallānaṁ ubbhatakaṁ nāma navaṁ sandhāgāraṁ acirakāritaṁ hoti anajjhāvuṭṭhaṁ samaṇena vā brāhmaṇena vā kenaci vā manussabhūtena.
translation-de-sabbamitta: Nun war da gerade kürzlich für die Mallas von Pāvā eine neue Stadthalle mit Namen Ubbhaṭaka erbaut worden. Bisher war sie noch von keinem Asketen oder Brahmanen oder von irgendjemandem benutzt worden.
translation-en-sujato: Now at that time a new town hall named Ubbhaṭaka had recently been constructed for the Mallas of Pāvā. It had not yet been occupied by an ascetic or brahmin or any person at all.
variant-pli-ms: sandhāgāraṁ → santhāgāraṁ (bj); saṇṭhāgāraṁ (sya-all, km); santhagāraṁ (pts1ed) | anajjhāvuṭṭhaṁ → anajjhāvutthaṁ (bj, sya-all, pts1ed, mr)

root-pli-ms: Assosuṁ kho pāveyyakā mallā: “bhagavā kira mallesu cārikaṁ caramāno mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi pāvaṁ anuppatto pāvāyaṁ viharati cundassa kammāraputtassa ambavane”ti.
translation-de-sabbamitta: Die Mallas von Pāvā hörten nun, der Buddha sei angekommen und hielte sich in Cundas Mangowäldchen auf.
translation-en-sujato: The Mallas of Pāvā also heard that the Buddha had arrived and was staying in Cunda’s mango grove.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho pāveyyakā mallā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu. Ekamantaṁ nisinnā kho pāveyyakā mallā bhagavantaṁ etadavocuṁ:
translation-de-sabbamitta: Da gingen sie zum Buddha, verbeugten sich, setzten sich zur Seite hin und sagten zu ihm:
translation-en-sujato: Then they went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him,

root-pli-ms: “idha, bhante, pāveyyakānaṁ mallānaṁ ubbhatakaṁ nāma navaṁ sandhāgāraṁ acirakāritaṁ hoti anajjhāvuṭṭhaṁ samaṇena vā brāhmaṇena vā kenaci vā manussabhūtena.
translation-de-sabbamitta: „Herr, kürzlich wurde für die Mallas von Pāvā eine neue Stadthalle mit Namen Ubbhaṭaka erbaut. Sie ist noch von keinem Asketen oder Brahmanen oder von irgendjemandem benutzt worden.
translation-en-sujato: “Sir, a new town hall named Ubbhaṭaka has recently been constructed for the Mallas of Pāvā. It has not yet been occupied by an ascetic or brahmin or any person at all.

root-pli-ms: Tañca kho, bhante, bhagavā paṭhamaṁ paribhuñjatu, bhagavatā paṭhamaṁ paribhuttaṁ pacchā pāveyyakā mallā paribhuñjissanti.
translation-de-sabbamitta: Der Buddha möchte der Erste sein, der sie benutzt, und erst danach wollen die Mallas von Pāvā sie benutzen.
translation-en-sujato: May the Buddha be the first to use it, and only then will the Mallas of Pāvā use it.

root-pli-ms: Tadassa pāveyyakānaṁ mallānaṁ dīgharattaṁ hitāya sukhāyā”ti.
translation-de-sabbamitta: Das wäre zum langanhaltenden Nutzen und Glück der Mallas von Pāvā.“
translation-en-sujato: That would be for the lasting welfare and happiness of the Mallas of Pāvā.”

root-pli-ms: Adhivāsesi kho bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena.
translation-de-sabbamitta: Der Buddha stimmte schweigend zu.
translation-en-sujato: The Buddha consented in silence.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho pāveyyakā mallā bhagavato adhivāsanaṁ viditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā yena sandhāgāraṁ tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā sabbasanthariṁ sandhāgāraṁ santharitvā bhagavato āsanāni paññāpetvā udakamaṇikaṁ patiṭṭhapetvā telapadīpaṁ āropetvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṁsu;
translation-de-sabbamitta: Da erhoben sich die Mallas von ihren Sitzen, der Zustimmung des Buddha gewiss, verbeugten sich und umrundeten den Buddha respektvoll, die rechte Seite ihm zugewandt. Dann gingen sie zu ihrer neuen Stadthalle, breiteten überall Teppiche aus, richteten Sitze her, stellten einen Krug mit Wasser auf und brachten eine Lampe. Dann gingen sie zum Buddha zurück,
translation-en-sujato: Then, knowing that the Buddha had consented, the Mallas got up from their seat, bowed, and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on their right. Then they went to the new town hall, where they spread carpets all over, prepared seats, set up a water jar, and placed a lamp. Then they went back to the Buddha,

root-pli-ms: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhaṁsu.
translation-de-sabbamitta: verbeugten sich, stellten sich zur Seite hin,
translation-en-sujato: bowed, stood to one side,

root-pli-ms: Ekamantaṁ ṭhitā kho te pāveyyakā mallā bhagavantaṁ etadavocuṁ:
translation-de-sabbamitta: berichteten über ihre Vorbereitungen
translation-en-sujato: and told him of their preparations, saying,

root-pli-ms: “sabbasantharisanthataṁ, bhante, sandhāgāraṁ, bhagavato āsanāni paññattāni, udakamaṇiko patiṭṭhāpito, telapadīpo āropito.
translation-de-sabbamitta: und sagten:

root-pli-ms: Yassadāni, bhante, bhagavā kālaṁ maññatī”ti.
translation-de-sabbamitta: „Bitte, Herr, komm, wann es dir passend erscheint.“
translation-en-sujato: “Please, sir, come at your convenience.”

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya saddhiṁ bhikkhusaṅghena yena sandhāgāraṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā pāde pakkhāletvā sandhāgāraṁ pavisitvā majjhimaṁ thambhaṁ nissāya puratthābhimukho nisīdi.
translation-de-sabbamitta: Da kleidete der Buddha sich an, nahm Schale und Robe und ging zusammen mit dem Saṅgha von Mönchen und Nonnen zu der neuen Stadthalle. Er wusch seine Füße, betrat die Stadthalle und setzte sich mit dem Gesicht nach Osten gegen den Mittelpfeiler.
translation-en-sujato: Then the Buddha robed up and, taking his bowl and robe, went to the new town hall together with the Saṅgha of mendicants. Having washed his feet he entered the town hall and sat against the central column facing east.
reference: ms8D_776, msdiv299, pts-cs1.4, pts-vp-pli3.209, sc4, sya11.224

root-pli-ms: Bhikkhusaṅghopi kho pāde pakkhāletvā sandhāgāraṁ pavisitvā pacchimaṁ bhittiṁ nissāya puratthābhimukho nisīdi bhagavantaṁyeva purakkhatvā.
translation-de-sabbamitta: Auch der Saṅgha von Mönchen und Nonnen wusch seine Füße, betrat die Stadthalle und setzte sich mit dem Gesicht nach Osten gegen die westliche Wand, sodass der Buddha vor ihnen saß.
translation-en-sujato: The Saṅgha of mendicants also washed their feet, entered the town hall, and sat against the west wall facing east, with the Buddha right in front of them.

root-pli-ms: Pāveyyakāpi kho mallā pāde pakkhāletvā sandhāgāraṁ pavisitvā puratthimaṁ bhittiṁ nissāya pacchimābhimukhā nisīdiṁsu bhagavantaṁyeva purakkhatvā.
translation-de-sabbamitta: Auch die Mallas von Pāvā wuschen ihre Füße, betraten die Stadthalle und setzten sich mit dem Gesicht nach Westen gegen die östliche Wand, sodass der Buddha vor ihnen saß.
translation-en-sujato: The Mallas of Pāvā also washed their feet, entered the town hall, and sat against the east wall facing west, with the Buddha right in front of them.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā pāveyyake malle bahudeva rattiṁ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṁsetvā uyyojesi:
translation-de-sabbamitta: Den größten Teil der Nacht verbrachte der Buddha damit, die Mallas mit einem Dhammavortrag anzuleiten, zu ermuntern, zu begeistern und anzuregen. Dann entließ er sie mit den Worten:
translation-en-sujato: The Buddha spent most of the night educating, encouraging, firing up, and inspiring the Mallas with a Dhamma talk. Then he dismissed them,

root-pli-ms: “abhikkantā kho, vāseṭṭhā, ratti.
translation-de-sabbamitta: „Die Nacht ist fortgeschritten, Vāseṭṭhas.
translation-en-sujato: “The night is getting late, Vāseṭṭhas.

root-pli-ms: Yassadāni tumhe kālaṁ maññathā”ti.
translation-de-sabbamitta: Bitte geht, wann es euch passend erscheint.“
translation-en-sujato: Please go at your convenience.”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho pāveyyakā mallā bhagavato paṭissutvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā pakkamiṁsu.
translation-de-sabbamitta: „Ja, Herr“, antworteten die Mallas. Sie erhoben sich von ihren Sitzen, verbeugten sich, umrundeten den Buddha respektvoll, die rechte Seite ihm zugewandt, und gingen.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” replied the Mallas. They got up from their seat, bowed, and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on their right, before leaving.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā acirapakkantesu pāveyyakesu mallesu tuṇhībhūtaṁ tuṇhībhūtaṁ bhikkhusaṅghaṁ anuviloketvā āyasmantaṁ sāriputtaṁ āmantesi:
translation-de-sabbamitta: Als sie gegangen waren, blickte der Buddha über den völlig stillen Saṅgha der Mönche und Nonnen und wandte sich an den Ehrwürdigen Sāriputta:
translation-en-sujato: Soon after they left, the Buddha looked around the Saṅgha of monks, who were so very silent. He addressed Venerable Sāriputta,
reference: cck11.217, dr11.238, ms8D_777, msdiv300, pts-cs1.5, sc5

root-pli-ms: “vigatathinamiddho kho, sāriputta, bhikkhusaṅgho.
translation-de-sabbamitta: „Sāriputta, da ist keine Dumpfheit oder Benommenheit im Saṅgha der Mönche und Nonnen.
translation-en-sujato: “Sāriputta, the Saṅgha of mendicants is rid of dullness and drowsiness.

root-pli-ms: Paṭibhātu taṁ, sāriputta, bhikkhūnaṁ dhammīkathā.
translation-de-sabbamitta: Halte einen Dhammavortrag für sie, so wie es dir in den Sinn kommt.
translation-en-sujato: Give them some Dhamma talk as you feel inspired.

root-pli-ms: Piṭṭhi me āgilāyati.
translation-de-sabbamitta: Mein Rücken schmerzt,
translation-en-sujato: My back is sore,

root-pli-ms: Tamahaṁ āyamissāmī”ti.
translation-de-sabbamitta: ich will ihn ausstrecken.“
translation-en-sujato: I’ll stretch it.”

root-pli-ms: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā sāriputto bhagavato paccassosi.
translation-de-sabbamitta: „Ja, Herr“, entgegnete Sāriputta.
translation-en-sujato: “Yes, sir,” Sāriputta replied.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho bhagavā catugguṇaṁ saṅghāṭiṁ paññāpetvā dakkhiṇena passena sīhaseyyaṁ kappesi pāde pādaṁ accādhāya, sato sampajāno uṭṭhānasaññaṁ manasi karitvā.
translation-de-sabbamitta: Da faltete der Buddha seine äußere Robe vierfach, breitete sie aus und legte sich in der Haltung des Löwen nieder – auf die rechte Seite, einen Fuß auf den anderen gelegt –, achtsam und umsichtig und im Gedanken an die Zeit des Aufstehens.
translation-en-sujato: And then the Buddha spread out his outer robe folded in four and laid down in the lion’s posture—on the right side, placing one foot on top of the other—mindful and aware, and focused on the time of getting up.

root-pli-ms: Tena kho pana samayena nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto pāvāyaṁ adhunākālaṅkato hoti.
translation-de-sabbamitta: Nun war da gerade kürzlich der Nigaṇṭha Nātaputta in Pāvā verstorben.
translation-en-sujato: Now at that time the Nigaṇṭha Nātaputta had recently passed away at Pāvā.

root-pli-ms: Tassa kālaṅkiriyāya bhinnā nigaṇṭhā dvedhikajātā bhaṇḍanajātā kalahajātā vivādāpannā aññamaññaṁ mukhasattīhi vitudantā viharanti:
translation-de-sabbamitta: Nach seinem Tod gab es eine Spaltung unter den Jaina-Asketen, es bildeten sich zwei Parteien, die zankten, stritten und aneinander gerieten und einander fortwährend mit scharfen Worten verletzten:
translation-en-sujato: With his passing the Jain ascetics split, dividing into two factions, arguing, quarreling, and fighting, continually wounding each other with barbed words:
variant-pli-ms: viharanti → vicaranti (sya-all, km); virahanti (pts1ed) | dvedhikajātā → dveḷhakajātā (sya-all, km)

root-pli-ms: “na tvaṁ imaṁ dhammavinayaṁ ājānāsi, ahaṁ imaṁ dhammavinayaṁ ājānāmi, kiṁ tvaṁ imaṁ dhammavinayaṁ ājānissasi. Micchāpaṭipanno tvamasi, ahamasmi sammāpaṭipanno. Sahitaṁ me, asahitaṁ te. Purevacanīyaṁ pacchā avaca, pacchāvacanīyaṁ pure avaca. Adhiciṇṇaṁ te viparāvattaṁ, āropito te vādo, niggahito tvamasi, cara vādappamokkhāya, nibbeṭhehi vā sace pahosī”ti.
translation-de-sabbamitta: „Du verstehst diese Lehre und Übung nicht. Ich verstehe diese Lehre und Übung. Was, du verstehst diese Lehre und Übung? Du übst falsch. Ich übe richtig. Ich bleibe beim Thema, du nicht. Was zuerst gesagt werden sollte, hast du zuletzt gesagt. Was zuletzt gesagt werden sollte, hast du zuerst gesagt. Was du dir so gut ausgedacht hast, ist widerlegt. Deine Behauptung ist entkräftet. Auf, rette deine Behauptung! Du steckst in der Falle; befreie dich daraus – wenn du kannst!“
translation-en-sujato: “You don’t understand this teaching and training. I understand this teaching and training. What, you understand this teaching and training? You’re practicing wrong. I’m practicing right. I stay on topic, you don’t. You said last what you should have said first. You said first what you should have said last. What you’ve thought so much about has been disproved. Your doctrine is refuted. Go on, save your doctrine! You’re trapped; get yourself out of this—if you can!”

root-pli-ms: Vadhoyeva kho maññe nigaṇṭhesu nāṭaputtiyesu vattati.
translation-de-sabbamitta: Man konnte glauben, unter den Jaina-Asketen gebe es nur Gemetzel.
translation-en-sujato: You’d think there was nothing but slaughter going on among the Jain ascetics.

root-pli-ms: Yepi nigaṇṭhassa nāṭaputtassa sāvakā gihī odātavasanā, tepi nigaṇṭhesu nāṭaputtiyesu nibbinnarūpā virattarūpā paṭivānarūpā, yathā taṁ durakkhāte dhammavinaye duppavedite aniyyānike anupasamasaṁvattanike asammāsambuddhappavedite bhinnathūpe appaṭisaraṇe.
translation-de-sabbamitta: Und die weißgekleideten Laienschülerinnen und -schüler des Nigaṇṭha Nātaputta waren ernüchtert, bestürzt und enttäuscht von den Jaina-Asketen. Und ebenso waren sie von einer Lehre und Übung enttäuscht, die so dürftig erklärt und vorgelegt war, die nicht unabhängig machte, nicht zum Frieden führte, nicht von einem vollkommen erwachten Buddha verkündet war; ihr Denkmal war zerbrochen, und sie hatten keine Zuflucht.
translation-en-sujato: And the Nigaṇṭha Nātaputta’s white-clothed lay disciples were disillusioned, dismayed, and disappointed in the Jain ascetics. They were equally disappointed with a teaching and training so poorly explained and poorly propounded, not emancipating, not leading to peace, proclaimed by someone who is not a fully awakened Buddha, with broken monument and without a refuge.

root-pli-ms: Atha kho āyasmā sāriputto bhikkhū āmantesi:
translation-de-sabbamitta: Da berichtete Sāriputta den Mönchen und Nonnen über diese Vorgänge. Und er fuhr fort:
translation-en-sujato: Then Sāriputta told the mendicants about these things. He went on to say,

root-pli-ms: “nigaṇṭho, āvuso, nāṭaputto pāvāyaṁ adhunākālaṅkato,
tassa kālaṅkiriyāya bhinnā nigaṇṭhā dvedhikajātā …pe… bhinnathūpe appaṭisaraṇe.
Evañhetaṁ, āvuso, hoti durakkhāte dhammavinaye duppavedite aniyyānike anupasamasaṁvattanike asammāsambuddhappavedite.
translation-de-sabbamitta: „Das, werte Freunde, geschieht, wenn eine Lehre und Übung dürftig erklärt und vorgelegt ist, wenn sie nicht unabhängig macht, nicht zum Frieden führt, nicht von einem vollkommen erwachten Buddha verkündet ist.
translation-en-sujato: “That’s what happens, reverends, when a teaching and training is poorly explained and poorly propounded, not emancipating, not leading to peace, proclaimed by someone who is not a fully awakened Buddha.

root-pli-ms: Ayaṁ kho panāvuso, amhākaṁ bhagavatā dhammo svākkhāto suppavedito niyyāniko upasamasaṁvattaniko sammāsambuddhappavedito.
translation-de-sabbamitta: Aber diese Lehre ist uns vom Gesegneten gut erklärt und vorgelegt worden, sie macht unabhängig, führt zum Frieden, ist von einem vollkommen erwachten Buddha verkündet.
translation-en-sujato: But this teaching is well explained and well propounded to us by the Blessed One, emancipating, leading to peace, proclaimed by someone who is a fully awakened Buddha.

root-pli-ms: Tattha sabbeheva saṅgāyitabbaṁ, na vivaditabbaṁ, yathayidaṁ brahmacariyaṁ addhaniyaṁ assa ciraṭṭhitikaṁ, tadassa bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lokānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṁ.
